ÆLS (Basil)
B1.3.4.
Saint Basil: Skeat 1881-1900, I, 50-90.



 1. BASILIVS WES GEHATEN SVM HALIG BISCOP se wæs fram cyldhade
swiðe gehealdsum, þeah þe he to langum fyrste ungefullod wære.
 4. His fæder and his frynd hine befæstan to lare to
woruldwisdome ða þa he syfon wyntre wæs, forþan þe on þam timan ne
teah nan æðelborennysse nænne man to wurðscype butan he wisdom ær
ðam lange leornode æt gelæredum uðwytum.
 9. Þa wunode se cnæplingc on Cappadoniscre byrig fif gear on
lare, and færde to Grecum, to Atheniscre byrig, seo wæs þa bremost on
lare.
 12. And Eubolus se uðwyta, þe þær yldost wæs on
wysdome, underfæng þonne cnapan, swa swa he frymdig wæs, to larlicre
scole.
 12. And he leornode þa swa þæt ða uðwytan his andgytes
wundrodon.
 16. On þære ylcan scole wæs seo wælreowa Iulianus,
cristen fram cyldhade, se wearð casere siððan, and awearp his geleafan
and gewende to deofle.
 19. Eac þær leornode on þære ylcan scole se æðela
Gregorius se ðe eft wearð biscop and fæla wundra worhta, swa swa
wyrdwryteres secgað.
 22. Basilius ða wunode mid þam uþwytan on lare ealles fiftyne
gær, and eallne þone wysdom wundorlice asmeade, þe grecisce larewas him
læran cuðan.
 26. Ac seo lar ne mihte þe butan geleafan wæs þam
cneorðlæcendum cnihte cyðan be his scyppende, þonne þe he sohte,
þeah þe heo him secgan ne cuðe.
 29. Him becom þa on mod þurh mynegunge godes þæt heo
sceolde secan þa soðan lare on cristenum bocum be his scyppende.
 32. Hwæt þa Basilius bliðlice ferde to Egypta lande and
þær leornode twelf monað on halgum bocum be þæs hælendes
fære, hu he þisne middaneard mid him sylfum alysde.
 36. Æfter geares fyrste ferde him eft ongean to his ealdan
lareowe, and lærde hine be Criste, hu mildheortlice he alysde mancynn on
rode, and hu he of deaðe aras on ðam þriddan dæge and to heofonum
astah to his halgan fæder.
 41. Eubolus se uðwyta þa wearð swa mycclum oflyst Basilies
lare þæt him ne hlyste nanes metes.
 44. Ac hi smeadon ðry dagas swiðe smeaþancollice ymbe
þæt ece lif, and ætes ne gymdon.
 46. Þa gelyfde se uðwyta on þonne ælmihtigan god, and
betæhte his æhta ealle Basilie, cwæð þæt he æfre wolde
wunian mid him.
 49. Basilius þa herede þone hælend mid wordum, and cwæð
to Eubole his ealdan lareowe, Uton nu aspendan ure speda on þearfum, and swa
mid gebylde bugan to fulluhte, alysde fram bendum þissere leasan worulde.
 54. Ða dydon ða wytan swa swa him bam gewearð, dældon
heora æhta ealle þearfum, and ferdon to Hierusalem fulluht secende; and
manega hæðena manna þurh hi gebugan to drihtne mid geleafan onbryrde.
 59. Hi coman ða siððan to ðære foresædan byrig
Hierusalem, þær se hælend ðrowade, and gesohtan þone biscop þe
ða burh bewyste, bædon fulluhtes, æt his fotum licgende.
 63. Se biscop wæs halig wær gehaten Maximinus, and
welwyllendlice hym getyðode þæs ðe hi gewylnodon, and sona hym mid
ferde to þære flowendan ea Iordanis gehaten, on þære wæs seo
hælend gefullod.
 67. Hwæt ða Basilius hine to eorþan astræhte, and mid
wope gewylnode sum gewis tacen æt Gode, his geleafan to trymminge, and alede
his ræf on þæra ea ofre & eode in nacod.
 71. Þa genealæhte seo biscop and mid bletsunge hine
gefullode.
 72. Efne þa færlice com fyr of heofonum, and an scinende
culfre scæt of þam fyre into ðære ea, and astyrede ðæt wæter,
fleah siþþan upp forðrihte to heofonum.
 76. And Basilius eode of þæm fantbaðe sona, and seo biscop
hine bewæfde, wundriende þæs tacnes.
 78. He gefullode eac siððan þonne foresædan Eubolum, and
hi begen gesmyrode mid gehalgudum ele, and eac gehuslode mid þæs
Hælendes gerynum.
 81. Hi wunodon þa begen mid þæm biscope ofer gear, and
siðan gewendon to anre widgyllan byrig, Antiochia geciged, seo soðlice
wæs mid cristendome afylled gefyrn on ealddagum.
 85. Þa gehadode seo biscop Basilium to diacone, and he æfter
fyrste ferde mid Eubole to his agenum æþele, þe he on geboren wæs.
 88. Ða mid þam þe hi coman to Cappadoniscre scyre and eodon
into þære byrig, þa wearð þam biscope geswutelod on gastlicre
gesihðe be ðam godes mannum, and þæt Basilius sceolde beon biscop
æfter him.
 92. Þa awoc Eusebius, þære ceastra bisceop, and asende his
preostas sona him togeanes, het him gelangian þa gelyfeden men to, and
sæde his ceastergewarum hwæt he geseah be him.
 96. Hi wurdon ða underfangene mid fulre estfulnesse, and seo
halga bisceop hi heold arwurðlice, þearle wundriende heora wysdomes
deopnysse.
 99. Þa æfter lytlum fyrste forðferde seo bisceop, and
Basilius se bylewitta wearð to bisceope gehalgod, and on his setle ahafen,
swa swa he geseah on ær þurh godes awrygennysse þa þa hi wið his
werd wæron.
 103. Hwæt ða Basilius his bisceopdom geheold mid mycelre
arwurðnysse, þurh þæs ælmihtigan wissunge, and godes gelaþunge
mid lare getrymde.
 106. He bæd þonne ælmihtigan God þæt he him gewissode
þæt he mid agenre spræce him offrian mihte ða lyflican
onsægednisse mid soðfæstre þenunge.
 109. Æfter þam gebede he wearð swiðe onbryrd þurh þone
halgan gast, & se Hælend him com to on sumere nihte mid his apostolum
and awrehte Basilium, cwæð þæt he his bena gehyrde.
 113. Þa stod se Hælend sylf æt þam halgan weofode, and
mid his halgum handum husel senode, and þam bisceope tæhte þæs þe
he biddende wæs.
 116. He cwæð to Basilie, beo þin muð afylled mid haligre
herunga æfter þinre bena, þæt ðu mid agenre spræce geoffrian
mæge þa liflican onsægednysse mid soðre þenunge.
 120. Þa wearð se bisceop mycclum ablicged, and genam þæt
husel þe se hælend gebletsode, tobræc on þreo and onbyrgede anes
dæles.
 123. Þone oðerne dæl he dyde gehealden mid him to bebyrgenne
æfter his forðsiðe.
 125. Þone ðryddan dæl he dyde onsundor, and het him
smiðian on smætum golde anre culfran anlicnysse, and þa upaheng bufan
þam altare and þær on gedyde þone ðryddan dæl þæs
deorwurðan husles; and seo culfra siþþan simle hi astyrede æt Basilies
messan þriwa mid þam husle.
 132. Eubolus se uðwyta and þa yldostan preostas stoden æt
þæra dura, stariende on þæt leoht, and beheolden þa apostolas þe
mid þam hælende coman mid wuldre gefrætewode, and hi wurdon afyrhte.
 136. Hi gehyrdon þa stemne þæs halgan sanges, and Basilium
gesawon binnan æt þæm weofode, and feollan to his fotum mid fyrhte
fornumene, þa ða he uteode, and him eall sædon hwæt hi þær
gesawon.
 140. Se bisceop þæs ðancode mid blyðum mode, and þam
folce sæde siððan larspell.
 142. Witodlice Basilius, gebyld þurh his drihten, be endebyrdnyss
awrat ealle ða þenunga þæra halgan mæssan, swa swa hit healdað
Grecas.
 145. He awrat eac munucregol mid mycelre gehealdsumnysse, þone
þe ða easternan and eac swylce Grecas anmodlice healdað, þeah þe he
hefegra sy þonne se ðe Benedictus siþþan us gebysnode, swylce to
anginne agenre gecyrrednysse; ac he tihte us on æfteweardan þæs ylcan
regoles, to geðungenra lareowa lifes drohtnungum, and tymde to þam regole
þe Basilius gesette.
 153. Sum Iudeisc man wolde gewytan to soþan be ðære halgan
mæssan, hwylce mihte heo hæfde, and be ðam halgan husle, þeah þe he
hæðen wære.
 156. Eode þa to mæssan mid oðrum mannum, and hlosnode georne
be ðære liflican onsægednysse.
 158. Þa mid ðam þe Basilius tobræc þæt husel, þa
þuhte þam Iudeiscan swylce he todælde an cyld; eode swa þeah mid
oðrum mannum earhlice to husle, and him wearð geseald an snæd
flæsces, and he sæp of ðæm calice eac swylce blod.
 163. Heold swa þeah sumne dæl ham to berenne mid him, and
ætæwode his wife and gewislice sæde hwæt he sylf geseah, and
siððan þæs on mergen com to Basilie biddende fulluhtes.
 167. Hwæt þa se biscop hine bliþelice gefullode, and ealle
his hiwan on þæs Hælendes naman.
 169. He eode æfter mæssan ut of þam temple, and efne þa
sona hine gesohte an wif biddende his þingunge to anum geþungenum
ealdormen.
 172. Basilius þa awrat þa earman wife an gewryt to þæm
ealdormenn on þisum andgite: þis earme wif me gesohte, sæde þæt ic
mihte hyre to ðe geþingian, þonne cyð þu nu ic bidde gif ic swa wel
wið þe mæg swa þæt wif truwað.
 177. Þa rædde se aldorman þæt ærendgewrit, and sende
him ongean sona on gewryte, cwæð þæt he wolde þam wife gemyltsian
for his þingunge, ac he swa þeah ne mihte þæt gafol alecgan þe heo
gelæstan sceolde.
 182. Þa asende se bisceop to þam foresædon ealdormenn eft
oðer gewryt mid þysum andgyte: Gif þu woldest myltsian and swa þeah ne
mihtest, þær is sum beladung on þære sægne; Gif þu þonne
mihtest myltsian and noldest, gebringe þe se hælend to hyre hafenleaste,
þæt þu ne mæge myltsian þeah þu wylle.
 189. Þa æfter sumum fyrste him wearð swiðe gram se healica
casera, and het hine gebindan, and him to gebringan bysmorlice on hæfte.
 192. Ða asende se ealdorman sona to Basilie, biddende earmlice
þæt he þone geyrsodon casere þurh his gebedu geliðgode, and hit
gelamp swa.
 195. Þa ymbe syx dagas se casere het sendan ongean þone
geswæncten ealdorman of þæm nearwum bendum, and him þa bliðe
wæs.
 198. Ða com se ealdorman to þam arwurðan biscope, þancode
his þingunge, and þam earmum wife be twifealdum forgeald þæs þe he
hyre benam.
 201. Þes ylca bisceop þe we ymbe sprecað sæde be him
sylfum on sumne timan, þæt he næfre on his life ne come neah wife
þurh hæmedþing, ac heold his clænnysse.
 205. On sumum dege ferde seo foresæda bisceop, þa rad Iulianus
se arlease casere mid mycelra fyrdinge, swiðe fus to wige, and gecneow
Basilium and cwæð him sona to, Ic hæbbe þe oferþogen on
geþungenre lare and on uðwytegunge.
 210. Him andwyrde se bisceop, Forgeafe God ælmihtig þæt
ðu fyligdest wysdome; and bead him mid þam worde þry berene hlafes,
swylce for bletsunge þæs þe he sylf bræc.
 214. Ða het se arleasa onfon þæra hlafa, and syllan þam
Godes menn gærs togeanes, and cwæð mid hospe, horse mete is bere
þæt he us forgeæf, underfo he gærs.
 218. Þa underfæng se halga þa handfulle and cwæð, We
budon þe Casere, þes þe we sylfa brucað, and þu sealdest us togeanes
þæt þæt ðe ungesceadwyse nytena habbað him to bigleofan,
gebysmriende us.
 222. Þa gebealh hine se casere and cwæð mid gebeote, þonne
ic eft gecyrre sigefæste fram fyrde, Ic aweste þinne buruh and gewyrce to
yrðlande.
 225. Ic wat þine dyrstignysse, and þine burhwara, þe
tobræcon þa anlicnysse þi ic sylf arærde, and me to þære
gebæd gebygdum cneowum.
 228. Æfter þysum worde he gewende to Persum, and Basilius
cydde his burhwarum þis, and nam him to ræde þæt hi þone reðan
casere mid sceattum gegladodon þonne he of þam siðe come.
 232. Hwæt þa seo burhware bliðelice gegaderode ungerim feos
ætforan þam bisceope.
 234. Þa bead he þam folce þreora daga fæsten, and het hi
astigan up to anre sticolre dune, on þære wæs gefyrn foremære
tæmpl sancte Marian gehalgod mid healicum wurðmynte.
 238. And hi æt þære halgan stowe þone hælend bædon,
þæt he hraðe towurpe þæs wælreowan andgyt, and hi ahrædde
wiþ ðone reðan casere.
 241. Þa geseah se biscop þa þa hi swiðost bædon on
sumere nihte, sancta Marian cuman mid heofonlicum werode to þære halgan
stowe, and cwæð to ðam halgum þe hyre gehendost stodan, Clypiað
þone martyr Mercurium to me, þæt he ardlice fare to þam arleasan
Iuliane, and hine acwelle for þan þe he Criste wiðsoc, and be minum sunu,
þam soðan Gode, tællice sprecþ mid toþundenum mode.
 250. Þa com Mercurius to ðære mæran cwene mid his
gewæpnunge, and wearð sona asend fram Cristes meder to þæs caseres
slæge.
 253. Ða wearð Basilius þearle afyrht, and eode mid Eubole eft
to ðære byrig, and siþþan to ðan sancte þe on ðæra cyrcean
læg, Mercurius se martyr, mid mycclum wurðmynte, and sohte his wæpnu,
ac he ne geseah hi na hwær.
 258. Þa axode he þone cyrcweard be þæs sanctes wæpnum,
and he swor þæt hi wæron gewyslice þær on æfen.
 260. Þa oncneow se bisceop cuðlice his gesihðe, and eode eft
to ðam munte mid mycelre blysse; Kydde þam folce þæt se casere wæs
ofslegen on þære ilcan nihte, swa swa him ætewod wæs.
 264. He eode eft ongean to þam arwurðan sancte, wolde gewytan
gif his wæpnu coman.
 266. Ða stod his franca þær, fula begleddod mid Iulianes
blode binnan þam gesceote.
 268. Efne þæs ymbe seofan niht com to þære ylcan ceastre
an þæs caseres þegna, and cydde þære burhware þis: Iulianus
wycode wið þa ea Eufraten, and him oferwacedon syfanfealde weardes.
 272. Þa com sum cempa uncuð us eallum, swiþe gewæpnod, and
hyne sona þurhþydde mid egeslicum onhræse, and ne æteowde
siððan.
 275. Þa hrymde Iulianus mid hospe, and earmlice gewat, on ure
gewytnysse.
 277. Ðus cydde se cempa, and gecneowode to þam bisceope
fulluhtes biddende, and se bisceop him þæs getyðode.
 279. Þa bead Basilius þære burhwara heora feoh, ac hi ealle
cwædon mid anre stemne, gif we þam dædlicam þas cyste geuðan,
þæt he ne towurpe ure wynsuman burh, myccle swiðor we sceolan þam
soðfæstan gode þas lac geoffrian þe us alysde fram deaðe.
 285. Þu hæfst þæt feoh mid þe, gefada embe loca hu þu
wylle.
 286. Ða nydde se bisceop þæt hi namon þæne þryddan
dæl, and þa twegen dælas he dyde to þære cyrcean, and to þæs
mynstræs neode, mid mænigfealdum cræftum.
 289. Twa gear rixode þæs reða Iulianus, and nolde gehealdan
his preosthad on riht, ac truwode on þone hæðenscype þe hine to helle
gebrohte.
 292. Eft on sumne timan wearð se arfæsta wer for ðan soðan
geleafan leaslice gewreged to Valens þam casere, þe ða cynedomes
geweold.
 295. Se wæs on criste gefullod, ac he ne cuþe his geleafan, ac
folgode gedwylde þurh gedwolmanna tihtinge.
 297. Þa het se casere þone halgan gefeccan to Antiochia
þære ænlican byrig.
 299. Þa mid þam þe se gedwola embe his deað smæda, þa
wearð his agen sunu yfele geuntrumed and orwena lifes, læg æt
forðsiðe.
 302. Þa eode seo cwen to ðam casere and cwæð, yfela þu
gefadast for Gode þinne ræd nu swelt uncer sunu for ðan soðfæstan
men.
 305. Þa clypode se casere and cwæð to Basilie, gif þin lar
is soð, and heo Gode gelicað, gebide for mine sunu þæt his yfel beo
afliged.
 308. Ða cwæð Basilius bealdlice to þam casere, gif þu
wylt onriht gelyfan, þonne lifað þin sunu.
 310. He behet þæt he wolde, and se halga gebæd for þæt
seoce cyld and him wæs sona bet.
 312. Þa cwædon þa gedwolmen, þe dwelodon þone casere,
þæt he ne sceolde bugan for Basilies lare of his agenum andgyte fram heora
æwfæstnysse, and sædon þæt his sunu wære gesundful þurh hi.
 316. Mid þam þe þa dwolmen hine bedydrodon þus, þa
forðferde þæt cyld færlice on heora handum.
 318. Eft on oðrum timan se ungelyfeda Valens genam godes circean
of þam godes þeowum, and forgeaf þam gedwolmannum þe hine bedydrodon.
 321. Ða ferde Basilius to ðam foresædan casere and mende
þæt unriht þe ða yfelan hine ongebrohton, swa þæt se casere æt
nextan betæhte to his dome.
 324. Hwæt þa Basilius to þære byrig ferde nicea gehaten
on þæra wæs gehæfd þæt foresæde mynster þe ða manfullan
abædon æt þam unrihtwisan casere, and þa cristenan todræfdon.
 328. Þa cwæþ Basilius, Uton belucan þas circan, and
þæt loc geinseglian, and ge ealle siðþan waciað þreo niht
wunigende on gebedum, and gif seo cyrce bið geopenad þurh eowre gebena,
habbað hi eow æfre siððan, and ne sæcgað us nenne þanc.
 333. Gif þone se ælmihtiga God nelle hi eow geopenian, þonne
wacie we ane niht, þone ælmihtigan biddende þæt he us geopenige þa
geinsæglodan cyrcan, and gif heo bið swa geopenad heo bið siðþan
ure, and gif heo þonne ne biþ, ne bidde we hyre næfre.
 338. Ða gelicode þam gedwolum þæs bisceopes dom, and
wacodon þa þreo niht, and on þam þriddan dege stodan æt þæra
cyrcan dura, singende ealle fram ærnemærien oð ofer midne dæg.
 342. Ac hi Crist ne gehyrde, for þan þe hi ne cuþon hine.
 343. Þa wacode Basilius on gebedum ane niht mid þam
geleaffullan folce and fængon on ærnemærgen ealle to clypienne
Kyrrieleyson, mid hluddre stemne to ðam leofan Hælende.
 347. Þa com færlice mycel wynd and wearp upp þa duru,
þæt ða scytelses to burston, and heo sloh on þone weall.
 349. Hi eodon þa in, þone ælmihtigan herigende, and se
bisceop messode and bletsode þa geleaffullan.
 351. And fæla þæra gedwolmanna fengon to geleafan.
 352. Ða ne mihte se casere wiðcweþan þam dome, ac let þa
Godes/ þeowas þæt godes templ bugian,and þæra are brucan þe him
geahnod wæs.
 355. Þa foresædan gedwolmen wæron gefullode on Gode, ac hi
ne gelyfdan onriht on þone lifigendan Crist, ac mid manegum gedwyldum
dwelodan þa cristenan.
 358. Sum arwurþe þegn hæfde ane dohter þa he wolde
gebringan binnan sumum mynstre and Criste betæcan, to his clænan
þeowdome.
 361. Þa wearð an his cnapena to cuð þam mædene, and
þurh deofles tihtinge hi digollice lufode; ac he ne dorste ameldian his
ungemetegodan lufe.
 364. Eode þa to anum drymen þe deofles cræft cuðe, and
behet him sceattes gif he mid his scyncræfte him þæt mæden mihte
gemacian to wife.
 367. Þa gebrohte se dryman þone cnapan to his deofle, and se
deofol befran þone dweligendan cnapan gif he wolde on hine gelyfan, and his
Hælende wiðsacen, wið þam þe he gefremode his fulan galnysse.
 371. Þa stod se earming ætforan þam arleasan deofle,
þær he healice sæt mid his helcnihtum, and cwæð he wolde
wiðsacan his Criste, and gelyfan on hine gif he his lust gefremode.
 375. Þa cwæð se sceocca eft, Ge synd swiðe ungetreowa;
þonne ge min behofiað, þonne ic helpe eow, and ge wiþsacað me eft and
cyrrað to eowrum Criste seþe is swiðe myldheort and myldelice eow
underfehþ.
 379. Ac wryt me nu sylf wylles þæt þu wiðsaca Criste and
þinum fulluhte, and ic gefremme ðinne lust, and þu beo on domes dæge
fordemed mid me.
 382. Ða awrat se earming mid his agenra hande swa swa se deofol
him gedihte þone pistol.
 384. And se deofol sona sænde to ðam mædene his fulan
gastas þe galnysse styriað, and ontendan þæt mæden to þæs
mannes lustum.
 387. Heo wearð þa geangsumod mid þæra ormætan
ontendnysse, and feoll adune færlice hrymende, Eala þu min fæder
gemyltsa þinre dehter, and forgif me þam men þe min mod me to spenð,
elles ic mot sweltan sarlicum deaðe.
 392. Þa weop se fæder wolde hi gefræfrian, and cwæð
mid mycelre sarnysse to þære seocan dehter, Ic wolde mid clænnysse
Criste þe beweddian to engla gefærredena, to frofre minre sawle, and þu
þus wodlice wilnast ceorles.
 397. Heo ne rohte his worda for þæra wodlican ontendnysse, and
cwæð þæt heo sceolde sweltan forraðe, gif se fæder nolde
gefremman hyre wyllan.
 400. Se fæder þa æt nextan be his freonda ræde, forgeaf
þa earman dohter þam deofles cnihte mid mycclum æhtam and his man
nyste.
 403. Ða nolde se deofles cniht cuman næfre to circan, ne godes
word gehyran ne þa halgan messan.
 405. Wearð þa geopenad his earman wife his manfullan behat
þam hetolan deofle.
 407. And heo mid mycelre angsumnysse arn to Basilie, and cydde him
be endebyrdnysse hyre cnihtes wiþersæc.
 409. Þa het se halga wer hine to him gefeccan, and befran gif hit
swa wære swa his wif him sæde.
 411. And he sæde mid wope hu he beswican wearð.
 412. Þa axode se bisceop, wylt þu bugan eft to Christe?
 413. Se wyþersaca cwæð, ic wylle georne leof, ac ic ne
mæg þeah ic wylle, forþan þe ic wiðsoc criste, and on gewryte
afæstnode þæt ic wære þæs deofles.
 416. Se halga wer him cwæð to, Ne hoga þu embe þæt; ure
hælend is swiþe welwyllende and wyle þe eft underfon, gif þu mid
soðre dædbote gecyrst eft to him.
 419. Hwæt þa Basilius gebletsode þone cniht, and beleac hine
onsundron on sumere digelre stowe, and tæhta him bota, and gebæd for
hine.
 422. Com eft ymbe ðry dagas; axode hu he mihte.
 423. Ða cwæð se dædbeta, þa deoflu cumað to me, and
me swiðe geegsiað, and eac swylce torfiað, and habbað him on hande min
agen handgewryt, cweðað þæt ic come to him and na hi to me.
 427. Basilius him cwæð to, ne beo ðu afyrht, gelyf soðlice
on God; and senode hine eft, beleac eft þa duru, and lede him his mete.
 430. He com eft ymbe feawa daga and cunnode þæs mannes.
 431. Se cniht cwæð to ðam halgan were, ic gehyra þa deoflu
feorran, and hyra egslican þiwracan, ac ic hi ne geseo.
 433. He beleac hine eft on þa ylcan wysan oð þone
feowerteoðogan dæg and fandode his siððan.
 435. Þa sæde se cnapa þæt he swiðe wel mihte, nu to
dæg ic seah hu ðu oferswiðdest þone deofol.
 437. Basilius þa on mergen gebrohte þone cnapan Into godes
huse, and het gegaderian þæt folc, and bæd hi ealle wacian þær on
niht mid him, and ðingian þam earman men to þam ælmihtigan Gode.
 441. Mid þam þe hi swiðost bædon binnan þæra cyrcan,
þa com se wælreowa deofol wolde geniman þone cnapan of Basilius handum,
hetolice teonde, and cwæð to ðam halgan þæt he hine berypte.
 445. Ne sohte ic na hine, ac he sylf com to me, her ic habbe his
handgewryt þæt ic hit gehealde mid me to þam gemænelican dome on
þam mycclum dæge.
 448. Ða cwæð se halga wer, we clypiað to ðam Hælende
upahafenum handum oð þæt þu þæt handgewryt agife.
 450. Ða clypodon hi ealle, kyrrieleyson, up ahafenum handum wið
heofonas weard.
 452. And efne þa æfter fyrste feol þæt ylce gewryt ufon
of þære lyfte to ðam geleaffullan biscope.
 454. He þancode þa gode mid gastlicra blysse, and axode þone
cnapan gif he oncneowe þæt gewryt.
 456. He cwæð, ic oncnawe þas cartan fulgeare; þis ic sylf
awrat þam awyrgedan deofla.
 458. Hwæt þa Basilius hi sona totær, and gehuslode þone
cnapan, and þam Hælende betæhte, and lærde hine georne hu he lybban
sceolde on Cristes geleafan oð his lifes ende.
 462. Basilius se mæra wearð mycclum onbryrd, and mid godcundre
beorhtnysse geblyssod forþearle.
 464. Eode ardlice to anes preostes huse, and het his gebroðra
beon his geferan.
 466. Anastasius wæs gehaten se arwurþa mæssepreost þe se
bisceop to fundode swa færlice mid gange.
 468. Mid þam wunode an mæden mærlice drohtnigende, geond
feowertig geare fec fægre gehealden.
 470. Heo wæs mannum geþuht swylce heo his gemæcca wære.
 471. Wytodlyce se messepreost wyste his tocyme þurh þone halgan
gast, and wolde hine behydan.
 473. Ac se bisceop wyste hwær he wæs ful geare, and het hine
mæssian for his mærlican drohtnunga.
 475. Þa æt þære messan wearð his mærð geswutelod,
swa þæt se halga gast hine ealne befeng, on fyres gelycnysse, þær hi
onlocoden.
 478. Se messepreost leofode be hlafe and be wætere, and symle he
fæste buton on freolsdagum.
 480. He hæfde ænne licðrowere belocen on anum clyfan
egeslice toswollen and unsprecende fornean, and hine ðær afedde unafunden
oð þæt.
 483. Ða eode Basilius to ðam clyfan, ac se preost nolde undon
þa duru mid cæge; ac se bisceop hi geopenade eaðelice mid his worde, and
wacode ealle þa niht mid þam wædlian hreoflian, biddende þone
hælend þæt he hine gehæleda, and gelædde hine on mergen forð
swiðe fægres hiwes, buton ælcum womme and wel sprecande.
 490. Þus wearð geopenad se arwurðe mæssepreost, and
þæt halige mæden þe his huses gymde.
 492. And se bisceop gewende mid his gebroðrum ham.
 493. Effrem wæs gehaten sum swiðe halig abbod, on wæstene
wunigende, fela wundra wyrcende, and manegum oðrum gebysnode þa þe bugan
to lare.
 496. Ða gehyrde he be þam wundrum þe Basilius worhte, and
bæd gelome æt Gode þæt he him geswutelode hwylc Basilius wære on
wurðscype mid him.
 499. Þa wearð þam abbode æteowed an fyren swer, se stod up
aþenod oð þa steapan heofonan, and him com stemn ufan, þus clypiende
hlude, Eala þu Effrem eall swylc is Basilius swylce þes fyrena swer þe
þu gesyhst her standan.
 504. Ða gewende Effrem of þam westene sona to ðam halgan
bisceope þæt he hine gespræce, and basilius sende sona him togeanes,
and hine wylcumode, swa swa he wyrðe wæs.
 508. And þa halgan him betweonan embe þæt heofonlice lif
geornlice smeadon swyðe smeaþancollice.
 510. Æfter þæra halgan messan, mid þam þe hi
gereordodon, cwæð se halga Effrem to þam arwurðan biscope, Ic bidde
þe, arwurða fæder, þæt þu me anes þinges tyðige.
 513. Ic wat þæt þu byst tyða swa hwæs swa þu bytst
æt Gode.
 514. Bide nu æt Gode þæt ic grecisc cunne.
 515. Þa cwæð se biscop him to, þu bæde ofer mine
mæðe, ac uton swa þeah biddan þas bena æt Gode.
 517. Hi feollan þa on gebedum, and Basilius cwæð, Hwi nelt
þu la Effrem, nu ðu swa arwurðe eart, beon mæssepreost?
 519. And se oðer him cwæð to, forðan þe ic eom synful.
 520. Þa sæde se biscop, eala gif ic hæfde þine synna
ana.
 522. Hi cneowdon þa æft, and æffrem þa spræc mid
greciscum Gereorde, God herigende, and se halga biscop hine hadode to
messepreost, and his wealhstod to diacone.
 525. And hi wendon eft ongean to þam widgyllan westene,
wuldrigende God.
 527. Sum swiðe welig wif wæs swylce on wudewan hade ac heo
lyfde sceandlice, swa swa swin on meoxe, and mid healicum synnum hi sylfe
fordyde.
 530. Heo wearð swa þeah æt nehstan wundorlice onbryrd þurh
godes mynegunge, and ealle hyre manlican dæda awrat on anre cartan, and
beworhte mid leade.
 533. Gesohte þa Basilium biddende and cweðende, Eale þu godes
halga beseoh me to are.
 535. Ealla mine synna ic, synfulle, awrat on þissere cartan, and
ic com to þe, leof, and ic bidde þe for godes lufan þæt þu me unlyse
þa insæglunge, ac adylega þa synna, to Dryhtne me þingiende.
 539. Se god þe me forgeaf þis gode geþanc, se wyle þe
gehyran me þingiende to him.
 541. Þa genam Basilius se biscop þa cartan, and beseah to
heofonum and cwæð to þam Hælende, ðin agen dæd is, Drihten,
þæt þu adylegie synna.
 544. Þu þe middaneardes synna myldheortlice ætbrytst,
eaðelice þu miht þyssere anre sawle synna adylegian, þu soðfæsta
drihten.
 547. Ealle ure synna synd mid þe awrytene, ac þin myldheortnys
is swiðe mycel and unasmægendlic.
 549. Git þa Basiliuus gebæd for þæt wif.
 551. Waciende þa niht, and þæt gewryt ageaf þam
foresædan wife, and þa wæron þa synna ealle adilegode butan anre
synna, Seo wæs seo mæste.
 553. And heo wearð þa æmod, biddende mid wope þone halgan
wer, þæt he þa mycclan synne mildheortlice adilegode,swa swa he dide
þa oðre, þurh his drihtnes unnan.
 557. Þa cwæð se ercebiscop, Ic eom eac synful, and myltse
behofige þæs heofonlican dryhtnes.
 559. Ac far þe to westene, and þu fintst anne wer haliges
lifes, se hatte Effrem.
 561. Agif him þas cartan, and cyþ him ymbe þe.
 562. And he mid gebedum gegladaþ God ælmihtigne.
 563. Þæt wif gewende þa to ðam westene swiðe.
 564. And Basilius wearð gebroht on legere to his forðsiðe,
forewittig swa þeah.
 566. AN æþele læce wæs wunigende on þære byrig,
IOSEP gehaten, hæðen and Iudeisc; se cuðe tocnawan gif he cunnode
þæs mannes, be his ædrena hrepunge, hweðer he hraðe swulte.
 570. And BASILIVS wiste þurh godes onwrigennysse, þæt he
sceolde þone læce to geleafan bringan and on fante fullian ær his
forðsiðe.
 573. Þa lufode he hine forði, and gelome hine gespræc,
tihtende to geleafan þeah þe he lange wiðsoce.
 575. Ða on sumum dæge sende Basilius æfter ðam ylcan
læce swylce he his lacnunga gyrnde, and het hine sceawian be his seocnysse:
axude þa hu him þuhte.
 578. And se oðer him andwyrde, Gearciað þa þing þe eow
gewunelice synd to bebyrigunge; þes biscop gewit hraðe.
 581. Ða cwæð se ercebiscop to ðam æðelan læce,
nastu hwæt þu sægst, þeah þu swa ne wene.
 583. Se læce him cwæð to, Ne lyfastu oð æfen.
 584. Þa cwæð Basilius, hwæt gif ic bide merigenes?
 585. Se ebreisca cwæþ eft, Ne bið hit swa langsum.
 586. Ane tid, ic wene, þæt þin sawul wunige on þe, ac
gefada þine þing, for þan þe ic þe sæcge þæt þes dæg ne
geendað ofer ðe cucena.
 589. Ða cwæð Basilius mid blyðum mode him to, Hwæt
destu gif ic to mergen middeges gebide?
 591. Se ebreisca cwæð, sylf ic swelte þonne.
 592. Se halga wer sæde, þu scealt sweltan synna and Criste
lybban, þurh geleafan awend.
 594. Se læce him andwyrde and cwæð þæt he gelyfan
wolde and his wyllan gefreman, gif he wunode of middæg.
 596. He behet þa mid aðe þæt he to þam hælende
gebuge, and fulluht underfenge, gif se halga fæder leofode.
 598. Hwæt ða Basilius bæd þone ælmihtigan God þæt
he his lif gelengde þam læce to hæle.
 600. Se biscop þa leofode swa swa he bæd æt Gode, and on
mergen gelangode þone læce him to.
 602. Se iudeisca þa com, and cwæð mid wundrunge, mid ealre
heortan Ic sæcge þæt Crist is soð God, and heonanforð wiðsace mid
soðum geleafan þam hatigendlicum bigengum þe ða Iudeiscan healdað.
 606. Hat me nu fullian, and mine hiwan ealle, on þæs
Hælendes naman buton elcunge.
 608. Se ærcebiscop cwæð, Ic eow ealle fullige mid minum
agenum handum, ðine hiwan and þe.
 610. Þa grapode se læce his lima eft and cwæð, ðin
mægn is aterod, and þa mihte þu næfst.
 612. Basilius him cwæð to, We habbað þone scyppend,þe
þæt gecynd gesceop, and se us gestrangað.
 614. He aras ða mid þam worde and eode to cyrcean, and
ætforan þam folce gefullode þone Ioseph, mid eallum his hiwum, and
gehuslode hi siððan, and lærde hi georne be ðam ecan life.
 618. Siþþan he messode mannum to nones, and lærde hi georne,
and luflice hi cyste, and genam ðone dæl þæs deorwurðan husles þe
se Hælend gehalgode, þe he heold oð þæt, and æfter þære
huslunge, mid herunga gewat to þam lifigendan Gode, þe he mid geleafan
wurðode, mid þam he wunað on blysse a butan ende.
 624. AMEN.
 625. Hwæt þa se læce þe ðær gelyfed wæs, feoll
uppon his breost mid flowendum tearum and cwæð mid wope wella, Basilius.
 628. Gif ðu sylf noldest, nære þu git forðfaran.
 629. Þa com mycel meniu on mergen to ðam lice, and Gregorius
bisceop, þe mid Basilie leornode, and oðre fela bisceopas, and gebrohten
þæt lic mid gastlicum sangum into Godes cyrcean.
 633. We wyllað nu ful sæcgan be ðam synfullan wife þe
Basilius sende mid þære anre synne to Effremme þam abbude, þæt he
ða an adylogode.
 636. Þæt wif becom æt nextan þurh þæt widgylle
westen to ðam halgan Effrem, and he wiste hyre fær ðuruh Godes
onwrigennysse, and hwæt heo wolde þær, and cwæð hire sona to, ic
eom synful mann.
 640. Heo awearp þa cartan ða, and cwæð to Effremme, Se
ærcebiscop me sende soðlice to ðe, þæt þu ðas ane synne, þe
on þyssere ymlan stent, þurh þine gebedu adilige, swa swa he dyde þa
oðre.
 644. Se halga Effrem cwæð, nese nese, dohtor; ac se ðe þa
manega synne mihte adilegian þurh his þingrædene ða þa ðu hine
bæde se mæg bet þone ic biddan for ðære anre.
 648. Gang ongean hraðe to ðam godes menn þæt ðu hine
befo ær his forðsiðe.
 650. Þa arn þæt earme wif ofer þæt westen swiðe, oð
þæt heo to þære byrig becom þær man bær Basilium, and feoll
ða to eorðan, flitende wið þone halgan, þæt he hi asende fram him
sylfum to westene on swa mycelne weg, and ne wearð gefrefrod.
 655. Heo wearp þa mid þam þæt gewryt on ða bære, and
cydde þam mannum be hyre misdædum.
 657. Þa wolde an ðæra preosta wytan þa synne, and sceawode
þa cartan, and clypode to ðam wife, To hwi swincst þu, la wif?
 659. Þeos carte is adilegod.
 660. Seo syn wearð þa adilegod þurh drihtnes mildsunge, swa
swa Basilius wolde þe ða wuldrode mid Gode.
 662. Ða fægnode þæt wif, and þæt folc wuldrode
þone lifigendan God þe lyfað on ecnysse.
 664. His lic wearð bebyrged on Cessariam byrig, Cappadoniscre
scyre, þær þær he sylf biscop wæs, manegum fremiende mid mycelre
lare.
 667. And he sylf wolde sweltan for rihte ær ðam þe he
forsuwode þone soðan gelyfan betwux þam gedwolmannum þe hine drehton
foroft.
 670. For ði he wuldrað nu a to worulde mid gode.
 670. AMEN

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

ÆLS (Julian & Basilissa)
B1.3.5.
Saints Julian and Basilissa: Skeat 1881-1900, I, 90-114.



 1. <foreign>IDVS IANVARII</foreign>.
 1. <foreign>PASSIO SANCTI IVLIANI ET SPONSE EIVS BASILISSE</foreign>.
 1. IVLIANVS WæS GEHATEN SUM ÆÐELE GODES ðEGN ON Egypta
lande, on antiochian þære byrig, se wæs æðelboren of æwfestum
magum and on Cristes lare gelæred fram geogoþe.
 5. Þa wolde his fæder and his frynd ealle þæt he wifian
sceolde þa ðe he eahtetyne gæra wæs, ac Iulianus cwæð þæt
he cunnian wolde his drihtnes wyllan hu he wolde be him.
 9. He wearð þa gebysgod on his gebedum seofan niht, bæd
þone ælmihtigan Crist þæt he his clænnysse geheolde.
 11. Ða æteowde se hælend hine sylfne on swefne þam
æþelan cnihte on ðære eahteoðan nihte, and cwæð þæt he
sceolde soðlice underfon mæden him to gemacan, þe hine ne moste ascyrian
fram his clænan lufe þe he gecoren hæfde.
 16. Se Hælend him cwæð to, Ic beo sylf mid þe, and on
þe adwesce ealle ontendnysse, and þæt mæden ic gebige eac to minre
lufe; and on eowrum brydbedde ic beo eow æteowed, and þurh eow me bið
gehalgod manegra oðre clennysse and ic þe underfo mid ðinum mædene to
heofonum.
 22. Ða awoc Iulianus gewyssod þurh his drihten, cwæð to
his freondum þæt he onfon wolde mæden him to gemacan, and hi mycclum
þæs fægnodon.
 25. Þa fundon his magas sum æðelboren mæden Basilissa
gehaten, and him þa begeaten.
 27. Þa wurdon gegearcode þa gyftu æfter gewunan, and hi butu
coman on anum bedde tosomne.
 29. Hwæt ða Iulianus hine georne gebæd to ðam hælende
Criste, þæt he hine geheolde wið ealla ontendnysse and yfele costnunga.
 32. Ða wearð þæt brydbed mid bræðe afylled swylce
þær lægon lilie and rose.
 34. Ða cwæð Basilissa to þam clænan brydguman, Hit is
wintertid nu and ic wundrie þearle hwanon þes wyrtbræð þus
wynsumlice steme; and me nu ne lyst nanes synscipes, ac þæs Hælendes
geþeodnysse mid gehealdenre clennisse.
 39. Iulianus andwyrde þam æðelan mædene, þes wynsuman
bræð þe ðu wundrast þearle næfð nan angin ne eac nænne
ænde.
 42. Þes bræð is of Criste seðe is clænnysse lufigend,
gif wit þurhwuniað on ansundum mægðhade, and hine clænlice
lufiað, þonne cume wit to his rice and wit ne beoð totwæmede, ac a to
worulde blyssiað.
 46. Basilissa cwæð þæt heo on clænum mægðhade
þurhwunian wolde for ðam wynsuman behate, and habban þæt ece lif and
ðone Hælend to brydguman.
 49. Þa clypode Iulianus on cneowgebedum ðus, <foreign>Confirma hoc
deus, quod operatus es in nobis et reliqua</foreign>.
 51. Gefæstna þis Hælend, þæt þæt ðu on us
gewyrcst.
 52. And Basilissa sona swa gelice dyde.
 53. Þa astyrede þæt brydbed and beorht leoht þær
scean.
 54. And Crist wearð gesewen mid scinendum werode, and his modur
Maria mid hyre mædenlicum heape.
 56. Crist clypode þa to ðam clænan cnihte, and cwæð
þæt he hæfde oferswiðod woruldlice gælsan and þone gramlican
feond.
 59. Of Marian werode wæs þus geclypod, Eadig eart þu
Basilissa, forþan þe þu gebygdest þin mod to halwendum mynegungum and
middaneardlice swæsnysse mid ealle forsihst, and þe sylfe gearcost to
wuldre.
 64. Þa com to ðam bedde boc fram þam Hælende.
 65. And twegen his halgan mid twam cynehelmum arærdan hi þa
upp and heton hi rædan.
 67. Ða rædde Iulianus þas word on þære bec, Se þe for
minre lufe middaneard forsihð, he bið soðlice geteald to þam
unbesmitenum halgum, þe næran on heora life besmitene mid wifum.
 71. Basilissa bið geteald to þæra mædena getæle þe
Marian folgiað þæs hælendes meder.
 73. Æfter þissere rædinge and oðrum tihtingum gewendon
þa halgan to þam Hælende upp.
 75. Hwæt þa Iulianus ungewæmmede heold his bryde, and hi
wæron geðeodde mid soðre clænnysse gastlice þeonde on godes
gewytnysse.
 78. Heora fæderas wæron gefyrn cristene; hit gelamp þa
raðe þæt hi of life gewytan, and læfdon heora æhta þam
æðelum mannum.
 81. Iulianus þa dælde be his drihtnes wyssunga heora land are
þe him læfed wæs, and arærde him mynster and his mædene oðer.
 84. He wearð þa fæder ofer fæla muneca, and Basilissa
modor ofer manega mynecena; and hi þa gastlican werod under gode gewyssodon
on dæghwamlicre lare to heora dryhtnes wyllan, oþ þæt se reðe
æhtnysse on Egypta lande becom fram þam welhreowan casere þe wæs
geciged Dioclytianus.
 90. Þa gebædon þa halgan hi to þam hælende.
 91. And he him asende þisne frofer þus cwæðende, Eala þu
Basilissa þine gebedu synd gefyllede þæt ealle þine mædenu of
middanearde gewitað ær ðan þe seo arlease ehtnys ofer eow becume,
þæt ge ne beon gewemmede þurh ða wodan ehteras.
 96. Hit wearð þa gefylled, swa swa him foresæde God,
þæt ealle ða femnan þe folgodon Basilissan gewytan of worulde to þam
wuldorfullan Hælende.
 99. And Basilissa siððan soðlice gelaðod gewat on
mægðhade of middanearde to Criste.
 101. And Iulianus mid blisse hi bebyrgde mid his munecum; And he
abad on life mid his leofan gebroðrum tihtende hi geornlice to ðam towerdan
gecampe.
 104. Ða com Martianus se manfulla cwællere into Antiochian
þære Egyptiscan byrig mid ormettre ehtnysse fram þam arleasan casere.
 107. He sette ða gebann þæt nan mann bicgan ne moste
oððe ænig þing syllan buton he onsægednysse geoffrode þam leasum
deofolgyldum and his drihten wiðsoce.
 110. Him wearð þa gesæd be ðam soðan geleafan þe
Iulianus heold mid his halgum gebroðrum, and sende to ðam heape het hi
gebugan to his deofolgyldum, þe læs þe hi fordemede wurdon.
 114. Ac Iulianus ne rohte þæs reðan þywrace, ne nan his
geferena forht næs on mode, ac wæron lustbære for þone leofan
drihten wita to þrowienne and eac wælhreowne deað.
 118. Þa gecyrde se ærendraca and þis sæde þam deman.
 119. Martianus þa het þone halgan Iulianum him to gelangian to
langsumum wytum, and het siððan forbernan ealle his gebroðra samod binnan
þam ylcan huse þe hi heora beda beeoden.
 123. Þa wearð se halga heap þam hælende geoffrod, and
þurh þæt hate fyr to heofonan rice becom.
 125. On ðere stowe beoð gehælede gehwilce untrume þurh
þæra martyra geearnunga þe on þære stowe ðrowodon.
 127. Hwæt ða Martianus se manfulla cwellere hæfde langsum
gewinn wið þone æðelan Iulianum, and cwæð þæt he geare wiste
his æðelborennysse.
 130. And ic þe forði tihte þæt ðu þam godum geoffrige
æfter þinre gebyrde, þæt hi þe blyðe beon.
 132. Iulianus him sæde, þu eart soðlice ablend mid þinre
yfelnysse and forþi me þus olæcst.
 134. Ge habbað manega godas and manega gydena, we soðlice
wurðian ænne soðne god.
 136. Eower godas synd agotene oððe agrafene, hu magon hi beon
gegladode þurh ænige bigencgas oþþe þam gemyltsian þe hi mid
gedwylde wurðiað?
 139. Þeos race is swiðe langsum fullice to gereccenne, ac we
hit sæcgað eow on þa scortostan wisan.
 141. Hwæt þa Martianus het his manfullan cwelleras þone
halgan beatan mid heardum saglum.
 143. Þa bærst sum sagol into anes beateres eagan, swa þæt
his eage wand ut mid þam slæge.
 145. Se man wæs þam deman þearle nydbehefe and cuð þam
casere and him eallum gecweme.
 146. Ða cwæð Martianus mid mycclum graman, swa micel is
þin drycræft þæt ðu þas dyntas naht ne gefretst, and þærto
eacan ablendst þone þe þe beaton sceolde.
 149. Iulianus þa cwæð to þam welhreowan þus, Clypiað
to eowrum godum and to eallum gydenum þæt hi nu gehælan þises
hæðenan eage, and gif hi ne magon, ic hine gehæle þurh Crist.
 153. Þa eoden þa hæðengyldan into heora temple, clypigende
hlude to ðam leasan gode.
 155. Ða andwerdan þa deofla of þam dædan anlicnyssum,
Gewitað fram us we synd wraðe geswæncte and mid fyre fornumene for
Iulianes intingan, æfre fram ðam dæge þe ge hine ærest
dræhton.
 159. Hu mage we blinde þone blindan gehælan?
 160. Þa cwæð Iulianus þe þæt eal wyste to Martiane
mid micelre blisse, Gang into þinum godum þe hi clypiað to him.
 163. Þa eode se ehtere into ðam temple, and geseah þa
anlicnyssa ealle tocwysede gyldena and sylfrena and sume of smyltinga, sume of
cristallan tobrytte mid ealle.
 167. Þa sæde Martianus þæt ða soðfæstan godes mid
geþylde forbæron þone bysmorfullan teonan, þæt hi swa Iulianum to
him gebigan mihton.
 170. He bæd swa þeah Iulianum þæt he his gebeot
gelæste, and þæs cnihtes eage þurh his Crist gehælde.
 172. Þa mærcode Iulianus þæs mannes eage mid Cristes
rodetacne and se cniht wearð gehæled, swylce his eage nære næfre
ær gederod.
 175. Ða clypode se cniht and cwæð to Martiane, Se god is to
gelyfanne þe ða Cristenan ongelyfað, and þine godas synd soðlice
deoflu.
 178. Martianus þa het hine beheafdian forðan þe he gelyfde on
þone lyfigendan God þe his eage onlihte and eac his heortan.
 181. He het eac geswencean mid swarum witum þone halgan Iulianum,
and het hine lædan geond ealle þa burh gebundene mid racenteagum.
 184. Martianus hæfde his sunu ær befæst to woruldlicre
lare and to uðwitegunge, on þære ylcan byrig þe se gebundene eode.
 187. His nama wæs Celsus and se geseah þone halgan, and hu
godes ænglas him mid flugon.
 189. Awearp þa his larboc and mid geleafan arn to þam halgan
were and his fet gesohte, cwæð þæt he wiðsoce þam sceandlicum
godum, and Crist andette mid ealre heortan.
 193. Ne mihte hine nan man of þam geleafan gebringan, ne fram
Iuliane þurh ænig þing ateon.
 195. Þa wærð Martianus and eac seo modor dreorige on mode,
and heora men ealle.
 197. And Martianus befran þone mæran Iulianum, hwi woldest
þu amyrran min ancennedan sunu þurh þinne drycræft, and to þinum
Criste geweman?
 200. Beheald ure sarnysse and urne sunu forlæt, and ic ðe
geþingie to urum kasere.
 202. Celsus se sunu sæde þam swicolan fæder þus, Ic
wiðsace þe fæder for þinum gedwylde, and ic gelyfa on Crist þe me
gecoren hæfð.
 205. Witna gif þu wylle mid wælhreowum tintregum þinne
agenre sunu for þinra goda bigencge.
 207. Gif þu nelle me ofslean, asend me to þam casere, þæt
ic þær deað þrowige for minum drihtne Criste.
 209. Þa halgan wurdon gebrohte on blindum cwearterne syððan
be Martianes hæse þær manna lic lagon, þe wæran ær acwealde on
ðam cwearterne gefyrn, þa weollon eall maðon and egeslice stuncon.
 213. Þa foresceawode Godes gifu þæt þær scean mycel
leoht and se stenc wearð awend to wynsumum bræðe, and eall se
unwynsumnyss him wearð to blysse.
 216. Þa cwædon þa cempan þe se cwellere gesette þam
halgum to weardmannum, þæra wæron twentig, Unrihtlic us bið, þæt
we æft gecyrron fram þysum beorhtan leohte to blindum þystrum, fram life
to deaðe, fram soðe to leasunga.
 221. Hi feollon þa ealle to Iulianes fotum, mid geleafan
herigende þæs Hælendes naman.
 223. Iulianus þa bæd mid onbryrdnysse his drihten, þæt he
foresceawode hu hi gefullode wurdon.
 225. Þær wæron binnan þære byrig seofan gebroðra
Cristena, þæs caseres cynnes, and heora fæder wæs Cristen, þam
alyfde se casere heora cristendom to healdenne butan ælcere ehtnysse, for
ðam arwurðan cynne.
 229. Hi hæfdon ænne mæssepreost swiðe mæres lifes,
Antonius gehaten, þe him mæssan gesang.
 231. Þas geneosode se Hælend, and het hi gan to þam
cwearterne mid heora mæssepreoste, þæt þa men wurdon gefullode.
 233. Hi eoden þa on niht and Godes ængel hi lædde and
þæt cweartern geopenade mid his handa hrepunge.
 235. Þa sædon þa gebroðra þæt se hælend hi asende
mid heora mæssepreostæ þa men to fullienne.
 237. Iulianus þa sona þæs þancode Gode, and wearð þa
gefullod se foresæda cnapa, and his fæder cempan on Cristes naman
endemes.
 240. Þis wæarð þa gecyd þam cwellere Martiane, þæt
þa seofan gebroðra butan ælcere ehtnysse woldan for Cristes naman on
þam cwearterne þrowian.
 243. Þa het se cwellere hi of þam cwearterne gelædan, and
axode hwi hi woldan butan ehtnysse þrowian.
 245. Þa cwæð se yldesta broðor to þam arleasan deman,
Andsæte bið þæt treow þe æfre grewð on leafum and næfre
nænne wæstm his scyppende ne bringð; swa synd we Cristene gif ure
cristendom ne bið acunnod.
 249. Þa het se cwellere hi to þam cwearterne gelædan, and
sende his gewrit to þam wælhreowan casere, Gehelp urum godum and hat to
þe gefeccan þisne dry Iulianum þe ure goda anlicnysse mid ealle tobrytte,
and minne sunu gebygde fram me to his Criste, and þa seofan cnihtas þe be
þinre leafa lyfedan buton ehtnysse on þyssere byrig for hyra mycclum
gebyrde.
 257. Þa asende se casere þisne cwide ongean, gif Iulianus
þurhwunað mid his geferum on þysum, nim fela tunnan and do hi þær on
innan, onæl hi siððan ealle oðrum mannum to bysne.
 261. And gif he þurh his drycræft þæt fyr adwescan
mæg, gewitna hi ealle loca hu þu wylle.
 263. Þa het Martianus þa godes menn gefeccan, and axode
Iulianum hweðer hi aht smeadon ymbe hyre agene þearfe on þære hwile
oðþæt.
 266. Iulianus sæde, ure geþanc is swa swa hit wæs; gif þu
ænig wite beþohtest, we synd gearwe to þam.
 268. Þa mid þyssere spræce bæron menn on ðære
stræt anes hæðenes mannes lic, and se heardheorta dema het beran þone
deadan to his domsetle.
 271. Cwæð þa to Iuliane, Eower Crist arærde þa deadan
to life, læt nu geswutelian gif he soð God sy, and ge þisne aræran.
 274. Þa andwyrde iulianus þam arleasan deman, Hwæt fremað
þam blindan seo beorhta sunbeam?
 276. Is swa þeah tima þæt Godes miht beo geswutelod.
 277. Iulianus ða hof to heofonum his eagan, biddende his drihten
þæt he þone deadan arærde.
 279. Þa æfter anre tida aras se deade and clypode ofer eall,
Eala hu andfæncge gebed, and hu clæne mægðhad is on þisum mæran
Iuliane.
 282. Eala hwider ic wæs gelæd and hwanon ic eom nu gebroht.
 283. Þa het Martianus mid his hospwordum þæt he ful sæde
his sið him eallum.
 285. Þa cwæþ se geeadcucoda, me coman to silhearwan atelices
hiwes swa heage swa entes, mid byrnendum eagum and egeslicum toðum.
 288. Heora earmes wæron swylce ormæte beames, heora clawa
scearpe, and hi sylfa unmildheorta.
 290. Þas þyllice me tugon to þære sweartan helle.
 291. Ða mid þam þe Iulianus his drihten gebæd þæt he
me eft arærde, þa unrotsodon helware and of godes þrymsetle wearð
þus geclypod, Beo se man ongean gelæd for minum leofan Iuliane, nelle ic
hine geunrotian on ænigum þincge.
 296. Þa coman twegen englas and me of ðam deoflum genamon and
me gebrohtan to life, þæt ic nu on God gelyfe, æfter minum deaðe,
þone þe ic ær wiðsoc.
 299. Þa wearð Martianus mycclum gedrefed, and het hi ealle
gebringan binnan þam cwearterne eft, and het gearcian ða tunnan to heora
bærnette, swa swa se kasere het þurh his ærendgewrit.
 303. Þa wearð se edcucode man betwux þysum gefvllod binnan
þam cwearterne and gebad mid þam Cristenum, oð þæt Martianus hi to
þam martyrdome gefette.
 306. Hi wurdon þa gebrohte gebundene on racenteagum ealle to
þam tunnum and to þære ontendnysse.
 308. Þa cwæð Martianus mid mycelre angsumnysse to þam
halgum werum and to his agenum suna, eala hwilc anwilnys and geortruwad wylla,
þurh ða þeos fægre geogað nu forwurðan sceall.
 312. Eala þu Iuliane, þe awendest minne sunu swa þæt he
min ne ræcð ne eac þære meder.
 314. Þa com seo modor mid mycelre sarnysse and ealle hyre
hyredmen to þære heofunga, and manega oðre menn to þære mycclan
wæfersyne.
 317. Þa cwæð þæs deman sunu to his dreorigan fæder,
Ne þurfe ge us bemænan ne urne siþ bewepan, bewepaþ eow sylfe, we
siðiaþ to heofonum.
 320. We farað ðurh þæt fyr unforhte þurh God, and we
ansunde becumað eft to eowrum gesihþum.
 322. Þonne þu me eft gesihst gesundne of þam fyre, geþafa
þæt min modor me gespræcan, and sume þreo niht on minum ræde
beon.
 325. Ic wene þæt þu ne forleosa naðor ne hi ne me.
 326. Þa wearð seo modor on mode geblissod, and se fæder
cwæð þæt he þæs cnapan willan wolde gefremman, gif he of þam
fyre come.
 329. Þa het se dema his gingran þis don, and eode mid his wife
aweg to his huse, for þan þe he ne mihte geseon hu his sunu forburne.
 332. Þa het se undergerefa hi ealle gebringan into ðam tunnum
and ontendan hi mid acuman, and mid wuda belecgan, swa þæt se lig astah ma
þone ðryttig fæðma on þæs folces gesihþe, oðþæt þæt
ad wæs forburnen, and ealle þa tunnan.
 337. Ða stodan þa halgan hale of þam fyre glitiniende swa swa
gold, þus herigende God, <foreign>Transiuimus per ignem et aquam, et eduxisti nos in
refrigerium</foreign> We ferdon þurh fyr and wæter, and þu us læddest on
celincge.
 341. Þis geaxode se dema, and þyder efste mid his wife, and
æfter langsumre spræce let þa modor to þam suna on synderlicre
clysincge, þæt heo þone sunu gebigde.
 344. Þa gebædon þa halgan binnan þam cwearterne for
þæt hæðene wif, þæt se hælend hire gemiltsode.
 346. Ða wearð þær eorðstyrung, and eall seo stow byfode,
and þær scean mycel leoht and mære bræð þær stanc, swa
þæt þæt wif wundrode þæs wynsuman bræþes, and cwæð
þæt heo næfre ær naht swilces ne gestunce.
 350. Þa gelyfde heo sona on þone lifigendan God, and wearð
gefullod æt þam foresædan preoste, and fullice gecyrred to ðam
soðan geleafan.
 353. Þa geaxode se dema þis þus gedon, and het hi ealle
gelædan to his laðan andweardnysse, and cwæð to his suna Celse mid
graman, Bæde þu forþi þinre modor spræce, þæt þu hi
gebigdest to þinum bigenge fram me.
 358. Se cnapa þancode gode, þe hi swa gebigde to his soðan
geleafan, þæt heo ne losode mid him.
 360. Þa het Martianus þæt man hi gelæhte, ac hi wurdon
ablende þe þæt bebod begunnon.
 362. Æfter þisum het se heardheorta dema beheafdian þa
cempan þe on Crist gelyfdan, and þa seofon gebroðra he het ealle
forbernan, and heold gyt þa feower mid þam foresædan wife, wolde hi
gelædan to his leofestan godum þe him to lafe wæron þa ða oðre
losodon, þæt hi huru þam godum heora lac geoffrodon.
 369. He het þa gedæftan þæt deofles templ, and þa
halgan coman þider on bendum, and ealle þa hæðengildan þe þæs
huses gimdon coman to þam temple, togeanes þam Cristenum.
 373. Þa bed Iulianus gebigedum cneowum, mid his geferum, þone
heofonlican God, þæt he his mihte geswutelode, mannum to geleafan and
þæt templ towurpe mid his awyrigedum godum.
 377. Æfter þære bene tobærst seo eorðe, and þæt
templ asanc mid eallum his sacerdum, and fela þære hæðenra forferdon
samod.
 380. Þa cwæð Iulianus to þam cwellere þus, Hwær is nu
seo fægernys þines gefrætowodan temple?
 382. Hwær synd þa anlicnyssa þe þu onwuldrodest?
 383. Swa swa hi besuncon on ðone sweartan grund, swa sceole ge
hæðene on helle grund besincan, þær bið æfre ece fyr and
undeadlic wyrm, þe eowre lichaman cywð and ge þeah ne sweltað, ac bið
æfre se lichama geedniwod to ðam witum.
 388. Þær ge biddað mildsunga, ac eow biþ forwyrned.
 389. Git þa Martianus for his manfulnysse nolde on God gelyfan,
ac wearð mid graman afylled, and cwæð þæt he wolde wrecan his
godas.
 392. Het þa bewindan heora handa and fet mid gesmyredum flexe and
fyr underbetan.
 394. Þa barn þæt fyr and þa bendas samod and þære
halgena lichaman belifon ungederode.
 396. Þa wolde se manfulla hi mislice getintregian, ac God hi
ahredde fram þam reðum witum, and sume eac ablende of þam bysmorfullum
þenum.
 399. Þa geseah se arleasa aidlian his smeagunge, and wolde
þagyt cunnian anes cynnes wite, þurh reþe deor, þa þa his reðnyss
ne mihte þurh manna dæda gedon swa he wolde.
 403. He het þa gelædan leon and beran, manega and mycele, to
þam halgum martyrum.
 405. Ac þa reðan deor ne dorston hi reppan, ac bigdon heora
heafda to ðære halgena fotum, and heora liða liccodon mid liðra
tungan.
 408. Þa het Martianus his manfullan cwelleras þa halgan
beheafdian, and hi þæs fægnodon, þanciende Gode ealra his godnyssa.
 411. Iulianus þa and se geonga cniht Martianes sunu, and his
modor samod, Antonius se preost, and se geedcucode man, wurdon tosomne
ofslagene for Criste, and ferdon mid wuldre to þam welwillendan Hælende,
and to heora geferum þe him forestopon, þæt is Basilissa, mid hyre
beorhtum mædenum, and se halga heap þe on ðam huse forbarn, and þa
twentig weardmenn þe se wælhreowa beheafdode, and þa seofan gebroðra
þe he forbernan het.
 421. And hi ealle nu mid Gode on ecnysse blyssiað.
 422. Hit gelamp þa sona swa hi ofslagene wæron þæt mycel
liget com ofer þa manfullan hæðenan, and swiðlic eorðstyrung and
egeslic þunor, swa þæt þæra manfulra mycel dæl forwearð, and
nan stow ne ætstod mid þam stænenum godum, ne nan hæðengyld se
hagol ne belæfde.
 428. Þa fleah Martianus for nean adyd, and he wearð fornumen
æfter feawum dagum, swa þæt wurmas crupon cuce of his lice, and se
arleasa gewat mid wite to helle.
 432. Þæra halgan lic þurh geleaffulle menn wurdon gebyrigde
sona mid blisse binnan Godes cyrcan.
 434. Sy him a wuldor on ecere worulde, we cweþað, AMEN.

ÆLS (Sebastian)
B1.3.6.
Saint Sebastian: Skeat 1881-1900, I, 116-46.



 1. <foreign>XIII KALENDAS FEBRUARII</foreign>.
 1. <foreign>PASSIO SANCTI SEBASTIANI MARTYRIS</foreign>.
 1. SEBASTIANUS HATTE SUM HALIG GODES ðEGN se wæs lange on lare
on Mediolana byrig, and wearð on Criste gefullod mid fullum geleafan.
 4. He wæs swiðe snotor wer and soðfæst on spræce,
rihtwis on dome and on ræde foregleaw, getreowe on neode and strang
foreþingere, on godnysse scinende and on eallum þeawum arwurðful.
 8. Dæghwamlice he gefylde his drihtnes þenunge geornlice, ac
he bediglode swa þeah his dæda þam casere Dioclitiane se wæs deofles
biggencga.
 11. He lufode swa þeah ðone halgan wær, nyste þæt he
gelyfde on þone lifigendan God.
 13. He gesette hine to ealdre ofer an werod, and het hine symble
beon ætforan his gesihðe.
 15. And ealle þa hyredmenn hine hæfdon for fæder and mid
lufe wurðodon, forðon þe God hine lufode.
 17. He folgode þam kasere uncuð him swa þeah, na swylce he ne
dorste for his drihtne ðrowian, ac he wolde gehyrtan ða þe se hæðena
casere dæghwamlice acwealde for Cristes geleafan.
 21. Þa geseah Sebastianus hu sume þa Cristenan woldon awacian
for ðam ormætum witum, and gehyrte heora mod to þæs Hælendes
geleafan, and þa Gode gebrohte þe se deofol ætbredan wolde.
 25. Þa wæron twegen gebroðra æþelborene for worulde,
Marcus and Marcellianus, mycclum geswencte on bendum and on swingelum for ðam
soþan geleafan.
 28. Hi sceoldon þa underhnigan nacodum swurde, ac heora frynd
abædon fyrst æt þam gerefan ðrittigra nihta þæt hi hi gebigdon
to ðam hæðengylde þe hi sylfe wurðodon.
 32. Þa betæhte Chromatius se heahgerefa þa cnihtas sumum
þegne to gehealdenne se hatte Nicostratus.
 34. Tranquillinus hatte þyssera halgena fæder, and heora modor
wæs Martia gecyged, hæðena þa gyt, and hi þyder comon mid mycelre
sarnyssa þær heora suna wæron gehæfte, and mid mycclum heofungum
heora geleafan woldon awendan and þa wita gestillan.
 40. Þær comon eac heora magas and mid manegum tihtingum
þæra cnihta mod fram Cristes geleafan woldon awecgan, swylce hi wislice
dydon.
 43. Heora wif eac bæron heora bearn him on handum, and axodon
mid wope hwi hi swa wælhreowlice dydon, þæt hi freonda ne rohton, ne
fæder oððe meder, and heora wif awurpon and wiðsocon heora bearn, and
heora swuran gearcodon sylfwylles to slege.
 48. Hwæt ða la ongunnon þa godes cempan hnexian and heora
mod awendon to hyre maga sarnysse.
 50. Ða geseah sona Sebastianus þæt, hu þa godes cempan
ongunnon hnexian for þam mycclan gewynne, and wearð him þa tomiddes and
cwæð to þam cnihtum mid cenum geleafan, Eala ge godes cempan, ge becomon
to sige, and nu ge awurpað eowerne cynehelm for þam earmlican swæsnyssum
þissera heofiendra.
 57. Ne awurpe ge ic bidde eowerne beorhtan sige for wifa
swæsnyssum oððe for cyldra tearum.
 59. Arærað eower sigebecn fram eorðlicum gewilnungum, and
onginnað eower gefeoht ongean ða ungesewenlican fynd.
 61. Þas þe her nu wepað woldon mid eow blissian, gif hi geare
wiston þæt þæt ge nu witon; hi wenað to soþum þæt þis lif
ana sy, and ne cunnon þæt oðer þe æfre endeleas bið.
 65. Þis lif is swa swicol þæt hit symble bepæcð þa
ðe hit swiþost lufiaþ and geleafan him to habbað.
 67. Ðises lifes gewilnung gelæt þa unstæððian to
manegum leahtrum and to mislicum frecednyssum.
 69. He cwæð þa to þam magum ðe þa martyras mistihton,
Gif nu þas gebroðra be eowrum benum gebugað fram heora Hælende to
eowrum hæðenscype, ðonne beoð hi mid eow on sceortere blysse, and beon
siððan ascyrede, swa þæt ge hi næfre ne geseoð buton on reðum
witum on þam widgyllan fyre, þær dracon and næddran mid deofollicum
toðum þæra hæðenra breost biterlice ceowað.
 77. Þær is wop and wanung and þæs ne wurð nan ende.
 78. Geþafiað ic bidde þisum gebroþrum nu, þæt hi þas
witu forbugan and beo ge embe þæt ylce.
 80. Lætað hi nu faran to ðam forestihtan kynehelme, and ne
beo ge ofdrædde; ne beoð hi fram eow ascyrede, ac hi farað to heofonum
to Hælende Criste, and rodorlice wununga witodlice underfoð, on þam ge
sylfa moton mid him æfre wunian, ælces yfeles orsorge on ecere blysse.
 86. Æfter þissere lare and oðrum langsumum spræcum, com
leoht of heofonum to ðam halgan wære, and mid þam leohte æteowde an
engel wið hine.
 89. Þa wurdon hi ealle þurh þæt wundor ablicgede.
 90. And þæs þægnes gebedda ðe þa gebroþra heold,
wæs for six gearum for swiðlicre untrumnysse hire spræce benæmed,
and heo hnah adune to Sebastianes fotum mid fullum geleafan.
 94. Þa cwæð Sebastianus, gif ic soð Godes þeow eom, and
gif þæt is soð þæt ic eow sæde, geopenie þonne se ælmihtiga
hælend þises wifes muð, þæt heo mæge spræcan, seðe
Zacharian muð his mæran witegan mid witegunge geopenade þa ða he awrat
Iohannes.
 100. Þa spræc þæt dumbe wif, hire nama wæs Zoe, and
cwæð þæt heo gesawe þone scinendan æncgel cumende of heofenum to
þam halgan wære, and heold ane boc ætforan his eagum, and be þære
bec sæde Sebastianus þa lare.
 105. Þa cwæð Zoe to Sebastiane eft, Eadige synd þa þe
þinum wordum gelyfað, and þa beoð awyrigde þe þises twyniað.
 108. Swa swa dægred todræfð þa dimlican þystra, and
manna eagan onlyht þe blinde wæron on niht, swa adræfde þin lar þa
geleafleaste fram me, and minne muð geopenode and min mod onlihte.
 112. Hwæt ða Nicostratus wearð swiðe afyrht, þa ða he
þæt wundor geseah on his wife gedon, and feol adune sona to Sebastianes
fotum, biddende forgifennysse þæt he þa broðra heold, and unband heora
handa and bæd þæt hi awæg eoden, ac hi þurhwunodon swa þeah on
þam gewinne oð deað.
 118. Þa ongunnon heora magas mycclum behreowsian þæt hi
æfre þa martyras mislæran woldon, and gelyfdon þa ealle endemes on
Crist.
 121. Þa het Sebastianus þone hæðenan þegn þæt he
þa hæftlingas þe he heold on þam cwearterne gebrohte to his spræce,
wolde hi gebigan to Criste.
 124. Ferde þa siððan and gefette ænne mæssepreost,
Policarpus gehaten, halig wær and snotor, þæt he þa nigehwyrfedan mid
fulluhte aþwoge.
 127. Þa wearð gefullod se foresæda Nicostratus, mid his wife
Zoe and þrym and ðrittigum mannum þe him ær folgodon, and mid him
gefullode wæron.
 130. Æfter þisum wearð gefullod þæra martyra fæder
Tranquillinus mid blysse, and his gebedda Martia, mid heora hiwum, and heora
suna wifum; æfter þysum þa hæftlingas þe Sebastianus het lædan
of þam hæftum ealles sixtyne.
 135. Ðæra martyra fæder Marcellianes and Marces wæs
endlyfan gear ær his fulluhte geuntrumed þurh þa mycclan fotadle and
nahte his fæðes geweald, ne furðon ne mihte his mete him aræcan, for
þam ægeslican wearrum þe on his limum weoxon; ac sona swa he andette mid
ealre heortan þa halgan þrynnysse on þam fulluhtbaðe, þa wearð he
gehæled fram eallum his sarnyssum, and herede þone Hælend þe him his
hæle forgeaf.
 144. Þær wæron eac untrume oðre twægen cnapan, oðer
wæs wæterseoc, oðer eall on wundum; ac hi wurdon gehælede fram heora
untrumnysse mid þam þe se mæssepreost hi mid þam fulluhte aþwoh.
 148. Hi wurdon þa ealle þurh þa wundra onbryrde, and on godes
herungum hi sylfe gebysgodon, and gearcodon heora mod to ðam martyrdome,
caflice to campienne for Cristes geleafan.
 152. Hwæt þa Chromatius se mihtiga gerefa, þe romana byrig
under þam casere geweold, het Tranquillinum þæt he him to come, wolde
witan æt him hwæt his suna hræddon binnan þam ðrittigum nihtum
þe he him let fyrste; hwæðer hi gebugan woldon to ðam bysmorfullum
godum, oððe þurhwunian on ðam witum for Criste.
 159. He com ða gehaten to þam heahgerefan, and eac ne bediglode
þæt he on Drihten gelyfde.
 161. Þa cwæð se heahgerefa, þe þa git hæðen wæs,
and eall swa yfele getucod swa Tranquillinus wær ær, Me þincþ
þæt þu bæde þinum bearnum fyrstes to þi þæt þu gelyfdest
heora leasum gedwyldum.
 165. Þa cwæð Tranquillinus to Chromatie þus, þa godas
þe ge wurðiað wæron arlease menn, yfele geborene and bysmorfulle on
life, mid facne afyllede and forðferdon earmlice.
 169. Cwyst þu la þæt nære nan lyfigende God ær þan
ðe Saturnus his suna abite, and heora flæsc æte on þam Iglande
Creta.
 172. Eft his sunu Iouis, þe ge wurðiað for God, se wolde
acwellan his unclænan fæder þe abat his gebroðra þa hi geborene
wæron, se Iouis wæs afylled mid fulre galnysse, and nam his agene
swystor, to his fulum synscype, swa swa ge rædað on eowrum gerecednyssum.
 178. La hu ne dwælast ðu, þe on þysum gedwylde gelyfst,
and þas arleasan menn arwurðast for godas.
 180. Þu forlætst þone ælmihtigan God þe eardað on
heofonum, and cwæðst to þam stane, ðu eart min god.
 182. Þa gewende Tranquillinus awæg æfter þysum.
 183. Ac se heahgerefa het hine gefeccan dearnunga on niht and him
digellice bead anne gyldene wecg wið þam þe he him tæhte þone
mæran læcecræft þe hine swa mihtelice gehealde.
 187. Þa cwæð Tranquillinus þæt mann Cristes gife ne
moste syllan wið sceattum oþþe swa gebicgan, ac gelyf on þone hælend
and þu bist swa hal swa ic.
 190. Chromatius þa bæd þæt he him gebrohte ðone mann
þe hine gefullode and fram þære coðe gehælde.
 192. Tranquillinus ða eode to ðam arwurðan preoste, sæde
hu hi spræcon, and hine sona gelædde to þam heahgerefan.
 194. And he cwæð him to, þeah þe þæs kaseres ehtnys
þa Cristenan gedrecce, þeah for minre hæle ic sylle eow healfne dæl
ealra minre æhta, gif ge mine atelican lima þurh ænig þing gehælen
magon fram þysum heardum wearrum.
 199. Þa hloh Policarpus and cwæð to þam untruman, Crist
mæg þine nytennysse þurh his miltsunge onlihtan, and eaðelice
æteowian þæt he is þin edstaþeligend.
 202. Se ðe sceattas underfehð and sylð Godes gife, se
fordeð his sawle and se seoca ne bið gehæled.
 204. Ac gelyf on þone Hælend and læt þe fullian, and þu
bist swa gesund swa þæs Tranquillinus.
 206. Þa bead Policarpus him þreora daga fæsten, and þis
sona sæde Sebastiane.
 208. Hi ða begen bædon binnon þam fyrste God, þæt he
his geleafan geswutelode þam seocan to hæle.
 210. Coman him siððan to and hine swæslice gretton.
 211. Þa cwæð Sebastianus betwux oðrum spræcon, ne
scealt þu for þinre hælðe anre to ðam Hælende gebugan, ne for
ðinum lichaman anum þe lætan fullian, ac swiðor for hihte þære
ecan hælðe, and for þam ece life ðu scealt gelyfan on God.
 216. Do þin mod hluttor þæt þu leornian mæge þurh
soðfæst gescead hwa þin scyppend sy; ne miht þu elles habban þa
hæle þe þu secst.
 219. Chromatius þa cwæð, sume Cristene synd to þam
bilewite menn þæt ðu ne miht afindan of anum þusende anne þe mæge
þe eawfæstlice spræce sprecan oððe leornian.
 223. Hu mihton þas becuman to Cristes geleafan?
 224. Sebastianus cwæð, Crist geceas fram frymðe hyrdas and
yrðlingas and anfealde fisceras, and hi siððan gelærde and to lareowum
gesette.
 227. Þu wurðast manega godas and manega gydenan; butan þu hi
awurpe ealle fram þinre heortan, and þone soðan God þe ðe gesceop
oncnæwst, ne miht ðu hæle habban ne þæt heofonlice lif.
 231. Ac læt us nu secan þine sceandlican godas, and tobrecon
þa stænenan and forbernan þa treowenan, amyltan þa sylfrenan and eac
swilce ða gyldenan, dælan siððan wædligum þa amoltenan
wæcgas.
 235. Chromatius cwæð, ne cume ge to þam teonan, ac ic
bebeode minum þeowum þæt hi hi ealle tobryton.
 237. Sebastianus cwæð, hi ne cunnon ðone geleafan, ne eac hi
gebletsian, and bið se deofol geare hu he him derige for sumum dyrnum gylte,
and cwæðaþ þa hæðenan þæt hi wurdon gehynde forþan þe hi
þa anlicnyssa æfre tobrecan dorston.
 242. Þa þe habbað geleafan and leornodon to campienne ongean
þone swicolan feond unforhte þurh God, and habbað Cristes byrnan, hi
magon tobrecan ða godas.
 245. Chromatius ða cwæð to þam cenum Godes þegnum,
gewurðe Godes willa and eower eac æt þysum.
 247. Hi þa sona begen begyrndon hi caflice, and to Gode
gebædon, and tobræcon ða anlicnyssa ma þone twa hund, micclum Gode
þanciende.
 250. Chromatius hæfde behydd on his digolnysse an wurðlic
weorc on mechanisc geweorc, of glæse and of golde and of glitiniendum
cristallan.
 253. Se cræft sceolde wissian gewisslice be steorrum hwæt
gehwilcum menn gelumpe on his lifes endebyrdnysse, ac hit wæs swa gehiwod
æfter hæðenum gedwylde.
 256. Þa com Sebastianus and se sacerd Policarpus æft to
Chromatie, and gemetton hine untrumne, and cwædon þæt he sum þing
hæfde untobrocen, þe his hæle hremde þurh reðe wiglunga.
 260. He cwæð þa, ic hæbbe on minum hordcleofan an
wundorlic weorc me to gewissunge, æfter steorrena gesetnyssum swa swa hi
standað on heofonum.
 263. On þam cræfte aspende Tranquillinus min fæder of
readum golde anum ma þonne twa hund punda.
 265. Þa cwæð Sebastianus, se gesæliga martyr, Gif þu
þisne cræft healst þu bist þe sylf unhal.
 267. Chromatius cwæð, hwæt derað þis ænigum?
 268. Ne we hit ne wurðiað mid gewunelicum offrungum, ac hit
gewissað us þurh wisne lareowdom, to gearlicum tidum and tunglena
ymbrynum.
 271. Policarpus sæde þis we forseoð, on þam is
soðfestnysse gelicnys, ac hit is leas swa þeah.
 273. Sebastianus cwæþ, þis is swutol gedwyld and leas
ydelnyss, swa swa we leornodon æt Criste.
 275. Manega menn adrincað on anum dæge togædere, þe on
mislicum tidum to middanearde comon.
 277. Oft on anum gefeohte feallað for wel manige, þe under anum
tungle næron ær akennede.
 279. Eft on anre tide twa mædencild cumað, and bið þæt
an sydefull and þæt oðer sceandlic.
 281. Nis þæt clæne herigendlic ne þæt gale tallic gif
him steorran forgefon þæt hi swa lyfedon.
 283. Forði synd laga gesætte þæt menn rihtlice libban,
and þæt þa rihtwisan beon geherode and þa unrihtwisan gehynde.
 285. Þa wundrode Chromatius heora wisera worda and cwæð, se
is soð God, þe swa gesceadwise biggengan hæfð.
 287. He geþafode ða þæt hi þæt weorc towurpon.
 288. Ac his sunu Tiburtius sona mid gebeote cwæþ þæt he
nolde nates hwon geþafian, þæt man swa deorwurðne cræft æfre
tocwysan sceolde, butan man þa halgan wurpe on twægen hate ofnas, gif his
fæder nære gehæled æfter þære bræce.
 293. Þa forbead se fæder þone frecenfullan cwyde.
 294. Ac þa halgan tihton þæt man þa ofnas ontende, and
gebædon hi to Gode, and tobræcon þæt weorc.
 296. Hwæt þa færlice com fæger Godes engel and cwæð
to Chromatiæ, Crist me asende to þe, on þone þe ðu gelyfst, þæt
þine lima beon gehælede.
 299. Æfter þysum worde he wearð eall gehæled, and arn to
þam engle, wolde his fet gecyssan.
 301. Se engel him cwæð to, Ne cys þu mine fet, ne þu me ne
hrepa, forðan þe þu ne eart gyt gefullod.
 303. Þa þa se sunu þæt geseah, þa gesohte he þæs
preostes fet, and se fæder feoll to Sebastianus fotum, bægen clypigende,
Crist is soð God, and ælmihtig Godes sunu, þe git þegnas Gode
bodiað.
 307. Þa wearð gefullod fæder and sunu mid heora innhyrede,
and heora æhta mannum, ægðres hades menn, ma þonne an ðusend.
 310. Þa cwæð Chromatius, se Cristena þegn, þæt he
eallum gemiltsode þe him æfre abulgon, and þam eallum forgeafe þe him
aht sceoldon, and gif he hwæne berypte, þæt he him þæt forgulde.
 314. He freode ealle his menn and him feoh dælde, and cwæð
ðæt he wið soce þam gewæsum lustum þissere worulde, þe is
gewitendlic.
 316. His sunu Tiburtius, se snotera cniht cwæð, Ic awende
minne willan fram eallum woruldþingum to gastlicum weorcum, nu ic Godes mann
eom, an of þam getele, þe þæt ece lif underfoð.
 321. On þam dagum wæs sum wis papa on Rome, Gaius gehaten
haliges lifes mann.
 323. Wið þone rædde Chromatius and be his ræde underfeng
ealle þa Cristenan into his cafertune, and him biglyfan foresceawode, for
þære swiðlican ehtnysse þe ða niwan asprang æfter Carines slege.
 327. Þam casere næs þa gyt cuð þæt Chromatius Cristen
wæs, and he begeat ða leafe þæt he of þam lande moste.
 329. Þa bebead se papa þam preoste Policarpe þæt he
gewende of Rome mid þam rumgyfolan þegne, and clypode to ðam Cristenum
þe mid Chromatiæ wæron, Ure hælend lyfde þæt mann his life
gebeorge.
 333. Fara nu se þe wille forð mid Chromatie, and wunige se þe
wille mid me on þyssere byrig.
 335. Þa bæd Tiburtius þæt he beon moste mid þam papan,
cwæð þæt him wynsum wære þæt he wurde ofslagan, gif he mihte
þusend siðon for ðam soðan geleafan, and þæt ece lif geearnian
þe nænne ende næfð.
 339. Þa belaf Sebastianus on þære byrig mid þam papan, and
se geonga Tiburtius and þa twægen gebroðra, Marcus and Marcellianus, mid
heora fæder Tranquilline, Nicostratus mid his breðer and his gebeddan Zoe,
Uictorinus mid his breðer and his broðor suna.
 344. Þas belifon on Rome on þære reðan ehtnysse, and þa
oþre ealle endemes ferdon awæg, mid Chromatie, swa swa him Crist
gewissode.
 347. Þa gehadode se papa Tranquillinum to preoste, his twægen
suna to diaconum, and þa oðre to subdiaconum.
 349. Sebastianum he gesette him eallum to mundboran.
 350. Hi wurdon ða gebysgode on heora gebedum ealle, dæges and
nihtes heora drihten herigende, biddende mid wope þæt hi wurðe wæron
for Criste to þrowigenne and becuman to his halgum.
 354. Hi gehældon untrume mid halgum gebedum, and blinde onlihton
þurh heora geleafan, and of wodum mannum þa awyrigedon deoflu afligdon.
 357. Tiburtius gemette ænne mann afeallene, þæt he his
heafod tobræc and eac his ban tocwysde.
 359. Þa sang he him ofer <foreign>Pater Noster</foreign> and Credan, and se mann
sona gesundful aras, and beah to fulluhte mid his fæder and meder.
 362. Æfter þysum wearð gelæht seo eadige Zoe, and for
Criste acweald and becom to his halgum.
 364. Þa oðre wurdon eac ealle gemartyrode.
 365. Tranquillinus wearð oftorfod mid stanum.
 366. Nicostratus se æðela wearð æft gelæht, mid feower
his geferum, and toforan þam deman gebroht, Fabianus gehaten, þe feng to
þære scire æfter chromatie, se wæs ðam cristenan onwerd.
 370. He axode þone casere hu he embe hi sceolde, ða het se
arleasa hi ealle fif pinian.
 372. Fabianus þa se feondlica dema þa ðe he ne mihte þa
menn gebigan fram Criste þurh þa reðan wita, þa het he hi wurpan ut on
sæ.
 375. Æfter þysum wearð gelæht se geleaffulla Tiburtius.
 376. Þa het Fabianus þæt he þam fulan Ioue recels
geoffrode oððe eode him sylf ofer byrnende gleda mid his barum fotum.
 379. Hwæt ða Tiburtius bealdlice eode ofer ða byrnendan
gleda, unforbærnedum fotum, and cwæð þæt him þuhte swylce he
eode ofer blostman.
 382. Fabianus þa, þæs feondes þen, het beheafdian þone
halgan Tiburtium, and siððan acwealde þone halgan Castolum, þe hæfde
geinnod ealle þas halgan.
 386. He gehæfte eft siððan Tranquillines suna, Marcellianus
and Marcus on anum micclum stocce, and mid isenum pilum heora ilas
gefæstnode, and cwæð þæt hi sceoldon swa standan on þam pilum
oðþæt hi geoffrodon heora lac þam godum.
 391. Hi sungon þa sona þisne sealm him betwynan, <foreign>Ecce quam
bonum et quam iocundum habitare fratres in unum, et cetera</foreign>.
 393. Eala hu mycel god is and hwylc wynsumnys ðær ðær
gebroðru beoð on annysse.
 395. Þa cwæð se gerefa þe him swa reðe wæs, Eala ge
ungesæligan and soðlice earmingas, alecgað eowre gewitleaste and
alysað eow fram witum.
 398. Þa gebroðra cwædon þæt hi on Cristes lufe þa
wæron gefæstnode mid fulre blysse, and on swilcum estum ær næron on
life, wiscton þæt hi moston swa wunian oð ende.
 402. Hi stodon þa stille on þam stocce gefæstnode ofer
dæg and ofer niht heora drihten herigende.
 404. Þa het Fabianus mid fullum graman þæt hi man begen
ofstunge þær ðær hi on gebedum stodon, and hi swa mid wuldre gewendon
to Criste.
 407. Hwæt þa Fabianus mid facne gewregde þone æðelan
Sebastianum to ðam arleasan casere Dioclitiane þe on ðam dagum wæs.
 410. Þa het se kasere hine gefæccan hraðe, and cwæð him
sona to mid swicolum geþance, Ic hæfde þe mid þam fyrmestan þe minum
hyrede folgodon, and þu lutodest oð þis on þam laðum Cristendome,
þam godum to teonan and me to unþearfe.
 415. Sebastianus cwæð, Crist ic wurðode symle, and for ðe
þingode and for þinum folce, Ic me gebidde to ðam Gode þe bið
eardigende on heofonum mid healicum mægenþrymme.
 419. Wod bið se ðe bit æt blindum stanum ænigne fultum on
his frecednyssum.
 421. Þa wearð Dioclitianus deoflice gram and het hine lædan
on heardum bendum ut to anum felda and hine þær gefæstnian and hentan
his mid flanum oð þæt he his feorh ageafe.
 425. Þa læddan þa cempan þone Cristes þegn, and setton
hine to myrcelse swa swa se manfulla het, and heora flan him on afæstnodon
foran and hindan, swa þicce on ælce healfe hwylce iles byrsta, and
forleton hine swa licgan for deadne.
 430. Þa com sum wudewe, þe wæs anes martyres laf, on
þære ylcan nihte, þær he læg forwundod, wolde his lic bebyrigan
and gemette hine libbendne.
 433. Heo lædde hine þa to hire huse cucenne, and binnan feawum
dagum hine fullice gehælde.
 435. Þa coman þa Cristenan and ðone cempan tihton þæt he
faran sceolde feor fram ðære byrig.
 437. Ac Sebastianus gebæd hine to Gode, astah þa up to
þære stægre þe stod wið þæs caseres botl, and þa ða se
casere com clypode him þus to, Eowre hæðengyldan þe healdað eowre
templa cwyðaþ fela leasunga eow be þam Cristenan, secgað þæt hi
syndon swutollice wiðer winnan eowrum cynedome and eac eowrum folce, ac eower
kynedom godað þurh heora godan geearnunga, forþan þe hi gebiddað for
Romaniscre leode and for eowrum anwealde unablinnendlice.
 447. Þa beseah Dioclitianus, se deofollica cwellere, to ðam
halgan were þe ðær swa heage stod, and cwæð orgællice, ne eart
þu la Sebastianus þone ðe ic gefyrn het mid flanum acwellan?
 451. Sebastianus cwæð, Crist me aræde æft to þi
þæt ic cyðe eow ætforan eallum folce eower unrihtwisan ehtnysse ofer
ða Cristenan.
 454. Þa het se casere þone godes cempan mid saglum ofbeatan
binnan his agenre byrig.
 456. Þa dydon þa cwelleras swa swa se casere het, and on niht
behyddon his halgan lichaman on anum adelseaðe, secgende him betwynan
þæt huru ða Cristenan ne becuman to his lice, and him to martyre macion
siððan.
 461. Þa æteowde Sebastianus on swæfne anre wudewan, Lucina
geciged, swiðe æwfæst man, and sæde hwær his lichama læg on
þam adelan, het hi faran to and hine ferian þanon, to catacumbas, þær
Cristes apostolas, Petrus and Pavlvs ærest bebyrgede wæron, and lecgan
his lic æt heora fotlæstum.
 468. Lucina þa ferde to ðam foreseadan seaðe on middere nihte
mid hire mannum, and his lic funde and ferede mid wurðmynte to þære
ylcan stowe þe he sylf bebead, and mid geornfulnysse hine þær bebyrigde,
þam ælmihtigan to wuldre se þe gewylt ealle þing, rixiende a on
ecnysse, eces wuldres cyning.
