ÆLS (Maur)
B1.3.7.
Saint Maur: Skeat 1881-1900, I, 148-68.



 1. <foreign>XUIII KALENDAS FEBRUARII NATALE SANCTI MAURI ABBATIS</foreign>.
 1. MAURUS WÆS GEHATEN SUM SWYÞE HALIG abbod, se wæs to lare
befæst sona fram iugoðe þam halgan Benedicte, þeah þe he
æþelboren wære.
 4. He þeah wel on lare and wæs swiðe gehyrsum þam halgan
Benedicte on eallum his hæsum, and on eallum godnyssum Gode ælmihtigon
þeowde, and eac his gebroðrum gode bysne sealde mid haligre drohtnunge, and
he forþy dyre wæs his lareowe Benedicte þe he geblissode mid weorcum.
 10. Hwilon ær we sædon on sumere oðre stowe hu se ylca
Maurus, þurh godes mihte eode uppon yrnendum wætere on anum widgyllan
pole, þa þa Benedictus hine het gehelpan þæs cnapan þe on þære
stream befeol þa ða he wæter fette.
 15. On sumne sæl eode se halga Maurus ham to mynstre weard mid
his gebroðrum.
 17. And Benedictus wæs þa mid anum æwfæstum were,
forþan þe his wif wæs mid wodnysse gedreht.
 19. And Maurus ða gemette ær he to mynstre come ænne dumbne
cnapan and se wæs creopere eac, ac se fæder and seo modor hine feredon
þider.
 22. Hi feollon ða butu mid flowendum tearum to Maures fotum and
befengon his cneowa, halsigende þurh Godes naman þæt he gehælde heora
cild.
 25. Þa nolde Maurus ðam mannum þæs tiðian, cwæð
þæt seo dæd nære him gedafenlic oðþæt þa gebroðra
bædon hine georne þæt he þam healtan cnapan his hæle abæde.
 29. Hwæt þa Maurus sona beseah to heofonum and cwæþ, þu
ure hælend Crist, þe behete þinum discipulum, Soð ic eow sæcge swa
hwæt swa ge biddað eow bið getyðod untwylice ðæs, gif ge
gelyfað þæt ge þa lac underfon, æteowa nu on us ælmihtig
Drihten, þæt we þine þeowan synd þeah ðe we synfulla synd, and we
þone ylcan geleafan mid lufe healdað.
 37. Æfter þisum wordum he cwæð to ðam wanhalan, On
þære halgan ðrynnysse naman, beo þu hal, cnapa, and stand on þinum
fotum ætforan us gesund, mid mines lareowes geearnungum eac swylce
gefultumod.
 41. Þa aras se cnapa and up rihte eode, and mid bliðre stemne
bletsode his drihten, þe hine gehælde þurh ðone halgan wer.
 44. Eft ða þa se halga Benedictus ham to mynstre com, and
þæt wif wearð gewittig þe he fram wodnysse ahredde, þa wurðode he
Maurum for þam mærlicum tacne þe he on ðære hwile gefremede þe he
on fyrlenum wæs.
 48. Maurus wæs eac oftost mid þam eadigan Benedicte, and his
wundra wiste and mid him worhte wundra.
 50. Sume þæra we secgað her, sume we forsuwiað.
 51. And he wæs fyrmest muneca to ðam mæran Benedicte, and
þæs mynstres geweold swa swa him gewissode Benedictus.
 53. On ðam timan asende sum gesælig biscop of Francena rice to
ðam halgan fæder mænigfealde lac and hine micclum bæd þæt he
him sendan sceolde gif him swa geþuht wære, sume eawfæste munecas þe
him mynsterlif astealdon, for ðan þe he wolde aræran on his biscoprice
munuclicne regol be Benedictes ræde.
 60. Hwæt ða Benedictus be his gebroðra ræde swa swa him
God geswutolode asende þa Maurum, þeah ðe he uneaðe mihte for heora
micclum lufe hine him fram lætan to ðam fyrlenan lande.
 64. He funde him eac geferan feower oðre munecas and sume
læwede menn to ðam lande mid him, and nam þone halgan regol þe he mid
his handum awrat, and betæhte Maure mid him to hæbbenne, and heora hlafes
gewiht and heora wines gemett, and asende hi mid bletsunga to ðam
foresædan bisceope.
 70. Eft on ærnemergen sende se arwurða Benedictus twægen
his muneca to Maure mid lacum, þæt is mid haligdome of þæs
Hælendes rode, and of Marian reafe and of Michaheles pelle, and of Stephanes
lichaman and of Martines reliquium, and an ærendgewrit mid þysum wordum
forð, Onfoh, min leofesta, þas endenehstan lac þines lareowes to langum
gemynde, and eow to gescyldnysse wið deofles syrwunga.
 79. Ic sæcge ðe to soðan þæt þu scealt gewitan on
ðam sixteoðan geare þæs ðe þu munuc wurde of þisseræ worulde
to wuldre mid Gode swa swa Crist gyrstandæg me cydde be þe, siððan
þu fram us siðodest on fare.
 84. Ic secge þe eac nu þæt eower sið ne bið na swa, swa
swa we wendon, ac wyrð elles gefadod and on oðre stowe, ac se ælmihtiga
God eow næfre ne forlæt, oð þæt ge gelogode beon.
 89. Farað nu gesunde and gesælige becumað.
 90. Maurus ða ferde mid mycelre blisse, and his geferan samod, to
Francena rice, ac twegen his geferan feollon be wege, an of anum stypele,
oþer on anne stan, swa þæt hi wurdon tocwysede and cwylmiende lagon, ac
Maurus hi gehealde on þæs Hælendes naman.
 96. Eac hi gemetton on sumum mynstre be wege ænne blindne man se
bæd his hæle georne æt ðam halgan Maure, and he hine gehælde
þurh God, and het þæt he wunode butan worunge on Godes þeowdome
þær on mynstre a, and he swa dyde eac siððan of þam dæge.
 102. Eft he gehælde on oðre stowe anre wydewan sunu þe
unwene ða læg, and gefrefrode þa modor, and men þæs wundrodon.
 105. And se cnapa arn sona to Maure hrymende and cweðende, þu
ahreddest mine sawle fram fyrenum witum, and he wearð munuc siððan.
 108. Maurus geseah eac swa swa him God geswutelode on þam ylcan
færelde Benedictes forðsið, and hu he to heofonum ferde, þeah þe he
on fyrlene wære.
 111. Hi ferdon þa forð to ðam foresædan bisceope, þe hi
gelangian het, ac he ne leofode na þa, ac wæs for feawum dagum forðfaren
of life, and oðer biscop geset on his bisceopstole.
 115. Hi wurdon þa unrote, and eoden swa þeah to ðam niwan
bisceope, bædon his rædes, cunnodon hwæðer he wolde þæs oðres
willan gefremman, and him munuclif aræran, swa swa se oðer gemynte.
 119. He cwæð þæt he ne mihte embe munuclif þa smeagen
be oðres bisceopes dihte, ac wolde beon embe his þincg be his agenum dihte,
and gedreohlæcan his hamas.
 122. Hi feordon þa þanon fram þære scire bisceope, and God
him foresceawode on sumere oðre scire on Francena rice fulgode wununge.
 125. Sum forðþegn wæs ða welig on þam lande, Florus
gehaten, and se hæfde gemynt mynster to arærenne, and mid munecum
gesettan, gif he ænige geaxode þe æwfæste wæron, forðan þe
Benedictus hlisa on þæt land becuman wæs, and him wearð eac gecydd be
Maures tocyme.
 131. Se þegn wæs wunigende butan wifes neawiste, forðan þe
his gebedda gefaren wæs of life, and læfde him ænne sunu þe
siððan wæs munuc and abbod æfter Maure, mærlice drohtnigende, swa
swa þeos boc segð swutelice her bæftan.
 136. Hwæt þa Florus ferde fægen him togeanes, and mid
micelre arwurðnysse þa æðelan godes menn underfeng to him and
foresceawode him wununge, herigende his drihten and ðone halgum Benedictum.
 140. Se Florus wæs ða fyrmest þæra Francena þegna, and
ðam cyninge leofest, þe on þæra leode rixode, forðan þe he wæs
æwfest æfre fram his geogoðe, and eall þæs cyninges ræd eode be
his dihte.
 144. Florus ða cydde þam cyninge his willan, and be his leafan
arærde on his agenum lande mynster and munuclif, swa swa Maurus him dihte,
and mid micelre are þæt mynster gegodode, and priuilegium sette on
swutelre gewitnysse, and Maure betæhte þæt mynster mid ealle to fullum
freodome, for his sawle ðearfe.
 151. He offrode eacc þa on ðam ylcan dege his ancennedan sunu
þam ælmihtigan Gode to munuclicere drohtnunge under Maures gymene.
 154. And cwæð þæt he sylf wolde, gif hit God swa
foresceawode eall woruldðing forlætan, and wunian on ðam mynstre on
Godes ðeowdome, and he hit eac swa gelæste.
 157. He gegaderode þa swiðe gode wyrhtan gehwanon, and
arærde þæt mynster eall be Maures ræde wið þa mycclan ea þe
menn hatað Liger.
 160. Hwæt ða on sumum dæge sæton him ætgædere
Florus and Maurus to middan þam wyrhtum, and Maurus rædde and rehte hit
Flore.
 163. Þa feol sum preost færlice of þam weorce, swa þæt
he samcucu læg, sweltendum gelic, and fleow eall blode.
 165. Ac Maurus hine het beran to Martines cyrcan, and Maurus inn
eode, and bæd ðone ælmihtigan for his arfæstnysse, þæt he þam
preoste gemiltsode and hine mihtelice gehælde.
 169. He aras þa eftsona and eode to ðam preoste, and his wunda
bletsode and cwæð him baldlice to, On ðæs scyppendes naman þe
gesceop mann of eorðan, aris þu gesund, and ardlice gang to ðinum
weallgeweorce and hit wel geenda.
 174. He aras þa gesund, swylce of slæpe awreht and began to
wundrigenne hu he wurde ðider gebroht.
 176. Þa cwæð se halga wer, ne wurde ðu hider geferod on
þinum agenum fotum, ac ðe feredon oþre; ac gang nu ardlice eft to þinum
weorce, þelæs þe hit beo gelet to lange þurh ðe.
 180. Ða eode se preost eft to his weorce, and Florus hine
astrehte to Maures fotum and cwæð, þu eart soðlice Maure þæs
mæran Benedictes folgere on wundrum, be ðam we for wel oft gehyrdon
þyllice gereccan, and he þearle siððan Maurum wurðode and on
wundrunge hæfde.
 186. Æfter þysum ongunnon of ðam gegaderwyrhtum tælan
ðone halgan þe gehælde þone preost, cwædon þæt he mid galdrum,
na mid Godes cræftum þyllice geworhte, and wolde beon furðor on oðrum
earde þonne he on his agenum wære, swyðor for gitsunge ðonne for
æwfæstnysse.
 192. Ac ða þa hi swiþost tældon þone soðfæstan
Maurum, þa wurdon afyllede mid ðam fulan gaste þry þæra wyrhtena,
and hi weddon þearle, swa þæt hyra an geendode sona, and þa oðre
twegen totæron hi sylfe mid heora agenum toðum and egeslice grymetedon.
 198. Maurus þa sona mycclum wearð astyred, and wepende eode
into þæra cyrcan, and mid mycelre onbryrdnysse bæd þone ælmihtigan
ðæt he þam deadan and þam deofolseocum gemiltsian sceolde, and heora
sawle gehelpan.
 203. He eode þa eft ut to þam earmum wodum, and on drihtnes
naman þa deoflu afligde of ðam wodum wyrhtum, and hi wurdon gehælede.
 206. He het eac beran into his gebædhuse þæs forðfarenan
lic þe se feond acwealde, and wacode ealle þa niht ofer ðæs wodan lic,
and het þæs on mergen mæssian for his sawle, and arærde þone
deadan þurh drihtnes mihte, and het hine warnian, gif he wolde libban,
þæt he nære on ðam mynstre næfre eft gesewen of ðam andweardan
dæge þe he of deaðe aras.
 214. Þa wearð geendod eall þæs mynstres weorc binnan eahte
gearum, and eac gehalgod mid healicum wurðmynte.
 216. Hwæt ða Florus gemunde hwæt he gemynte æt fruman,
and hwæt he Gode behet þa ða he began þæt mynster, and bæd him
þa leafe æt his kynehlaforde þæt he moste gecyrran fram þam
swicolum welum and wunian on ðam mynstre þe he geworht hæfde, and be
Maures dihte adreogan his lif, and on Godes þeowdome gastlice libban and swa
geearnian ða ecan myrhþe.
 224. Se cyning ða geþafode þam þegne his willan, þeah
þe he uneaðe mihte on his mode findan þæt he swa leofne freond fram
him lætan sceolde, and cwæð þæt he sylf wolde geseon ða stowe,
and þær andwerd beon þonne he his beard alede.
 229. Æfter ðysum ferde Florus to ðam mynstre.
 230. And his kynehlaford com swa swa hi cwædon, and bæd
þæt he moste beon heora broðor for Gode, and forgeaf sumne ham to
þære halgan stowe, and mildelice spræc to eallum ðam munecum
swiðost swa þeah synderlice to Maure, and behet þæt he wolde him hold
beon eallum; and bær him sylf his lac and lede uppon þæt weofod.
 237. Florus het ða forðbæran his fægeran maðmas on
golde and on seolfre and hi Gode geoffrode, and his menn gefreode ætforan
ðam weofode, and awearp his wæpna and wearð þa bescoren ætforan
þam cyninge to Cristes þeowdome.
 242. And se cyning blyssode and blyðe wearð on mode, for
ðæs þegnes gecyrrednysse and soðum geleafan.
 244. Eft æfter gereorde, het se æðela cyning þæt
Florus hine gespræce ær þan þe he þanon ferde, and he com þa sona
mid sumum oðrum munecum on munucwisan gescryd.
 244. Þa weop se cyning, and þancode Gode his godan wyllan, and
tihte hine georne þæt he geornful wære on þam gastlican life and on
Godes þeowdome, swa swa he on woruldþingum wislice ær leofode, and se
cyning syððan siðode þanon.
 253. Eft þæs on mærgen rad Maurus to þam lande þe se
cyning him geaf, and his cepte sum beddryda, se læg seofon gear toslopenum
limum, and wæs þyder geboren to biddenne his hæle.
 257. Þa bletsode Maurus þone beddrydan mann, and he sona gesund
sylf upp aras, swa ðæt hit næs gesene hweðer he seoc wære.
 260. Þa bugon gehwylce æðelborenne menn to Maures mynstre to
munuclicere drohtnunge.
 262. Sume eac befæstan heora suna him to Godes þeowdome,
oðþæt þær gadorod wæs hund teontig muneca and feowertig ealles.
 265. Þa gecwæð se abbod and ealle þa gebroðra þæt
þer ne mihte na ma muneca wunian, þe læs þe ðam gebroðrum
bigleofan ateorode, ac wære þæt getel wunigende æfre, ne læs ne
ma, on þam munuclife.
 270. Hit gelamp ða siððan þæt se gesæliga Florus
gewat of worulde wuldorful to Criste, on ðam þrytteoðan geare æfter
þam þe he munuc wæs.
 273. Sum ercediacon com eac hwilum to Maure, þa næfdon hi nan
win buton on anum gewealdenan butruce.
 276. And Maurus þa bletsode bliðelice þæt win, cwæð
þæt God mihte gemycclian þone wætan, se ðe iu on westene wæter
utteah of heardum stanclude, and of heofonum asende his folce bigleofan
feowertig geara.
 281. Hi druncon ða þæt win wel hundseofontig manna, and
æfre wæs se buteruc brerdful wines.
 283. Maurus gemette ænne man eft se wæs yfele getawod and
hine æt se cancor, and his weleres wæron awlætte mid ealle and eac his
nosu, fornumen mid attre.
 287. Þa bletsode Maurus þone mann feorran, and he sona wearð
wundorlice gehæled.
 289. Siððan nolde Maurus of ðam mynstre faran for nanre
neode, butan he nyde sceolde, forðan þe he wiste hwæt him gewitegod
wæs, ðurh sancte Benedicte, ða þa he siðode him fram, þæt he
sceolde gewitan of worulde to Gode on ðam feowerteoðan geare þæs þe
he ferde fram him; and wunode þa on sundrum, and sette þam gebroðrum
oþerne abbod be heora ealra ræde, ðæs ylcan Flores sunu, þe we
ær foresædan.
 298. He wearð þa gebysgod on his gebedum þearle on Martines
cyrcan mid his twam munecum, to ðriddan healfan geare mid ealre
geornfulnysse, and mid gastlicre gewilnunge Godes miltsunge bæd.
 302. Þa on sumere nihte geseah he þone deofol, þa þa he
wolde gan into Godes cyrcan.
 304. Se feond hæfde him mid fela oðre sceoccan, and forwyrnde
him inganges, and mid graman him cwæþ to, þu come hider, Maure, to
uncuðum earde, and wendest þæt ðu mihtest us awegdrifan of urum
wunungum.
 308. Ac ðu scealt witan nu þæt ic mid mislicum deaðe
þine munecas acwelle, swa þæt earfoðlice heora ænig belifð of swa
micclum werode, þe her wunað mid þe.
 312. Þa cwæð se halga wer to ðam hetolan sceoccan,
ðreage ðe se hælend, þe hæfð ealles geweald, þu leasbreda feond
and facnes ordfruma.
 315. Hwæt ða se sceocca sona fordwan of his gesihðe mid
swiðlicum reame, swa þæt ða munecas micclum afyrhte wurdon awrehte
ðurh his wodlican stemne, and eodon to uhtsange, ær timan swa þeah.
 320. Maurus ða eode into Martines cyrcan, and mid micelre
sarnysse þone soðfæstan God bæd, þæt he him geswutelode be
ðæs sceoccan gylpe, and him gewislicor onwrige þæs awyrgedan saga.
 324. Maurus ða geseah ænne scinende engel wið hine
standende, and þas word him secgende, þu Godes dyrling, hwi eart ðu swa
dreorig?
 327. Witodlice se deofol wat towerde ðing hwilon, na symle,
þurh sume gebicnunge be þam þe he oft geseah, þeah þe he sylf leas
sy; and þæt þæt he þe sæde is soð be dæle, swa þæt se
mæste dæl ðinre muneca sceal of life gewitan binnan lytlan fyrste, and
hi ealle becumað to ðam ecan life; and þu sylf siððan gesælig him
fyligst to Godes rice þurh gode geearnunga.
 336. Æfter ðisum wordum gewat se engel him fram.
 337. And Maurus þæs on mergen þa munecas gespræc, and
ealle his gesihðe him openlice sæde, and manode hi georne þæt hi
gearwe wæron, and mid soðre behreowsunga heora sawle aþwogon fram eallum
synnum, þæt hi siðian mihton to Godes beorhtnysse mid broðorlicre
lufe.
 343. Æfter þisum wordum wurdon þa munecas mycclum abryrde
and heora gebeda sungon, and hi sylfe gearcodon to þam soðan life, and hi
sylfe betæhton ðam soðfæstan scyppende.
 347. Him com ða se cwealm swa swa se engel gecwæð, swa
þæt an hund muneca and syxtyne munecas binnan fif monðum of ðam
mynstre gewiton, and Maurus se abbod geendode siððan, swa se engel sæde
him sylfum on ær.
 352. Þær belifon swa þeah lifes on ðam mynstre feower and
twentig muneca æfter Maures forðsiðe, and he wæs bebyrged binnan
Martines cyrcan.
 355. Þær beoð wundra geworhte ðurh þone halgan wer ðam
ælmihtigan to lofe, seðe lyfað a on ecnysse.
 357. Þæs halgan Maures lif wæs þus gelogod; ða þa he
twelf wintra wæs he wæs betæht Benedicte, and he wunode mid him
twentig wintra siððan, and on his agenum mynstre em feowertig geara;
þæt synd eall togedere twa and hundseofontig geare.
 362. Twegen þæra muneca ðe mid him þyder comon
forðferdon þær on þam foresædan cwealme, and twegen cyrdon ongean
swa swa he sylf bebead, eft to Munte Casin, ðanon þe hi ær coman, and
hyre oðer awrat þas gewyrdelican race, on ledenum gereorde ac we it
reccað on Englisc.
 368. Sy wuldor and lof ðam welwillendan Gode, seðe wurðað
his halgan mid wuldre on ecnysse.
 369. AMEN.

ÆLS (Agnes)
B1.3.8.
Saint Agnes: Skeat 1881-1900, I, 170-94.



 1. <foreign>XII KALENDAS FEBRUARIAS NATALE SANCTE AGNETIS UIRGINIS</foreign>.
 1. AMBROSIVS BISCEOP BINNAN MEDIOLANA afunde on ealdum bocum be
ðære eadigan Agne, hu heo on Rome byrig reðe ehtnysse acom, and on
mægðhade martyrdom ðrowode.
 5. Ða awrat Ambrosius be þam mædene ðus.
 6. On þære tide wæs sum æðelboren mæden Agnes
gehaten, on ðone Hælend gelyfed, binnan Rome byrig, bilewit and snotor,
cildlic on gearum and ealdlic on mode.
 10. Seo wan þurh geleafan wið þa feondlican ealdras, and on
ðam þritteoðan geara þone deað forleas and þæt ece lif gemette,
forðan þe heo lufode Crist.
 13. Heo wæs wlitig on ansyne, and wlitigre on geleafan.
 14. Þa ða heo gewende of scole, ða awogode hi sum cniht,
Simpronies sunu, þe wæs geset ofer ða burh to heahgerefan, and wæs
hæðengilda.
 17. Þa budon ða magas þam mædene sona deorwurðe gyrlan,
and deorwurðran beheton, ac seo eadige Agnes þæt eall forseah, and
þæra maðma ne rohte þe ma þe reocendes meoxes.
 21. Ða brohte se cniht to ðam clænan mædene deorwurða
gimmas and woruldlice glencga, and behet hire welan gif heo wolde hine.
 24. Þa andwyrde Agnes anrædlice þam cnihte, Gewit ðu fram
me synne ontendnys, leahtras foda, and deaðes bigleafa, gewit fram me.
 27. Ic hæbbe oðerne lufiend, þinne ungelican on
æðelborennysse, seðe me bead bæteran frætegunga, and his geleafan
hring me let to wedde, and me gefrætewode mid unasmeagendlicra
wurðfulnysse.
 32. He befeng minne swiðran and eac minne swuran mid deorwurðum
stanum and mid scinendum gimmum.
 34. He gesette his tacn on minum nebbe þæt ic nænne
oðerne ofer hine ne lufige.
 36. He geglængde me mid orle of golde awefen, and mid ormettum
mynum me gefretewode.
 38. He æteowde me eac his ænlican hordas, ða he me gehet
gif ic him gelæste.
 40. Ne mæg ic him to teonan oðerne geceosan, and hine
forlætan þe me mid lufe beweddode.
 42. His ansyn is wlitigre and his lufu wynsumre, his brydbedd me is
gearo nu iu mid dreamum.
 44. His mædenu me singað mid geswegum stemnum.
 45. Of his muðe ic underfeng meoluc and hunig, nu iu ic eom
beclypt mid his clænum earmum.
 47. His fægera lichama is minum geferlæht, and his blod
geglende mine eahhringas.
 49. His modor is mæden and his mihtiga fæder wifes ne breac,
and him a bugað englas.
 51. His wlites wuldriað þa wynsumum tunglan, sunne and mona
þe middaneard onlihtað.
 53. Þurh his spæc geedcuciað eac ða deadan, and þurh his
hrepunge beoð gestrangode þa unstrangan seocan.
 55. His speda ne ateoriað ne his welan ne waniað.
 56. Þam anum ic healde minne truwan æfre, þam ic me
befæste mid ealre estfulnysse.
 58. Þonne ic hine lufige, ic beo eallunga clæne.
 59. Þonne Ic hine hreppe, ic beo unwemme.
 60. Ðonne Ic hine underfo, ic beo mæden forð, and þær
bærn ne ateoriað on ðam brydlace.
 62. Þær is eacnung buton sare and singallic
wæstmbærnyss.
 63. Se cniht wearð geancsumod and wiðinnan ablend æfter
þæs mædenes spræce, þe hine spearn mid wordum.
 65. He wearð þa gesicelod, and siccetunga teah of niwellicum
breoste, on bedde licgende.
 67. Þa cunnodan læcas hwi he licgende wære, and cyddan
þam fæder þæs cnihtes modleaste.
 69. Þa sende se fæder sona to ðam mædene þæt ylce
ærende þe his sunu ær abead, ac Agnes wiðsoc, sæde þæt heo
nolde þæs ærran brydguman æþelan truwan æfre gewemman þurh
ænig wedd.
 74. Þa þuhte ðam heahgerefan huxlic on mode þæt heo
oþerne tealde toforan his gebyrdum.
 76. Befran swa þeah þearle mid mycelre ðrutunge hwæt se
brydguma wære þe agnes onwuldrode.
 78. Him wearð þa gesæd þæt heo fram cildhade sona
Cristen wære, and swa mid drycræfte afylled þæt heo Crist tealde
hire to brydguman.
 81. Hwæt ða Simpronius mid swiðlicum gehlyde, het hi
gefeccan ham to his domsetle, and ærest onsundron mid geswæsum wordum,
olehte þam mædene, and æfter ðam geegsode.
 85. Ac þæt Godes mæden ne mihte beon bepæht þurh
ænige lyffetunge fram hire leofan drihtne, ne heo næs afyrht for his
þeowracan.
 88. Þa geseah Sympronius hyre soþan anrædnysse, and cydde
hire freondum þæt heo forscylgod wære for hire Cristendome, þe se
casere onscunode.
 91. Eft þæs on mergen het se manfulla dema þa eadigan Agnen
him to gefeccan, and sæde hire gelome hu his sunu hi lufode, ac him speow
hwonlice, þeah þe he swiðe spræce.
 95. He gesæt þa his domsetl, dreorig on mode, and behet ðam
mædene menigfealde wita buton heo wiðsoce þone soðan hælend.
 98. He cwæð æft siððan to ðam snoteran mædene,
Hlyst minum ræde, gif ðu lufast megðhad, þæt ðu gebuge mid
biggengum hraðe to þære gydenan Uesta, þe galnysse onscunað.
 102. Agnes ða andwyrde þam arleasan and cwæð, Ic forseah
þinne sunu ðe soþlice is man, and ic nates hwon ne mæg on his nebwlite
beseon for mines Cristes lufe; hu mæg ic him to teonan to þam deadum
anlicnyssum me geeadmedan?
 107. Þa cwæð se heahgerefa to ðam halgan mædene, Ic
forbær þe oð þis forðan þe ðu gyt cild eart.
 109. Þu tælst ure godas swa þeah ne græma þu hi.
 110. Agnes him andwyrde, Se ælmihtiga herað swiðor manna mod
þonne heora mycclan ylde, and se geleafa ne bið on gearum ac bið on
glæwum andgitum.
 113. Læt þine godas geyrsian gif hi aht magon.
 114. Læt hi sylfe beodan þæt we us to him gebiddan, gif
þu þis don ne miht, drece us, loca, hu þu wylle.
 116. Þa cwæð Simpronius, se sceandlica dema, Geceos þe nu,
Agnes, an þæra twegra; oððe þu mid mædenum þæra mæran
Uestan þinne lac geoffrige, oððe þu laðum myltestrum scealt beon
geferlæht and fullice gebysmrod, and ða Cristenan ne magon þe þonne
ahreddan.
 122. Hwæt þa Agnes andwyrde mid mycelre anrædnysse, gif
ðu cuðest minne God, ne cwæde þu ðas word.
 124. Orsorhlice ic forseo þine þeowracan, forþan þe ic
geare cann mines drihtnes mihte.
 126. Ic truwige on him forþan ðe he is me trumweall and
unateorigendlic bewerigend, þæt ic ðinum awyrgedum godum ne ðurfe
geoffrian, ne þurh ælfremede horwan æfre beon gefyled mid þam fulum
myltestrum.
 131. Ic hæbbe godes encgel haligne mid me.
 132. Þine godas syndon agotene of are of þam ðe man wyrcð
wynsume fate, Oððe hi synd stænene mid þam þe man stræta
wyrcð.
 135. Nis na godes wunung on ðam grægum stanum, ne on ærenum
wecgum, ac he wunað on heofonum.
 137. Þe soðlice genimð, and þine gelican, seo grimlice hell
mid þam grædigum fyre, on þam ge beoð toblawene and forbyrnan ne
magon, ac beoð æfre geedniwode ðære ecan ontendnysse.
 141. Þa het se woda dema hyre wæda of adon, and hi swa nacode
gelædan to þam forligres huse, and het clypian geond þa stræt and
cyðan be þysum.
 144. Hwæt ða Godes miht mycclum wearð geswutelod, swa
þæt þæs mædenes fex befeng hi eall abutan sona swa þa cwelleras
hire claðas of abrudon, and þæt fex hi behelede on ælce healfe
gelice.
 148. Hi tugon ða þæt mæden to þæra myltestrena huse,
ac heo gemette þær sona scinende Godes encgel, swa þæt nan man ne
mihte for ðam mycclum leohte hire on beseon oððe hi hreppan, for þan
þe ðet hus eall scean, swa swa sunne on dæg; and swa hi hi gearnlicor
sceawodon, swa scimodon heora eagon swiðor.
 154. Agnes hi þa astrehte þone ælmihtigan biddende, and God
hyre þa asende scinende tunecan.
 156. Heo þancode ða Criste, and ðone clað hire onadyde, and
wæs swiðe gemæte hire micelnysse, beorhte scinende, swa þæt men
geseon mihton þæt God hire sende þone scinende clað.
 160. Þa wearð þæra myltestrena hus mannum to gebædhuse,
and ælc seðe inneode arwurðode God for þam heofonlican leohte þe on
ðam huse scean.
 163. Þa com þæs gerefan suna to þære scinendan stowe,
mid his sceandlicum gegadum, wolde þa godes þinene gebysmrian, and sende
him sona ætforan sume into hire.
 166. Ac hi wundrodon swiðe þæs wynsuman leohtes, and
ablicgede cyrdon to heora bysmorfullum hlaforde.
 168. Þa ðreade he hi þearle forðan þe hi þæs
scinendan leohtes swa swiðe wundrodon, and hi gewemman ne dorston.
 170. Arn þa him sylf inn mid sceandlicum willan, ac he feol
astreht ætforan þam mædene adyd, þurh ðone deofol þe he dwollice
gehyrsumede.
 173. He læg þær swa dæd lange on þære flora.
 174. Ða wendon his gegadan þæt he wære gebysgod embe his
fracedan dæda, þa fandode heora an, and gemette hine deadne, and dreorig
sona clypode, Eala ge Romanisce arfæste symle, gehelpað us hraðe; þeos
reðe myltestre mid hire drycræfte adydde urne hlaford.
 180. Þa arn seo burhwaru ablycged þider sona, and se fæder
eac com, clypigende mid gehlyde, þu wælhreowasta wimman, woldest ðu
geswutelian þinne feondlican drycræft swa þæt ðu minne sunu
adyddest?
 184. Agnes him cwæð to, Hwi synd þa oðre cuce þe hider
inneodon, buton forðon þe hi arwurðodon þone ælmihtigan God, þe me
myldheortlice gescrydde, and asende me his encgel, þe minne lichaman geheold,
seþe wæs fram cyldcradole Criste gehalgod?
 189. Þin sceamleasa sunu mid sceamleasum anginne arn into me, ac
se encgel hine afylde, and ðam deofle betæhte þe hine adydde
þærrihte.
 192. Þa cwæð se heahgerefa to ðam halgan mædene, þin
saga bið geswutelod gif þu þone sylfan encgel bitst, þæt he minne
ancennedan sunu nu ansundne arære.
 195. Agnes seo eadige him andwyrde þus, Ne synd ge na wyrðe
þæt wundor to geseonne, ac swa þeah is tima þæt drihtnes miht beo
geswutelod.
 198. Gað eow nu þeah ealle ut, þæt ic me ana gebidde.
 199. Hi eodon þa ealle ut, and heo hi ana gebæd, biddende hire
drihten þæt he þone deadan arærde.
 201. Þa æteowde þær Cristes encgel, and þone cniht
arærde.
 202. And he arn þærrihte ut, þa he geedcucod wæs,
clypigende ofer eall, and cwæðende þus, An God is on heofonum, and eac
on eorðan, seðe is þæra Cristenra God, and eower godas ne synd
nahtes.
 206. Hi ne magon him sylfum fremian, ne oðrum fultumian.
 207. Þa wurdon þa hæðengyldan hetelice gedrefede, and
clypodon mid gehlyde be ðam geleaffullan mædene, Animað animað hraðe
þa reðan wiccan, seo þe ðus awent þurh wiccecræft manna mod.
 211. Þa ne dorste se heahgerefa naht ongean þa
hæðengyldan, ac forlet his gingran togeanes þære ceaste, and ferde
himsylf aweg sorhful on mode, forðan þe he ne mihte þæt mæden
ahreddan wið þa hæðengyldan, æfter his suna æriste.
 216. Hwæt þa Aspasius se undergerefa ne mihte wiðcwæðan
þam cwealmbærum folce, ac het þa ontendan for þam micclum teonan
swyðe micel fyr, and hi tomiddes besceofan.
 220. Hit wearð þa swa gedon, swa se wælhreowa het, ac se lig
hine todælde on twegen dælas sona, and forswælde þa ðe þa ceaste
macedon.
 223. And Agnes seo eadige stod on ælemiddan gesund, astræhtum
handum þus hi gebiddende, Eala ðu ælmihtiga God, ana to gebiddene,
ondrædendlic scyppend, soþlice to wurðigenne, mines drihtnes fæder,
ðe ic bletsige, forðan þe Ic ætwand þurh þinne wynsuman sunu,
þæra arleasra þeowracan, and eac þæs deofles fylðe.
 230. Efne ic eom begoten mid godcundlicum deawe, þæs lig is
todæled and þa geleafleasan forswælede.
 232. Ic bletsige ðe fæder bodigendlic God, þæt ic þurh
fyr unforht to ðe faran mot.
 234. Þæt þæt ic gelyfde þæt ic geseo, ðæt
þæt ic gehihte, þæt ic hæbbe nu.
 236. Þe Ic andette mid muðe and mid minre heortan, and mid
eallum innoðe ic þe gewilnige, ænne soðne God, þe mid þinum suna
rixast, and mid þam halgan gaste, an ælmihtig God æfre.
 240. Þæt fyr wearð þa acwenced, þæt þær an col
ne gleow, and þæt folc tealde þæt to drycræfte, grymetende mid
gehlyde, grame to feore.
 243. Ða ne mihte Aspasius þa micclan ceaste acuman, ac het hi
acwellan mid cwealmbærum swurde, and Crist hi ða underfeng, for his naman
gemartyrode.
 246. Se fæder and seo modor mid mycelre blysse, gelæhton hyre
lic and gelæddon to heora agenum, and hi ðær bebyrigdon buton sarnysse,
and þær gelome wacodon, wurðigende þa stowe.
 250. Þa on sumere nihte gesawon hi cuman mycel mædenlic werod,
and Agnes tomiddes.
 252. Hi wæron ealle geglengede mid gyldenum gyrlum, and mid
ormætum leohte arwurðlice ferdon.
 254. Þa cwæð seo halige Agnes to hire magum ðus, Warniað
þæt ge ne wepon me swa swa deade, ac blyssiað mid me.
 256. Ic eom þysum mædenum geferlæht, and ic mid him
underfeng swiðe fægere wununga, and ðam ic eom on heofonum geþeodd,
þe ic her on eorðan lufode.
 259. Æfter þysum wordum heo gewende forð mid þam
mædenum.
 260. Þa wearð þeos gesihþ swiðe gewidmærsod.
 261. Hit gelamp ða siððan æfter lytlum fyrste, on þæs
caseres dagum þe Constantinus hatte, þæt sume menn sædon þa
gesihþe his dehter Constantia gehaten, seo wæs hæðen þagit.
 265. Heo wæs swa þeah snotor, and swyðe unhal, and on eallum
limum egeslice wunda hæfde.
 267. Þa ðohte heo þæt heo wolde wacian ane niht æt
Agnes byrgene, biddan hire hæle.
 269. Heo com þa þider þeah þe heo hæðen wære, and
mid geleaffullum mode to ðam mædene clypode þe ða byrgene ahte,
þæt heo hyre hæle forgeafe.
 272. Heo wearð þa on slæpe and on swefne geseah þa eadigan
Agnen, þas word hire secgende, Ongin anrædlice ðu æðele Constantia,
and gelyf ðæt se Hælend þe gehælen mæge, ðurh þone þu
scealt underfon ðinra wunda hæle.
 277. Þa awoc Constantia and wæs swa gehæled þæt on
hire lice næs gesyne aht þæra sarra wunda.
 279. Heo ferde ða hal ham to hire fæder, and hine geblyssode
and hire gebroðra, and ealle ða hiredmenn for hire hæle blyssodon, and
se hæðenscipe wanode and Godes geleafa weox.
 283. Heo wearð þa gefullod swa swa hire fæder wæs, and
hadunga underfeng mid fægere drohtnunga.
 285. And manega oðre mædenu þurh hire mærlican gebysnunga
forsawon woruldlustas and wurdon Criste gehalgode.
 287. Ða bæd Constantia Constantinum hire fæder þæt he
þære eadigan Agne ane cyrcan arærde, and hire sylfre ane ðruh
þær het gesettan.
 290. Þes hlisa asprang þa on eallum ðam leodscipe, and coman
fela untrume to þære halgan byrigene, and wurdon gehælede þurh ða
halgan Agnen.
 293. Þa Romaniscan mædenu manega eac ðurhwunodon on
clænum mægðhade for Cristes lufe, æfter Agnes gebysnunga þe
þær bebyrged is.
 296. <foreign>ALIA SENTENTIA QUAM SCRIPSIT TERRENTIANVS</foreign>.
 297. ON ÐAM DAGUM WæS SVM HERETOGA GEHATEN GALlicanus,
sigefæst on gefeohtum, and ful leof þam casere for his micclan sige,
þeah þe he nære gefullod.
 299. Se awogode Constantian þæs caseres dohtor on þære
tide þe ða Scyðiscan swiðe wunnon wið hine.
 301. Wearð þa se casere for þære wogunge astyrod, wiste
þæt seo dohtor, þe drihten hæfde gecoren, hraðor wolde sweltan
þonne ceorlian.
 304. Þa geseah seo dohtor hire fæder gedrefednysse, and
cwæð him ðus to mid clænum ingehyde, Ic wat þæt god nele me
næfre forlætan.
 307. Awurp þine ymbhydignysse, and behat me þam heretogan,
þæt he me underfo æfter ðam gefeohte, siððan he ða
Scyððiscan mid sige oferwinð.
 310. For þysum behate, ic wille habban his dohtra Attican and
Arthemian to minre geþeodnysse, oð þæt uncre gifta gegearcode beon.
 313. Hæbbe he mid him forð to þære fyrdincge Iohannem and
Paulum, mine ða getreowostan, þæt hi mine þeawas magon him secgan, and
ic ðurh his dohtra his þeawas oncnawe.
 317. Hit wearð swa gedon, þæt heo ða dohtra underfeng, and
se heretoga ferde mid þære fyrdincge.
 319. Þa gebæd Constantia hi to Gode sona mid mycelre
onbryrdnysse þæt he hire bena gehyrde, Eala ðu ælmihtiga God, þe
for Agnes ðingunga, þines mæran martyres, minne hreoflan gehældest,
and me sylfre geswutelodest þinne soðan lufe, and þu behete us on þinum
halgan godspelle, Soð ic eow secge, eow sylð min fæder swa hwæs swa
ge hine biddaþ her on minum naman, Ic bidde ðe, min drihten, þæt ðu
þas mædenu þe gestryne, and heora fæder Gallicanum, þe me wile þe
beniman, geðeod to clænnysse þines geleafan.
 330. Geopena heora heortan earan to þære halwendan lare,
þæt hi þe anne lufian, and eorðlice ðing ne gewilnion, and mid
beornendre lufe to þinum brydbedde becumen.
 333. Æfter þysum gebede gebugon ða mædenu to ðam halgan
fulluhte ær se fæder come, and wurdon gehadode to þæs Hælendes
clænnysse.
 336. Þa com Gallicanus eac to gode gebogen, and hine gebæd
sona mid soðum geleafan æt þæs halgan Petres stowe þe stent binnan
Rome.
 339. Hine wylcumede se casere, and cwæð him to mid blysse,
þa ða þu to þam gefeohte ferdest þu offrodost þam fulum deoflum,
and nu ðu sigefæst come, þu gebæde þe to Criste, and to his
apostolum; cyð me hu hit sy.
 343. Þa aleat Gallicanus to ðam geleaffullan casere, and
sæde be endebyrdnysse hu he beah to Gode, þa Scyððiscan þeoda
ofslogan ure fela, and ic wearð belocen on anre lytlan byrig mid hwonlicum
fultume, and we feohtan ne dorston ongean ðone ormætan here, he hæfde
þa burh beseten.
 349. Þa offrode Ic gelome mine lac þam godum, oþþæt mine
geferan me and hi betæhton ðam onwinnendum feondum, and ic ða fleames
cepte.
 352. Þa cwædon ða cristenan, Iohannes and Paulus, Behat
þam heofonlicum Gode þæt ðu to him gebuge, gif he þe nu gehelpð,
and þu hæfst sige.
 355. Ic ða sona behet, swa swa þa halgan me tihton, and me com
þærrihte to Godes encgel mid rode, het me niman min swurd and siðian mid
him.
 358. Ic him fyligde ða, and fela englas coman on manna
gelicnyssum, mærlice gewæpnode, gehyrton me mid wordum, and heton me gan
forð oðþæt we becoman þær se cyning wæs.
 362. He feoll ða afyrht to minum fotum astreht.
 363. Þa gebundon ða Godes cempan Bardan þone cynincg and his
twægen suna, and betæhton hi me.
 365. Ne sloh ic nænne, ne ofslean ne het.
 366. Nu is þin land gehealden and þa leoda þe onbugað.
 367. Ealle ða heafodmenn þe to me gebugan, mid heora cempum, ic
gebigde to Criste; ða oðre ic forseah þe swa don noldon.
 370. Ic sylf eom swa Cristen þæt ic gecwæð on behate
þæt ic heonanforð nelle habban wifes gemanan.
 372. Find me nu æftergencgan, þæt ic Gode mæge þeowian
on soðre æwfæstnysse swa ic þam ælmihtigan behet.
 374. Þa beclypte se casere ðone Godes cempan, and sæde hu
his dohtra drihtne þeowdon, and his twa geswustra eac siððan gelyfdon.
 377. Þa eodon hi to healle, and seo halige Helena com mid ðam
foresædum mædenum, micclum blyssigende.
 379. Hi þurhwunodon on mægðhade, mærlice drohtniende,
oð þæt hi gewiton of worulde to Criste.
 381. Gallicanus þa freode fif þusend manna, and mid æhtum
gewelgode and wædlum todælde his manigfealdan welan, and gewende him
þanon to sumum halgan were se hatte Hilarianus, mid sumum his mannum þe
hine ne mihton forlætan.
 386. Feower land he forgeaf forð in mid him, ælþeodigum to
andfencge and to ælmesdædum.
 388. Þa asprang his word wide geond land, hu se mære man manna
fet aðwoh, and wæter bær to handum, and mid wistum þenode.
 391. He wearð ða swa halig þæt he gehælde untrume, and
swa hraðe swa he beseah on ða witseocan menn, swa wurdon hi aclænsode
fram þam unclænan gastum.
 394. Eft ða þa Iulianus, se arleasa wiðersæce, wearð to
casere gecoren, þeah þe he wære to preoste bescoren.
 396. Þa sette he geban, swa swa he wæs bealwes full, þæt
ða Cristenan nahton nan þincg on worulde.
 398. Adræfde þa Gallicanum þone godes man aweg.
 399. And he ferde to Alexandrian þære ægiptiscan byrig,
wende siððan to westene and wæs ðær ancra, oð þæt sum
hæðengylda hine ðær ofsloh, forþan þe he nolde þam fulum godum
geoffrian, and he swa mid sige siþode to Criste.
 404. Eft Iulianus, se ylca wiðersaca, wolde gebigan þa halgan
gebroðra Iohannem and Paulum to his hæðengilde, ac þaða he ne mihte
þa mæran Godes ðegnas to his hirede aspanan, ne to his hæðenscipe
geweman, þa sende he him to sumne hæðenne wer, Terrentianus gehaten, se
hæfde mid him ane gyldene anlicnysse, and cwæð to ðam Godes mannum,
Ure hlaford Iulianus het eow gebiddan to þyssere anlicnysse, oððe ic inc
begen ofslea.
 412. Þa cwædon þa halgan, ne cunne we nanne God buton
fæder and sunu and þone halgan gast.
 415. Þyssere halgan ðrynnysse hæfð þin hlaford
wiðsacen, and wile oðre geweman mid him to forwyrde.
 417. Hwæt ða Terrentianus het þa twægen gebroðra
digellice beheafdian, and on heora huse bebyrigan.
 419. Þa wearð Iulianus for his wælhreownysse sona þæs
ofslægæn, þurh sancta Marian hæse.
 421. And Cristendom wæs þeonde, and þa halgan wurdon
gecydde, swa þæt wode menn wurdon gehælede on ðam ylcan huse þe
þa halgan onlagon.
 424. And Terrentianes sunu, mid sweartum deofle afylled, arn to
heora byrgenum, egeslice wedende, and se fæder sona gesohte þa byrigena,
anddette his synne þæt he ofsloh ða halgan, and wearð gefullod, and
his suna wittig, þam Hælende to lofe, þe leofað a on ecnysse; AMEN.

END_TEXT

ÆLS (Agatha)
B1.3.9.
Saint Agatha: Skeat 1881-1900, I, 194-208.



 1. <foreign>NONIS FEBRUARIIS, NATALE SANCTE AGATHE UIRGINIS</foreign>.
 1. AGATHES WÆS GECIGED SUM GESÆLIG MÆDEN ON ðæræ
scyre Sicilia, snotor and gelyfed, on ðam timan þe Quintianus, se
cwealmbære ehtere, þære scyre geweold wælhreowlice under þam
casere.
 5. Se wæs grædig gitsere, and his galnysse underþeod,
deofles þeowetlincg, and drihten onscunode.
 7. Þa com him to earan be Agathes drohtnunge and smeade hu he
mihte þæt mæden him begitan.
 9. Het hi þa gefeccan, and betæhte hi anum fulum wife,
Afrodosia geciged, sceandlic on þeawum, seo hæfde nigon dohtra nahtlice
and fracode, þæt heo geond þrittig nihte hire þeawas leornode, and
hire mod awende þurh þæra myltestrena forspennincgæ.
 14. Hwæt ða Affrodosia, se fracedosta wimman, mid hire nigon
dohtrum gedrehte Agathen, hwilon olecende, hwilon egsigende, wende þæt heo
mihte hire mod awendan.
 18. Þa cwæð Agathes to þam yfelan teame, Eower word syndon
winde gelice, ac hi ne magon afyllan min fæstræde geþanc, þe is
gegrundstaþelod.
 22. Ðis heo cwæð mid wope, and gewilnode to ðrowigenne for
Cristes naman þa cwealmbæran wita, swa swa se þurstiga on ðære
sunnan hætan gewilnað wylsprincges oððe wæteres celincge.
 26. Þa geseah Affrodosia þæt heo þære femnan mod
gebigan ne mihte mid hyre bismorfullum tihtincgum, and ferde to Quintiane and
cwæð him þus to, Stanas magon hnexian, and þæt starce isen on
leades gelicnysse, ærðan þe se geleafa mæge of Agathes breoste beon
æfre adwæsced.
 32. Ic and mine dohtra dæges and nihtes naht elles ne drugon
buton hi æfre tihton to þinre geþafunga, þeah ðe us hwonlice
speowe.
 35. Ic hire bead gymmas and gyrlan of golde, and oðre mærða
and mære gebytlu, hamas and hyred, and heo þæt eall forseah on meoxes
gelicnysse þe lið under fotum.
 39. Þa yrsode Quintianus and het hi ardlice feccan, befran hi
ða æt fruman be hyre gebyrdum.
 41. Agathes þa cwæð, ic eom æðelborenre mægðe, swa
swa eall min mægð me is to witan.
 43. Ða cwæð se dema, Hwi dest þu ðe sylfe ðurh wace
þeawas, swilce þu wyln sy?
 45. Agathes andwyrde, Ic eom godes þinen, and mycel
æðelborennys bið þæt man be Cristes ðeow.
 47. Quintianus cwæð to þam Cristes mædene, Hwæt la,
næbbe we nane æþelborennysse forðan þe we forseoð þines Cristes
ðeowdom?
 50. Agathes andwyrde þam arleasan and cwæð, Eower
æðelborennys becymð to swa bysmorfullum hæftnede þæt ge beoð
þeowan synne and stanum.
 53. Quintianus cwæð, þa cwealmbæran wita, magon
eaðelice gewrecan swa hwæt swa ðu mid wedendum muðe tælst.
 56. Sege swa þeah, ær ðu becume to þam foresædum witum,
hwi ðu ure goda biggencgas forseo?
 58. Agathes andwyrde þam arleasan ðus, Ne cwæð þu na
goda ac gramlicra deofla, þæra anlicnysse ge awendað on are and on
stanum, and ealle ða græftas ofergyldað mid cræfte.
 61. Quintianus þa cwæð þæt heo gecure oðer ðæra,
swa heo mid fordemdum dyslice forferde, swa heo þam godum geoffrode, swa swa
æðelboren and wis.
 65. Agathes him andwyrde anrædlice and cwæð, Beo þin wif
swylc swa Uenus, þin fule gyden, wæs, and beo ðu swylc swa Iouis, þin
sceandlica god, wæs, þæt git magon beon getealde eac betwux þam
godum.
 69. Þa het Quintianus hi mid handum slean gelome on þæt
hleor, þæt heo hlydan ne sceolde.
 71. Ða cwæð agathes eft ða ylcan word.
 72. Quintianus cwæð, þu cwyst þæt ðu gecure þa
tintregu to ðrowigenne, nu þu minne teonan geedlecst.
 74. Þæt mæden him andwyrde, micclum ic wundrie þe
snoterne mannan to swa micclum dysige gebigedne, þæt ðu swylce for godas
hæfst þe ðe sceamað to geeuenlæcenne.
 77. Gif hi soða godes synd, godes ic þe gewisce, gif þu hi
onscunast wit cweðaþ þonne an.
 79. Hat hi swa yfele and swa unclæne, þæt gif ðu hwylcne
wyrige, þæt ðu gewisce him þæs, þæt his lif beo gelic þinum
laðum godum.
 82. Quintianus hire cwæð to, Hwi clypast ðu swa fela
ideles?
 83. Geoffra ðam godum, þæt ic ðe gramlice ne fordo.
 84. Ða andwyrde Agathes unforht þam deman, Gif ðu mid
wilddeorum me nu bætan wylt, hi beoð sona handtame, þurh þæs
hælendes naman.
 87. Gif þu me fyr gearcost, me cymð færlice of heofonum
halwendlic deaw, þurh drihtnes ænglas.
 89. Gif ðu me swingla behætst, ic hæbbe þone halgan gast
þurh ðone ic forseo ealle þine swingla.
 91. Þa cwehte se dema his deoflice heafod, and het hi gebringan
on anum blindum cwearterne, and het þæt heo sceolde hi sylfe beþencan hu
heo mihte ætwindan þam wælhreowum tintregum.
 95. Ða cwæð Agathes, þu, earmingc, beðenc þe hu ðu
mæge ætwindan ðam ecum witum.
 97. Eode þa bliðelice to ðam blindum cwearterne, swylce heo
wære gelaðod to lustfullum beorscype, and betæhte hire gewin þam
welwyllendan drihtne.
 100. Hwæt ða on mergen se manfulla dema het Agathen gelædan
to his laðan andwerdnysse, and befran hwæt heo smeade be hyre
gesundfulnysse.
 103. Agathes him cwæð to, Crist me is for hæle.
 104. Se dema axode hu lange wylt ðu, ungesælige, ateon þas
ydelnysse mid Cristes andetnysse?
 106. Wiðsac ðinne Crist, and clypa to þam godum, þe læs
ðe þu ðin lif forlæte on iugoðe.
 108. Agathes andwyrde anfealdlice and cwæð, Wiðsac ðu
þine godas, þe synd stænene and treowene, and gebide þe to þinum
scyppende, þe soðlice aleofað; gif ðu hine forsihst, þu scealt on
ecum witum ðrowian.
 112. Þa wearð se arleasa gehathyrt, and het hi on hencgene
astreccan, and ðrawan swa swa wiððan wælhreowlice, and cwæð,
Forlæt þine anwylnysse, þæt ðinum life beo geborgen.
 115. Agathes andwyrde on ðære hencgene þus, Swa ic
lustfullige on þisum laðum witum swa swa se ðe gesihð þone þe he
gewilnode oððe se þe fint fela goldhordas.
 119. Ne mæg min sawl beon gebroht mid blysse to heofonum butan
min lichama beo on þinum bendum genyrwod, and fram ðinum cwellerum on
þinum copsum agrapod.
 122. Þa gebealh hine se wælhreowa and het hi gewriðan on
ðam breoste mid þære hencgene and het siððan ofaceorfan.
 124. Agathes him cwæð to, Eala ðu arleasosta, ne sceamode
þe to ceorfanne þæt þæt ðu sylf suce?
 126. Ac ic habbe mine breost on minre sawle ansunde, mid þam ðe
Ic min andgit eallunga afede.
 128. Quintianus ða het hi to cwearterne gelædan, and het hire
ofteon ætes and wætes, and cwæð þæt nan læce hi lacnian ne
moste.
 131. Efne ða on middre nihte com sum harwencge mann into þam
cwearterne, and his cnapa him ætforan, hæfde leohtfæt on handa, wolde
þa halgan gelacnian.
 134. Seo eadige Agathes cwæð to ðam læce, Ne gymde Ic
nanes læcecræftas næfre on minum life, ic hæbbe minne hælend
þe gehælð mid his worde; he mæg, gif he wyle, mihtelice me
gehælan.
 138. Þa cwæð se harwencga, He me sende to ðec ; Ic eom his
apostol, and ðu efne nu bist hal on his naman.
 140. And he sona ferde.
 141. Þa cneowode Agathes and ðancode Criste þæt he hi
gemunde and his mæran apostol to hire asende mid swylcum frofre.
 144. Æfter ðam gebede beseah to hyre breoste, and wæs
þæt corfene breost þurh Crist geedstaðelod, and ealle hire wunda
wurdon gehælede.
 147. Þær scean ða mycel leoht on þam sweartum cwearterne,
swa þæt ða weardas flugon mid fyrhte fornumene.
 149. Þa tihton þa hæftlingas þæt halige mæden
þæt heo awæg eode, and ða wita forfluge.
 151. Þa cwæð Agathes, þæt æðele mæden, Nelle ic
amyrran mine kynehelm, ne ða weardas geswencan, ac ic þurhwunige her.
 154. Þa on ðam fiftan dæge het se dema hi gefeccan, and
cwæð þæt heo sceolde þam godum geoffrian, oððe mid teartum
witum getintregod beon.
 157. Þa cwæð Agathes, þu earma andgitleasa, hwa wyle
clypian to stane, and na to þam soðan gode ðe me fram eallum þam witum,
þe ðu wælhreowlice on minum lice gefæstnodest, for his naman
gehælde and min breost geedstaðelode, þe ðu, arleasa, forcurfe?
 162. Þa befran se hæðengylda hwa hi gehælde.
 163. Agathes cwæð, Crist godes sunu.
 164. Quintianus cwæð to ðam clænum mædene, git þu
namast Crist?
 165. Heo cwæð him to andsware, Crist ic andette mid welerum
and æfre mid heortan to him clypige.
 167. Ða cwæð se deofles þen, nu ic sceal geseon gif Crist
ðe gehælð.
 168. Het ða streowian geond þa flor, fela byrnenda gleda and
tobrysede tigelan, and hi swa nacode het wylian on þam fyre.
 171. Þa wearð mycel eorðstyrung on ðære ylcan stowe, and
feol se stænene wah uppan þæs stuntan rædboran, þæt he
ælltocwysde and sum oþer cniht samod, swyðe rihtlice swa forðan þe
hi rædboran wæran þæs arleasan deman to his yfelum dædum.
 176. Eac swylce seo burh eall byuigende stod for ðære
eorðstyrunge, and arn seo burhwaru endemes to þam arleasan, axiende mid
gehlyde hwi he þæt Godes mæden swa gramlice tintregode.
 180. Þa fleah Quintianus, afyrht for ðam gehlyde, and eac seo
eorðstyrung hine geegsode þearle; het swa þeah hi gebringan binnan ðam
cwearterne.
 183. Hwæt ða Agathes inwerdlice clypode mid astrehtum handum
to þam Hælende þus, Eala ðu min drihten, þe me to menn gesceope, and
æfre fram cyldhade me gescyldest ofþis, þu þe woruldlice lufe awendest
fram me, þu ðe dydest þæt ic ofercom þæs cwelleres tintregu,
scearp isen and fyr and þa slitendan clawa, þu ðe me on þam witum
geþyld forgeafe; ðe ic bidde, Drihten, þæt ðu minne gast nu to þe
genime, forðan þe nu is tima þæt ic þas woruld forlæte, and to
þinre liðan miltheortnysse becuman mote, min leofa Drihten.
 195. Æfter þysum gebede binnan þam cwearterne heo ageaf hire
gast, and to Gode siðode.
 197. Þa com seo burhwaru, and bebyrigde hire lic mid mycelre
arwurðnysse on eallniwere þryh.
 199. Þær com ða godes encgel gangende swa swa mann, þam
fyligdan æt fotum fela wlitige cnapan, and sette enne marmstan æt
þæs mædenes heafde binnan þære þryh, þysum wordum awritene,
<foreign>Mentem sanctam spontaneam, honorem deo, et patrie liberationem</foreign>.
 204. Þæt is on Englisc, halig mod sylfwille, wurðmynt þam
welwyllendan Gode, and eardes alysednyss.
 205. Þa awende se encgel aweg mid þam cnapum, and nes se mann
on þære scire þe hi gesawe ærþan.
 207. Hwæt ða, Quintianus, Cristes wiðerwinna, ferde on scipe
ofer Semithetum embe Agathen æhta, and eac wolde gehæftan ealle hire
mægðe, ac he ne moste for Criste.
 211. Hine gelæhte an hors, þa ða he læg on ðam scipe,
hetelice mid toðum and hefde him upp.
 213. Þa spearn oðer hors to, and asprencde hine ofer bord, and
næs his fule lic afundan æfre siððan.
 215. Þa ne dorste nan man dreccan hire megðe, ac arwurðodon
hi ealle, geegsode þurh God.
 217. On þære ylcan scire Sicilian landes is an byrnende munt,
þone menn hatað Ethna, onæled mid <foreign>sulphore</foreign>, þæt is swæfel on
Englisc.
 220. Se munt byrnð æfre, swa swa ma oþre doð.
 221. Þa getimode hit ymbe twelfmonað æfter Agathes
þrowunge, and Ethna up ableow swyðe egeslice ontendnysse, and arn be þam
munte on flodes gelicnysse, and formulton þa stanas, and seo eorðe forbarn,
oð þæt hit to þære byrig becom.
 226. Þa urnon þa hæðenan to þære halgan byrgene, and
ahofen þone oferbrædels of þære halgan byrgene togeanes þam fyre,
þe hi afærde forðearle.
 229. Þa wearð þæt fyr gestilled, and ætstod sona for
Agathen geearnungum, þære æðelan femnan.
 231. Six dagas hit barn, and ætstod on þam dæge þe seo
eadige Agathes to ðam ece life gewat, þæt swa wurde geswutelod þæt
seo ceaster wearð ahred fram þæs fyres frecednysse þurh Agathen
foreþingunge, þam Hælende to lofe, þe his halgan swa wurðaþ.
 236. Þæs him sy a wuldor on ecere worulde; AMEN.

ÆLS (Lucy)
B1.3.10.
Saint Lucy: Skeat 1881-1900, I, 210-18.



 1. <foreign>DE SANCTA LUCIA UIRGO</foreign>.
 1. ÐA ASPRANG AGATHEN HLISA OFER LAND AND SÆ, SWA þæt
fram Siracusa sohte mycel meniu ofer fiftig mila þæs mædenes byrgene,
on Catanensciscre byrig mid mycelre onbryrdnysse.
 5. Þa com sum wydewe, seo wæs geciged Euthicia, betwux oðrum
mannum to þære mæran byrigene, and hire dohtor samod, seo gesælige
Lucia.
 8. Seo wydewe wæs unhal, swa þæt hire arn blod geond feower
geare fæc, and fæla læca cunnode, ac hi ealle ne mihton hyre anre
gehelpan.
 11. Hit gelamp ða æt þære mæssan, þæt man
rædde þæt godspell, hu þæt wif wearð gehæled, þe wæs on
blodes ryne, þaða heo hrepode þæs Hælendes reaf.
 14. Þa cwæð Lucia mid geleafan to hire meder, Gif þu
gelyfst, modor, þysum mæran godspelle, gelyf þæt Agathes geearnode
æt Criste, þaða heo for his naman ðrowode þæt heo hine symle
hæbbe on andwerdnysse on ecere blysse.
 19. Gehrepa hire byrigene, and þu bist sona hal.
 20. Þa æfter þære mæssan seo modor and seo dohtor
astrehton hi on gebedum æt þære byrgene.
 22. Mid þam þe hi lagon and gelencgdon ða gebedu, þa
wearð Lucia on slæpe, and geseah Agathen betwux engla werodum, ænlice
gefretewode, and clypode hyre þus to, clypigende ufenne, Min swustor Lucia,
soð godes mæden, hwi bitst þu æt me þæs þe ðu miht sylf
getiðian?
 28. Þinre meder geheolp þin halga geleafa, and efne heo is
gehæled halwendlice ðurh Crist.
 30. And swa swa þeos burh is gemærsod þurh me fram Criste,
swa bið Siracusa burh þurh þe gewlitegod, forðan þe þu gearcodest
Criste, on þinum clænan mægðhade, wynsume wununge.
 33. And ða awoc Lucia.
 34. Heo aras ða bifigende for ðære beorhtan gesihðe, and
sæde to hire meder, þu eart mihtiglice gehæled.
 36. Nu bidde ic þe, þurh þa ylcan þe þe mid gebedum
gehælde, þæt þu nanne brydguman næfre me ne namige, ne of minum
lichaman deadlicne wæstm ne sece; ac þa ðing þe þu woldest to
gewemmednysse me syllan, forgif me ða to clænnysse to Criste farendre.
 41. Þa cwæð seo modor, mine þincg þu wast, and ic heold
nu nigon gear wið ealle hynða þines fæder gestreon and furðor hi
geeacnode.
 44. Beluc ærest mine eagan, and þa æhta ateoh loca hu þe
licige, min leofa dohtor.
 46. Þa cwæð Lucia, hlyst mines rædes; ne miht ðu naht
lædan of þysum life mid þe, and þæt þu on deaðe sylst for
drihtnes naman, þu hit sylst for þan þe þu hit ne miht mid þe
aweglædan.
 50. Ac syle nu on gesundfulnysse þam soðan Hælende swa
hwæt swa þu gemyntest on forðsiþe to donne.
 52. Þus tihte Lucia gelome þa modor, oð þæt heo
beceapode þa scinendan gymmas, and eac hire landare wið licgendum feo, and
dælde siððan þearfum and ælþeodigum mannum, wydewum and wreccum
and wisum Godes þeowum.
 57. Þis com þa to earan þam æðelborenan cnihte þe
awogode Lucian, se wæs geciged Pascasius, arleas hæðengilda, and tihte
þæt halige mæden to þæra deofla offrungum.
 60. Ac þæt drihtnes mæden cwæð, Hluttor offrung
þæt is, and licwurðe Gode, þæt mann wydewan geneosige and wreccan
gefrefrige, and steopbearnum gehelpe on heora gedrefednyssum.
 64. Ne dreah ic nu þrym gearum nane oþre dæda, butan þam
lyfigendan drihtne þas lac geoffrode.
 66. Nu ic wylle me sylfe him soðlice geoffrian, forðan ic leng
næbbe hwæt ic on his lacum aspende.
 68. Þa yrsode Pascasius, and hi spræcon fela, oð þæt he
hire swingele behet gif heo suwian nolde.
 70. Lucia him cwæð to, þæs lifigendan Godes word ne magon
geswican, ne forsuwode beon.
 72. He axode ða mid olle, Eart þu la God?
 73. Lucia him andwyrde, Ic eom þæs ælmihtigan þinen;
forþi ic cwæð Godes word, forþan þe he on his godspelle cwæð,
Ne synd ge þe þær sprecað, ac sprycþ se halga gast on eow.
 76. Eft þa Pascasius orgellice befran, Wunað se halga gast on
þe eornostlice?
 78. Lucia andwyrde þam arleasan and cwæð, Se apostol behet
þam ðe healdað clænnysse, þæt hi synd godes templ, and þæs
halgan gastes wunung.
 81. Þa cwæð se arleasa, Ic hate þe ardlice lædan to
þæra myltestrena huse, þæt ðu þinne mægðhad forleose,
þæt se halga gast þe fram fleo, ðonne þu fullice byst gescynd.
 84. Lucia andwyrde þus, ne bið ænig gewemmed lichama to
plihte gif hit ne licað þam mode.
 86. Þeah þu mine hand ahebbe to ðinum hæþengilde, and
swa þurh me geoffrige mines unwilles, ic beo þeah unscyldig ætforan
ðam soðan Gode, seþe demð be þam willan, and wat ealle þincg.
 90. Gif þu me unwilles gewemman nu dest, me bið twifeald
clænnysse geteald to wuldre.
 92. Ne miht þu gebigan minne willan to þe, swa hwæt swa þu
minum lichaman dest, ne mæg þæt belimpan to me.
 95. Þa wolde se wælhreowa his word gefyllan, þæt heo
wurde gelæd to þære laðan fulnysse, and begunnon hi teon to þære
galnysse huse; ac Godes miht wearð geswutelod sona on þam mædene, swa
þæt se halga gast hi heold and mid hefe gefæstnode, þæt þa
manfullan ne mihton þæt mæden astyrian.
 100. Þa cnitton hi rapas mid reðum anginne hire to handum and
fotum, and fela samod tugon, ac heo næs astyrod, ac stod swa swa munt.
 103. Þa wearð geancsumod se arleasa Pascasius, and het him
gelangian þa leasan drymen to, þæt hi þæt Godes mæden mid heora
galdrum oferswyðdon.
 106. Ac ðaþa him naht ne speow, þa het he spannan oxan to, ac
hi ne mihton awecgan þæt mæden þagit swa.
 108. Se cwellere þa cwæð to þam clænan mædene,
hwæt is se intinga þæt an þusend manna þe ne magon astyrian swa
unstrang swa ðu eart?
 111. Lucia him cwæð to, þeah þu clypige tyn þusend
manna, hi sceolan ealle gehyran þone halgan gast þus cweðende, <foreign>Cadent a
latere tuo mille, et decem milia a dextris tuis, tibi autem non adpropinquabit
malum,</foreign> þusend feallað fram þinre sidan, and tyn þusend fram þinre
swyðran, þe sylf soðlice ne genealecæð nan yfel.
 116. Þa wearð se arleasa geancsumod eft swiðor on mode, and
het mycel ad ontendan on ymbhwyrfte þæs mædenes, and mid pice hi
besprencgan/ and mid spyrcendum ele.
 119. Heo stod þa unforht on þam fyre and cwæð, Ic abæd
æt Criste þæt ðis cwealmbæra fyr me ne gewylde, þæt þu
wurðe gescynd, and hit þam geleaffullum afyrsige þære ðrowunge
forhtunge, and þam ungeleaffullum þa yfelan blysse ofteo.
 124. Þa wearð se wælhreowa wodlice geancsumod, þæt his
magas ne mihton his modleaste acuman; Ac heton acwellan þæt clæne
mæden mid swurde.
 127. Heo wearð þa gewundod, þæt hire wand se innoð ut,
ac heo ne gewat swa þeah, ac þurhwunode on gebedum swa lange swa heo wolde,
and to þære leode cwæð, Ic secge eow to soþan þæt sib is
forgifen Godes gelaðunge, and se gramlica casere Dioclytianus is gedon of his
rice and Maximianus se manfulla is dead.
 134. Swa swa seo Catanenscisce burh binnan hire weallum hæfð
minre swyster Agathen miccle foreþingunga, swa ic eom forgifen, fram þam
ælmihtigan Gode nu þyssere byrig Siracusanan eow to geþingienne, gif ge
foð to geleafan.
 139. Mid þam þe heo þis spræc, wearþ se manfulla
Pascasius mid racenteagum gebunden, and beforan ðam mædene gelæd.
 141. He wæs ær gewreged for his wælhreowum dædum, to
Romaniscre leode, þe ða ealle land geweolden.
 143. He wearð þa gebroht on bendum to Rome, and þa witan
heton hine beheafdian, þaþa he ne mihte his mandæda betellan.
 146. Seo eadiga Lucia on þære ylcan stowe wunode þe heo
ofslagen wæs, oðþæt sacerdas coman and hi gehusloden mid haligre
gerynu.
 149. And heo gewat to Criste mid þam þe hi cwædon amen.
 150. Þa arærde þa leoda þær heo læg cyrcan, and on
hire naman gehalgodon, þam hælende to wurðmynte seðe æfre rixað
on ecnysse god;AMEN.

ÆLS (Peter's Chair)
B1.3.11.
Chair of Saint Peter: Skeat 1881-1900, I, 218-38.



 1. <foreign>UIII KALENDAS MARTIAS, CATHEDRA SANCTI PETRI</foreign>.
 1. WE CWEÐAþ ON GERIMCRÆFTE CATHEDRA SANCTI PETRI seofon
nihton er þam monðe þe we Martius hatað.
 3. Nu synd sume men þe nyton hwæt se nama getacnað.
 4. Cathedra is gereht bisceopstol on Englisc, and se halga Petrus
wæs ahafen on þam dæge on his bisceopstol on þære byrig
Antiochian.
 7. Þone stol he gesæt seofon gear fullice, and siððan
gewende be Godes wissunge to þære mæran Rome byrig and þær binnan
wunode fif and twentig geara, and fela wundra æteowde þære Romaniscan
leode oðþæt he hi to geleafan gebigde.
 12. He ferde fram Antiochian for þan þe he wæs apostol and
sceolde gehwær gecuman and Cristendom aræran.
 14. Þa gesæt he on Rome oðer bisceopsetl, oð þæt se
arleasa Nero hine ahencg on rode.
 16. Nu wylle we eow secgan sume Petres wundra, him to wurðmynte
and eow to trymmincge, ac ure mæð nys þæt we ealle his mærða
secgan.
 19. We sædon hwilon ær hu his sceadu gehealde ealle þa
untruman þe heo oferglad, swa hwær swa he eode, and hi ealle astodon
ansunde ætforan him, þe on ðam fænne ær lagon.
 23. Nu wylle we eac eow secgan hu he sume dæg eode to þam
Godes temple mid þam godspellere Iohanne.
 25. Þa læg þær sum creopere lama fram cildhade, se wæs
dæghwamlice geboren to þam beorhtan gete, þæt he ælmessan
underfencge æt þam infarendum.
 28. Ða beseah he to Petre sumere ælmessan wilnigende.
 29. Petrus soþlice cwæð, Næbbe ic seolfor ne gold, ic
þe do þæt ic hæbbe, aris on Drihtnes naman hal on þinum fotum, and
gefeng his swiðran arærde hine upp.
 32. And he leop sona cunnigende his feðes, hwæðer he cuðe
gan.
 34. Eode þa mid blisse binnan þam temple mid þam halgum
apostolum, þone hælend herigende.
 36. Þa oncneowan hine ealle þe hine cuðon ær, and micclum
wundrodon þæs wædlan hæle.
 38. Eft æt sumon sæle þa Petrus siþode neosigenne þa
geleaffullan, þa becom he to Liddan, wolde ða gebroðra gespræcan þe
on þære byrig eardodon.
 41. Þa gemette he anne bædrydan binnon þam weallum, Eneas
gehaten, for eahte gearum lama.
 43. Þa cwæð se eadiga Petrus to þam earman bæddrydan,
gehæle ðe drihten Crist, aris and do þe gearowne.
 45. Þa aras se bæddryda unbunden fram Petre, se þe hæfð
þa mihte þæt he mæg unbinden þa fæstan cnottan fyrnlicra synna
þam ðe mid dædbote hine biddað georne þæt he him geþingie to
þam hælende criste.
 50. Þa gelyfde seo burhwaru, þurh þæs bæddrydan
hæle,on þone soðan God, and gecyrde to fulluhte, and þa Saroniscan swa
gelice dydon.
 53. Ioppe hatte sum burh, gehende þære Liddan, on þære
wæs an wydewe wel gelyfed, Thabitas geciged, and swyþe ælmesgeorn, and
mid godum weorcum geglencged forþearle.
 57. Seo wearð geuntrumad on þam ylcan timan, gewat þa of
life, and læg on uppflora.
 59. Þa geaxodon þa geleaffullan þe þæt lic besætan
þæt Petrus wæs on Liddan, þam lande swa gehende, asendan þa twegen
weras wið his, and bædon þæt he butan yldincge hi geneosode.
 63. Þa aras se apostol and ardlice þider com, eode to þære
uppflora, and efne him embe stodon wepende wydewan and wanhafele þearfan,
æteowigende him þa reaf and þa gerenodan tunecan, þe Thabitas him
worhte ær þan þe heo gewite.
 68. Þa het se halga Petrus þæt hi him þæt hus gerymdon,
and gebigde his cneowa biddende hire lifes.
 70. Wende þa to þam lice and hlude clypode, Thabita aris, and
heo þærrihte geedcucode, beseah to Petre, and geset hire upp.
 73. Þa gelæhte Petrus hire liþian hand, arærde hi upp
hale of þam bedde.
 75. Þa asprang þis wundor wide geond þæt land, and fela
gelyfdon on þone lifigendan God.
 77. Þa wunode Petrus æfter þære wydewan æryste manega
dagas on Ioppe, mid sumum gelyfedan menn, Symon gehaten; his hus stod wið
þa sæ.
 80. Þa wolde se apostol hine onsundron gebiddan, and astah to
þære uppflora embe midne dæg utan, wæs eac ofhingrod, and wolde
þær anbidian.
 83. Þa wearð him æteowed wundorlic gesihð, he geseah
heofonas opene and him com to an fæt, fyðerscyte and brad, and binnan
þam wæron ealle cuce nytenu creopende and gangande.
 87. Him com stemn to, þus clypiende þriwa, aris nu Petrus, and
þas reðan deor ofsleh, maca þe to mete, þæt þu mege þe
gereordian.
 90. Þa cwæð se halga wer, ne gewurðe hit, leof Drihten,
forþan ðe ic ne onbyrgde swa hwæt swa unclæne bið.
 92. Þa com him eft stemn to þus clypigende of heofonum,
þæt þæt God geclænsode, ne cwæð þu þæt hit ful sy.
 94. Þriwa him wæs þus geclypod to, and þærrihte wearð
þæt fæt upp to heofonum abroden, eft mid þam nytenum.
 96. We wyllað eow secgan sceortlice þas getacnunge.
 97. Þæt fyþerscyte fæt mid þam fulum nytenum hæfde
getacnunge ealles hæðenes folces, þe on fyðerscytum middanearde
fullice leofdon, ac Crist hi geclænsode, þurh his tocyme on worulde.
 101. And forþi cwæþ se stemn clypigende to Petre, þæt
he hine gereordode mid þam reþenum nytenum, forþan þe hi wæron
geclænsode þurh Cristes þrowunge, and he sceolde hi awendan of þam
wyrmhiwe þurh soðe lare to gesceadwisnysse, and to manna gelicnysse of
þam laðum hiwe.
 107. Þriwa clypode seo stemn fram þære halgan ðrynnysse,
seo þe is an ælmihtig God æfre untodæledlic.
 109. Mid þam ðe Petrus smeade hwæt his gesihð gemænde,
þa clypodon þær ðry weras, cnucigende æt þam geate, and axodon
æt þam hiwum hwæðer se halga Petrus þær wununge hæfde, woldon
hine gespræcan.
 113. Efne þa se halga gast him þæt sæde and cwæð,
þry weras þe secað, of Cessarean byrig, aris and far mid him, forþan
þe ic hi asende.
 116. Petrus þa eode ardlice to ðam mannum, befran for hwylcum
intingan hi hine axodon.
 118. Hi sædon þæt Cornelius hi asende to him.
 119. He is hundredes ealdor, and hæfð Godes ege, swyðe
rihtwys wer, þæt wat eall þeos scyr.
 121. Him com to Godes æncgel and cwæð þæt he sceolde
þe him to langian, and þine lare gehyran.
 123. Þa on ærnemergen eode se eadiga Petrus mid þam
ærendracum, and eac his gebroðra samod to Cessarean byrig.
 126. Cornelius gelaðode his leofestan freond, wolde þæt hi
gehyrdon þa halgan lare æt Petre, and eode him togeanes, and hine
eadmodlice gebigde adune to his fotum, ac his onfencg Petrus.
 130. Eode þa inn mid Cornelie, and cwæð to him eallum, Ge
witon þæt us Iudeiscum ne gedafenað to genealecenne eow hæðenum
mannum, ac me geswutelode God þæt us nys to cweðenne þæt ge
unclæne syndon.
 134. Ic com eac forþy buton ælcere twynunge, ic axe þone
intingan, hwi þu me gelangodest.
 136. Cornelius cwæð þa, me com to Godes encgel nu ær on
dæg embe nontid, þaþa ic me ana gebæd, stod on hwitum gyrlum and
cwæð þus to me, þin gebæd is gehyred fram þam healican Gode, and
þine ælmyssan synd on his gesihþe getealde.
 141. Asend nu to Ioppen to Symone Petre, and gelange hine to þe,
þæt he þe lifes word secge.
 143. Nu sende ic to þe and we synd gearwe ealle þa þincg to
gehyrenne, þe se hælend þe bebead.
 145. Cristendom næs þagit cuð on þære byrig, ne þes
Cornelius næs on Criste gefullod, ac he gelyfde swa þeah on þone
lifigendan God, and mid ælmessum geearnode þæs ængles wyssunge, and
astealde þam hæþenum healice gebysnunge, ða þa he to fulluhte heora
fyrmest beah.
 151. Þa cwæð se eadiga Petrus, Ic oncneow to soþan
þæt Gode is andfencge on ælcere mægðe seþe hine ondræt, and
deð rihtwisnysse.
 154. Ongan þa to secgenne þone soþan geleafan þam
hæðenan þegne be ðæs hælendes fære; hu he worhte wundra on
þyssere worulda fela, and siððan deað þrowode sylfwilles for us, and
on þam þryddan dæge aras of ðam deaðe gesund.
 159. Þa betwux þysum wordum wearþ mycel Godes wundor, swa
þæt se halga gast com ofer þa hæðenan, and hi ealle spræcon,
þe ða lare gehyrdon, mislicum gereordum mærsigende God.
 163. Þa wundrodon þa Iudeiscan þe þær wæran mid
Petre, geleaffulle on Criste, þæt se halga gast com ofer ða
hæðenan, and se halga Petrus cwæð, hwa mæg wæteres forwyrnan
þysum werum to fulluhte, nu hi þone halgan gast habbað underfangen swa
swa we sylfe?
 168. And he sona het hi ealle fullian, on þæs ælmihtigan
naman.
 170. Þa bædon hi Petrum þæt he andbidode þær ane
feawa daga æfter heora fulluhte.
 172. Eft þaða Petrus com to þam Cristenum heape binnan
Hierusalem, þa befrunon þa gebroðra þe of Iudeiscum cynne on Crist
gelyfdon, Hwi eodest þu to þam hæðenum, and on heora huse geæte ?
 176. Þa Iudeiscan wendon þæt hi ana wæron Gode gecorene,
and forþy swa cwædon.
 178. On ealdum dagum under moyses æ noldon þa Iudeiscan
genealecan þam hæþenum, ne mid him gereordian, and swyþe rihtlice
þa, forþan þe hi gelyfdon on þane lifigendan God, and þa hæðenan
gelyfdon on þa leasan godas, þaða næron godas ac gramlice deofle.
 184. Nu woldon ða Iudesican heora gewunan healdan æfter heora
fulluhte, and forseon ða hæþenan.
 186. Þa began se halga Petrus him eallum secgan hwæt him God
geswutelode ærðan þe he þider siþode, and hu se halga gast com ofer
þa hæþenan and cwæð, Gif God him forgeaf þæs halgan gastes
gife swa swa us on frymþe on fyrenum gereordum, hwæt eom ic manna þæt
ic mihte God forbeodan?
 192. Þa suwodon þa Iudeiscan syððan hi þis gehyrdon, and
wuldrodon God, þæt he wolde forgifan þam hæþenan dædbote to
þam heofonlican life.
 195. Marcellus wæs gehaten sum mære Godes þegn, se folgode
Symone þam sceandlican dry, oðþæt se eadiga Petrus þone arleasan
oferdraf.
 198. Þa forlet Marcellus þone manfullan dry, and folgode Petre
and to fulluhte beah.
 200. Nu awrat þæs Marcellus hu sancte Petres dohtor Petronella
gewat of worulde to Criste.
 202. Petrus hæfde wif ærðan þe he wære gecyrred to
Cristes hirede, ac he wiþcwæð siððan woruldlicum gewilnungum and
wifes neawiste, forþan þe Crist astealde clænnysse on worulde, and ealle
his folgeras ferdon on clænnysse, swa swa Petres cwæð cuþlice him
to.
 208. <foreign>Ecce nos reliquimus omnia, et secuti sumus te; quid ergo erit
nobis</foreign>; Efne we forleton ealle þincg on worulde and þe nu folgiaþ,
hwæt foresceawost þu us?
 211. On anginne middaneardes cwæð se ælmihtiga God, Beoð
gemenigfylde and gefyllað þas eorðan.
 213. And Crist wolde on his tocyme clænnysse aræran, and his
halgan hired heold on clænnysse.
 215. Menn hæfdon on frymðe heora magan to wife, and swa wel
mosten for ðære wifleaste, and gif nu hwa swa deð næfð he Godes
bletsunge.
 218. Under moyses æ, moste se bisceop habban an genæwnod wif,
for þære gewissan æftergencgnysse, þæt is þæt se sunu sceolde
symle fon to þam hade, æfter his fæder geendunge and nan oðer ne
moste.
 222. Hit mihte þa wel swa, for þan þe hi ne mæssodon
næfre, ac hi offrodon nytenu on heora lacum Gode.
 224. Ne husel næs gehalgod ærþam ðe se hælend com, and
þa niwan gecyðnysse mid Cristendome arærde, and geceas þa clænan to
his clænum þeowdome, na to nytena offrunge ac to his agenum lichaman.
 228. And bisceopas ne beoð nu be gebyrdum gecorene, ac seo halige
gelaðung lufað þa clænan, and Crist wile habban þa þe him
clænlice þeniað æt þam liflicum lacum his lichaman and blodes.
 232. We sceoldan secgan be þære snoteran Petronellan, þæs
eadigan Petres dehter, ac us bearn þis on mod.
 234. Se foresæda Marcellus sæde þæt heo læge on
paralisin swa swa Petrus sylf wolde.
 236. Þa axode Titus þone eadigan apostol, hwi he geþafode
þæt heo swa lage on þam legerbedde, þonne he oðre alefede ealle
gehælde, and heo ana læg swa.
 239. Ða cwæð se halga fæder þæt hire fremode
þæt, ac þelæs þe hwa wene þæt ure word ne mæge hire hæle
forgifan, ic hate hi nu arisan and us eallum þenian.
 242. And heo þærrihte aras, þenode hire fæder and his
geferum hal.
 244. Æfter þære þenunge het se halga Petrus hi to bedde
gan and beon eft seoc.
 246. Heo þeah ða on Godes ege and God hi eft gehælde, swa
þæt heo sylf mihte manega oðre gehælen, þurh halige gebedu on
ðæs Hælendes naman.
 249. Hire wæs sum oþer mæden geferlæht Felicula gehaten,
fulfremed on Godes ege and on ealre godnysse.
 251. Ac Petronella wæs swyðe wlitig on hiwe.
 252. Þa com sum heretoga se wæs gehaten Flaccus, mid mycelre
fare to þære mæran Petronellan, wolde hi niman to wife for hire
wlitigan hiwe.
 255. Þa cwæð þæt halige mæden to þam hæþenan
menn, hwi come þu mid wæpnum and mid wælreowum cempum to anum mædene
unmihtigum to wige?
 258. Ac gif ðu me habban wylt hat cuman to me æðelborenne
wif and wlitige mædenu nu æfter ðrym dagum, and ic efne mid him to
þinum huse cume.
 261. And he hire gelyfde.
 262. Hwæt þa Petronella mid fæstenum hi gebæd to ðam
heofonlican cynincge, þe heo gecoren hæfde on eallum þam fyrste, and
Felicula samod, oðþæt Nicomedis se mæssepreost com on þam ðriddan
dæge, and dyde him mæssan, and seo halige Petronella þa husel
underfeng, gewende to hire bedde and gewat sona.
 269. Þa comon þa wif swa heo hæfde gecwæden, and
behwurfon hire lic oþþæt heo bebyrged wæs, swylce hi forðan comon
þæt hi þa fæmnan bestodon.
 272. Þa awende se Flaccus to Feliculan his mod, and cwæþ
hire þus to mid þrutigendum mode, Geceos þe nu ardlice an þyssere
twægra, oþþe ðu beo min wif oððe gebuh to urum godum and him lac
geoffra.
 276. Ac heo him andwyrde þus, Ne beo ic næfre þin wif,
forðan þe ic sylfwylles eom Criste gehalgod, ne ic þam hæþenum godum
lac ne geoffrige, forðan þe ic on Crist gelyfe.
 280. Þa het se arleasa Flaccus þa fæmnan gebringan on
þysterfullum cwearterne, and cwæð þæt man ne sceolde ænigne
bigleofan hire don binnon seofon nihton.
 283. Heo wunode þa swa seofon niht meteleas, and syððan
wearð getintregod for þan soðan geleafan and for hyre mægðhade
oðþæt heo wearð gemartyrod, and hire gast ferde freoh to heofonum.
 287. Þa com Nicomedis se foresæda mæssepreost, and bebyrgde
hire lic to lofe þam ælmihtigan.
 289. Þa gelæhte Flaccus þone geleaffullan preost, and
forðan þe he nolde þam fulum godum geoffrian, het hine beswingan
oðþæt he sawlode.
 292. He gewat þa to heofonan to hælende Criste, þam is
wuldor and wurðmynt on ealra worulda woruld;AMEN.

END_TEXT
