ÆLS (Edmund)
B1.3.31.
Passion of Saint Edmund: Skeat 1881-1900, II, 314-34.



 1. <foreign>XII KAL DECEMBRES, PASSIO SANCTI EADMVNDI REGIS ET MARTYRIS</foreign>.
 1. SVM SWYÐE GELÆRED MUNUC com suþan ofer sæ fram sancte
Benedictes stowe on Æþelredes cynincges dæge to Dunstane
ærcebisceope, þrim gearum ær he forðferde; and se munuc hatte Abbo.
 4. Þa wurdon hi æt spræce oþþæt Dunstan rehte be
sancte Eadmunde, swa swa Eadmundes swurdbora hit rehte Æþelstane cynincge
þa þa Dunstan iung man wæs, and se swurdbora wæs forealdod man.
 7. Þa gesette se munuc ealle þa gereccednysse on anre bec, and
eft ða þa seo boc com to us binnan feawum gearum þa awende we hit on
Englisc, swa swa hit heræfter stent.
 10. Se munuc þa Abbo binnan twam gearum gewende ham to his
mynstre and wearð sona to abbode geset on þam ylcan mynstre.
 13. EADMUND SE EADIGA EASTENGAL CYNINCG wæs snotor and
wurðfull, and wurðode symble mid æþelum þeawum þone ælmihtigan
God.
 16. He wæs eadmod and geþungen, and swa anræde þurhwunode
þæt he nolde abugan to bysmorfullum leahtrum, ne on naþre healfe he ne
ahylde his þeawas, ac wæs symble gemyndig þære soþan lare.
 20. Gif þu eart to heafodmen geset, ne ahefe þu ðe, ac beo
betwux mannum swa swa an man of him.
 22. He wæs cystig wædlum and wydewum swa swa fæder, and
mid welwillendnysse gewissode his folc symle to rihtwisnysse, and þam reþum
styrde, and gesæliglice leofode on soþan geleafan.
 26. Hit gelamp ða æt nextan þæt þa Deniscan leode
ferdon mid sciphere hergiende and sleande wide geond land swa swa heora gewuna
is.
 29. On þam flotan wæron þa fyrmestan heafodmen Hinguar and
Hubba, geanlæhte þurh deofol, and hi on Norðhymbralande gelendon mid
æscum, and aweston þæt land, and þa leoda ofslogon.
 33. Þa gewende Hinguar east mid his scipum, and Hubba belaf on
Norðhymbralande, gewunnenum sige mid wælhreownysse.
 36. Hinguar þa becom to eastenglum rowende, on þam geare þe
ælfred æðelincg an and twentig geare wæs, se þe westsexena cynincg
siþþan wearð mære.
 39. And se foresæda Hinguar færlice swa swa wulf on lande
bestalcode, and þa leode sloh weras and wif, and þa ungewittigan cild, and
to bysmore tucode þa bilewitan Cristenan.
 43. He sende ða sona syððan to þam cyninge beotlic
ærende, þæt he abugan sceolde to his manrædene gif he rohte his
feores.
 46. Se ærendraca com þa to Eadmunde cynincge and Hinguares
ærende him ardlice abead.
 48. Hinguar ure cyning, cene and sigefæst on sæ and on lande,
hæfð fela þeoda gewyld, and com nu mid fyrde færlice her to lande
þæt he her wintersetl mid his werode hæbbe.
 52. Nu het he þe dælan þine digelan goldhordas and þinra
yldrena gestreon ardlice wið hine, and þu beo his underkyning, gif ðu
cucu beon wylt, forðanþe ðu næfst þa mihte þæt þu mage him
wiðstandan.
 56. Hwæt þa Eadmund clypode ænne bisceop þe him þa
gehendost wæs, and wið hine smeade hu he þam reþan Hinguare andwyrdan
sceolde.
 59. Þa forhtode se bisceop for þam færlican gelimpe, and for
þæs cynincges life, and cwæþ þæt him ræd þuhte þæt he
to þam gebuge þe him bead Hinguar.
 62. Þa suwode se cynincg and beseah to þære eorþan, and
cwæþ þa æt nextan cynelice him to, Eala þu bisceop, to bysmore synd
getawode þas earman landleoda, and me nu leofre wære þæt ic on feohte
feolle wið þam þe min folc moste heora eardes brucan.
 67. And se bisceop cwæþ, Eala þu leofa cyning, þin folc
lið ofslagen, and þu næfst þone fultum þæt þu feohtan mæge,
and þas flotmen cumað, and þe cucenne gebindað butan þu mid fleame
þinum feore gebeorge, oððe þu þe swa gebeorge þæt þu buge to
him.
 73. Þa cwæð Eadmund cyning swa swa he ful cene wæs,
þæs ic gewilnige and gewisce mid mode, þæt ic ana ne belife æfter
minum leofum þegnum þe on heora bedde wurdon, mid bearnum and wifum,
færlice ofslægene fram þysum flotmannum.
 78. Næs me næfre gewunelic þæt ic worhte fleames, ac ic
wolde swiðor sweltan gif ic þorfte for minum agenum earde, and se
ælmihtiga God wat þæt ic nelle abugan fram his biggengum æfre, ne
fram his soþan lufe, swelte ic, lybbe ic.
 83. Æfter þysum wordum he gewende to þam ærendracan þe
Hinguar him to sende, and sæde him unforht, Witodlice þu wære wyrðe
sleges nu, ac ic nelle afylan on þinum fulum blode mine clænan handa,
forðanþe ic Criste folgie, þe us swa gebysnode, and ic bliðelice wille
beon ofslagen þurh eow gif hit swa god foresceawað.
 90. Far nu swiþe hraðe, and sege þinum reþan hlaforde, ne
abihð næfre Eadmund Hingware on life, hæþenum heretogan, buton he to
Hælende Criste ærest mid geleafan on þysum lande gebuge.
 94. Þa gewende se ærendraca ardlice aweg, and gemette be
wæge þone wælhreowan Hingwar mid eallre his fyrde fuse to Eadmunde, and
sæde þam arleasan hu him geandwyrd wæs.
 98. Hingwar þa bebead mid bylde þam sciphere þæt hi
þæs cynincges anes ealle cepan sceoldon, þe his hæse forseah, and
hine sona bindan.
 101. Hwæt þa Eadmund cynincg mid þam þe Hingwar com, stod
innan his healle þæs Hælendes gemyndig, and awearp his wæpna, wolde
geæfenlæcan Cristes gebysnungum, þe forbead Petre mid wæpnum to
winnenne wið þa wælhreowan Iudeiscan.
 106. Hwæt þa arleasan þa Eadmund gebundon, and gebysmrodon
huxlice, and beoton mid saglum; and swa syððan læddon þone
geleaffullan cyning to anum eorðfæstum treowe, and tigdon hine þærto
mid heardum bendum, and hine eft swuncgon langlice mid swipum, and he symble
clypode betwux þam swinglum mid soðan geleafan to Hælende Criste, and
þa hæþenan þa for his geleafan wurdon wodlice yrre forþanþe he
clypode Crist him to fultume.
 116. Hi scuton þa mid gafelucum swilce him to gamenes to, oð
þæt he eall wæs besæt mid heora scotungum swilce igles byrsta, swa
swa Sebastianus wæs.
 119. Þa geseah Hingwar, se arlease flotman, þæt se
æþela cyning nolde Criste wiðsacan, ac mid anrædum geleafan hine
æfre clypode, het hine þa beheafdian and þa hæðenan swa dydon.
 123. Betwux þam þe he clypode to Criste þagit, þa tugon
þa hæþenan þone halgan to slæge, and mid anum swencge slogon him of
þæt heafod, and his sawl siþode gesælig to Criste.
 127. Þær wæs sum man gehende, gehealden þurh God behyd
þam hæþenum, þe þis gehyrde eall, and hit eft sæde swa swa we hit
secgað her.
 130. Hwæt ða se flothere ferde eft to scipe, and behyddon
þæt heafod þæs halgan Eadmundes on þam þiccum bremelum þæt
hit bebyrged ne wurde.
 133. Þa æfter fyrste, syððan hi afarene wæron, com
þæt landfolc to þe þær to lafe wæs þa, þær heora
hlafordes lic læg butan heafde, and wurdon swiðe sarige for his slege on
mode, and huru þæt hi næfdon þæt heafod to þam bodige.
 138. Þa sæde se sceawere þe hit ær geseah þæt þa
flotmen hæfdon þæt heafod mid him, and wæs him geðuht swa swa hit
wæs ful soð þæt hi behyddon þæt heafod on þam holte forhwega.
 142. Hi eodon þa secende ealle endemes to þam wuda, secende
gehwær geond þyfelas and bremelas gif hi ahwær mihton gemeton þæt
heafod.
 145. Wæs eac micel wundor þæt an wulf wearð asend, þurh
Godes wissunge to bewerigenne þæt heafod wið þa oþre deor, ofer
dæg and niht.
 148. Hi eodon þa secende, and symle clypigende, swa swa hit
gewunelic is þam ðe on wuda gað oft, Hwær eart þu nu gefera?
 150. And him andwyrde þæt heafod, Her, her, her; and swa
gelome clypode andswarigende him eallum, swa oft swa heora ænig clypode,
oþþæt hi ealle becomen þurh ða clypunga him to.
 154. Þa læg se græga wulf þe bewiste þæt heafod, and
mid his twam fotum hæfde þæt heafod beclypped, grædig and hungrig,
and for Gode ne dorste þæs heafdes abyrian, and heold hit wið deor.
 158. Þa wurdon hi ofwundrode þæs wulfes hyrdrædenne, and
þæt halige heafod ham feredon mid him, þancigende þam ælmihtigan
ealra his wundra; ac se wulf folgode forð mid þam heafde oþþæt hi to
tune comon, swylce he tam wære, and gewende eft siþþan to wuda ongean.
 164. Þa landleoda þa siþþan ledon þæt heafod to þam
halgan bodige, and bebyrigdon hine swa swa hi selost mihton on swylcere
hrædinge and cyrcan arærdan sona him onuppon.
 168. Eft þa on fyrste, æfter fela gearum, þa seo hergung
geswac and sibb wearð forgifen þam geswenctan folce, þa fengon hi
togædere and worhton ane cyrcan wurðlice þam halgan, forþanðe gelome
wundra wurdon æt his byrgene, æt þam gebædhuse þær he bebyrged
wæs.
 174. Hi woldon þa ferian mid folclicum wurðmynte þone halgan
lichaman, and læcgan innan þære cyrcan.
 176. Þa wæs micel wundor þæt he wæs eall swa gehal
swylce he cucu wære mid clænum lichaman, and his swura wæs gehalod
þe ær wæs forslagen, and wæs swylce an seolcen þræd embe his
swuran ræd, mannum to sweotelunge hu he ofslagen wæs.
 181. Eac swilce þa wunda þe þa wælhreowan hæþenan mid
gelomum scotungum on his lice macodon, wæron gehælede þurh þone
heofonlican God, and he liþ swa ansund oþ þisne andwerdan dæg,
andbidigende æristes, and þæs ecan wuldres.
 186. His lichaman us cyð, þe lið unformolsnod, þæt he
butan forligre her on worulde leofode, and mid clænum life to Criste
siþode.
 189. Sum wudewe wunode Oswyn gehaten æt þæs halgan byrgene
on gebedum and fæstenum manega gear syððan.
 192. Seo wolde efsian ælce geare þone Sanct, and his næglas
ceorfan syferlice mid lufe, and on scryne healdan to haligdome on weofode.
 195. Þa wurðode þæt landfolc mid geleafan þone sanct,
and þeodred bisceop þearle mid gifum on golde and on seolfre, þam sancte
to wurðmynte.
 198. Þa comon on sumne sæl ungesælige þeofas, eahta on
anre nihte to þam arwurðan halgan, woldon stelan þa maðmas þe men
þyder brohton, and cunnodon mid cræfte hu hi in cumon mihton.
 202. Sum sloh mid slecge swiðe þa hæpsan, sum heora mid
feolan feolode abutan, sum eac underdealf þa duru mid spade, sum heora mid
hlæddre wolde unlucan þæt ægðyrl; ac hi swuncon on idel, and
earmlice ferdon, swa þæt se halga wer hi wundorlice geband, ælcne swa
he stod strutigende mid tole, þæt heora nan ne mihte þæt morð
gefremman, ne hi þanon astyrian, ac stodon swa oð mergen.
 211. Men þa þæs wundrodon hu þa weargas hangodon, sum on
hlæddre, sum leat to gedelfe, and ælc on his weorce wæs fæste
gebunden.
 214. Hi wurdon þa gebrohte to þam bisceope ealle, and he het hi
hon on heagum gealgum ealle; ac he næs na gemyndig hu se mildheorta God
clypode þurh his witegan þas word þe her standað, <foreign>Eos qui ducuntur ad
mortem eruere ne cesses</foreign>; þa þe man læt to deaðe alys hi ut symble.
 220. And eac þa halgan canones gehadodum forbeodað ge bisceopum
ge preostum, to beonne embe þeofas, forþanþe hit ne gebyraþ þam þe
beoð gecorene Gode to þegnigenne þæt hi geþwærlæcan sceolon on
æniges mannes deaðe, gif hi beoð Drihtnes þenas.
 225. Eft þa Ðeodred bisceop sceawode his bec syððan
behreowsode mid geomerunge þæt he swa reðne dom sette þam
ungesæligum þeofum, and hit besargode æfre oð his lifes ende; and
þa leode bæd georne, þæt hi him mid fæstan fullice þry dagas,
biddende þone ælmihtigan þæt he him arian scolde.
 231. On þam lande wæs sum man, Leofstan gehaten, rice for
worulde and unwittig for Gode, se rad to þam halgan mid riccetere swiðe,
and het him æteowian orhlice swiðe þone halgan sanct hwæþer he
gesund wære, ac swa hraðe swa he geseah þæs sanctes lichaman, þa
awedde he sona and wælhreowlice grymetede, and earmlice geendode yfelum
deaðe.
 239. Þis is ðam gelic þe se geleaffulla papa Gregorius
sæde on his gesetnysse be ðam halgan Laurentie ðe lið on Romebyrig,
þæt menn woldon sceawian symle hu he lage, ge gode ge yfele, ac God hi
gestilde, swa þæt þær swulton on þære sceawunge ane seofon menn
ætgædere.
 245. Þa geswicon þa oþre to sceawigenne þone martyr mid
menniscum gedwylde.
 247. Fela wundra we gehyrdon on folclicre spræce be þam halgan
Eadmunde þe we her nellaþ on gewrite settan, ac hi wat gehwa.
 250. On þyssum halgan is swutel, and on swilcum oþrum, þæt
God ælmihtig mæg þone man aræran eft on domes dæg andsundne of
eorþan, se þe hylt Eadmunde halne his lichaman, oð þone micclan dæg,
þeah ðe he of moldan come.
 255. Wyrðe is seo stow for þam wurðfullan halgan þæt hi
man wurþige and wel gelogige mid clænum Godes þeowum, to Cristes
þeowdome, forþanþe se halga is mærra þonne men magon asmeagan.
 259. Nis Angelcynn bedæled Drihtnes halgena, þonne on
Englalanda licgaþ swilce halgan swylce þæs halga cyning is, and
Cuþberht se eadiga, and sancte Æþeldryð on Elig, and eac hire swustor,
ansunde on lichaman, geleafan to trymminge.
 264. Synd eac fela oðre on Angelcynne halgan þe fela wundra
wyrcað, swa swa hit wide is cuð þam ælmihtigan to lofe, þe hi on
gelyfdon.
 267. Crist geswutelaþ mannum þurh his mæran halgan þæt
he is ælmihtig God þe macað swilce wundra þeah þe þa earman Iudei
hine eallunge wiðsocen, forþanþe hi synd awyrgede swa swa hi wiscton him
sylfum.
 271. Ne beoð nane wundra geworhte æt heora byrgenum,
forðanþe hi ne gelyfað on þone lifigendan Crist, ac Crist geswutelað
mannum hwær se soða geleafa is, þonne he swylce wundra wyrcð þurh
his halgan wide geond þas eorðan.
 275. Þæs him sy wuldor a mid his heofonlican fæder, and
þam halgan gaste a buton ende; AMEN.

ÆLS (Cecilia)
B1.3.32.
Passion of Saint Cecilia: Skeat 1881-1900, II, 356-76.



 1. <foreign>X KAL DECEMBR: PASSIO SANCTAE CECILIE VIRGINIS</foreign>.
 1. IU ON EALDUM DAGUM WæS SUM æðELE MæDEN Cecilia
gehaten, fram cildhade cristen, on romana rice þa þa seo reðe ehtnys stod
on þæra casera dagum þe Cristes ne gymdon.
 5. Þeos halige fæmne hæfde on hire breoste swa micele lufe
to þam ecan life þæt heo dæges and nihtes embe Drihtnes godspel, and
embe Godes lare mid geleafan smeade, and on singalum gebedum hi sylfe
gebysgode.
 10. Heo wearð swaþeah beweddad swa swa hit woldon hire frynd,
anum æþelan cnihte, se næs cristen þa git, Ualerianus gehaten, se is
nu halig sanct.
 13. Hwæt ða Cecilia hi sylfe gescrydde mid hæran to lice,
and gelome fæste biddende mid wope þæt heo wurde gescyld wið ælce
gewemmednysse oððe weres gemanan.
 17. Heo clypode to halgum and to heahenglum biddende heora fultumes
to þam heofonlican Gode, þæt heo on clænnysse Criste moste
þeowian.
 20. Hit gewearð swaþeah þæt se wurðfulla cniht þa
brydlac geforþode, and gefette þæt mæden mid woruldlicum wurðmynte
swa swa heora gebyrde wæron.
 23. Þa betwux þam sangum and þam singalum dreamum sang
Cecilia symle þus Gode, <foreign>Fiat cor meum et corpus meum immaculatum ut Non
confundar</foreign> Beo min heorte and min lichama þurh God ungewemmed þæt ic ne
beo gescynd, and sang symle swa.
 28. Hi wurdon þa gebrohte on bedde ætgædere, and Cecilia
sona, þæt snotere mæden, gespræc hire brydguman, and þus to Gode
tihte.
 31. Eala þu min leofa man ic þe mid lufe secge, Ic hæbbe
godes encgel þe gehylt me on lufe, and gif þu wylt me gewemman, he went
sona to ðe and mid gramum þe slihð þæt þu sona ne leofast.
 35. Gif þu þonne me lufast, and butan laðe gehylst on
clænum mægðhade, Crist þonne lufað þe, and his gife geswutelað
þe sylfum swa swa me.
 38. Se cniht wearð þa afyrht, and cwæð to þam mædene,
Do þæt ic geseo sylf þone engel, gif þu wylt þæt ic gelyfe
þinum wordum be þam; and gif þe oþer cniht cuþre is þonne ic, hine
ic ofslea, and þe samod mid him.
 43. Cecilia þa cwæð, gif þu on Crist gelyfst and þu
gefullod bist fram fyrnlicum synnum, þu miht sona geseon þone scinendan
engel.
 46. Ualerianus andwyrde þa eft þam mædene, Hwa mihte me
fullian þus færlice nu, þæt ic mihte geseon þone scinendan engel.
 49. Seo fæmne þa lærde swa lange þone cniht oð þæt
he gelyfde on þone lifigendan God, and ferde to þam papan þe ðær ful
gehende wæs, Urbanus gehaten, and him fulluhtes bæd.
 53. Se papa þa blissode þæt he gebeah to Gode, and bæd
þone ælmihtigan God þæt he for his arfæstnysse þam cnihte
gewissode þæt he wurde geleafful.
 56. Efne þa færlice ætforan heora gesihþum com Godes
engel mid anum gyldenum gewrite, and Ualerianus feoll afyrht to eorðan.
 59. Þa arærde hine se engel and het hine rædan þa
gyldenan stafas þe him God tosende.
 61. On þam gewrite wæron þas word gelogode, <foreign>Unus deus, una
fides, unum baptisam</foreign>; An ælmihtig God is, and an geleafa, and an fulluht;
and he feng to rædene.
 65. Þa cwæð se engel, gelyfst þu þises, oððe licað
þe elles hwæt?
 66. Ualerianus andwyrde, hwæt bið æfre soðlicre oððe
to gelyfenne ænigum lifigendum menn?
 68. And se engel þa gewende mid þam worde him fram.
 69. Se papa ða siððan hine sona gefullode, and his geleafan
him tæhte, and let hine eft faran ham to Cecilian þam halgan mædene.
 72. Þa funde se cniht þa fæmnan standende on hire gebedum on
hire bure ane and Godes engel standande mid gyldenum fyþerhaman, mid twam
cynehelmum gehende þam mædene.
 76. Þa cynehelmas wæron wundorlice scinende on rosan
readnysse, and on lilian hwitnysse.
 78. And he forgeaf þa ænne þam æþelan mædene, and
oþerne þam cnihte, and cwæð him þus to, Healdað þas cynehelmas
mid clænre heortan forþamþe ic hi genam on neorxnewange.
 82. Ne hi næfre ne forseariað ne heora swetnysse ne
forleosað, ne heora wlita ne awent to wyrsan hiwe, ne hi nan man ne gesihð
butan se þe clænnysse lufað; and þu Ualeriane forðanþe ðu lufast
clænnysse, se Hælend þe het biddan swa hwilce bene swa þu wille.
 87. Þa cneowode se cniht and cwæð to þam engle, Næs me
nan þing swa leof on þysum life wunigende swa me wæs min broþor, and
bið me uneaþe þæt ic beo alysed, and he losige on witum.
 91. Þas bene ic bidde þæt min broþor Tiburtius beo alysed
þurh God and to geleafan gebiged, and he do unc begen him to biggengum.
 94. Þa cwæð se engel eft mid blisse him to, Forþanþe
þu þæs bæde þe bet Gode licað þin broðor Tiburtius bið
gestryned þurh þe to þam ecan life, swa swa þu gelyfdest on God þurh
Cecilian lare, and git sceolan begen, þu and þin broðor, beon gemartyrode
samod.
 99. And se engel þa gewende up to heofonum.
 100. Hi smeadon þa mid glædnysse, and embe Godes willan
spræcon, oþþæt his broþor com bliðe on mergen him to, and cyste
hi butu, and cwæð mid blisse, Ic wundrige þearle hu nu on wintres
dæge her lilian blostm oþþe rosan bræð swa wynsumlice and swa
werodlice stincað.
 106. Ðeah þe ic hæfde me on handa þa blostman, ne mihton
hi swa wynsumne wyrtbræð macian; and ic secge to soþan þæt ic swa
eom afylled mid þam swetan bræða, swylce ic sy geedniwod.
 110. Þa cwæð se broðor, þurh mine bene þe com þæs
wynsuma bræð to þæt þu wite heonanforð hwæs blod readaþ on
rosan gelicnysse, and hwæs lichama hwitað on lilian fægernysse.
 114. We habbað cynehelmas halige mid us scinende swa swa rose and
snawhwite swa swa lilie, þa þu ne miht geseon þeah þe hi scinende
beon.
 117. Þa cwæð tiburtius, Sege me, broðor min, gehyre ic
þis on slæpe, oððe þu hit sægst on eornost?
 118. Se oðer him cwæð to, oð þis we leofodon swilce we
on slæpe wæron, ac we synd nu gewende to soðfæstnysse; þa godas
þe we wurþodon syndon gramlice deofla.
 122. Þa cwæð se oþer, Hu wearð þe þæt cuþ?
 123. Ualerianus andwyrde, Godes engel me tæhte, and þone þu
miht geseon gif ðu soðlice bist on fulluhte aþwogen fram þam fulum
deofolgilde.
 126. Hi spræcon þa swa lange, oðþæt he to geleafan
beah, and se broðor wolde þæt he wurde gefullod.
 128. Þa befran Tiburtius hwa hine fullian sceolde.
 129. Se oðer him cwæð to, Urbanus se papa.
 130. Eft þa Tiburtius him andwyrde and cwæð, Se is geutlagod
and lið him on digelan for his cristendome, and gif we cumað him to, we
beoð gewitnode, gif hit wyrð ameldod.
 134. And þa hwile þe we secað, swa swa hit gesæd is,
godcundnysse on heofonum, we graman gemetað and lifleaste on eorðan, gif we
his lare folgiað.
 137. Þa cwæð Cecilia sona mid gebylde, gif þis lif wære
ana, and oþer nære selre, þonne mihte we ondrædan us deaðes
rihtlice.
 140. Þa axode Tiburtius, is ænig oþer lif?
 141. Cecilia him cwæð to, Cuð is gehwilcum menn þæt
þis lif is geswincful, and on swate wunað; þis lif bið alefed on
langsumum sarum, and on hætum ofþefod, and on hungre gewæht, mid mettum
gefylled, and modig on welum, mid hafenleaste aworpen and ahafen þurh
iugoðe, mid ylde gebiged, and tobryt mid seocnysse, mid unrotnysse fornumen,
and geangsumod þurh cara.
 149. Þonne cymð him deað to, and deð of gemynde ealle þa
blysse þe he breac on his life, and on þam ecan life þe æfter þysum
cymð bið þam rihtwisum forgifen rest and gefea, and þam unrihtwisum
þa ecan wita.
 154. Þa cwæð Tiburtius, hwa com þanon hider þe mihte us
secgan gif hit swa wære?
 156. Cecilia þa aras, and mid anrædnysse cwæð, Ealle
gesceafta scyppend ænne sunu gestrynde, and forðteah þurh hine sylfne
þone frofer gast; þurh þone sunu he gesceop ealle gesceafta þe syndon,
and hi ealle gelyffæste þurh þone lifigendan gast.
 161. Þa andwyrde Tiburtius, ænne God gebodiað, and humeta
namast þu namcuðlice þry Godas?
 163. Cecilia him andwyrde, an God is ælmihtig on his
mægenþrymnysse wunigende; ðone arwurðiað we Cristenan æfre on
þrynnysse, and on soðre annysse, forþanþe fæder and sunu and se
frofer gast an gecynd habbað, and ænne cynedom, swa swa on anum men synd
soðlice þreo þing, andgit and wylla and gewittig gemynd, þe anum men
gehyrsumiaþ æfre togædere.
 171. Þa feoll Tiburtius forht to hire cneowum, and clypode hlude,
and cwæð mid geleafan, Ne þincð me þæt þu spræce mid
menniscre spræce, ac swilce Godes engel sylf spræce þurh þe.
 175. Ac ic axie git be þam oþrum life, hwa þæt gesawe, and
siððan come hider?
 177. Hwæt þa Cecilia him snoterlice andwyrde, and sæde hu
se Hælend of heofonum com to us, and hwylce wundra he worhte on þisre
worulde fela, and hu he þa deadan arærde of deaðe to life, and hu he
sylf of deaðe on þam þriddan dæge aras; and fela þincg him sæde
swutellice be Criste.
 183. Þa weop Tiburtius, and gewilnode georne þæt he gefullod
wurde æt þam foresædan papan, and se broþer siþode sona forð mid
him, and cydde þam papan hwæt hi gecweden hæfdon.
 187. Se papa ða Urbanus blissode on Gode, and gefullode sona
þone gesæligan cniht, and sæde him geleafan geond seofon dagas on an,
oþ þæt he fulfremod ferde eft ongean.
 191. He beget þa æt Gode þa gastlican gesælþa, swa
þæt he dæghwamlice Drihtnes englas geseh, and swa hwæs he gewilnode,
him ne forwyrnde God, and worhte gelome wundra þurh hine, and þurh his
broðor, swa swa bec secgað.
 196. Þa wæs on Rome byrig sum reðe cwellere Almachius
gehaten, se wæs heahgerefa, and he mid manegum witum gemartyrode þa
Cristenan, þa ða he ofaxian mihte, and man ne moste hi bebyrigan.
 200. Ualerianus þa and his foresæda broþor bebyrigdon þa
martyras þe se manfulla acwealde, and ælmyssan dælde dæghwamlice
þearfum, oð þæt se arleasa ehtere ofaxode heora dæda.
 203. Hwæt þa Almachius het þa men gelangian, and axode hi
sona mid swiðlicre þreatunge hwi hi þa bebyrigdon þe his beboda
forsawon, and for heora scyldum ofslagene lagon; oþþe hwi hi dældon
dearnunga heora æhta waclicum mannum unwislicum ræde?
 210. Þa andwyrde Tiburtius þam arleasan and cwæð, Eala,
gif þa halgan þe þu hete ofslean and we bebyrigdon, woldon us habban huru
him to þeowum to heora þenungum.
 214. Hi þa swa lange motodon, oþ þæt se manfulla het mid
saglum beatan þone oþerne broþor; and sum rædbora þa to þam
reðan þus cwæð, Hat hi, leof, acwellan, nu hi Cristene synd; gif þu
þonne elcast, heora æhta hi dælað þearfum and wædlum, and þu
witnast hi siððan, and næfst þa æhta for þinre ælcunge.
 221. Almachius þa het his manfullan cwelleras lædan þa
gebroðra on bendum togædere to þam hæþengilde, and het hi
geoffrian, oþþe hi man ofsloge mid swurde þærrihte.
 225. Hi lædde þa Maximus swa se manfulla het mid oþrum
cwellerum to þære cwealmstowe.
 227. Þe weop Maximus forþanþe hi woldon sweltan, and axode
þa gebroðra hwi hi swa bliþelice eodon to heora agenum slege, swylce to
gebeorscipe.
 230. Þa cwæð se yldra broþor, Noldon we efstan to deaþe
mid swa mycelre blisse, gif we to beteran life soðlice ne becomon siððan
we ofslagene beoð, to þam ecan life, swa swa we leornodon to soþan.
 234. Betwux þære tihtinge þa þa hi tengdon forð, þa
cwæð se Maximus to þam martyrum þus, Ic wolde eac forseon þisre
worulde swæsnysse, gif ic wiste to gewissan þæt eowre word wæron
soþe.
 238. Þa cwæð se gingra broðor of þam bendum him to, Ure
drihten Crist deð þæt þu gesihst, þonne we ofslagene beoð, hu ure
sawla farað mid wuldre to him, gif þu wylt nu behatan þæt þu mid
eallum mode, þin man behreowsige.
 243. Maximus þa cwæð to þam martyrum þus, Fyr me
forbærne gif ic ne buge to Criste, siþþan ic geseo hu eowre sawla
farað to þam oþrum life þe ge embe sprecað.
 247. Þa cwædon þa halgan gebroþra þe he on bendum
lædde, Bebeod þysum cwellerum þæt hi us cuce healdan on þinum
agenum huse nu þas ane niht oðþæt þu sy gefullod fram fyrnlicum
synnum, þæt þu mote geseon þa gesihðe þurh God.
 252. Hi wurdon þa gebrohte on bendum to his huse, and Cecilia seo
eadige mid arwurðum sacerdum þider com sona, and hi sæton þa niht embe
Crist sprecende, oþþæt þa cwelleras gelyfdon and wurdon gefullode
æt þam foresædum preostum.
 257. Hwæt þa on dægræd þæt deorwurðe mæden
Cecilia clypode, and cwæð to him eallum, Nu ge la Godes cempan, awurpað
caflice eow fram þæra þeostra weorc, and wurðað ymbscrydde mid
leohtes wæpnum to þysum gewinne nu.
 262. Ge habbað gecampod swiðe godne campdom, eowerne ryne ge
gefyldon and geleafan geheoldon.
 264. Gað to þam wuldorbeage þæs wynsuman lifes, þonne se
rihtwisa dema deð eow to edleane.
 266. Hi wurdon þa gelædde for heora geleafan to slege, and mid
swurde beheafdode.
 267. Þa beheold Maximus and sæde mid aþe to þam
ymbstandendum, Ic geseah soðlice mid þam þe hi ofslagene wurdon, Godes
englas scinende on sunnan gelicnysse fleogende him to, and underfengon heora
sawla, and þa sawla ic geseah swiðe wlitig faran forð mid þam englum on
heora fiðerum to heofonum.
 274. Þa þa Maximus sæde swa soðlice ðas word weopendum
eagum, þe gewendon þa hæþenan manega to geleafan fram heora leasum
godum.
 277. Almachius þa ofaxode þæt se arwurða Maximus mid
eallum his hiwum on þone Hælend gelyfde, and wæron gefullode, wearð
þa him gram and het hine swingan mid leadenum swipum oþ þæt he gewat
of worulde to Criste.
 282. Cecilia þa sona þone sanct bebyrigde on stænenre þryh
on þam stede þe lagon þa twegen gebroþra bebyrigde on ær.
 285. Heo dælde þa siððan digellice þearfum hire
brydguman æhta, and his broþor þing; and Almachius wolde witan ymbe þa
æhtan, swylce heo wydewe wære, and heo wearð þa geneadod þæt heo
offrian sceolde þam arleasum godum.
 290. Þa weopon þa hæðenan þæt swa wlitig fæmne,
and swa æþelboren wimman mid wisdome afylled, wolde deað þrowian on
witum, swa iung.
 293. Þa cwæð Cecilia and sæde him eallum, Ne bið se
forloren þe lið for Gode ofslagen; he bið swa awend to wuldre of deaðe,
swilce man lam sylle and sylf nime gold, swilce he sylle wac hus and wuldorful
underfo; sylle gewitendlic and ungewitendlic underfo; sylle wacne stan and
wurðfulne gym underfo.
 300. Heo tihte þa swa lange þa ungeleaffullan hæðenan oð
þæt hi ealle cwædon mid anre stemne þus, We gelyfað þæt Crist
Godes sunu soðlice God is, þe þe þyllice underfeng him to þinenne on
worulde.
 304. Þa wurdon gefullode feower hund manna on Cecilian huse þam
Hælende to lofe, and se papa mæssode þam mannum gelome on þam ylcan
huse, and se hæðenscipe wanode.
 308. Almachius se arleasa het þa ardlice gefeccan þa eadigan
Cecilian, and hi axode sona of hwylcere mægðe heo wære, and hi motodon
lange, oþþæt þam deman ofþuhte hyre drystignyss, and cwæð
orhlice eft to þam mædene, Nast þu mine mihte?
 313. And þæt mæden him cwæð to, Ic secge, gif þu
hætst, hwilce mihte þu hæfst.
 315. Ælces mannes miht þe on modignysse færð is soðlice
þam gelic swilce man siwige ane bytte, and blawe hi fulle windes, and wyrce
siððan an þyrl þonne heo toþunden bið on hire greatnysse þonne
togæð seo miht.
 320. Almachius hire cwæð to þa þa hi campodon mid wordum,
Hwæt þu ungesælige, nast þu þæt me is geseald anweald to
ofsleanne and to edcucigenne, and þu spræcst swa modelice mine mihta
tælende.
 324. Þæt mæden him cwæð to, Oþer is modignyss,
oþer is anrædnyss, and ic anrædlice spræc, na modelice, forþanþe
we modignysse eallunga onscuniað.
 327. And eft heo cwæð him to, þu cwæde þæt þu
hæfdest to acwellene anweald and to edcucigenne, ac ic cwæðe þæt
þu miht þa cucan adydan, and þam deadan þu ne miht eft lif forgifan, ac
þu lyhst openlice.
 332. Almachius hire andwyrde, Awurp þine dyrstignysse and geoffra
þam godum arwurðlice onsægednysse.
 334. Cecilia him cwæð to, cunna mid grapunge hwæðer hi
stanas synd, and stænene anlicnysse, þa þe þu godas gecigst begotene
mid leade, and þu miht swa witan gewislice mid grapunge gif ðu geseon ne
miht þæt hi synd stanas.
 339. Hi mihton wel to lime gif man hi lede on ad; nu hi ne
fremiað him sylfum, ne soðlice mannum; and hi mihton to lime gif hi man
lede on fyr.
 342. Þa wearð se arleasa dema deoflice gram, and het hi
lædan sona, and seoðan on wætere on hire agenum huse for þæs
Hælendes naman.
 345. Þa dydon þa hæþenan swa swa hi het Almachius, and heo
læg on þam bæðe bufan byrnendum fyre, ofer dæg and niht
ungederodum lichaman, swa swa on cealdum wætere, þæt heo ne swætte
furðon.
 349. Hi cyddon þa Almachie hu þæt mæden þurhwunode on
þam hatum baðe mid halum lichaman, and furþon butan swate.
 351. Þa sende he ænne cwellere to, and het hi beheafdian on
þam hatan wætere.
 353. Se cwellere hi sloh þa mid his swurde æne, eft, and
þryddan siðe, ac hire swura næs forod; and he forlet hi sona swa samcuce
licgan, forþamþe witan cwædon þæt nan cwellere ne sceolde feower
siðan slean to, þonne man sloge scyldigne.
 358. Heo leofode þa þry dagas and þa geleaffullan tihte, and
hire mædena betæhte þam maran papan, and hire hus wearð gehalgod to
haligre cyrcan, þær wurdon þurh God wundra gelome.
 362. And Urbanus se papa bebyrigde hi arwurðlice to wuldre þam
ælmihtigan þe on ecnysse rixað; AMEN.

ÆLS (Chrysanthus)
B1.3.33.
Passion of Saint Chrysanthus and his Wife Daria: Skeat 1881-1900, II, 378-98.



 1. <foreign>III KAL DECEMBR: PASSIO CHRISANTI ET DARIæ SPONSE EIVS</foreign>.
 1. ON ÐAM TIMAN ÐE NVMERIANVS CASERE RIXODE, þa ferde sum
æðelboren man fram Alexandrian byrig to Rome byrig, Polemius gehaten, se
wæs hæþengilda; and he hæfde ænne sunu gehaten Crisantus.
 6. Se kasere hine underfeng ða mid fullum wurðmynte, and þa
Romaniscan witan hine wurðodon swyðe.
 8. Þa befæste he his sunu sona to lare to woruldwisdome
þæt he uðwita wurde; forðamþe on þam dagum ne mihte nan man beon
geþogen buton he hæþene bec hæfde geleornod, and þa cræftas
cuþe þe kaseres þa lufodon.
 13. Crisantus þa leornode mid leohtum andgite, and mid gleawum
mode grammatican cræft and þa hæðenan bec, oþþæt þa halgan
godspel him becomon to hande.
 16. Þa cwæð he to him sylfum, Swa lange ic leornode þa
ungeleaffullan bec mid þeostrum afyllede, oþþæt ic færlice becom to
soðfæstnysse leohte, and ic snotor ne beo gif ic cyrre to þeostrum fram
þam soðan leohte.
 21. Uton healdan fæste þone fægeran goldhord; nelle ic hine
forleosan, nu ic swa lange swanc, unnyt ic leofode gif ic hine nu forlæte.
 24. He began þa to secenne swyðe ða Cristenan oðþæt he
ofaxode ænne arwurðne mæssepreost on fyrlenum wunigende, and he
fægnode þæs.
 27. He wearð þa gefullod æt þam foresædan preoste, and
leornode his geleafan mid þam halgan lareowe, swa þæt he þone
Cristendom cuðe be fullan, and began to bodigenne bealdlice þone
Hælend.
 31. Þa gestodon his frynd his fæder and cwædon, To plihte
þinre æhta and þines agenes heafdes bodað þes þin cnapa swa
bealdlice be Criste; wurðe hit þam casere cuþ ne canst þu þe nænne
ræd.
 35. Þa gebealh hine se fæder, and gebrohte þone sunu on
leohtleasum cwearterne, and beleac hine þær; and on æfen symle sende
him bigleofan lytelne and wacne, and he wunode þær swa .
 39. Þa sædon þa magas eft sona þam fæder, Gif þu
wille þinne sunu geweman fram Criste, þonne most þu him olæcan, and
eftmettas beodan, and do þæt he wifige þonne wile he forgitan siððan
he wer bið þæt he wæs Cristen.
 44. Þas geswencednyssa and þas sweartan þeostra þe þu him
dest to wite, awendaþ þa cristenan him sylfum to wuldra, na to witnunge.
 47. Se fæder þa het feccan of þam fulum cwearterne þone
geswenctan cniht, and hine sona scrydde mid deorwurðum reafum, and het
dæftan his bur mid pallum and mid wahryftum wurðlice þam cnihte .
 51. He funde eac sona fif mædena him to, wlitige and rance, to
wunigenne mid him, and het þæt hi awendon mid heora wodlican plegan his
geþanc fram Criste, and cwæð þæt hi sceoldon sylfe hit gebicgan,
gif hi ne bigdon his mod.
 56. He sende him eac gelome sanda and estas, ac se cniht forseah
þa sanda and drencas, and þa mædena onscunode, swa swa man deþ
næddran.
 59. He læg on gebedum and forbeah heora cossas, and bæd
þone Hælend þæt he geheolde his clænnyse, swa swa he heold Iosepes
on ægipta lande.
 62. He andette eac Gode mid eallum mode and cwæð, Ic bidde
þe, drihten, þæt þu do þæs næddran þæt hi ealle slapon on
minre gesihðe nu, þæt hi swræccan ne magon mid heora wodlican plegan
ænige galnysse on me, forðanþe ic truwige on þe.
 67. Midþamþe Crisantus clypode þas word to Gode, þa slepon
þa mædene swa swarum slape, þæt man hi awreccan ne mihte butan man hi
awurpe ut of þæs cnihtes bure þe ða clænnysse lufode.
 71. Wiðutan þam bure hi æton and wacodon, and swa hraðe
swa hi ineodon hi wurdon on slæpe.
 73. Þis wearð þa gesæd sona þam fæder, and he beweop
þone sunu swilce he dead wære.
 75. Þa cwæð sum rædbora þæt Chrisantus leornode
drycræft æt þam Cristenum and ofercom mid þam þa bilewitan
mædene on þam bure swa eaþelice; and tihte þone fæder þæt he
funde sum mæden on cræftum getogen, þe cuþe him andwyrde.
 80. Þa wæs sum mæden wundorlice cræftig on þære
ylcan byrig æþelborenre mægðe, Daria gehaten, on hæðenscipe
wunigende, wlitig on wæstme and on uðwitegunge snoter.
 84. Polemius þa sona sende his frynd to þam mædene Darian
and micclum wæs biddende, þæt heo Chrisantum gewemde fram Criste mid
spræce, and þæt heo hæfde hine hire to were syððan.
 88. Him gewearð þa æt nextan þæt heo wolde swa don, and
com þa geglenged mid golde to þam cnihte, and scinendum gymstanum swilce
sunbeam færlice, and hine frefrode mid hire fægerum wordum.
 92. Þa cwæð Crisantus hire to mid clænum mode þus,
swyðe þu geglengdest mid golde þe sylfe þæt þu mid þinre wlite
mine willan aidlige, ac þu mihtest habban þone Hælend to brydguman gif
þu hine lufodest, and heolde þe clænlice on ungewemmedum mægðhade,
and þu wurde swa wlitig wiþinnan on mode, swa swa þu wiðutan eart.
 99. Daria him andwyrde, ne dyde ic for galnysse, þæt ic þus
gefretewod ferde in to þe, ac þines fæder wop ic wolde gestillan,
þæt þu him ne losige ne huru þam godum.
 103. Crisantus þa axode betwux oþrum spræcum, Hwilce
godnysse hæfde eower god Saturnus þe abat his suna þonne hi geborene
wæron, swa swa his biggengan on heora bocum awriton, oþþe hwilce
godnysse hæfde se gramlica Iouis se þe on fulum forligre leofode on
worulde, and his agen swustor him geceas to wife, and manega manslihtas and
morðdæda gefremode, and drycræft arærde to bedydrigenne þa
unwaran?
 112. Oððe hwylc halignyss wæs on þam hetelan Ercule, þam
ormætan ente, þe ealle acwealde his nehgeburas, and forbærnde hine
sylfne swa cucenne on fyre, siððan he acweald hæfde men and þa leon
and þa micclan næddran?
 117. Hwilc beoð þa lytlan godas on to gelyfenne, nu þa
fyrmestan godas swa fullice leofodon?
 118. Crisantus þa swa lange to geleafan tihte Darian mid wordum,
oþþæt heo gewende to Gode forlætenum gedwylde deoflicra biggenga.
 122. Hi wurdon þa anræde, and wunodon ætgædere gehiwodum
synscipe, and gehealdenre clænnysse, oþþæt Daria underfeng fulluht on
Gode, and Godes bec leornode æt þam gelæredum cnihte, and hire mod
gestrangode, on mægðhade wunigende.
 127. Wurdon þa on fyrste fela men gebigde þurh heora drohtnunge
fram deofles biggengum to Cristes geleafan and to clænum life.
 130. Cnihtas gecyrdon þurh Crisantes lare, and mædenu þurh
Darian, manega to drihtne, forlætenum synscipe, and geswæsum lustum,
oþþæt sume men astyrodon sace be þysum, and hi wurdon gewrehte to
þam wælhreowan deman, þe on þone timan geweold þære widgillan
Rome byrig.
 136. Hwæt þa se hæðena dema het gehæftan Crisantum and
Darian samod for Drihtnes geleafan, and mid mislicum witum het hi gewitnian
oð deað, gif hi noldon geoffrian þam arwurðum godum.
 140. Crisantus wearð betæht hundseofontigum cempum, and hi
hine bundon hetelice swiðe, ac þa bendas toburston sona swa he gebunden
wæs.
 143. Hi gebundon hine eft, oft and gelome, ac þa bendas toslupon
swa swyðlice him fram, þæt man ne mihte tocnawan hwæðer hi gecnytte
wæron.
 146. Þa yrsodon þa cempan ongean þone Cristenen cniht, and
gesettan hine þa on ænne heardne stocc, and his sceancan gefæstnodon on
þam fotcopsum bysmrigende mid wordum þone halgan wer; ac se fotcops awende
wundorlice to þrexe, and eall to duste þurh Drihtnes mihte.
 152. Þa wendon þa cempan þæt he cuðe drycræft, and
beguton hine ealne mid ealdum miggan, wendon þæt se migga mihte aidlian
ealne his scincræft; ac hi swuncon on idel, forðanþe se migga þurh
Godes mihte wearð to swetum stence sona awend.
 158. Hi behyldon þa ardlice ænne oxan mid graman, and
besywodon Crisantum swa mid þære hyde to his nacodum lice, and ledon hine
ongean þa sunnan.
 161. He læg swa ealne dæg on þære ormætan hætan,
ac seo hyd ne mihte aheardian him abutan, ne þam halgan derian on þære
hatan sunnan.
 164. Hi tigdon þa his swuran swiðe mid racenteagum, and his
handa samod mid heardum isene, and þa fet togædere mid gramlicum anginne,
and wurpon hine swa gebundene into anum blindum cwearterne.
 168. Þa toslupon þa bendas on his swuran and handum and
þær scean micel leoht swa swa of manigum leohtfatum.
 170. Þa cempan þa cyddon þæt Claudio heora ealdre, and he
sylf com þærto, and geseah þæt leoht, and het hine utgan, and began
hine to axienne; Hwæt is seo micele miht þinre morðcræfte þæt
þu þyllic gefremast þurh feondlicne drycræft?
 175. Ic gewylde foroft þa anrædan drymen, and ælcne
wiccecræft ic eaðelice oferswiðde, and þa Chaldeiscan wigleras, and
þa wurmgaleras, ic mihte gewyldan to minum willan æfre; and ic næfre ne
afunde swa fæstne drycræft.
 180. Ic wille nu swaþeah þæt þu awende þe sylfne fram
þinum Cristendome and gecweme urum godum mid arwurðum offrungum.
 182. Him andwyrde þa Crisantus, þu mihtest tocnawan gif þu
cuþest ænig god, þæt ic mid drycræfte ne dyde þas þing, ac me
fylste God sylf mid godcundre mihte.
 186. Þine godas ne geseoþ ne soðlice ne gehyrað, ac syndon
andgitlease mid leade gefæstnode.
 188. Claudius þa het hine hetelice swingan mid greatum gyrdum for
his goda teonan.
 190. Þa wurdon þa gyrda wundorlice gehnexode færlice on
heora handum swilce hit fæðera wæron.
 192. Þa þa hi man heold hi wæron hearde and hostige; þonne
man sloh, sona hi hnexodon.
 194. Claudius þa het þone halgan forlæton, and hine
siððan scrydan, and he sylf clypode, Nis þeos miht of mannum, ac is Godes
mærð þe ealle þas wita gewylde swa eaðelice.
 198. Hwæt wille we leng don buton licgan ealle æt his
arwurðum cneowum, and eadmodlice biddan þæt he us geþingie to
þyllicum Gode, þe his biggengan macaþ swa mihtige on gewinne?
 202. Hi feollon þa ealle mid fyrhte to his cneowum, and Claudius
him cwæð to, Ic oncneow to soþan þæt þin God is soð God, and ic
sylf nu bidde þæt þu me geþingie hu ic wurðe his biggenga.
 206. Crisantus him andwyrde, Ne þearft þu yrnan on fotum ac mid
geleafan gan þæt þu God oncnawe.
 208. Swa micclum he bið andwerd anum gehwilcum men, swa micclum
swa he hine secð mid soþum geleafan.
 210. Crisantus hi lærde þa oþþæt hi gelyfdon on God,
claudius/ and his wif, Hilaria gehaten, and heora twegen suna, Nason and
Maurus; and heora maga fela to fulluhte hi gebugon, and þa hundseofontig
cempan þe Claudius bewiste, wurdon gefullode mid heora freondum þæs
dæges.
 216. Hi ealle þa wunodon wuldrigende heora Drihten, and geornlice
leornodon heora geleafan æt Crisante, and wiscton þæt hi moston wite
þrowian for Criste.
 219. Hit bið langsum to awritene þa wundra þe hi gefremodon,
ealle be endebyrdnysse, forþanþe we efstað swyðe eow mannum to secgenne
hu hi gemartyrode wæron.
 222. Numerianus se casere, þære cristenra ehtere, þa þa
him wearð cuð þæt Claudius gelyfde, and ealle þa cempan Cristene
wæron, þa het he niman Claudium and lædan to sæ, and wurpan hine ut
mid anum weorcstane.
 227. He het beheafdian siððan þa hundseofontig cempan, butan
heora hwilc wolde awegan his geleafan, ac hi ealle efston anrædlice to
slæge, and Claudies twegen suna cwædon þæt hi wæron on Criste
gefullode, and underfon woldon deað mid þam cempum, for Cristes geleafan.
 233. Hi wurdon þa ofslagene samod for Criste, and Hilaria se
eadiga eac wearð gelæht to þam martyrdome fram þam manfullan.
 236. Þa bæd heo þa cwelleras, þe hi to cwale læddon,
þæt heo moste ærest hi ardlice gebiddan, and heo swa dyde, and Drihtnes
lichaman underfeng, and on þam gebedum gewat of worulde to Criste.
 240. Efter þysum wearð se halga wer Crisantus on cwearterne
gebroht, swa swa se casere het, þæt he mid Darian for Drihtnes geleafan on
mislicum witum gemartyrod wurde.
 244. Þæt cweartern wearð afylled mid fulum adelan, and butan
ælcum leohte atelice stincende.
 246. Daria seo eadiga fram þam arwurþan wæs onsundran
gehæft, and hi man sende þa to myltestrena huse, þam manfullan to
gamene; ac God hi gescylde wið þa sceandlican hæðenan.
 250. Þæt anþræce cweartern þe Crisantus on wæs,
wearð onliht sona wundorlice þurh God, and þær wynsum bræð
werodlice stemde.
 253. And an leo utbærst ut of þære leona pearruce, and arn
to Darian þurh Drihtnes sande, þær heo læg on gebedum, and alæt to
eorðan astræhtum limum wið þæt geleaffulle mæden.
 257. Þa woldon ða hæðenan habban hi to bysmore, and nyston
þæt seo leo læg inne mid hire.
 259. Eode þa heora an into þam mædene, ac seo leo hine
gelæhte, and alede hine adune and beseah to Darian swylce heo axian wolde hu
heo/ wolde be him þa he gewyld læg.
 263. Daria þa cwæð to þam deore þus, Ic þe halsige
þurh Crist þæt þu þam cnihte ne derige, ac læt hine butan ege
hlystan minre spræce.
 266. Þa forlet seo leo þone ungeleaffullan cniht, and forstod
him þa duru þæt he Darian gespræce, and þæt nan oþer man ne
mihte in to him.
 269. Daria þa cwæð to þam ofdræddan men, Efne þeos
reþe leo arwurðað nu God, and þu, gesceadwisa man, þe sylfne fordest,
and þu fægnast, earmincg, on þinre fulan galnysse, þurh þa ðu
scealt weopan and wite þrowian.
 274. Þa gesohte he hi and sæde mid fyrhte, Læt me gan
gesund ut and ic syððan bodige mannum þone hælend þe þu mærsast
and wurðast.
 277. Þa het Daria þæt deor him ryman ut, and he arn ut,
arwurðigende God and þæt halige mæden, hire mihte cyðende.
 280. Þa woldon þa hæþenan hetan þære leo, ac heo
gelæhte æfre, ænne and ænne, and brohte hi to Darian þurh
Drihtnes mihte.
 283. Þæt mæden þa cwæð to þam mannum þus, Gif ge
wyllað gelyfan on þone lifigendan Crist, þonne mage ge gan unamyrrede
heonan; gif ge þonne nellað þone geleafan habban, nat ic gif eowre godas
eow gehelpan magon.
 288. Hi ealle þa clypodon swilce mid anre stemne, Se ðe on
crist ne gelyfe, ne cume he cucu heonon.
 290. And hi eodon þa ut ealle clypigende, Eala ge Romaniscan
leoda, gelyfað to soþan þæt nan oþer god nys butan Criste anum.
 293. Þa wearð se heahgerefa hearde gegremod, and het ontendan
fyr ætforan þære dura þær Daria inne wæs mid þam deore samod,
wolde hi forbærnan butu ætgædere.
 297. Þa forhtode seo leo for þam fyre þearle, ac Daria
cwæð to þam deore þus, Ne beo þu afyrht, þis fyr þe ne derað,
ne þu ne bist ofslagen ærþanþe þu sylf acwele.
 301. Gang þe nu orsorh aweg, and God ahret, þone þe ðu
wurðodest mid þinum weorcum todæg.
 303. Þa eode seo leo alotenum heafde tomiddes þæs folces
freolice aweg; and þa þe heo ær gefeng wurdon gefullode siððan hi
oncneowan Crist þurh ða leon.
 307. Þis wearð þa gecyd þam casere sona, and he het mid
graman his heahgerefan geniman Crisantum and Darian, and acwellan hi mid witum,
gif hi noldon offrian þam arleasum godum.
 311. Se heahgerefa þa het on hengene astreccan þone halgan
Crisantum, and mid candelum bærnan buta his sidan.
 313. Þa tobærst seo hengen mid eallum ðam cræfte, and
þa candela acwuncon.
 315. Ealswa þa oþre men þe yfelian woldon þa halgan Darian,
Drihten hi gelette, swa þæt heora sina sona forscruncon, swa hwa swa hi
hrepode, þæt hi hrymdon for ece.
 319. Hwæt ða Celerinus, se forscyldegoda gerefa, mid fyrhte
wearð fornumen, and ferde to þam casere, and sæde him be endebyrdnysse
þa syllican tacne.
 322. Numerianus þa, se manfulla casere, tealde þæt to
drycræfte, na to Drihtnes tacnum, and het lædan buta þa halgan
togædere to anum sandpytte, and setton hi þæron and bewurpan mid
eorþan and mid weorcstanum.
 327. Hi wurdon þa buta bebyrigde swa cuce, swa swa se casere het,
and hi mid clænnysse ferdon of worulde to wuldre to wunigenne mid Criste.
 330. Þær wurdon gefremode fela wundra þurh God, and þæt
folc gewurðode þa wuldorfullan halgan, and gelome sohton mid geleafan
þider.
 333. Hit gelamp þa on fyrste þa þa þæt folc þider
sohte to þam micclan screfe þær þa martyras lagon, þæt se casere
het ahebban ænne wah to þæs scræfes ingange, þæt hi ut ne
mihton, and het afyllan þæt clyf færlice him onuppan, þæt hi ealle
togædere heora gastas ageafon, mid eorðan ofhrorene, and hi rixiað mid
Gode on þam ecan life, for heora geleafan acwealde.
 341. We wurþiað Godes halgan, ac wite ge swaþeah þæt
þam halgum nis nan neod ure herunge on þam life, ac us sylfum fremað
þæt þæt we secgað be him; ærest to gebysnunge, þæt we þe
beteran beon, and eft to þingrædene þonne us þearf bið.
 346. Mycel ehtnys wæs þa ða hi wæron gemartyrode, ac git
cymð earfoþre ehtnys on Anticristes tocyme, forþanþe þa martyras
worhton manega wundra þurh God, and on Anticristes timan ateoriað þa
wundra, and se deofol wyrcð þonne wundra þurh his scincræft, mid
leasum gedwimorum to dweligenne þa geleaffullan.
 352. Mycel angsumnys bið þam arwurðum halgum, þæt se
feondlica ehtere fela tacna wyrce, and hi sylfe ne moton swa þa martyras
dydon, wundra æteowigende on þam wyrstan timan.
 356. Hi beoð swaþeah gehealdenne þurh þæs hælendes
mihte gif hi heora geleafan gehealdað oð ende, on þam earfoðum
ehtnyssum þæs arleasan deofles; Swa swa se hælend cwæð on his
halgan godspelle, se þe þone Antecrist eaðelice fordeð, þam sy wuldor
and lof a to worulde; AMEN.

ÆLS (Thomas)
B1.3.34.
Passion of Saint Thomas the Apostle: Skeat 1881-1900, II, 398-424.



 1. <foreign>XII KALENDAS IALNUARIAS: PASSIO SANCTI THOME APOSTOLI</foreign>.
 13. Æfter þæs hælendes þrowunge and æriste of
deaðe and upstige to heofonum, þa þa his apostolas toferdon geond þisne
middaneard, þa becom Thomas to Cesarian byrig, and se Hælend sylf of
heofonum com him to, þus cweðende, þæra Indiscra kyning þe is
gehaten Gundoforus asende his gerefan to Sirian lande to secenne sumne wyrhtan
þe wel cunne on cræfte, cum nu, ic þe asende sona forð mid him.
 22. Þa andwyrde Thomas, Eala þu, min Drihten, send me þyder
þe þu wille buton to þam Indiscum.
 24. Se hælend him cwæð to, Far nu, and ic beo mid þe, and
þe ne forlæte, and æfter þan þe þu me gestrynst þa Indiscan,
þu cymst to me mid wuldorbeage martyrdomes.
 27. Thomas him andwyrde, þu eart min Drihten, and ic eom þin
þeowa; gewurðe þin willa.
 29. Efne þa se gerefa reow him to lande, Abbanes gehaten, fram
þam Indiscan kyninge, and eode geond þa scira his ærende secende.
 32. Crist him þa eode to, and cwæð openlice, Hwæt bigst
þu iunglincg?
 33. He andwyrde and cwæð, Min hlaford, þæra Indiscra
cyning, asende me to þysum earde to axienne wyrhtan, þæt ic hi gehyrige
ham to his weorce; oþþe ic hi bicge, gif hi beoð þeowe; þa þe on
stane cunnon, and gecwemlice on treowe, þæt hi on Romanisce wisan
ærære his cynebotl.
 40. Þa cwæð se Hælend to þam cnihte sona, Ic hæbbe
ænne wyrhtan wurðfulne and getreowne, þone ic oft asende to ænlipigum
burgum, and swa hwæt swa he begit his swinces to medes, he hit bringð to
me butan swicdome.
 45. Þisne ic wille sendan gif þu swa wylt mid þe þæt
þu mid wurðmynte æfter þam weorce eft hine asende gesundne to me.
 48. Þa blissode Abbanes, and beah to his cneowum, and se
Hælend betæhte þone halgan Thoman him ham to hæbbenne, and hi swa
toeodon.
 51. Þa axode Abbanes þone arwurðan apostol, Sege me to
soþan, gif þu sy his þeowa?
 53. Thomas him andwyrde, Gif ic his æht nære, ic wolde
forseon sona his hæsa; ac ic eom his þeowa, and þa þing ne do þe ic
sylf geceose, ac þæt me sægð min Hlaford.
 57. Ic eom an his þeowena of þam ungerimum, and we ealle cunnon
cræftas on weorcum, and farað geond scira and butan swicdome bringað eft
urum Hlaforde þæt þæt we geearniað.
 61. Hi eodon þa to scipe and heora segel arærdon, and mid
winde ferdon swa swa him gewissode God.
 63. Abbanes þa cwæð eft to þam apostole, Gif þu canst on
cræftum swa swa þu cwæde nu ær, hwi wolde þin hlaford þe
alætan to me?
 66. Thomas him cwæð to be Cristes getimbrunge, Ic lecge þa
grundweallas þe gelæstað æfre, and ic sette þone wah þe ne
asihð næfre, and þa egðyrle macige þe ælteowe beoð þæt
þam huse ne bið wana þæs healican leohtes.
 71. Ic arære þa getimbrunge, þæt hire hrof oferstihð
ealle gebytlu, and bið utan fæger, and swaþeah wlitigre þæt weorc
wiðinnan.
 74. Swa hwæt swa bið on marmstane, oþþe on mærlicre
getimbrunge, ic soþlice wyrce; and gif þu wilt me befæstan cnapan to
lærenne, ic him cuðlice tæce.
 77. Abbanes þa cwæð, ænlic is se wer þe swilce wyrhtan
hæfð, he is selra þonne sum kynincg.
 79. Thomas him andwyrde, ænlice þu spræce.
 80. Kyninges sunu he is, ancenned his fæder, and hylt his
fæder rice on healicum muntum, þær nan feond ne cymð þe his frið
awyrde; ne þær wædla ne bið, ne wanhal gemet.
 84. Hi seglodon þa forð seofon niht on an, and on land eodon;
ac hit bið langsum to secganne ealle þa wundra þe he worhte on þam
lande, forðan þe we onettað to his arwurðan þrowunge.
 88. Hi comon þa æt nextan to þæm cyninge on India, and
Abbanes gebrohte ardlice Thoman to þæs cyninges spræce, and he
cwæð him to, Miht þu me aræran on Romanisce wisan cynelice gebytlu?
 92. He cwæð þæt he mihte.
 93. Þa sceawodon hi þone stede þær hit standan sceolde,
and Thomas eode metende mid anre metegyrde þone stede, and cwæð þæt
he wolde wyrcan þa healle ærest on eastdæle and þa oþre gebytlu
bæftan þære healle, bæðhus and kycenan, and winterhus and
sumorhus, and wynsume buras, twelf hus togædere mid godum bigelsum; ac swylc
weorc nis gewunelic to wyrcenne on Englalande, and forþy we ne secgað
swutellice heora naman.
 102. Þa beheold se cyning and cwæþ to þam apostole, þu
eart æþela cræfta and kynegum þu sceoldest wyrcan.
 104. Se cyning þa betæhte þam Cristes wyrhtan ungerim feos
to forðigenne þæt weorc, and rad geond his hamas swa swa his rice
læg.
 107. Thomas þa ferde freolice bodigende Godes geleafan geond
þæt land gehwær, and fullode þa geleaffullan, and þæt feoh
dælde rumlice þearfum and arærde cyrcan.
 111. Hit gelamp þa swa þæt he to geleafan gebigde ungerim
folces and fyrðrode cyrcan, and preostas gehadode to þæs Hælendes
biggengum binnan twam gearum, ær se brema kyning Gundoforus gecyrde to
ðære scire ongean.
 116. Hit wearð þa gecydd þam cyninge þus, and he het
gebindan begen mid racenteagum, Abbanes and Thoman, and on þeostrum
cwearterne gramlice scufan, oþ þæt hi man ofsloge.
 120. Þa læg þæs cyninges broðor his lifes orwene, se
wæs Gad gehaten, Gundofore swiðe leof, and he elcode forðy hu he embe hi
dyde.
 123. Mid þam þe he wolde hi to wæfersyne tucian, þa gewat
se Gad of worulde to helle.
 125. Man heold þa þæt lic on þa hæðenan wisan, and se
broðor wolde wurðlice hine bestandan, and kynelice macian mid mærðum
his byrgene.
 128. Þa on þone feorðan dæg færlice on mergen aras se
ylce Gad aræred þurh God, and þa licmen wurdon wundorlice afyrhte for
þam niwan wundre þæt he wearð geedcucod.
 132. Þa clypode se geedcucode and cwæð to his breðer,
Gehyr nu min broðor be þam halgan men þone ðe þu woldest to
wæfersyne tucian; se is Godes freond, and Godes englas him þeniað.
 136. Min sawl wæs gelæd soþlice to heofonum þurh Godes
englas, and ic þær geseah þa mæran gebytlu þe Thomas þe worhte on
þære gelicnysse þe he hit gelogode her, mid gymstanum gefrætewod,
fægere geond eall.
 141. Mid þam þe ic sceawode þa scinendan gebytlu, þa
sædon me þa englas, þis synd þa gebytla þe Thomas getimbrode þinum
breðer on eorðan.
 144. Ic wiscte þa þæt ic moste on þam mæran huse huru
durewerd beon.
 145. Drihtnes englas þa cwædon, þin broðor nis wyrðe
þises weorces fægernysse; gif þu hit habban wylt we biddað þone
Hælend þæt he þe arære of þam reðan deaðe, and þu bigst
hit siððan þæt þin broþor underfo his feoh þe he wenð þæt
him forworpen sy.
 151. Æfter þysum wordum he efste to þam cwearterne, and
gesohte þone apostol secgende mid wope, Min broþor nyste leof þæt þu
þæs lifigendan Godes apostol wære, and he hæfð healice agylt.
 155. He unband hine sona, and bæd þæt he underfenge
deorwurðe gyrlan.
 156. Þa cwæð Drihtnes þegen, Git þu nast þæt ne
weriað wuldorfulle gyrlan ne flæsclice frætewunga þa þe folgiað
Criste, and gewilniað to hæbbenne þa heofonlican mihta.
 160. Þes pallium þe ic werige wyle me gelæstan, and min
syric ne tosihð, ne mine sceos ne tobærstað, ær þan þe min sawl
siðað of þam lichaman.
 163. Efne þa þa hi uteodon of þam ealdan cwearterne, þa
gesohte Gundoforus þone Godes apostol, biddende miltsunge his misdæda
georne.
 166. Þa cwæð Thomas him to, Crist min Drihten hæfð
micel getiþod þurh his mildheortnysse eow, þæt he wolde geswutelian
swa his digelnysse eow.
 169. Nu syndon eowre scira and eowre ceastra afyllede mid halgum
cyrcum, and þæs Hælendes geleafan; beoð eow sylfe nu gearwe to
gewendenne to Criste, þæt ge beon gefullode fram fyrnlicum synnum, and
beon gehalgode on þam halwendum fante.
 174. Þa cwæð sona Gad to þam Godes apostole, þa gebytlu
ic sceawode þe þu minum breþer getimbrodest, and englas me geærndodon
to þam ælmihtigan Hælende, þæt ic hi gebicgan moste.
 177. Þa cwæð bliþelice Thomas, hit stent on þinum
breþer gif þu hit gebicgan most.
 179. Se cyning þa Gundoforus cwæð to his breþer, Nu hit me
geworht is, ic wene þæt hit min beo; wyrce se apostol þe oþer weorc
þyllic; gif he þonne ne mage macian þe oþer, unc bam mæg helpan to
hæbbenne ðis an.
 184. Þa cwæð se halga apostol, Se Hælend hæfð
getimbrod ungerime wununge and widgylla gebytlu fram middaneardes frymðe
mærlice on heofonum, and þa beoð geceapode mid soþum geleafan.
 188. Gif ge willað nu beon embe þa gebytlu swiðor, and embe
þa heofonlican speda sprecan on eornost, þonne magon eowre æhta yrnan
eow ætforan; and hi ne magon folgian on forðsiðe eow.
 192. Lætað nu eowre æhta wydewum fremian, wædlum, and
wanhalum, and witað to soþan þæt hi be hundfealdum eow gehealdene
beoð, þær þær nan geendung eow on ecnysse ne becymð.
 196. Þa asprang his hlisa geond þæt land wide þæt to
Indian come Cristes apostol, se þe mihte gehælan mid his handa hrepunge
deafe and blinde, and þa deadan aræran.
 200. Þa wende þæt landfolc þæt he wære God sylf, and
brohton him kynehelmas, and budon him gyrlan kynelice geworhte, and woldon him
offrian hryþera and rammas, swa swa ricum gode.
 204. Thomas þa gecwæð þæt hi comon ealle to anum gemote
þæt he mihte him secgan hwæt him to donne wære, and hi dydon þa
swa.
 206. Hi comon þa feorran to anum felde eft, and manega þider
feredon mislice untrume, þæt se halga Thomas hi gehælan sceolde.
 210. Þa het se halga apostol ahebban þa seocan on anre stowe
ealle, and stod him tomiddes upastrehtum handum to heofonum and cwæð, Eala
þu halga God, ungesewenlice wealdend, and unawendendlic þurhwunigende
æfre, þu þe asendest us þinne sunu ælmihtigne, se forgeaf us þa
mihte þæt we mihton gehælan adlige and untrume ealle on his naman, and
behet us toeacan, þæt swa hwæs swa we bædon on his halgan naman
æt his heofonlican fæder, þæt he us getiþode swa swa ælmihtig
God; nu bidde we on his naman þæt þu gehæle þas untruman, þæt
þis folc tocnawe mid fullum geleafan þæt þu eart ana God mid þinum
ancennedan suna, and mid þam halgan gaste, heofona wealdend.
 225. Æfter þysre clypunge þa hi cwædon, amen.
 226. Þa com þær swilc leoht, swilce þær liget brude,
þæt hi ealle wendon þæt hi forwurðan sceoldon, and lagon
astræhte lange mid þam apostole.
 229. Þa aras Thomas up and het hi arisan and cwæð, Min
Drihten sylf com hider swa swa scinende liget, and hæfð eow gehæled;
ahebbað eowre heafda.
 232. Þa arison þa wanhalan wundorlice gehælede wuldrigende
þone ælmihtigan and his arwurþan apostol.
 234. Hwæt þa Thomas astah to anum stane and stod þæt hi
ealle mihton hine ænne geseon, and clypode hlude, and cwæð to þam
folce, Gehyrað nu ealle.
 237. Se Hælend me asende to þysum earde hider and ic his
þeowa eom, mann swa swa ge syndon, and he asende me to þy þæt ic eow
tæcan sceolde hu ge þa sceandlican godas mid ealle forlætan, and mid
geleafan bugan to eowrum scyppende, se þe soð God is ana, and wile
gehealdan þa þe on hine gelyfað.
 244. He tæhte þa langlice geleafan þam folce, and hu hi
leahtres forbugon and bysmorlice dæda, and hu hi on godum weorcum
þurhwunian sceoldon.
 246. He cwæð eft to þære meniu þe on þam gemote
wæron, Ne eom ic na God, ac eom Godes þeowa; nimað eowre sceattas þe
ge me syllan woldon, and dælað hi þearfum for Drihtnes lufan, and bið
gearwe to fulluhte mid fullum geleafan.
 252. Hi dydon sona swa, and on þone Sunnandæg wurdon
feowertyne þusenda gefullode on Criste butan wifum and cildum, þe ne wurdon
getealde.
 255. Þa wearð se halga Thomas gewissod eft þurh God þæt
he sceolde faran to þære fyrran Indian, and gewende þyder, and wundra
gefremode.
 258. He gehælde þær þurh God healte and blinde and ealle
untrumnyssa, and þa egeslican hreoflian, and deofla adræfde and þa
deadan arærde.
 261. Þæt landfolc þa ne mihte his lare wiðcweþan,
þonne he swilce wundra geworhte him ætforan.
 263. Sum wif hatte Sintice, seo wæs six gear blind, and wearð
þa gehæled æt þam halgan apostole, and com to hire magan Migdonia
gehaten beorhte locigende, þe blind hire fram eode.
 267. Þa cwæð Migdonia, þes man is God sylf oððe Godes
engel, þe þine eagan onlihte swa butan læcecræfte.
 269. And hi swa lange spræcon oðþæt hi eodon butu
þær se apostol bodode.
 271. Migdonia þa gelyfde on þone lifigendan God, þurh
þæs apostoles lare, and leng nolde cuman to hire weres bedde, æfter
þære bodunge.
 274. Seo Migdonia wæs þæs kyninges wifes swuster, and hire
wer þa gemacode wið Migdeum þone kyning þæt man sette on cweartern
sona þone apostol.
 277. Migdonia þa com to þam cwearterne dreorig, and feoll to
his fotum mid fyrhte cweðende, Ic bidde þe, leof, þæs lifigendan Godes
apostol, þæt þu for me ne underfo swa fullicne teonan, and Godes yrre
becume for þam intingan ofer me.
 282. Se godes man hire cwæð to, Gang þe ham ongean, and ic
cume ham to þe þæt þu oncnawe þurh þæt, þæt ic sylfwilles
þrowige, for mines scippendes naman, and hu micel se geleafa mæg þurh
God gedon.
 286. Heo dyde þa swa, and hire dura beleac, licgende on gebedum
on hire bure astreht.
 288. Efne þa se apostol on þære ylcan nihte com to Migdonian
and cwæð, Swa swa þu becymst þurh me to þam ecan life, swa ic eac
becume þurh þe to Criste, mid kynehelme martyrdomes.
 292. Beo nu swiþe anræde.
 292. Heo andwyrde mid fyrhte, La leof, ic þe bidde þæt þu
onlihte mine sawla, þæt ic geseon mage þone soðfæstan weg, þæt
ic ne befealle on þone fulan sæð.
 296. Thomas hire cwæð to, cep þæt þu fæste seofon
dagas georne, and ic syððan cume eft to þe, and þe gefullige fram
fyrnlicum synnum, and ælcne þe gelyfð on þone lifigendan God.
 300. Æfter þysum com hire wer to þam kyninge Migdeum and
bæd georne þone kyning þæt seo cwen moste gespræcan hire swuster
cunnian gif heo mihte hire mod gebigan þæt heo his gebedda wære; Ne
mæg ic hi geolæcan, ne mid ege gedon þæt heo ete mid me oþþe on
me beseo.
 306. Þa geþafode se cynincg þæt seo cwen þider eode, and
heo cwæð sona to hire swuster ðus, Eala þu Migdonia, min leofe
swustor, hwi forsihst þu þinne wer, and geunwurðast þe sylfe?
 310. Se kyning sylf hit bemænð, and his men ealle, þæt
þu swa færlice forlure þin gewitt.
 312. Migdonia hire andwyrde, Eala þu, min swuster, wistest þu
þæt ic wat, þas word þu ne cwæde.
 314. Se apostol wyrcð fela wundra on mannum, and sægð us to
soþan þæt sy oþer lif undeadlic and ece, ælces yfeles bedæled.
 317. Nu to niht eode se ealdorman him to, forþanþe his suna
wæs færlice dead, and lædde þone apostol to þam lifleasan cnapan,
and he sona arærde his suna of deaðe.
 321. Nu he sitt, and lærð þær geleafan on þam huse, and
gehælð þa untruman, ealle þe him to cumað.
 323. Triptia seo cwen cwæð hire to andsware, Gif hit swa is,
swa þu sægst, ic wille geseon þone man.
 325. Dyslic bið to forseonne soðlice þæt ece lif, and
heardmod bið se man þe ne mage þysum gelyfan.
 327. Hi eodon þa butu his bodunge to gehyrenne; hi gemetton þa
þone apostol micclum gebysgod ofer þa untruman men þe he ealne dæg
gehælde þurh his handa hrepunge on þæs Hælendes naman.
 331. Þa ða seo cwen geseah swilce wundra æt him, þa
cwæð heo ofwundrod, Awyrgede synd þa men þe nellað gelyfan
þyllicum weorcum.
 334. Þa stod þær an hreofla tohrorenum lichaman, atelic on
hiwe, and hine gehælde Thomas, and hine gefullode ætforan þære
cwene.
 337. Heo feol þa to his fotum, fulluhtes biddende, and þæs
ecan lifes mid geleafan gewilnode, and cwæð þæt heo gelyfde on þone
lifigendan God.
 340. Thomas þa bletsode bliþelice þa cwene, and lærde hi
georne to geleafan and cwæð, Min Drihten me clypode þæt ic cume to
him, and min tima is nu þæt ic of middanearde fare; underfoh nu forðy
fulluht æt me hraðe.
 345. He gefullode hi þa, and fela oþre mid hire wera and wifa,
and þa unwittigan cild, and lærde hi georne þæt hi lufodon heora
cyrcan, and sacerdas arwurðodon; and hi siþodon þa ham.
 349. Þa com seo cwen on æfnunge to þam cyninge ham, and he
cwæð hire sona to, Swyðe lange þu wære.
 351. Heo cwæð eft him to, Ge cwædon þæt min swuster,
and ic sylf eac wende, þæt heo gewitleas wære; ac heo soþlice becom
to soþum wisdome on þam heo me dyde dælnimend þæs ecan lifes.
 355. Soðlice ic geseah þone sylfan apostol se þe halwende
ræd æghwylcum men forgifð.
 357. Nu þu kyning miht macian þe undeadlicne gif þu wilt
gehyran þone halgan apostol; ne swyltst þu on eccnysse, gif þu soðlice
gelyfst.
 360. Þa forhtode se cyning, and het feccan him to þone
foresædan þegen þe hire swustor hæfde, and clypode mid gehlyde, and
cwæð him sona to, Mid þam þe ic hogode helpan þinum wife, mid þam
ic forleas min, and heo is mycele wyrse me þonne Migdonia þe.
 365. And hi motodon lange.
 366. Þa het se kyning gebringan on bendum him Thoman, and axode
mid graman, Hwæt is se, eower God, þe awent þurh þe swa ure wif us
fram?
 369. Thomas him cwæð to, þu kyning wilt habban clænlice
þenunga and gecwema þenas; wenst þu þæt God nelle, se ðe gewylt
ealle þing, habban clæna þenas and clænlice þenunga?
 373. Þa cwæð Migdeus se kyning, Gemaca mid wordum eft
þæt þa wif gecyrran sylfwilles to us.
 375. Thomas him andwyrde, Ic worhte ænne stypel, and þu
cwyðst þæt ic sceolde sylf hine towurpan; ac ic secge him swyðor
soðlice Godes word, þæt se þe lufað on eorþan his eorðlican
fæder, modor, oððe bearn, oþþe wif ofer God, ne bið he Gode
wurð.
 380. And he cwæð eft him to, þu kyning ne miht ofslean þa
sawle mid wæpnum, þeah ðe þu þone lichaman alecge on deaðe.
 383. God se soðfæsta kyning mæg asendan ægðer ge sawle
ge lichaman to þam ecan fyre.
 385. Þæt wif moste þa swa hire wer forlætan forþanþe
he hæþen wæs, and hetol ehtere; ac canones swaþeah cweðaþ and
beodað þæt nan wif ne sceole hire wer forlætan swilce for
eawfæstnysse, buton him bam swa gelicige.
 389. Þa het se kyning lecgan hate isena sona under his nacodum
fotum, þæt he lange swa þrowode, ac þæs arn wæter up wundorlice
sona and celde þa isena.
 393. Þa cwæð Thomas him to, Ne dyde God þis for me, ac for
þe swiþor, þæt þu swa huru gelyfde on þone lifigendan God.
 395. Witodlice he mæg þa mihte me syllan þæt ic butan
wætere þin wite me ne ondræde.
 397. Þa het Migdeus se kyning þone Godes man gedon on weallende
wæter; þa wearð hit acolod, and nan brand nolde byrnan under þam
wætere.
 400. He wearð þa gelæd to þam lifleasum godum þæt he
his lac sceolde lecgan him on offrunga, and his cneowa gebigan þam
bysmorfullum anlicnyssum.
 403. Þa gebæd hine Thomas bealdlice to his Drihtne, and het
þone scuccan þe on þam scincræfte wunode þæt he ut eode of
þære anlicnysse him to, and het hine on Godes naman þæt he towende
þa anlicnyssa, and þæt deofles templ, swa þæt hit ne derode nanum.
 408. Þa eode se deofol of þære anlicnysse ut, and towende hi
sona, swa swa wex formylt, swa þæt ne belaf hire an lim gesund.
 411. Þa clypodon þa hæþengildan, and hetelice grimetodon,
and heora an sona ofsloh þone apostol mid atogenum swurde, sæde þæt
he wolde his godes teonan wrecan; and se cyning gewende þanon, forþanþe
þæt folc wolde wrecan þone apostol.
 416. Hi feredon þa his lic mid geleafan to cyrcan, and wurðlice
bebyrigdon, to wuldre þam ælmihtigan.
 418. Þær wurdon gelome wundra gefremode; wode men þær
wæron on gewitte gebrohte, and gehwilce untrumnyssa hwiltidum þær
wurdon gehælde þurh God, and se Godes apostol wearð syððan geferod
to Syrian lande mid micelre arwurðnysse, þam ælmihtigan to lofe, se þe
on ecnysse rixað riclice mihtig; AMEN.

END_TEXT

ÆLS (Vincent)
B1.3.35.
The Martyrdom of Saint Vincent: Skeat 1881-1900, II, 426-42.



 1. <foreign>XI KAL FEBR, PASSIO SANCTI VINCENTII MARTYRIS</foreign>.
 1. ON Ispanian lande þære Speoniscan leode wæs se halga
martir þe hatte Uincentius to menn geboren, & mid his magum fægere
afedd, on mycclum þeawum cristendome, & he eac on Cristes lare wel
þeonde wæs, oððæt he wearð gehadod to halgum ercan diacone,
þam Helende þeowiende mid þam mæran bisceope Ualerium, se wæs þa
mære lareow on Ispanian lande, swa swa seo gerecednysse us segð on ledenum
gereorde.
 10. Þa aras seo ehtnys þæra arleasra cwelleræ wide geond
þas world wodlice swiðe ongean Cristes geleafan, & ongean þa
Cristenan menn ðe God lufedon, forþan þe se deofol wolde adwæscan
þone geleafan mid þam mycelam ehtnessum, & þam ormetum witum; ac swa
man ma ofsloh þara martira þa, swa þær ma gelyfdon þyrh þa mycclan
wundra þe þa halgan geworhtan, þurh þæs helendes mihte; forþam
þe soða geleafa þæs soðfestan Godes ne byð næfre adwæsced,
þurh þa deofollican ehtnysse, ac byð swiðor geeacnod swa swa us segað
ure/ bec.
 21. On þam dagum wæs þa sum heretoga wælhreow, Datianus
gehatan swiðe hetol ehtere on anre heafodbyrig on þam foresædan lande,
þe begeat æt þam casere þæt he acwellan moste þa halgan Cristenan
menn mid mislicum witum.
 26. Him geuþe þa se casere, swa swa us cyþað bec, þæt
se wælhreowa ehtere þone anweald hæfde, þæt he moste acwellan þa
Cristenan men mid witum, forþamþe hi begen wæron mid bealowe afyllede,
Criste/ wiðerwinnan mid wodlicre reðnysse.
 31. Hwæt þa Datianus, se deofollica cwellere, on þam
anwealde þe he underfangen hæfde, gecydde his wodnysse ofer þa Cristenan
menn, & began to dreccenne mid dyrstigum anginne þa halgum bisceopas,
& þa gehadodan preostas and þa diacones.
 36. Wolde ærest þa heafodmen þæs halgan geleafan mid
witum oferswiðan, þæt he syððan mihte þa læssan ofercuman &
fram heora geleafan gebigan.
 39. Þa efste se bisceop & se eadiga Uincentius to þam
æðelan martirdome; þohtan þæt hi wurdon witodlice gesælige, gif
hi mid estfulnesse eardlice underfengon þone wuldorfullan cynehelm heora
martyrdomes, þurh þa andætnysse þæs Hælendes geleafan.
 45. Datianus þa, se deofollica ehtere, het gebringan þa halgan
gebundene mid racenteagum into anre burig & hi begen het belucan on
leohtleasum cwearterne.
 48. And let hi liggan swa on meteleaste, swiðe micclum
gehefegode mid þam heardan isene; hopode þæt hi sceolde þurh þa wita
abugan fram Godes geleafan.
 52. Æfter langsumum fyrste he het hi gebringan him to; wende
þæt hi wæron mid þam witum fornumene, & mid þære meteleaste
mihtlease gedone; wolde hi gewitnian mid marum witum, þæt hi swa
eaðelice geendian ne sceoldan.
 57. Hi comon þa begen mid bliðum mode and mid fægerum
andwlitum & ansundum lichamum to þam geleafleasan deman; & he wearð
ofwundrod þæt hi wæron ansunde & fægeres hiwæs on fulre
mihte; & axode þa weardmen humeta hi dorston hi swa wel fedan mid wistum
& drencum.
 62. Hi cwædon þæt hi hym on naþor ne dydon.
 63. He ne mihte na tocnawæn þæt Crist sylf hi afedde, &
befran þa mid graman þone foresædon bisceop, þus axian, Eala þu
Ualerius, ic þe befrine nu, hwæt dest þu, mid þam þæt þu durre
winne ongean þone casere, oððe ongein us, swilce þurh
eawfæstnysse?
 68. Ac þe bisceop ne geandwearde þam wælhreowum swa
hraðe, forþan þe God wolde þæt he wurde oferswiðed þurh þone
diacon Vincentius on þam martirdome, þe þa gearo wæs to þam
wuldorfullan sige; & þæt se manfulla mihte eac tocnawan þæt se
bisceop mihte mid gebyldum and godum geleafan his wita forseon, þa ða he
wearð oferswiðed þurh þone diacon mid his leofan drihtnes geleafan.
 76. Þa cwæð Uincentius to þam arwyrðam bisceope þus,
La/ leof, geandweard þam arleasan mid anrædum geleafan, þæt his
wodnys swa wurðe tobrut, mid ealdordome ures Drihtnes soðlice mihte.
 80. Seo ylce nædre specð nu þurh þises arleasan muð,
þe þa frumsceapenan men, Adam and Euan, gefurn forlærde, & mid
niðfullum andan him benæmde þæs wuldres þe him God forgeaf on
neorxnawange/, gif hi him gehyrsumodon.
 84. He ne geearnode nanes wuldres, ne he ne wunode on
soðfæstnesse, ac þone deað þe he scencte þam frumsceapenum mannum,
þone he dranc ærest him sylfum to bealowe.
 88. Winne he wiþ me on þisum gewinne nu, & he wið me
feohte on his feondlicum truwan, & he gesyhð soðlice þæt ic
swyþor mæg.
 91. Þone ic beo gewitnod þonne he þe witnaþ, forþan þe
he sylf sceal swærran witu þrowian, & he byð oferswiðed on minre
geswencednysse.
 94. Þa geangsumode bealh hine sona se arleasa Datianus, &
cwæð to his gingrum & to his witnerum þus, Forlæteð þysne
bisceop & gebringaþ on witum Uincentium þone wiðercoran, þe us mid
wordum swa tynð.
 98. Ahoð hine, ic hate, on þære hengene, & hetelice
astreccað ealle his lima, þæt þa liþa him togaan.
 100. Þa gefæstnodon þa cwelleras þone Cristes þegn on
þære heardan hengene, & hine hetelice tihton swa swa man web tiht,
& se wælhreowa him cwæð to, Hwæt segst þu nu, Uincentius?
 103. Hwæt þing þe be þe sylfuum & be þinum earman
lichaman on þysum laþum witum?
 105. Se halga wer þa cwæþ to þam wælhreowan þus,
þises ic gewilnode & gewiscte æfre.
 107. Nis me nan þing leofre þæt me on minum life getimode,
& þu swiðost geþwærlæcst mines sylfes gewilnunge.
 109. Nelle ic þæt þu geswice, forþan þe ic sylf gearo
eom witu to ðrowienne, for þam wuldorfullan Drihtne.
 111. Nelle ic þæt ðu wanige min wuldor for Gode and mine
gesælða/; & þonne þu me witnast, þu bist sylf gewitnod.
 113. Datianus þa deofollice yrsode, and wæs gram on his
mode/, & began to sleanne swiðe mid gyrdum his agene witneras, þe
þone halgan witnodon, þæt hi swiðor sceolde hine geswæncan.
 117. Se halga wer þa cwæþ, Nu þu gewrecst on him ða witu
þe ic þrowige for þinre wælhreownysse, swilce þu sylf wille gewrecen
me on him.
 120. He hrymde þa swiðor & mid reðnysse grymetode swa
leo/, & gyt swiðor wedde sleande his cwelleras mid saglum & mid
gyrdum; het hi swiðor witnian þone halgan wer on þære hengene.
 124. Þohte þæt he mihte his mod ahnexian þurh þa
ormætan wita, ac he wann on idel, forþan þe hi ateorodon on þære
tintregunge, þæt hi leng ne mihton þone martir gewitnian, & he
anræde þurhwunode on þam witum swa þeah.
 129. Datianus þa axode mid æblæcum andwlitan his reðan
cwelleras, þus cweðende him to, Hwar is nu eower miht & eower mægen
becumen?
 132. Ne oncnawe ic eowere handa þe æfre hetole wæran, swa
oft swa ge gewitnodon þa ðe wæron forscyldegode oþþe þurh
manslihte/ oððe þurh morþdæda, oððe þurh drycræft oððe
dyrne forliger.
 136. Æfre ge gewyldon mid witum hi ealle, & hi heore diglan
dæda eow bedyrnan ne mihton.
 138. Ac ge nu ne magon þusne mann oferswiðan þæt he huru
suwige on þysum scearpum witum.
 140. Þa smercode se halga wer & to þam hetolan Datianus
þus/ cwæð, þis is þæt awriten is witodlice on Godes æ þæt
ða geseondan ne geseoþ ne þa gehyrendan ne gehyrað.
 143. Drihten Crist ic andette, þæs ælmihtigan fæder
sunu, mid þam halgan gaste, anne soðne God.
 145. Ac witna me gyt swiðor for þissere soðan andetnysse
þæt ðu on eallum þingum þe oferswiðedne oncnawe.
 147. Datianus þa cwæþ to þam Drihtnes cyþere, gemilsa
þe sylfum & ne amyr þine geoguþe, & þin lif ne gescyrt on
þisum suslum þus, þæt þu hure ætberste þisum heardum witum,
huru ne æt ende, þeah þu ær noldest.
 152. Uincentius him cwæþ to mid cenum geleafum þus, ne
ondræde ic me þine witu ne þine wælhreowan tintrego, ac ic swiðor
ondræde þæt þu geswican wylle þinre reðnusse & swa me
gemiltsian.
 156. Dacianus þa het hine gedon of þære hengene, & hine
eft ahon on heardum gealgan sona; & hine man þa swang & mid saglum
beot, & mid blysum ontende his bare lic eall, astrehtum limum, ac his
geleafa swaþeah ne ateorode on his Drihtenes andetnysse æfre
þurhwunede.
 162. Man ledde to his breostum feower brade isene clutas swiðe
glowende þæt hit sang ongean, & hi þa teartan wita mid witum
geeacnodon, & his ærran wunda mid wundum ofsettan, & into his
innoðum hine gewundodon, swa þæt on his lichaman nan dæl ne belaf
þe nære gewundod on ðære witnunge soðlice.
 169. Him fleow þa þæt blod ut ofer ealne þone lichaman,
& him se innoþ eac geopenode ongean & his liþa toslupon on þam
laðum tintregum.
 172. Ac he eall þis forbær mid bliþum andwlitan & mid
strangum gaste on Godes andetnysse, to þam Helende clypiende þe he on
gelyfde.
 175. Wala wa, cwæþ Datianus, we synd oferswiðede.
 176. Ac secaþ nu, ic bidde, an blind cweartærn þær nan
leoht ne mage inn, & on þam myclum þeostrum strewiað geond eall
tobrocene tigelan scearpe geecgode, & þæron astreccaþ þysne
wiðercoran, þæt he hine bewendan fram wite to wite & symble gearewe
habbe.
 182. Belucað hine þonne fæste þæt he licge þær ana
leohtes bedæled on þam laðum bedde.
 184. Secgað me swa sona swa ge oncnawaþ þæt he cucu ne
byð.
 185. & þa cwelleras swa dydon, gebrohton þone halgan wer on
þam blindan cwearterne, & besæton hine syððan, wakigende.
 188. Mid þam ðe þa weardmen wurdon on slæpe, þa com
þær heofonlic leoht into þam halgan were on þam blindan cweartearne
swilce an beorht sunbeam, & him wearð gebeddod mid hnescre beddinge,
swiðe/ ænlice, & he sylf þa sang his sealmes bliðe his drihten
heriende mid incundre heortan.
 194. Þa ða weardmen awocan, þa wundrode þa weardmen
þæs wynsuman leohtes, swiðe afyrhte for þam færlican tacne.
 196. Þa cwæþ se halga wer, of þam heofonlican leohte ne
beo ge afyrhte.
 197. Ic heom nu gefrefrod mid engellicre þenunge.
 198. Gað in & sceawiað hu me is.
 199. Ge gebrohten me on þrystum, & ic blissige nu on leohte;
mine bendas sund tolysede, & ic blissige mid sange.
 201. Ic eom nu gestrangod & hnesce understreowod.
 202. Wundriað þises, þæt se þe wurðaþ God mid
soþre andetnesse, þæt he sigefæst byþ æfre.
 204. Cyþaþ nu ardlice eowerum arleasan hlaforde hwilces leohtes
ic bruce, & hwilcere beddinge, þæt he gyt mage asmeagan sum þing
syllic wite to minum wuldre ic bidde ne wanige he nan þing, þæs þe
he/ minum martirdome mage to wuldre becuman.
 209. His mildheortednesse ane ic me ondræde swiðost, þæt
he beo awend swilce he wille me gemilscian.
 211. Hi cyddon þa þis þam hetolan cwellere, & he wearð
geangsumod on his mode & æblæce on nebbe cwæþ him to
andsware, Hwæt mage we him mare don, nu we synd oferswiðede.
 215. Berað hine nu, ic bidde, ut of þam blindan cwærterne
to suman softan bedde þæt he mage swa hine gereste.
 217. Nelle ic hine wyrcan wuldorfulran gyt, gif he on þam witum
gewitnod ateorað.
 219. Hi hine namon and þa bæran bliþelice on æarmun
þe hine ær witnodon on þam wælhreowum tintregum.
 221. & hi his fet cystun, & his flowende blod geornlice
gaderoden him sylfum to hæle, & geleddon hine swa on þam softan bedde
swa swa se arlesa het & forleetan hine swa.
 225. Hit gelamp þa sona æfter litlum fyrstum, þæt se
halga diacon gewat of worlde to Gode mid sigefæstum martirdome,
oferswiðdum deofle, to þam ecan wuldre mid þam welwillendan Drihtene,
þæt þæt he þam behet eallum þe hine lufiað & þam þe his
geleafan healdaþ oð ende.
 231. Datianus þa cwæþ, se deofollica cwelleræ, ofsceamod
swaþeah, gif ic oferswiðan ne mihte hine ær cucene, ic hine witnige
þus deadne.
 234. Awyrpað nu his lic on anum widgillum felda, fugelum to
æse, & fulum hundum to mete, & þam wildeorum; & his
wælhreowan þegnas swa dydon.
 237. Sona geferedan þæt lic to þam feldan middan, & hit
þar awurpon wildeorum and fugelum to mete, Hit gelamp þa sona þurh
Godes foresceawunge þæt an sweart hrem þær fleah sona to, &
bewerode þæt lic wið þa wildan fugelas, & hi ealle afligde mid his
fiðerum aweg, & eac þa reðan deor mid his onræsum.
 244. Se ælmihtiga God þe þe Eliam his witegan þurh þone
sweartan hræm asende hwilon mete, on þam westene ðe he onwunode,
& hine þa afedde ðær þur þæs fugelas þenunge, swa swa on
cyninga bocum fulcuð is be þam; þe ylca God geheold nu þæs halgan
weres lic, þurh þæs hremmes weardunge wið þa oðre fugelas.
 250. Þis wearð eft gecydd þam arleasan Datiane, & he þa
geangsumod þus cwæþ, Ne mæg ic hine oferswiðan forðon swa
deadne?
 253. Swa ic his swiðor ehte mid swiðlicre ehtnysse, swa ic hine
swiðor wyrce wuldorfulran symle.
 255. Ac gif þeorðe ne mæg þone mann forniman, be he
besenced on sælicum yðum, þæt us swa oft ne sceamige for his anes
sige on manna gesihþum, þe hit eall geseoð, and witon beo he huru
bediglod on þære deopen sæ.
 260. Be he besiwod on anum sæcce mid hefegum stanum, &
awurpað hine on þære widgillan sæ, þam fixum to mete þeah þe
þa fugelas noldon.
 263. Ða reþan cwelleras þa raþe swa dydon, awurpan þæs
halgan lic on þære widgillan sæ, mid þam hefegum stanum, swa swa hi
het þe dema, þæt he huru ne sceolde þære sæ ætberstan, þeah
þe he þære eorðan æror ætburste.
 267. Ða hig swa gedon hæfdon, swa ðe dema hi het.
 268. & reowan him hamweard mid healicre blisse.
 269. Ac soðlice þæs halgan weres lic, þurh þes
Hælendes mihte, to þam strande becom ærþam þe hi stopon on land,
& on þam ceosole gelæg, oð þæt sum geleafful wudewa swutele
gebicnunge be þam underfeng hwær se halga lichama læg on þam strande,
beworpen mid þam sand ceosole þurh þa sælican yþa, swilce he
bebyrged wære þurh Godes wissunge.
 276. His lic wearð þa geferod to geleaffulre cyrcan mid mycelre
arwyrðnesse, & þar on innan bebyriged; & his halgan ban wurdon wide
todælede, & mid mycelre lufe hi man wyrðaþ gehwær swa swa us
secgað bec, for his soðan geleafan, þam Hælende to lofe þe leofað
a on ecnesse;amen.
