START_TEXT

ÆHom 1
B1.4.1.
Nativitas Domini: Pope 1967-8, I, 196-216.



 1. We rædað on þisum Drihtenlican symbeldæge þæt
halige godspell be þæs Hælendes acennednysse, ægðer ge be his
godcundnysse ge be his menniscnysse, swa swa Iohannes awrat þe her on life
mid him on his hirede wunode, his modrian suna, & Crist hine lufode for
his/ clænan mægðhade, & he lede his heafod on þæs Hælendes
breost, on þam þe wunode þæs wisdomes þæt he swa mihte
cyðan be Cristes godcundnysse.
 10. Be him god geswutelode on þære gastlican gesihðe,
ærest þurh Ezechiel & eft on Apocalypsi, on earnes gelicnysse mid
þam oðrum godspellerum, þæt he mihte sceawian mid scearpum eagum on
earnes gelicnysse be þæs Hælendes godcundnysse, swa swa se earn
sceawað þære sunnan leoman unateorigendum eagum ofer eallum nytenum.
 17. Ða þry oðre godspelleras awriton heora godspell be
Cristes menniscnysse, hu he to mannum com, & eac be þam wundrum þe he
geworhte on life.
 20. Ða bædon þa bisceopas binnan Asian lande þone halgan
Iohannem þæt he him awrite sume gewissunge be þæs Hælendes
godcundnysse.
 23. And he him bead þa þreora daga fæsten, & æfter
þam fæstene he wearð swa afylled mid þam Halgan Gaste þæt he
ongann to writenne þa halgan Cristes boc swa swa we her secgað: <foreign>In
principio erat Verbum, ET RELIQVA:</foreign> þæt is on Engliscre spræce, On
angynne wæs Word, & þæt Word wæs mid Gode, & þæt Word
wæs God.
 30. Ðis wæs on anginne mid þam ælmihtigan Gode.
 31. Ealle þing syndon gesceapene þurh þæt Word, &
butan þam Worde nis geworht nan þing.
 33. Ðæt geworht is wæs lif on him sylfum, & þæt
lif witodlice wæs manna leoht.
 35. And þæt leoht scean on ðeostrum, & þa ðeostru ne
underfengon þæt foresæde leoht.
 37. Sum man wæs asend fram Gode sylfum to us, & his nama
wæs witodlice Iohannes.
 39. Ðes com on gecyðnysse þæt he cydde be ðam leohte
soðe gecyðnysse, þæt ealle gelyfdon þurh hine.
 41. Næs he na him sylf leoht, ac þæt he cydde gecyðnesse
be þam leohte.
 42. Ðæt soðe leoht wæs þe onliht ælcne mannan þe
on þisne middaneard becymð to menn geboren.
 44. On middanearde he wæs, & þes middaneard wæs geworht
eall þurh hine, & middaneard ne oncneow hine.
 46. On his agenum he com, & his agene ne underfengon hine.
 47. Swa fela swa hine underfengon, þam he forgeaf anweald Godes
bearn to beonne, þam þe on his naman gelyfað; þa þe na of blodum, ne
of þæs flæsces willan, ne of þæs weres willan, ac ða þæ of
Gode synd acennede.
 51. And þæt Word is geworht flæsc & hit wunode on us.
 52. And we sylfe gesawon soðlice his wuldor, swylc wuldor swa
gedafenað Godes ancennedan Suna, eall fulne mid gyfe & mid
soðfæstnysse.
 55. Augustinus se wisa & se wordsnotera bisceop sæde
þæt he ne mihte gehyran þonne he him sylf wæs embe þæt
halige/ godspell for þære micclan deopnysse þæs diglan andgites.
 59. Ac he asmeade þeah hwæðre sume þa getacnunge
þurh Godes sylfes fultum þæs & be his onwrigenysse we hit
awritað on engliscre spræce.
 63. Se soðfæsta godspellere us sæde þurh God þæt
þæt Word wæs on anginne mid þam ælmihtigan Gode: On anginne wæs
þæt Word: & þæt angin is se Fæder, mid þam wæs þæt
Word wunigende æfre & þæt Word is anginn, swa swa he eft sæde,
<foreign>Ego principium qui et loquor uobis</foreign>: Ic sylf eom anginn, ic ðe to eow
sprece.
 70. Be þam awrat Moyses se mæra heretoga, <foreign>In principio fecit
Deus celum et terram</foreign>: God geworhte on anginne heofonan & eorðan, &
þæt anginn is his ancenneda Sunu, þurh þone he gesceop ealle gesceafta
& hi ealle geliffæste þurh þone lyfiendan Gast: hi þry syndon an
anginn & an ælmihtig God.
 77. We cweðað eft gyt be þam ylcan anginne þæt þæt
Word wæs on anginne mid þam ælmihtigan Gode.
 79. & se sealmwyrhta sang be þam Worde swa swa we her
secgað eow to swutelunge: <foreign>Uerbo Domini cæli firmati sunt et spiritu oris
eius omnis uirtus eorum</foreign> Heofonas synd gefæstnode þurh þæt halige
Godes word, & þurh his muðes gast heora miht is getrymmed.
 84. Her is nu belocen on þysum lytlan ferse eall seo halige
ðrynnys þe is þrymwealdend God: se fæder & his Word, þæt is
his agen Wisdom, for ðan þe word is wisdomes geswutelung, & se Halga
Gast, þe hylt ealle þing.
 89. Ða halgan englas þe on heofonum wuniað syndon
gestaþelfæste & gestrangode swiðe þurh þæt halige Word
þæs heofonlican Fæder, & þurh þone Halgan Gast hi synd
gegladode to heora Scyppendes lufe, þe hi gesceop on wuldre; & þæra
manna heortan þe on middanearde gelyfað on þone soðan God symble beoð
on luste þurh þone sylfan Gast, & he sylð us eallum ure synna
forgyfennysse swiþe mihtiglice.
 98. Eft sang se sealmwyrhta on sumum oðrum sealme: <foreign>Quam
magnificata sunt opera tua, Domine: omnia in sapientia fecisti; impleta est
terra possessione tua</foreign>: Eala þu soþa Drihten, swiðe synd gemærsode
þine micelan weorc; & þu geworhtest ealle þing on þinum wisdome;
& witodlice is gefylled eall eorðan ymhwyrft mid þinre ehte.
 106. Ær he sang be þam Worde, & æfter be þam
Wisdome/.
 107. Paulus se apostol eac on his pistole awrat be urum Hælende
criste/ & cwæð þæt he wære þæs halgan Fæder wisdom
& his wundorlice miht.
 110. Eac sædon sume hæðne on heora gesetnessum þæt
we sceolon gelyfan on þone soþan god þe wilt þa heofonas &
geworhte ealle þing.
 113. An hæðen mann wæs iu on egypta lande ær
cristes/ acennednysse, & he cydde be Criste, Hermes gehaten, & se
hælend/ geceas hine to gewitnysse for his micclan wisdome.
 117. He awrat ane boc, þe hatte þuss on Leden: <foreign>Uerbum
Perfectum</foreign>, þæt is, Fulfremed Word.
 119. Word þæt ge magon gehyran hu se soðlice oncneow:
<foreign>Filius benedicti Dei atque bonæ uoluntatis, cuius nomen non potest humano
ore narrari:Est autem inenarrabilis sermo sapientiæ, sanctus sanctis, de
solo Deo: Dominus est omnium, dominante Deo mortalibus, et qui ab hominibus
indagari non potest, super omnes est</foreign>; He cwæð be urum Hælende: He is
sunu witodlice þæs gebletsodan Godes & þæs godan willan, &
mannes muð ne mæg his naman fullcyðan; He is wisdomes spræc us
unasecgendlic, & halig his halgum of Gode anum; he is ure ealra Drihten, of
þam wealdendan Gode þe gewylt þa deadlican, & se þe ne mæg
nateshwon fram mannum beon asmead, for þan ðe he is ofer ealle menn.
 138. Ðus wrat se Hermes on his gesetnysse be þam ælmihtigan
Fæder & his ancennedan Suna, & het hine Wisdomes Spræc, & se
godspellere Word; & he cwæð þæt he wære of Gode sylfum anum,
for ðan þe he næfde nane modor þa gyt on þære godcundnysse, ac he
is of Gode anum, mannum unasecgendlic, swa swa Hermes awrat.
 145. Fela we mihton secgan swylcera gewitnyssa þurh hæðene
witegan be þam heofonlican Gode, gyf us to lang ne þuhte hit her to
logienne.
 148. On anginne wæs Word, & þæt Word wæs mid Gode,
and þæt Word wæs God.
 150. Ðis wæs on anginne mid þam ælmihtigan Gode.
 151. Sume gedwolmen dweledon on geleafan & noldon gelyfan
þæt þæs lyfigendan Godes Sunu wære æfre mid him butan anginne;
ac se godspellere oferdrifð þyllice gedwolan þus awritende: On anginne
wæs Word, & þæt Word wæs mid Gode, & þæt Word wæs
God.
 157. Her ge magon gehyran on þisum halgan godspelle þæt
oðer is se Fæder, oðer is se Sunu, & oðer is se Halga Gast, þeah
ðe him eallum si an godcundnys æfre, & an mægenðrymnys
gemæne.
 161. Seo an godcundnyss þe him eallum is gemæne nele na
geþafian þæt hi þry godas syndon, ne þæt heora ænig beo
unmihtigra þonne oðer; & þeos godcundnyss ne ongann næfre, ac heo
wæs æfre wunigende on ðrymnysse & on soðre annysse a butan ende.
 167. Ealle þing syndon gesceapene þurh þæt Word, &
butan þam Worde nis geworht nan þing.
 169. Nis he na gesceapen, ne he nis na gesceaft, þurh þone ðe
syndon ealle þing gesceapene.
 171. Ealle þa gesceafta gesewenlice on worulde & þa
ungesewenlican on þam uppheofone þe ænige wununge habbað, ge furðon
þa wurmas, ealle hi synd gesceapene þurh þone soðan Wisdom, þe is
Word gehaten on þisum godspelle; & butan þam Worde nis nan þing
geworht.
 177. Ða gesceafta syndon gesette on þrim þingum, <foreign>In
mensura et numero et pondere</foreign>; þæt is on Engliscere spræce,him is
ær/ gesett hu miccle hi beoð & hwylce mihte hi habbað, & hi
habbað gemet, & he hi ealle gehylt se ðe ana is unametendlic.
 183. Næs næfre nan synn þurh god gesceapen ne nan
unrihtwisnyss ne yfel þurh hine ac þurh Godes willan þe ða englas
forgægdon, forleton to deoflum awend.
 189. & eft þurh Adam on his forgægednysse.
 190. Næfð yfel nane wununge þæt hit wesan mæge
ahwær buton on gesceaftum þe gode wæron gesceapene.
 192. Gode wæron þa englas fram Gode gesceapene & þæt
yfel næs þa gyt nahwær wunigende, ac hi hit afundon, & forferdon
þurh þæt, & þæt yfel wunað gyt on þam earmum gastum, &
eac on þam mannum þe heora mod awendað to unrihtwisnysse, & yfeles ne
geswicað, & þa godan menn dreccað Gode to forsewenysse, &
geswencað gehu mid ofsetnyssum.
 200. God gesceop heofonas, him sylfum to wununge & his halgum
englum þe him gehyrsumedon, & eac he geuþe þære ylcan wununge
Adames ofspringe gyf hi hit geearnodon.
 204. Ac æfter Adames gylte us wæs seo eorðe betæht on to
wunigenne on þissere worulde, & God us þeah geuðe for his godnesse
þære sunnan leoht to leohtfate on dæge & monan & steorran us
mannum on niht & menigfealde bricas to urum bigleofan: fixas & fugelas
þe on flodum wuniað, & þa wildan deor þe on wudum eardiað, þa
þe clæne syndon, mid his micclan cyste he forgeaf us gemænelice
eallum, ricum & heanum, þe heora hentan magon.
 215. Nytenu & orfcynn he forgeaf us to fultume, & wyrta to
læcedome & to wlite þære eorþan, & orfe to flæsce mid
oðrum wæstmum þæra we moton brucan be ures lifes neode; & we
magon geearnian on urum wræcsiðe gyt þæt ece lif mid him & þa
uplican wununga gyf we forlætað unriht & lufiað urne Scyppend.
 222. Manega gesceafta mislice us dreccað eall for urum synnum,
þæt we swa tocnawon hwæs we wyrðe syndon, & gewilnian þæs
beteran.
 225. Ðin gelica þe cwyð to sum teonfullic word; ðu modegast
ongean, & ne miht ðe bewerian wið flean on slæpe þæt hi ðe ne
awreccon.
 228. Swa wæs iu Pharao, þe wann ongean God, se Egiptisca
cyning, swa swa us cydde Moyses, þæt God hyne gewylde mid gnættum &
fleogum, þæt he oft abæd are æt Gode þurh Moyses þingunge &
ne mihte na fleon þa mæðleasan hundes lys þe him on þone muð
flugon ne þæra fleogena meniu þe his mete besæton, ne þæra
gærstapena þe gnogon his wæstmas Moyses him abæd oft miltsunge
& Pharao awægde his folces mod wið God oðþæt he sylf adranc
mid ealre his dugoðe on þære readan sæ swicdomum.
 240. Eaðe mihte God, gyf he swa wolde, sendan beran & leon
ongean/ þam breman cyninge, dracan eac & næddran, & hine swa
dreccan/ ac þa eaðelican gesceafta sceoldon gewyldan his modignysse,
þæt he wa ne on flot, þæt he ne forferde gyf he swa .
 247. Oft man wyrcð nu isen of eorðan gold & seolfor ac
hi/ ne mihte nan mann macian to wecgum gyf God ne geworhte þa oran to
þam.
 251. Ne furðon ænne sticcan ne ænne stæf we næfdon ne
ane oflætan to urum mæssan gode gyf he us ne foresceawode him sylf
þæt on ær; & we magon swaþeah mid his agenum þingum hine us
gegladian & hine eac gremian gyf we him ætbredað his agene cyste his
cystigan modes.
 257. Ða deoplican drymen mid heora drycræftum on Egypta lande
þe forlærdon Farao worhton manega tacna ongean Moysen of þam ylcan
antimbre þe God ær gesceop, oðþæt hi sylfe sædon, oferswyðede
æt nextan, <foreign>Digitus Dei est hoc</foreign>, þæt Godes finger wære Moysen on
fultume & hi ne mihton na leng Moyse wiðstandan for þam strangan fingre
þe hi gefreddan hiom ongean.
 267. Ge ne magon na swiðor, þeah ðe we eow secgon, heora
scincræft/ tocnawan, ac us secgað lareowas þæt of fearres flæsce,
fule stincendum, beoð beon acende, þæt hi cuce swa fleoð, & of
assan flæsce cumað wæpsas & of horses flæsce cumað eac
hyrnetta, & on ælcum wæstme, gyf hit miswent on geare cumað
syndrige/ wurmas, swa swa we gesawon oft.
 275. We secgað nu forð on embe þis soðe godspell: ðæt
þæt geworht is wæs lif on him sylfum.
 277. Ðeos eorðe is geworht, ac heo nis na hyre sylf lif, ac on
þam wisdome þe geworhte þa eorþan is þæt liflice gescead þe
gesceop ða eorðan.
 280. Ðu sceawast þa heofonan & sunnan & monan; hi synd
on þam cræfte, we cweðað nu swutelicor, on þam Godes wisdome, þe
is witodlice lif, & cann wyrcan his weorc be his dihte, & he is ure lif
on þam we lybbað & styriað, & on þam we syndon, swa swa us
sæde Paulus.
 286. And þæt lif witodlice wæs manna leoht.
 287. Ðæra manna leoht he is þe gelyfað on hine, swa swa he
sylf cwæð on sumon godspelle: <foreign>Ego sum lux mundi, et cetera</foreign>: Ic eom
middaneardes leoht, & se ðe me fyligð, ne gæð he na on þeostrum,
ac hæfð lifes leoht.
 292. And þæt leoht scean on þystrum, & þa ðeostru ne
underfengon þæt foresæde leoht.
 294. Swa swa þære sunnan leoht bescinð þæne blindan,
& se blinda ne gesihð þone scinendan leoman, swa eac þa unrihtwisan
& þa ungeleaffullan mid ablendum modum ne mihton geseon þæs
Hælendes leoht þe onliht þas woruld.
 299. Sum mann wæs asend fram Gode sylfum to us, & his nama
wæs witodlice Iohannes.
 301. He wæs fram Gode asend þæt he secgan mihte soðe
gecyðnysse, swa swa her æfter segð on þisum godspelle: ðes com on
gecyðnysse þæt he cydde be ðam leohte soðe gecyðnysse, þæt
ealle gelyfdon þurh hine.
 306. Swa swa se dægsteorra on dægered up gæð
ætforan þære sunnan, swa scean Iohannes ætforan cristes tocyme,
& he hine fullode, & wæs eac his bydel to þære halgan
bodunge/.
 310. Næs he na him sylf leoht, ac þæt he cydde gecyðnysse
be þam leohte.
 311. Se hælend sæde be him on sumere stowe þæt he
leohtfæt/ wære beorhte lixende for þan þe he bodode bealdlice
be Criste, & se godspellere segð þæt he nære him sylf leoht for
þan þe Cristes leoht þe us ealle onliht onlihte eac Iohannem þæt he
leoht wære.
 317. Se Hælend sæde eac to his halgum apostolum, <foreign>Vos estis
lux mundi</foreign>: Ge syndon middaneardes leoht, for þan ðe hi onlihton manncynn
to geleafan mid heora halgan lare, swa swa Crist him lærde.
 321. Paulus cwæð eac to þam geleaffullum: Hwilon ge wæron
þeostru, nu ge syndon leoht on Gode; for þan þe hi ða gelyfdon on
þone lyfiendan God.
 324. Æc ure eagan syndon gehatene leoht, ac hi naht ne geseoð
butan hi sum leoht habbon, oððe þæs dæges leoht, oððe lihtinge
on niht.
 327. Nu segð se godspellere be þam soðan leohte, ðæt
soðe leoht wæs þe onliht ælcne mannan þe on þisne middaneard
becymð to men geboren.
 330. Ðæt soðe leoht is ure leofa Hælend, þe is him sylf
leoht & onliht ælcne mann þe his geleafan leoht on his life gehylt,
oððe on godum gecynde oððe on godcundum wisdome, for þan þe ælc
wisdom is of Gode sylfum & we nan god nabbað buton of Godes gyfe.
 336. On middanearde he wæs, & þes middaneard wæs eall
geworht þurh hine, & middaneard ne oncneow hine.
 338. He wæs on middanearde þurh his godcundnysse, & he com
to middanearde þurh his menniscnysse, & þes middaneard, þæt syndon
þa menn þe lufiað to swiðe þas lænan woruld, noldon oncnawan
Cristes tocyme, swa swa se godspellere gyt segð her bæftan: On his agenum
he com, & his agene ne underfengon hine.
 345. Ðæt syndon þa ungeleaffullan men ðe his geleafan
forsawon.
 346. Ðis is swa gesæd be sumum mannum her, ac manega gelyfdon
of þisum middanearde, ge of Iudeiscum cynne ge of hæðenum þeodum, on
þone soðan Hælend, þeah þe hi sume noldon.
 350. Swa fela swa hine underfengon, eallum hiom he forgeaf anweald
Godes bearn to beonne, þam þe on his naman gelyfað.
 352. Her ge magon gehyran þæs Hælendes cystignysse &
his micclan godnysse ofer manna bearnum þæt he gyfð us anweald, gif we
on hine gelyfað, Godes bearn to beonne, swa swa þis godspell segð &
swa swa he sylf sæde to sumum his gecorenum: <foreign>Ego dixi dii estis, et filii
Excelsi omnes</foreign>: Ic sæde to soðan, ge sylfe syndon godas, & suna
þæs Hextan þe heofonas gewylt.
 360. Micel mærð is þis, & miccle geþingðu, þæt
se ælmihtiga God þurh his godnysse het us menn godas, & his agene
bearn, gyf we þone anweald æt him geearniað.
 364. Be þam ylcan cwæð iu God sylf to Moysen: <foreign>Ecce
constitui te deum Pharaonis; et Aaron frater tuus erit propheta tuus</foreign>; Nu ic
þe sette, cwæð God sylf to him, þæt þu beo pharaones god, &
þin broðor Aaron sceal beon þin witega.
 370. Swa micelne Moyse þæt he hine gesette swylcum cyninge to
gode, þe ann wið God sylfne, ac him comon þa to tyn cynna wita Readan
Sæ.
 375. Be þisum sang eac se sealmwyrhta þus: <foreign>Deus stetit in
synagoga deorum: in medio autem deos diiudicat</foreign>; He cwæð, God sylf gestod
on þæra goda gesamnunge, & he on middeweardan þa godas toscæt,
for þan þe God sylf deð synderlice gehwylcum, þam þe he godas
gewyrcð, synderlicne wurðmynt, ælcum heora anum be þam þe him
gewyrð & be þam þe hi lufiað þone lyfiendan God se þe ana is
ælmihtig Scyppend þurh hine sylfne.
 386. Crist is ancenned Sunu of þam ælmihtigan Fæder; nu
nolde he ana beon butan he gebroðra hæfde, ferde þa to middanearde
& fette him gebroðra swa þæt he mihte cyþan his micclan
cystignysse & his rice him forgyfan mid him to rixienne.
 391. Ða þe na of blodum ne of þæs flæsces willan ne of
weres willan, ac ða þe of Gode synd acennede.
 393. Ne bið na of þam blode þes halga bearnteam, ne of weres
gestreone, ne of wifes cenninge, ac of Godes geleafan, swa swa God sylf
sæde: Buton gehwylc mann beo acenned of wætere & of þam Halgan
Gaste, næfð he na Godes rice.
 398. Ðæt þe of flæsce bið acenned, þæt bið
flæsc witodlice, & þæt þe bið acenned of gaste, þæt bið
eac swylce gast: þæt synd þa gastlican bearn þe on Godes gelaþunge
þurh þæt halige fulluht & þurh þone Halgan Gast Gode beoð
acennede, gyf hi on gode þurhwuniað.
 403. And þæt Word is geworht flæsc, & hit wunode on
us.
 404. Nis þæt halige Word awend to flæsce, ac se heofonlica
æþeling her on þas woruld com & þa menniscnysse genam of Marian
innoðe, soð man acenned on sawle and on lichaman, & wunode swaþeah
God on þære godcundnysse, an ælmihtig Hælend, us to alysende .
 410. Nu cwædon þa Mannichei, þa manfullan gedwolan, þæt
Gode wære unwurð on his mægenþrymnysse þæt he wurde acenned of
wifmannes gecynde.
 413. Ac gehyre se dysega & se gedwola secgan þæt þæt
halige mæden, þæs Hælendes modor, næfde nane fulnysse, ne
furðon galnysse ne weres gemanan, ac þurhwunode mæden, & heo butan
sarnysse hyre cild acende, & hyre gedafenode, þa þa heo urne Drihten
gebær, þæt heo mæden wære æfre on mærlicum wurðmynte.
 420. Gyf seo sunne scinð, swa swa we geseoð oft, on fulum
adelan/ & heo befyled ne bið, micele swiðor mihte se ælmihtiga
Godes Sunu butan eallum fylðum beon of hyre acenned, & heo mihte beon
micclum geclænsod þurh his halgan mihte & he næs befyled &
hyre mægðhad is ansund, þonne heo butan hæmede bær.
 427. And we sylfe gesawon soðlice his wuldor, swylc wuldor swa
gedafenað Godes ancennedan Suna.
 429. Ða apostoli gesawon þe siðedon mid him þa wundra
þe/ he worhte, & hu he wearð hwilon uppan anre dune æteowed
þæt his nebbwlite scean swylce sunbeam, & his gewæda seinon
hwitre/ þonne snaw.
 434. Eft hi hine gesawon syððan he of deaðe aras on
ansundum/ lichaman, & hu he astah to heofonum, & cwædon hit to
mannum/ mid micelre wundrunge.
 437. Iohannes se fulluhtere hine gefullode on þære ea
iordanen/, & Crist þa up eode ut of þam wætere & godes
stefn/ of heofonum sæde him to: þes is min leofa Sunu, þe me wel
licað.
 441. Eft syððan on þam munte, þa þe him mid wæron þa
þa he swa beorhte scean, swa swa we sædon ær, gehyrdon of heofonum
þone halgan Fæder þus cweðende him to mid cuðlicere lufe: ðes is
min leofa Sunu, on þam me wel licað: gehyrsumiað him.
 446. Ðus sæde Matheus.
 447. Eft on þriddan siðe, ær Cristes þrowunge, clypode
se ylca Fæder cuðlice him to, þæt eall þæt folc gehyrde þe
þam Hælende folgode, cwæð þæt he hine mersode, & hine
mærsian wolde.
 451. Nu wæs þis micel wuldor & micel gewitnyss þam Suna,
þæt se Fæder swa þriwa þuss clypode him to hlude of heofonum,
þæt menn hit gehyran mihton; & sume eac cwædon þæt hit þunor
wære.
 455. Ðæt godspell geendað nu on þisum wordum þuss: Eall
fulne mid gyfe & mid soðfæstnysse.
 457. On þære menniscnysse he hæfde swa micele gyfe þæt
he wæs soð God & soð mann geboren, Dauides cynnes, of þam
clænan mædene, an Crist wuniende on twam edwistum.
 461. Soðfæstnysse he hæfð, swa he sylf sæde: <foreign>Ego sum
uia, & ueritas, & uita</foreign>: Ic sylf eom se weg, & soðfæstnyss,
& lif.
 464. Ðurh Moysen wæs gesett þam ealdum mannum iu æ, &
open lagu, & se leofa Hælend gebrohte us niwum mannum gife &
soðfæstnysse, & he þa þing gefylde þe gefyrn wæron be him
gewitegode þurh Moysen & witegan; & eall his fær wæs beðoht
fram frymðe þissere worulde.
 470. Ðam is wuldor & lof & wyrðmynt on ecnysse mid
þam heofonlican Fæder & þam Halgan Gaste on anre godcundnysse: we
cweðað, AMEN.

START_TEXT

ÆHom 2
B1.4.2.
Feria VI in prima ebdomada Quadragesimae: Pope 1967-8, I, 230-42.



 1. Men þa leofostan, us lyst nu eow secgan be þam halgan
godspelle þe ge gehyrdon nu rædan, þæt ge beon þe geleaffulran
þurh þa boclican lare, and þa anrædran on eowrum Drihtne.
 4. Se godspellere Iohannes, þe wæs Godes dyrling, Cristes
moddrian sunu, sæde on þære Cristes bec þæt ure Hælend Crist,
þa þa he her on life wæs lichamlice wunigende, þa wolde he faran on
sumne symbeldæg soþlice to Hierusalem.
 10. On þære byrig wæs gehæfd, gehende þam temple, an
wundorlic wæterscipe, Bethsaida gehaten; þone wæterscipe beworhte se
wisa cyning Salomon mid fif porticon fæstum weorcstanum, and man on þa
ealdan wisan þa offrunga þær þwoh þe man offrode symle on Salomones
temple, Gode to wyrþmynte, on þære Iudeiscra wisan.
 17. On þam wæterscipe wurdon wundra gelome þurh þone
ælmihtigan God, swa þæt he his engel asende of heofonlicum þrymme,
and he þæt wæter styrode binnan þam porticum be Godes dihte gelome,
and swa hwilc untrum man swa come into þam wætere æfter þæs engles
styrunge, se wearþ sona hal fram swa hwilcere untrumnysse swa he wære
gehæfd.
 24. Þær lagon þa forþi on þam foresædum porticum fela
untrumra manna mislice gebrocode, blindra and healtra, and on handum alefode,
andbidigende þære styrunge þurh þæs engles tocyme.
 28. Þær læg þa sum beddryda andbidigende þæs ylcan,
eahta and þrittig wintra on his untrumnysse.
 30. Ða þa se Hælend þider com, swa swa we ær sædon,
and wiste be þam men þæt he wæs lange untrum, þa cwæð he to
þam earman, Wylt þu beon hal?
 33. Se lama him andwyrde, La leof, ic næbbe nænne mannan þe
mage me into þam wæterscipe don æfter þære styrunge, and þonne
ic earming þyder cume, þonne cymð sum oðer man ær into þam
wætere.
 38. Þa cwæþ se Hælend him to, Aris hal of ðam bedde,
and ber þin legerbed gangende heonon.
 40. Se man þa sona mihtiglice wearð gehæled, and bær his
legerbed on his bæce, and eode.
 42. Hit wæs þa Sæternesdæg þa þis geworden wæs;
þone dæg wurþodon þa Iudeiscan mid freolse, æfter Moyses æ, and
hi to þam men cwædon þe ðær gehæled wæs, Hit is halig
restendæg; ne most ðu styrigan þine beddinge.
 47. Se man him andwyrde anrædlice and cwæð, Se ðe me
gehælde, he het me niman min bed and gan; and hi ongunnon hine axian,
Hwæt is se man þe het þe niman þin bed and gan?
 51. And se þe þær gehæled wæs nyste hwæt se
Hælend wæs, and se Hælend þa eode of þære meniu.
 53. Syþðan eft se Hælend geseah þone mann binnan þam
temple, and him bebead þas word: Efne nu þu eart gehæled, heald þe nu
heonon forð, þæt þu ne syngie, þy læs þe þe sum þing wyrse
gelimpe; and se man þa eode, and sæde þam Iudeiscum þæt se
Hælend hine gehælde.
 59. We habbað nu gesæd sceortlice þis godspel anfealdum
andgite, and we eac willað eow secgan þæt gastlice andgyt, æfter
Agustinus trahtnunge, sceortlice swaþeah, þæt ge ne beon gehefegode.
 63. Se wæterscipe wæs beworht mid fif porticum, and hæfde
getacnunge, swa swa se trahtnere segð, Iudeisces folces, þe wæs befangen
þa mid fif ælicum bocum, þe Moyses him sette be Godes sylfes dihte,
þæt hi singian ne sceoldon.
 68. On þam porticum lagon alefode and adlige, blinde and healte,
and on handum forscruncene.
 70. Swa wæron þa Iudei wanhale on mode, and on heora geleafan
alefode forþearle, for þam ðe Moysæs æ ne mihte hi gerihtwisian,
oþþæt Crist sylf com cuðlice to mannum, and us gerihtlæhte mid
geleafan and gife, and eac þa Iudeiscan þe on hine gelyfdon.
 76. Þa beoþ blinde on mode þe ne magon geseon þæs
geleafan leoht, þeah hi locion brade; and þa beoð healte on heortan þe
þæs Hælendes beboda unrihtlice farende ne gefyllað mid weorcum; and
þa beoþ deafe þe Drihtnes hæsum nellað gehyrsumian, þeah þe hi
þa gehyron.
 82. Se hæfð forscruncene hand þe næfð mildheortnysse
weorc, and biþ unwæstmbære, and æfre fordrugod.
 84. Be swilcum cwæð se Hælend on his halgan godspelle, þa
þa sum lama læg þær þær he lærde þæt folc: Astrece
þine hand; and he hal wearð sona, and astrehte his swyþran, þe
forsearod wæs oþ þæt.
 88. Swilce he wære gemanod mid þam mihtigan wundre, astrece
þine hand, þe ær wæs uncystig, to ælmysdædum earmum þearfum.
 91. Swilce wanhale lagon wiðinnan þam porticon, ac se
ælmihtiga Hælend þe of heofenum astah mancyn to alysanne mihte hi
gehælan on sawle and on lichaman, þurh his soðan gyfe.
 95. Hys nama is Hælend, for þan þe he gehælþ his folc,
swa swa se engel cwæþ be him, ær þan þe he acenned wære: He
gehælþ hys folc fram heora synnum.
 98. Micele mare wundor is þæt he wolde beon mann on þisum
life, and alysan us þurh hine, þonne þa wundra wæron þe he worhte
betwux mannum; and selran us wæron þa ungesewenlican wundra, þurh þa
he adwæscte þa dyrnan leahtras urra sawla, þonne þa gesewenlican
wundra, þurh þa ðe wæron gehælede þa þe eft swulton.
 105. Witodlice seo sawul þe fram synnum bið gehæled, and on
geleafan þurhwunað, færð of þisum life to Gode; and se brosnigenda
lichama, þeah þe he beo gehæled, bið mid deaþe fornumen and to duste
awend.
 109. He bið swaþeah gehæled to ansundre hæle eft on
Domesdæg, þonne he of deaþe arist, and syþðan ne swylt, ne seoc ne
gewyrð, ne him hingrian ne mæg, ne him þurst ne deraþ, ne he ne
forealdað, ac bið ece syþþan, on sawle and on lichaman, orsorh
deaþes.
 115. On þam wæterscipe wæron twa wundorlice mihta, an
þurh þone engel, oþer þurh þone Hælend.
 117. Æfter þæs engles styrunge eode in se ðe mihte, and
wæs sona gehæled fram his seocnysse, and se þe syþþan com swanc on
idel, for þan þe se engel getacnode ures Hælendes tocyme, se þe on his
tocyme cydde his mihte, and mid wundrum astyrode þæt Iudeisce folc, swa
þæt hi andodon ongean his lare, oþþæt hi syrwdon hu hi hyne
beswicon.
 125. An wæs gehæled æfter þæs engles tocyme, and
ænne gehælde se Hælend on his tocyme, for ðære annysse ures
geleafan; and swa hwa swa bið buton þære annysse Cristes gelaþunge, ne
becymþ ðam nan hæl.
 130. Þurh þæs wæteres styrunge wæs eac getacnod
þæs Hælendes þrowung, þurh þa hæl becom eallum mancynne þe
on anum geleafan Criste gehyrsumiað mid haligre drohtnunge.
 134. Ænne he gehælde þa of eallum þam untrumum, se ðe
mid anum worde eaðelice mihte hi ealle gehælan; ac he wolde swiþor
þurh þæt an wundor awreccan heora mod, and heora sawla onlihtan þurh
þæt syllice tacn.
 139. Eahta and þrittig wintra wunode se bedryda on þam
legerbedde, anbidigende his hæle, oðþæt Crist sylf com, þe
sceortlice beleac ealle halige bec on twam bebodum: þæt is, þæt ðu
lufige and mid geleafan wurðige þone ælmihtigan Drihten mid ealre
þinre heortan, and syþþan þinne nextan swa swa þe sylfne.
 146. Lege þas twa beboda to þam twam læs feowertigum
þæs langsuman legeres þæs laman beddrydan, þonne bið þær
fullice feowertiggetel.
 149. Fram þære fulfremednysse færð se man æmptig, se
ðe næfð þa soþan lufe his Scippendes and manna.
 151. Soþlice þis getel wæs gesett gefyrn, þa þa Moyses
fæste feowertig daga, and Godes æ sette be Godes sylfes dihte; and Helias
se witiga eall swa lange fæste, on þam wæs seo witegung witodlice
getacnod; ac hi ne mihton þurh hi sylfe swylc fæsten þurhteon, ac him
sealde þa mihte se þe mæg ealle þing.
 158. Eft þa ure Hælend on hys andweardnysse fæste feowertig
daga, þurh his agenne fultum; þurh þone wæron getacnode þa towerdan
godspell þe he sylf gefadode þurh his feower godspelleras, mannum to lare
and to geleafan trymminge.
 163. Ðis wæs se ordfruma ures Lenctenes, and þus
gegrundweallod þurh God sylfne ær, and us is to healdenne forþi þæt
halige fæsten þyssere tide, swa us tæcð ure scrift.
 167. Nu is oþer fæsten us eac to healdenne, swa swa se apostol
Paulus on his pistole awrat, þæt we us forhabbon fram arleasnysse and fram
yfelum lustum þysre worulde, and syferlice lybban symble gemetlice, rihtlice
and arfæstlice, anbidigende edleanes þæs eadigan hihtes ures
Hælendes tocymes, on þam we underfoð þæt ece lif mid him, gif we nu
gehyrsumiað his hæsum mid weorcum, and þa þe hine forseoð he
besencð on hellegrund.
 177. Þis fæsten ær Eastran we fæstað mid geswince, and
we freolslice syþþan fiftig daga lybbað, oþ þa halgan Pentecosten
þe se Halga Gast on com on fyres gelicnysse, and þone geleafan getrymede,
ærest þam apostolum, and eft þurh hi mancynne, swilce we on þisum life
swincon, and on ðam towerdan blission, underfangenre mede on þam ecan
freolse.
 184. Þreo þing bebead se Hælend þam bedrydan: þæt is,
aris, and ber þin legerbed, and gang.
 186. He gehælde his untrumnysse mid þam þe he het hine
arisan, and swaþeah seo dæd getacnode sum þing, swilce he þam seocan
sæde þisum andgite: Asceac þe of hraþe þa sleacnysse fulra leahtra,
þe þu gefyrn on lage, and gearca þe sylfne to þære sawle mægnum;
and swaþeah næs genoh þam seocan bedrydan þæt he hal up arise, ac
het hyne þa gyt beran his legerbedd, and eac gan þanon.
 195. Ber þin legerbed, þæt is, beo geþyldig, and forber
þine nextan, swa swa þu betst mæge, teonfullan dæda oþþe word,
Swa swa se apostol Paulus cwæð on sumum pistole: <foreign>Alter alterius onera
portate, et sic adimplebitis legem Christi</foreign>: Berað, ic bidde, eowre byrþena
eow betwynan, and ge swa gefyllað soþlice Cristes æ; þis belycð
ægðer ge lufe ge hatunge.
 203. Ure ælc sceal mid lufe oðrum fylstan, and eac ure
yfelnysse us betwynan forberan, þæt Godes æ on us swa beo gefylled.
 206. Soðlice Cristes æ is seo soþe lufu, and seo ne byð
gefylled buton we swa don þæt we ure byrþena beron us betwynan.
 209. Crist het hine gan, þæt is on godra weorca stapum
forðstæppan, and ne standan idel.
 211. He bær þa his bed bliþelice gangende, and þa
Iudeiscan ceorodon for ðam Sæternesdæge, þone hi miclum wurþodon
æfter moyses æ, for þan þe se ælmihtiga God ealle þing gesceop,
gesewenlice and ungesewenlice, ealle on six dagum, and on þone seofoðan
geswac his weorces, and þone dæg gehalgode, and het on his æ syþþan
þone dæg freolsian, for þære digelan getacnunge Cristes þrowunge,
swa swa hit cuþ wearð syþþan.
 220. God gesceop his gesceafta on syx dagum ealle, and geswac on
þone seofoþan, swa þæt he syþþan ne gesceop nane oþre gesceafta,
ac þa sylfan geedniwað on mannum and on nytenum mihtiglice oþ þis.
 223. He gesceop þa twegen men, and ealle tida gesette, ac he ne
gesceop na syþþan seldcuþe gesceafta, of þam ealdan dihte þe he æt
fruman gesette; ac he gescipð ælce dæge edniwe sawla, and on lichaman
geliffæst, swa swa we leorniað on bocum, and þa sawla ne beoð
nahwær gesceapene ær þan þe God hi asent to þam gesceapenan
lichaman/ on heora moddra innoþum, and hi swa men wurþað.
 232. Nu ge magon tocnawan þæt ure sawla ne cumað of fæder
ne of meder, ac se heofonlica Fæder gescipð þone lichaman and hine
geliffæst mid sawle; and he ealle gesceafta geedniwað symble, ge on fixum
ge on fugelum ge on feðerfetum nytenum, for ðam ðe þa ærran for ylde
ateoriaþ; and he gewissað þas woruld mid welwillendum dihte, þeah ðe
ure yfelnys him oft abelge, and we þonne swingla for urum synnum
þrowiaþ.
 241. Nu smeagað menn for oft hwær hit eal becume þe fram
Adame wæs oð ðis gesceapen, ac hi nyton þæt se ælmihtiga micel
wile habban into his heofonlican rice, swa swa him gerisan mæg, þæt he
micclum werode mihtiglice rixige; and eac ealles to fela forfaraþ þurh
synna.
 247. Se ylca restendæg, swa swa we ræddan lyttle ær,
getacnode þone dæg þe ure Drihten forðfaren on byrgenne læg for
ure alysednysse, and geswac þæra wundra þe he worhte on his life, and on
þam Sunnandæge aras of deaþe gesund, and is nu se Sunnandæg
syþþan gehalgod þurh ures Drihtnes ærist, þe on þam dæge aras,
and we hine wurþiað Gode to wyrðmynte, and syþþan geswac þæs
Sæternesdæges freols.
 256. On þam ealdan restendæge, þe we ær embe spræcon,
ne worhton þa Iudei nan þeowtlic weorc, and se an getacnode eal ure lif,
þe is gastlic ræstendæg, on þam we Gode sceolon symle þeowian, and
synna forbugan, þe synd þeowtlice weorc, and on þeowte gebringað heora
wyrcendras a to worulde.
 263. Þa Iudeiscan freolsodon þone foresædan restendæg,
and oft bemændon þa ða men wæron gehælede on þam dæge fram
urum Hælende.
 266. Þa axode he hi on sumne sæl be sumum wæterseocum men
hwæðer he on þam freolsdæge þe hi swa freolice wurðedon moste
beon gehæled fram þam micclan broce.
 269. Hi suwodon þa ealle, and se Hælend sona þone
wæterseocan gehælde on heora gesihþum, and axode hi syþþan, swylce
mid bigspelle, Hwæt la, nelle ge, gif hwylceowres assa fylþ, oððe oxa,
on pyt, ardlice hine up ateon on þam halgan ræstendæge?
 274. And hi þa ne mihton nan þing him geandwyrdan, for þan
þe hi wæron oferswyþde.
 276. Se gehæleda mann gemette þone Hælend syþþan on
þam temple, and he him sæde þas word: Nu þu eart gehæled, geheald
þe wið synna, þæt þe sum þing ne gelimpe on þinum life wyrse.
 280. Mid þam he geswutelode þæt he for synnum wæs
gebrocod, ac swaþeah ne beoð ealle untrume for synnum geswencte, þeah
þe hi sume beon.
 283. Sume beoþ geuntrumode þæt hi þe eadmodran beon, sume
for fandunge, sume for Godes wundrum, for þan þe Godes domas swiðe digle
sint, and æfre rihtwise on eallum his dædum.
 287. Se gehæleda man þa, syþþan he þone Hælend
gespræc, cydde þam Iudeiscum þæt Crist hine gehælde, and hine
mærsode, his mihte herigende.
 290. Þam sy wuldor on ecnysse mid his ælmihtigan Fæder and
þam Halgan Gaste on anre Godcundnysse, AMEN.

ÆHom 3
B1.4.3.
Feria VI in secunda ebdomada Quadragesimae: Pope 1967-8, I, 248-56.



 1. Ure Drihten sæde oft swiðe digle bigspell; þa on sumne
sæl sæde he þis bigspel his leorningcnihtum and þam geleafleasum
Iudeiscum: Sum hiredes ealdor wæs, þe het settan wineard, and hine
behegode, and het delfan þærinne ane winwringan, and worhte anne stypel,
and betæhte þone wineard his tilium syððan, and ferde on
ælþeodignysse to fyrlenum lande.
 9. Eft þa ða þæs wineardes wæstmas genealæhton, þa
sende he his þeowan to ðam foresædum tilium, þæt hi underfengon
þæs wineardes wæstmas.
 12. Þa gelæhton þa tilian heora hlafordes þeowan, and
sumne beswungon, sumne eac ofslogon, sumne oftorfedon soðlice mid stanum.
 15. Eft se hlaford syððan sende oðre þeowan, micele ma him
to, and þa manfullan tilian dydon sona embe hi swa swa embe þa oðre.
 18. He sende þa æt nextan his sunu to, and cwæð, Hi
wyllað forwandian witodlice minne sunu.
 20. Þa tilian þa gesawon þone sunu, and cwædon, þes ys
se yrfenuma; uton hine ofslean, and his yrfweardnyss ure byð syððan.
 23. Hi gelæhton þone sunu þa and gelæddon of þam
winearde and hine ofslogon.
 24. Hwæt secgce ge, hu deð þæs wineardes hlaford embe
þa wælhreowan tilian, þonne he cymð him to?
 26. Þa cwædon þa Iudeiscan, þa yfelan tilian he yfele
fordeð, and betæcð his wineard oðrum tilium syððan, þe him
wæstmas agyfað on gewissum timan.
 30. Se Hælend him sæde þa be þam hyrnstane þus: Ne
rædde ge on bocum be þam hyrnstane, þone þa weallwyrhtan aworpen
hæfdon, þæt se is geworht on ðæs wealles hyrnan?
 34. Þys ys þurh God gedon, and hyt ys wundorlic on eowrum
gesihþum, and ic secge eow forþi þæt Godes rice byð eow ætbroden,
and byð þære þeode geseald þe him syllað wæstmas, and se ðe
on þone stan fylþ, he byð tobrocen, and se ðe se stan offylþ, se
byð tocwysed.
 40. Hwæt þa bisceopealdras, þa þa hi þis bigspel
gehyrdon, and þa sunderhalgan sona oncneowon þæt he hit sæde be him,
and sohton him betwynan on heora sundorrununge hu hi hyne beræddon, ac hi
ondredon þa mænigu þe him mid wæs þa, for ðam ðe þæt folc
hæfde hine for witegan.
 46. We habbað anfealdlice gesæd eow nu þis godspell, and we
willað geopnian eow þæt andgyt nu, for ðam þe ge ne cunnon ealle
tocnawan þa digelnysse, buton man eow secge þæra snotera lareowa
trahtnunge be þam, swa swa hit on bocum stent.
 51. Se hiredes ealdor witudlice þe hæfde þone wineard is se
heofonlica God, þe hæfde gelogod þa Iudeiscan þeode on þam selestan
earde þysre worulde middan, and sette him æ, þæt hi hine ænne
æfre wurþian sceoldon mid halgum biggencgum, swa swa þa fif bec
tæhton þe Moyses him awrat, se mæra heretoga, þe fram Egipta lande
hi lædde to ðam earde, and hi ana þa hæfdon andgyt embe God, and
ealle oðre þeoda þeowdon deofolgyldum.
 61. Þa het God hi oft þurh his halgan witegan wineardes naman,
for þam ðe hi wyrcan sceoldon gode wæstmas Gode, swa swa god wineard.
 64. Be þam winearde cwæð se witega Isaias: Ic abad þæt
min wineard bære me wæstmas, and he þa forðbrohte abroðene berian;
nu æteowe ic eow hwæt ic þam winearde do: Ic tobrece his hege, and him
fram abrede, and hyne man toberð and tobryt hys wæstmas; ic towurpe his
weal and he byð fortreden; ic hine aweste, and he ne byð gescreadod
oððe bedolfen, ac him deriað bremelas þe him on weaxað, and wilde
þornas, and ic eac beode þam uplicum wolcnum þæt hi nænne renscur
him on ne rinon.
 76. Godes wineard soðlice is Israhela hiwræden, and ic abad
heora þæt hi worhton dom, and efne hi worhton unrihtwisnysse.
 79. Rihtwisnysse ic abad, and hi worhton hream: þis sæde se
witega be þam ungesæligum Iudeum.
 81. Þone wineard he behegode, þæt is Israhela folc, mid
mærlicum burgum, and mid engla hyrdrædena.
 83. Se stypel þe he getimbrode, þæt wæs þæt
stænene tempel þe se snotera Salomon gesette on Hierusalem mid wundorlicum
cræfte, to wurðmynte Gode, and seo winwringe getacnode þæt weofud
þær wiðinnan, on þam man offrode Gode on ða ealdan wisan
mænigfealde lac mid geleafan symle.
 89. God betæhte þone wineard þam wisum bocerum and þam
Sunderhalgum þe heoldon his æ, þæt hi him wæstmas ageafon godra
weorca, and he ferde syððan on fyrlenne wræcsið.
 93. Manega þær geþugon of ðam mancynne Gode, þeah þe
hi sume ungesælige wæron, and Crist forsawon, and eac besyrwdon.
 96. He cidde eac him, and on sumne sæl cwæð, Wa eow bocerum
and eow Sunderhalgum, ge hiweras þe heofonan rice ætforan mannum
belucað, and ge sylfe in ne farað, ne þam ne geðafiað þe in faran
woldon.
 101. Ge teoðiað eowre wyrta, and witudlice forlætað þa
maran beboda þe eow bebyt seo æ, rihtne dom and geleafan, and
mildheortnysse weorc.
 104. Þas þing gedafenode soðlice to donne, and eac þa
oðre na to forlætene.
 106. Lytle ær we sædon þæt se hlaford ferde on fyrlene
wræcsið syððan he þone wineard betæhte.
 108. Ne færð God swaðeah feorr ahwyder aweg, se ðe on
ælcere stowe hys andweardnysse cyð; ac he let þone wineard on heora
gewealde, and let hi habban cyre agenes willan, and hi na ne nydde on naðre
healfe, for ðam ðe ælc man hæfð agenne cyre hwæt he lufige on
his lifes timan.
 115. Se hiredes ealdor sende, swa swa we sædon ær, his men to
ðam winearde, wolde hys wæstmas habban, for ðam ðe se heofonlica God
him sende gelome to heahfæderas and witegan, wolde hi gerihtlæcan, ac
þa Iudei ofslogon sume of þam witegum, and sume beswungon, swa swa us
segð þis godspell, and sume hi stændon mid stiðre reðnysse.
 122. He sende eft ma þeowan to ðam manfullan tilian, and hi swa
him þenedon swa swa þam oðrum.
 124. He sende þa æt nextan hys agenne sunu to, for ðam ðe
se ælmihtiga God swa mildheort wæs us þæt he his agenne Sunu asende
of heofonum mancyn to alysenne, and þa manfullan Iudei swa dyrstige wæron
þæt hi dorston hine acwellan, and Crist swa alysde þa ðe gelyfað on
hyne, and he ne wiðerode na ongean, ac wæs gehyrsum hys Fæder, for
ðære micclan lufe þe he to mancynne hæfð, þæt he sylfwilles
sealde hys lif for us.
 133. He cwæð to ðam Iudeiscum, Hwæt deð þæs
hiredes ealdor be þæs wineardes tilium?
 134. And hi ne wendon þa gyt þæt hi hyt sylfe wæron, and
sædon him to andsware, þa yfelan tilian he yfele fordeð, and betæcð
his wineard oðrum tilium syððan, þe him wæstmas agyfað on gewissum
timan.
 139. Rihtlice hi demdon heora agenne dom.
 140. Soðlice gyf hi wiston þæt hi hyt sylfe wæron, noldon
hi andwyrdan swa amberlice be þam.
 142. Witodlice se hyrnstan þe se Hælend foresæde, þe hylt
þa twegen weallas, ys se Hælend sylf, þe gefegde togædere of twam
folcum hys cyrcan, manega of Iudeiscum and ma of hæðenum folce, to anre
gelaþunge on soðum geleafan.
 147. Manega ætspurnað mid mislicum synnum æt þam
hyrnstane, ac hi habbað forgyfennysse, þa ðe mid dædbote heora Drihten
gladiað.
 150. Oþer is þæt man fealle uppon þone stan, and oðer is
þæt se stan uppon hyne fealle.
 152. Se fylþ uppon þone stan, se ðe syngað on Crist, and se
ðe Criste wiðsæcð, se stan fylþ uppon hyne, and hine ealne tocwyst
on þam ecum witum.
 155. He cwæð þa æt nextan, swa swa we cwædon ær,
þæt Godes rice byð eow ætbroden, and byð þære þeode geseald
þe him syllað wæstmas.
 158. Him is soðlice ætbroden seo boclice lar, and eall seo
deopnyss þe be Drihtne sprycð, and is geopenad eallum Cristenum þe hine
wurðiað mid weorcum and geleafan.
 162. Hwæt þa bisceopealdras, þa ða hi þis bigspel
gehyrdon, and þa Sundorhalgan sona oncneowon þæt he hit sæde be him,
and sohton him betwynan on heora sundorrununge hu hi hyne beræddon, ac hi
ondredon þa mænigu þe him mid wæs þa, for ðam ðe þæt folc
hæfde hine for witegan.
 168. Þeah þe hi heardheorte wæron and hetole on mode, and
noldon/ gelyfan on þone lifigendan Crist, þeah hi oncneowon þæt he
cwæð be him þa larlican bigspel, and gebulgon hi sona, and woldon hine
besyrwan, gyf hi wiston hu for þære mæniu þe him mid ferdon, and his
lare gehyrdon, and his wundra gesawon, and hyne wurðedon swa swa mærne
witegan.
 176. Ure geleafa is mara þonne þære mænigu wære, for
ðam ðe we gelyfað on ðæs lifigendan Godes Sunu, þæt he wæs
æfre God mid his þam ecan Fæder, and þam Halgan Gaste, on heofona
rice wunigende, and wæs man geworden þa ða he sylf wolde for ure
alysednysse, þæs we him æfre þanciað.
 182. Uton smeagan nu georne þæt we sume wæstmas godra
weorca Gode agyfan, and mid urum geleafan hine æfre wurþian, þæt we
mid þam Hælende habban þæt ece lif, swa swa he behet þam ðe hyne
lufiað; þam si wuldor and lof on ecere worulde, amen.

ÆHom 4
B1.4.4.
Dominica III in Quadragesima: Pope 1967-8, I, 264-80.



 1. On þæræ mæran tide þe se mildheorta Hælend
wunode mid mannum on soðre menniscnysse, wundra wyrcende, þa wearð him
gebroht to sum witseoc man, wundorlice gedreht; him wæs soðlice benæmed
his gesihð and spræc, and he swa dumb and ablend deoflice wedde.
 7. Hwæt þa se mildheorta Crist þurh his godcundan mihte
þone mann gehælde, and ðone hetelan deofol him fram adræfde þe hine
drehte oð ðæt, and he þa, gewittig, wel spræc and gehyrde, and eall
seo meniu micclum þæs wundrode.
 12. Þa sædon þa Iudeiscan þæt ure Drihten sceolde þa
wundra wyrcan on þæs deofles mihte þe men hataþ Beelzebub, ac hi lugon
forðearle.
 15. Sume hi woldon eac þæt he sum syllic tacen of heofonum
æteowde, ac he cwæþ him to, þa ða he geseah heora syrwiendan
geþohtas: ælc cynerice þe bið on him sylfum todæled bið soðlice
toworpen, and ne wunaþ na on sibbe, and hiwræden fealð ofer
hiwrædene.
 21. Gif se sceocca soðlice is on him sylfum todæled, hu mæg
þonne standan his rice staþolfæst?
 23. Ge secgaþ þæt ic adræfde deofla of mannum þurh
ðæs deofles mihte þe menn hataþ Beelzebub, and gif ic on his naman
adræfe deofla of mannum, on hwæs naman adræfaþ eowre suna þonne?
 27. Þis sæde se Hælend be his apostolum, þe wæron
heora suna and heora siblingas, and hi deofla adræfdon on heora Drihtnes
naman, and fela wundra worhton on ðæs folces gesihðe.
 31. Ða cwæþ se Hælend to þam heardheortum folce:
Witodlice gif ic aflyge on Godes fingre deofla, Godes rice becymð soðlice
on eow.
 34. Ðonne se stranga healt his inburh fæste, þonne beoð on
sibbe þa ðing þe he sylf hæfð.
 36. Ac gif sum strengra cymð and hine oferswið, ealle his
wæpna he gewinð þonne on þam ðe he truwode, and todælð his
herereaf.
 39. Se þe nys mid me, he bið ongean me, and se þe mid me ne
gaderaþ, he towyrpð soðlice.
 41. Þonne se unclæna gast gæþ ut of ðam men, þonne
færð he worigende on unwæterigum stowum secende him reste, ac he
soðlice ne fint.
 44. Þonne cweþ se fula gast þæt he faran wylle into his
huse, of þam ðe he ut ferde, and cymþ ðonne to, and afint hit
gedæft.
 47. He genimð him þonne to seofan oðre gastas wyrsan þonne
he sylf sy, and hi wuniaþ mid þam men, and bið þæs mannes wise wyrse
þonne hit ær wære.
 50. Mid þam ðe he þis clypode, þa cwæþ him sum wif to
of þære menigo mid micelre stemne: Eadig is se innoð þe ðe to mannum
gebær, and gesælige syndon þa breost þe þu gesuce.
 54. Hire andwyrde se Hælend: Gyt synd eadigran þa ðe Godes
word gehyrað and hit gehealdaþ.
 56. We gegaderiað þæt andgyt to þisum godspelle be þam
twam godspellerum, Lucam and Matheum, and we wyllað sceortlice secgan eow
þæt andgit.
 59. Ure Drihten gehælde þa þurh his heofonlican mihte þone
earmann wodan fram his wodnysse, and fram his dumbnysse þæs deoflican
bendas, and fram þæræ blindnysse þe hine ablende se deofol, and eall
seo meniu micclum þæs wundrode.
 64. Dæghwamlice he wyrcþ ðas ylcan wundra gyt, æfter
gastlicum andgite, on Godes gelaþunge, on soðre gecyrrednysse synfulra
manna.
 67. Þonne se ungeleaffulla þe læg on his synnum gebihþ to
his Drihtne mid soþre dædbote, and ðone deofol forlæt þe hine
forlædde on ær, þonne bið he geclænsod fram þam unclænan
gaste, and hæfð þæs geleafan leoht, and herað his Drihten.
 72. Þa sædon þa Iudeiscan þæt ure Drihten sceolde þa
wundra wyrcan on þæs deofles naman þe men hatað Beelzebub, ac hi lufon
forðearle.
 75. Hwilon ær we sædon be þisum sceandlican deofle.
 76. Ða hæþenan leoda gelyfdon on hine and heton hine Beel,
sume Baal, and se ylca hæfde yfelne tonaman, þæt is Zebub, for
ðære sceandlican offrunge.
 80. Ða hæþenan him offrodon swa swa healicum gode sceap and
hryðeru, and ofslogon þa; þa gewunedon þær fleogan to þære
fulan offrunge, and his bigengas þa hine heton Beelzebub, þæt is
fleogena Bel, oððe se ðe fleogan hæfð, for þan ðe zebub is
gesæd fleoge.
 86. Nu sædon ða Iudeiscan, urum Drihtne to teonan, þæt he
sceolde adræfan deofla of mannum on ðises godes naman, þe is gramlic
deofol, and næfð nane mihte menn to gehælenne.
 90. Sume hi woldon eac þæt he sum syllic tacen of heofonum
æteowde, ac hi his fandodon swa.
 92. Þa Iudeiscan gesawon swutele tacna on þam wodan men þe
ðær wæs gehæled, and swaþeah woldon wundra geseon ufon of
heofonum, mid ungeleaffulnysse fandiende Cristes, ac he cwæþ him to, þa
ða he geseah heora syrwigendan geþohtas: ælc cynerice þe bið on him
sylfum todæled bið soðlice toworpen, and ne wunað na on sibbe, and
hiwræden fealð ofer hiwrædene.
 101. Gif se woruldlica cyning winð wið his leoda, and þa
leoda wiðeriað wið heora cynehlaford, þonne cymð heora sacu him to
aworpennysse, and þæt cynerice bið raðe swa toworpen, and gif þæs
hiredes hlaford hatað his cnihtas and him onwinnende bið, hi wurþaþ
sona totwæmede.
 107. Ða cwæþ se Hælend him to be þam hetelan deofle
þus: Gif se sceocca soðlice is on him sylfum todæled, hu mæg þonne
standan his rice staðolfæst?
 110. Nele nan deofol adræfan oðerne, ac hi ealle syrwiað mid
heora searucræftum mid anrædum mode hu hi men beswicon to hellicum
suslum, þær ðær hi sylfe wuniað, and heora rice is on þam reþum
witum æfter Domesdæge a butan ende.
 116. Ge secgaþ þæt ic adræfe deofla of mannum þurh
ðæs deofles mihte þe menn hatað Beelzebub, and gif ic on his naman
adræfe deofla of mannum, on hwæs naman adræfað eowre suna þonne?
 120. Þis sæde se Hælend be his apostolum, ðe wæron
heora suna and heora siblingas, and hi deofla adræfdon on heora Drihtnes
naman, and fela wundra wrohton on þæs folces gesihðe.
 124. <foreign>Ideo ipsi iudices uestri erunt</foreign>: Forþam ða ylcan beoð
eft eowre deman.
 126. Þa halgan apostolas þe þam Hælende folgodon on
soðre lare sceolon eft beon ealles manncynnes deman on þam micclan dæge,
ge þæra Iudeiscra ge oðra leoda, þeah ðe hi comon of þam yfelan
cynne þe Criste wiðsoc and eac swilce ofsloh.
 132. Ða cwæþ se Hælend to þam heardheortum folce:
Witodlice gif ic aflige on Godes fingre deofla, Godes rice becymð soðlice
on eow.
 135. Godes finger soðlice getacnode þone Halgan Gast, swa swa
Matheus awrat, þisum wordum cweþende: <foreign>Si in spiritu Dei eicio demones</foreign>:
Gif ic on Godes Gaste deofla adræfe.
 139. Þes finger oferswiðde soðlice þa drymen on Egipta
lande ætforan Farao, þa ða hi wunnon wið Moysen and God, woldon wyrcan
gnættas, ac God him forwyrnde; and hi ða oferswiðde sædon openlice:
<foreign>digitus Dei est hoc</foreign>: ðis is Godes finger.
 145. Mid þisum fingre wæron eac swilce awritene Moyses tabulan
on þam munte Syna; on ðam tabolum wæron tyn word awritene, þæt is
seo ealde æ, eallum mannum to steore, ge þam ealdan folce ge us þe nu
syndon.
 150. Godes hand soðlice is ure Hælend Crist, þurh ðone he
gesceop ealle gesceafta, and Godes finger is witodlice se Halga Gast, þurh
ðone adræfde ure Drihten ða deofla, and þurh ðone syndon
geliffæste ealle lybbende gesceaftu, and ðurh ðone se halga Fæder his
halgum todælð menigfealde gyfa and micele mihta, and þurh þone
witegodon ealle witegan be Criste.
 158. Nis us nan lim swa gewylde to gehwilcum weorce swa us syndon
ure fingras, and forði is gehaten se Halga Gast Godes finger for þam
menigfealdum gifum þe God gifð his halgum þurh ðone Halgan Gast, be
þam þe him gewyrð.
 163. Ne sceal nan mann wenan, ne on his mode wealcan, þæt ure
Hælend sy on his heofonlican mihte læsse þonne his Fæder for ðan
ðe he is gehaten Godes hand on bocum; ac he is God ælmihtig, and se Halga
Gast is on ðam heofonlican þrymme æfre ælmihtig God on anre
Godcundnysse mid þam halgan Fæder and þam Hælende Criste, hi ðry an
ælmihtig God æfre rixiende, and heora rice ne bið næfre todæled
ne næfre toworpen, ac wunað a on ecnysse.
 173. <foreign>Profecto peruenit in uos regnum Dei</foreign>: Witodlice Godes rice
becymð on eow.
 175. Crist sylf is Godes rice, swa swa he cwæþ on oðre
stowe: <foreign>Regnum Dei intra uos est</foreign>: þæt is on Englisc, Godes rice is
betweox eow.
 178. Godes rice is eac Godes gelaþung, þæt is eall Cristen
folc þe on Crist gelyfð, and he hi gebringð eac to ðam heofonlican
rice, ge of Iudeiscum cynne þe on Crist gelyfdon, ge of oðrum leodscipum
þe his geleafan healdað.
 183. Þonne se stranga healt his inburh fæste, þonne beoð
on sibbe þa ðing þe he sylf hæfð.
 185. Ac gif sum strengra cymð and hine oferswið, ealle his
wæpna he gewinð þonne on ðam ðe he truwode, and todælð his
herereaf.
 188. Deofol is se stranga þe ure Drihten embe spræc, ðe
hæfde eall manncynn on his andwealde þa ðurh Adames forgægednysse, ac
Godes Sunu com, strengra þonne he, and hine gewylde, and his wepna him
ætbræd and tobræc his searocræftas, and his herereaf todælde
þe he mid his deaðe alysde þa ða he Adam and Efan and heora ofspring
genam, swiðe micelne dæl, of þam manfullum deofle, and gelædde hi of
helle up to heofonan rice.
 197. <foreign>Qui non est mecum aduersum me est:</foreign> Se ðe nys mid me, he
bið ongean me, and se þe mid me ne gaderaþ, he towyrpð soðlice.
 200. Ures Drihtnes dæda and þæs deofles ne magon nateshwon
geþwærian ne beon gelice, for þan ðe se Hælend wyle us gehealdan
æfre, and se deofol wile us fordon gif he mæg.
 204. Crist tihð to mihtum symle and deofol to mandædum, ac we
sceolon gehyrsumian urum Hælende symle, þe is ure hyrde, na þam hetelan
wulfe, þe þæs anes cepð, hu he us tostencge mid mislicum leahtrum fram
ðam mildan Hælende.
 209. Eac þa manfullan menn þe mistihtaþ oðre to deofollicum
weorcum wiðeriað ongean Crist, and mid him ne gaderiað, ac swiðor
towurpaþ.
 212. Ðonne se unclæna gast gæþ ut of þam men, þonne
færð he worigende on unwæterigum stowum, secende him reste, ac he
soðlice ne fint on þam clænheortum him gecweme wununge.
 216. He forlæt þa clænan mod þe Criste þeowiað, þa
ðe þurh syfernysse syndon unwæterige, and him reste secð on þam
receleasum, þe on oferflowednysse and fulnysse lybbað, swa swa ure Drihten
be þam deofle gecwæþ: <foreign>Sub umbra, inquit, dormit in secreto calami, et
locis humentibus</foreign>; ðæt is on urum gereorde, he gerest hine on sceadewe,
and on þæs reodes digolnysse, and on fuhtum stowum.
 224. Ðæs deofles rest bið on deorcum sceadewum for ðan
ðe he slæpþ on ðam sweartum ingehydum þe ðæs geleafan leoht on
heora life nabbað; and ða ðe þurh hiwunge beoð swa hole swa reod,
wiðutan scinende and wiðinnan æmtige, and þa ðe fuhtiende beoð on
fulre galnysse, on swilcum he macað symle his wununge.
 231. Se deofol bið adræfed þurh ures Drihtnes mihte of þam
hæþenan men þonne hine man fullað; þonne secð he gehwær him
sylfum wununge, ac he ne fint on þam clænum him gecweme wununge.
 235. Ðonne cweþ se fula gast þæt he faran wylle into his
huse of þam þe he ut ferde, into þam Cristenan men gif he his Cristendom
ne healt mid godum bigengum, swa swa he Gode behet: þæt he deofle
wiðsoce and his weorcum and getotum.
 240. He cymþ þonne to and afint hit aswapen, and eac swilce
æmtig and eall him gedæft.
 242. Se man bið geclænsod fram his unclænum synnum þurh
þæt halige fulluht on þæs Hælendes naman; ac gif he æmtig bið
æfter his fulluhte fram eallum godum weorcum, and ðurh hiwunge
gefrætewod þam fulan deofle, þonne genimð he him to seofan oðre
gastas wyrsan þonne he sylf sy, and hi wuniað mid þam men, and bið
ðæs mannes wise wyrse þonne hit ær wære.
 249. Ða seofon gastas syndon þa seofan heafodleahtras,
gyfernyss and forlir, gytsung and yrre, asolcennyss and unrotnyss, idelgylp,
and eahteoðe is modignyss.
 252. Gif ðas heafodleahtras habbað stede on þam menn, þonne
næfþ Godes gast nane wununge on him, ac he bið eall deofles gif he
geendaþ on ðam, and him wære selre þæt he soðlice ne cuðe
þære soðfæstnysse weg, þonne he sceolde abugan fram þære
soðfæstnysse to ðam sweartan deofle eft.
 258. Se Hælend cwæþ to þam heardheortum Iudeiscum: <foreign>Sic
erit et generationi huic pessime</foreign>: þus gewyrð witodlice þissere wyrstan
mægðe.
 261. Ða þa þæt Iudeisce folc underfeng Godes æ, þa
ferde se fula gast fram þam folce aweg; ac he cyrde eft to him mid þam
seofon heafodleahtrum þa ða hi Criste wiðsocon and to cwale gedydon, and
Godes æ swa awurpon þe witegode embe Crist, and heora wise wearð ða
wyrse þonne æror, for þan ðe hi wiðsocon þam soðfæstan
Hælende, mancynnes Alysend, and mislice hine tældon.
 269. Mid þan ðe he þis clypode, þa cwæþ him sum wif to
of þære menio mid micelre stemne: Eadig is se innoð þe ðe to mannum
gebær, and gesælige syndon þa breost þe ðu gesuce.
 273. Þurh ðises wifes stemne wurdon þa gescynde þa arleasan
Iudeiscan, Drihtnes wiðersacan, and heora geleafleast þurh hire geleafan.
 276. Eac þæra gedwolmanna þe dwelodon embe Crist, and
sædon þæt he nære on soðre menniscnysse, ealle heo oferswiðde
mid soðum geleafan, for ðan ðe se innoð wæs eadig soðlice þe
Godes Sunu abær, and ða breost þe he seac on his cildhade wæron
gesælige, swa swa heo sæde.
 282. Ðis wif getacnode untwylice mid wordum and mid anrædum
geleafan ealle Godes gelaþunge, þæt is eal Cristen folc þe on Crist nu
gelyfð, and ægþer ge mid mode ge mid muþe hine herað, on soðum
geleafan þone soðfæstan Hælend.
 287. Hire andwyrde se Hælend: Gyt syndon eadigran þa ðe
Godes word gehyrað and hit gehealdaþ.
 289. Eadig is Maria þæt arwyrðe mæden, þæt heo Godes
Sunu abær bliðe to mannum; ac heo is swaþeah git swyþor eadig, for
ðan ðe heo Godes word lufað and healt.
 293. Eac syndon eadige þa ealle þe gehyrað þæt halige
Godes word and hit healdað mid lufe.
 295. Uton herian urne Drihten, and þæt halige Godes word eac
swilce lufian and mid geleafan gehealdan.
 297. Ðæs us geunne se ælmihtiga Wealdend, se ðe a rixað
on ecnysse; amen.

ÆHom 5
B1.4.5.
Feria VI in tertia ebdomada Quadragesimae: Pope 1967-8, I, 288-300.



 1. Se godspellere Iohannes sæde on þysum godspelle þæt
Crist ure Hælend, þa þa he her on life wæs, come on sumne sæl to
Samarian byrig, to ðæs heahfæderes wurþige þe wæs gehaten Iacob;
þone wurþig he forgeaf Iosepe his suna, and þær wæs se wæterpytt
þe ðær worhte Iacob.
 7. Se Hælend þa sæt þær, of ðam siðfæte werig,
wið ðone wæterpytt, and hit wæs þa middæg, and his discipuli
eodon into ðære byrig, þæt hi him mete bohton, and he abad þær
þa hwile.
 11. Þa com þær betwux þam of Samarian byrig an wif to
ðam wæterscipe, wolde wæter feccan, and se Hælend hyre cwæð to,
Syle me drincan.
 14. Þæt wif him cwæð to andsware, Hwi wilt þu me
þæs biddan, þonne þu eart Iudeisc, and ic Samaritanisc wif?
 16. Nellað þa Iudeiscan mid nanum Samaritaniscum etan oððe
drincan.
 17. Hyre andwyrde se Hælend, Gyf þu cuþest Godes gyfe, and
wistest hwa þe cwæð to, Syle me drincan, wen ys þæt þu bæde
hine and he wolde þe syllan of þam liflican wætere.
 21. Þæt wif him cwæð þa to, þes wæterpyt ys deop,
and þu hlædfæt næfst; hwanon hæfst þu liflic wæter?
 23. Eart þu la furðor þonne ure fæder Iacob, þe us
þysne pyt forgeaf?
 24. And he sylf þærof dranc, and hys bearn and nytenu.
 25. Hyre andwyrde se Hælend, ælcum þæra þyrst eft þe
of þysum wætere drincð, and þam ne þyrst on ecnysse þe of þam
wætere drincð þe ic him sylle, ac hit soðlice wyrð wylspring on him
ræsendes/ wæteres to ðam ecan life.
 30. Him andwyrde þæt wif, Hlaford, syle me of þysum
liflican wætere, þæt me heonon forð ne þyrste, ne ic her ne þurfe
hladan.
 33. Þa cwæð se Hælend hyre to, Gang clypa þinne wer,
and cum hider þonne.
 34. Heo cwæð him to andsware, Næbbe ic nanne wer.
 35. Þa cwæð se Hælend, Wel þu cwæde, wif, næbbe
ic nanne wer; fif weras þu hæfdest, and þone þe þu nu hæfst, nis
se/ þin wer; þæt þu sædest soðlice.
 39. Þæt wif him cwæð þa to, Hlaford, ic geseo
þæt þu witega eart; and ure fæderas woldon on þysum munte hi
gebiddan, and ge secgað þæt on Hierusalem si seo stow þær þær
gedafenað to gebiddenne.
 44. Þa cwæð se Hælend hyre to, Wif, gelif þu me
þæt se tima cymð þonne ge eow ne gebiddað ne on þysum munte ne on
Hierusalem to ðam heofonlican Fæder: for ðam þe ge gebiddað
þæt ge nyton; we us gebiddað þæt we witon, for ðam þe se
hæl is of Iudeiscum folce; ac se tima cymð, and nu is soðlice, þonne
þa soðan biddendras gebiddað hi to ðam Fæder on gaste and on
soðfæstnysse, and God Fæder secð swilce biddendras þe him to
gebiddað.
 54. God soðlice is gast, and þam ðe him to gebiddað
gedafenað to gebiddanne on gaste and on soðfæstnysse.
 56. Þæt wif him cwæð þa to, Ic wat þæt us cymð
se ðe is gehaten Mæssias, þæt is Hælend Crist, and þonne he
cymð he cyð us ealle þing.
 59. Hyre andwyrde se Hælend, Ic hit eom þe þe to sprece.
 60. Mid þam þa comon Cristes leorningcnihtas, and hi wundrodon
þæt he to wifmenn spræc; heora nan swaþeah nolde befrinan hwæt
heo þær wolde, oððe hwæt he hire to spræce.
 64. Þæt wif þa forlet hyre wæterfæt þær, and eode
into ðære byrig, and to ðam burhwarum cwæð, Cumað and geseoð
soðlice þone man þe me ealle þa þing sæde þe ic æfre
gefremode; cweþe ge, la leof, hwæðer he sylf Crist sy.
 69. And seo burhwaru þa eode ut ardlice to him.
 70. Þa bædon his leorningcnihtas hine betwux þam,
cweþende, Ett, leof lareow.
 71. And he him andwyrde þus: Ic hæbbe mete to etenne þone
þe ge nyton.
 73. Hys discipuli þa sædon digellice him betwynan, Hwæðer
ænig man him brohte mete hider?
 75. Se Hælend him cwæð þa to, Min mete is soðlice
þæt ic þæs willan wyrce þe me hider asende þæt ic hys weorc
gefylle.
 77. La hu ne secge ge þæt feower monðas synt gyt ær
þam þe gerip cume?
 79. Efne ic secge eow, sceawiað þas eardas, for ðam þe hi
synd gearwe to geripe nu, and se þe ripð þæt gerip, se underfehþ
mede, and he gaderað wæstm into ðam ecan life, þæt hi samod
blission, se ðe sæwþ and se ðe ripð.
 84. On þam is soð word gecwæden, þæt oðer is se ðe
sæwð and oðer se ðe ripð.
 85. Ic sende eow to rippanne þæt þæt ge ne beswuncon;
oðre hit beswuncon, and ge ferdon in to heora geswincum.
 88. Of þære burhware þa Samarian byrig manega menn gelyfdon
on þone lifigendan Hælend for ðæs wifes gecyðnysse þe heo cydde
be him, þæt he hyre sæde swa hwæt swa heo gefremode.
 92. Þa þa seo burhwaru him com to, þa bædon hi hine georne
þæt he þær wunode, and he wunode þær twegen dagas, and micele ma
gelyfdon for hys mæran lare, and to ðam wife cwædon, þæt we for
þinre spræce ne gelyfað; we sylfe gehyrdon and soðlice witon þæt
þes is soðlice Hælend middaneardes.
 98. Langsum trahtnung belimpð to ðysum godspelle, and ge ne
magon undergytan ealle þa deopnysse buton man hit eow secge sceortum andgyte,
þe læs þe seo deopnys eow drecce to swiðe.
 102. Se hælend wæs werig, þeah þe hit wundorlic si.
 103. His heofonlica Fæder þurh hine gesceop ealle gesceafta
buton geswince; ne swanc se Fæder ne se Sunu naðor on þam micclan
weorce, ac Crist wæs werig swaþeah on þære menniscnysse, æfter
mannes gecynde, and his untrumnys is ure trumnys, his trumnys us gesceop,
and his untrumnyss us alysde.
 110. On þære sixtan tide he sæt werig æt þam pytte,
and on ðære syxtan ylde þysre worulde he com to middanearde mancynn to
alysenne.
 113. Þær com of Samarian byrig, swa swa we sædon eow ær,
þæt wif to þam Hælende, and heo hæfde getacnunge, for ðam þe
heo ælþeodig wæs fram Iudeiscum cynne, ealre þære Gelaþunge þe
on Criste nu gelyfð, of eallum leodscipum þe to geleafan bugon.
 118. Se Hælend bæd drincan, swa swa ge gehyrdon ær, æt
þam Samaritaniscan wife, for ðan ðe he gewilnode hire geleafan, þæt
heo gelyfde on hine, and þæt gedwyld forlete þæs deoflican bigengas
þæra hæþenra goda þæt hi oð ðæt wurðedon.
 123. Þa wundrode þæt wif þæt he wolde drincan of hyre
fæte, for ðam ðe þa Iudeiscan noldon næfre brucan nanes þinges
mid þam hæþenum, ne of heora fatum furðon næfre drincan, and hi
rihtlice swa dydon, for þam soðan biggenge þæs ælmihtigan Godes
þe hi on gelyfdon, þæt hi ne wurdon befylede þurh þa fulan
hæþenan.
 130. Crist cwæð to þam wife, gyf þu cuþest Godes gyfe;
Godes gyfu is se Halga Gast; soðlice þone Gast forgyfð God hys gecorenum,
swa þæt he him on wunað and gewissað hi symble to Godes willan and to
godum weorcum, and þæt ys þæt wæter þe he þam wife behet.
 136. And he cwæð be þam wætere þe wæs on þam
pytte, Ælcum þæra þyrst eft þe of þysum wætere drincð, and
þam ne þyrst on ecnysse þe of þam wætere drincð þe ic him sylle,
ac hit soðlice wyrð wylspring on him ræsendes wæteres to ðam ecan
life; and þæt is soðlice swa swa ure Hælend cwæð ær his
þrowunge: Ælcum þe þyrste cume to and drince.
 144. Se ðe gelyfð on me, swa swa gewritu secgað, of his
innoðe flowað liflices wæteres flod; þis sæde se Hælend be þam
Halgan Gaste, þe þa underfengon þe on hine gelyfdon.
 148. He is se liflica wylspring, and þam ðe he on wunað ne
þyrst on ecnysse, ac þæt ece lif him bið forgyfen on heofonan rice.
 151. Þæt wif nyste þa gyt hwilc wæter he mænde, and
cwæð, Hlafurd, syle me drincan of þysum liflican wætere, þæt me
heonon forð ne þyrste, ne ic her ne þurfe hladan.
 154. Heo wolde þa iu beon buton geswince, ac heo ne gehyrde þa
gyt hwæt se Hælend cwæð on sumre oðre stowe to his apostolum:
Cumað to me, ealle þe geswincað and gehefegode synd, and ic eow
gereordige.
 159. Ge ne magon understandan þa micclan deopnysse ealles þyses
godspelles, swa swa we ær sædon, and we forþi gescyrtað be sumum
dæle þysne traht.
 162. He cwæð to ðam wife, Wif, gelyf þu me þæt se
tima cymð þonne ge eow ne gebiddað ne on þysum munte ne on Hierusalem
to _am heofonlðam heofonlican Fæder: for ðam ðe ge gebiddað þæt
ge nyton; we us gebiddað þæt we witon, for ðam þe se hæl is of
Iudeiscum folce.
 168. Ac se tima cymð, and nu is soðlice, þonne þa soðan
biddendras gebiddað hi to ðam Fæder on gaste and on soðfæstnysse,
and God Fæder secð swilce biddendras þe him to gebiddað.
 172. God soðlice is gast, and þam ðe him to gebiddað
gedafenað to gebiddenne on gaste and on soðfæstnysse.
 174. Nu ne þurfe we astigan to sticolum muntum mid earfoðnysse,
us to gebiddanne, swilce God si gehendor on þam hean munte þonne on
þære dene, for hyre deopnysse.
 178. Se heaga munt getacnað þa heagan modignysse, and seo dene
eadmodnysse, þe ure Drihten lufað, and we sceolon us gebiddan mid soðre
eadmodnysse, gyf we willað þæt us gehyre se heofonlica God, se ðe on
heannysse wunað, and behylt þa eadmodan, and byð symble gehende þam
ðe mid soðfæstnysse him to clypiað on heora gedrefednysse.
 185. Ne we ne þurfon secan ofer sæ ne ofer land, mid widgilre
worunge, þone welwillendan God, þone þe þæt arfæste mod mid him
æfre hæfð_and he bið æfre anweard eallum weldondum on ælcum
lande þær hys geleafa byð.
 190. Witodlice þa Iudeiscan þe þa wurþedon God gebædon
hi to Gode binnan þam temple, and Crist cwæð to þam wife, we us
gebiddað þæt we witon, for þam þe se hæl is of Iudeiscum folce.
 194. Se hæl ys soðlice ure Hælend Crist, se ðe of
Iudeiscum cynne com of Marian, þe wæs þæs cynecynnes, and þone
Kyning gebær heofonan and eorðan to ure alysednysse.
 198. Þyss wiston þa witegan þe hit witegodon toweard, and of
þam cynne comon Cristes apostoli, and manega oðre, þe æfter his
æriste heora æhte beceapodon, and eall þæt wurð ledon æt
ðæra apostola fotum, and folgodon Criste buton gytsunge, and heora
bigleofa wæs gemæne him eallum mid þam apostolum.
 205. Þæt wif cwæð to Criste, Ic wat þæt Mæssias
cymð, se ðe ys Crist gecweden; and he cwæð to hire, Ic hit eom þe to
ðe sprece; and þa comon his leorningcnihtas.
 208. Messias on Ebreisc, Christus on Grecisc, unctus on Leden, ys
on Englisc gesmyrod; þæt ys ure Hælend, þe mid þam Halgan Gaste
wæs on þære menniscnysse mihtiglice gesmyrod mid seofonfealdre gyfe,
swa swa us sæde se witega Isaias on his witegunge, þa þa he wrat be
Criste.
 214. Þæt wif forlet þa sona hyre wæterfæt þær
standan, and efste to ðære byrig and bodade ymbe crist.
 216. Mid þam þe heo gehyrde of þæs Hælendes muþe, Ic
hit eom, se ðe to ðe sprece, þa efste heo swiðe ham to ðære byrig,
and began to bodienne þam burhwarum embe Crist.
 220. Heo forlet hyre wæterfæt, þe hæfde getacnunge
woruldlicre gewilnunge, and wearð þa bydel, and cydde soðfæstnysse
þam ceastergewarum, and manega þa gelyfdon on þone lifigendan Hælend
þurh þæs wifes gecyðnysse þe heo cydde be him.
 225. Þa bædon his leorningcnihtas hine betwux þam, þus
cweþende: Ett, leof lareow; and he him andwyrde þus; Ic hæbbe mete to
etanne þone þe ge nyton.
 228. Her ge magon gehyran þæt ure Hælend æt, þonne his
leorningcnihtas hine laðedon to mete, þeah þe sum mæssepreost, þe we
meldian nellað, ætsoce mid gedwylde þæt ure Drihten ne æte
næfre on þysum life, ac he leah forþearle.
 233. He ne cuðe na þa Cristes boc þe us cyð ymbe þæt,
þæt ure Hælend æte swa swa oðre men doð, ge ær his þrowunge
ge æfter his æriste.
 236. He æt soðlice and dranc, for ðam ðe he soð man
wæs; he æt buton gyfernysse and dranc buton druncennysse, and eall his
lif wæs gelogod buton synnum, and nan leahter næfde nænne stede on
him.
 240. He cwæð, Min mete is þæt ic þæs willan wyrce
þe me hider asende þæt ic his weorc gefylle.
 242. Hys gastlica mete ys mancynnes alysednyss, and him þyrste on
þam wife hyre geleafan, and he symble gewilnað urre sawla hælu, and his
Fæder willan he worhte þa, þa he þa burhware gebigde to geleafan.
 247. He cwæð, Ic secge eow, sceawiað þas eardas, for ðam
ðe hi synd gearwe to geripe nu, and se ðe ripð þæt gerip, se
underfecð mede, and he gaderað wæstm into þam ecan life, þæt hi
samod blission, se ðe sæwð and se ðe ripð.
 252. On þam is soð word gecweden, þæt oþer is se ðe
sæwð, and oðer se ðe ripð; ic sende eow to ripanne þæt þæt
ge ne beswuncon; oðre hyt beswuncon, and ge ferdon in to heora geswincum.
 256. Þa heahfæderas and þa witegan þe embe þone
Hælend cyddon, þa wæron þa sæderas þe seowon Godes lare, and
þæt gelyfede folc þe þa gelyfde on God wæs þæt gerip soðlice
þæt Crist embe sæde, and þa apostoli wæron witodlice þa rifteras
þe þæt gerip gaderodon into Godes berne heofonan rices, þær hi
gehealdene beoð, þæt hi samod blission, þa sæderas and þa
rifteras, on þære ecan blisse for heora geswince.
 265. Soðlice ure Hælend þurh hine sylfne eft and þurh his
apostolas and heora æftergengan seow þa godspellican lare and geleafan on
his folce, and þæt sæd nu wyxt oþ þysre worulde geendunge,
gemenced wið coccel, þæt synd þa manfullan þe betwux þam gelyfedum
lybbað her on worulde.
 271. Englas beoð þa rifteras_ þa rifteras on ende þysre
worulde, swa swa Crist sylf sæde on sumon his godspella, and hi gaderiað
onsundron þa synfullan menn, and þa ðe unrihtwisnysse worhton on heora
life, and wurpað hi gebundenne into þam byrnendan fyre, þær bið wop
and wanung on ealra worulda woruld.
 277. Þonne scinað þa rihtwisan, swa swa sunne deð nu, on
heora Fæder rice; þis sæde se Hælend.
 279. Seo burhwaru gelyfde, swa swa we sædon ær, ærest
þurh þæt wif; and eft, þa þa hi comon to Criste sylfum þær
þær he sæt, þa bædon hi þæt he wunode þær sume hwile,
and he him getiþode, and twegen dagas þær wunode, lærende þæt
folc, oððæt hi gelyfdon fullice, and to ðam wife cwædon þe him
cydde ær be him, We ne gelyfað nu þurh þine gecyðnysse; we sylfe
gehyrdon and to soðan witon þæt þes ys Hælend soþlice
middaneardes.
 289. On þone we eac gelyfað, se ðe alysde us.
 290. Si him wuldor and lof a to worulde, amen.
