ÆHom 6
B1.4.6.
Feria VI in quarta ebdomada Quadragesimae: Pope 1967-8, I, 311-29.



 1. On þam halgan godspelle þe ge gehyrdon nu rædan us segð
be Lazare, þe seoc læg þa he wæs on Bethaniawic wuniende þa, and
wæs Marðan broðor and Marian soðlice, and þæt wæs seo Maria
þe mid micelre arwurðnysse mid deorwurðre sealfe urne Drihten smyrode,
and mid hyre fexe wipode hys fet.
 8. Þa ða he seoc læg, þa sændon his geswustra to þam
Hælende sona, secgende mid sarnysse, La leof hlaford, þone þe þu
lufast/ ys nu geuntrumod.
 11. He him andwyrde and cwæð: Nis þeos untrumnyss na to
deaðe, ac for Godes wuldre, þæt Godes Sunu sy gewuldrod þurh hine.
 14. Se Hælend lufode soðlice Marthan, and Marian hire swuster,
and Lazarum heora broþur, and þa þa he geaxode be him þæt he
geuntrumod wæs, þa wunode he twegen dagas on þære ylcan stowe, and
æfter þam cwæð to his leorningcnihtum, Uton faran nu eft to Iudea
lande.
 21. Þa cwædon his leorningcnihtas,La leof lareow, nu for
feawum dagum sohton þa Iudeiscan þe to stænenne, and þu eft nu wylt
þyder ongean faran?
 24. And he him andwyrde, La hu næfð se dæg twelf tida on
him?
 26. And se ðe gæð on dæg, se ne ætspyrnð na, for
þam ðe he gesicð þises middaneardes leoht.
 28. Se ðe gæð on niht, se soþlice ætspyrnð, for þam
þe leoht nis on him.
 29. And he eft þa cwæð, Lazarus ure freond liþ nu and
slæpð, ac ic wille faran þyder, þæt ic hine awecce.
 32. Þa cwædon hys discipuli, Drihten, gyf he slæpð, he
byð gehealden.
 33. And se Hælend sæde be Lazares deaðe, þe læg þa
forðfaren; hi wendon soþlice þæt he be slæpe sæde.
 36. He cwæð þa openlice oðre word him to: Lazarus is
forðfaren, and ic for eow blissige, þæt ge gelyfon, for ðam þe ic
næs þær; ac uton faran to him.
 39. And Thomas cwæð þa, þæs tonama wæs Didimus, to
hys geferum, Uton we eac faran, þæt we swelton mid him.
 42. Se Hælend þa ferde, and hi forð mid him, and comon on
þone feorðan dæg þæs þe he bebyrged wæs to Bethanian wic,
þær he bebyrged wæs, þanon wæron to Ierusalem fiftene furlang.
 46. Manega þa comon of þam Iudeiscum to Marþan and Marian,
and mid him wæron, þæt hi hi gefrefrodon for heora broður deaðe.
 49. Martha þa gehyrde þæt se Hælend wæs cumen, and
eode him togeanes, and Maria sæt æt ham.
 51. Þa cwæð Martha sona swa heo geseah þone Hælend,
Hlafurd, gyf þu her wære, nære min broþur dead; ac ic swaðeah wat
þæt God þe getiþað swa hwæs swa þu hine bitst.
 54. And se Hælend cwæð, þin broþur arist.
 55. And Martha him cwæð to, Ic wat þæt he arist on þam
æriste, on þam endenextan dæge.
 57. Hyre andwyrde se Hælend, Ic eom ærist and lif; se ðe
gelyfð on me, þeah þe he dead si, he leofað swaþeah; and ælc
þæra þe leofað and on me gelyfð, ne swylt he on ecnysse; gelyfst
þu þis, Martha?
 62. Heo andwyrde and cwæð, Witudlice, hlafurd, ic gelyfe
þæt þu eart Crist, Godes Sunu, þe on þysne middaneard to mannum
come.
 65. Heo eode þa sona, syððan heo þys cwæð, and clypode
hyre swuster, mid swigan cweþende, Se lareow ys her, and he þe clypað.
 68. Heo aras þa sona and eode to him, and se Hælend þa gyt
wæs on þære ylcan stowe þær Martha him spræc to, oððæt
Maria com.
 71. Þa eodon þa Iudei æfter Marian, for þan ðe hi
gesawon þæt heo swa raðe aras, and cwædon þæt heo wolde wepan
æt þære byrgenne.
 74. Maria þa sona swa heo þone Hælend geseah, þa feoll heo
to hys fotum, and him þus cwæð to: Hlaford, gyf þu hær wære,
nære min broður dead.
 77. Þa ða se Hælend geseah hi sarlice wepan, and þa
Iudeiscan wepende þe hire mid comon, þa grymette he on gaste, and hyne
sylfne gedrefde, and cwæð, Hwær lede ge hine?
 80. And hi cwædon him to, Hlafurd, cum and geseoh.
 81. And þa weop se Hælend.
 82. Þa sædon þa Iudeiscan, Gesixst þu, hu he hine lufode.
 83. Sume of him sædon, La hu ne mihte se don, se ðe þone
blindan gehælde, þæt þes eac ne swulte?
 85. Se Hælend eft grymetende com to ðære byrgenne, and
cwæð to þam ymbstandendum, Doð him of þone stan.
 87. Martha cwæð to Criste, Hlaford leof, he stincð, for
ðam ðe feower dagas synt syððan he bebyrged wæs.
 89. Se Hælend hyre cwæð to, La hu ne sæde ic þe
þæt gyf þu gelyfst, þu gesihst Godes wuldor?
 91. Hi ahofon þæt hlid þa of þære þryh raðe, and se
Hælend cwæð, upahafenum eagum, Fæder, ic þancige þe, for ðam
ðe þu me gehyrdest; ic soðlice wat þæt þu me symle gehyrst, ac for
ðam folce ic sæde þe her onbutan stent, þæt hi gelyfon þæt
þu me asendest.
 97. Þa þa he þis cwæð, þa clypode he hlude, <foreign>Lazare,
ueni foras</foreign>: Lazarus, cum hider ut.
 99. And he forð stop sona, se ðe forðfaren wæs, bewunden
swaþeah, swa swa hit gewunelic wæs, handum and fotum, and his heafud
wæs befangen mid swatclaðe, swa swa he geled wæs.
 103. Þa cwæð se Hælend to ðam ymbstandendum, Tolysað
hys bendas, and lætað hine gan.
 105. And he þa leofode lange syððan, halre þonne he ær
wæs, þurh þæs Hælendes mihte.
 107. Manega þa eornostlice of þam Iudeiscum þe comon to
Marian and Marthan hire swuster and gesawon hu se Hælend heora broþur
arærde gelyfdon on hyne for þam liflican tacne.
 111. Betwux eallum þam wundrum þe ure Hælend worhte ys
þyss miccle wundor mærlicost geþuht, þæt he þone stincendan
Lazarum to life arærde; ac gyf we behealdað hwa hyne arærde, þonne
mage we blissian swiðor þonne wundrian.
 116. Se arærde þone man se ðe man geworhte; he ys se
ancenneda Sunu þæs ælmihtigan Fæder, þurh þone synd gesceapene
ealle gesceafta; and la, hwilc wundor is þeah þe to life arise an mann
þurh hyne, þonne ælce dæge beoð manega acennede þurh hys mihte on
worulde?
 122. Micele mare miht ys menn to gescippenne þonne to
arærenne þone þe ær wæs.
 124. He gemedemode swaþeah þæt he menn gesceope, and eac
þæt he arærde hi eft of deaðe.
 126. He gesceop ealle menn, and sume arærde, se ðe eaðe
mihte ealle gif he wolde deade aræran þurh his drihtenlican mihte; ac he
heold witodlice þæt weorc him sylfum oð ða geendunge þysre worulde,
swa he sylf sæde on sumon godspelle, þæt se tima cymð þonne ealle
þa deadan þe on byrgenum beoð gehyrað swutellice Godes Sunu stefne, and
gað of heora byrgenum to lifes æriste, þa ðe god worhton; to
genyðerunge æriste, þa ðe yfel worhton.
 137. Is swaþeah oðer ærist on urum sawlum þe ure Hælend
deð dæghwamlice on mannum, þonne seo sawul arist of ðære synna
deaðe, for ðam se ðe syngað, hys sawul ne leofað, buton heo þurh
andetnysse eft acucige, and þurh dædbote hyre Drihten gladige.
 143. Ælc man ondræd him deaðes tocyme, and feawa him
ondrædað þære sawle deað.
 145. For ðæs lichaman life, þe langsum beon ne mæg,
swincað menn swiðe, on sæ and on lande, þæt hi deaðe
ætbærston, and beoð swaþeah deade on sumne timan, þeah þe hi sume
hwile ætfleon; and hi nellað swincan þæt hi ne singian, þæt
heora sawla lybban on þam ecan life buton geswince, and byð se lichama
æfter Domesdæge to ðam ylcan gebroht, on sawle geliffæst syððan
aa to worulde.
 154. Ondræde swa þu ondræde, se deað þe cymð to; ys
forþi wislicor þæt þu warnige georne þæt þu yfele ne swelte, on
synnum geendod, and syððan ecelice on sawle and on lichaman æfre
cwylmige on endeleasum witum, and sweltan ne mage swaðeah næfre.
 160. We willað secgan eow nu be þære sawle deaðe, þæt
he/ ys þreora cynna, þeah þe hit eow cuð ne si.
 162. Se þe yfel geþengð and yfel don wile, him ys se deað
wiðinnan digollice on his sawle; and se þe yfel wile and þæt yfel
gefremað, he byð þonne openlice yfele dead.
 166. Se ðe gewunolice and unforwandodlice singað, and hys yfel
gewidmærsað þurh yfelne hlisan, se ys bebyrged on bismerfullum
leahtrum, and he fule þonne stincð on his fracodum dædum.
 170. Nu segð us seo Cristes boc þæt Crist ure Hælend
þry men arærde of deaðe to life, and þa þry getacnodon þone
þryfealdan deað þære synfullan sawle, þe syngað on þreo wisan:
on yfelre geþafunge oððe yfelum geþohte, on yfelre fremminge, and on
yfelum gewunan.
 176. Ure Drihten arærde anes ealdormannes dohtor, seo ðe
læg dead digellice on his huse, and næs þa gyt geferod forð openlice,
and heo soðlice getacnode þære sawle deað þe byð wiðinnan hyre
þurh þæt yfele geþanc, and ne bið geopenod þurh yfele fremmincge.
 182. He arærde anne cniht þa þa he com to anre byrig Naim
gehaten, and he wæs geferod on þæs folces gesihþe, and him folgode
seo modor, dreorig wepende; ac ure Drihten sona hi swæslice gefrefrode, and
hyre sunu arærde, and betæhte þære meder, swa swa he mildheort
wæs.
 188. Þes deada getacnode þære sawle deað þe syngað
openlice, swilce heo ferige on folces gesihþe hyre deadan on bære, and
byð þonne cuð hyre synfulla deað þurh þa openan synna.
 192. Gyf þu syngodest, þu hit soðlice behreowsa, and Crist
arærð þe, þæt þu cucu byst on Gode, and betæcð þe þinre
meder, þæt ys, his gelaþunge, on þære þu wære gefullod, and
on þære þu scealt geþeon.
 196. Se þridda deada wæs þe ure Drihten arærde Lazarus se
Iudeisca, se læg bebyrged fule þa stincende, swa swa we her beforan
sædon; and he hæfde getacnunge þæs synfullan mannes, þe hæfð
him on gewunan hys yfelan dæda, and stincð þurh unhlisan and yfelne
gewunan.
 202. Swylcra ys to fela þe on synnum licgað, forlorene on
þeawum and ofhrorene mid leahtrum, and nellað gehyran þa halgan lare, and
þincð him æþryt þæt he embe þæt þence, hu he arise of
þam reocendan meoxe; is him leofre to licganne on his lichaman lustum þonne
he ænig þing swince and hys softnyse forleose.
 209. Witodlice ure leofa Hælend mæg, swa swa ælmihtig God,
ða sawla aræran þe ðuss ðryfealdlice syngiað, swa swa he þas
þry deadan þurh his drihtenlican mihte to life arærde, him sylfum to
lofe/.
 213. Is nu swyðe to witenne þæt nis næfre nan synn to
ðam swiðe micel þæt man ne mæg gebetan her on ðisum life, gif he
ða dædbote deð be þæs gyltes mæðe, on Gode truwiende.
 217. Ure Hælend swaðeah sæde on his godspelle þæt se
mann ðe tallic word cwyð ongean ðone Halgan Gast, and hine hæfð to
hospe, næfð he his næfre forgyfenysse, ne on ðissere worulde, ne on
ðære toweardan.
 221. Oft gedwolmenn spræcon dyselice be Criste, ac hi hit eft
gebetton, and gebugon to him mid soðum geleafan, and he heom sealde
forgyfenysse, swa swa he sylf sæde: ðeah ðe hwa secge be me tal oððe
hosp, hit byð him forgyfen, gif he hit behreowsað; ac se ðe be ðam
Halgan Gaste hosp gecwyð oððe tal, ðonne byð his synn æfre
endeleas.
 227. Se ælmihtiga Fæder, þe ealle ðing gesceop, hæfð
ænne Sunu of him anum acenned unasecgendlice, þone soðfæstan
Hælend; and se Halga Gast nis na gehaten Sunu, for ðan þe se an Fæder
is æfre unbegunnen, and his ancenneda Sunu of him sylfum æfre, and se
Halga Gast is heora begra Willa and Lufu, æfre hiom betwynan, of hiom bam
gelice.
 236. Nu nis se Fæder heora begra fæder, for ðan þe heora
oðer is suna, and se oðer nis na suna.
 238. Eft se ylca Sunu nis na heora begra suna, þæs Fæder
and þæs Gastes, on ðære godcundnesse.
 240. Ac se Halga Gast ana is heom bam gemænelice, ðam
ælmihtigan Fæder and his ancennedan Suna, and ðurh ðone Gast beoð
ealle synna forgyfene.
 243. Se wisan Fæder witodlice gesceop and geworhte ðurh his
halgan Wisdom, þe his Sunu is, ealle gesceafta; and he hi soðlice
geliffæste þurh ðone Halgan Gast, ðe is heora begra Lufu.
 247. Heora weorc beoð æfre untodæledlice, and hi habbað
ealle ane godcundnysse, and ealle an gecynd and ænne mægenþrymm.
 250. Ac ðæra synna forgyfenyss stent on þam Halgan Gaste,
and he deð forgyfenysse ðam dædbetendum mannum, and heora mod onliht mid
his liðan forgyfennysse, and hi syððan gefrefrað, for ðan ðe he is
Frofergast.
 254. Swa swa seo acennednyss to Criste anum belimpð, swa
belimpð seo forgyfenyss to ðam lifigendan Gaste, se ðe is ælmihtig God
æfre unbegunnen, of ðam Fæder and of þam Suna, heora begra Lufu.
 258. Be ðam ge magon witan þæt he is eallwealdend God,
þonne he swa mihtig is þæt he mæg forgyfan ealra manna synna þe
hiom soðlice behreowsiað heora misdæda, on eallum middanearde.
 262. Se Hælend ana, ðe is gehaten Crist, underfeng þa
menniscnysse and for us mannum ðrowode; nu hæbbe we ða alysednysse
ðurh ðone leofan Drihten, and ure synna forgyfenysse þurh ðæne
Halgan Gast; and ðeah eall seo ðrynnyss on soðre annysse ægðer
ðyssera dæda us deð untwylice, for ðan þe hi ealle wyrceað æfre
an weorc.
 269. Se mann cwyð hosp and tal ongean ðone Halgan Gast se ðe
næfre ne geswicð synna to wyrcenne, and wunað on his yfele oð ende his
lifes, and forsyhð þa forgyfenesse ðæs soðfæstan Gastes, and him
sylfum swa belycð þone liflican weg to ðære miltsunge ðæs
miltsiendan Gastes mid his heardheortnysse his hetelan modes.
 276. Behreowsiendan mannum gemiltsað se Halga Gast, ac ðam he
ne miltsað næfre þe his gyfe forseoð.
 278. Nu sceolon we biddan mid gebigedum mode þone ælmihtigan
Fæder, þe us ðurh his Wisdom gesceop, and us eft alysde ðurh ðone
ylcan Sunu, þæt he ure synna fram us adylegie þurh ðone Halgan Gast,
and us gehealde wið deofol, þæt we him gegan þe us ær geworhte.
 284. Se hetela deofol, ðe syrwð embe manncynn, asent yfele
geðohtas and þwyrlice ongean God on ðæs mannes heortan, þæt he
mæge hine gebringan on orwennysse, þæt he ortruwian sceole be Godes
mildheortnysse forþam manfullum geðohtum; ac wite nu gehwa þæt ða
yfelan geþohtas ne magon us derian gyf hig us ne geliciað, and gyf we hig
onscuniað, and to urum Drihtene clypiað.
 292. Ne sceal nan man swaðeah, þeah he synfull si, geortruwian
hyne sylfne for hys synna micelnysse, ne se goda man ne sceal for hys godnysse
gedyrstlæcan to swiðe, ne dyslice hyne ahebban, ne þone synfullan
forseon, for þam hit swa getimað foroft þæt se synfulla mann his
mandæde behreowsað, and hyne Drihten arærð, swa swa he dyde Lazarum,
and he leofað þonne bet on his lifes rihtinge þonne þa lybbon þe his
lif ær tældon.
 301. Be swilcum we rædað on sumum godspelle, þæt an
synful wif wæs swiðe fordon mann, and heo ofaxode þa þæt ure
Hælend wæs mid anum Sunderhalgum, se hatte Simon.
 305. Þa com þæt wif þyder, and to Criste genealæhte,
licgende æt his fotum, gelomlice wepende, and mid hyre tearum hys fet
aþwoh, and mid hyre fexe hi forhtlice wipode, and mid deorwurðre sealfe hi
syððan smyrode, swa swa hyt gewunelic wæs on Iudeiscre þeode.
 311. Þa cwæð se Hælend be hyre þæt hyre wæron
forgyfene manega synna, for ðam þe heo micclum lufode.
 313. Se mann þe ortruwað, and endeleaslice syngað, and on his
heardheortnysse his lif geendað, se byð gewislice dead þam wyrstan
deaðe, for ðam þe he færð of þysum frecenfullan life to ðam ecan
deaðe for hys endeleasum synnum.
 318. Be þrym deadum we rædað þe ure Drihten arærde, ac
hys wundra næron awritene ealle, ac þa ane man wrat þe mihton
genihtsumian mannum to hæle, and to heora geleafan, and þa ðe hæfdon
healice getacnunge, þe wurdon geopenode eft þurh þone Hælend.
 324. Hys apostoli arærdon and heora æftergengan manega menn
of deaðe, ac se ylca Drihten dyde þæt þurh hi, swa swa he dyde ær
þurh hyne sylfne on hys andweardnysse.
 328. Þa geswustra cyddon Criste be Lazare þæt he licgende
wæs, and he wunode swaðeah on þære ylcan stowe, anbidigende swa lange
oððæt he forðfaren wæs, and ferde syððan to him.
 332. He nolde hine gehælan, ac wolde hine aræran, and þurh
þæt miccle wundor his mihta geswutelian.
 334. His leorningcnihtas woldon gelettan þone Hælend, þæt
he ne ferde to ðære frecednysse þær þa Iudeiscan woldon hyne
berædan, and he forþi ær þanon siþode.
 338. Þa halgan apostoli woldon þam Hælende þone ræd
tæcan þæt he ne þorfte sweltan, se þe sylfwilles com þæt he
sweltan wolde, þæt hi sylfe ne swulton, ne we eac soðlice, þam yfelan
deaðe þe he us of alysde.
 343. Se Hælend cwæð þa him to, Se dæg hæfð
twelf tida, and se ðe færð on dæg, hys fot ne ætspyrnð, for
þam ðe he þæt leoht gesihþ þyses middaneardes.
 346. He is se soða dæg, and þæt soðe leoht ealles
middaneardes, and se man þe him filigð, ne gæð he na on þeostrum, ac
hæfð lifes leoht.
 349. His twelf apostoli synt þa twelf tida þe ðam dæge
folgiað Drihtne Hælende, þeah þe se swicola Iudas, þe hyne
syððan belæwde, of þam wurðmynte afeolle; ac þær feng oðer
to, Mathias se eadmoda, and wearð eft gefylled þæt twelffealde getel on
þam twelf apostolum.
 355. Se Hælend cwæð to Marthan, Lazares swuster, Ic eom
ærist and lif; se ðe gelyfð on me, þeah þe he dead si, he leofað
swaþeah, and ælc þæra þe leofað and on me gelyfð, ne swylt he
on ecnysse.
 359. And he sæde on oðre stowe, <foreign>Ego sum Deus Abraham et Deus
Isaac et Deus Iacob</foreign>: Ic eom Abrahames God and Isaaces and Iacobes.
 362. Nis na God deadra manna, ac is libbendra; ealle menn him
lybbað.
 363. Se þe on hine gelyfð, þeah þe he dead si, he sceal
libban swaþeah, and se ðe ne gelyfð on hyne, þeah þe he lifes si, he
ys dead swaþeah þam yfelan deaðe.
 367. We ne durran gelencgan na leng þysne traht, ne eow geswencan
na swiðor mid þam, þe læs þe eower sum ceorige on mode; ac uton
biddan ealle urne Drihten Crist þæt he ure sawla fram synnum arære, and
us þæt ece lif on ende forgyfe; þam si wuldor and lof a to worulde,
amen.

ÆHom 7
B1.4.7.
Dominica IV post Pascha: Pope 1967-8, I, 340-50.



 1. Manega godspel syndon gesette to mæssan of ðære
langsuman spræce þe ure leofa Hælend spræc on þære nihte þe
he belæwed wæs, swa swa Iohannes awrat, þe hit wiste eall.
 4. An þæra godspella is þe we nu embe sprecað, and eow
secgan wyllað þæs Hælendes agene word, swa swa he sylf sæde.
 8. He cwæð to his folgerum on þære foresædan nihte, Ic
fare nu to þam þe me asende hider, and eower nan ne befrinð hwider ic
fare nu, ac eower heorte unrotsað for ðan þe ic eow þis sæde.
 12. Ic secge eow soðfæstnysse, þæt eow sylfum fremað
þæt ic swa fare.
 13. And he heom sæde eft, Gif ic eow fram ne fare, ne cymð eow
se Froforgast.
 15. Gif ic soðlice fare, ic asende hine to eow.
 16. Mid þam þe he cymð, he þreað þysne middaneard,
ægþer ge be synne ge be rihtwisnysse, and be soþum dome, sona swa he
cymð.
 19. Be synne he þreað, for ðan þe hi ne gelyfað on me; be
rihtwisnysse he þreað, for ðan þe ic nu fare up to minum Fæder, and
ge me ne geseoð.
 22. Be dome he þreað, for ðan þe nu is gedemed þam yfelan
ealdre þises middaneardes.
 24. Git ic hæbbe soðlice eow to secgenne fela þing, ac ge ne
magon hit understandan, ne on mode aræfnian.
 26. Þonne se soðfæstnysse Gast cymð, he tæcð eow
ealle soðfæstnysse.
 27. Ne sprecð he na of him sylfum, ac sprecð swa hwæt swa he
gehyrð; and þa þing þe gewurðaþ, witodlice he cyð eow.
 29. Me soðlice he mærsað, for ðan þe he of minum þa
þing underfehþ þe he eow bodaþ.
 31. We secgað nu swutellicor þas gesetnysse: þæt se
Hælend sæde þæt he siðian wolde to his heofonlican Fæder þe
hine asende; and his geferum næs to befrinenne nan neod, þonne hi gesawon
swutellice ealle hu he upp astah eaþelice to heofonum, and þæt wolcn
underfeng wurðlice hine, heom onhawigendum, ungedwimorlice.
 39. Eower heorte unrotsað for ðan þe ic eow þis sæde.
 40. Him wæs lað to forlætenne þone leofan Hælend, and
hi uneaðe mihton his neawiste aberan, for ðan þe hi næron þa git
gefrefrode þurh þone Halgan Gast, swa swa hi syððan wæron.
 44. Ic secge eow soðfæstnysse, þæt eow sylfum fremað
þæt ic swa fare; and he heom sæde eft, Gif ic eow fram ne fare, ne
cymð eow se Froforgast.
 47. Eow fremað micclum þæt ic min mennisce hiw eowrum
gesihþum afyrsige, þæt ge syððan magon þurh geleafan habban maran
lufe to me, and gewilnian on mode þære upplican wununge, þyder þe ic
siðige me sylf nu ærest.
 52. Gif ic eow fram ne fare, ne cymð eow se Froforgast.
 53. Swiðe eaþe he mihte, mid him þa wuniende, him on eorðan
forgifan þone ylcan Froforgast, swa swa he dyde syððan, þa þa he of
deaþe aras: he bleow on heom eallum, þus heom secgende: Underfoð nu on
eow þone Halgan Froforgast; and þam mannum þe ge syllað synna
forgifennysse, þam beoð sona forgifene heora synna gewiss; þam þe ge
nellað forgifan, þam ne beoð forgifene.
 61. Swilcne anweald he forgeaf eallum his apostolum; ac hi ne
mihton habban swa micele gewilnunge to þam heofonlican life, ær ðan þe
se Hælend, heom onlocigendum, upp to heofonum astah; and he heom asende
syððan of heofonum þone Halgan Gast, swa swa he heom behet.
 67. Se Halga Gast wunode on þam halgum witegum þe witegodon
embe Crist on þære ealdan æ, and eac he wæs soðlice on Cristes
apostolum; ac he ne com na swa swutellice swa swa he syððan dyde, on
scinendre beorhtnesse, swilce byrnende fyr, to þam Godes bydelum þe bodedon
mancynne.
 73. Mid þam þe he cymð, he þreað þisne middaneard
ægðer ge be synne ge be rihtwisnysse, and be soðum dome, sona swa he
cymð.
 76. Be eallum þisum þingum þreade se Hælend, mid mannum
wunigende, þa ðe his word gehyrdon; ac he ne þreade swaðeah þurh hine
sylfne þa git buton þæt Iudeisce cynn, þe he to cumen wæs, and mid
þam þe he wunode and fela tacna geworhte.
 81. Se Halga Gast soðlice, syððan he asend wæs his halgum
apostolum and on heom wunode, þreade endemes ealne middaneard be þam ðrim
þingum þe se Hælend sæde.
 85. Be synne he þreað, for ðan þe hi ne gelyfað on me.
 86. Seo ungeleaffulnyss is þæra synna ordfruma, þæt man
ne gelyfe on þone lifigendan Hælend; and se geleafa is ordfruma ealra
goddra mihta, for ðan þe se geleafa us gelæt to heofonum.
 90. Micel synn him wæs þe gesawon his wundra, þæt hi
noldon gelyfan on þone leofan Hælend, þe ða deadan arærde þurh
his drihtenlican mihte, and fela oðra wundra geworhte heom ætforan.
 94. Be þam sang se witega and se sealmwyrhta iu, ær þan þe
se Hælend her on worulde mann wære, and cwæð be ðam Iudeiscum and
be heora dyrstinysse þus: <foreign>sagitte paruulorum facte sunt plage eorum</foreign>.
 98. Se witega cwæð be him þæt heora weorc wæron, and
þa wunda gelice, þe hy on ðam Hælende hetelice afæstnodon,
þæra cildra sceotungum þe sceotiað mid reodum on heore geonglicum
plegan on heora plegstowe.
 103. Hwæt is swa idellic, oððe swa untrumlic, swa swa
þæt man fordeme þone soþan Deman, and þone gebinde þe unbint eall
mancynn, and þone wylle ofslean þe ure synna forgyfð, and þa deadan
arærde þurh his drihtenlican mihte?
 108. And we ealle beoð arærde eft þurh hine on Domesdæg.
 109. Swylce wæron soðlice þæra Iudeiscra syrwunga ongean
þone Hælend þæt hy hine acwealdon, for þan þe he oferswiðde
þone sylfan deað swa mid his halgum æriste, us to alysednysse.
 113. <foreign>Et infirmitate sunt contra eos lingue eorum</foreign>: And heora
tungan wæron geuntrumode swyðe ongean hy sylfe: þus sæde se witega.
 116. Swyþe untrume wæron heora tungan gewiss, þa ða hy
sylfe sædon be ðam soðan Hælende, Gif he Godes Sunu is, gange he of
þære rode.
 119. And þa weardmenn syððan þe besæton his byrgene
cyddon þæt Crist aras cucu of þære byrgene.
 121. Læssan þinges hy bædon on heora geleafleaste, þæt
Crist þa gan sceolde cucu of ðære rode; ac he soðlice aras syððan
of ðæm deaðe, to maran wundrunge, gewunnenum sige of ðæm ealdan
deofle, and alysde us fram þam ecan deaðe and þæs deofles anwealde.
 127. Eow is nu eac to witenne, and we wyllað eow sæcgan,
þæt ure leofa Hælend her on life wunode æfter his agenum deaðe,
syððan he of deaðe aras, mid his halgum apostolum, and he hy wissode mid
mænigfealdre lare hu hy læran sceoldon eall manncyn to geleafan, þæt
hy rihtlice gelyfdon, and to fulluhte gebugon fram heora fyrnlicum synnum,
þæt hy þæt ece lif mid him habban mihton.
 135. Swa swa he eallum behet þam þe hine lufiað.
 136. He æt þa sylf and dranc openlice mid him, þæt he swa
geswutolode þæt he soðlice leofode æfter his agenum deaðe, þe he
oferswiðde mid mihte, and he feowertig daga wæs wunigende mid him,
þæt hy hine handledon and mid handum grapedon on his handum and fotum, hu
he gefæstnod wæs, and eac on his sidan hy sceawodon his dolhswaða, and
hy mihton geseon þæt he soðlice aras on ansundum lichaman, oferswiðdum
deaðe.
 145. Ealle his lima he hæfde, and hæfð butan twyn; on his
fotum he stod, and þa næron butan sceancan; his sidan hy grapodon, and he
soðlice hæfde ge innoð ge breost, butan þam þe ne magon ænige
sidan beon to geswuteligenne.
 150. Innoð he hæfde eac, þa ða he æt and dranc; and
tungan he hæfde, þa ða he to him spræc; and he næs butan toðum,
þe mid þære tungan swegdon; and þrotan he hæfde, þa ða hy
gehyrdon his stæmne; and his handa hæfdon, þe hy gegrapedon, earmas and
exla, on ansundum lichaman.
 156. Ne mihte nan wana beon þam welwillendan Hælende ænig
his limena æfter his æriste, þonne he us eallum behet þæt æfter
urum deaðe, þonne we on Domesdæg of deaðe arisað, þæt us ne
bið forloren forðon þæt læste hær on urum lichaman, be ðam
þe we on life hæfdon ær.
 162. Be rihtwisnesse he þreað, for ðan þe ic nu fare up to
minum Fæder, and ge me ne geseoð.
 164. Ðæt is seo rihtwisnys, þæt man rihtlice gelyfe on
þone soðan Hælend, þone gesawon his folgeras, and on hine gelyfdon,
and mid lufe wurðodon.
 167. We ne gesawon hine, ac we swaðeah gelyfað mid rihtum
geleafan, us to rihtwisnysse, on þone soðan Scyppend, þe us gesceop to
mannum, and us eft alysde fram deofles anwealde.
 171. Be dome he þreað, for ðan þe nu is gedemed þam
yfelan ealdre þyses middaneardes.
 173. Þone hetolan deofol he het middaneardes ealdor, for ðan
þe he hæfð ofer þa unrihtwisan micelne ealdordom, þe þisne
middaneard lufiað swiðor þonne þone Scyppend þe gesceop þysne
middaneard.
 177. Næfð se deofol swaðeah on his anwealde nateshwon ealne
þysne middaneard; ac se ælmihtiga God ah ealne embhwyrft, and þa ðe
him/ on wuniað, and þa þe arwurðiað hine mid weorcum a.
 181. Ðam deofle wæs gedemed þurh ures Drihtnes ðrowunge,
swa þæt he him of anam Adames ofspring, and forgeaf his apostolum þone
anweald ofer hine, þæt hi mihton adræfan deoflu of ðam wodum, and
eall þæs deofles miht hi mihton fortredan, and se yfela ne mihte heom
ahwar derian.
 187. Gyt ic hæbbe soðlice eow to secgenne fela þing, ac ge
ne magon hit understandan, ne on mode aræfnian.
 189. Fela þing he sæde syððan his apostolum, æfter his
æriste, þe hi ær ne mihton eaðe understandan, ær ðan þe hi
gesawon þone Hælend mid heom halne æfter deaþe, etende and drincende,
heom onlocigendum, and his lare heom secgende mid swutelum spræcum.
 195. Ðonne se soðfæstnesse Gast cymð, he tæcð eow
ealle soðfæstnysse.
 196. Ða halgan apostolas þurh þone Halgan Gast wurdon swa
gelærede þæt hi witodlice spræcon mid eallum gereordum uncuðra
þeoda, and hi læran mihton mancynn on worulde of ðam ealdum bocum þe
hi ær ne cuðon under Moyses lage, mid micclum andgite gastlicra
getacnunga, swa swa him God onwreah.
 203. Ac nan mann ne mæg on middanearde swaðeah becuman on his
life to ealre soðfæstnesse, ær ðan þe he sylf becume to þam
soðfæstan Gode, swa swa se þeoda lareow Paulus us sæde.
 207. Ne sprecð he na of him sylfum, ac sprecð swa hwæt swa
he gehyrð.
 208. Se Halga Gast ne sprycð na, swa swa se Hælend cwæð,
buton of ðam þe he is on anre godcundnysse.
 210. He is seo micele Lufu and se mihtiga Willa þæs Fæder
and þæs Suna, of heom bam gelice, and ealle þa witegan witegodon þurh
hine, and þa halgan apostolas þurh hine spræcon, micclum onbryrde and
gebylde þurh hine.
 215. And þa þing þe gewurðað witodlice he cyð eow.
 216. Þis is swa we ær sædon, þæt seo witegung is of
him, and þa þing þe becomon he cydde him foran to, and heora mod onlihte
mid his micclan gife.
 219. Me soðlice he mærsað, for ðan þe he of minum þa
þing underfehð þe he eow bodaþ.
 221. Se Halga Gast mærsode Cristes menniscnysse, for ðan þe
his gifu is on Godes halgum wunigende, and Godes lufu is agoten on urum heortum
þurh þone ylcan Gast, þe is Godes Lufu, of ðam Fæder and of ðam
Suna, him symle gemæne, on anre mægenþrymnysse, a to worulde.
 226. AMEN.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

ÆHom 8
B1.4.8.
Dominica V post Pascha: Pope 1967-8, I, 357-68.



 1. Sume menn nyton gewiss, for heora nytennysse, hwi godspell is
gecweden, oþþe hwæt godspell gemæne.
 3. Godspell is witodlice Godes sylfes lar, and ða word þe he
spræc on þissere worulde, mancynne to lare and to rihtum geleafan; and
þæt is swyðe god spell, þurh Godes tocyme us to gehyrenne þæt we
habban moton þa heofonlican wununge mid him sylfum æfre, swa swa he þam
eallum behet þe hine lufiað, on rihtwisnysse and on rihtum geleafan and on
soðfæstnysse hine secende.
 12. Nu sceole we gehyran þæt halige godspell mid onbryrdnysse,
us to beterunge, and eac we sceolon witan hwæt ða word mænon, þæt
we magon hi awendan to weorcum þe eað: for ðan þe se bið wis þe mid
weorcum geswutelað þa halgan Godes lage and his halgan lare, and se bið
unrihtwis þe heorcnað þæra worda, and nele hi awendan to weorcum, him
to þearfe.
 20. On þære Frigenihte þe ætforan Eastron bið hæfde
ure Hælend, ær ðan þe he þrowode, swiðe langsume spræce wið
his leorningcnihtas, and heom fela þing sæde on his fundunge þa; and
Iohannes se godspellere hit gesette on Cristes bec, þe his lare gehyrde; and
he cwæð him þa þus to: <foreign>amen, amen, dico uobis, si quid petieritis
Patrem in nomine meo, dabit uobis; et reliqua</foreign>; Soð, soð ic eow secge, gif
ge sylfe hwæs biddaþ æt minum halgan Fæder eow on minum naman, he
hit forgyfð eow untwylice hraðe.
 32. Ne bæde ge nan þing git on minum naman; biddaþ and ge
underfoð, þæt eower bliss beo full.
 34. Ic spræc to eow on bigspellum, ac nu bið se tima þæt
ic on bigspellum eow to ne sprece, ac ic cyðe eow swutellice be þam soðan
Fæder.
 37. On þam dæge ge biddað on minum naman geornlice, and ic
ne sæde eow git þæt ic sylf wylle biddan þone ylcan Fæder, for eow
þingiende.
 40. Se sylfa Fæder lufað eow, for ðan þe ge lufedon me,
and ge gelyfdon þæt ic fram Gode ferde.
 42. Ic ferde fram þam Fæder and com to middanearde; ic
forlæte eft middaneard and ic fare to þam Fæder.
 44. Þa sædon his folgeras mid swiðlicre blisse, Efne þu
sprecst nu swutellice, leof, and þu nateshwon ne segst nan bigspell nu us.
 47. Nu we witon soðlice þæt þu wast ealle þing, and þe
nis nan neod þæt þe hwa ahsige; on ðam we gelyfað, þæt þu
fram Gode come.
 50. We habbað nu gesæd sceortlice on Englisc þis halige
godspell, swa swa ge gehyrdon nu, þa nacedan word ana; ac we nu wyllað mid
fægerum andgite hi gefrætewian eow, þæt hi licweorðe beon to lare
eow eallum, gif ge þæt gastlice andgit mid godum willan underfoð.
 56. Soð, soð ic eow secge, gif ge sylfe hwæs biddaþ æt
minum halgan Fæder eow on minum naman, he hit forgifð eow untwylice
hraðe.
 59. Se Hælend wæs gehaten fram his cildhade Iesus, fram þam
halgan engle, ær ðan þe he acenned wurde, and se bitt on his naman se
ðe him hælu bitt, for ðan þe Iesus is Hælend gecweden.
 63. Bide þe nu hælu on þæs Hælendes naman, modes and
lichaman, oþþe for leofne freond, and se Fæder þe tiðað untwylice
þæs, gif ðu andsæte ne bist and þine gebedu him.
 67. Gif ðu þonne yfel bist, þu most yfeles geswican, and to
þam godan Fæder mid godnysse gebugan.
 69. And gif ðu yfeles bitst ænigum oðrum menn, þu ne bitst
na þonne swa swa se Hælend bebead, ac mid yfelum mode þu yfeles
gewilnast, þæt nis nan hælu on þæs Hælendes naman.
 73. Micele þing abædon þa mæran apostolas æt þam
halgan Fæder æfter þæs Hælendes upstige, þa ða hi arærdon
þa deadan on heora Drihtnes naman, swa swa he sylf ær dyde; and hi
menigfealde wundra geworhton on his naman, and hi þa hæþenan leoda to
his geleafan gebigdon.
 79. Hwilon eac se witega þe wæs Helias gehaten bæd þone
ælmihtigan God for manna yfelnyssum þæt he renscuras forwyrnde to
feorðan healfan geare; and he eft syððan abæd þæt God asende
renscuras and eorðlice wæstmas, for ðan þe hi awendon þa heora mod
to Gode mid maran geleafan.
 85. Be þam micclum benum þe menn magon abiddan, þa ðe Gode
liciað, cwæð se leofa Hælend on sumum oðrum godspelle to his halgum
apostolum: <foreign>amen, dico uobis, quia si quis dixerit huic monti, Tollere et
mittere in mare, et non hesitauerit in corde suo, sed crediderit, quia
quodcumque dixerit fiat fiet ei</foreign>: Soð ic eow secge, gif hwa segð on
eornost, and cwyð to anum munte on minum naman þus, far ðu on Godes naman
feor ut on sæ, and gif him na ne tweonað þæt he þæs tiða beo,
ac gelyfð on heortan, swa hwæt swa he gecwyð, hit becymð and
gewyrð.
 97. Micel bið seo ben þæt se munt aweg fare of his agenum
stede þurh ænigne mannan; ac we magon eow secgan þæt hit soðlice
gewearð þurh ænne haligne wer, swa swa we her secgað: Sum halig
bisceop wæs gehaten Gregorius, swiðe micel lareow on micclum
geþingðum, be þam ic sæde hwilon, on sumum oþrum spelle, hu he
þone hæþenan god, þe nane godcundnysse næfde, adræfde mid his
tocyme of his anlicnysse aweg.
 106. Se ylca Gregorius wolde Gode aræran halig mynsterlif
gehende anre ea; ac þær wæs to gehende swiðe heah clif onemn, and
wæs se stede myrige to þam mynsterlife, gif he rumra wære to þam
godes weorce.
 109. Ða mearcode se bisceop on þam munte þone dæl þe he
habban wolde to þæs weorces rymette, and bæd þa þone ælmihtigan,
þe mæg þæt he wile, þæt he ahofe þone munt be his mearcunge,
þæt he mihte macian his mynster on þam rymette; and God þa sona asceaf
þone munt butan geswince, swa swa he gewilnode; and se halga wer worhte him
ðær mynster.
 119. Ða wæron twegen gebroðra, welige on life, and hæfdon
ænne fixnoð on anum bradum mere, heom bam gemæne, to micelre tilunge;
ac þær wurdon oft æt þam wæterscipe mænigfealde ceastu and
manslihtas, and micele gefeoht for ðan fixnoðe.
 125. Hwæt ða se bisceop wearð geunblissod for ðam blodes
gyte, and abæd þa æt Gode þæt he worhte þæne wæterscipe to
wynsumum eorðlande; and þæt wæter sona gewende of ðam fixnoþe,
and wæs se mere awend to widgillum felda, swa þæt man erode ealne
þone fixnoð, and þær corn weox æfre wynsumlice syððan.
 132. Iulianus se wiðersaca, þe wær ærest Cristen, and to
preoste besceoren for ðæs caseres ege, awearp his geleafan and gelyfde on
deofolgyld syððan he his sylfes geweold; and he wearð casere, and lufode
þa drycræft and þæs deofles þeowdom; and he þa manega martyras
acwealde, and wann wið þone Hælend, oþþæt he forferde.
 139. He asende ænne deofol to sumum lande hwilon, on sumum
ærende, þæt he ardlice ferde; and se deofol þa be his sande ferde,
and com eft him to embe tyn daga fyrst.
 143. Þa cwæð se casere him to, Hwi come þu swa late?
 144. Se deofol him andwyrde, Ic wearð yfele gelett þurh ænne
haligne munuc, se hatte Publius; ic ne mihte na faran forð on þin
ærende, for ðan þe se munuc, mid his micclum gebedum, forwyrnde me
þæs weges, and ic wende nu ongean butan ælcum ærende, ungewiss eft
to þe.
 150. And se casere wearð on þam wege ofslagen, and sum his
þegna, þe þis þa gehyrde, gewende to þam munuce, and wearð munuc
him sylf.
 153. Swilce þing maciað þa mæran gebedu þurh þone
soðan God, þe symle wile well, and gehyrð þa gebedu on his halgena
neode, and his þearfena clypunga uncuðlice ne forsihþ.
 157. Þæt godspell us segð þæt se Hælend sæde, Ne
bæde ge nan þing gytt on minum naman.
 159. Forði hi ne bædon on þæs Hælendes naman, for
ðan þe hi hæfdon hine sylfne mid heom, his lare brucende, and ne
bædon na swiðe þa ungesewenlican þing, þonne hi hine gesawon.
 163. Biddaþ, and ge underfoð, þæt eower bliss beo full.
 164. Ðære ecan blisse he het hi þa biddan, for ðan þe
nanum menn ne bið full bliss on his life, þæt him ne eglige æfre sum
þing her.
 167. Ic spræc to eow on bigspellum, ac nu bið se tima þæt
ic on bigspellum eow to ne sprece, ac ic cyþe eow swutellice be þam soðan
Fæder.
 170. On bocum is gewunelic bigspell to secgenne, þæt is oþer
ðing on wordum, and oþer on getacnungum, and se Hælend heom spræc to
swiðe gelome on manegum bigspellum, heora mode to trymminge; ac he sæde
heom nu þæt he swutellice wolde be þam halgan Fæder heom bodian and
cyþan, for ðan þe he sylf deþ þæt his halgan geseoð his Fæder
on his wuldre, þonne hi wuniað mid him, swa swa ða englas geseoð hine
soðlice nu.
 179. On þam dæge ge biddaþ on minum naman geornlice.
 180. On ðam life is an dæg, þe næfre ne geendaþ, and on
dæge hi biddað, þa þe þonne biddað, na on sweartum þeostrum
þissera costnunga; ac þæs Hælendes word heom beoð þonne cuðe,
þe þus sæde to heom on sumum his godspella: <foreign>Ego et Pater unum sumus</foreign>:
Ic and min Fæder syndon witodlice an.
 187. Þæt is, soðlice, an God, on anre godcundnysse, and him
bam is gemæne æfre an soð Lufu, þæt is se Halga Gast, þe
gæð of him bam.
 190. He cwæð, wyt syndon, for ðan þe se Sunu is æfre
swa wunigende, and ne awent na of ðam, ne heora nan ne bið abroden to
oþrum, þæt he elles beo of ðam þe he ær wæs.
 194. He cwæð, wyt syndon an, for ðære annysse, þæt
seo an godcundnyss, and seo an mægenþrymnys, and þæt an gecynd þe
him is gemæne nele geþafian þæt hi þry godas syndon, ac an
ælmihtig God æfre on ðrym hadum; and þis oncnawað þa halgan
þonne hi hine geseoð.
 200. Næs na se halga Fæder to menn geboren for us, ne he
ne/ þrowode for us, ac þrowode se Sunu, se ðe þa menniscnysse ana
underfeng; and her ge magon gehyran þæt hi syndon þry, and an God
swaðeah, swa swa we ær ræddon.
 205. Ðæt godspell sprecð forð on þus þæs
Hælendes word: And ic ne sæde eow gyt þæt ic sylf wylle biddan
þone ylcan Fæder, for eow þingiende.
 208. On þære menniscnysse þe he mid is befangen, he bit for
his halgum his heofenlican Fæder; and on his godcundnysse, on þære þe
he God is, he getiþað ealle þing æfre mid þam Fæder; and we
habbað on þam Suna swiðe godne þingere.
 213. Se sylfa Fæder lufað eow, for ðan þe ge lufedon me,
and ge gelyfdon þæt ic fram Gode ferde.
 215. Her ge magon gehyran þæt se ðe næfð þone Sunu,
þæt he næfð þone Fæder þe hine asende; and se Fæder lufað
þa þe gelyfað on Crist, and se bið gesælig þe swylce lufe
underfehþ.
 219. Ic ferde fram þam Fæder, and com to middanearde; ic
forlæte eft middaneard, and ic fare to þam Fæder.
 221. He com to middanearde, and wæs mann gesewenlic, se ðe
ungesewenlic mid þam soðan Fæder wæs; and he forlet middaneard, mid
þam þe he up astah on þære menniscnysse to þam ungesewenlican; ac he
wunað swaðeah, oþ þissere worulde ende, mid his halgum mannum on
þære godcundnysse, swa swa he sylf behet, se ðe ne wægð næfre.
 228. Gif ðu þises wundrast, hu he wunian mage mid mannum on
eorðan, and eac swilce on heofenum, sceawa be þære sunnan, þe is Godes
gesceaft, hu heo mage asendan hyre scinendan leoman fram hire upplican ryne
ofer ealne middaneard.
 233. Se sunbeam bescinð þe swutellice eallne; and ne mæg se
Eallwealdend, gif ðu hine lufast, his leoman þe asendan, and eac þe
lufian?
 236. Þa sædon his folgeras mid swiðlicre blisse, Efne þu
sprecst nu swutellice, leof, and þu nateshwon ne segst nan bigspell nu us.
 239. Hwæt mage we eow secgan swutellicor be þysum þonne ða
apostolas hit gesæd habbað, swa swa ge gehyrdon nu on þissere segene?
 242. Nu we witon soðlice þæt þu wast ealle þing, and
þe nis nan neod þæt þe hwa axige.
 244. Ful soð hi sædon be þam soðan Hælende, þæt he
ealle þing wat, swa swa eallwealdend God; and þæt is seo swutelung his
soðan godcundnysse, þæt he mæg asmeagan ealra manna heortan, and ure
geþohtas þurhseon ealle; and we ne ðurfon axian hu he sylf don wylle.
 250. Þa apostoli sædon þa, swa swa we sceoldon don, On þam
we gelyfað, þæt þu fram Gode come.
 252. And we sceolon gelyfan on þone lyfigendan Hælend,
þæt se Fæder us lufie þe hine asende, and ure heortan onlihte mid
þæs Halgan Gastes gife, þam is æfre an wuldor and an wurðmynt,
AMEN.

ÆHom 9
B1.4.9.
Dominica post Ascensionem Domini: Pope 1967-8, I, 378-89.



 1. Se Hælend her on life, mid his halgum apostolum and mid
mannum wunigende, manega wundra wyrcende, on þære ylcan nihte þæs
ðe he on merien þrowode, sæde his folgerum on his fundunge þus:
þonne se Froforgast cymð þe ic eow asende fram minum Fæder, se ðe
is/ soðfæstnysse Gast, and se soðlice forðstæpð of ðam soþan
Fæder, he cyð gecyðnysse swiðe cuðlice be me, þæt is, þæt
he bið gewitnyss eallra minra weorca.
 10. And ge eac cyþað gecyðnysse be me, for ðan þe ge fram
anginne mid me wunedon.
 12. Ic spræc þas ðing to eow þæt ge ne beon
geæswicode.
 13. Hi geutlagiað eow of heora gesamnungum, ac se tima becymð
þæt þa þe eow ofsleað þæt hi wenað þæt hi gearcion Gode
þenunge swa; and þas ðing hi doð on heora gedwylde, for ðan þe hi
ne cunnon minne Fæder ne me.
 18. Ac ðas þing ic spræc to eow þæt ge beon gemyndige,
þonne heora tima cymð, þæt ic hit eow sæde.
 20. Se Hælend spræc openlice æfre to his geferum, and oft
to folces mannum on his micclan lare, wolde þæt menn wiston wið hwæt
hi hi warnian sceoldon, and hwæt menn don sceolon on heora Drihtnes willan,
þa þe his word wyllað mid weorcum gefyllan.
 25. Ge magon gehyran hu he sylf cwæð be ðam: <foreign>ego palam
locutus sum mundo; Et reliqua</foreign>; Ic spræc openlice to þisum middanearde; ic
tæhte on gesamnunge symle, and on ðam temple, þær ðær þa
Iudeiscan ealle ætsomne comon, and ic on digelnysse nan þing ne spræc.
 31. He sealde eac bysne soðlice mid þam, þæt witan sceolon
cyðan heora word openlice, and þa ðe manegum rædaþ, na mid runungum,
for ðan þe manega magon maran ræd findan þonne ænlypige magon mid
agenum gewille.
 36. Be þam ylcan us manað Godes wisdom on bocum: <foreign>Omnia cum
consilio fac, et post factum non pænitebis</foreign>: Gefada ealle þing fægere
mid geþeahte, and æfter þære dæde þe ne ofðingþ nan þing.
 40. Ne se wita ne sceal his wisdom behydan, gif he ræd cunne,
swa swa hit cwyð be þam: <foreign>Sapientia abscondita et thesaurus occultus,
quæ utilitas in utroque</foreign>;Se behydda wisdom and se bedigloda goldhord, hwilc
fremu is ænigum on aðrum þæra?
 46. And þæs behofað se cyning þæt he clypige to his
witum, and be heora ræde, na be rununge fare, for ðan þe se cyning is
Cristes sylfes speligend ofer ðam Cristenan folce þe Crist sylf alysde, him
to hyrde gehalgod, þæt he hi healdan sceole, mid þæs folces fultume,
wið/ onfeohtendne here, and him sige biddan æt þam soðan Hælende,
þe him þone anweald under him sylfum forgeaf, swa swa ealle cyningas dydon
þe gecwemdon Gode.
 55. Ælc cyning bið halig þe gehylt Godes folc, and mid lufe
gewissað, na mid wælhreownysse, ac æfre æfter rihte, na mid
anwilnysse, and wyle eac syllan, gif hit swa micel neod bið, his agen lif
æt nextan for his leode ware, swa swa se Hælend sealde hine sylfne for
us, þeah þe he mihte eall mancynn ahreddan butan his agenum deaðe, and of
ðam deofle geniman his agen handgeweorc, gif he swa don wolde.
 64. Se Hælend befran hwilon his halgan apostolas hu woruldmenn
sædon hwæt he him sylf wære.
 66. Hi andwyrdon him þus: Sume secgað þæt þu sy Iohannes
se fulluhtere, sume Helias, sume Hieremias, oþþe sum witega.
 69. Ða cwæð se Hælend heom to, Hwæt secge ge hwæt
ic si?
 70. Petrus him andwyrde mid anrædan mode, þu eart se soða
Crist, þæs lifigendan Godes Sunu.
 72. Þas word we sædon hwilon on sumon oþrum spelle mid
swutelum andgite; ac we secgað nu her þæt se Hælend sealde swa bysne
us mannum þæt we sceolon witan hwilc word we sylfe habbað, oþþe
hwilcne hlisan on ures lifes þeawum, and gerihtlæcan us æfre to
beteran, þæt we yfele bysne oðrum mannum ne syllon on ænigre
wohnysse oþþe anwilnysse; for ðan þe seo yfele bysen byð openlice
forwyrd.
 81. Eft sæde se Hælend, Ic sealde eow bysne, þæt swa swa
ic eow dyde, þæt ge don sylfe swa.
 83. Nu sæde se Hælend, swa swa us segð þis godspell,
ðonne se Frofergast cymð þe ic eow asende fram minum Fæder, se ðe is
soðfæstnysse Gast, and se soðlice forðstæpð of ðam soþan
Fæder, he cyð gecyþnysse swyðe cuðlice be me, þæt is, þæt
he byð gewitnys ealra minra weorca.
 89. Mannum næs na swa cuð on swa micelre swutelunge be
þære halgan þrynnysse, ær þæs Hælendes tocyme on his
menniscnysse, ac he mannum geopenode oftrædlice mid wordum be his
heofonlican Fæder and be þam Halgan Gaste, and he sylf spræc to
mannum, þæt secgende swutelice, swa swa ge gehyrdon her on þisum
godspelle.
 96. On oþre stowe he sæde, swa swa Matheus awrat, to his
halgum apostolum, þus heom bebeodende: <foreign>Euntes ergo docete omnes gentes,
baptizantes eos in nomine Patris, et Filii, et Spiritus sancti; et reliqua</foreign>:
Farað eornostlice to fyrlenum landum; lærað ealle þeoda, and mid
geleafan fulliað on þæs Fæder naman, and his Suna witodlice, and
þæs Halgan Gastes; þus cwæð se Godes Sunu.
 104. Her is micel swutelung þæs soðan geleafan, hu se
Hælend sylf hit sæde, and bead þæt ealle þeoda sceoldon swa beon
gefullode on þa halgan þrynnysse and soðe annysse; and þes an geleafa
is eallum to healdenne, þam mannum þe habbað ænigne myne to Gode.
 110. He cwæð þæt he sylf wolde asendan þone Gast,
þære soðfæstnysse Gast, þe of ðam Fæder forðstæpð, for
ðan þe se Frofergast forðstæpð of heom bam, heora begra Lufu, gelic
him on mihte.
 114. Þone asende se Sunu, and sæde þæt he sceolde
gecyðnysse cyþan be Criste swutelice.
 116. Hi begen hine sendon, and he sylfwilles com, for ðam þe se
ylca Gast, þurh his godcundnysse, swa swa ælmihtig Wealdend swiðe wide
todælþ his gastlican gifa ofer Godes folce on eallum middanearde swiðe
mihtiglice; and he his seofonfealdan gifa besæwð on us mannum, be þam
þe him gewyrð, and we us sylfe gearciað mid estfullum mode, þæt he
mid us wunige.
 124. Micel let se Hælend þæs Halgan Gastes gecyðnysse,
þæt is, his gewitnysse, for ðon þe he wurðode begen þone
heofenlican Fæder and þone Halgan Gast oft on his menniscnysse on þisum
middanearde, swa swa us swiðost segð Iohannes gesetnys on þære
feorðan Cristes bec, þe Iohannes sylf awrat.
 130. Se Halga Gast cydde gecyðnysse be Criste ærist þam
apostolum on þære upflora, þa þa he on fyres gelicnysse befeng hi
ealle and hy ealle onælde, swa swa man isen deð, butan
ælcere/ dare, mid incundre lufe.
 135. Hi wurdon þa gewissode wundorlice mid his gife be Cristes
menniscnysse, and hi cenlice bodedon cyningum and ealdormannum embe þæs
Hælendes fær; and on ealre soðfæstnysse he hi symle getrymde.
 139. His gifa syndon micele on seofonfealde wisan: on wisdome and
on andgite and on wislicum geþeahte, on modes anrædnysse mid micelre
strengðe, on soðum ingehyde and on arfæstnysse, on Godes ege eac mid
underþeodnysse; be þysum we sædon swutelicor iu ær.
 145. Mid godum inngehyde he gladaþ ure mod, and þurh hine we
oncnawað hwæt us to donne is, and he us gestrangað to þære
fremminge, þæt we for earfoðnysse ure anginn ne forlæton; and se ðe
Cristes Gast næfð, nis he na Cristes mann.
 150. And ge eac cyþað gecyðnysse be me, for ðan þe ge
fram anginne mid me wunedon.
 152. Ðurh þone Halgan Gast hi wurdon gebylde, and eac heora
anrædnyss eall wæs gestrangod þurh þæt þæt hi wunedon mid
þam wuldres Drihtne, on ealre his fare, fram frymðe his lare, and mihton
buton tweon bodian mancynne þæt þæt hi gehyrdon and hi sylfe
gesawon.
 158. Be þam cwæð Petrus on his bodunge iu: Of deaþe he
aras on þam þriddan dæge, and us he wæs geswutelod; na eallum folce,
ac we ðe æton mid him, and eac swilce druncon, æfter ðam þe he aras
of ðam deaþe gesund.
 163. Crist wolde habban him sylfum to gewitan þa halgan witegan
þe witegodon be him on þære ealdan gecyðnysse, ær ðan þe he
come to mannum, and eft syððan his apostolas, swa swa we sædon nu her;
and þa halgan martyras syndon his gewitan, þe heora lif sealdon, for his
geleafan ofslagene; and ælc þæra þe soð tæcð on soðfæstre
lare is Cristes gewita wið ða unrihtan gedwolan þe gedwyld lufedon
oþþe gyt lufiað.
 172. Ic spræc þas þing to eow þæt ge ne beon
geæswicode.
 173. Hi geutlagiað eow of heora gesamnungum.
 174. Se bið geæswicod þe on orwennysse þurh yfele
gebysnunga hihtleas befylþ, and byð þonne beswicen on synlicum gylte, gif
he unwær byð wið ða yfelan bysne.
 178. Nu warnode se Hælend wið þæt his apostolas, and
cwæð þæt þa ehteras of heora gemotum hi woldon geutlagian, and mid
ealle adræfan, swa swa þa Iudeiscan dydon eft syððan beswungon þa
apostolas, and him swiðe forbudon þæt hi nan ðing ne bodedon be þam
Hælende nahwar; ac hi noldon geswican swaðeah þære bodunge, cwædon
þæt hit gedafenað Drihtne to gehyrsumienne swiðor þonne mannum; and
hi swa eac dydon.
 187. Ac se tima becymð þæt þa ðe eow ofsleað,
þæt/ hi wenað þæt hi gearcian Gode þenunge swa.
 189. Þa Iudeiscan wendon þe wunnon wið ðone Hælend
þæt hi Moyses lage mihton swa gefyllan, mid þam þe hi acwealdon
Cristes bydelas, þe þæt godspell bodedon under Godes gife, on þære
niwan gecyðnysse, þa ða Iudeiscan ne cuðon.
 194. Þa oftorfodon hi Stephanum mid stanum oð deað, and
þone rihtwisan Iacob mid heora reðnysse, and þone oþerne Iacob hi eac
beheafdedon, and besetton ehtnysse on þa oðre apostolas, and mid
niðfullum hatungum heora lare onscunodon.
 199. And þas ðing hi doð on heora gedwylde, for ðan þe hi
ne cunnon minne Fæder ne me.
 201. Ða Iudeiscan noldon urne Drihten oncnawan mid soðum
geleafan, þæt he Godes Sunu is, ac mid anwilnysse his wordum
wiðcwædon, and nabbað nu naðor ne þone Fæder ne hine, swa swa he
sylf sæde on sumum oðrum godspelle: Se ðe me hatað, he hatað minne
Fæder.
 207. Ac þas ðing ic spræc to eow þæt ge beon gemyndige,
þonne heora tima cymð, þæt ic hit eow sæde.
 209. Se Hælend hi warnode wið þa toweardan gefeoht, for
ðan þe gehwa mæg micele eað acuman þa earfoðnyssa þe him æror
beoð cuðe, þonne þa færlican þe him færinga becumað.
 213. And micel frofor him wæs on þam gefeohte eft, þæt se
sylfa hi warnode þe him symle mihte on þam gewinne gehelpan, þæt hi
hæfdon sige, and æfter þam sige heom gesælþe forgifan, and þone
ecan wurðmynt on wuldre mid him, se ðe a rixað on ecnysse.
 218. AMEN.
