ÆHom 10
B1.4.10.
Dominica Pentecosten: Pope 1967-8, I, 396-405.



 1. Iohannes se godspellere, þe ðis godspell awrat, sæde
þæt se Hælend her on þisum life on sumne sæl spræce to his
apostolum ðus: Se ðe me soðlice lufað, he hylt mine spræce, and min
Fæder hine lufað, and wyt becumað to him, and mid him wuniað witodlice
begen.
 7. Se þe me ne lufað, ne hylt he mine spræce.
 8. And seo spræc þe ge gehyrdon, nis heo na min spræc, ac
þæs ylcan Fæder þe me asende.
 10. Ic spræc ðas þing to eow mid eow nu wunigende.
 11. Se halga Froforgast þe min Fæder asent on minum naman eow,
he eow tæcð ealle þing, and eow ealle þing geswutelað, swa hwæt
swa ic eow secge.
 14. Ic forlæte eow sibbe, and mine sibbe eow sylle.
 15. Ne forgife ic eow swa swa þes middaneard gifð.
 16. Ne beo eower heorte gedrefed, ne ne forhtige nateshwon.
 17. Ge gehyrdon þæt ic sæde soðlice nu eow, þæt ic
sylf nu fare, and ic cume to eow.
 19. Gif ge me lufedon, ge witodlice blissodon, for ðam þe ic
fare to minum Fæder nu, for ðan þe se Fæder is mare þonne ic sy.
 22. And nu ic hit eow secge ær ðan þe hit gewurðe,
þæt ge þonne his gelyfon þonne hit gedon bið.
 24. Ne sprece ic na fela þing heonon forð to eow.
 25. Ðises middaneardes ealdor to me sylfum becom, and he nan
þing næfð eallunga on me; ac oncnawe þes middaneard þæt ic minne
Fæder lufige, and swa swa he bebod me gesette, swa ic do untwylice.
 29. Se Hælend us sæde on þisum halgan godspelle þæt se
ðe me lufað, he hylt mine spræce.
 31. Þære lufe fandung is þæs weorces fremming, þæt
is þæt God wile þa weorc habban æt us, þæt we mid godum weorcum
hine wurðian a, na mid nacodum wordum butan þære fremminge, for ðan
þe seo lufu sceall beon geswutelod mid dædum.
 36. And min Fæder hine lufað, and wit becumað to him, and
mid him wuniað witodlice begen.
 38. Gesælig bið se mann þe swilce cuman underfehð, gif he
mid unþeawum hi aweg ne adrifð, ne mid sweartum synnum, swilce cuman him
fram.
 41. Ne hi ne cumað na butan heora begra Lufu, þæt is se
Halga Gast, þe hi asendon begen on þysum ylcan dæge ofer ða apostolas,
þæt Godes lufu wære wuniende mid heom, for ðon þe hi on eorðan
embe God þa smeadon, and his willan gefremedon mid þæs weorces fremminge
on manegum wisum, on wundrum and tacnum, þurh ðone ylcan Gast æfre
gestrangode.
 49. God sylf afandað ælces mannes heortan, hwæðer se
mann wylle his wununge habban, oþþe leahtras lufian, þe Gode misliciað;
and nan mann ne bið fram Gode forlæten, buton he sylf forlæte his lufe
him ær fram, and bið þonne his gylt þæt hine God swa forlæt, for
ðan þe he ne rohte on his receleaste Godes wununge on him, ne eac his
neosunge.
 57. Se Hælend us sæde on þysum soðum godspelle, Se ðe
me ne lufað, ne hylt he mine spræce.
 59. Ne bið seo lufu idel, gif heo God lufað, ac wyrcð
mihtilice micele þing æfre, and gif heo wyrcan nele, nis heo þonne
lufu.
 62. Godes lufu sceal beon geswutelod on us on muðe and on mode
and on þæs mannes life, þæt he Godes spræce mid godnysse gefylle.
 65. And seo spræc þe ge gehyrdon, nis heo na min spræc, ac
þæs ylcan Fæder þe me asende.
 67. Se Hælend, þe ðis spræc, is gehaten Word, of ðam
Fæder acenned, and he sylf cwæð forði þæt seo spræc nære
þe he þa spræc to him his sylfes agen spræc, ac his Fæder
spræc, þonne he is þæs Fæder Word þe wið hi þa swa spræc;
and heom bam synd gemæne, butan ælcere tweonunge, ægðer ge word ge
weorc, and witodlice ealle þing.
 74. Ic spræc þas ðing to eow mid eow nu wunigende.
 75. He wæs ða mid heom wunigende lichamlice, and he heom fram
ferde swiðe fus to heofonum, to his ecan myrhðe, þe he æfre hæfde,
and he wunode swaðeah witodlice mid him þurh his godcundnysse, and hi
gewissode a.
 80. Se halga Frofergast, þe min Fæder asent on minum naman
eow, he eow tæcð ealle þing, and eow ealle þing geswutelað, swa
hwæt swa ic eow secge.
 83. Se Halga Gast is gehaten Paraclitus on Greciscre spræce, and
on Leden Consolator, þæt is Frefrigend on Englisc, for ðan þe he
gefrefrað þæra manna heortan þe heora synna behreowsiað, and he sylf
gedeþ ealra synna forgifennysse on eallum middanearde, þurh his micclan
gife, and he gegladað ælcne þe on Gode truwað, and ealle þa englas
þe eardiað on heofenum he endemes gegladað to Godes lufe æfre, for
ðan þe he sylf is soðlice Godes lufu, þæs Fæder and þæs
Suna, him symle gemæne, of him bam æfre, anes gecyndes.
 95. He wearð asend þa, swa swa se Hælend sæde, fram ðam
halgan Fæder, and fram his Suna eac, on fyres gelicnysse swiðe hlude
swegende ufan of heofenan ofer ða apostolas on þysum ylcan dæge on anre
upflora; on ðam huse wæron hundtwelftig manna ða, þæs Hælendes
folgeras, þe him folgodon on life; on þam wæs þæt anginn ealles
Cristendomes, and hi eallne middaneard, þurh ða micclan gife þæs
Halgan Gastes, to Gode gebigdon.
 105. We habbað gesæd swutellicor be þisum on þam oðrum
spelle þe her to gebyrað, on þam man mæg gehyran be þam Halgan
Gaste, se ðe hit rædan wyle, oþþe rædan gehyrð.
 109. Buton se Halga Gast nu eowre heortan onlihte mid his gastlican
gife, ne gað ure word aht innto eowre heortan, eow to onbryrdnysse, ne to
nanre beterunge butan his gife.
 113. Ealle ge gehyrað þas ane rædinge, and swaðeah butan
twyn ne beoð ealle eowre mod gelice onlihte þurh ðas lare endemes, for
ðan þe se Halga Gast þurh his godcundnysse his gife eow forgifð be
þam þe he wyle; he is ælmihtig God, and he ealle þing gehylt mid þam
Fæder and þam Suna, on anre godcundnysse.
 120. Se Hælend þa sæde his apostolum þus: Ic forlæte
eow sibbe, and mine sibbe eow sylle.
 122. Sibbe he forgeaf symle his apostolum, and sibbe he lufað on
geleaffullum mannum, mid soðfæstnysse, a butan swicdome.
 125. He forlet hi on sibbe, and heom syððan forgeaf his þa
ecan sibbe on his rice mid him.
 127. Ne forgife ic eow swa swa ðes middaneard forgifð.
 128. Ðes middaneard forgifð þa gewitendlican þing, and he
forgifð þa ecan þam þe hine lufiað.
 130. Ne beo eower heorte gedrefed, ne ne forhtige nateshwon.
 131. Se Hælend hi gefrefrode mid his fægerum wordum, nolde
þæt hi wurdon wiðinnan gedrefede for his fundunge þa and his fær to
heofenum, and he heom þus sæde, swa swa ðis godspell us segð: Ge
gehyrdon þæt ic sæde soðlice nu eow þæt ic sylf nu fare, and ic
cume to eow.
 137. For ðan þe he ða ferde, and he gefette hi eft to
þære ecan blisse, swa swa he heom behet.
 139. Gif ge me lufedon, ge witodlice blissodon, for ðan þe ic
fare to minum Fæder nu, for ðan þe se Fæder is mare þonne ic sy.
 142. Hi lufodon hine ealle, and swaðeah forhtodon, for ðan þe
he swa fus wæs fram heom þa to heofonum, ac hi mihton blissian on mode
þæs ðe swiðor, þæt he to wuldre ferde of ðisum gewinnum, and
þæt hi sylfe moston syððan him fylian.
 147. On þære menniscnysse is se Fæder mare, and be
þære he spræc swa ær his ðrowunge, ær ðan þe he sylf wæs
gewuldrod mid his æriste, and swa is gecweden be Cristes menniscnysse.
 151. Be þam ðe he soð God is, he wæs symle acenned of
ðam ælmihtigan Fæder, eal swa mihtig swa he, for ðam þe se
ælmihtiga ne mæg beon na læsse; be þam þe he mann wæs, he
wæs of Marian acenned; be þam þe he lichama wæs, he læg bebyrged;
on þam ðe he dead wæs, he aras of deaþe, þæt is on ðam menn,
þe mihte beon dead, for ðan þe his godcundlice miht ne mihte beon dead.
 159. Arrius hatte iu sum healic gedwola, se wolde lytlian þone
leofan Hælend, þæt he unmihtigre wære on his mægenþrymme
þonne se halga Fæder wæs on his godcundnysse; ac þam gedwolan becom,
for his micclum gedwylde, swyðe bysmorlic deað, swa swa bec us secgað,
swa þæt him aeode ut eall his innoð togædere þa ða he to gange
eode, and he swa earmlice swealt, swa æmtig on innoðe swa swa his geleafa
wæs, for ðan þe he wolde wanian on his gewitleaste þæs
Hælendes mihte, þe ne mæg beon gewanod.
 170. Olimpius wæs gehaten sum oðer gedwola, se sæt him on
bæðe, and he ungesæliglice spræc mid gedwylde, for ðan þe he
gedwola wæs, hæfde him to hospe þa halgan ðrynnysse, ac him com fyr
to færlice ehsynes, and forbærnde his lic eall on þam baþe to colum,
þæt he mihte witan hwæne he tælde.
 177. We sceolon gelyfan on þone lyfigendan Hælend, þæt he
ælmihtig God is æfre mid þam Fæder, and mid þam Halgan Gaste, on
anre godcundnysse; seo godcundnys ne mæg næfre beon gelytlod.
 181. Ðis godspell segð git forð þæt se Hælend sæde
ða, And nu ic hit eow secge ær ðan þe hit gewurðe, þæt ge
þonne his gelyfon þonne hit gedon byð.
 184. Þis is swutellice gesæd, and he sæde forð git, Ne
sprece ic na fela þing heonon forð to eow, for ðan þe he þæs on
merien for mancynne ðrowode, and ne spræc na leng on þam life wið hi.
 188. Ðises middaneardes ealdor to me sylfum becom, and he nan
ðing næfð eallunga on me.
 190. Þæt wæs se sylfa deofol, þe on ðam synfullum
rixað, and is yfel ealdor arleasra manna, se com to þam Hælende, cunnode
gif he mihte ænige synne oþþe sumne gylt on Criste afindan, ac he ne
funde nan þing, swa swa se Hælend her him sylf sæde nu on þisum
godspelle þe ge gehyrdon nu.
 197. Se deofol þa forleas þæt he gelæht hæfde to his
anwealde æror of Adames cynne, eall þæt on God gelyfde, and hi alysde
Crist, se ðe butan synnum unscyldig þrowode, and he sigefæst swa
siðode heonon mid þam herereafe þe he on helle gefette, ealle his
gecorenan of Adames cynne.
 204. Se hælend cwæð þa gyt on þises godspelles ende, Ac
oncnawe þes middaneard þæt ic minne Fæder lufige, and swa swa he
bebod me gesette, swa ic do untwylice.
 207. On þam we magon tocnawan þæt Crist lufode his Fæder,
on þam þe he wæs gehyrsum his Fæder oþ deað, and be his bebode he
us swa alysde, sylfwilles swaðeah; þam sy a wuldor mid þam Halgan Gaste
on ecnysse, AMEN.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

ÆHom 11
B1.4.11.
Sermo ad populum in octavis Pentecosten dicendus: Pope 1967-8, I, 415-47.



 1. We wyllað eow secgan sume swutelunge nu be þam halgum tidum
ðe we healdað and weorðiað on geleaffullum cyrcum mid Godes lofsangum,
þæt ge sum andgit þæron tocnawan magon, hu eall ðæs geares
ymbegang Gode ælmihtigum ðeowað.
 6. Ærest we worðiað on Middewintres Dæge ures Hælendes
acennednysse, hu he to mannum com on soðre menniscnysse mid flæsce
befangen for ure alysednysse of þam halgan mædene Maria gehaten, seo ðe
ana is ægþer ge mæden ge modor.
 12. On þam twelftan dæge þære tide ymbeganges we
wurðiað mid lofsangum hu ða geleaffullan cyningas of eastdæle comon
ðe Criste lac brohton, and hu he wearð gefullod fram þam fulluhtere
Iohanne on ðære ea Iordane on ðam ylcan dæge, þeah ðe he unsynnig
wære, ac he wolde sylf swa gehalgian ure fulluht mid his halgan lichaman,
and ealle wæterstreamas mid his ingange.
 20. On þam feowerteogoðan dæge fram his acennednysse, ðe
we cweðað on Englisc Candelmæssedæg, bær þæt halige mæden
his modor Maria ðone heofonlican æþeling to þam halgan temple mid
þam ælicum lacum, swa swa se ælmihtiga God ær Moysen bebead, þam
mæran heretogan, and se ealda Symeon him sealde ðær bletsunge, and be
him witegode, and eac seo wudewe Anna.
 28. On Lengtenes anginne we eac swylce wurðiað mid urum
lofsangum hu se leofa Hælend on þam westene fæste feowertig daga
tosomne, and hu hine ðær costnode se hetela deofol, ac he wearð
oferswiðed þurh þone soðan Hælend.
 33. Eft we weorðiað on ufeweardan Lengtene on halgum
rædingum þæs Hælendes ðrowunge, hu he wæs gefæstnod for urum
synnum on rode on Langgan Frigedæge mid feower næglum, and gewundod mid
spere syððan he gewiten wæs, and hu he wæs bebyrged on þam ylcan
dæge, and us swa alysde mid his agenum deaðe.
 40. He aras eft of deaðe on þam Easterdæge, mid þam ylcan
lichaman ðe he ær on ðrowode to ecum ðingum awend, mid undeadlicnysse,
and we wurðiað þa tid wurðlice mid sangum seofon niht on an, swilce hit
an dæg sy, for ðære micelan mærðe mancynnes alysednysse.
 46. On ðam feowerteogoðan dæge þæs ðe he of deaðe
aras, he astah to heofonum to his halgan Fæder, mid þam ylcan lichaman
ðe he of deaðe arærde, ætforan his apostolum, þe him folgodon on
life; and we eac wurðiað wurðlice þone dæg on ðunresdæg on
ðære Gangwucan, for ðam ðe he geopenode us infær to heofonum mid
his agenum upstige, gif we hit geearnian willað.
 54. Eft ðæs ymbe tyn niht on urum ðeowdome we mærsiað
þone dæg mid mærlicum wurðmynte þe we hatað Pentecosten, on ðam
com se Halga Gast of heofonum swegende ofer ða halgan apostolas, on fyres
gelicnysse, and afylde þæt hus ðær þær hi inne sæton, and
sealde heora ælcum swa micele mihte, þæt hi mihton sprecan mid eallum
gereordum ðe on eorðan syndon, and hi eac gebylde to ðære
godspellican/ bodunge, swa þæt hi unforhte ferdon geond ðas woruld, and
ða hæþenan gebigdon to þæs Hælendes geleafan, and fela wundra
worhton, and gefullodon mancynn.
 66. Seofon dagas we wurðiað mid urum sange on cyrcan ðone
halgan tocyme þæs Halgan Gastes, for ðære seofonfealdan gife þe he
gifð mannum, swa swa we sædon eow on sumum spelle ær, hu he todælð
his gifa on geleaffullum mannum be þam ðe he sylf wile, for ðan ða he
soð God is.
 72. On ðyssere wucan we wurðodon ðas tid, and nu todæg we
heriað þa halgan þrynnysse mid urum ðeowdome, and on ðyssere wucan
oð Sunnanæfen we singað be þam, and we belucað swa mid urum
lofsangum þone halgan geleafan þe we habbað to Gode, for ðan ðe we
gelyfað on þone lyfiendan God, on ða halgan þrynnysse, þe heofonas
gewylt and ealle gesceafta, an ælmihtig Scyppend, swa swa gewrita cyðað
on Cristenum bocum, and ða halgan fæderas, fram frymðe middaneardes.
 83. Æfre wæs se Fæder witodlice mid þam Suna, and eac se
Halga Gast, on eallum his færelde, for ðan ðe hi ðry sind an
þrymwealdend God on anre Godcundnysse æfre rixiende, on anum gecynde,
ealle gelice mihtige; ac se sunu ana soðlice underfeng ða menniscnysse of
us, þe he us mid alysde.
 90. Eall ðæs geares ymbegang herað God ælmihtigne, and we
mid urum ðeowdome geðwærlæcað þam tidum, ac we nellað nu secgan
na swiðor embe ðæt, ac we wyllað embe us sylfe secgan hwæthwega.
 94. Se frumsceapena mann, swa swa we sædon eow oft, Adam ure
fæder, wæs ðurh God swa gesceapen þæt he beon mihte butan synnum
æfre, and eac butan deaðe, gif he his Drihtne gehyrde; and gif he syngode,
he sceolde beon deadlic; and he wurde gesælig gif he na ne syngode, þa
ða he soðlice mihte synna forbugan, and he wurde earming, ða ða he
eaðelice mihte synna forbugan, gif he syngode.
 103. Ða com se ealda deofol mid andan afylled, and beswac ðone
mann, þæt he syngode wið God, and his bebod tobræc þe he him bebead
to healdenne, and he wearð ða deadlic, and eall his ofspring syððan.
 107. Ne gesceop God þone deað, ne he soðlice ne blissað on
manna forwyrde, swa swa gewritu secgað.
 109. <foreign>Inuidia autem diaboli mors intrauit in orbem terrarum</foreign>: Ac
ðurh þæs deofles andan se deað com on ðas woruld.
 111. On ðreo wisan he cymð, swa swa hit fullcuð is: <foreign>Mors
acerba, mors inmatura, mors naturalis</foreign>; ðæt is on Englisc, se bitera
deað, se ungeripoda deað, and se gecyndelica.
 115. Se bitera deað is gecweden þe bið on cildum, and se
ungeripoda deað, on geongum mannum, and se gecyndelica, þe becymð þam
ealdum.
 118. Ælc man him ondræt þæs lichaman deað, and feawa
him ondrædað þære sawle deað.
 120. Þam lichaman men tiliað, þe lange lybban ne mæg, and
ne tiliað þære sawle þe ne swelt on ecnysse.
 122. Ne becymð na yfel deað þam ðe ær wel lyfode, ac se
hæfð yfelne deað ðe þam deaðe folgode, and on yfelum dædum
deofle gecwemde.
 125. Ne ðearft ðu na hogian hu ðu sceole sweltan, ac hoga
ðu swiðor hu ðin sawol sceole æfter þam forðsiðe faran be
gewyrhtum, oððe to reste, oððe to reþum witum.
 129. Twegen deaðas synd, swa swa us secgað bec: an is ðæs
lichaman deað, þe eallum mannum becymð, oðer is ðære sawle deað,
þe ðurh synna becymð, na eallum mannum, ac þam manfullum anum, and
heora sawul losað fram þam ecan life, and ne swelt ðeah næfre on
ðære hellican susle, ac bið æfre geedniwed to þam ecum witum.
 136. Þysum deaðe ætwindað, swa swa ure Drihten cwæþ,
ða ðe his word healdað, and hi habbað þæt ece lif mid þam
soðan Hælende, þe hi gehyrsumedon on life.
 139. Ælc man ðe Godes freond is sceolde swyðe æfstan
æfre mid godum weorcum, þæt he Gode gecwemde, and to þam earde becume
ðe us behaten is, þæt is heofonan rice, swa swa Crist us behet.
 143. Hwa dorste æfre gewilnian þæs wynsuman eardes, and swa
miceles wurðmyntes, gif se welwillenda Hælend us ne behete þone
heofonlican eard, and forði com to middanearde þæt he mancynn alysde,
ægðer ge weras ge wif, and ða unwittigan cild, and ða gehadodan menn
þe healdað heora clænnysse, and wið deofles costnunge dæghwamlice
campiað; nu ne mæg Godes behat beon us alogen, ðe us hæfð behaten
heofonan rices myrhðe, for his arfæstnysse, na for ure godnysse.
 153. Micel heap andbidað þær ura holdra freonda ures tocymes
to him, hohfull git embe us, orsorh be him sylfum, woldon us geseon on
ðære ylcan blisse ðe hi on wuniað.
 157. Hwa nele nu efstan to ðære ecan blisse fram þyssere
earfoðnysse ðe we on wuniað, fram deofles hæftnyssum to þam
arfæstan Drihtne?
 160. Is swaðeah micel neod þæt ða ðe manegum fremiað,
þæt heora lif beo þæs ðe leng mid us, and mid heora fultume us
gefyrðriun to Gode.
 163. Se syrwienda deofol swicað æfre embe us, and on þæs
mannes forðsiðe fela cnottan him bryt; ac se mann behofað micclum gebeda
gehadodra manna, þe him foreðingian on his forðsiðe, þæt he þam
feonde ætberste; for ðam ðe we rædað on bocum þæt se reða
feond come swilce egeslic draca to anum licgendum cnihte, wolde his sawle
habban for his synnum to helle, ac ðær comon munecas to on ðæs mannes
forðsiðe, and geornlice bædon for þam geongan cnihte, oððæt hi
swa afligdon þone feondlican dracan, and se cniht gewyrpte, and wunode on
life, oððæt he his synna gebette, and eft syððan gewat, ac he ne
geseah ðone dracan ða, for ðan ðe he oferswiðed wæs.
 177. Man sceal eac syllan þam seocan men husel, þa hwile ðe
he hit þicgan mæg, ær ðam ðe he sawlige, for ðan ðe us secgað
bec þæt he hit sceole ðicgan, ac he his ne mæg onbyrian gif he bið
gewiten ær.
 181. To goddra manna forðsiðe God asent his englas, þæt hi
heora sawla onfon on heora forðsiðe, and gelædon to reste, swa swa we
leorniað on bocum, and Crist him tæcð wununge be heora gewyrhtum.
 185. Ða ðe gode beoð, and Gode ær gecwemdon, on eallum
godum weorcum, ða wuniað mid Gode, and ða ðe ne beoð ful gode, ne
afeormode mid ealle fram eallum heora synnum, þa sceolon to witum faran, and
on þam witum þrowian, oððæt hi wurðon clæne, and þurh
ðingrædene ðanon alysde.
 191. Ða fordonan synfullan þe deofle gehyrsumodon on eallum
synnum, and forsawon heora Drihten, and swa geendodon, þa sceolon to helle
swa raðe swa hi gewitað, and ðær wunian æfre.
 195. Gif se man wolde huru, þonne he seoc bið, to Gode
gecyrran, and his synna geandettan mid soðre bereowsunge, se soðfæsta
Dema him wolde mildsian, þæt he moste huru on Domesdæge þam deofle
ætwindan.
 200. Nis na eallum mannum se gemænelica deað gelice earfoðe,
ac foroft becymð þam synfullan men sumera synna forgyfennys, þurh ðone
earfoðan deað þe hine swa swiðe drehte, and ðurh ðone ogan þæs
egeslican deaðes.
 205. Sume eac blissiað on heora forðsiðe foroft, þonne hi
witodlice geseoð þæt hi sceolon to reste, and gladað þonne seo
sawul, and swa gewit of life.
 208. Sumera manna sawla siðiað to reste æfter heora
forðsiðe, and sume farað to witum, be þam ðe hi geworhton ær, and
beoð eft alysede þurh ælmesdæda, and swiðost þurh ða mæssan,
gif him man fore deð, and sume beoð fordemede mid þam deoflum to helle,
and se ðe æne cymð to helle, ne cymð he næfre ðanon, and se ðe
æne cymð to reste, ne cymð he næfre to witum.
 216. Seo sawul hæfð soðlice, swa swa us secgað bec,
þæs lichaman gelicnysse on eallum hyre limum, and heo gefret softnysse
oððe sarnysse, swa hwæðer swa heo on bið, be þam ðe heo
geearnode ær.
 220. Sume leahtras beoð on ðisum life gebette, and sume
æfter deaðe, swa swa ure Drihten sæde; ac ða micclan synna ne magon
þær beon gebette, ne þam fordonan ne fremað þæt þæt him man
fore deð, for ðan ðe he his ne geearnode ær on his life.
 225. Ða leohtan gyltas and ða lytlan synna beoð þonne
afeormode þurh ðæt witniendlice fyr, and nis nanes cynnes wite on
þyssere worulde swa teart swa swa þæt foresæde fyr þe afeormað
þa gymeleasan.
 229. Sume beoð þær lange, sume lytle hwile, be þam ðe
him fore beoð his frynd her on life, and be þam ðe he geearnode ær on
his life, and ælc mæg tocnawan oðerne on þam life, and ða ðe to
reste becumað oncnawað soðlice ge þa ðe hi ær cuðon ge þa ðe
hi na ne cuðon, for ðan ðe hi on weldædum wæron ær gelice.
 236. And þa halgan sawla þe on heofonum wuniað gebiddað for
us ðe on eorðan wuniað, and eac for ðam sawlum ðe syndon on witum,
and hi habbað gemynd heora holdra freonda, and we magon eac þingian ðam
ðe on witum beoð, and swiðust þurh mæssan, swa swa us secgað bec,
ac þam ðe on helle beoð ne gehelpð nan foreþingung.
 243. Þa halgan sawla syndon soðlice on blisse, on anfealdum
gyrlum þære ecan blisse, for ðan ðe hi lybbað nu butan heora
lichaman, ac hi onfoð heora lichaman, þeah ðe he formolsnod wære, eft
on ðam micclan dæge, þurh heora Drihtnes mihte, and hi beoð þonne
gefretewode mid fægerum lichaman, and þæt bið þæt oðer reaf
ðære ecan myrhðe, and hi beoð þonne ece, and æfre undeadlice, ge
on sawle ge on lichaman, gesælilice mid Gode, and heora lichama bið
ðonne swiðe leoht and wynsum, ðeah ðe he him hefig wære her on life
æror.
 254. Dæghwamlice hi willniað þæt Domesdæg cume
hraðe, þæt hi magon blissian on twyfealdre blisse, on sawle and on
lichaman, ac hi sceolon swaðeah be Godes willan abidan heora gebroðra
getel, and ðæra haligra manna ðe of middanearde cumað to him,
oððæt þær swa fela beon swa God foresceawode on ær, ða ða he
ærest gesceop ealle þas woruld.
 261. Nu hi sceawiað soðlice heora Scyppendes beorhtnysse, and
nis forði nan gesceaft þe hi geseon ne magon, ge on heofonum ge on
eorðan, ge ða ðe on helle beoð, ac hira bliss ne bið na swaðeah
gewanod, þurh ðæt þæt hi geseoð þa synfullan on witum, ac hi
ðanciað þæs ðe swiðor heora Scyppende æfre, þæt he hi swa
ahredde fram þam reðum witum.
 268. Þa halgan sawla geseoð swutollice ealle ðing, ac ða
arleasan sawla ðe on suslum wuniað ne magon gewitan hwæt gewyrð mid
us; hi habbað swaðeah hoge be heora freondum on life, þeah ðe hit naht
ne fremige, ne heora freondum ne him.
 273. Nis nanum men nu cuð, ne cucum ne deadum, ne nanum
gesceafte, swa swa se Hælend sæde, Hwenne se miccla dom eallum mannum
becume, for ðan ðe God sylf gesceop gesceafta swa swa he wolde, be nanes
oðres dihte, ne eac se dæg ne cymð þyssere worulde geendunge be
æniges mannes ræde, ac þurh his anes foresceawunge þe ealle ðing
gesceop.
 280. Ure Hælend sæde him sylf be þam dæge þæt
woruldmen bytliað and begað heora tilunge, and wæpmen wifiað, and
wifmen ceorliað, oðþæt se miccla dæg eallum mannum becymð, and se
Hælend sylf cymð mid his scinendum englum, and seo sunne forsweorcð, and
soðlice se mona, for ðam ormætan leohte þæs mihtigan Drihtnes.
 287. Understandað nu, men, hu micel miht is on Criste, þonne
seo sunne and se mona ne magon syllan nan leoht, for þam godcundan leohte
ðe gæþ of þam Hælende.
 290. Engla werod berað þa beorhtan rode him ætforan, and his
slagan geseoð hwæne hi ofslogon ær, and he æteowð þa wunda
gewislice him; þonne wepað þa synfullan and swiðe heofiað, þa ðe
on heora life ðone Hælend forsawon, and oncnawað heora synna mid
sorhfullum mode.
 296. Ðonne ofergæþ an fyr ealle ðas woruld, and se engel
blæwð þa seofoðan byman, þæt is seo æftemyste, and ealle men
arisað þe æfre wurdon on life mid lichaman cuce, and eal swa hraðe
beoð þa cuce ðe cumað þonne of helle swa swa ða lybbendan beoð
þe on life beoð gemette.
 302. Ða cucan beoð ofslagene sona mid þam fyre, ac hi beoð
þærrihte eft acucode on ecum lichaman, swa swa ða oðre, and hi ealle
ðonne beoð on anre ylde syððan, on þære ylde þe Crist wæs
ða ða he ðrowode, wæron hi on ylde deade, wæron hi on cildhade.
 308. Ælc man hæfð swaðeah his agene lenge, on ðære
mycelnysse þe he man wæs ær, oððe he beon sceolde, gif he fulweoxe,
se ðe on cildhade oððe samweaxen gewat.
 312. Swa swa God gesceop on sawle and on lichaman ge wæpmen ge
wifmen, and geworhte hi to men, and he ægðerne had eft syððan alysde,
swa he eac on Domesdæg of deaðe hi arærð, ge weras ge wif, and hi
wuniað æfre swa, butan ælcere galnysse, ge gode ge yfele, and nan wer
syððan ne gewifað næfre, ne wif ne ceorlað, ne hi cild ne
gestrynað.
 320. Ne ða halgan ne beoð þe to heofonum sceolon on ænigre
awyrdnysse, oððe wanhale, oððe anegede, þeah ðe he ær wære
lama on his life, ac his lima beoð him ealle ansunde, on scinendre
beorhtnysse, and grapiendlice on ðam gastlican lichaman.
 326. Ða wiðercorenan soðlice, ðe wuniað æfre on
suslum, hwæt sceal him ænig wlite on þam sweartan fyre, þonne he
æfre heofað, and egeslice gristbitað, and wolde gif he mihte wurðan to
nahte, oððe beon dead, ac he ne bið swaðeah, ne he of þam witum ne
mæg wurðan æfre alysed?
 332. Ælc man sceal arisan þonne þe æfre on life wæs;
wære he on wætere adruncen, oððe hine wilde deor æton, oððe
hine fyr forbærnde færlice to duste, and ðæt dust wurde toworpen mid
blædum, swaðeah se ælmihtiga God mæg hine eft aræran, se ðe
ealle þas woruld geworhte of nahte, and se ðe þises ne gelyfð, ne bið
his geleafa naht.
 339. Man bewint þone deadan gewunelice mid reafe, ac ðæt
reaf ne arist na ðe hraðor mid þam men, for ðan ðe he ne behofað
þæs huxlican reafes, ac þære gastlican gyrlan ðe him God
foresceawað.
 343. God asent þonne his englas, and hi gegaderiað him to ealle
his gecorenan of eallum middanearde, and standað ða godan men on Godes
swiðran hand, and ða wiðercorenan on his wynstran hand.
 347. Þonne sitt se Hælend on his heofonlican ðrymsetle,
mihtig and wuldorful, and milde þam godum, egeslic and andrysne þam earmum
synfullum, and ealle men geseoð swutollice þone Hælend on ðære
menniscnysse, ac ne moton swaðeah ða earman synfullan geseon his
godcundnysse; ða godan ana geseoð þa godcundnysse.
 354. His twelf apostolas, þe him folgodon on life, sittað
þonne eac on twelf domsettlum, and ealle ða halgan weras ðe ðas woruld
forleton, and woruldlice æhta mid ealle forsawon, sittað on domsetlum
soðlice mid him, and hi mid þam Hælende mancynne þonne demað.
 360. Ðær beoð feower gefylcu on þam micelan flocce:
þæt forme gefylc bið þe we her foresædon, þe sittað mid þam
Hælende on heora heahsettlum; him ne bið na gedemed, ac hi demað mid
Criste eallum oðrum mannum mihtelice on wuldre.
 365. Ðæt oðer werod bið þæra woruldmanna ðe on
godum weorcum Gode ær gecwemdon, and mid ælmysdædum geearnodon æt
Gode þa heofonlican wununge and þæt ece wuldor; hi ne demað nanum men,
ac him bið gedemed, swa þæt hi habbon heofonan rices wuldor.
 371. Ðæt þridde werod bið witodlice þonne þæra
Cristenra manna ðe cuðon heora geleafan, ac hi gremedon God mid gramlicum
dædum, and fullice lyfedon on fulum synnum æfre: morðslagan and
mandædan, and unmæðfulle gitseras, wigleras and wiccan, and
unlybwyrhtan, þeofas and reaferas, and ða reðan drymen, þa forsworenan
men, and ða swicelan wedlogan, ða fulan forliras, and ða fracodan
myltestran ðe acwellað heora cild ær þan ðe hit cuð beo mannum; hi
ne dydon nan god Gode to wurðmynte, ne nane ælmessan, ac geendodon on
synnum; him bið þonne gedemed mid þam deofle to helle.
 384. Þæt feorðe gefylc bið ðæra fulra hæðenra
þe nane cyððe ne hæfdon to þam heofonlican Gode, ne Cristes
geleafan ne cuðon on heora life; hi adrugon heora lif on deofles biggengum,
and hi butan Godes æ æfre syngodon, and eft butan Godes æ on ecnysse
forwurðað, mid þam leasan Cristenum æfre cwylmigende.
 391. Ne mæg þonne nan man nahwar beon behydd, ac ealle beoð
þær þe æfre cuce wæron, and þær beoð æteowde ure eallra
geðohtas, and ealle ure dæda eallum þam werodum; þæt ðe ær
wæs gebet ne bið þær na æteowed, ac ða ungebettan synna beoð
þær geswutelode; hi beoð þonne ofsceamode, and sorhfulle on mode,
þæt hi ær noldon andettan heora synna, and dædbote gedon be heora
lareowes dihte.
 400. Þær beoð ealle gelice, ge se hlaford ge se ðeowa, se
rica and se heana, on þam rihtan dome, and ðær nan man ne mæg ne ne
mot habban nane gewitnysse þe hine betelle, for ðan ðe his dæda beoð
undigle ðonne eallum.
 405. Ðonne cweð se Hælend of his halgan ðrymsettle to
ðam godum Cristenum ðe Godes willan gefremedon, ðe standað on his
swiðran healfe, þus secgende him to: <foreign>Uenite, benedicti Patris mei, Et
cetera</foreign>: Cumað, ge gebletsodan mines heofonlican Fæder, and habbað
þæt rice ðe eow gegearcod wæs fram þam forman anginne þissere
worulde.
 412. Me hingrode soðlice, and ge me gereordodon.
 413. Eft ða ða me þyrste, ge sealdon me drincan.
 414. Eac ic wæs cuma, and ge me underfengon.
 415. Ic wæs eac swilce nacod, and ge me scryddon.
 416. Ic wæs eac swilce untrum, and ge me geneosodon.
 417. On cwearterne ic wæs, and ge comon to me.
 418. Þonne andswariað hi ðam arfæstan Deman þus: Eala
ðu Drihten leof, hwænne gesawe we ðe oððe hungrienne and we ðe
feddon, oððe eft þurstine and we ðe scencton?
 422. Oððe hwænne wære ðu cuma and we ðe underfengon,
oððe/ hwænne wære þu unscryd and we ðe scryddon?
 424. Hwænne wære þu untrum and we ðe geneosodon, oððe
on cwearterne and we comon to ðe?
 426. Ðonne andwyrt se Cyning þam arfæstan and cweð: Soð
ic eow secge, þæt ge me sylfum dydon þas foresædan ðing, swa oft
swa ge hi dydon anum of ðisum lyttlum minra gebroðra.
 430. Þæt is soðlice swa to understandenne: swa oft swa ge
ælmessan dydon anum lytlan ðearfan of Cristenum mannum, þæt ge dydon
Criste, for ðan ðe Crist sylf is Cristenra manna heafod, and eft ða
Cristenan syndon Cristes lima.
 435. Ðonne cweð se Dema eft to ðam dreorigan heape ðe stent
on his wynstran hand, Gewitað heonan fram me, ge awyrigedan, into þam ecan
fyre ðe is ðam deofle gegearcod, and eallum his englum.
 438. Me hingrode soðlice, and ge me ne gereordodon; eft ic wæs
ðurstig, and ge me ne scencton.
 441. Eac ic wæs cuma, and ge me ne underfengon; ic wæs eac
swilce unscryd; nolde ge me scrydan.
 443. Ic wæs untrum and on cwearterne; ne come ge to me.
 444. Þonne andwyrdað þa synfullan þam soðan Deman ðus:
Eala ðu soða Drihten, hwænne gesawe we ðe hungrinne oððe
þurstigne, cuman oððe nacodne, untrumne oððe on cwearterne, and we ne
ðenodon ðe?
 448. Ðonne andwyrt se Dema þam earmum forscyldegodum: Soð ic
eow secge, me sylfum ge his forwyrndon swa oft swa ge his forwyrndon anum of
þisum lytlum.
 451. Ðonne gewitað þa earmingas and ða arleasan synfullan
into þam ecan wite mid þam awyrgedan deofle, and ða rihtwisan farað
forð mid þam Hælende to þam ecan life, mid his engla werodum.
 455. On ðisum wordum we magon gewislice tocnawan ðæt ða
synfullan beoð besencte ærest on helle, mid þam awyrgedum deoflum,
ðær ðær hi wunian sceolon, and ða halgan syððan siðiað to
heofonum.
 459. Be ðære ylcan endebyrdnysse awrat eac Iohannes ðus:
Heora ælcum wæs gedemed be his agenum weorcum; þonne se deað and seo
hell wurdon asende into þam bradan mere ðæs brastligendan fyres.
 463. Se deað and seo hell is se deofol sylf, for ðan ðe he is
ealdor ðæs ecan deaðes, and he is se ordfruma eallra ðæra witena.
 466. Þa cwæð eft Iohannes be ðam arleasum mannum:
ælc ðæra manna wæs aworpen into ðam widgillan mere ðæs bradan
fyres, ðe on ðære liflican bec æror næs awriten on þam ecan
gemynde, swa swa ðæra halgena naman ðe mid þam Hælende wuniað
syndon awritene on ðære wuldorfullan bec, þæt is seo forestihtung
fram frymðe mid Gode.
 473. On anum fyre hi byrnað on þam byrnendan mere, ða earman
menniscan menn, and ða modigan deoflu; þæt fyr bið ðonne ece, and hi
ecelice byrnað, ac heora lichaman ne magon næfre forbyrnan, for ðan ðe
hi beoð ece æfter þam æriste.
 477. Nu smeagað sume men hu ða ungesæligan deoflu magon
ðær gefredan ðæs fyres bryne on him, þonne hi syndon gastas, and
nabbað nanne lichaman.
 481. We secgað nu to soþan þæt ðæs mannes sawul is
belocen on his lichaman ða hwile ðe he lybbende bið, and heo of þam
lichaman ne mæg be hyre agenum dihte, ac ðæron forberð, swa betere
swa wyrse, blisse and sarnysse, and þonne heo ute bið, ne gefret se lichama
nane sarnysse.
 487. Eall swa eaðelice mæg se ælmihtiga God belucan ða
deofla on þam deorcan fyre, þæt hi ðæron cwylmion, and ofcuman ne
magon; and se ðe þa halgan englas on heofonum gegladað, se mæg eac
gedreccan þa deoflu on þam fyre, ðeah ðe hi gastas syndon,
forscyldegode ealle.
 493. Ðæra manna wite bið swa gemetegod þurh God þæt
se ðe hwonlicor syngode, þæt he hwonlicor ðrowað, and se ðe
swiðor syngode, þæt he swiðor ðrowige, and be his agenum geearnungum
ælc man ðær ðrowað.
 497. Ðæt liðoste wite and þæt leohtoste bið ðam
unwittigum cildum ðe wæron ungefullode, þe nane oðre synne ðurh hi
sylfe ne geworhton, buton þære anre ðe Adam þurhteah, and ðurh ða
ane wæs eall mancynn fordon, buton þam ðe gelyfdon on ðone lyfiendan
Hælend, and wurdon gefullode fram ðære fyrnlican synne.
 504. Ne magon þa fordemdan, ne furðon ða deoflu, þa blisse
geseon þe bið mid ðam halgum, syððan hi gebrohte beoð on þam
bradan fyre, ac hi ðær beclysede cwylmiað on eccnysse.
 508. Iohannes se Godspellere, on his gastlican gesihðe, cwæþ
þæt he gesawe syððan æfter ðisum, eallniwe heofonan and eallniwe
eorðan, for ðan ðe þes middaneard bið mid þam bradan fyre ðe on
Cristes tocyme cymð swa færlice eall geedniwod, and eac seo sunne and se
mona soðlice be seofanfealdum beoð beorhtran þonne hi nu syndon, be þan
ðe us secgað bec; and on ðære niwan heofonan, and on ðære niwan
eorðan ne beoð nane oðre buton Godes gecorenan, þe his halgum
gegearcode fela eardungstowa.
 519. Æfter ðysum dome ure Drihten færð to his heofonlican
Fæder, mid þam halgum mannum ðe he on middanearde of þære moldan
arærde, and betæchð hi his Fæder, swa hit stent on bocum: <foreign>Cum
tradiderit regnum Patri suo</foreign>: þæt is on urum gereorde, þonne he
betæhcð rice his Fæder; for ðan ðe hi beoð Godes rice, and hi
rixiað mid Gode.
 526. Crist him gelæst þonne, swa swa he him on life behet,
ða ða he clypode of eorðan to his ælmihtigan Fæder: Fæder min,
ic wylle þæt ða wunion mid me ðe ðu me forgeafe of ðisum
middanearde, ðær ðær ic sylf eom, þæt hi geseon magon mine
beorhtnysse, ðe ðu me forgeafe, for ðan ðe ðu lufudest me, ær
ðam ðe middaneard gewurde.
 533. Se Hælend soðlice is his halgena heafod, and hi mid him
rixiað, his englum gelice, and hi God geseoð, swa swutellice swa swa
englas, swa swa Iohannes cwæþ to ðam Cristenum mannum: We hine soðlice
geseoð swutellice swa swa he is.
 538. And eft se apostol Paulus on his pistole cwæð: Nu we menn
geseoð swilce þurh sceawere, and on rædelse, ac we eft geseoð fram
ansyne to ansyne on þam ecan life.
 542. Eft cwæþ se Hælend on his halgan godspelle, þæt
ðær ic sylf beo, ðær bið min ðen, and se ðe me ðenað, hine
gearwurðað/ min Fæder.
 545. Manega becumað of middanearde to heofonum Godes halgena, for
ðan ðe he habban wile micel werod mid him, swa swa hit wel gerist, and hi
beoð geendebyrde ælc be his geearnungum, and eac gewuldrode on þam
micelan wurðscipe, be ðam ðe hi on life lufodon heora Scyppend; and ðar
ne bið nan anda on heora ænigum, ac hi ealle beoð on anre
geðwærnysse, and on soðre sibbe symle wunigende.
 554. Ðær bið swiðe micel and swiðe mære on wuldre se
þe læst bið geðuht on þam life wunigende, and he ne gewilnað nanes
wuldres furðor ofer þæt ðe he hæfð þurh ðæs Hælendes
gife.
 558. Ælc man mæg ðær geseon oðres mannes geðoht, ne
him næfre ne hingrað, ne hefigmod ne bið, ne him ðurst ne derað, ne
hine ne drehð nan ðing, ac hi ealle beoð on anre blisse mid Criste, hine
lufigende buton toforlætennysse, and hine herigende butan werignysse, and
Crist sylf ðonne bið him eallum ælc ðing, and him naht wana ne bið,
þonne hi hine habbað.
 566. He is heora rice, and lif, and wurðmynt, heora hæl and
wuldor, sibb and genihtsumnys, and ðær soðlice bið an ece dæg, ðe
næfre ne geendað, and hi be twyfealdan beoð þonne gewuldrode on sawle
and on lichaman, and hi scinað æfre swa beorhte swa sunne on heora
Fæder rice.
 572. Se ðe leofað and rixað mid his leofan Suna and ðam
Halgan gaste, on anre godcundnysse, an ælmihtig God, a butan ende, AMEN.

END_TEXT

ÆHom 12
B1.4.12.
De sancta Trinitate et de festis diebus per annum: Pope 1967-8, I, 463-72.



 1. Se ælmihtiga Wealdend, ðe ne ongann næfre, & se ðe
ana is soð God, gesceop ealle ðing, gesewenlice & ungesewenlice, ðurh
his soðan Wisdom; & se Wisdom is witodlice his Sunu, ure Hælend Crist,
se ðe us alysde; & se ðridda had on ðære halgan ðrynnysse is se
halga Froforgast þe us gefrefrað mid his gyfe & ure mod onliht æfre
to goodnysse; & he ealra manna synna þurh his mihte forgyfð, þam ðe
mid dædbote doð geswicenysse.
 11. Se is soðlice lufu ðæs soðfæstan Fæder, &
his Suna lufu, & heora begra willa, for ðan ðe hi wyllað an.
 14. & ðurh ðone Gast syndon soðlice geliffæste ealle
ða gesceafta ðe se Fæder gesceop þurh his ancennedan Suna, swa swa us
secgað bec.
 17. Ðeos is seo halige ðrynnyss þe ealle þing gesceop, an
anre Godcundnysse æfre wuniende, on anum mægenðrymme, & on anum
gecynde.
 20. Englas he gesceop on ænlicre fægernysse, manega
ðusenda, on micelre strengðe, þæt hi mihton geseon Godes mærða
mid him, & mid him wunian on his ecum wuldre.
 24. Hi nabbað nanne lichaman, ac hi libbað on gaste,
ungesewenlice us þe on synnum libbað.
 26. And þa halgan englas, þe on heofenum wuniað, ne worhton
næfre nane synne, ne hi syngian ne magon, buton ðam anum ðe þanon
afeollon for heora modignysse ongean ðone ælmihtigan God.
 30. And hi wurdon ða awende to awyrgedum deoflum, for ðan ðe
hi noldon habban heora Scyppend heom to hlaforde, ac wolde se fyrmesta him sylf
beon God.
 33. Ða ne mihte he gewunian on ðære micclan mærðe, ne
eac his gegadan butan Godes mihte, ac wurdon ða asyndrode fram ðam soðan
Gode, for ðam ðe hi forleton his hlafordscipe ealle, swiðe unwislice,
fram him ascirode, mid andan afyllede & mid orwennysse ælcere mildsunge,
manfulle/ gastas.
 40. And ælc þæra yfela ðe on ðissere worulde becymð,
eall hit gewyrð æfre þurh þa awyrgedan gastas, & ðurh ða
yfelan menn þe hi magun forlæran to ðam yfelan willan þe hi on
wuniað.
 44. Witodlice on angynne se ælmihtiga God ealle ðing gesceop,
heofonas & eorðan, & ealne middaneard, þone widgillan garsecg,
& þa wundorlican niwelnyssa, & syððan þa twegen men on sawle
& on lichaman, Adam & Euan, to his anlicnysse; & se deofol beswac
syððan eft þa menn, þæt hi godes bebod tobræcon ðurh his lare,
& wurdon þa deadlice & fordemde to helle, & eall heora ofspring,
to ðam ecan wite.
 53. Ac se mildheorta Fæder, ðe us to mannum gesceop þurh his
ancennedan Suna, wolde eft alysan ðurh ðone ylcan Suna eall manncynn of
deofle & fram ðam ecan deaðe, & he cydde þæt ðurh witegana
cyðnysse on manegum wisum ær ðan ðe hit gewurde, þæt se
heofonlica æðeling her on worulde sceolde to menn beon acenned of anum
mædene.
 61. Ða on þære syxtan ylde þyssere worulde asende se halga
Fæder his heahengel Gabriel to Marian þam mædene, þe wæs Cristes
modor, & het hyre cyðan þæt heo cennan sceolde þæs heofonlican
Godes Sunu on hyre halgum innoðe; & heo ða gelyfde ðære liflican
bodunge & cwæð him to andsware, Ic eom Godes þinen, getimie me
æfter þinum worde.
 69. Heo wearð ða mid cilde æfter þære segene, & heo
eode mid þam cilde æfter gewunan nigon monðas fullice oð middewintres
timan, & heo ða acende Crist urne Hælend butan earfoðnysse, þæs
ælmihtigan Godes Sunu, on soðre menniscnysse, middaneardes Alysend.
 75. Ðonne we wyrðiað on Middewintres Dæge ures
Hælendes acennednysse, hu he to mannum com on soðre menniscnysse, mid
flæsce befangen, for ure alysednysse, of ðam halgan mædene Maria
gehaten, seo ðe ana is ægðer ge mæden ge moder.
 81. Twelf dagas we wurðiað to wyrðmynte þam Hælende mid
urum lofsangum for his micclan lufe on his acennednysse timan, for ðan ðe
he com to us þa us to alysenne of ðam laðan ðeowte hellewites, gyf we
hine lufiað.
 86. On ðam twelftan dæge þære tide ymbganges we
wurðiað mid lofsangum hu ða geleaffullan cyningas of eastdæle comon,
þe Criste lac brohton & hu he wearð gefullod fram ðam fulluhtere
Iohanne on ðære ea Iordane on ðam ylcan dæge, þeah ðe he unsynnig
wære, ac he wolde sylf swa gehalgian ure fulluht mid his halgum lichaman,
& ealle wæterstreamas mid his ingange.
 94. On ðam feowerteogoðan dæge fram his acennednysse, þe
we cweðað on Englisc Candelmæssedæg, bær þæt halige mæden
his modor Maria þone heofonlican æðeling to þam halgan temple mid
þam ælicum lacum, swa swa se ælmihtiga God ær Moysen bebead, þam
mæran heretogan, & se ealda Simeon him sealde þær bletsunge, &
be him witegode, & eac seo wuduwe Anna.
 102. He worhte on ðissere worulde wundra wel fela, to
geswutelienne þæt he soð God is: blinde he gehælde & þa
beddridan, healte & hreoflige to fulre hæle, þa wodan & þa
gewittleasan he gebrohte on gewitte, & þa deofla afligde þe hi
gedrehton ær.
 108. Uppan sae he eode, & þa sælican yða hine
abæron; & he þone blawendan wind mid his hæse gestilde, þæt
he ætstod sona, & þa scipmenn sædon þæt he soð Godes sunu
wære.
 112. Wæter he awende to wynsuman wine, & ealle untrumnyssa
he eaðelice gehælde, & ða deadan arærde þurh his drihtenlican
mihte, þæt hi lange leofodon on ðisum life syððan, & ælc god
he tæhte, swa swa þæt godspell us segð, & ælc yfel he forbead
& unrihtwisnysse, & we hine wurðiað on his weorcum & lare.
 119. On sumne sæl he afedde fif þusend manna, butan wifum
& cildum, & hi wel gereordode, mid fif berenum hlafum & twam lytlum
fixum, & þær wæron to lafe twelf wilian fulle.
 123. On oðrum sæle he afedde feower ðusend manna mid seofon
hlafum & feawum fixum, & hi læfdon þæs metes seofon spyrtan
fulle, & þa wifmenn næron mid heora winclum getealde.
 127. Ðyllice wundra wurðiað hine.
 128. On Lenctenes anginne we eac swylce wyrðiað mid urum
lofsangum hu se leofa Hælend on ðam westene fæste feowertig daga
tosomne & hu he hine ðær costnode se hetola deofol, ac he wearð
oferswiðed þurh þone soðan Hælend.
 133. Eft we wurðiað on ufeweardan Lenctene on halgum
rædingum þæs Hælendes ðrowunge, hu he us alysde of þam laðan
ðeowte, & fram ðæs deofles anwealde mid his agenum deaðe, on rode
ahangen for urum synnum, unsynnig him sylf, gefæstnod mid feower nægelum
& mid spere gewundod on his swiðran sidan syþþan he gewiten wæs,
& hu he wæs bebyrged on ðam ylcan dæge & us swa alysde mid his
agenum deaðe.
 142. He wearð þa bebyrged on ðam ylcan dæge, & he aras
of deaðe on ðam þriddan dæge, mid ðam ylcan lichaman ðe he ær
on ðrowode to ecum ðingum awend, mid undeadlicnysse, gewunnenum sige of
þam wælhreowan deofle, & he him of anam his agen handgeweorc, Adam
& Euan, & eall þæt he wolde of heora cynne þe him gecweme
wæron.
 150. And we wurðiað þa tid wurðlice mid sangum seofon niht
on an, swylce hit an dæg sy, for ðære micclan mærðe manncynnes
alysednysse.
 153. On ðam feowerteogeðan dæge þæs ðe he of deaðe
aras he astah to heofonum to his halgan Fæder, ætforan his apostolum,
ðe him folgodon on life, mid þære menniscnysse þe he of Marian genam,
& mid þam ylcan lichaman þe he of deaðe arærde.
 158. And we eac wurðiað wurðlice ðone dæg on þære
Gangwucan, for ðan þe he geopenode us on ðam foresædan dæge
infær to heofonum mid his agenum upstige, gif we hit geearnian wyllað.
 162. And he sitt nu on heofonum soþlice an Crist æt his
Fæder swiðran, & ealra gesceafta gewylt, & cymð eft to demende
on ðam micclan dæge eallum manncynne, ælcum be his dædum, & we
ealle menn cumað cuce him togeanes of urum deaðe aræred ðurh his
drihtenlican mihte, ælc mann ðe ær cucu wæs on his moder innoðe,
þæt ure ælc ðær onfo edlean æt Gode, swa god swa yfel, be ðam
ðe we geearnodon.
 171. Eft ðæs embe tyn niht on urum ðeowdome we mærsiað
þone dæg mid mærlicum wyrðmynte þe we hatað Pentecosten, on ðam
com se Halga Gast of heofonum swegende ofer ða halgan apostolas on fyres
gelicnysse, & afylde þæt hus þær þær hi inne sæton, &
sealde heora ælcum swa micele mihte þæt hi mihton sprecan mid eallum
gereordum þe on eorðan syndon.
 179. & hi eac gebylde to ðære godspellican bodunge, swa
þæt hi unforhte ferdon geond þas woruld, & þa hæðenan
gebigdon to þæs Hælendes geleafan, & fela wundra worhton, &
gefullodon manncynn.
 183. Seofon dagas we wurðiað mid urum lofsange on cyrcan þone
halgan tocyme þæs Halgan Gastes, for ðære seofonfealdan gife þe he
gifð mannum.
 186. He todælð his gifa on geleaffullum mannum be ðam ðe
he sylf wyle, for ðan ðe he soð God is.
 188. On ðære Pentecosten wucan we wurðiað þa tid, &
on ðam Sunnandæge ðe syððan bið þæræfter we heriað mid
lofsangum þa halgan þrynnysse mid soðum geleafan, & we belucað swa
mid urum lofsangum þone halgan geleafan þe we habbað to Gode, for þan
ðe we gelyfað on þone lyfigendan God, on ða halgan ðrynnysse þe
heofonas gewylt & ealle gesceafta, an ælmihtig Scyppend.
 197. We secgað nu be ðam soðan Gode þe ealle ðing
gesceop, se ðe ana is God, þæt he is wunigende, swa swa ða witegan
secgað, æfre on ðrim hadum, butan anginne & ende.
 201. Se ælmihtiga Fæder nis of nanum oðrum; se gestrynde
ænne Sunu of him anum acennedne, & se wæs æfre wunigende ær
anginne mid him on his halgum bosme, & ðurh hine he gesceop ealle þa
gesceafta þe gesceapene syndon, for ðan ðe he is se wisdom of þam wisan
Fæder, & seo micele miht of ðam mihtigan Fæder, ðurh ðone þe
he gedihte ðone deopan cræft, & he ealle þing geliffæste þurh
ðone lyfigendan Gast, se ðe is witodlice heora Willa & Lufu, him bam
gemæne on anre Godcundnysse, & on anum mægenðrymme anes gecyndes.
 213. He nis na acenned, ac he cymð of him bam swa swa lufu &
willa, for ðan þe hi wyllað an, se Fæder & se Suna & se
foresæda Halga Gast.
 216. Hi synd þry on namum on ðrynnysse wunigende, ac seo an
Godcundnyss þe him eallum is gemæne nele geþafian þæt hi þry
godas syndon, ac an ælmihtig God on soðre annysse.
 220. Nu is se Fæder Fæder & se Suna Sunu, & heora
begra Willa, þæt is witodlice seo Lufu heora micclan mægenþrymmes,
æfre swa wunigende, þæt heora nan nis læssa ne lator þonne oðer,
for ðan ðe seo Godcundnyss ne gæð næfre on twa, ne heo nateshwon ne
underfehð nane lytlunge.
 226. Se Sunu ana is soðlice acenned ærest of þam Fæder
buton ælcere meder, & eft of Marian butan eorðlicum Fæder, þæt
he us alysde & us lif forgeafe on his heofenlican wuldre mid his halgum
englum.
 231. Ðæs we him ðanciað on urum þeowdome, & his
halgan Fæder þe hine asende to us, þam is an wyrðmynt mid þam Halgan
Gaste on ealra worulda woruld; we cweðað, Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

ÆHom 13
B1.4.13.
Dominica I post Pentecosten: Pope 1967-8, I, 479-89.



 1. Sum Phariseisc mann was gehaten Nichodemus, an þæra ealdra
Iudeisces folces: se com hwilon nihtes to þam Hælende, and cwæð, We
witon, leof lareow, þæt ðu fram Gode come: ne mæg nan mann soðlice
swylce tacna wyrcan swilce swa ðu wyrcst, buton God beo mid him.
 7. Se Hælend andwyrde and þus him cwæð to: Soð soð ic
þe secge, þæt nan mann ne gesyhþ Godes rice æfre, buton he beo eft
acenned.
 10. Him cwæð Nichodemus to, swiðe þæs ofwundrod, Hu
mæg se ealda mann eft beon acenned?
 12. Mæg he, la, inn faran to his modor innoðe eft, and swa
beon geedcenned?
 13. Ac him cwæð se Hælend to, Soð soð ic þe secge,
swa hwa swa ne bið geedcenned of wætere and of ðam Halgan Gaste, ne
mæg he inn to Godes rice.
 16. Ðæt þe of flæsce byð acenned, þæt bið
witodlice flæsc, and þæt þe of gaste bið acenned, þæt bið
gast untwylice.
 18. Ne wundra ðu nateshwon þæt ic ðe nu sæde, þæt
eow gebyrað þæt ge beon eft acennede.
 20. Se gast orðaþ soðlice þær ðær he orðian wile,
and þu his stemne gehyrst, ac ðu swaðeah nast hwanon se gast cume,
oþþe hwider he fare; þus bið ælc þæra manna þe of ðam gaste
bið acenned.
 24. Nichodemus him cwæð to, Hu magon þas þing gewurðan?
 25. Se Hælend him andwyrde eft, þus him secgende: þu eart
æðele lareow on Israhela þeode, and ðu þas þing nast?
 27. And he eft him to cwæð, Soð, soð ic þe secge,
þæt we soðlice sprecað þæt þæt we geare witon, and we eac
seðað þæt þæt we gesawon, and ge ure gecyðnysse nellað
underfon nateshwon mid eow.
 32. Gif ic eorðlice þing openlice eow secge, and ge þæra
ne gelyfað, hu gelyfe ge þonne gif ic þa heofenlican ðing eow secgan
wylle?
 35. And nan mann ne astihþ nateshwon to heofenum, buton se ðe
of heofonum hider nyðer astah, þæt is mannes Sunu, se ðe is on
heofonum.
 38. And swa swa Moyses on þam micclan westene þa næddran up
ahof to healicum tacne, swa gedafenað to ahebbenne on sumere heahnesse
þone/ mannes Sunu, þæt þa men ne losion þe on hine gelyfað, ac
habban heom þæt ece lif.
 43. Ðis halige godspell þe ge gehyrdon nu hæfð micele
getacnunge, ac we moton eow secgan be eowrum andgite, þæt ge ealles ne
beon þære lare bedælede, ne ure Drihtnes worda.
 47. Se Sunderhalga wæs gehaten Nichodemus, þe on nihtlicre
tide genealæhte to Criste: wolde gehyran his halgan lare, swa huru digollice
nihtes, for ðan þe he ne dorste dæges, for ðan þe þa Iudeiscan mid
dyrstigum anginne ælcne geutlagodon þe on hine gelyfde.
 53. He wæs an þæra ealdra of ðam yldostum witum Iudeisces
folces, and he ferde nihtes to þæs Hælendes spræce, and him ðus
cwæð þa to: We witon, leof lareow, þæt ðu fram Gode come: ne
mæg nan mann soðlice swilce tacna wyrcan swilce swa ðu wyrcst, buton God
beo mid him.
 59. Wislice he understod þæs Hælendes wundra, and þa
micclan mihte þe he on mannum gefremode, for ðan þe he gehælde
ælcne þe him to com fram eallum unhælþum; and he cwæð þa him
to þæt he fram Gode come, and þæt God him mid wære, and wolde his
lare leornian æt him digollice nihtes, þa ða he dæges ne dorste.
 66. Se Hælend andwyrde and þus him cwæð to: Soð, soð
ic þe secge, þæt nan mann ne gesihþ Godes rice æfre, buton he beo
eft acenned.
 69. He com nihtes to Criste, and seo niht getacnode his agene
nytennysse, þæt he nyste þa gyt þæt seo oðer acennednys þe
Crist embe þa spræc wæs þæt halige fulluht þe he sylf astealde,
on þam þe ealle menn beoð fram synnum aðwogene; and Nichodemus þa on
his nytennysse cwæð, Hu mæg se ealda mann eft beon acenned?
 76. Maeg he, la, inn faran to his modor innoðe eft, and swa beon
geedcenned?
 78. Ðas word þe he gecwæð to Criste mid nytennysse, be
þære acennednysse þe fulcuð is us eallum, þæt heo eft ne mæg
beon geedlæht on life, þæt man oþre siðe of his meder beo acenned,
þa habbað getacnunge, swa swa ðes traht us segð, þære gastlican
acennednysse on Godes gelaþunge, þæt heo ne mot na beon geedlæht on
þam menn, þæt he tuwa underfo fulluhtes on life.
 86. Þeah þe se mæssepreost manfull beo on life, and he cild
fullie on þam soðan geleafan þære halgan þrynnysse, ne sceal
þæt cild eft syððan beon gefullod æt beterum lareowe, þæt seo
halige þrynnyss ne beo swa geunwurðod; ne se yfela preost ne mæg þurh
his agene synna Godes þenunga befylan þe of Gode sylfum cymð, for ðan
þe se Halga Gast aþwyhð þone hæþenan fram eallum his synnum on
þam soðan fulluhte.
 95. Ac him cwæð se Hælend to, Soð, soð ic þe secge,
swa hwa swa ne bið geedcenned of wætere and of ðam Halgan Gaste, ne
mæg he inn to Godes rice.
 98. Ðis wæs geswutelod sona on anginne, þa þa God ærest
gesceop gesceafta þurh his mihte: þa wæs Godes sylfes Gast, swa swa seo
boc us secgð, gefered ofer wæterum, þæt ure fulluht wære ða iu
getacnod mid toweardre mihte, and þæs wæteres gecynd wurde gehalgod
þurh þone Halgan Gast, þe gehalgað ure fulluht, and þa sawle
wiðinnan fram eallum synnum aþwyhð.
 106. Nu ne scyle ge healdan eowre cild to plihte to lange
hæþene, for ðan þe hi nabbað innfær to heofonum, gif hi
hæþene acwelað.
 109. Hi ne beoð na cild soðlice on Domesdæg, ac beoð swa
micele menn swa swa hi mihton beon, gif hi fulweoxon on gewunelicre ylde.
 112. And þa hæþenan cild on helle a wuniað, and þa
gefulledon farað to heofenum, on lichaman and on sawle, and libbað a
syððan, ge þa ane ge þa oðre, butan geendunge.
 116. Þæt þe of flæsce byð acenned, þæt byð
witodlice flæsc, and þæt þe of gaste byð acenned, þæt byð
gast untwylice.
 118. Seo gastlice acennednyss byð ungesewenlic, and þæs
lichaman acennednyss is gesewenlic eall, þonne þæt cild wyxt, and
gewyrð eft cnapa, and eft syððan cniht, oþþæt he swa becymð to
þære ylde þe him geann his Scyppend.
 123. Seo gastlice acennednys, þæt man Gode beo acenned on
þam halgan fulluhte, þurh þone Halgan Gast, is us ungesewenlic, for
ðan þe we geseon ne magon hwæt ðær bið gefremed on þam
gefullodan menn.
 127. Ðu gesyxt hine bedyppan on þam sciran wætere, and eft
up ateon mid þam ylcan hiwe þe he hæfde æror, ær ðan þe he
dufe; ac seo halige modor, þe is Godes Gelaþung, wat þæt þæt cild
bið synnfull bedyped innto þam fante, and bið up abroden fram synnum
aðwogen, þurh þæt halige fulluht.
 134. Þurh Adames forgægednesse, þe godes bebod tobræc,
beoð þa cild synfulle; ac þurh Godes sylfes gyfe heora synna beoð
adylegode, þæt hi Godes menn beoð, and of ðam flæsclicum hywe
wurðað/ gastlice, and Godes bearn gehatene, swa swa us bec secgað.
 139. Se Hælend cwæð syððan to Nichodeme þus: Ne
wundra ðu nateshwon þæt ic ðe nu sæde, þæt eow gebyrað
þæt ge beon eft acennede.
 142. He wolde þæt he cuðe þa gastlican acennednysse, butan
þære þe he ne mihte his folgere beon, and he hine þa tihte to
ðære acennednysse mid his diglum wordum, þe he onwreah us syððan.
 146. Se gast orðað soðlice þær þær he orðian
wile, and þu his stemne gehyrst, ac ðu swaðeah nast hwanon se gast cume,
oþþe hwyder he fare.
 149. Þus byð ælc þæra manna þe of ðam gaste bið
acenned.
 150. Se Halga Gast orðað þær ðær he orðian wyle,
þonne he hæfð þa mihte þæt he mæg onlihtan þæs
mannes mod þe he wyle, and awendan hit to gode, fram dysige to wisdome, fram
gedwylde to geleafan, fram synna fremminge to soðre dædbote, and fram
eallum wohnyssum awendan to rihte.
 156. Ðær man Godes lof singð, þær swegð þæs
Gastes stemn, þær man Godes lare segð, þær swegð þæs
Gastes/ stemn, and þær man embe God smeað, þær bið þæs
Gastes gifu; ac þu ne miht na geseon hu se sylfa Gast cymð innto þam
godan menn þe Godes Gast underfehþ, þeah ðe þu him on locige and his
lare gehyre, for ðan þe se Gast is ungesewenlices gecyndes; and se mann
bið oþer, fram his yfele abroden to beterum willan þurh ðæs Gastes
gife.
 165. Nichodemus him cwæð to, Hu magon þas þing
gewurðan?
 166. Se Hælend him andwyrde eft, þus him secgende: ðu eart
lareow on Israhel, and ðu þas þing nast?
 168. Ne sæde se Hælend þas word him to tale, þæt he
lareow wære and nyste þas gerynu, ac he wolde swiðor þa soðan
eadmodnysse him on gebringan to his beterunge, butan þære ne mæg nan
mann geðeon Gode.
 173. And he eft him to cwæð, swa swa us cyð þis godspell,
Soð, soð ic þe secge, þæt we soðlice sprecað þæt þæt
we gearu witon, and we eac seðað þæt þæt we gesawon, and ge ure
gecyðnysse nellað underfon nateshwon mid eow.
 178. Se Hælend him sæde þæt þæt he sylf wiste, and
þæt þæt he geseah he gesoðode eac þurh his geseðnysse, þeah
ðe hi sume noldon of ðam Iudeiscum his lare underfon, ne his geseðnysse,
him sylfum to rihtinge; ac manega underfengon on eallum middanearde þæs
Hælendes geleafan and his lare geornlice, and swa doð gyt æfre, oþ
ende þissere worulde.
 186. Gif ic eorðlice þing openlice eow secge, and ge þæra
ne gelyfað, hu gelyfe ge þonne gyf ic þa heofenlican þing eow secgan
wylle?
 189. Embe eorðlice þing he sæde þam Iudeiscum, þa ða
he him sæde be his sylfes ðrowunge, and be þam æriste his agenes
lichaman, þe he of eorðan genam of eorðlicre meder; and be heofenlicum he
spræc her be þam fulluhte, and þa ða he eft spræc be his upstige to
heofonum to þam ecan life, þe is heofonlic gewiss; and þa ungesæligan
his segene ne gelyfdon.
 197. And nan mann ne astihð nateshwon to heofenum, buton se ðe
of heofenum hider nyðer astah, þæt is mannes Sunu, se ðe is on
heofenum.
 200. Se Hælend is soðlice anes mannes sunu, swa swa nan oþer
nis, and he is ure Heafod, and he astah of heofenum us to alysenne, and he eft
up astah æfter his ðrowunge, and he behet his halgum þæt hi him
folgian moston, and mid him wunian þær ðær he sylf wunað.
 206. He astah þa ana, ac him æfterfyligdon his agene lima, up
to ðam Heafde, and æfre folgiað, oþ ende þissere worulde; for ðan
þe his halgan heonon farað to him, of þisum lænan life to heora leofan
Drihtne, oþþæt hi ealle beon to þam Heafde gegaderode.
 212. Seo menniscnys ne com na mid Criste of heofenum, ne heo on
heofenum næs þa þa he þis gecwæð; ac se an Hælend on
ægðrum gecynde, Godes and mannes, mihte swa wel sprecan swa swa ge
gehyrdon on þissere rædinge, þæt he of heofenum astah, and on
heofenum wære, þa þa he þus gespræc to þam Nichodeme.
 219. And swa swa Moyses on þam micclan westene þa næddran
up ahof to healicum tacne, swa gedafenað to ahebbenne on sumere heahnysse
þone mannes Sunu, þæt þa menn ne losion þe on hine gelyfað, ac
habbon heom þæt ece lif.
 224. Ðis andgit we sædon on þam twam oþrum spellum swiðe
gewislice, ac we wyllað swaðeah sceortlice secgan þas geendunge eow.
 227. Moyses se heretoga on þam micclum westene worhte be Godes
hæse ane ærene næddran, þa þa þæt folc wæs fram ðam
næddrum tosliten, and he þa up arærde þa ærenan næddran swilce
to tacne, and hi besawon þærto þe ðær toslitene wæron, and heom
sona wæs bet.
 233. Seo ærene næddre, þe buton attre wæs, getacnode
Cristes deaþ, þe unsynnig þrowode, up ahafen on rode; and we to him
beseoð mid fullum geleafan, þæt we fram urum synnum þurh hine beon
alysde, and lif habban mid him a on ecnysse, swa swa he us behet; þam is a
wurðmynt and wuldor on ecnysse, mid his heofenlican Fæder, and þam
Halgan Gaste, on anre godcundnysse; we cweðað, AMEN.

END_TEXT

ÆHom 14
B1.4.14.
Dominica V post Pentecosten: Pope 1967-8, II, 497-507.



 1. Lucas se godspellere, þe wæs læce on life, and he manega
gehælde fram mislicum coðum mid his læcecræfte, ac he gelacnode
swiðor manegra manna sawla mid his lare on worulde, he awrat be ðam
Hælende þæt he her on life on sumere tide þus sæde on his
godspelle to his halgum apostolum, and swa þurh hy to us: <foreign>Estote ergo
misericordes, et reliqua</foreign>: Beoð mildheorte eornostlice, eall swa eower
Fæder is; ne deme ge nateshwon, and ge ne beoð gedemede.
 11. Ne fordeme ge, and ge ne beoð fordemede; forgifað oðrum
mannum, and eow bið forgifen.
 13. Dælað and doð god, and eow bið god forgifen.
 14. Hy forgifað eft into eowrum bosme swiðe god gemet þam
þe ge nu dælað, and gecrammod gemet, and swiðe gehrysed, and
oferflowende, eow to edleane.
 18. On ðam gemete þe ge ametað eow bið eft ameten.
 18. He sæde eac soðlice hym þis bigspell þus: Hu mæg la
se blinda lædan þone blindan, and hu ne feallað hy begen on sumne
blindne seað?
 22. Ne bið na se leorningcniht furðor þonne his lareow;
ælc þæra bið fulfremed þe bið swa swa his lareow.
 24. Hu miht þu la geseon þæt mot to gewissan on ðines
broðor eagan, and þone beam ne gesihst þe is soðlice on ðinum eagan,
and hu miht þu secgan to þinum breðer þus: geðafa, min broðor,
þæt ic þæt mot ateo of ðinum eagan nu, and þu nelt geseon þe
sylf þone beam þe bið on ðinum eagan?
 31. Ac ateoh, þu hiwere, ærest þone beam ut of ðinum
eagan, and þu locast þonne þæt þu of ðines broþor eagan þæt
mot ut ateo.
 34. Her syndon syllice word samlæredum mannum; nu wylle we eow
geopenian þæt andgit þærto, and eow swutelicor sæcgan heora
getacnunge.
 37. Se Hælend us bebead on þisum halgan godspelle, Beoð
mildheorte eornostlice, eal swa eower Fæder is.
 39. Her ge magon gehyran þæs Hælendes godnysse, þonne he
cwæð swa be us, þæt we swylcne Fæder us habban moton, þone
heofenlican God, gif we mildheorte beoð, for ðan þe he is mildheort, swa
þæt he læt scinan his sunnan gelice ofer þa godan men and ofer ða
yfelan, and forgifð renscuras rihtwisum and unrihtwisum, and eorðlice
wæstmas eallum to fodan, þam þe hine lufiað and þam þe hine
hatigað.
 48. Se hatað his Scyppend, se ðe forsihð his hæse, and
nele mid weorcum his word gefyllan, ac swaðeah hine afet se heofonlica
Fæder, þæt he on sumne sæl gecyrre to Gode, oððe he beo rihtlice
þam reðan deofle on his ænde betæht, gif he ær ne gecyrð.
 54. He het us beon mildheorte oðrum mannum symble, mid ealre
godnysse, swa swa God sylf is; ac se ne bið na mildheort þe oðre men
geswencð, and hefige byrðene him on bæc behypð, unforwandodlice, mid
wælreownysse æfre, and þa læssan berypð swiðe unrihtlice, and
wyle swaþeah habban him sylfum softnysse, and nyle geðencan hu he
geswencð þa earman.
 62. Ne sceolde he næfre softnysse brucan, se ðe ne mæg
geþafian his underþeoddum mannum þæt hy lisse habban on heora lifes
geswincum, þonne he eaðe mihte him liðian foroft, þæt he him sylf
hæfde sume lisse his sawle.
 67. God lufað þa liðnysse, þæt man lissige oðrum on
hefegum geswincum þe men habbað on gewunan, on mislicum geldum and on
manegum gesetnyssum, and he ða mannhatan swiðe micclum onscunað, and
þa mildheortan to his mildse becumað.
 72. Be Godes mildheortnysse cwæð se witega þus:
<foreign>Misericordiam et iudicium cantabo tibi, Domine</foreign>: Ic singe þe, Drihten,
soðe mildheortnysse, and swiðe rihtne dom þe ðu gedemest mannum; for
ðan þe he gemildsað mannum her on life, þæt hy gecyrran moton fram
heora synnum to him, and he ðam dom gedemeð þe hine dollice forseoð, on
ðam toweardan life, þe lyt his nu gymað, for ðan þe nu is se tima on
ðam þe he mildsað, and þonne bið se ende, þæt he eallum deme.
 82. Swiðe mildheort he is þam þe hihtað on hine, ac
swiðest þam welwillendum, and þam rihtgeðancedum, þe nellað
unrihtlice oðre geswencan, butan for rihtwisre steore and rihtum
gesetnyssum.
 86. Þæt godspell sægeð gyt forð þus be endebyrdnysse:
Ne deme ge nateshwon, and ge ne beoð gedemede.
 88. Ne forbead he mid ealle ælcne dom þam witan, þam þe
deman sceal, ac ða dyrstignysse, þæt man ofaxxie ærest symble
þæt riht.
 91. Sume þing synd nu digle, þe God sylf demeþ eft, and sume
þing synd opene, be ðam man deman sceal, and man ne sceal mid gewille
bewerian þone scyldigan, ne eft mid nanum wo þone unscyldigan fordon, ne
for nanum sceatte þæt soðe awægan, ne for nanum ege þæt unriht
drifan, ac mid mildheortnysse þa men gerihtlæcan, swa swa heræfter
sægð on ðisum godspelle: Ne fordeme ge nænne, and ge ne beoð
fordemede.
 100. Iacob se rihtwisa awrat on his pistole, þam men bið dom
geset butan mildheortnysse eft, se ðe nu oðrum demeð butan
mildheortnysse.
 103. Forgifað oðrum mannum, and eow bið forgifen.
 104. God hat us forgifan ure teonan mannum, þæt he us forgife
ure synna þurh þæt.
 106. Dælað and doð god, and eow bið god forgifen.
 107. Se ðe dæleð for Gode, God geeacnað his þing, and
him eft be hundfealdum his ælmessan forgylt.
 109. Hy forgyfað eft into eowrum bosme swiðe god gemet, þam
þe ge nu dælað, and gecrammod gemet, and swiðe gehrisod, and
oferflowende, eow to edleane.
 113. He mænde þa þearfan, þe man nu deð god, þæt hy
sceolon ageldan us eft þæt gemet; ac God sylf agylt for hyg swiðe
glædlice us eall þæt we him nu doð for his naman to gode, swa
þæt ure gemet bið swiðe wel getreden, and on ælce healfe
oferflewð þonne.
 119. On ðam gemete þe ge ametað eow bið eft ameten.
 120. Þis mæg beon gecweden be eallum urum dædum, ge worda
ge weorca, þæt God witodlice ælcum men gylt eft be his agenum
dædum.
 123. He sæde eac soþlice hym þis bigspell þus: Hu mæg
la se blinda lædan þone blindan, and hu ne feallað hy begen on sumne
blindne seað?
 126. Bispell getacnað on bocum gelome oðer þing on wordum and
oðer on getacnungum.
 128. Nu ne mæg nan lareow, butan he ða lare hæbbe, þa
læwedan men gerihtlæcan to Godes rihtwisnysse, ne se leahterfulla man ne
mæg leahtras forbeodan, ne ðam dysigan styran, buton he styre ærest his
agenum unðeawum fram eallum gedwyldum, and gode bysne sylle symble þam
læwedum.
 134. Ne bið na se leorningcniht furðor þonne his lareow;
ælc þæra bið fulfremed þe bið swa swa his lareaw.
 136. Crist sylf is se lareaw, and he sealde us bysne, þæt we
sceolan mildsian, swa swa he mildsað us; and we ne magon beon butan ehtnysse
her, þe ma þe he sylf wæs, ac we sceolan forberan fela for his naman,
swa swa he gebysnode us.
 141. Mænig leorningcild leornode foroft þæt he mare cuðe
on micclum andgyte þonne his agen lareow, þe hine lærde æt fruman,
and forðig is se Hælend her gecweden lareow, þæt we beon fulfremede,
gif we him folgiað.
 146. Hu miht þu la geseon þæt mot to gewissan on þines
broðor eagan, and ðone beam ne gesihst þe is soðlice on ðinum eagan,
and hu miht þu secgan to ðinum breðer þus: geðafa, min broðor,
þæt ic þæt mot ateo of ðinum eagan nu, and þu nelt geseon þe
sylf þone beam þe bið on ðinum eagan?
 153. Ne mæg se langa beam licgan on þinum eagan, ac se beam
getacnað þa teonfullan hatunge, þæt þu hatige þone man mid hetelum
mode, and þæt mot getacnað þæs mannes yrsunge; þonne ne miht þu
na þæt mot ut ateon of ðæs mannes eagan, buton þu ærest awurpe
þa hatunge þe fram, þe is heafodleahter, and ðu syððan swa miht
þæs mannes yrre gestyran, and gif ðu hine hatast, ne miht þu him
styran.
 162. Be ðam ylcan andgyte he cwæð on oðre stowe,
<foreign>Liquantes culicem et glutientes camelum</foreign>: Hy ahlyttriað þone stut of heora
liðe mid seohhann, and hy ealne forswelgað þone olfend gehalne.
 166. Þæt is, þæt hy tælað mid teonfullum mode and
mid modignysse, þe is gylta mæst, þa lytlan gyltas, swylce hy hluttrion
þone stut, and nellað þa micclan synna on hym sylfum gebetan, ac wyllað
mid hospe huxlice tælan oðra manna misdæda, þonne hy maran sylfe
habbað.
 172. Ac ateoh, þu hywere, ærest þone beam ut of þinum
eagan, and ðu locast þonne þæt þu of ðines broðor eagan þæt
mot ut ateo.
 175. Hiwere bið se mann þe hogað ymbe þæt þæt he
oðerne gerihtlæce ær hine sylfne, swylce he leahtras onscunige, and
bið him sylf leahterfull; ac Crist us gewissode, þe ne wandode nan þing,
het us ærest adon ure dyrnan unðeawas and þa yfelan hatunge fram ure
heortan aweg, and mid hluttrum mode syððan gerihtlæcan þa eaðelican
gyltas on oðrum mannum swa.
 183. Þa men sceolon styran þe to styrene agon, þæt syndon
þa witan, þe ðone wisdom habbað and fram Gode þone anweald þæt
hy oðrum styron, swaþeah mid liðnysse and mid lufe symble, and hy heora
agene unþeawas ne forgytan, þæt God sy gehered on his halgum þegenum.
 189. We willað eow secgan sume bysne be ðysum, hu se Hælend
sylf her on life dyde: He becom to ðam munte þe men hatað Oliueti wið
ða burh Hierusalem, on Iudea lande; þa eode he on ærnemergen into ðam
temple, and eall þæt folc sona in ðrang him to, and he ða sittende him
sylf hy lærde georne, swa swa his gewuna wæs; and hit þa gelamp swa
þæt þa Sunderhalgan and þa sylfan boceras gebrohton an wif swa into
ðam temple, and heo wæs befangen on fulum forligre, and leton hy standan
on his gesihðe, and cwædon, þu leof lareow, þis wif wæs nu
gelæht on openum forligre, and on Moyses lage he bebead witodlice þæt
man mid stanum oftorfode swa forscyldegodne wifman; hwæt sægest þu us
nu be swylcere dæde?
 206. Þis hy sædon to him þæt hy his fandodon, þæt hy
mihton wyrcan sume wrohte be him, gif he þurh his liþnysse heora lage
tobræce, gif he ðam forlegenan wife lif þa getæcan wolde, oððe he
wurde wælreow on heora gewitnysse, gif he oftorfian hete þæt wif þa
mid stanum.
 212. He ða beah adun, and awrat mid his fingre swa on ðære
eorðan, and hy acsodon þa gyt.
 214. Þa sæt se Hælend upp and sæde hym þus to: Swa
hwylc eower swa næfð nane synne on him, awyrpe se ærest ænne stan on
hy; and he sylf þa eft on þære eorðan awrat.
 218. Hwæt þa, ða heafodmen, þa hy þis gehyrdon, eodon
hym ealle ut endemes hire fram, and þæt wif stod ana ætforan þam
Hælende.
 221. He sæt þa eft up and sæde to ðam wife, Hwær
syndon nu, la wif, þa þe ðe wregdon swa swiðe; ne fordemde heora nan
þe to deaðe for ðam?
 224. Þæt wif him andwyrde, mid afyrhtum mode, Na, leofa
Drihten, ne fordemde heora nan me.
 226. Se Hælend hire cwæð to, Ne ic ðe ne fordeme; gang
þu nu aweg, and þu heonan forð ne synga.
 228. On ða wisan he forgeaf þone gylt þam wife, þæt heo
syððan sceolde wið swylc þing hy gehealdan, for ðan þe ælc man
bið, þe geandet his synna, and þæt ylce eft deð his Drihtne on
teonan, þam hunde gelic, þe geet his spiweðan, and ðam swine gelic,
þe hit besylað eft æfter his þweale, and bið his ende wyrse þonne
his angin wære.
 235. Gewissige us se Hælend to his willan æfre, þam is
wuldor and lof a to weorulde, AMEN.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

ÆHom 15
B1.4.15.
Dominica VI post Pentecosten: Pope 1967-8, II, 515-25.



 1. On ðære tide iu hit getimode swa, þa ða se Hælend
wæs her on life mid mannum, þæt he stod mid ðam folce swa wið
ænne fixnoð, þæt wæs an brad mere Genesareð gehaten, and he
geseah twa scipu standan wið ðone mere, and þæt folc efste eall
swiðe wið his weard, and woldon æt him gehyran his halgan lare, and ða
fisceras mid ðam þe fiscodon on ðam mere eodon of ðam wætere and
swyledon heora net.
 10. Petrus wæs þa fiscere, þe is apostol nu; þa stod his
scip þærwið, on ðam astah se Hælend, and het hine ascufan þæt
scip hwon fram lande, and sæt þa on ðam scipe gehende þam lande, and
he lærde þæt folc þe on ðam lande stod, swa swa his gewuna wæs
þæt he wissode mancynne.
 16. Þa æfter þære lare, he het alætan ut þone halgan
Petrum his scip on ðære dypan, and het hy aweorpan heora net on
fixnoðe.
 19. Him andwyrde Petrus, Eala leof lareow, ealle niht we swuncon,
on idel wacigende, and we naht ne gefengon; ac ic for ðinum worde þæt
net nu awurpe; and hy hit wurpon þa ut.
 23. Þa sloh þæt net swa full sona þæra fisca þæt
hit hwæthwega bærst; ac hy bicnodon sona heora geferan on ðam oðrum
scipe, þæt hy hraðe comon hym to fultumigenne.
 27. Hy comon þa sona, and þa scipu buta mid fixum afyldon,
þæt hy fornean dufan.
 29. Þa ða Petrus geseah swylcne fixnoð mid him, þa feoll he
sona to ðæs Hælendes cneowum, and cwæð mid ege eadmodlice him to,
Gewit fram me, Drihten; ic eom synful man.
 33. He wæs swiðe afyrht, and his geferan ealle, and Iacob, and
Iohannes, Zebedees suna, wæron eac afyrhte for ðam fiscnoðe swiðe.
 36. Þa cwæð se Hælend þus to þam halgan Petre: Ne
ondræd þu ðe nan ðing for ðissere dæde.
 38. Þu fehst men heonan forð, swa swa þu fixas fenge.
 39. Hy tugon þa to lande heora scipa gehladene, and hy ealle
þing forleton, and folgodon swa Criste.
 41. Se fiscnoð þe we embe sprecað wæs swiðe fæger and
myrige on Iudea lande, Galileiscre scire, and swiðe mycel mere, manegra mila
lang, þreo mile on bræde, mid ferscum wætere.
 45. Þæt wæter flewð eall of ðære miclan ea þe men
hatað Iordanen into ðam mere, þær is myrige fiscnoð, and men hit
heton sæ, for ðære micelnysse þæs micclan flodes.
 49. Wið ðone mere stod se Hælend mid ðam folce þa, and
þæt folc genealæhte, his lare to gehyrenne, for ðan þe ealle
þeoda nu yrnað him to, þurh soðne geleafan, his lare secende.
 53. Þa twa scipu getacniað, þe he geseah þær standan,
þa men þe gelyfdon on Iudea lande on þone halgan Hælend, and þæt
hæðene folc þe of eallum landum gelyfdon on hine.
 57. Of ægðrum folce God wat his gecorenan, and of ægðrum
mennisce he manega gebringð of ðam deopum yðum þissere worlde to
staþolfæstnysse þæs toweardan lifes; for ðan þe þæt flod
getacnað þe hy on fixodon þas andweardan woruld þe we on wuniað, and
se strand getacnað þa staðolfæstnysse þæs toweardan lifes, to
ðam us gelæt Crist, gif we his lare folgiað on ures lifes þeawum.
 66. Þa fisceras þe eodon up of ðam ficsnoðe and heora net
swyledon, þæt syndon þa lareowas þe us læran sceolon, þæt we
gelyfon on God, and us fram nytennysse mid heora nette ateon to ðam halgan
Hælende, þe us habban wyle to þære stoðolfæstnysse þære
stæþþian worulde.
 72. Þa fisceras swyledon heora net on ðam wætere, for ðan
þe ða lareowas hwilon us læran sceolon, and on sumne sæl heora sylfes
gyman.
 75. Petrus wæs ða fiscere, þe is apostol nu; þa stod his
scip þærwið.
 76. On ðam astah se Hælend, and het hine ascufan þæt scip
hwon fram lande, and sæt ða on ðam scipe gehende þam lande, and he
lærde þæt folc þe on ðam lande stod, swa swa his gewuna wæs
þæt he wissode mancynne.
 81. Petrus scip getacnode, þe ðær stod gehende, þæt
Iudeisce folc þe gewændon to Criste and on hine gelyfdon, þeah þe hy
sume noldon, on ðam wæs þæt anginn ealre gelaðunge.
 85. Þæt oðer scip getacnode eall þæt hæðene folc
of eallum mancynne þe mid geleafan oncnawað þone leofan Hælend, and
þæt is seo gelaðung þe is gecweden Ecclesia.
 89. Þæt Iudeisce folc wæs gehaten Sinagoga, þæt is
gegaderung on Engliscere spræce.
 91. Of Petrus scipe he lærde þæt folc on ðam lande, and
us becom seo lar of Iudea lande, þurh þa halgan apostolas, þe ða
hæðenan lærdon, and men to geleafan of ælcum lande gebigdon, and
cyrican arærdon to Godes gesetnyssum on his halgum þeowdome, swa swa hit
man healt gyt on ðam godum folcum, þe Godes willan cepað; ac we healdað
wace, her on Engla þeode, Godes gesetnyssa, þe he gesette to steore, and
þam eallum to lare þe hine lufiað.
 101. We wyrcað us sylfe eallniwe gesetnyssa of ðam þe God
sylf tæhte, ongean his gesetnyssum, and ealra þæra witena þe wæron
beforan us, ongean hy ealle we gað mid ure anwilnysse; ac se weg sceal beon
swiðe earfoðe us, þæt we hy fortredon mid teonfullum þeawum, and God
sylfne forseon, swa swa we to swiðe doð.
 108. Þa æfter þære lare, he het alætan ut þone
halgan Petrum his scip on ðære dypan, and het hy awurpan heora net on
fiscnoðe.
 111. Wið þæt land he lærde, and hy leton uttor
syððan, for ðan þe he sylf lærde on Iudea lande, and his lar becom
syððan to gehwylcum landum, swa swa hit fullcuð is, on Cristendome wide.
 115. Him andwyrde Petrus, eala leof lareow, ealle niht we swuncon,
on idel wacigende, and we naht ne gefengon; ac ic for ðinum worde þæt
net nu awurpe; and hy hit awurpon þa ut.
 119. Se sealmwyrhta cwæð, þus singende be Gode: <foreign>Nisi
Dominus edificauerit domum, in uanum laborant qui ædificant eam</foreign>: Buton
Drihten sylf þæt hus getimbrige, on idel hy swincað, þa ðe hit
wyrcað.
 123. Butan God sylf onlihte þara manna heortan þe his lare
gehyrað mid his halgan gife, on idel swincð se lareow mid his lare
wiðutan.
 126. Þa sloh þæt net swa ful sona þæra fixa þæt
hit hwæthwega bærst.
 127. And nu bið eac swa.
 128. Swa fela manna gebugað mid ðam gecorenum to Cristes
geleafan on his Gelaðunge, þæt hy sume yfele eft ut abrecað, and hy on
gedwyldum adreogað heora lif, swa swa þa Engliscan men doð þe to ðam
Deniscum gebugað, and mearciað hy deofle to his mannrædene, and his
weorc wyrcað, hym sylfum to forwyrde, and heora agene leode belæwað to
deaðe.
 136. Hwæt, bið æfre wyrse ænig þing on worlde þonne
swylc dæd is ongean his agene Drihten, and hine sylfne besence on ðam ecum
suslum, ælfremed fram Gode, and fram eallum his halgum?
 140. Swa dydon eac hwilon sume þa Cristenan on anginne
Cristendomes: þa ða man acwealde þa halgan martiras huxlice mid witum,
for Cristes geleafan, þa cyddon wel fela heora ungetrywðæ, and
wiðsocon Criste, and hine forleton, þæt hy libban moston, ac heora lif
wæs syððan wyrse þonne deað.
 147. Tuwa het se Hælend her on ðissum life mid nette fixian,
and hy fengon sona heora net full fixa, for micelre getacnunge: æne ær
his þrowunge, be ðam þe we nu secgað, and oðre siðe eft, æfter
his æriste.
 152. Nu bærst heora net on ðisum fixnoðe, for ðære
getacnunge þe we ær sædon, and þes fixnoð getacnað þa halgan
Gelaðunge, þæt is eall Cristen folc þe on God nu gelyfað, on ðam
syndon ægðer ge yfele ge gode, and hy sume misfarað, swa swa we sædon
ær.
 158. Æt ðam oðrum cyrre, æfter his þrowunge, he het
awurpan þæt net on ða swiðran healfe, and hy manega fixas and swiðe
micele gefengon, and heora net ne bærst for ðære getacnunge, for ðan
þe se fixnoð æfter his æriste getacnode soðlice þa gesæligan
Cristenan, þe to Godes rice þurh Godes sylfes fultum eadige becumað to
ðam ecan life, þanan heora nan ne mæg syððan ut aberstan; and seo
swiðre hand getacnode þa gecorenan halgan, and for ðam hy awurpon
þæt net on ða swiðran hand.
 169. Þis godspell ne sægð na þe we nu secgað eow on
hwæðre healfe he hete hy awurpan þæt net; ac seo wynstre hand
swaþeah getacnað þa yfelan.
 172. Ne wen þu na forðig þæt þin wynstre yfel beo, for
ðan þe Godes lar and lareowas us secgað þæt se rihtwisa man
næfð nænne wynstran, ac buta his handa him beoð for swiðran.
 176. Þis godspell us sægð her þæt hy sona gebicnodon
heora geferan on ðam oðran scipe, þæt hy hraðe comon hym to
fultumigenne.
 179. Þæt oðer scip getacnað, swa swa we ær sædon,
þæt hæðene folc on fyrlenum landum þe on Crist gelyfað on
Cristendome wide, for ðan þe se Hælend ne afunde nateshwon on Iudea
lande swa fela gelyfedra manna swa swa he habban wolde to ðam heofonlican
life.
 185. Þa geceas he us of eallum leodscipum, and he swa gefylð
þæt fulle getel þe he habban wyle to his ecan wuldre.
 188. Hy comon þa sona, and þa scipu butu mid fixum afyldon,
þæt hy fornean dufon.
 190. Þa scipu he gefylð forð oð Domesdæg, and þeah
þe hy frecednysse and fela costnunga þolion on þissere worulde, hy ne
wurðað swaþeah nateshwon besencte, for ðan þe Crist sylf mæg his
halgan gehealdan, and heora gehelpan æfre.
 195. Þa þa Petrus geseah swylcne fixnoð mid hym, þa feol he
sona to þæs Hælendes cneowum, and cwæð mid ege eadmodlice him to,
Gewit fram me, Drihten; ic eom synfull man.
 199. Nolde se Hælend for his bene swaþeah hym fram gewitan, ac
wunode mid hym, oððæt hy to lande gelændon mid ealle, for ðan þe
ða lareowas þe Godes folc lærað, bisceopas and mæssepreostas, ne
moton forlætan þa halgan Godes wican þe God hym betæhte for nanre
costnunge, for ðan þe Crist hy ahret, gif hy for his lufan ne forlætað
his heorde.
 207. He wæs swiðe afyrht, and his geferan ealle, and Iacob,
and Iohannes, Zebedees suna, wæron eac afyrhte for þam fixnoðe swiðe.
 210. Iacob and Iohannes wæron gebroðra.
 211. And heora fæder wæs gehaten Zebedeus, and heora modor
wæs Cristes moddrige, swa swa bec secgað be heora gebyrdum.
 214. Þa cwæð se Hælend þus to ðam halgan Petre: Ne
ondræd þu ðe nan þing for ðissere dæde.
 216. Þu fehst men heonan forð, swa swa þu fixas fenge.
 217. Se Hælend gefrefrode swiðe fægere Petrum, for ðan
þe he wel wyle eallum welwillendum, and sæde þæt he sceolde
syððan men gefon; nu dyde he eac swa be his Drihtnes wordum, þæt he
manega menn mid his lare gefeng, and mid wundorlicum tacnum þe he geworhte on
life, swa swa he ær gefeng fixas mid his nettum; and we gyt habbað his
halgan lare mid us on Cristenum bocum, us sylfum to beterunge.
 226. Hy tugon þa to lande heora scipa gehladene, and hy ealle
þing forleton, and folgodon swa Criste.
 228. Crist geceas fisceras him sylfum to folgerum, ungelærede
men, and hy forleton ealle þing, his lare folgiende, and him her on life, and
hy syððan wurdon swa swiðe gelærede þæt eall se Cristendom on
Cristes gelaðunge wearð þurh hy ahræred mid þæs Hælendes
fultume; þam is wuldor and wurðmynt a to worolde, AMEN.
