START_TEXT

ÆHom 16
B1.4.16.
Dominica VII post Pentecosten: Pope 1967-8, II, 531-41.



 1. Matheus se godspellere, þe wæs mid Criste on life, and his
lare gehyrde, on his hirede wuniende, he awrat be Criste þæt he
gecwæð hwilon þus to his halgum apostolum, and þurh hy eac to us:
Soð ic eow secge, þæt ge sylfe ne becumað into heofonan rice, butan
eower rihtwisnys beo eallunga mare ætforan minum Fæder þonne þæra
bocera is and ðæra Sunderhalgena.
 9. Ge gehyrdon þa bebodu þe God bebead gefyrn þam ealdan
Israhele under Moyses lage, and hym þus sæde: Ne ofsleh þu mannan; and
se ðe man ofslihð, se bið domes scyldig.
 13. Ic secge eow to soðan þæt se bið domes scyldig, se
ðe nu yrsað wið his agenne broðor.
 15. Se ðe him hosp gecwyð, se bið þeahtes scyldig, and se
ðe hine hæt stuntne, se bið wites scyldig on þam witnigendlican fyre
þære toweardan worulde, buton he ðone gylt gebete on his life.
 19. Gif ðu geoffrast Gode ænige lac æt his weofode, and
þu þonne geþencst þæt þin broðor hæfð sum þing ongean
þe, gesete þine lac ætforan þam weofode, and fær ðe ærest
hraðe to þinum agnum breðer, and hine geglada; and þonne þu eft
cymst, geoffra þine lac.
 25. Þis godspel is nu gesæd sceortlice eow þus; and we
secgað eow þæt sume men wendon þæt seo ealde æ on Moyses timan
wære miccle stiðre mannum to gehealdenne þonne Cristes boboda, þe he
gecwæð him sylf on ðære niwan lage æfter his tocyme, under Godes
gife, on ðæs godspelles timan, swa swa we healdan sceolon gif we hyrað
Gode; ac hy magon gehyran her on ðisum godspelle þæt Cristes beboda,
þe he bebead mannum, syndon miccle maran þonne Moyses lagu; and we sceolon
liðian and ure lif awendan to ðæs Hælendes bebodum, gif we habban
wyllað þa micclan myrhðe mid him, swa swa he us behet.
 39. We ne magon libban on ðisum life nateshwon, þæt we ne
agylton wið God and wið men on worde and on weorce; ac we sceolon symble to
Gode gecyrran and his mildsunge biddan; for ðon þe he is gearu, gif we hine
biddað mid inneweardre heortan, þæt he us mildsige; and him is miccle
leofre ures lifes rihting þonne ænig oðer sceat, gif we geswicað
yfeles.
 47. Ælce dæg we syngiað, and ælce dæg we sceolon urne
Hælend gladian mid sumre godnysse, se ðe æfre wile us mannum mildsian;
and he nyle naht eaðe þæs synfullan deað, ac he swyðor wyle þæt
he gecyrre and lybbe; and se ðe bote underfehð, and he beo syððan
hræðe þæs of life, he sceal to reste gewiss, for þon þe he
gecyrde fram his synnum to Gode.
 55. Se Hælend us sæde, swa swa ge gehyrdon ær, Soð ic
eow secge, þæt ge sylfe ne becumað into heofonan rice, buton eower
rihtwisnys beo eallunga mare ætforan minum Fæder þonne þæra bocera
is and ðæra Sunderhalgena.
 60. Þa boceras syndon and þa Sundorhalgan þa ealdan witan,
þe wæron gefyrn, under Moyses lage, swa micclum gelærede þæt hy
ða ealdan æ on heora wisan cuðon; ac hy ne heoldon swaþeah þa halgan
Godes æ swa wel swa hy sceoldon.
 65. Þa cidde hym se Hælend swiðe oftrædlice, for ðan
þe hy ne heoldon þa halgan beboda swa swa God sylf hym bebead; ac hy woldon
hym sylfe þæt hy halige wæron, and wæron swaþeah misworohte
wiðinnan.
 70. Þa sæde se Hælend, þe geseah heora heortan, swiðe
egeslice word, hym þus cidende: <foreign>Uos iustificatis uos coram hominibus; Deus,
autem, nouit corda uestra</foreign>: Ge tellað eow rihtwise on manna gesihþum, ac
God soðlice cann swaðeah eowere heortan; ge synd swa swa byrgenu þe
beoð wiðutan agrafene mid ofergeweorcum, swiðe wel amette, and syndon
afyllede mid forrotodnysse; and ge swaþeah lufiað hlisan and herunge.
 80. Hym wæs beboden, on heora gehealdsumnyssum on Moyses lage,
þæt hy moston lufian heora agene frynd, and hatian heora fynd; ac us bead
se Hælend, her on ðysum life, þæt we lufian sceolon symble, butan
hiwunge, ure agene freond, and ælcne Cristene man, and eac for Godes lufan
lufian ure fynd, þæt ure rihtwisnys beo mare þonne heora, we ðe habban
sceolon þæt heofonlice lif, gif we gehyrsume beoð Godes hæsum mid
weorcum.
 90. Hym wæs beboden þæt hy ne hæmdon unrihtlice wið
oþra manna wif; ac us sæde Crist þus: <foreign>Omnis qui uiderit mulierem ad
concupiscendum eam iam mechatus est eam in corde suo</foreign>; þæt is on Englisc,
ælc man þe sceawað wifman mid luste, þæt he hy habban wolde,
þæt him witodlice bið þæt forliger gefremod on his agenre heortan
þurh þone unlust, þæt he hire gewilnode.
 99. We secgað swaðeah þæt si eaðre to betenne þa
yfelan geþohtas þonne þa yfelan dæda, gyf man þone yfelan
willan awent to beteran.
 102. Hy teoðodon heora wyrta, and wolice forleton þa maran
beboda þe Moyses bebead on þære halgan Godes æ hym to gehealdenne.
 105. Nu sceole we healdan swa þa læssan beboda, þæt we
ða maran eac mid weorcum gefyllan.
 107. Hy tæhton mid wordum, swa swa hit awriten is, Godes lare
mannum, and forleton þa weorc; ac se biþ mære lareow, swa swa se
Hælend sæde, se þe him sylf gedeð, and he syððan swa tæcð,
and onginneð þa bysne on him sylfum ærest.
 112. Hym wæs behaten, gif hy heoldon Godes æ, eorðlice
wæstmas, and Crist witodlice behet þæt ece lif þam þe his word
healdað, þæt þe mannes eage ne mihte geseon, ne eare gehyran, ne
heorte asmeagan, þa micclan mærðe þe se mildheorta Crist þam eallum
behet þe hine lufiað; and þærtoeacan he forgifð us ure neode.
 120. Nu mote we habban maran rihtwisnysse, nu us synd behatene þa
heofonlican speda, þæt we moton sona siþian to Criste on urum
forðsiþe, gif we ær mid wærscipe ure synna gebetað sylfwilles on
life.
 125. Ge gehyrdon þa bebodu þe God bebead gefyrn þam ealdan
Israhele under Moyses lage, and hym þus sæde: Ne ofslih ðu mannan; and
se ðe man ofslihð, se bið domes scyldig.
 129. Ic secge eow to soþan þæt se bið domes scyldig, se
ðe nu yrsað wið his agenne broðor.
 131. On ðam dome man toscæt hwilc his scyld wære, and oft
he bið unscyldig on ðam dome getæht, se ðe ær wæs geteald
þæt he scyldig wære; and man mæg gegladian mid godum willan þa
færlican yrsunge, and forfon mid wisdome, eað þonne he gebete gif he
bið ofslagen.
 137. To ægþer þæra þinga, þæt is yrre and
mansliht, gæð se rihta dom; ac hit bið swaþeah leohtre on bote on
ðam lybbendan men, þeah þe he yrsige, and hit eft gehæle, swa swa
þis godspell on æfteweardan sægð, þæt we magon gegladian þone
þe we ær abulgon.
 143. Se þe his breþer hosp gecwyð, se bið þeahtes
scyldig.
 144. Her syndon nu twa þing, þæt yrre and se hosp, and
þær gæð geþeaht to þam twam þingum, þæt man mid geþeahte
secge him his wite, hwæt he sylf þrowige for ðam twam þingum; ac
swaþeah hwilon swa scyldig man ætwint, be ðam þe se trahtnere us
sægð on Leden.
 150. And se ðe hine hæt stuntne, se bið wites scyldig on
ðam witnigendlican fyre þære toweardan worulde.
 152. Her syndon nu þreo þing, and forþig mare wite: þæt
yrre and se hosp, and eac teonræden; and þas þing sceolon, swa swa us
sægð seo boc, on ðam toweardan wite beon afeormode, buton se man hy
sylfwilles gebete.
 157. Micele maran gyltas man mæg gebetan her on þisum life,
and þone Hælend gegladian, þæt he ne þurfe þrowian on ðam
toweardan life.
 160. God cwæð þurh his witegan þæt he wolde mildsian
ælcum men þe gecyrð fram his synnum to him, þam þe mid geomerunge
gewyrcð dædbote, and his synna ne beo syþþan on gemynde.
 163. Lareowas sceolon læran and styran, and witan sceolon
þreagan þa ðwyran and þa stuntan, ægþer ge mid wordum ge mid
weorcum hwilon, swa swa Crist sylf dyde, þe cidde þam Iudeiscum for heora
gedwyldum and dyrstigan anginne.
 169. Paulus se Apostol on his pistole cwæð þus: <foreign>Argue,
obsecra/, increpa, in omni patientia et doctrina</foreign>: þrea ðu and bide, cid
mid geðylde, on ealre lare to lifes bebodum.
 173. Gif hwa nu þurh steore sum styrne word gecwyð to his
underþeoddum for heora stuntnysse, ne bið na þæt gelic þam
unþeawfæstan men, þe for his receleaste misræceð oðerne, for
nanre steore, ac for stuntnesse.
 178. We sceolon us gebletsian and abiddan æt Gode þat he us
gehealde, and urne muð þurhhlynne, swa swa se witega bæd, þysum
wordum cweðende: <foreign>Pone, Domine, custodiam ori meo, et hostium circumstantie
labiis meis</foreign>: Sete þu, leof Drihten, minum muðe hyrdrædene, and duru
minum welerum, þinre wearde abutan.
 184. Duru he abæd, þæt he fordyttan mihte þa idelan
spræca, and undon his muð to wisdomes spræcum, and to wurðianne God,
swa swa man belycð and geopenað þa duru.
 188. Vton nu gehyran þæs Hælendes læcedom, hu we magon
gehælan her on ðisum life ure yfelan word wið ðone þe we
gegremodon.
 191. Gif ðu geoffrast Gode ænige lac æt his weofode, and
þu þonne geðencst þæt þin broðor hæfð sum ðing ongean
þe, gesete þine lac ætforan þam weofode, and far þe ærest raðe
to þinum agenum breðer, and hine geglada; and þonne þu eft cymst,
geoffra þine lac.
 197. Se Hælend cwæð eft on sumere oðre stowe, þonne ge
sylfe standað on eowrum gebedum, forgifað þonne on eowrum heortum eallum
oðrum mannum þe wið eow agyltað þæt se Heofonlica Fæder eowre
synna forgife; and butan ge forgifon, ne forgifð he na eow.
 203. Þonne hæfð ure broðor sum þing ongean us, gif we
him deredon oððe gedydon unðanc; þonne sceole we don be ures Drihtnes
lare, gegladian uren broðor mid goodum ingehyde, þone Cristenan man, butan
ælcere hiwunge, þæt God sylf underfo glædlice ure lac, se ðe nele
underfon nan þing ær æt us, ær we habban sibbe on soðfæstum
mode.
 211. Gif us ænig man derað oððe gedeð unþanc, þæt
we sceolon forgifan, swa swa se Hælend sæde, þæt us ure synna
syððan beon forgifene.
 214. Vre lac syndon þe we offriað Gode ure halgan gebedu, and
þæt we gehelpon þam earmum mid urum ælmessum, and ælc þing þe
we doð urum Drihtne to lofe; þa beoð ealle Godes lac, and we mid godum
willan þa sceolon geoffrian, þæt hy andfenge beon, and Gode licwyrðe,
þe lufiað æfre sibbe, and he mid smyltnysse symble demð eallum.
 222. Be ðam sang se sealmwyrhta, þus secgende him to: <foreign>Adiutor
meus, tibi sallam, et cetera</foreign>;þæt is on Engliscre spræce, þu eart min
gefylsta; þe sylfum ic singe; þu eart min onfond, min agen soð God, and
min mildheortnys.
 227. He het hine mildheortnys, for ðan þe he milde is, and he
on manega wisan þam mannum gehylpð þe mid anrædnysse to him æfre
hopiað.
 230. Þam is wuldor and wurðmynt a to worulde, AMEN

ÆHom 17
B1.4.17.
Dominica X post Pentecosten: Pope 1967-8, II, 547-59.



 1. Se Hælend sæde þus to his halgum apostolum, her on
þisum life libbende mid mannum, for ðon þe he oft gespræc wið hy on
bigspellum: Sum welig man wæs iu, se hæfde tungerefan; þa wearð se
gerefa forsæd wið his hlaford, þæt he his god sceolde swiðe him
fram aspendan; and se hlaford sona gelangode hine, and befran hine þa,Hwæt
gehyre ic be ðe?
 9. Betæc þine wican; ne miht þu beon leng on minum
folgoþe.
 10. And se gerefa þa cwæð on his agenum mode, Hwæt mæg
ic la nu don?
 12. Nu ic beo bescired, and ic sylf ne mæg mid minum fotum
delfan, ne ic ne mæg for sceame ahwær bedician.
 14. And he eft þa cwæð, Ic wylle nu betwyx þisum tilian me
freonda on þam þe aht sceolon minum hlaforde nu, þæt hy me underfon
into heora husum, þonne ic betæht hæbbe þas wican me fram.
 19. He gelaðode þa sona his underþeoddan him to, þa þe
aht sceoldon his hlaforde on feo, and cwæð to heora anum, Hwæt ahst
þu to gyldenne?
 22. He cwæð þæt he sceolde syllan his hlaforde
hundteontig oman mid ele ametene.
 24. Þa het se gerefa him awritan fiftig.
 25. He cwæð þa to oðrum, Hwæt scealt þu þinum
hlaforde?
 26. He cwæð þæt he sceolde him hundteontig mittan
hwætes.
 27. And se gerefa het him on gewrite settan þæt he
hundeahtatig him agifan sceolde.
 29. Hwæt þa heora hlaford herode eft syððan þone gerefan
on his unrihtwisnysse, for ðan þe he snotorlice wið hine sylfne gedyde;
for ðan þe woroldmen, þyssere worlde bearn, syndon micele snoteran on
heora cynrene þonne þæs leohtes bearn, þæt synd þa geleaffullan.
 35. Þa sæde se Hælend eft syððan him þus to: Wyrcað
eow freonda of ðam unrihtan welan, þæt hy underfon eow on eowrum
forðsiþe to him on ðam ecum eardungstowum eft.
 39. Se welega man þe hæfde þone tungerefan is se
ælmihtiga God, þe ah ealle þing, and he betæhte mannum his micclan
welan her on þisum andwerdan life, þæt he geuðe us andgites and
gesceades, swa swa þam englum, toforan oþrum gesceaftum, and
þærtoeacan us forgifð ure neode on life, þurh his micclan cyste; for
ðan þe he mancynn lufað, þa ðe hine oncnawað and him cyððe to
habbað þurh soðne geleafan and singalre lufe.
 49. We synd his gerefan, þe his welan habbað, and we yfele
aspendað his æhta him fram, þonne we ure andgit to yfele awendað, and
ure mennisce gescead to manfullum leahtrum; and we nyllað mid gesceade us
sylfum gewissian, ne wyrcan his willan þe wyle us habban; and him nane
æhta ne synd swa inmede swa him synd to agenne ure sawle clæne.
 57. Be þam sang se sealmwyrhta, þus secgende us: <foreign>Homo, cum in
honore esset, non intellexit, et cetera</foreign>: Se mann witodlice, þa ða he on
wurðmynte wæs, he hit ne understod; ac þam stuntum nytenum he wearð
wiðmeten, and wæs hym þa gelic.
 62. Ælc þara manna þe his andgit awent to yfelum weorcum
fram rihtwisnysse, and nele understandan his agenne wurðmynt, þæt he is
sylf geworht to Godes anlicnysse, and mid gewitleaste unwurðað hine sylfne
fram þam micclan wurðmynte, þæt he on meoxe licge on þam fulum
leahtrum, fulre þonne nyten, he aspent yfele his hlafordes æhta, þonne
he his agen gescead on synnum eall aspent, and hine wacne gedeþ and
unwurðne symble.
 72. Þas syndan þa leahtras þe misliciað Gode: eawbryce and
forliger, and ælces cynnes reaflac, morðdæda and manslihtas and ealle
manaðas, wiccecræft and wiglung and þa wogan domas, stala and leasunga
and þa micclan druncennyssa, untimaæt and oferfyll and þæt man wyrce
unlybban, and þæt man nylle freolsian mid nanum wurðmynte þone halgan
Sunnandæg, þam Hælende to lofe, þe on ðam Sunnandæge him sylf
aras of deaðe and he manega wundra geworhte on ðam dæge ne his halgena
mæssedagas, þe man healdan sceolde, and gan to cyrcan, Godes lof to
gehyrenne.
 84. Vton nu geedlæcan, þæt is, eft eow nu secgan, þisses
godspelles anginn, swa swa we ær sædon, þæt ge magon þe eað
þæt andgit understandan: Sum welig man wæs iu, se hæfde tungerefan;
þa wearð se gerefa forsæd wið his hlaford, þæt he his god sceolde
swiðe him fram aspendan; and se hlaford sona gelangode hine, and befran hine
þa, Hwæt gehyre ic be ðe?
 92. Betæc þine wican; ne miht þu beon leng on minum
folgoðe.
 94. On twa wisan us gelangað and him to clypað se Hælend,
oððe on andweardum life ærest to dædbote, oððe on ðam oðrum
life eft to þam dome.
 97. Nu sceole we beðencan us sylfe her on life, þæt we to
yfele ne beon eft on ðam dome.
 99. And se gerefa þa cwæð on his agenum mode, Hwæt mæg
ic la nu don, nu ic beo bescired, and ic sylf ne mæg mid minum fotum delfan,
ne ic ne mæg for sceame ahwær bedician?
 103. We ne magon delfan, ne we ne moton wyrcan nane gode wæstmas
ænigre drohtnunge æfter þisum life, gif we ærðan noldon; ne
þær ne bið nan earnung, ac bið edlean gewiss ealra ure dæda, be
ðam þe we dydon ær; ne we ne magon bedecian for bysmore þær, gif we
æmtige beoð ælces godes þonne swa swa þa stuntan mædenu, þe
mid heom sylfon næfdon on heora leohtfatum nan leoht þam brydguman,
Hælende Criste, swa swa he him sylf sæde, and woldon þa biddan oððe
gebicgan hym leoht; ac hy wurdon belocene wiðutan fram Criste, for ðon þe
hy næfdon him nane lihtinge ætforan.
 116. Be ðam ylcan gecwæð eft Godes wisdom: For þæs
wintres cyle nolde se asolcena erian; he bedecað eft on sumera, and him ne
bið na getiðad.
 119. Þæt is, þæt he on life lytel swanc for Criste, and
he ða ecan myrhþe ne mæg þonne abiddan.
 121. He eft þa syððan gecwæð on his agenum geðance, Ic
wylle nu betwyx þisum tilian me freonda on ðam þe aht sceolan minum
hlaforde nu, þæt hy me underfon into heora husum, þonne ic betæht
hæbbe þas wican me fram.
 126. He gelaðode þa sona his underþeoddan him to, þa ðe
aht sceoldon his hlaforde on feo, and cwæð to heora anum, Hwæt ahst
þu to gyldenne?
 129. He cwæð þæt he sceolde syllan his hlaforde
hundteontig oman mid ele ametene.
 131. Þa het se gerefa him awritan fiftig.
 132. Ele wyxt on treowum, eall swa win deð; ac þa elebeamas
beoð maran on wæstme, and þa berian grytran, and hy man gaderað and
wringð, and man et þone ele, swa swa we etað buteran, on manegum
estmettum, and he is metta fyrmest.
 137. Man deð hine to leohte eac on ðam lande on fægerum
leohtfatum, for ðan þe he fæt is, and wynsumlice byrnð binnan Godes
cyrcan; he is swiðe deorweorðe, and hine man deð to fulluhte, and to
Godes þenungum, þonne he gehalgod bið.
 142. He cwæð þa to oðrum, Hwæt scealt þu þinum
hlaforde?
 143. He cwæð þæt he sceolde him hundteontig mittan
hwætes; and se gerefa het him on gewrite settan þæt he hundeahtatig him
agifan sceolde.
 146. He lissode þam mannum þæt he mihte hopian to heora
freondrædene, þæt hy underfengon hine eft syððan into heora husum;
ac ðas dæde we sceolon swiðor understandan on gastlicum andgite, and us
tilian freonda, ge on Godes þenum ge on Godes þearfum, mid urum
weldædum, þæt we wunian moton on ðam ecum eardungstowum æfter urum
forðsiþe mid ðam Godes mannum þe we ure god doð nu.
 155. Ne sceole we na mid facne us freond gewyrcan, ac þis is
soð bysen hu we sceolon don of rihtum gestreonum, swa swa we rædað on
bocum: dælan nu ælmyssan, and don beforan us, þæt we habban hy eft
be hundfealdum us sylfum, þær þær nan þeof ne mæg ne ne mot hy
forstelan, ne nan moððe ne mæg ne nan om hym derian, ac hy andsunde
þær us beoð gehealdenne.
 163. Ælc man sceal don her be his agenre mæðe; se þe mare
hæbbe, do be his mæðe; se ðe læsse hæbbe, do of his lytlan,
þæt nan man ne beo butan ælmyssan.
 167. Be ðam cwæð se Hælend on oþrum godspelle, Gelaða
to þinum godum þearfan and wannhale, blinde and healte, and þu bist
eadig; for ðan þe hy nabbað hwæt hy þe forgeldon; þe bið
forgolden witodlice on ðara rihtwisra æriste.
 172. Þæt is on Domesdæge, þonne we of deaðe arisað.
 173. Zacheus se rica wæs unrihtwis æt fruman, ac syððan
he underfeng þone fyrmestan cuman, þone Hælend sylfne.
 175. Þa sæde Zacheus, Drihten leof, ic wylle dælan mine
æhta, þone healfan dæl þearfum, and þærtoeacan ic wylle be
feowerfealdum forgyldan swa hwæt swa ic reafode.
 179. And se Hælend þa sæde sona him to andsware, Nu
todæg is geworden hæl þisum hirede; for þan þe Zacheus swa wæs
gerihtwisod þurh þæs Hælendes tocyme, þe com to his huse.
 183. Cristes apostolas, swa swa us cyþað bec, forleton heora
æhta ealle for Criste, and him swa folgodon swa hwider swa he ferde; and hy
hæfdon mid him þa heofonlican speda.
 187. Sum earm wudewe wearp ænne feorðling betwux oðrum
mannum þe wurpon heora ælmyssan to ðam halgan weofode binnan Hierusalem,
and se Hælend sæde sona be hyre þæt heo mare brohte þonne ænig
oðer man, for þan þe heo brohte ealne hire bigleofan mid cystigum mode,
and Crist hy þa herode.
 194. Se Hælend cwæð eac, Gif hwa sylð drincan anum
þurstigum men huru ceald wæter, þæt he hæfð his mede þære
lytlan weldæde; and se gooda willa, þe wel wyle symble, is Gode andfenge,
swylce he offrige him lac.
 199. Þus we sceolon geearnian þa upplican wununge mid
þyllicum dædum, urum Drihtne to lofe, mid nanum andsætum facne, ne mid
ænigum swicdome, þæt we gastlice gefyllon þas godspellican word, be
ðam þe ge gehyrdon her on þissere rædinge.
 204. Hwæt þa heora hlaford herode eft syððan þone
gerefan on his unrihtwisnysse, for ðan þe he snotorlice wið hine sylfne
gedyde.
 207. Vre drihten herað mid beteran herunge his getreowan wicnere,
þe his willan gefremode on ðam gastlicum tilungum, and him þus to cwið:
<foreign>Euge serue bone et fidelis, et reliqua</foreign>: Eala þu goda þeowa, and me wel
getrywe, þu wære getrywe on lytlum þingum me; nu ic þe gesette ofer
manegum þingum; gang nu on blisse on þines hlafordes godum.
 215. Þa worldmen soðlice, þissere worlde bearn, syndon micele
snoteran on heora cynryne þonne þæs leohtes bearn, þæt synd þa
geleaffullan.
 218. Þa worldmen cunnon þa worldcundan snoternysse, and þa
yfelan hocas þe se Hælend onscunað, be ðam is awriten þisum wordum
on bocum: <foreign>Sapientia enim huius mundi stultitia est apud Deum</foreign>: þissere
worlde wisdom is stuntnyss ætforan Gode.
 223. Þu telest to wisdome þæt þu þin gewill hæbbe,
and þu mæge oferdrifan oþerne man mid wo; ac Crist wile habban
unsceððinysse on us, and þa bilehwitnysse, swa swa he us bebead: <foreign>Estote
prudentes sicut serpentes, et simplices sicut columbe</foreign>: Beoð swa snotere swa
swa neddran syndon, and swa bylehwite swa swa culfran beoð.
 230. Seo næddre is eallra nytena snoterost, and se deofol þurh
hy beswac þa frumsceapenan men; nu sceole we beon snotere wið ðæs
deofles swicdomas, swa swa se Hælend sæde, and besceawian gleawlice
þæs deofles lotwrencas, þæt he us ne forlære.
 235. Seo næddre awurpð ælce geare hire ealdan haman, and
bið þonne befangen mid eallniwum felle; uton we swa don, awurpan ure synna,
and þa yfelan þeawas, and leornian þa godan, þæt we mid Godes gife
beon ymbscrydde wiðinnan.
 240. Seo næddre wyle eac bewerian hire heafod, and hy ealle
bewindan on embhwyrfte þæs heafdes, þæt man huru þæs heafdes
hentan ne mæge.
 243. Swa we sceolon eac don, gif we snotere beoð, ne lætan us
nan þing swa leof swa urne Hælend, þe is ure heafod; and we for his
lufan urne lichaman sceolon syllan to deaðe, gif hit swa micel neod bið,
ær we hine wiðsacon and ure sawle forleoson, þe is selost æhta.
 249. Culfre is swiðe bylewit, and eall butan geallan, and lufað
annysse betwyx hyre geferum, and swiðe unhearmgeorn and unhetol oðrum.
 252. Healdan we þas þeawas, þæt we unhearmgeorne beon, and
butan byternysse betwux gebroðrum symble, þæt we mannum ne derian mid
unrihtum dædum, ac habban us annysse on ealre rihtwisnysse, and lætan
gehwæne habban þæt þe his is mid rihte; þonne hæbbe we þa
bylewitnysse þe se Hælend sylf tæhte.
 258. Þa sæde se Hælend eft syððan hym þus to:
Wyrcað eow freonda of ðam unrihtan welan, þæt hy underfon eow on
eowrum forðsiðe to him on ðam ecum eardungstowum eft.
 262. Þa unrihtan welan syndon witodlice þæt weoruldlice
feoh, on ðam þa unrihtwisan menn besettað heora hiht, and on þam
hopiað/; ac þa rihtwisan menn awændað heora feoh to heora lifes
neodum, and lybbað be ðam feo, and habbað heora hyht to þam heofonlicum
spedum, to þam ecum þingum on eornost swaðeah.
 269. Se þe ælmyssan dæleð of ðam eorðlicum feo, and
of þam sceortum welum þissere worulde, Godes þeowum and his þearfum,
God sylf him forgylt eft, swa þæt we wununge hæfð on heofonan rice
mid þam þe he dælde and gedyde his god.
 274. Ealswa þa lareowas þe lærað Godes folc, and manega
gebetað mid heora gebysnungum, magon witan gewis þæt hy wunian moton on
þære ecan myrhðe mid ðam ælmihtigan Gode, for þan þe hy
getreowlice tilodon heora hlaforde.
 279. Se Hælend sylf sæde on sumere oðre stowe, Se ðe on
lytlum þinge bið his hlaforde getrywe, se bið him getrywe on ðam maran
þingum; and se ðe ungetrywe bið on þam læssan þinge, se bið
ungetrywe on ðam maran þinge.
 284. Lytel þing is geteald þises lifes ryne wið ða ecan
worulde, þe ne wurð na geendod.
 286. Þa woruldcundan þing syndon witodlice læssan þonne
þa gastlican, þe is Godes sylfes lar, þæt is se halga wisdom, þe us
simble tiht up to urum Scyppende, þe us gesceop to mannum.
 290. Se ðe on woruldþingum wurð ungetrywe, ne wurð he on
þam gastlicum Gode getrywe, þæt he ða heofonlican pund holdlice
dæle.
 293. Getrywsige us se Hælend þurh þone Halgan Gast, þæt
we his willan gewyrcan moton; þam sy a wuldor on ecnysse, amen.

ÆHom 18
B1.4.18.
Dominica XII post octavas Pentecosten: Pope 1967-8, II, 567-80.



 2. Ðæs Hælendes eard wæs on Iudea lande, Galileiscre
scire, þa þa he her on life wæs, on þære byrig Nazareth; ac he
wæs geboren on þære byrig Bethleem, swa swa bec secgað.
 5. Ða ferde he geond eall þære foresædan scire, to eallum
samnungum, symle lærende þæt folc, & bodigende godspell & Godes
rice mannum, & ealle gehælde þe untrume wæron, & he ælce
adle & ælce untrumnysse adræfde of eallum þam mannum þe him
mihton to cuman.
 11. His hlisa þa asprang to Sirian lande, ofer eall þæt
rice, þæt is swiþe rum land; & him man gebrohte þa to fela
bedridan menn, & þa monaðseocan, & þa sylfan wodan, & on
manegum adlum mislice geswencte; & se soþa Hælend gehælde hi ealle,
& him þa fyligde micel folc gehwanon.
 18. Nu segð us se godspellere þe þiss godspell gesette þe
nu gebirað to þissere mæssan, MARCVS gehaten se þe wæs martyr
for Criste, þæt ure Hælend becom to þære galileiscan sæ,
farende fram gemærum þæs tyriscan folces geond þæt
sidoneiscan/, on þam sælande decapolis, swa on bocum synd gehatene
tyn burhscira.
 25. Ða gebrohte man him to, tomiddes þam folce, ænne dumne
mann, & se wæs eac swilce deaf, & bædon þone Hælend þæt
he hine hrepode mid his halwendum fingrum; & se Hælend sona
gelædde þone mannan ut of þære meniu.
 30. He dyde þa his fingras innto his earan, & mid his
halwendan spatle hys tungan hrepode, & beseah to heofenum, & sæde
mid geomerunge to þam duman menn þis an dyrne word, <foreign>Effeta</foreign>: þæt is
on Englisc, to geopenigenne; þæt his earan wurdon & his muð
geopenode.
 36. Hwæt þa, sona wurdon his earan geopenode, & his tungan
bend wearð unbunden eac, & he rihtlice spræc mid his agenum gereorde.
 39. Ða bebead se Hælend þam þe hine brohton þæt hi
hit ne sædon nanum menn nateshwon; ac hi þæs þe swiþor hit sædon
mid wundrunge, & cyddon his mærþa mannum, þuss secgende: Wel he
gedyde ealle þing þurh his wundorlican mihte: he gedyde þæt þa
deafan mihton wel gehyran, & he gedyde þam dumban þæt hi mihton
sprecan.
 46. Ðiss godspell is nu gesæd þuss sceortlice on Englisc; nu
wylle we geedlæcan eft þa ylcan word þæs halgan godspelles, & eow
geopenian þæt gastlice andgit be endebyrdnesse þære haligan lare, mid
hyre getacnungum.
 51. Tirus & Sidon syndon twa burga, be þam spræc se
Hælend on sumere stowe hwilon, þa þa he cidde swiþe þam burgum þe
he on geworhte his wundra & tacna, þæt hi noldon gelyfan for his
liflicum tacnum, ne hi sylfe gerihtlæcan for his soþum wundrum.
 57. He cwæð to þære byrig þe hatte Corozaim, & to
anre oðre byrig, Bethsaida gehaten, Wa þe, Corozaim; wa þe, Bethsaida:
gyf swylce wundra wurdon gefremode on Tyro & Sidone swa swa syndon on eow
gefremode, gefyrn hi gedydon mycele dædbote on hæran & on axon.
 64. Nu secge ic to soþan þæt sumera þinga byþ læsse
wite on Domesdæg Tyro & Sidone þonne eow sylfum beo, þe gesawon mine
wundra.
 67. Se Hælend genealæhte to þam sælende to þam
worigendum yþum, ðe hæfdon getacnunge þære unstæððignesse
þæs stuntan mennisces þe butan geleafan leofedon oð þæt, of þam
he wolde habban gehwæne to his gyfe, to þære miltsunge his micclan
cystignesse, for þan þe swa swa þæt godspell us segð, þæt he
gegaderode þa Godes bearn on anum þe wæron tostencte, to his
staðolfæstnesse þæt hi lif hæfdon on him, se þe ure lif is &
eac þæra.
 78. An eard wæs gehaten þa on eastdæle, begeondan
þære ea iordanen decapolis on bocum, þæt is Tyn Burhscira, to
þam com se Hælend, swa swa segð þiss godspell, & he þær
gehælde þurh his halgan hrepunge þone deafan & þone dumban, &
gedyde hine halne, swa swa he ælcne dyde þe him to genealæhte.
 85. Ðes deafa mann getacnode & þes dumba witodlice eall
Adames cynn, þe adeafode swiþe þurh þære næddran word, þe
wæron us deadlice on þære forgægednysse ongean Godes bebod, þæt
mancynn nolde mid geleafan gehiran þa halgan Godes word to his wissunge
þonne.
 91. Mancynn adumbode eac fram his Drihtenes herungum syþþan he
æne gespræc his agen bepæcend, & wið hine motode mid mycelre
dyrstignysse, for þan þe hit is yfel, & mid attre gemenged, þæt se
mann motige wið þone manfullan deofol, swa swa git doð foroft drymen
& wiccan on heora scincræfte, to beswicenne swa þa ungesælige men
þe to him secað.
 99. Ne mihte na se deafa ne se dumba abiddan þone halgan
Hælend his agene hæle; ac his magas bædon, þe hine gebrohton to
Criste, þæt he hine gehælde þurh his halgan mihte; & he mildelice
þam mannum getyþode, for þan þe he eallgod is, & æfre wel wille
eallum rihtgeþancodum þe on hine truwiað.
 106. Swa we sceolon eac don, gif sum ure freonda ne mæg þurh
hine sylfne secan æt his Drihtene his sawle læcedom mid soðre
andetnysse; we sceolon him fulstan & him fore gebiddan, & mid Godes
lare gelome hine tyhtan, þæt he his sawle hæle gesece æt his
Drihtene, þæt he gehyran mage & herian his Scyppend.
 113. Ðiss halige godspell segð þæt se Hælend sona
gelædde þone mann ut of þære meniu, for þan þe he hine alædde
of þæs folces gehlide, þæt he hine awende fram his ærran gewunan
to his halgum bebodum mid gehyrsumnesse, þæt he on godum þeawum Gode
gelicode, & to Godes wegum awende hine sylfne.
 120. He dyde þa his fingras innto his earan.
 121. Ðæs Hælendes fingras, þe halwende syndon,
getacniað soðlice þa seofonfealdan gyfa þæs Halgan Gastes, þe ure
heortan onlihtað; & þurh þa ylcan gyfe he onlihte his mod, þæt
he mihte gehyran þa halwendan lare, & andgit swa habban þurh þone
Halgan Gast; & se Hælend adræfde, þurh þone ylcan Gast, þa
egeslican deofla of þam gedrehton mannum, & he him gewitt forgeaf him
sylfum to wyrðmynte.
 130. Mid his halwendan spatle he hrepode his tungan, þæt he
sprecan mihte, & mannum eac cyþan godes mærða on him mid
menniscum gesceade, þæt ælc mann sceolde, þa god his mod onliht,
his geleafan andettan oþrum menn.
 135. He beseah to heofonum, & sæde mid geomerunge to þam
dumban menn þis an dyrne word: <foreign>Effeta</foreign>: þæt is on Englisc, to
geopenigenne.
 138. To heofonum he beseah mid swiþlicere geomerunge, for þan
þe he gesceop him sylf us æt fruman to heofonlicum þingum, & him
hearde ofhreow þæt we swa feorran þa befeollon þanon on þa
eorðlican þing ealles to utlice.
 143. He geswutelode eac mid his sylfes geomerunge þæt we
sceolon gewilnian þære heofonlican wununge, to þære þe we wæron
geworhte æt fruman, mid modes geomerunge & mid manegum tearum, for þan
þe swa mycel þing mot beon geearnod mid mycelre gewilnunge & þæs
modes godnesse.
 149. He cwæð þa <foreign>effeta</foreign>, þæt ys to geopenigenne, for
þære deafnysse þe him derode oð þæt; ac his halwende hrepung his
earan undyde.
 152. Be þære ylcan dæde doð git Godes þenas þonne hi
cild fulliað, þæt hi settað heora fingras innan þæs cildes earan
mid heora spatle, & on þæs cildes nosu, secgende <foreign>effeta</foreign>.
 156. Ðæt spatl getacnað, swa swa þes traht segð, þone
upplican wisdom þe hit gewilnian sceal, & þære nosa stenc getacnað
þone stenc be þam þe se apostol Paulus þuss awrat: <foreign>Christi bonus odor
sumus Deo in omni loco</foreign>: We syndon us sylfe soðlice Cristes bræð, Gode
sylfum god bræð on ælcere stowe.
 163. Be þam ilcan gecwæð se eadiga Iob: Swa lange swa seo
oreðung is on us wunigende, & Godes Gast on urum nosum, ne sceolon we
sprecan unrihtwisnysse on urum welerum, ne leasunga smeagan mid ure tungan
ahwar.
 168. Hwæt, þa sona wurdon his earan geopenode, & his
tungan bend wearð unbunden eac, & he rihtlice spræc mid his agenum
gereorde.
 171. We sprecað rihtlice on rihtum geleafan, þæt we rihtlice
gelyfon on þone lyfigendan God, & we hine andettan, us sylfum to
hæle.
 174. Nu sceole we hogian þæt we hine ne gremion æfter urum
fulluhte ealles to swiþe, þurh unrihtwise word & þa yfelan dæda;
ac we sceolon swiþor hine symle gladian on mode & on muþe, & eac
mid þam dædum, þæt ure andetness us idel ne beo.
 180. Ða bebead se Hælend þam þe hine brohton þæt hi
hit ne sædon nanum menn nateshwon; ac hi þæs þe swiþor hit sædon
mid wundrunge, & cyddan his mærða mannum, þuss cweðende: Wel he
gedyde ealle þing þurh his wundorlican mihte: he gedyde þæt þa
deafan mihton wel gehyran, & he gedyde þam dumban þæt hi mihton
sprecan.
 187. Se Hælend, þe mihte swylce wundra gefremman, mihte eac
don þæt hi digle wæron; ac he bebead þam mannum þæt hi hit
nanum/ ne sædon for þan þe he sealde him sylf us swa bysne þæt
we/ on þam godum dædum þe we for Gode gedoþ þæne idelan
gylp æfre forbugon .
 194. Se idela gylp huru is an heafodleahter, gode swiðe
sædon/ sæte, & we eac sceolon þone yfelan unþeaw us fram
ascyrian, gyf we habban wyllað þa heofonlican mede, for þam þe se
Hælend swiþe oft forbead on his halgum godspellum þysne heafodleahter,
& het us on digelnysse don ure ælmyssan, & ure gebedu binnan urum
locum, þæt God sylf hit us forgilde, þe gesihð ure digelnysse.
 203. We wyllað eow gereccan sume Cristes wundra, to getrymminge
eowres geleafan.
 204. Vre Drihten stah on scyp, & him fyligdon his
leorningcnihtas.
 205. Efne þa færlice aras mycel styrung & hreohness on
þære sæ, swa þæt þæt scyp wearð mid yþum oferþeht.
 206. Se wind witodlice heom stod ongean mid ormætum blæde.
 207. And se Hælend wearð on slæpe on þam steorsetle.
 208. Ða genealæhton his leorningcnihtas & hine awrehton,
þuss cweðende: Drihten, gehelp ure; we losiað.
 210. He andwyrde, Eala ge lytles geleafan, to hwi synd ge afyrhte?
 211. He aras þa, & þywde þone wind & þa sæ,
& het hi stille beon.
 211. Hwæt þa sona wearð geworden mycel smyltnyss on
þære sae, swa þæt þa reðran, micclum wundriende, cwædon:
Hwæt la, hwylc is þes, þæt ægðer ge windas ge sæ him
gehyrsumiað?
 215. Se Hælend geswutelode mid þam slæpe þa soþan
menniscnysse, & mid þam wundre his godcundan mægenþrymnysse.
 216. He slep swa swa soð mann, & he þa yþiendan sæ mid
anre hæse gestilde swa swa ælmihtig Scyppend, þe ær gesette
þære sæ gemæru, þæt heo nateshwon ne mot middaneard ofergan.
 220. Hi þa oferreowon þone brym & gelendon on þam lande
þe is gehaten Gerasenorum.
 221. Efne þa þa hi upp eodon, arn þær an wod mann togeanes
þam Hælende, se hæfde wununge on hæþenum byrgenum, & hine ne
mihte nan mann mid racenteagum gehealdan, ne mid fotcopsum gehæftan, for
þan þe he eaþelice tobræc þa isenan racenteaga, & þa fotcopsas
eall tocwysde.
 225. He wunode on dunum dæges & nihtes, & on byrgenum,
hrymende, & beatende hine sylfne mid stanum, & nan mann ne mihte
þæs weges faran.
 227. He arn þa to þam Hælende, þa þa he hine geseah,
& feoll to his fotum, mid mycelre stemne clypiende, Eala þu Hælend,
þæs Hehstan Godes Sunu, ic halsige þe þæt þu me ne tintregie.
 230. Se Hælend him cwæð to, ðu unclæna gast, gewit of
þam menn.
 231. And he hine þa befran hwæt his nama wære.
 232. Ða andwyrde se unclæna gast þurh þæs wodan muð,
& cwæð, Min nama is eorod, for þan þe we her manega synd.
 234. And bæd hine þa micclum þæt he hine of þam earde
ne adræfde.
 235. Ða stod þær onemm ða dune micel heord swyna, &
þa deofla bædon þæt hi moston into ðam swynum.
 237. Þa geðafode se Hælend þæt ðam deoflum.
 237. And hi gewiton of ðam  men into ðam swynum.
 238. Þa swyn ða ealle endemes scuton into þære sæ, sume
twa þusend, & þær adruncon þurh þone deofellican scyfe.
 240. Ða swanas flugon afyrhte to þære byrig, & cyddon be
þam swynum, & be þam witseocan menn.
 241. Ða comon þa ceastergewaran sona to þam Hælende, &
gesawon þone wodan mann wel gescrydne, & gewittiges modes, se þe ær
awedde.
 243. Ða gewende Crist to scype, & se gewitseoca hine bæd
þæt he moste mid him.
 245. Drihten him andwyrde, Far þe ham to þinum hiwum, &
cyþ heom hu mycele mihte Drihten on þe geworhte, & hu he þe
gemiltsode.
 247. He þa ferde, swiþe bodigende Drihtenes wundra, and menn
þæs wundredon.
 249. An eorod is on bocum geteald to syx þusendum, & swa fela
awrygedra gasta wæron þam anum menn getenge, oðþæt se mildheorta
Hælend to þam lande reow, & hine ahredde.
 252. Ða deoflu oncneowon urne Hælend Crist, & þæt
Iudeisce folc hine dwollice wiðsoc, & syndon forþi wyrsan þonne þa
awyrgedan deoflu, þe feollon to his fotum mid fyrhte fornumene.
 256. Ne dorston þa deoflu, þa þa hi adræfde wæron, into
þam swynum, gyf he heom ne sealde leafe, ne into nanum menn, for þan þe
se ælmihtiga Drihten ure gecynd hæfde on him sylfum genumen.
 260. Ða swyn hi gecuron for heora sweartum hiwe, & for
þære fulnesse fenlices adelan.
 262. Se mann þe hæfð swynes þeawas, & wyle hine
aþwean mid wope fram synnum, & eft hine befylan fullice mid leahtrum, swa
swa swin deð, þe cyrð to meoxe æfter his þweale, þeawleas nyten,
þonne byð he betæht þam atelicum deoflum for his fulum dædum, þe
he fyrnlice geedlæcð.
 269. Se þe oft gegremað God þurh leahtras, & æfre
geedlæcð his yfelan dæda, he byþ swyne gelic, & forscyldegod
wið God.
 272. Uton we herian urne Drihten symle on his micclum wundrum,
& us miltsunge biddan, & yfel forlætan, & eft ne geedlæcan,
þæt we moton ætwindan þam wælhreowan deoflum & Gode geþeon
þurh gode gehealtsumnesse.
 277. We wyllað eow gyt secgan sum wundor be Criste, & þas
geendunge eallswa geglengan, anfealdum andgite, swa swa Lucas hit awrat on
þære Cristes bec, þuss cweðende be him: Se Hælend ferde iv to
Capharnonbyrig on Galileiscum earde, þær þær his eðel wæs, and
he hi þær lærde on heora restendagum, and hi ealle wundredon
wundorlican lare, for þan þe his spræc wæs on swiðlicere mihte.
 286. And þær wæs þa an wod mann on þære gesamnunge
mid þam fulan gaste deoflice afylled, & se awyrgeda gast þas word
þa clypode swiðe ge Crist, hwæt is us gemæne?
 291. Þu come to fordonne & to amyrrenne us.
 292. Eala ic wat geare þæt þu eart Godes Halga.
 293. Se Hælend þa sona þreade þone deofol, þuss him
secgende: Swiga þu hraðe, & gewit aweg of þisum wodan menn; & he
swa sona þone sceoccan adræfde of þam earman menn, heom eallum tomiddes,
& se deofol ne mihte naht derian þam menn.
 299. Ða wearð mycel oga on eallum þam mannum, & hi
swiþe spræcon, secgende heom betwynan, Hwæt is la þiss word, þuss
wundorlic on him, þæt he on anwealde & on mihte bebytt þam
unclænum gastum þæt hi ut gewitað?
 304. Ða wearð gewidmærsod wide his hlisa on ælcere stowe
ealles þæs eardes.
 306. Swylce wundra worhte se welwillenda Hælend her on þisum
life, to geleafan trymminge, þæt þa mihton secgan þe gesawon his
wundra, & we magon witan þe þa word gehyrað, swa swa his godspelleras
be him sylfum awriton, þæt he is Godes Suna þe gesceop ealle þing,
& us þa alysde mid his agenum life of deofles anwealde; þæs we him a
secgað wuldor & wyrðmynt mid wordum & dædum.
 314. AMEN.

START_TEXT

ÆHom 19
B1.4.19.
Sermo de Die Iudicii: Pope 1967-8, II, 590-609.



 2. Seo halige Cristes boc þe ymbe Cristes wundra sprycð segð
þæt ða Sunderhalgan on sumne sæl ahsodan urne Hælend Crist ymbe
hys tocyme, and ymbe Godes rice on þam mycclan dæge þe we Domesdæg
hatað; and he hym andwyrde þuss: Ne cymð na Godes rice be nanre cepinge,
ne menn ne cweþað na, efne he cymð nu; for þam þe he cymð
færlice, swa swa færlic liget, þe scyt fram eastdæle scinende oð
westdæl.
 10. And swa swa gefyrn gelamp on Noeys flode, menn æton and
druncon and dwollice leofodan, cnihtas wifodon and wif ceorlodan, oðþæt
Noe eode into þam arce.
 14. Þæt flod þa becom færlice ofer hi ealle, and eall
mancynn adrencte, buton eahta mannum, þe innan þam arce wæron, swa swa
hym wissode God.
 17. And swa swa on Loðes dagum eft syððan gelamp, menn
æton and druncon, bohtan and sealdan, byttlodan and plantodan, and beeodan
heora tilunga; þa sende God færlice, sona swa Loð wæs of þære
byrig alæd, ofer þam fif burhscirum fyr and swefel, swylce hit renscur
wære, and mid ealle forbærnde þa fif burhscira.
 24. Eall swa bið on þam dæge þe ure Drihten bið
æteowed, and he cymð to demenne on þam micclan dome eallum manncynne,
ælcum be hys weorcum.
 27. Gif hwa bið on þære tide ymbe hys tilunge, oððe on
his/ huse, oððe on hys æcere, ne mæg he geefstan þæt he aht
ahredde oððe aweg gebringe, gewæda oððe fata.
 31. On þære nihte beoð twegen on anum bedde; an þæra
bið genumen, and oðer bið forlæten.
 33. And twa grindað þonne on anre cwyrne ætgædere; seo an
bið genumen, and seo oðer bið forlæten.
 35. Twegen beoð on æcere erigende ætgædere; se an bið
genumen, and se oðer bið forlæten.
 37. Hi andwyrdan þa and hyne ahsodan þuss: Hwider beoð hy
genumene?
 38. And he hym cwæð to, Swa hwær swa þæt hold bið,
þider gadriað þa earnas.
 40. We willað eow nu secgan sceortlice, gif we magon, þa
diglostan word on þisum Drihtenlican godspelle, for þon þe ge eaðe ne
magon hyt eall understandan.
 43. We habbað nu gehyred on þisum halgan godspelle þæt we
ne magon na cepan, ne nanum menn nis cuð, hwænne ure Drihten cymð to
demenne mancynne on þam endenyhstan dæge þysse worulde; ac we gelyfað
swaþeah þæt us alogen ne bið þæt he cymð soðlice mid hys
scinendum englum on þissere worulde geendunge us to demanne, ælcum be hys
geearnungum; and he þonne forgifð þam þe hym gehyrsumedan, and þam
þe hine gegladodan mid goodum weorcum æfre, þa ecan myrhðe and þa
ecan midwununge mid eallum his halgum on heofonan rice.
 55. Þa earman synfullan, þe hyne forsawan on life, and mid
yfelum dædum hyne æfre gremodan, þa beoð besencte on þære
sweartan helle, mid þam awyrgedum deoflum, æfre to worulde; and se ðe
þyses ne gelyfeð, nys hys geleafa naht.
 60. Se Hælend us sæde soðlice gelicnysse be Noeys flode and
Loðes alysednysse; nu wite ge sume hu hit wæs be Noe and be hys flode, ac
eower fela nat hu hyt wæs be Loðe; ac we wyllað eow secgan.
 65. Loð wæs iu gehaten sum halig Godes þegn, Abrahames
broðor sunu, ær Moyses æ; se eardode þa on þam yfelan leodscipe
Sodomitiscre burhware, þa wæron synfulle menn, and bysmorlice forscyldgode
on sceamlicum dædum.
 70. Þa forbærnde hi God mid heora fif burhscirum mid
heofonlicum fyre and hellicum swefle; ac he sende on ær twegen scinende
englas to þam geleaffullan Loðe, and alædde hyne ut of þam fulan
mancynne, þæt he mid him ne forwurde.
 75. Eall swa bið on Domesdæge on ures Drihtnes tocyme:
þæt fyr cymð swa færlice þæt menn foresceawian ne magon, and mid
egeslicum bryne ealne middaneard ofergæð; and menn þonne ne gymað, for
þam micclan ogan, æniges oðres þinges butan þæs anes brogan, ne
nan mann ne mæg ætberstan þam bradan fyre ahwider; and þæt fyr
þonne afeormað þas eorðan, and hi geedniwað to ænlicum hiwe, and
heo ne bið na forburnen, ac bið geclænsod from eallum þam fylþum
þe hyre fram frymðe becomon, and heo swa on ecnysse eall scinende
þurhwunað.
 86. On þære nihte beoð twegen on anum bedde; an þara bið
genumen, and oðer bið forlæten.
 88. Niht is her gecweden for ðære nytennysse, and for
þære mycelan ehtnysse on Anticristes timan; þonne beoð twegen menn on
anum bedde ætgædere; an þæra bið genumen, and oðer bið
forlæten.
 92. Ða beoð þonne on bedde þe beoð on stillnysse, and
fram eallum woruldcarum æmtige þonne beoð, and Godes þeowdom begað
mid goodum inngehyde; ac hi ne beoð na twegen, ac on twa todælede.
 96. Oþre beoð gecorene and Gode gecweme, oðre beoð mid
hiwunge on his þeowdome afundene.
 98. Þonne genimð se Hælend to hys heofonlican rice þa þe
æmtige wæron fram eallum woruldcarum, æfre on his þeowdome oð
ðone endenyhstan dæg; and sume eac of þam, ðe ungesælige wæron,
and mid leasre hiwunge and lyffetunge ferdon, he forlæt bæftan hym, and
hi beoð þonne belocene wiðutan þære ecan myrhðe.
 105. Swa bið se an genumen and se oðer forlæten þe on
þam bedde beoð þonne gemette þæt is, on þære stilnysse heora
staþolfæstan modes; na twegen menn ana, ac on twa wisan gemodode, oðre
mid soðfæstnysse, oðre mid hiwunge.
 110. Twa grindað þonne on anre cwyrne ætgædere; seo an
bið genumen, and seo oðer bið forlæten.
 112. Ær he cwæð twegen, nu he cwæð twa, on anre cwyrne
emlice grindende.
 114. Þæt synd þa woruldmenn þe woruldþing begað; and
seo woruldcaru is þære cwyrne wiðmeten, þe æfre gæð abutan
ymbe fela geþohtas and mislicum dædum þe menn behofiað, and hefegum
geswincum, swa swa ge sylfe witon.
 119. Be þysum he cwæð twa, and nolde cweðan twegen, for
þam þe hi soðlice ne beoð on swylcere fullfremednysse þæt hi sylfe
magon hym sylfum wissian, ac hy sceolan lybban be heora lareowa wissunge,
bisceopa and mæssepreosta, and heora misdæda betan be heora scrifta
tæcinge, and of heora tilunge don symle ælmyssan; ac hi ne magon
swaþeah þam beon geefenlæhte þe ealle þing forleton for þæs
Hælendes lufon, and hym æfre þeowodon.
 128. Forði synd twa gecwedene, and na twegen weras, for þam
woruldcarum þe hi on wuniað.
 130. Of þam woruldmannum witodlice beoð on twa wisan gemodode
and mislice gelogode; sume beoð gecorene, sume wiðercorene; sume hi
libbað heora lif rihtlice, sume wolice and on synnum geendiað; þonne
genimð se Hælend to hys heofonlican rice on þam micclan dæge of þam
woruldmannum þa ðe mid goodum willan and weorcum æfre hym ær
gecwemdan oð heora lifes ende, and þa wiðercorenan beoð wiðutan
belocene; þonne bið seo an genumen, and seo oðer forlæten.
 141. Twegen beoð on æcere, erigende ætgædere; se an
bið genumen, and se oðer bið forlæten.
 143. Her he cwæð twegen, and nolde cweþan twa, for þære
fullfremednysse and fægerum geþingþum þe þa habban sceolan þe on
Godes æcere swincað.
 146. Godes æcer is Godes gelaþung, þæt is, eall Cristen
folc þe on Crist gelyfð, swa swa Paulus cwæð on sumum his pistole to
þam geleaffullum mannum þe he to geleafan gebigde: <foreign>Dei agricultura estis,
Dei edificatio estis</foreign>; þæt is on Englisc, Ge synd Godes tilung and Godes
getimbrung.
 153. Witað nu þis: Biscopas and mæssepreostas syndon manna
lareowas; hi sceolan hogian ymbe þæs Hælendes tilunge, þæt hi
manega sawla of manncynne gestrynan þam welwillendan Hælende, þe wile us
habban.
 158. Hi sceolon þone Cristendom don Cristes folce, and mid heora
lare symle to geleafan weman, and æfre mid weorcum hym wel bysnian, and on
heora þeowdome þe hi Gode þeowiað hym foreþingian; þonne beoð hi
rihtlice Godes tilian on þam gastlican æcere, and hi swa miclum beoð on
maran geþingðe, swa hi ma sawla of manncynne begytað to heofonan rice;
and hi habbað ealdordom on þam ecan life ofer eallum þam sawlum þe hy
Gode gestryndon mid þære gastlican teolunge.
 169. Is swaþeah to lyt þæra lareowa nu þe þus don wille,
and is manncynn forþi miclum geyrmed, for þam þe þæra is feawa
folces lareowa þe geornlice hogie hu man yfel alegce and unrihtwisnysse, and
riht arære, swa swa we rædað on bocum: <foreign>Canes muti non possunt
latrare</foreign>: Hi synd þa dumban hundas, and hy ne magon beorcan.
 176. Þis cwæð se witega be Godes lareowum, þe noldan
bodian and gebigan manncynn to Godes willan þa on þam timan þe hi
wæron.
 180. Nu is hit gyt wyrse on urum timan, þæt we ealle suwiað,
and unriht gæð forð openlice and digollice, and we embe ne hogiað.
 183. Witodlice þa lareowas þe us lar of com, hi bododan þam
hæðenum and þam hetelum ehterum, and heora lif sealdon for Godes
geleafan; ac we ne durran nu to þam gedyrstlæcan, þæt we Cristenum
cyninge oððe Cristenum folce Godes beboda and Godes willan secgan.
 189. Nu synd twegen gecwedene þe Gode tilian sceolan on þære
gastlican tilunge on Godes gelaðunge, for þam ðe hi ne beoð ealle on
ane wisan geworhte.
 192. Sume hi beoð geornfulle, sume gymelease, sume anræde,
sume asolcene, sume nyttwyrðe, sume unnyttwyrðe, sume swiðe fremfulle,
sume swiðe derigende.
 196. Þonne bið se an genumen, and se oðor forlæten,
þonne se Hælend genimð to his halgum englum ða goodan lareowas into
Godes rice, and þa yfelan beoð wiðutan belocene.
 200. On þisum þrim endebyrdnyssum bið eall mancynn belocen:
twegen on þam bedde, and twa æt þære cwyrne, twegen on þam
æcere, swa swa ge gehyrdon nu.
 203. Hi andwyrdan þa and hyne ahsodon þuss: Hwider beoð hi
genumene?
 204. And he hym cwæð to, Swa hwær swa þæt hold bið,
þider gaderiað þa earnas.
 206. Þa Sundorhalgan ahsodan þone Hælend þa þus: hwider
þa goodan sceoldan gegripene beon, oððe hwider þa yfelan beon
forlætene.
 209. Ða andwyrde he be þam goodum, and nolde be þam yfelum.
 210. Þa earnas getacniað þa geþungenan halgan; and swa swa
earnas hi gegaderiað þær þær þæt hold bið, swa beoð þa
halgan weras to þam Hælende gegadorade, þær þær he on
menniscnysse mihtiglice rihsað, soð mann and soð god, an Godes Sunu
þæs ælmihtigan Fæder, mid þam he æfre ricsað, and mid þam
Halgan Gaste, on anre godcundnysse, amen.
 217. Þa þe beoð forlætene and belocene wiðutan of þam
þrim werodum, þa gewendað to helle, mid eallum deoflum fordemede on
ecnysse; and hi næfre syððan nane miltsunge ne begitað, for þam ðe
hi æfre ær on synnum wunedon.
 222. We habbað nu gesæd hu ða Sundorhalgan ahsodon þone
Hælend be ende þissere worulde; nu wille we eow secgan sceortlice, gif we
magon, hu hys agene leorningcnihtas hyne ahsodon be þam, swa swa seo Cristes
boc us cyð be þam ylcan: <foreign>Interrogatus Iesus a discipulis de consummatione
seculi, dixit eis, Cum autem uideritis abhominationem desolationis, et
reliqua</foreign>; ða halgan apostolas þe mid þam Hælende ferdon, þa þa he
her on worulde wunode mid mannum, ahsodan hyne endemys be þissere worulde
geendunge; he hym þa andwyrde, and hym þus to cwæð: þonne ge
geseoð standan on þære halgan stowe onscuniendlic deofolgild, swa swa
Danihel awrat, se ðe þæt ræde oððe rædan gehyre, undergyte he
þonne þæs witegan word.
 237. Ða þe on Iudea lande þonne lybbende beoð, þa fleoð
þonne to muntum and to micclum dunum; and se ðe on his huse bið on þam
healicum hrofe, ne astige he þonne of þam sticolan hrofe, þæt he hys
yddisce ahredde þe on þam huse bið.
 242. And se þe on æcere beo ymbe hys tilunge, ne cyrre he
underbæc to genimenne hys reaf.
 244. Wa þam eacniendum on þam yfelum dagum, and þam fedendum
on þære frecednysse.
 246. Biddað eornostlice þæt hyt ne beo on wintra, oððe
on restendæge, þonne ge æmtige beoð.
 248. Þonne beoð witodlice swylce gedrefednyssa swylce næfre
ær næran, ne eft ne gewurþað.
 250. Butan God gescyrte þa sorhfullan dagas, eall manncynn
forwurde witodlice ætgædere.
 252. Ac for hys gecorenum he gescyrte þa dagas.
 253. Gif hwa þonne eow sægð þæt Crist sylf beo þonne
on worulde wuniende mid mannum, ne gelyfe ge þæs, for þam þe lease
Cristas/ on þam timan arisað and fela tacna wyrcað, menn to beswicenne
mid heora scincræftum, and eac þa gecorenan menn, gif hit gewurðan
mæg.
 259. Warniað eow eornostlice; ic hyt hæbbe eow gesæd.
 260. Sona æfter þære gedrefednysse adeorcað seo sunne,
and mid ealle aþeostrað, and eac se mona, and steorran feallað færlice
of heofonum, and heofonan mihta beoð þonne astyrode.
 264. Menn geseoð þonne mannes Sunu cumende on þam healicum
wolcnum mid micclum wuldre; he asent þonne soðlice hys englas, and hy
gegaderiað Godes gecorenan menn fram þam feowor windum þissere worulde,
and of þære eorðan up oð þa heofonan.
 270. We habbað nu gesæd þis halige godspell anfealdum
andgyte, and we eac willað þæt gastlice andgyt þurh God eow secgan.
 273. Þa halgan apostolas þe mid þam Hælende ferdon, þa
þa he her on worulde wunode mid mannum, ahsodan hyne endemes be þissere
worulde geendunge; he hym þa andwyrde, and hym þus to cwæð: þonne ge
geseoð standan on þære halgan stowe onscunigendlic deofolgyld, swa swa
Danihel awrat, se ðe þæt ræde, oððe rædan gehyre, undergyte
he þonne þæs witegan word.
 281. Iu on ealdum dagum, ær ðam þe Cristendom wære, menn
worhton deofolgyld wide geond þas woruld, and hi þærto gebædon; ac
ure Drihten adwæscte þone hæðenscype mid hys halgan tocyme, and
þone Cristendom arærde þurh hyne sylfne ærest, and þurh hys
leorningcnihtas, and þurh hys lareowas syððan.
 287. Nu ne wyrcð nan mann nu on þysum timan, gif he geleafan
hæfð, hæþengyld openlice; ac se arleasa Antecrist on ende þissere
worulde wyrcð fela wundra þurh hys feondlican mihte, and þurh Godes
geþafunge, and segð þæt he God si; and þurh hys mycclan wundra menn
bugað to hym and on hine gelyfað, hym sylfum to forwyrde; ac þa gecorenan
halgan hym wiðcweðað æfre, þeah ðæ þa gedwolan hys gedwyldum
gelyfan.
 296. Hwæt bið mare deofolgyld þonne se deofollica Antecrist
hym Godes wurðmynt geahnige, and hyne God talige, and men hym to gebiddan
þurh hys leasan tacna, and þone Hælend forseon, þe is eall
soðfæstnyss?
 300. On þære halgan stowe stent þonne þæt deofolgyld,
swa swa se apostol awrat on sumum hys pistole: <foreign>Ita ut in templo Dei sedeat,
ostendens se tamquam sit Deus</foreign>: Swa þæt he sitt on Godes temple, and
segð þæt he God sy.
 304. Him farað mid æfre ungesewenlice deoflu, þurh ða he
wyrcð wundra wide geond þas eorðan, and ofer eallum manncynne becymð
seo ehtnyss.
 307. Þa ðe on Iudea lande þonne libbende beoð, þa fleoð
to muntum and to micclum dunum; and se ðe on his huse bið on þam healicum
hrofe, ne astige he þonne of þam sticolan hrofe, þæt he hys yddisce
ahredde þe on ðam huse bið.
 312. And se ðe on æcere beo ymbe hys tilunge, ne cyrre he
underbæc to genimene hys reaf.
 314. We moton eow secgan swa swa ge magon understandan, hwilum
anfealdlice be eowrum andgite, hwilum eow geopenian þa inran digolnysse, for
þam þe ge eaðe ne magon hyt eall understandan.
 318. Wa þam eacniendum on þam yfelum dagum, and þam fedendum
on þære frecednysse.
 320. Hwæt agyltað þa wif, þe be Godes hæse tymað and
heora cild fedað on þære frecednysse?
 322. Ac þis is gecweden be þam leasum Cristenum, þe beoð
mid leahtrum afyllede, swa swa gefearhsugu, and mid unwrencum þa unwaran
fordoð, and heora yfel geeacniað swylce mid fostre.
 326. Biddað eornostlice þæt hyt ne beo on wintra, oððe
on restendæge, þonne ge æmtige beoð.
 328. Ne mænde he þone winter þe gewunelice cymð on
þæs geares ymbryne, ac swa swa he on oðre stowe cwæð, <foreign>quia
abundabit iniquitas, refrigescet caritas multorum</foreign>; þæt is, on Engliscum
gereorde, þæt on þam yfelan timan arist seo unrihtwisnyss, and swiðe
gemenigfylt, and seo soðe lufu swiðe acolað, na ealra manna, ac swiðe
manegra, þæt hy nateshwon ne lufiað þone lifigendan God, ne hyra
nyhstan, ne furðan hy sylfe; for ðon se ðe God ne lufað, ne lufað he
hyne sylfne.
 338. Se restendæg is, swa swa we rædað on bocum, halig
freolsdæg on Iudea folce, swa swa we healdað þone halgan Sunnandæg
fram woroldlicum weorcum; and we sceolan wilnian æfre, and æt Gode
biddan, þæt we ne beon æmtige fram goodum weorcum, and on Godes lufan
acolode, þonne us se endenyhsta dæg onsigende bið.
 345. Þonne beoð witodlice swylce gedrefednyssa swylce næfre
ær næron, ne eft ne gewurðað.
 347. Micel ehtnys wæs on anginne Cristendomes, and eac lange
syððan for Cristes geleafan, ær ðam þe man mihte þysne middaneard
gebigan fram þam hæþenscype þe hy on afedde wæron to þam soðan
geleafan þæs lyfigendan Godes.
 352. Man acwealde þa Cristenan mid mislicum cwylmingum, and mid
menigfealdum tintregum hi gemartyrode; ac hym geuðe se Hælend þæt hy
mihton þa wyrcan þa ilcan wundra þe he sylf geworhte.
 356. Nu ne bið hit na swa on Antecristes timan; he tintregað
þa halgan, and eac tacna wyrcð, and þa halgan ne magon on þam timan
gewyrcan ænige tacna, ac hi yfele beoð forþam gedrefede, þonne se
deofol wyrcð menigfealde wundra, and hi sylfe ne magon nane mihte gefremman
on manna gesihðe.
 363. Þonne wet se deofol, and gewitnað þa halgan mid swylcum
tintregum/ swa we secgan ne magon, and mid deofles mihte macað fela wundra.
 366. Butan God gescyrtte þa sorhfullan dagas, eall manncynn
forwurde witodlice ætgædere; ac for his gecorenum halgum he gescyrte þa
dagas.
 369. Ðreo gear he ricsað and syx monðas on mancynne, on
eallre modignysse, eall mid deofle afylled, and on eallum unþeawum and
egeslicum fylðum hys lif bið gelogod on þam lytlan fyrste; and ælcne
mannan he tiht to hys fulum þeawum, and on ælce wisan he wile mancynn
fordon.
 375. Ac for Godes gecorenum God gehradað hys timan.
 376. Gif hwa þonne eow segð þæt Crist sylf beo þonne
wunigende on weorolde mid mannum, ne gelyfe ge þæs, for þam ðe lease
Cristas on þam timan arisað, and fela tacna wyrcað, menn to beswicanne
mid heora scincræftum, and eac þa gecorenan menn, gif hit gewurðan
mæg; warniað eow eornostlice; ic hit hæbbe eow gesæd.
 383. Ure Hælend Crist ne cymð na to mancynne openlice
æteowed on þissere weorolde ær þam micclan dæge þonne he
mancynne demð; ac þa leasan Cristas and þa leasan witegan þonne cumað
on Antecristes timan; hi syndon hys lima and hys leasan geferan, and geond
þas woruld farað mid feondlicum cræfte, and to fela beswicað mid heora
scincræfte; ac þa beoð gehealdene þe þurhwuniað oð ende on
Cristes geleafan, swa swa he sylf gecwæð.
 393. He gewarnode þa, swa swa þis gewrit us segð, hys halgan
apostolas, and eac us þurh hi, þæt we georne healdan hys geleafan
æfre, and ure lif syllan ær we hyne wiðsacon; and hyt soðlice
gewyrð swa swa he sylf sæde, swa swa we nu ræddon on þissere
rædinge.
 399. Sona æfter þære gedrefednysse adeorcað seo sunne,
and mid ealle aþeostrað, and eac se mona, and steorran feallað færlice
of heofonum, and heofonan mihta beoð þonne astyrode.
 403. Sona æfter þære ehtnysse bið Antecrist ofslagen
þurh Cristes mihte on hys tocyme, and engla werodu beoð astyrede, and mid
þam Hælende cumað of þam heofonlican þrymme swutollice æteowde,
swa swa us segð þis godspell.
 408. Menn geseoð þonne mannes Sunu cumende on þam healicum
wolcnum mid micclum wuldre.
 410. Crist sylf is mannes Sunu, swa swa he sæde foroft; he is
anes mannes sunu swa swa nan oðer man nis; he cymð þonne on þam wolcnum
mid micclum wuldre to þam micclan dome, swa swa hit awriten is.
 414. He asent þonne soðlice hys englas, and hi gegaderiað
Godes gecorenan menn fram þam feower windum þissere worulde, and of
þære eorðan up oð þa heofonan.
 418. Ða englas þonne blawað heora byman hlude, and eall
manncyn arist þe æfre cucu wæs of heora byrgenum, and þa englas
gebringaþ þa gecorenan menn to Criste sylfum, þæt hi mid him ricsian
on heofonan rice on lichaman and on sawle, gesæliglice æfre.
 424. Crist cwæð on oðre stowe be þam arleasum þuss:
<foreign>Exibunt angeli et separabunt malos de medio iustorum, et mittent eos in
caminum ignis, ibi erit fletus et stridor dentium</foreign>;þæt is on Englisc,
Englas farað þonne and asyndriað þa yfelan and þa synnfullan menn
fram þam rihtwisum, þe ricsiað mid Gode, and awurpað hi ealle innto
ðam widgillan fyre þære bradan helle, on þære hy byrnað æfre,
þær bið wop and wanung, and toða gristbitung; and hi nahwar ne
wuniað butan on þam witum æfre.
 435. Soðlice þa halgan siðiað mid Criste to heofonan rice
mid hys halgum englum, ge weras ge wifmenn, swa swa hi on worulde lyfodon, and
siððan wuniað gesælige mid him on unasecgendlicre blisse a butan ende,
AMEN.

START_TEXT

ÆHom 20
B1.4.20.
De doctrina Apostolica: Pope 1967-8, II, 622-35.



 2. On manega wisan lærð Godes lar þa Cristenan.
 2. On þære lare is ægðer ge liðnys ge stiðnyss, for
þan ðe ealle men ne magon anes modes beon.
 4. Ærest man fet þæt cild mid meolce, and syððan mid
hlafe.
 5. Gif ðu hit fetst ærest mid hlafe, hit ne leofað sona.
 5. Eft, þonne hit yldre byð, hit behofað þæs hlafes, and
stiðran metes.
 6. Swa is eac on Godes lare liðnyss and stiðnys, þæt se
ðe gyt ne mæg þa mæstan beboda healdan, þæt he huru leornige on
ðam liðran bebodum hu he on sumne sæl hine sylfne gewylde to maran
stiðnysse mid his modes gecnyrdnysse.
 9. An eorðlic cyning hæfð meniges cynnes menn, sume
geþungenran, sume ungeþungenran.
 10. Swa gedafenað eac Gode þæt he gode men hæbbe and
geþungene þenas to his ðenungum, and him nateshwon ne licað þæt hi
ealle þa liðnysse lufian, ac he wyle þæt hi sume ða softnysse
forhogion, and heardnysse niman to healicum geþincðum.
 14. Paulus, þeoda lareow, cwæð, swylce be him sylfum ac he
mænde mid þam eac oðre menn, ða ða ic wæs lytel and iung, ic
spræc swa swa iungling, ic cuðe swa swa lytlingc, ic þohte swa swa
lytlingc.
 17. Eft, þa þa ic to werlicere ylde becom, ic awearp and
aidlode þa idelnyssa þe ic on cildlicre ylde beeode.
 19. Eft cwæð sum witega, <foreign>Puer centum annorum maledictus
erit</foreign>: Hundteontigwintre cild byð awyrged.
 21. Ðæt is on andgite, Se mann ðe hæfð ylde on gearum,
and hæfð cildes þeawas on dysige, þæt se byð awyrged.
 22. Ælc treow blewð ær þan þe hit wæstmas bere, and
ælc corn bið ærest gærs.
 23. Swa eac ælc godes cinnes mann sceal hine sylfne to godnysse
awendan, and wisdom lufian, and forlætan idelnysse.
 25. He sceal hlystan wisdomes æt wisum mannum, for þan swa he
oftor Godes lare gehyrð, swa he gehendor byð þam wisdome.
 27. Ne sceal nan mann forhogian þæt he gehyre Godes lare, for
þan ðe hit byð swyðe pleolic þam men þæt he his Scyppendes
beboda gehyran nelle, swylce he Godes hæse forseo.
 30. Wæteres gecynd is hnesce, and stanes gecynd is heard, ac
swaþeah þæt wæter foroft dropmælum þyrlað þone heardan
stan.
 32. Swa eac Godes word þurhgæð þæs mannes heortan, and
ahnexað to Godes bebodum, gif he gelome þa lare gehyrð.
 34. God cwæð æt fruman to mancynne, on middaneardes
anginne, Weaxað and beoð gemenigfylde, and gefyllað þas eorðan.
 35. Eft on þære niwan gecyðnysse, þæt is on
godspelbodunge, cwæð Crist to ðam IUdeiscum, Ic secge eow to soðan,
þæt/ swa hwa swa his wif forlæt, buton heo dyrneceorl hæbbe, and gif
he oðer wif nimð, þonne byð he forliger, and se ðe þæt
forlætene/ wif genimð byð forliger.
 40. Ða cwædon Cristes leorningcnihtas him to, Gif ðam were
is þus mid wife, selre him byð þæt he ne wifige.
 42. Ða cwæð Crist, Ne underfoð ealle men þis word, ac
þam þe hit forgifen byð.
 43. Sume eunuchi synd þe beoð swa acennede, and sume eunuchi
synd þe synd fram mannum swa gemacode, and sume eunuchi synd ðe hi sylfe
forhabbað fram hæmede for heofonan rices myrhðe.
 46. Healde ðis se þe hit healdan mæge.
 46. Gif Crist hete ealle men healdan mægðhad, þonne wurde
mancyn raðe geendod.
 48. Nu is Criste leofre þæt se man be his agenre gecorennysse
þa clænnysse geceose þe he sylf astealde, þonne he ealle menn bebunde
mid þam anum bebode.
 50. And seo clæne lac, þæt is mægðhad, sceal beon Gode
mid glædnysse geoffrod, na mid neadunge ænigre hæse.
 53. Wite gehwa, se ðe þa clænnysse Gode æne behæt,
þæt he hit eft ne awæge.
 54. Fæder and moder moton heora bearn to swa hwylcum cræfte
gedon swa him leofost byð, and God bead þæt ealle bearn beon gehyrsume
fæder and meder.
 56. Gif hi þonne heora bearn Gode betæcað, to his clænum
ðeowdome, and þæt bearn byð him ungehyrsum, þonne getimað him swa
swa hit awriten is: <foreign>Nemo inobediens parentibus saluus erit</foreign>: Ne byð nan man
gehealden þe byð ungehyrsum fæder and meder.
 61. Ne mot nan man his lima ne his gesceapu forceorfan.
 61. We rædað on þære bec, Uita Patrum, þæt twegen
munecas gehældon hi sylfe ; ac ealle ða halgan lareowas hi amansumodon
sona, and hi mid mycelre earfoðnysse eft begeaton þæt hi unamansumode
wurdon, for þan ðe bec hit forbeodað.
 66. God behet þurh þone witegan Isaiam þam mannum þe on
mægðhade wuniað, and þa clænnysse gecuron þe him gecweme is,
þæt he wolde him forgifan þa selestan wununge on his huse, þæt is
on heofonan rice, and þone selran naman him gesettan, toforan sunum and
dohtrum, se þe ne byð næfre adilegod.
 70. Se apostol Paulus, ealra þeoda lareow, awrat on his pistole
ðus: Ic secge wydewum, and þam ðe butan hæmede wuniað, þæt him
is swyðe god þæt hi swa þurhwunian, swa swa ic sylf.
 73. Eft cwæð se ylca apostol, Gif ðu wif nimst, þu ne
syngast; and gif mæden ceorlað, heo ne syngað.
 75. Ic secge swaþeah þæt þes tima is swiðe sceort.
 76. Beon forði þa ðe wif habbað swylce hi nan nabbon; and
þa ðe blissiað swylce hi na ne blission; and þa ðe bicgað swylce hi
hit nagon; and þa ðe brucað þyses middaneardes, beon hi swylce hi his
ne brucon.
 79. Ðises middaneardes hiw gewit.
 79. Se man þe butan wife wunað hogað hu he Gode gecweme; and
se þe mid wife wunað hogað embe woruldþing, and hu he his wife
gecweme.
 82. And clæne mæden cepð Godes willan, þæt heo halig
sy ægðer ge on lichaman ge on sawle; and seo ðe ceorlode smeað embe
woruldþing, and hu heo hyre were licige.
 84. Ðæt wif byð under hyre weres iuce þa hwile þe he
leofað; and gif heo hyre wer oferbit, þonne byð heo frig, swa heo on
wydewan hade wunige, swa heo ceorlige, gif heo iung byð and ungehealtsum; ac
heo byð gesælig gif heo on wudewan hade wunað, be minum ræde.
 88. Ic wene þæt ic hæbbe Godes Gast on me.
 90. Se ylca ðeoda lareow, Paulus, cwæð: God byð þam men
þæt he wif ne hreppe; swaþeah, þe læs þe hi on forliger
befeallon, wifige se ðe wille, and ceorlige seo ðe wille; and heora naðor
oðerne ne bepæce; cepan hi huru þæt hi magon on gewissum timan hi
clænlice to Gode gebiddan.
 94. Gif hwylc gelyfed man hæfð ungeleafful wif, and heo wylle
wunian mid him, ne forlæte he hi; þæt ungeleaffulle wif byð
gerihtwisod þurh þone geleaffullan wer.
 97. And gif hwylc geleafful wif hæfð ungeleaffulne wer, and he
wylle wunian mid hyre, ne forlæte heo hine; se ungeleaffulla wer byð
gerihtwisod þurh þæt geleaffulle wif.
 99. Ic bebeode swaðeah na ic ac God sylf bebyt þæt wer and
wif hi ne totwæman.
 100. Gif hi þonne þæt doð, wunian hi butan hæmede,
oððe hi eft hi gegaderian.
 102. Eac hit wære rihtlic, æfter boca tæcinge, þæt se
cniht ungewemmed wære oððæt he wifode, swa swa he wyle þæt his
mæden ungewemmed him to cume.
 105. Se ylca apostol cwæð, ælc man hæfð synderlice
gife fram Gode, sum swa, sum elles.
 106. Swa mycel is se sinscipe, þæt þeah hwa hæbbe
untymende wif, and heo ne mage bearn habban, þæt se wer ne mot swaþeah
hi forlætan, and oðer tymende geniman, for þan ðe God ælmihtig
mæg eaðe gedon, gif his willa swa byð, þæt þæt untymende wif
byð tymende, swa swa he dyde Abrahames wife, and Isaaces, and gehwylce
oðre.
 111. Nis swaþeah hæmed geset for nanum þinge buton for
bearnes gestreone, and æfter þam boclican regole, ne sceolde nan man
bearneacnigendum wife genealæcan, ne monoðseocum, ne þam ðe for ylde
untymende byð.
 114. Se ðe þis healdan mæg, he byð fulfremed on læwedum
hade, swa swa we be manegum mannum rædað.
 116. Se ðe hine sylfne to þyssere forhæfednysse gewyldan ne
mæg, he ah þearfe þæt he mid ælmyssan and mid sumere dædbote
hine sylfne geclænsie.
 119. Is eac to witenne þæt Cristene men sceoldon gan to husle
oftor þonne hi doð, swa swa man deð þær ðær man þone
Cristendom wel hylt.
 121. Eawfæste men magon gan to husle be Godes leafe Sunnandagum
on Lenctenfæstene, and on ðam þrim Swigdagum, and on Easterdæge, and
on þam þunresdæge on þære Gangwucan, on ðam dæge þe Crist to
heofonum lichamlice astah, and on Pentecosten, and on ðam feower Sunnandagum
þe beoð æfter þam feower Ymbrenfæstenum.
 126. Ðus mæg don se ðe rihtlice leofað, gif he ne byð
underþeod þam eahta heafodleahtrum: þæt is, modignyss and gifernyss,
unrihthæmed and gitsung, unwislic weamodnyss and þyssere worulde
unrotnys, asolcennyss and idelgylp.
 129. Se þe swa oft gan nelle to husle, gange huru þriwa on
geare.
 131. Gif man seocne mann huslað, he sceal his synna geandettan,
and he ne sceal na ortruwian, ne on orwennysse befeallan, ac hihtan on þone
Hælend, and hopian to his miltsunge, for ðan se þe ortruwað be Godes
arfæstnysse, and hihtleas geendað, se losað on ecnysse.
 136. Be ðam we magon secgan sume soðe bysne, swa swa Beda
awrat, ðysum wordum secgende: He cwæð þæt sum forðmann wære on
Myrcena lande, swyðe leof þam cyninge þe Kenred wæs gehaten.
 140. Se þegen wæs gymeleas on his þeawum and dædum, and
dyslice leofode, and fordyde hine sylfne.
 142. Ða manode hine se cyning þæt he his mandæda geswice,
and his synna geandette mid soðre behreowsunge, þylæste he færlice
forðferde mid his synnum.
 145. Se cyning hine lufode, and gelome hine swa tihte, ac he
forseah his lare, and let him eaðe embe þæt, cwæð þæt he
wolde on fyrste fon to dædbote.
 148. He wearð ða gesicelod sarlice æt nextan, and se cyning
Kenred com to him licgendum, and bæd þæt he sceolde his synna
geandettan mid soðre behreowsunge huru ær he swulte.
 152. He cwæð þæt he nolde cyðan þa his synna, ac
syððan he gewyrpte he wolde hi geandettan, þy læs ðe hine man
tælde, swylce he for yrhðe hi geandette þa on his untrumnysse, þa ða
he ansund nolde.
 156. Him þuhte þæt he spræce þegenlice word, ac he
wæs beswicen þurh þone swicolan deofol, swa swa hit him aeode earmlice
syððan.
 159. His wise wæs ða wyrsigende, and him weox seo untrumnys,
and se cyning eode eft in to ðam seocan.
 161. He clypode ða earmlice, and cwæð to þam cyninge,
Hwæt woldest þu nu æt me?
 162. Ne miht þu me nanum gode.
 163. Ða cwæð se cyning him to, Ne clypa þu swa unwislice;
wite þin gewit.
 164. He andwyrde and cwæð, Ne eom ic na gewitleas, ac min
gewit is yfel.
 166. Me comon lytle ær to twegen Godes englas, and brohton me
ane boc, seo wæs beorhte scinende, ac heo wæs swyðe gehwæde, and
heton me rædan.
 169. Ic ða sceawode þa boc and þæron geseah þa feawa
godan dæda þe ic dyde seldon, þa wæron swyðe feawa; and hi
færlice genamon eft þa boc æt me, and me nan þing ne sædon.
 173. Efne þa færlice comon þa cwealmbæran deoflu, swyðe
anþræc werod, and eall ðis hus afyldon, and manega wiðutan on ælce
healfe sæton.
 176. Hwæt ða se fyrmesta forðteah ane boc mycele and
ormæte, swylce mannes byrðen.
 178. He het þa ræcan me to rædenne þa boc, and ic
þæron geseah mid sweartum stafum awritene ealle mine synna þe ic sið
and ær gefremode, and mine yfelan geþohtas on þære atelican bec,
swyðe swutelice, swa swa ic sylf oncneow.
 183. Ða cwædon þa deoflu to þam Drihtnes englum ðe ða
lytlan boc me brohton, Hwæs abide ge her?
 185. Ge sylfe witon þæt þeos sawul is ure.
 186. Ða englas þa cwædon to þam atelicum deoflum, Soð ge
secgað; nimað his sawle to ðam ecum witum on eowrum forwyrde.
 189. And þa englas sona of minre syhðe gewiton.
 190. Ða arison sona of þam sweartan flocce twegen egeslice
deoflu mid isenum tolum, swylce twa scearu, and slogon me hetelice, an on
þæt heafod and oðer on þone fot, and gað nu þa dyntas þæs
deofollican sleges to minum innoðe mid ormætum sarum, and þonne hi
togædere cumað, min gast sceal gewitan of þam earman lichaman mid þam
atelicum deoflum to hellicum clysingum, on ðam hatan fyre.
 199. Ðus clypode se earming mid orwennysse, and he hraðe
þæs gewat to ðam ecum witum butan dædbote, mid ðam deoflum
genyðerod.
 202. Ne fremode his gesyhð him sylfum nan þing, ac for oðrum
mannum him wearð æteowed þæt, þæt þa beon gerihtlæhte þe
ðas rædinge gehyrað, for ðan ðe ure dæda beoð ealle awritene,
swa yfele, swa gode, on ecum gemynde, and us eft beoð æteowde on ðam
endenextan dæge.
 208. Us sæde eac Beda be sumum gelæredum smyðe, se wæs
mynsterman, and gemearcod Gode.
 210. Se lufode druncennysse, and dyslice leofode, and læg on his
smiððan, and forlet his tidsangas, and þa gebroðra ne mihton gebetan
his unþeawas.
 213. He wearð ða æt nextan geuntrumod to deaðe, and geseah
helle gata him sylfum geopenode, and eac þone deofol on þam deopum witum,
and þa arleasan Iudeiscan, þe urne Drihten ofslogon, ealle fordemede on
þam ecan fyre; and geseah him sylf eac, hwær his setl wæs gegearcod on
ðam hellican fyre, and wanode him sylfum, and sæde þam gebroðrum
hwæt him geswutelod wæs.
 221. Ða bædon þa gebroðra þæt he gebuge to Gode mid
soðre behreowsunge, ær þan ðe he sawlode.
 223. He andwyrde mid orwennysse, Hu mæg ic nu gecyrran, þonne
ic sylf geseah min setl on helle?
 225. And he gewat þa swa mid þam wordum of life, butan
huslunge, and hi ne dorston him fore gebiddan.
 227. Him getimode þa swa, swa swa us secgað bec: þæt se
ðe sylfwilles nele his cyrican gesecan, þæt he sceal unþances into
helle gan.
 230. Eala, hu mycel todal is on Godes domum.
 231. Se eadiga Stephanus, þa ða he ehtnysse þolode, and to
deaðe wæs gebroht for Drihtnes geleafan, ða geseah he swutelice þone
soðfæstan Hælend æt his Fæder swyðran, þurh ða scinendan
heofonan, þyder þe he to sceolde for his soðan geleafan.
 236. And þes earma smið openlice geseah þa hellican wita and
þa hetelan deofla, þyder þe he, ungesælig, him sylf toweard wæs,
æfre to wunigenne on witum mid him for his yfelnysse and orwennysse, for
þan ðe he nolde furðon on his ende gecyrran.
 242. Us secgað bec foroft þæt manega gebugon on ende, on
heora forðsiðe, to Gode mid fæstum geleafan, and mid soðre
behreowsunge, and heora synna geandettan, and God him þa gemiltsode for his
micclan godnysse.
 246. Se sceaða þe hangode forscyldegod on rode mid andetnysse
bæd Cristes arfæstnysse, and Crist him sona behet þæt he cuman moste
ðæs ylcan dæges mid him to ðam ecan wuldre.
 250. Ælc þæra þe geortruwað and geendað butan hihte,
se losað openlice on ðam ecan forwyrde; and se þe hopað to Criste
becymð to miltsunge huru on Domesdæg, for þæs Hælendes godnysse.
 254. Se us gelæde to ðam ecan life.
 254. AMEN.
