START_TEXT

ÆHom 21
B1.4.21.
De populo Israhel: Pope 1967-8, II, 641-60.



 1. We habbað nu gesæd, swa we sceortlicost mihton, on þam
ærran cwyde, hu se ælmihtiga God his agen folc ahredde fram Faraoes
þeowte, and hu hi siðodon ofer ða Readan Sæ, and hu he hi afedde
feowertig geara mid heofonlicum mete, and þær nan man næs on eallum
þam fyrste furðon geuntrumod, ne heora reaf næs tobrocen binnon þam
fyrste.
 9. Nu wylle we git secgan sum ðing be ðam folce.
 10. Syx hund þusend manna, swa swa Moyses awrat, wæron on
þære fyrde, wigendra manna, buton þam ceorlfolce, and cildum and wifum,
and God hi ealle afedde swyðe eaðelice, swa þæt him ælce dæg com
edniwe mete to mid þam upplicum deawe æt heora geteldum, swa hwær swa
hi wicodon, and se wæs on swæcce ælces cynnes werednysse þæs þe
þam menn gelyste.
 18. Ðæt is swutellice to secgenne þæt se mete awende, on
þæs mannes muðe þe þone mete æt, to þæs metes swæcce ðe
him sylfum gelicode, swa hu swa he wolde habban to gereorde.
 22. And of heardum stane him arn wæteres stream him eallum
genoh, and eac heora orue, for þan ðe se ælmihtiga God, þeah ðe he
eaðe mihte, nolde him win sendan on þam westene þa, ne furðan ealu,
flowende of ðam stane.
 27. God sylf com ða sume dæg him to on anum mycclum munte þe
menn hatað Sinai, swa þæt eall þæt folc mihte geseon swyðe mycel
fyr ofer ealne þone munt mid egeslicum lige, for þan ðe God sylf com mid
ðam fyre ðyder, and mid bymena dreame, and mid micclum þunore.
 33. He gesette þa æ eallum þam folce, þæt synd rihte
lagu, hu men lybban sceoldon, and ænne God wurðian æfre mid geleafan,
for þan ðe nan god nys þe ænige godcundnysse hæbbe buton se ana
þe ealle þing gesceop.
 33. He worhte feala wundra on ðam westene þa, ac þæt folc
wæs wiðerræde witodlice to oft, and to swyðe gegremedon þone
soðan God.
 41. Moyses wunode on þam munte mid Gode feowertig daga on an, and
þæt folc þa hwile worhton him god of golde agotenne, and him lac
offrodon, and swyðe þæs fægnodon on heora gebeorscype, and begunnon
to plegenne ætforan þam gode þe hi of golde geworhton.
 47. Ða cwæð God to Moyse on þam munte Sinai, Astih adune
hraðe of ðysum steapum munte; þis folc hæfð gesyngod, and hi sylfe
worhton him agotenne god of golde nu iu, and him lac offriað, and to him
gebiddað.
 52. Moyses þa astah of þam sticolan munte, and com to ðam
folce ætforan þam gode, and cwæð to him eallum mid anrædum mode,
gif her æni man sy of eallum þysum folce þe on God gelyfe, gange se to
me.
 57. Hwæt þa sona eode eall seo mægð him to of Leuies
cynne, and he cwæð him þa to, Gað nu hraðe ealle unforhte mid
wæpnum þurh ealle þas fyrde fram ende oð oðrum, and ofsleað ealle
tomiddes þam folce þa ðe ge gemetað for þyssere mandæde.
 63. Ða eode seo mægð be Moyses hæse þurh ealne þone
here æfre ofsleande, and hi ofslogon on þam dæge þreo and twentig
þusenda, and Moyses tobræc and tobrytte þone god eall to duste þa, and
þæt gedwyld alede.
 68. Eft æfter þysum hi begunnon ceorian mid mycelre murcnunge
ongean God Ælmihtigne, for heora geswince þe hi swuncon on þære fare;
ac Gode ne licode na heora geleafleast, ne heora ceorung, ac asende him to fyr
of heofonum, and forbærnde sona sumne dæl þæs werodes for heora
wodnysse.
 75. Ða clypodon hi ealle endemes to Moysen, and Moyses gebæd
þone ælmihtigan God for ðam dyrstigan folce, and þæt fyr wearð
adwæsced.
 78. Ðas race we secgað eow nu to rihtinge, þæt nan mann ne
sceole ceorian ongean God mid dyrstigum anginne, ne his Drihten gremian, se
þe æfre wyle wel þam ðe hit geearniað, and he ða gefrefrað þe
his fultumes biddað.
 83. Hi ongunnon eft ceorian and swyðe murcnian, æfter
flæscmettum swyðe oflyste, and sædon him betwynan, Hwa sylð us
flæscmete?
 86. Witodlice we wæron wel on Egipta lande on fisce and on
fugele, and on feala estmettum; nu we naht ne geseoð buton þysne ænne
mete.
 89. Ða wearð Moyses micclum astyred, ac God him cwæð to
þæt him cuman sceolde, eallum þam folce, na to anum dæge, ac to anum
monðe, flæscmættas genoge, oððæt him wlatode þære
gewilnunge.
 94. God sende him ða sona, mid swyðlicum winde, micel fleogende
fugelcyn feorran ofer sæ; þa flugon endemes into þære fyrde, swa
þæt ælc man gefeng on eallum þam folce swa micel swa he wolde and he
gewyldan mihte; and æton swa swyðe of þære sande ealle.
 100. Ne ateorode him se mete ðe hi swa micclum gewilnodon, ac
þæt flæsc cleofode þa gyt on heora toðum, and þa ða hi fulle
wæron, þa feollon hi deade, feala þæs folces, for þan þe hi
fandodon Godes.
 104. Hwi woldon hi gremian God swa unðearfes, þæt hi mid
ceorunge forsawon þone mete þe him ælce dæg edniwe becom, and woldon
habban wyrta and þa gewunelican mettas þe hi ær hæfdon æt ham on
Egipta lande, þa ða hi worhton Pharaoes weallas, and his burga getimbrodon
on bysmorlicum þeowte, and man ælcne beswang mid gescyndnysse ða, buton
he þæt weallweorc wel ða gefyrþrode.
 113. And heora hysecild eac man het acwellan of þam twelf
mægðum, þa ða hi to mannum comon.
 115. Nu alysde hi God of ðam laðum þeowte, and heora fynd
acwealde, and Pharao þone cyning, þe hi swa geswencte, on þære sæ
middan, þæt þær nan man ne becom cucu ða to lande buton Israhela
folc, ðe ferdon of ðam lande gangende mid fotum, þurh Godes mihte ealle,
ofer ða Readan Sæ, swa swa we rædað on bocum.
 122. Nu wæron hi oflyste þurh heora unlustas flæsclicra
metta, unmægðlice swaþeah, for þam ðe se heofonlica mete hæfde
ælcne swæc ælcere werodnysse þe ænig mete hæfð, and wæs
eac wurðlicor þonne ða wyrta wæron þe hi æt ham sudon on heora
croccum mid flæsce.
 128. Se heofonlica mete hæfde þa getacnunge ures Hælendes
Cristes, þe com of heofonum to us, þe is engla bigleofa and ealra manna lif
þe on hine gelyfað, and hine nu lufiað.
 132. Þone acwealdon syððan þæt ylce Iudeisce cynn, and
noldon hine habban heora sawlum to bigleofan; ac we gelyfað on hine, and lif
habbað þurh hine, and he is us inmeddre þonne ða estmettas, for þan
ðe we æfre habbað ealle þing þurh hine, ge on ðyssere worulde ge
on ðære toweardan, and us nanre werednysse ne byð wana mid him, gif we
hine ænne habbað on urum geleafan.
 140. Se ælmihtiga God æfter þysum gespræc to Moyse þam
heretogan, and het hine sendan of ðæs folces meniu menn to ðam lande,
þær þær hi to sceoldon, and sceawian þæt land, for þan ðe
God wolde his agen word gefyllan, and þæt folc gelædan to ðam
behatenan lande, swa swa he gefyrn behet þam heahfædere Abrahame.
 147. Moyses þa genamode of ðam twelf mægðum twelf
heafodmenn, and het faran to þam lande, and sceawian þa wæstmas on wuda
and on felda, and het hi eac bringan him to sceawienne of þæs landes
wæstmum, þæt hi witan mihton hwæðer þæt land wære
wæstmbære and god.
 153. Hi ferdon þa sona to ðam foresædan lande, and sceawedon
þone eard, and eac swylce brohton sume winbogas mid berion afyllode and
oðre ofætan him eallum to sceawienne, and cwædon to Moyse and to ealre
þære meniu, Ðæt land we sceawedon þe ðu us to sendest; þær
is swyðe god eard, ac he is earfoðe us to begytenne þurh urne fultum
swaðeah; þær synd mycele burga and mærlice geweallode, and þær
we gesawon eac swylce entas, Enaches cynnes þæs ealdan entes; we synd
wið hi geðuhte swylce oðre gærstapan.
 165. Ða wurdon hi ealle wundorlice astyrode mid mycelre ceorunge,
and sædon him betwynan, Uton eft gecyrran to Egipta lande, þæt we on
ðam lande ne licgan ofslagene, ne ure wif and cild ne wurðon gehergode.
 170. Iosue, swaþeah, and se snotera Chaleph, þe þær asende
wæron mid þam foresædum ærendracan to sceawigenne þæt land,
sædon ða him eallum, Se eard þe we sceawedon is swyðe ænlic and
god, and God sylf us gelæt and to ðam earde gebringð.
 175. Ne beo ge na wiðerræde ongean Godes ræde; eaðelice
we magon þæt mancynn ofercuman; ne beo ge na afyrhte, for þan ðe God
is mid us.
 178. Ða wurdon hi ealle wundorlice him grame, and woldon hine
oftorfian wodlice mid stanum; ac Godes wuldor ætywde, þæt hi ealle
gesawon, and god sylf gespræc sona to Moysen: Hu lange wyle þys folc me to
tale habban, and humeta nellað hi me gyt gelyfan on eallum þam wundrum þe
ic worhte ætforan him?
 185. Ælc þæra manna þe is of ealre þyssere menigu nu
þritigwintre, þe ðus ceorode soðlice ongean me, ne sceal he becuman to
ðam æðelan earde þe eow behaten wæs, buton Iosue ana and his gefera
Chaleph.
 190. Eowre cildra sceolon, ðe nu synd unwittige, habban þone
eard þe eow swa mislicað, and eowre lic sceolon licgan bæftan him on
ðysum westene for eower unrihtwisnysse.
 194. Æfter þysum wordum wearð Godes yrre egeslice geswutelod
on ðam ærendracan þe þæt land sceawedon, and hit syððan
tældon, and ealles þæs folces mod swa mistihton ongean God, swa
þæt hi ealle feollon on þæs folces gesyhðe, mid Godes yrre
ofslagene, buton se snotera Chaleph, and se æðela Iosue, hi ane twegen
leofodon, for þan ðe God cwæð be him þæt hi becuman sceoldon to
þam foresædon lande for heora geleafan.
 203. Ðæt folc þa þæs on merigen macodon hi gearwe,
astigon ða endemys up to anre dune, sædon þæt hi woldon siðian to
þam earde; ac Moyses him forbead micclum þus cweðende: Ne fare ge, ic eow
bidde, swa fuse to þam lande, for þan ðe God nis nu nateshwon mid eow,
þylæste ge feallon ætforan eowrum feondum.
 210. Hi swaþeah ablende mid gebeote ferdon butan Godes dihte mid
dyslicum anginne; ac him com togeanes þæt Chananeisce folc, and hi swyðe
ofslogon mid swurdes ecge, and on fleame gebrohton þa fyrdlafe, þæt hi
mihton geseon þæt hi swuncon on ydel, swa swa ælc þæra manna deð
þe ongean his Drihten winð.
 217. Æfter þysum arison eft ongean Moysen þridde healf hund
manna mid mycelre ceorunge, þære heafodmenn wæron þus gehatene: Chore
and Dathan, Abiron and Hon.
 221. Hi axodon ða mid graman þa Godes þegnas, Moysen and
Aaron, Hwi wylle ge swa mycclum eow sylfe ahebban ofer ðysum folce?
 224. And þrafodon hi swyðe hwi hi sceoldon habban anweald ofer
hi.
 225. Ða cwæð moyses him to, nimað nu tomerigen eower
ælc his storcyllan, þæt ge sterna magon ealle ætforan Gode, and God
þonne geswutelað hwæne he gecyst to his þenungum.
 229. Ða þæs on merigen wolde Moyses gestillan and mid
wisdome alecgan heora wodnysse; sende þa to Dathan and to his geferum,
þæt hi comon him to, and cuðlice to spræcon; ac hi forsawon endemes
his hæse, and mid maran wodnysse hine micclum tyrigdon, and þone
ælmihtigan God gremedon to swyðe, þe hine gesette him to heretogan.
 237. Se Chore þa genam, þe we ær foresædon, and ealle his
gegadan, Gode to forsewennysse, ælc his recelsfæt ætforan Godes
getelde, and ontendon þone stor, swa swa man steran sceal, swylce hi mihton
hi sylfe gewyrcan Gode to sacerdon, buton he sylf hi gecure, swa swa Aaron
wæs, se arwurða bisceop, þone þe God sylf geceas, and gesette him to
bisceope on þa ealdan wisan æfter Moyses æ.
 246. Mid þam þe hi ðus dydon mid dyrstigon anginne, þa
ætiwde þær sona gesewenlice Godes wuldor, and God cwæð to Moysen,
Gað him fram hraðe.
 249. And seo eorðe tobærst under heora fotum, and forswealh
Dathan for his dyrstignysse, and þone Abiron, mid eallum heora hiwum, mid
wifum and mid cildum, þær þær hi wicodon; and hi swa cuce ferdon
fordone to helle, and ælc man fleag aweg, for heora hreame afyrht.
 255. Ðær com eac swylce fyr færlice fram Gode, and
forbærnde þone Chore þær þær he bær þone stor, and þridde
healf hund manna mid him forburnon, mid heora recelsfatum, for heora
dyrstignysse, þæt hi ongean Godes willan worhton hi to sacerdum, and
þone forsawon þe he him geset hæfde.
 261. On þam æftran dæge þe ðis gedon wæs, ongan eall
þæt folc flitan wið moysen, and wið þone aaron þe we ær embe
spræcon, mid mycelre ceorunge, sædon þæt hi hæfdon godes folc
ofslagen, and gremedon hi swyðe, and mid micclum gehlyde macodon þa ceaste,
oððæt hi begen flugon binnan godes getelde; and þær æteowde sona
gesewenlice godes wuldor, and fyr com fram gode, and forbærnde þæs
folces feowertyne þusenda mid færlicum bryne, oððæt aaron eode ut
of ðam getelde mid his storcyllan, and stod him tomiddes, gebæd ða for
hi, and se grama geswac.
 274. On ðysum mæg gehyran se ðe hæfð ænig andgyt
þæt hit byð swyðe hearmlic þam ðe huxlice tælð bisceopas and
sacerdas, þe syndon godes bydelas, and to lareowum gesette to lærenne
godes folc, þonne se lareow him segð godes gesetnyssa and his beboda, him
sylfum to þearfe, and he þonne forsyhð, and to forsewennysse hæfð ge
þone godes bydel ge þa godes beboda, be þam cwæð se hælend to his
discipulum: <foreign>qui uos audit me audit, et qui uos spernit me spernit</foreign>.
 284. Ðæt is on urum gereorde, se þe eow gehyrð, he
gehyrð me þurh ða gehyrsumnysse, and se þe eow forsihð, he forsyhð
me.
 287. Hi forsawon moysen and þone mæron bisceop, aaron his
broðor, mid bysmorlicum hospe, ac god sylf gewræc heora forsewennysse, for
þan ðe hi god tældon þa ða hi tældon hi.
 291. Swa deð ælc þæra manna þe his ealdor forsyhð,
þe byð godes speligend on gastlicere lare, on þam ealdorscype þe him
god geuðe; gif he hine forsyhð, his sawul sceal þrowian þæt ylce
wite, buton he hit ær gebete, þe hi ða þrowodon on heora lichaman.
 297. Hi wæron flæsclice menn, and underfencgon heora wite on
ðyssere worulde, æfter moyses æ; we syndon gastlice menn under godes
gife nu, and ure sawul sceal, gif we forseoð god, þæt wite underfon on
þære toweardan worulde, buton we swa gesælige beon þæt we hit
sylfe gebeton ær ure geendunge wið ðone ælmihtigan god.
 304. Eft on oðrum timan þæt israhela folc, þa ða hi
ferdon mid þam foresædan moyse, and becomon to ðam lande þe is
gecweden edom, þa begunnon hi to cidenne mid micelre ceorunge ongean þone
ælmihtigan god for heora geswince, and ongean moysen, and mid graman
cwædon, hwi læddest þu la us of egipta lande, þæt we her swulton
on ðysum westene?
 312. We nabbað þone hlaf þe us lyste etan, and us nu wlatað
wið þysne leohtan mete.
 314. Ða for þære ceorunge sende him god to byrnende
næddran, swa swa us bec secgað, and þa fyrenan næddran þæs
folces feala to deaðe geætrodon mid egeslicum geslite.
 318. Hi comon þa to moyse, and cwædon him þus to: we
habbað gesyngod þæt we swa spræcon ongean þone ælmihtigan god
and ongean þe, leof; gebide nu for us, þæt god afyrsige þas næddran
fram us.
 322. And moyses þa sona gebæd for þam folce, swa swa hi hine
bædon.
 324. Ða spræc se ælmihtiga god to þam arwurðan moysen,
hat nu gewyrcan ane ærene næddran, and gesete þa upp, swylce to tacne,
and se þe beo tosliten, beseo to þære næddran þe of ðam are bið
gemacod, and he leofað gesund.
 329. Hwæt þa moyses het macian þa næddran, and gesettan
to tacne, swa swa god sylf hine het, and þa toslitenan menn besawon to
þære næddran, and wurdon swa gehælede fram þæra wyrma geslite.
 333. Se hælend sylf sæde on sumum his godspelle hwæt
þeos dæd getacnode on ðam diglan andgyte, and we hit gesetton on englisc
on sumum oðrum spelle.
 336. We wyllað swaðeah secgan sceortlice her nu þæt seo
ærene næddre, þe butan attre wæs, hæfde getacnunge ures
hælendes deaðes, þe butan ælcere synne sylf þrowode for us, and mid
his unscyldigum deaðe us fram deaðe ahredde, fram þam ecan deaðe þe
us þurh adam becom of ðære næddran lare þe hine forlærde.
 343. Ða terendan næddran, þe totæron þæt folc,
syndon ure synna, þe us tosliton wyllað; ac we sceolon behealdan ðæs
hælendes þrowunge mid soðum geleafan, and we beoð sona hale.
 347. Ðæt folc on ðam westene wæs þa gehæled þurh
ða ærenan næddran fram þam andweardan deaðe; ac se hælend
sæde þæt þa sceolon habban þæt ece lif mid him þe on hine
gelyfað.
 351. Seo gehiwode anlicnys gehælde ða hwilwendlice, and
þæt soðe þing nu sylð us þæt ece lif.
 353. God afandode þa þæs folces anrædnysse on ðam
langsumum færelde feowertig geara; he wolde þæt hi wæron mid weorcum
gehyrsume his halwendum bebodum, him to ecere hæle.
 357. Ða wurdon hi wiðerræde wolice foroft, and þone
ælmihtigan god swa egeslice gegremedon þæt eall seo yld wearð on
þam westene ofslagen, buton twam mannum anum, iosue and chaleph.
 361. Hi wæron gehyrsume godes hæsum æfre, and hi forþi
hæfdon þone behatenan eard, and þæt þæt micele mare is, godes
mildse þærtoeacan.
 364. Feowertig wintra hi wæron on þam westene farende, and
moyses geendode eac on þam færelde, þa þa he on ylde wæs
hundtwelftig geara; and his broðor aaron eac þær geendode, and moyses
gesette þone foresædan iosue þam folce to heretogan, swa swa him bebead
god.
 370. Seo geoguð þe wæs on þam westene afedd wæs þa
geweaxen, and to wige ful strang, and iosue hi lædde to ðam behatenan
lande; and hi gefyldon swa, þeah ðe heora fæderas noldon, godes willan
mid weorcum, and gewunnon þone eard mid wundorlicum sige, swa swa hit awriten
is.
 376. Ðam folce wæs behaten þurh þone heofonlican god
þæt hi sceoldon habban soðlice renscuras and eorðlice wæstmas on
wuda and on felda, ofætan and ele, and eac swylce win, and heora fynd
oferwinnan, gif hi wurðodon hine, and mid ealre heortan hine æfre
lufodon.
 382. Ac crist sylf behet us on his halgan godspelle þæt we
sceolon habban, þær þær he sylf wunað, þæt ece lif mid him and
mid eallum his halgum, gif we hine wurðiað on ðysum andweardan life, and
mid soðum geleafan hine lufiað æfre.
 387. He het us swyðost cepan þæs soþan lifes æfre, and
cwæð þæt we sceoldon symle eac habban ure eorðlican neode
þærtoeacan soðlice.
 390. Paulus se apostol, ealra þeoda lareow, manode þone
leodscipe þe he to geleafan gebigde, and ealle cristene menn, and cwæð
þæt we sceoldon geornlice us warnian wið ða yfelan ceorunge, þæt
we swa ne gegremion god ælmihtigne nu mid urum yfelum þeawum, swa swa
þæt ealde folc dyde on þam westene þa, wiðerrædlice to swyðe.
 397. Hit stent on bocum awriten for ure beterunge, and to mycelre
bysne us endenextum mannum, þæt we geearnian sceolon æfre þæt
betere, and þa ecan myrhðe mid gode ælmihtigum.
 401. Nu syndon manega menn þe secgað þæt hi nellað godes
lare gehyran, þelæste hi sceolon habban maran wita gif hi witon þa
lare, and gif hi nellað don swa swa drihten bebyt, hi sylfe gerihtlæcan
þurh þa soðan lare.
 406. Nu cweðe we þærtogeanes, þæt gif se cyning asent
gewrit to sumon his þegena, and he hit forsyhð swa swyðe þæt he hit
nele gehyran, ne his aseon, þæt se cyning ne byð na swyðe bliðe him,
þonne he geaxað hu he hine forseah.
 411. Seo halige lar nis na on eallum leodscypum swa swyðe swa on
sumon, ac us secgað bec þæt hi mihton tocnawan þone ælmihtigan god
þurh þa gesceafta þe he gesceop on worulde, þæt he is ana to
wurðigenne þe geworhte ealle þing.
 416. Se man þe hæfð lare on his leodscype genoge, and mæg
ða gehyran butan micclum geswince, and nele hi gehyran, ne gode gehyrsumian,
næfð he nane beladunge wið ðone leofan drihten.
 420. Se þe lare næfð, ne lare ne gehyrð, se mihte habban
sume beladunge; ac paulus se apostol cwæð on his pistole þus: <foreign>qui sine
lege peccabunt, sine lege peribunt</foreign>.
 424. Ðæt is, on engliscere spræce, ða þe buton godes
æ synna gewyrcað, þa eac butan godes æ on ende forwurðað.
 427. Gerihtlæce us se leofa drihten crist, and us gewenie to his
willan æfre, þam is wuldor and lof a to worulde, amen.

ÆHom 22
B1.4.22.
De falsis diis: Pope 1967-8, II, 676-712.



 1. <foreign>o fratres dilectissimi, diuina scriptura cultum unius ueri dei
nos docuit, his uerbis dicendo: unus est dominus, una fides, unum baptisma,
unus deus et pater omnium, qui est super omnes, et per omnia, et in omnibus
nobis; ex quo omnia, per quem omnia, in quo omnia; ipsi gloria in secula</foreign>; eala
ge gebroðra ða leofostan, þæt godcunde gewrit us tæhte þone
biggeng anes soðes godes, þisum wordum cweþende: an drihten is, and an
geleafa, and an fulluht; an god and fæder ealra þinga, se ðe is ofer
ealle þing, and þurh ealle þing, and on us eallum of þam synd ealle
þing, and þurh þone synd ealle þing, and on þam synd ealle þing; sy
him wuldor a to worulde, amen.
 12. Se ælmihtiga fæder gestrynde ænne sunu of him sylfum,
butan wifes gemanan, and þurh þone sunu he geworhte ealle gesceafta,
gesewenlice and ungesewenlice.
 14. Se sunu is eall swa eald swa se fæder, for þæm þe se
fæder wæs æfre butan anginne, and se sunu wæs æfre butan anginne
of him acenned, eall swa mihtig swa se fæder.
 17. Se halga gast nis na acenned, ac he is þæs fæder and
þæs suna willa and lufu, of him bam gelice, and þurh þone gast syndon
ealle gesceafta geliffæste þe se fæder gesceop þurh his sunu, se ðe
is his wisdom.
 20. Þeos halige þrynnyss is an ælmihtig god æfre
unbegunnen and ungeendod.
 21. Hi synd þry on naman, fæder, and sunu, and halig gast;
and hy ne synd na þry godas, ac hy þry syndon an ælmihtig god
untodæledlic, for þam þe hym þrym is an gecynd, and an ræd, and an
weorc on eallum þingum.
 25. And selre us is soðlice to gelyfanne on þas halgan
þrynnysse, and hi geandettan, þonne us sy to smeagenne to swiðe embe
þæt.
 28. Ðeos þrynnyss gesceop þa scinændan englas, and adam
and euan eft syððan to mannum, and sealde hym anweald ofer eorðlice
gesceafta; and hi mihtan wunian symle butan deaðe, gif hi þæt an godes
bebod næfre ne tobræcan.
 33. Ða wunode adam swa orsorh on blisse, and him nan gesceaft
sceððan/ ne mihte, þa hwile þe he geheold þæt heofonlice bebod.
 36. Him ne derode nan fyr, þeah þe he mid fotum on stope,
ne nan wæter ne mihte þone mannan adrencan, þeah þe he on yðum urne
færlice.
 39. Ne nan wildeor ne mihte, ne nan wurmcynn ne dorste derian
þam/ menn mid hys muðes slite.
 41. Ne hungor ne þurst, ne hefigtyme cyle, ne nan swiðlic
hæte, ne seocnyss ne mihton adam geswencan on þam earde, þa hwile þe
he þæt lytle bebod mid geleafan geheold.
 45. Eft, þa þa he agylt hæfde, and godes bebod tobræc,
þa forleas he þa gesælþa, and on geswincum leofode, swa þæt hine
biton/ lys bealdlice and flean, þone þe ær ne dorste se draca furþon
hreppan.
 49. He moste þa warnian wið wæter and wið fyr, and
behealdan wærlice þæt he hearde ne feolle, and mid agenum geswince him
ætes tilian; and þa gecyndelican good þe him god on gesceop, he moste
þa healdan, gif he hi habban wolde, mid mycelre gymene, swa swa gyt doð
þa goodan, þe mid geswince healdað hi sylfe wið leahtras.
 56. Eac swylce seo sunne, and soðlice se mona wurdon benæmde
heora wynsuman beorhtnysse æfter adames gylte, na be agenum gewyrhtum.
 59. Be seofonfealdan wæs seo sunne þa beorhtre ærþam se
mann agylte, and se mona hæfde þære sunnan beorhtnysse, swa swa heo
scinð nu us.
 62. Hi sceolan eft swaþeah æfter domesdæge habban be fullan
heora beorhtnysse, be þam þe hy gesceapene wæran; and se mona ne
ealdað æfter þam dæge, ac bið ansund scinende, swa swa seo sunne
deð nu.
 66. Menn magon eac geearnian mid micelre earfoðnysse þæt hi
wunian mid gode on wynsumnysse æfre æfter domesdæge, a butan deaðe,
þa þe nu gehyrsumiað his hæsum mid weorce; and þa þe god forseoð
beoð besencte on helle on þam ecum witum and endeleasum cwylmingum.
 72. Nu ne ræde we on bocum þæt man arærde
hæþengyld on eallum þam fyrste ær noes flode, oðþæt þa entas
worhtan þone wundorlican stypel æfter noes flode, and hym swa feala
gereorda god þar forgeaf swa þæra wyrhtena wæs.
 77. Ða þa hi toferdon to fyrlenum landum, and mancynn þa
weox, þa wurdon hi bepæhte þurh þone ealdan deofol þe adam ær
beswac, swa þæt hi worhton wolice him godas, and þone scyppend forsawon
þe hy gesceop to mannum.
 82. Hi namon þa to wisdome þæt hi wurþodon him for godas
þa sunnan and þone monan, for heora scinendan beorhtnysse, and him lac
offrodan, and forletan heora scyppend.
 85. Sume menn eac sædon be þam scinendum steorrum þæt hi
godas wæron, and wurþodan hy georne.
 87. Sume hi gelyfdon on fyr for his færlicum bryne, sume eac on
wæter, and wurðodan hi for godas; sume on þa eorþan, for þon þe
heo ealle þing afet.
 90. Ac hi mihton tocnawan, gif hi cuðan þæt gescead,
þæt se is ana god þe hi ealle gesceop, us mannum to bryce, for his
micclan godnysse.
 93. Þas gesceafta doð swa swa hym gedihte heora scyppend, and
ne magon naht don butan drihtnes willan, for þan þe nan scyppend nis butan
se an soða god, and we hine wurðiað mid gewissum geleafan, cweþende
mid muðe and mid modes incundnysse þæt se is ana god þe ealle þing
gesceop/.
 99. Git þa, þa hæþenan noldan beon gehealdene on swa
feawum godum, ac fengon to wurðianne mislice entas and men him to godum, þa
þe mihtige wæron on woruldlicum geþincðum, and egefulle on life,
þeah þe hy leofodon fullice.
 104. An man wæs eardiende on þam ilande creta, saturnus
gehaten, swiðlic and wælhreow, swa þæt he abat hys suna, þa þa hi
geborene wæron, and unfæderlice macode heora flæsc him to mete.
 108. He læfde swaþeah ænne to life, þeah þe he abite
his gebroðra on ær; se wæs iouis gehaten, hetol and þrymlic.
 111. He afligde his fæder of þam foresædan iglande, and
wolde hine acwellan, gif he him come to.
 113. Se iouis wæs swa swiðe gal, þæt he on hys swustor
gewifode; seo wæs gehaten iuno, swiðe healic gyden.
 115. Heora gedohtra wæron minerua and uenus.
 116. Þa forlæg se fæder fullice buta, and manega his magan
manlice/ gewemde.
 118. Þas manfullan menn wæron þa mæroston godas þe þa
hæþenan wurðodan, and worhton him to godum; ac se sunu wæs swaþeah
swiðor gewurðod þonne se fæder wære on heora fulan bigenge.
 122. Þes iouis is arwurðust ealra þæra goda þe þa
hæþenan hæfdon on heora gedwylde; and he hatte þor betwux sumum
þeodum, þone þa deniscan leoda lufiað swiðost.
 126. His sunu hatte mars, se macede æfre saca, and wrohte and
wawan he wolde æfre styrian.
 128. Þisne wurðodan þa hæðenan for healicne god, and swa
oft swa hi fyrdadon, oððe to gefeohte woldan, þonne offrodon hi heora lac
on ær þisum gode.
 131. Hi gelyfdon þæt he mihte micclum him fultumian on þam
gefeohte, for þam þe he gefeoht lufode.
 133. Sum man wæs gehaten mercurius on life, se wæs swiðe
facenfull and swicol on dædum, and lufode eac stala and leasbregdnyssa.
 136. Þone macodan þa hæþenan him to mæran gode, and
æt wega gelætum him lac offrodan, and to heagum beorgum him brohtan
onsægednysse/.
 139. Ðes god wæs arwyrðe betwyx eallum hæþenum, and he
is oðon gehaten oðrum naman on denisc.
 141. Nu secgað þa deniscan on heora gedwylde þæt se iouis
wære, þe hi þor hatað, mercuries sunu, þe hi oðon hatað; ac hi
nabbað na riht, for þam þe we rædað on bocum, ge on hæþenum ge
on cristenum, þæt se hetola iouis to soðan wære saturnes sunu, and
þa bec ne magon beon awægede þe þa ealdan hæðenan be him awriton
þuss; and eac on martira þrowungum we gemetað swa awriten.
 150. Sum wif hatte uenus, seo wæs ioues dohter, swa fracod on
galnysse þæt hire fæder hi hæfde, and eac hire broðor, and oðre
gehwylce, on myltestrena wisan; ac hi wurðiað þa hæþenan for halige
gydenan, swa swa heora godes dohter.
 155. Manega oþre godas wæron mislice afundene, and eac swilce
gydenan, on swiðlicum wurðmynte geond ealne middaneard, manncynne to
forwyrde; ac þas synd þa fyrmestan, þeah ðe hi fullice leofodan.
 159. Se syrwienda deofol, þe swicað embe mancyn, gebrohte þa
hæþenan on þæt healice gedwyld, þæt hi swa fule menn him fundon
to godum, þe þa leahtras lufodan, þe liciað þam deofle, þæt eac
heora biggengan heora bysmor lufodan, and ælfremede wurdan fram þam
ælmihtigan gode, se ðe leahtras onscunað, and lufað þa
clænnysse.
 166. Hi gesettan eac þa þære sunnan and þam monan, and
þam oðrum godum, ælcum his dæg: ærest þære sunnan þone
sunnandæg, and syððan þam monan þone monandæg; and þone
þriddan dæg hi þeowdan marte, heora feohtegode, him to fultume.
 172. Þone feorþan dæg hi sealdan, him to frofre, þam
foresædan mercurie, heora mæran gode.
 174. Þone fiftan dæg hi freolsodan mærlice, ioue to
wyrðmynte, þam mærestan gode.
 176. Ðone sixtan dæg hi gesetton þære sceamleasan gydenan
uenus/ gehaten, and fricg on denisc.
 178. Þone seofoðan dæg hi sealdan saturne þam ealdan,
þæra goda fæder, him sylfum to frofre, endenexð swaþeah, þeah he
yldost wære.
 181. Hi woldan git wurðian arwurðlicor þa godas, and
forgeafon him steorran, swilce hi ahton heora geweald: þa syfan tunglan,
sunnan and monan, and þa oðre fif, þe farað æfre ongean þone roder
to eastdæle werd, ac hi gebigð seo heofon underbæc æfre.
 187. Ac þa steorran swaþeah scinon on heofonum on frymþe
middaneardes, ær þa manfullan godas wurdon acennede, oððe gecorene to
godum.
 190. Hi worhtan eac anlicnyssa þam arwurþum godum, sume of
smætum golde, and þa asmeadan mid cræfte, sume of hwitum seolfre, sume
eac of stanum, sume of mislicum antimbre, be þam þe heora mihta wæron;
and him hus arærdon, þæt hi heton tempel, and þarinne gelogodan heora
leofan godas mid leade gebundene, and gebædon hi þarto.
 197. Þa gesawon þa deoflu, þe hi beswicon on ær, þa
fægran anlicnyssa, and flugon þarto, and þurh þa anlicnyssa
spræcon to þam earmum mannum, and hi swa forlæddon mid heora leasungum,
and to hellicum suslum heora sawla gebrohtan.
 202. Smiðas hi worhtan smealice mid cræfte, and oft gesealdon
þa sylfrenan godas, sumne to maran wurðe, be þam þe he gemacod wæs,
sumne eac waclicor, be þam þe his wurð wæs.
 206. And swa lange swa he sloh þone samworhtan god, and mid his
græfseaxe holode hetelice þa eagan, ne stod him nan ege for þære
anlicnysse; ac þonne heo geworht wæs, he wurðode hi for god.
 210. We rædað on þære bec þe is liber regum gehaten
þæt þa hæðenan philistei fuhton gelome wið þæt israhela
folc, þe ana þa gelyfde on þone ælmihtigan god, on abrahames wisan.
 214. Þa on sumne sæl gelamp hit for heora synnum, swaþeah,
þæt þa hæþenan fuhton on þam folce sige, and arcam domini
gelæhtan þæt is drihtnes scrin, on þam scrine wæs gehealden se
heofonlica mete, and aarones gyrd, þæs æreston bisceopes, and moyses
tabulan, þe on þam munte wæron mid godes fingre awritene, his folce to
lare.
 221. Þa ferodon þa hæþenan þæt foresæde scrin mid
þam heofonlican haligdome ham to heora temple, and settan hit þa
arwurðlice up to heora gode, se god hatte dagon, þam hæþenum swyðe
dyre.
 225. Eft þa on ærnemergen, þa þa hy inn eodan, þa fundon
hi heora god on þære flore licgende ætforan þam godes scrine, swylce
he friðes bæde.
 228. Hi hofan eft þa dagon to þam drihtnes scrine, þær
þær he ær stod, and stopan him þanon.
 230. Coman þa eft on mergen, and cunnodan hu hit wære; þa
wæs dagones heafod æt þære dura forcorfen, and his twa handbreda
aheawene æt þam þerrscwalde, and dagon læg heafodleas ætforan
þam halgan scrine, for þam þe hit ne gedafenode þære deofollican
anlicnysse þæt heo wið þæt halige scrin swa healice stode.
 236. Þa sende god sona mid graman to þære leode færlicne
manncwealm, and þa philisteos acwealde, for þam þe hi hæfdon þæt
halige scrin þær on heora hæþenscipe, swylce hy hit habban woldon.
 240. Him comon eac mys to, manega geond þæt land, and heora
æceras aweston, and þone eard fordydon.
 242. Ða gecwædon þa landleodan þæt hi lædan woldan
þæt godes scrin him fram, geond heora fif burga, fram scire to scire,
þæt se cwealm geswice.
 245. Hi ferodan þa þæt scrin geond þa fif burga, and swa
hwar swa hit becom, swa com se cwealm sona and; mid færlicum deaðe þa
philistheos acwealde, and hi earmlice hrymdon for þam reþan deaþe.
 249. Hi axodan þa heora witan hwæt him wislicost þuhte, hu
him to donne wære embe þæt halige scrin, hwæðer hi hit ham
asendon, oððe hi hit hæfdon þar leng.
 252. Ða andwyrdon þa witan þam axiendan þuss: gif ge
þæt halige scrin ham sendan wyllað, ne sende ge hit na æmtig, ac
arwurðlice mid lacum.
 255. Foð nu togædere of eower fif burgum, and wyrcað gode to
lace fif gyldene hringas and fif gyldene mys, þæt se grama geswice, for
þam þe eow eallum wæs an wite gemæne.
 259. Wyrcað eac ænne wæn wurðlice to þam scrine, and
ane niwe cæpsan eowrum lacum to fætelse, and nimað twa geonge cy, þe
under iuce ne comon, þæt hi þæt halige scrin ham ferian magon mid
þam gyldenum lacum þe ge gode geoffriað, and healdað þa cealfas æt
ham getigede; þonne mage ge tocnawan, gyf þa cy willað gan forð on
þone weg fram heora cealfum, þæt hit godes yrre wæs þe eow swa
geswencte.
 268. Gif hi þonne gan nellað mid þæs godes scrine heonon,
þonne mage ge tocnawan þæt se cwealm næs forþi, þurh godes yrre,
ac gelamp elles.
 271. Hwæt, þa philistei þa fengon to þam ræde, and
geworhton fif hringas of heora fif burhgum, and fif gyldene mys, and macodan
þone wæn mid ealre þære fare, and geforþodan þæt scrin.
 275. Þa eodan þa iungan cy, geiucode to þam wæne, to
israhela lande, hlowende swiðe æfter heora cealfum, and ne gecyrdon
swaþeah of þan rihtan wege, swilce hi gewittige wæron.
 279. And þa philistei folgodan þam wæne to israhela lande,
and forleton hit þar; and se manncwealm geswac þa, and þæra musa
gedrecednyss.
 282. Israhel eac þa beah anmodlice to gode, and god hi þa
geheold wið ða hæþenan leoda, and him sige forgeaf, þæt hi slogon
heora fynd, and on sibbe wunodan on samuheles dæge.
 286. Her we magon tocnawan be þam hæðenum godum, hwilce
mihte hi hæfdon ongean þone ælmihtigan god.
 288. Hi ne synd na godas, ac synd gramlice deofla, sawla
bepæcendras and synna ordfruman, þe heora biggengan gebringað into þam
bradan fyre hellicre cwylminge, þanon hi ne cumað næfre.
 292. Us is eac fulcuð be þam þrim cnihtum on chaldea rice,
þe se cyning awearp into byrnendum ofne, for þam þe hi ne bugon to his
godum fram þam ælmihtigan gode, þe ealle þing gesceop.
 296. God hi eac ahredde wið ðone gramlican cyning, swa þæt
heora fex furþon on þam fyre næs forswæled, ac eodan him singende on
þam swegendan lige, hergende heora drihten, and ungederode þurhwunodan.
 300. On þam ilcan lande wæs þa se witega danihel, godes
heahþegen, haliges lifes mann.
 302. Þa on daries dagum gedemdon his witan þæt binnan
þrittigum dagum ne bæde nan mann nane bene æt gode, butan æt þam
cyninge, and woldan swa besyrwan þone unscyldigan danihel, for þon þe he
wæs swyðe dyre darige þam cinge.
 307. Ða dyde se witega swa swa his gewuna wæs, eode into his
upflore, and feoll þær on cneowum, and gebæd hyne to gode, gebigedum
limum/, oðþæt þa hæþenan coman, þe his cepton georne.
 311. Hi wregdon þa danihel to darige þam cinge, sædon
þæt he forsawe heora ealra gesetnysse, and woldon hine besceofan into
þæra leona seaþe.
 314. Ða swanc se cyning swiðe oð æfen, wolde
ðone/ witegan bewerian wið hi.
 316. Ac ða ða he ne mihte na leng, ða let he hine
niman/ and wurpan þam leonum þe lagon on þam seaðe.
 318. Þa cwæð darius se cyning to danihele þam witegan,
ðin god þe þu wurðast wile þe ahreddan.
 320. And he þa geinseglade wiðutan þone seað, and wearð
swa sarig þæt he slapon ne mihte on ealræ þære nihte, ne he
ætes ne gymde.
 323. Darius þa se cining on dægred aras, eode to þam
seaðe, and sarlice clypode, danihel, þu godes mann, mihte la þin god
wið ða leon þe gehealdan?
 326. And he andwyrde sona, þu leofa cining, leofa þu on
ecnysse; min god me asende to sona his engel, and he þæra leona muð
beleac mid his bendum, þæt heora nan ne mihte minum limum derian, for
þan þe on me is afunden ætforan gode rihtwisnyss, and ic wið ðe,
cyning, ne worhte nanne gylt.
 333. Se cyning þa sona swiðe þæs fægnode, and het up
ateon ardlice danihel, and þa in awurpan þe hine wregdon ær.
 336. Hi wurdan þa gebrohte mid bearnum and wifum, and into þam
seaðe sona aworpene, and þa leon hi gelæhton, and heora lima totæron,
ær þam þe hi furðan moston feallan adune.
 340. Ða sende se cyning sona ænne pistol geond ealle his
leoda, and hi luflice grette, þisum wordum awritene: ic wille þæt min
folc on eallum minum rice anmodlice buge to daniheles gode, and hine
ondrædon.
 345. He is lifigenda god, and ece on weorulde, and his rice ne
bið toworpen on ecnysse.
 347. He is soð alysend, and tacna wyrcend on heofonum and on
eorðan, se ðe heold danihel wið þa reþan deor, þæt hi him derian
ne mihton.
 350. Danihel leofode þa swiðe leof þam cyninge, oðþæt
cyrus cyning to þam cynedome feng, and danihel wearð þa þæs cyninges
gedrinca, and he hine arwurðode ofer ealle his þegnas.
 354. Þa wæs on babilone, þære micclan byrig, þæra
hæþenra god, se wæs gehaten bel, and hine man dæghwamlice fedde mid
feowertigum sceapum, and him man win sealde, six sestras to þam dæge, and
twelf sestras melues to his metsunge.
 359. Se cyning hine wurðode, and com ælce dæge hine to
gebiddanne to bel þam gode; and danihel se snotra forseah þone bel, and
gebæd hyne æfre to þam ælmihtigan gode.
 363. Ða axode se cyning on anum dæge danihel, hwi nelt þu
þe gebiddan to bele þam gode?
 365. Þa andwerde danihel anrædlice þam cyninge, ic nelle
wurðian þa geworhtan godas, ac ic gelyfe on þone lyfigendan god, se þe
heofonas and eorþan and ealle þing gesceop, and hæfð þone anwald
ealles flæsces.
 370. Ða andwyrde se cyning eft þam witegan, ne þincð þe,
la, danihel, þæt þes deorwyrða bel sy lifiende god, nu he lyfað be
mettum, and dæghwamlice drincð þæt we him doð to lace?
 374. Ða cwæð danihel, ne dwela þu, cyning; þes god is
æren wiðutan agoten, and læmen wiðinnan, and ne lyfað be mettum, ne
he næfre ne æt oð ðisne andwyrdan dæg.
 378. Þa geswearc se cyning sona on mode, and het þa biggengan
þe bele þeowdan cuman to his spræce, and cwæð him þuss to: buton
ge me secgan þæt þæt soð is be þisum, hwa þas mettas þicge
þe we maciað bele, ealle ge sceolan sweltan, gif ic gesund beo.
 384. Gif ge þonne æteowiað þæt he ytt þas mettas,
þonne sceal daniel sweltan deaðe, se þe tælde bel and to bysmore
hæfde.
 387. Ða cwæð danihel to þam cyninge þus: stande þin
word, cyning.
 388. And hi stopon to þam temple.
 389. Þar wæron hundseofantig þæra sacerda ealra, þe
þeowdon bele on his biggengum simle.
 391. Þa cwædon hi ealle anmodlice to þam cinge, we gað nu
ealle ut ætforan þe, cyning, and sete þu sylf þa sanda him beforan,
and beluc þa duru, gyf þu us ne gelyfst, and geinsegla þa locu mid
þinum agenum hringe, and þonne þu on ærnemergen in gæst and
sceawast, gif þas lac ne beoð bebrocene þurh bel, beo hit ure lifleast;
and gif bel hi geytt, swelte þonne danihel, þe swa hyne hyrwde.
 400. Hi eodan þa ealle ut ætforan þam cyninge, and he sylf
gelogode þa lac ætforan bel; and danihel het syftan on þæs cyninges
gesihthe axon geond þa flore, þæt he eft mihte tocnawan hwa on þa flor
stope þe onfenge þæs metes; and se cyning þa geinseglode ardlice þa
duru.
 406. Hwæt, þa sacerdas þa, mid cildum and wifum, eodan into
ðam temple under þære eorðan, ealle on þære nihte, and æton
þone mete, swa swa heora gewuna wæs, and þæt win eal druncon, and bel
heora god ne abat þæra laca.
 411. Eft þa on ærnemergen eode se cyning mid danihele to þam
temple, and þa duru sceawode; þa stod heo swa geinseglod swa swa hi hi on
æfen forleton.
 414. Hi geopenodan þa duru and in besawon.
 415. Þa clypode se cyning, and cwæð to þære anlicnysse,
mære eart þu, bel, and mid þe nis nan facn.
 417. Ða hloh danihel, and gelette þone cyning, þæt he in
ne eode, and axode hine þuss: hwæt þincð þe, la cyning?
 419. Hwæþer þu mage tocnawan hwæs fotlæsta þu geseo
on þissere flore astapene?
 421. Þa beheold se cyning, and cwæð to danihele, ic geseo on
þisum axum ealdra manna stapas, wifa and cilda.
 423. And he wearþ ða yrre.
 424. He het þa gelæccan þa leasan sacerdos, and hi þa
unþances æteowdon him þa duru under þære flore, þar hi inn eodan,
and þone mete þigdon þe wæs gemynt þam gode.
 428. Ða het se cyning sona ofslean hi ealle, and betæhte
þone god to daniheles dome.
 430. Þa tobræc danihel bel þone god, and towearp his tempel
unwurðlice eall.
 432. Þa wæs on þære byrig gewunod an draca, and þa
babiloniscan bæron him mete, and hine for god wurðodan, þeah þe he
wyrm wære.
 435. Ða cwæð se cyning sume dæg to danihele þuss: ne
miht þu nu cweþan þæt þes ne sy cucu god; gebide þe to him, þeah
þe þu to bele noldest.
 438. Þa andwyrde danihel ðus eaðelice þam cyninge: ic
gebidde me æfre to þam ælmihtigon gode, se þe is lyfigende god; and
gif þu me leafe sylst, ic ofslea þisne dracan buton swurde and stafe.
 442. Ða cwæð cyrus se cyning þæt he cunnian moste gif
he butan wæpnum mihte þone wurm acwellan.
 444. Danihel þa worhte þam dracan þas lac: he nam pic and
rysel, and punode togædere, and mid byrstum gemengde, and berode to welerum,
and seað hi swiðe, and sealde þam dracan.
 448. Ða tobærst he sona swa he abat þæs metes, and
danihel cwæð þa to þæs dracan biggengum, nu ge magon geseon
hwæne ge swa wurðodan.
 451. Þa wurdon geæbyligde þa babiloniscan þearle, and
comon to þam cyninge, and cwædon mid graman, þes ælþeodega danihel
hæfð þinne anwald genumen; he is cyning geworden; he acwealde þone
dracan, and urne bel he towearp, and his biggengan he ofsloh; betæce hine nu
us, elles we þe ofsleað.
 457. Ða ne mihte se cyning wiðcweðan him eallum, ac
betæhte þone witegan þam witleasum folce, and hi hine wurpan in to
þam wilderon, þar wæron syfon leon, and he þar six dagas wunode.
 461. Ælce dæge man sealde ærþan þam leonum twa sceap
to bigleofan and twegen leapas oð ðæt; ac him næs þa nan geseald,
þæt hi tosliton danihel.
 464. Þa wæs on iudea lande an geleafful witega, abbacuc
gehaten, se hæfde rifteras abedene to his corne, and bær him heora mete.
 467. Him com þa fleogende to færlice godes engel, and het
beran þone mete to babilonian hraþe, and syllan danihele, þe sæt on
þam pytte.
 470. Ða cwæð se abbacuc to þam engle þuss: la, leof, ic
ne geseah þa burh þe þu segst ne ic nat þone seað, ne embe secgan ne
gehyrde.
 473. Þa gelæhte se engel abbacuc be þam feaxe, and bær
hine swiftlice to þære foresædan byrig and to þæra leona seaðe,
swiðe swiftum flyhte.
 476. Ða clypode abbacuc to þam oþrum witegan, ðu godes mann
danihel, nim þisne mete þe to þe þe god sende.
 478. And he sona andwyrde, eala þu min god, þu wære min
gemyndig, and þu ne forlætst þa þe lufiað þe.
 481. And he æt sona of þære godes sande, and se engel
ardlice eft abbacuc ferode to his lande ongean ofer swiðe langne weg.
 484. Eft þa on þone seofoðan dæg eode se cyning sarig to
þam seaðe, and beseah into.
 486. Þa efne sæt danihel ansund betwux þam deorum.
 487. Þa clypode se cyning, and cwæð þuss to gode: eala
þu drihten god þe danihel on belyfð, mycel eart þu and mihtig.
 489. And he het his menn sona upp ateon danihel of þæra deora
seaðe.
 491. He het þa in awurpan þe hine ær forwregdon, and hi
wurdon abitene on anre beorhthwile ætforan þam cyninge fram þam frecum
deorum.
 494. Feala we mihton secgan be swilcum leasum godum, hu bysmorfulle
hi wæron and heora biggengon tihton to eallum fracodnyssum, and to
endeleasum morðdædum; and se wæs þam godum dyrost þe dyde mæste
fylðe.
 498. Hwæt þa ure hælend crist com to þisse weorulde on
þære sixtan ylde, and he soðfæstnysse tæhte, and mid manegum
wundrum manna heortan onlihte, and geswutolade mid tacnum þæt he soð god
is, þonne he of deaðe aras þurh his drihtenlican mihte, and to heofonum
astah ætforan hundtwelftigum mannum, wera and wifa, þe his gewitan
wæron on eallum þam wundrum þe he ætforan him geworhte.
 506. Ge habbað oft gehyred be þæs hælendes wundrum, and
be his halgan lare, and hu hold he is mancynne, þam þe leahtras forseoð
and lufiað heora scyppend; for þan þe him synd swiðe laðe þa
leahterfullan biggengan, for þan þe his gecynd is þæt he clænnysse
lufige.
 511. Is eac nu for langsum to secganne hu his geleaffullan
apostolas towurpon þonne hæþengyld æfter þæs hælendes
upstige, and þa fracodan godas afligdon mid mihte of heora anlicnyssum þar
men on locodan.
 515. Ða apostoli hi tobræcon, and heora biggengas towurpan;
and þa godan cyningas þe to gode gebugon heton mid ealle þa anlicnyssa
tocwysan; and man worhte of þam godum gode cytelas and hweras, and mislice
andluman of þam gemyltum anlicnyssum, and notodan þæs ares, þe ær
ynnytt wæs.
 521. On egypta lande on alexandriabyrig, þe wæs heafodburh
þa egyptiscre þeode, wæs se fyrmesta god þe þæt folc wurþode
seraphis gehaten, swiþe namcuð þa.
 525. Him wæs fram ealdum dagum aræred micel tempel mid
wundorlicum cræfte, wurðlice gefadod, and þæs anlicnyss wæs
ænlice geworht of ælcum antimbre þe of eorþan cymð of ælcum
treowcynne, and of ælcum wecge, mid golde beworht and mid hwitum seolfre.
 531. Seo anlicnyss wæs swiðe heah on lenge, manegra
fæðma, of micclum antimbre geworht, and heo wæs swa brad betwux þam
bigelsum gefæstnod þæt heo mid twam handum þa twegen weallas
geræhte, and þæt hus wæs swaþeah swiðe heah and wid.
 536. Heo wæs swiðe egeslic on to beseonne, for hire micelnysse
on menigfealdum cræfte, and þa egyptiscan leoda gelyfdon on þone god,
and his biggengon sædon, gif him hwa abulge, þæt seo heofon sona
sceolde afeallan, and seo eorðe nyþan mid ealle toberstan.
 542. Eft þa þa se tima com on theodosiges dagum þæs
æþelan caseres, þe ealle het tobrecan þa leasan godas mid micclum
geleafan, þa wearð eac tobrytt se arwyrða seraphis.
 546. Hine mann sloh þa swiðe mid scearpre æxe, ac he hit ne
gefredde, for þam þe he wæs treowen, ne he nan word ne cwæð, for
þam þe he cucu næs, ne seo heofon ne feoll, ne seo eorðe ne
tobærst; ac man cearf ardlice him of þæt heafod.
 551. Þar wearð þa micel gamen þæt feala musa scutan of
þære anlicnysse, þa hire of wæs þæt heafod, floccmælum
yrnende geond þa widgillan flor, þæt men mihton tocnawan þæt þar
wæs musa wunung, and nan godcundnyss, ne godes geleafa.
 556. Man toheow þa sticmælum þone sceoccenan god, and mid
langum rapum his lima toferode; his heafod hi drogon mid hospe geond þa burh,
and his lima forbærndon, and þone buc æt nextan, to micelre
wæfersyne tomiddes þam folce; and þa cristenan tobræcon, swa swa se
casere het, ealle þa anlicnyssa þæra ærenra goda on alexandria and on
eallum burgum, and þæt ealde gedwyld wearð þa adwæsced.
 565. Man funde eac syððan under þam fulum weofodum cnapena
heafda, þe man acwealde þær þam godum to offrunge, and oðre
fracodnyssa, swa þæt heora biggengan þa bysmorlican fylþa sceawian ne
mihton, ofsceamode forþearle þæt hi swa lange folgodon swa fulum
hlafordum, and gebugon þa to gode, to his clænum biggengum.
 572. Git we willað secgan be sumum leasum gode, þe æfter
cristes menniscnysse þurh cristes geleafan eaðelice wearð of his
anlicnysse adræfed.
 575. Gregorius wæs gehaten sum swiðe halig biscop, se worhte
miccle wundra and mihta þurh god.
 577. Se rad on wintres dæge embe sume neode ofer þa micclan
muntas þe man mundiu hæt, and ne mihte for snawe nahwider gecyrran
þær he wicstowe hæfde; ac þar wæs gehende an hæþen tempel,
gehalgod þam gode þe wæs gehaten apollo, and he þyder gecyrde and
wunode on þam temple, for þæs wintres cyle.
 584. Þær stod seo anlicnyss þæs ærenan godes binnan
þam temple, and his biggenga axode æt þære anlicnysse oftrædlice
gehwæt, and se deofol sylf andwyrde of þære anlicnysse, and sæde
þam sacerde þe hine synderlice wurðode menigfealde gedwimor, and he hi
þam mannum sæde þe hwæs befrunon æt þære feondlican
anlicnysse; and se sacerd lyfode be þam lacum symble þe þa hæðenan
brohton to þam healican gedwylde.
 593. Ða wearð se god afliged of þære fulan anlicnysse
þurh þone halgan wer þe þær wicode on niht, and ne mihte andwyrdan
þurh þa anlicnyssæ þam earman sacerde, swa swa he ær dyde.
 597. He offrode þa lac gelome þam gode, and seo anlicnyss ne
mihte geandwyrdan þam biggengan.
 599. He wearð þa geancsumod earmlice on mode, ac him sæde se
deofol þas word on slæpe: hwi clypast þu to me þar þar ic cuman ne
mæg?
 602. Se oðer hine axode, hwæt se intinga wære hwi he þar
cuman ne mihte; and þa cwæð se deofol þæt he adræfed wære of
þære dyrnan wununge þurh gregories tocyme; and þa cwæð se sacerd,
hwæt tæcst þu nu to ræde?
 606. And he him hraþe andwyrde, ne mot ic nateshwon into
þære stowe faran buton ic hæbbe leafe þæs halgan gregories.
 609. Þa macode se sacerd his fare on mergen ofer langne weg to
þam geleaffullan biscope, and his fet gesohte, his sið bemænende,
þæt his bigleofa moste mid ealle him losian, for þam þe he afligde
færlice mid his tocyme þone god þe he wurðode of his gewunelican
stowe.
 615. Ða awrat gregorius þis gewrit to þam gode: ic grete
þe, apollo, and ic þe leafe sylle eft to farenne into þinre stowe, and
þa þing to donne þe þu ær dydest.
 619. Se sacerd genam þa sona þæt gewrit, and ham swiðe
efste, and wið ða anlicnysse lede þæt gewrit; þa gewearð se deofol
sona oninnan þa anlicnysse, and eft to him spræc, swa swa he ær dyde,
þæs þe he hine axode.
 624. Þa begann se sacerd swiðe to smeagenne, and cwæð on
his mode, nu þes min god þus færð: gregorius hine afligde, and he
fleah sona aweg, and eft cuman ne mihte into his anlicnysse, butan gregorius
him lyfde.
 628. La hu ne is forðy gregorius betera þonne þes min god
sy?
 630. He beleac þa his tempel, mid geleafan onbryrd, and ferde eft
ongean mid þam ilcan gewrite to þam arwurðan biscope, and him ealle
asæde be his godes geancyme, and be his modes smeaunge, and feoll to his
fotum, fulluhtes biddende, and þæt he hine betæhte þam heofonlican
gode, þurh þæs mihte þe he afligde þæra hæþenra godas.
 637. He bæd þa swa lange mid geleafan þone bisceop þæt
he hine cristnode; and he clænlice lyfode syððan of þam dæge on
swiðlicre forhæfdnysse, and ealle woruldþing forlet, and wunode mid
þam bisceope.
 641. He wearð þa gefullod, and swa fullfremedlice þeah on
halgum mægnum, mid micclum geleafan, and on godes lare, þæt he æfter
gregorie to biscope wearð gehalgod, and geheold wislice þone biscophad mid
godre gebysnunge, gode to gecwemednysse, swa swa us cyðað bec; and ures
drihtnes geleafa adwæscte þæt hæþengild, for þan þe se
cristendom com gehwær and þær.
 649. Oft sædon þa hæþenan þæt ure hælend crist
come æfter heora godum, and hi yldran wæron, and cwædon þæt þa
yldran godas arwurðran wæron and swiðor to wurðianne þonne se ðe
sið come.
 653. Ac þa dysgan nyston þæt ure drihten wæs æfre mid
his heofonlican fæder on fullfremedre mihte, æfre ælmihtig god of
þam ælmihtigan fæder, and com syððan to mannum, þa þa he sylf
wolde, on soðre menniscnysse, mancynn to alysenne.
 658. And þa godas þe þa hæþenan heoldon mid gedwylde,
þa gescop ure hælend mid his heofonlican fæder ac he ne gesceop hi na
to godum, ac to oðrum gesceaftum for þam þe nan gesceaft nis þe se an
god ne gesceope, þeah þe hi sume wurdan awende to deoflum, and sume man
wurðode wolice for godas.
 664. Nis nan oðer god, ne nan oðer scyppend, buton seo halige
þrynnyss, þe is þrymwealdend god, se ðe ana gewylt ealra gesceafta, and
ælcum men forgylt eft be his weorcum on þissere weorolde geendunge, and
eac hwilon ær.
 669. Ure hælend cwæð swaþeah be his halgum þegnum, <foreign>ego
dixi, dii estis, et filii excelsi omnes</foreign>: ic cwæð þæt ge synd godas,
and ealle suna þæs hehstan.
 672. Swa micelne wurðmynt forgeaf se mildheorta drihten his
halgum þegnum, þæt he het hi godas; ac nan mann næfð swaþeah nane
mihte þurh hine sylfne, buton of þam anum gode þe ealle þing gesceop,
þam sy wuldor and lof a to worulde.
 676. Amen.

START_TEXT

ÆHom 23
B1.4.23.
Wyrdwriteras us secgað ... [excerpt]: Pope 1967-8, II, 728-32.



 1. Wyrdwriteras us secgað, ða ðe awritan be cyningum,
þæt þa ealdan cyningas on ðam ærran timan hogodon hu hi mihton
heora byrðena alihtan, for þan ðe an man ne mæg æghwar beon, and
ætsomne ealle þing aberan, þeah ðe he anweald hæbbe.
 6. Ða gesetton þa cyningas, him sylfum to fultume, ealdormen
under him, and hi oft asendon to manegum gewinnum, swa swa hit awriten is ge on
hæþenum bocum ge on bibliothecan; and þa ealdormen gewyldon þa
onwinnendan fynd, swa swa we wyllað secgan sume bysne be þam of þam
ledenbocum, þæt man us ne lihnige.
 13. Dauid se mæra cyning, þeah ðe he cene wære, he asende
his heretogan, swa swa hit segð on leden on þæra cyninga bocum, swa swa
we cyðað her on ledenum gereorde, þæt man us gelyfe: <foreign>misit dauid ioab
ducem, et omnem exercitum bellatorum, et cetera</foreign>: dauid se cyning asende his
heretogan, ioab gehaten, and he gefeaht wið amon, and his fynd afligde mid
ealre his fyrde.
 21. <foreign>factum est ergo, uertente anno, eo tempore quo solent reges
procedere ad bella, misit dauid ioab, et cetera</foreign>.
 24. Dauid se cyning asende eft ioab on ðam oðran geare to ðam
ammoniscum, and he oferwann hi mid þæs cyninges werode, and sige ðær
geferde, swa swa us segð seo racu.
 28. <foreign>dixit ergo dauid, nunc magis aflicturus est nos siba filius
bochri, et cetera</foreign>.
 30. Siba wæs gehaten sum dauides þegena, se astyrode þæt
folc mid feondlicre spræce ongean þone cyning dauid, and cwæð
þæt hi ne sceoldan dauide fylian, ne be his ræde faran.
 34. Ða fleah se siba mid fleamdome aweg; ac ioab se heretoga his
heafod begeat æt þære burhware þe he to geboren wæs.
 37. <foreign>factum est autem rursum prelium aduersus israhel
philistinorum, et cetera</foreign>.
 39. Eft wæs geworden wið israhel gefeoht; on ðam gefeohte
wæs sum wundorlic ent se wolde ofslean þone cyning dauid, ac him gehealp
sona abisai his ðegen, ioabes broðor, and he þone ent ofsloh, for þon
ðe he geseah hu he syrwde embe dauid, wolde hine forstelan betwux his
þegenum.
 46. Ða sworon sona ðæs cyninges ðegenas ealle, and
sædon him þus to: ne scealt ðu næfre heonon forð mid us to
gefeohte, þinum feore to plyhte, þelæste þu adwæsce israhela
leohtfæt: þæt wæs dauid him sylf be ðam ðe hi sædon swa.
 51. Constantinus, se casere ðe ærest beah to cristendome,
hæfde ænne heretogan se hatte gallicanus, þone he asende oft mid
swiðlicere fyrdincge ongean ða onwinnendan leoda þe wunnon ongean þone
casere, and he hi æfre gewilde to ðæs caseres willan.
 56. And se gallicanus wearð syððan swa halig þæt he
wundra worhte and wearð gemartirod for criste, swa swa ic awrat on englisc on
sumum spelle iu.
 59. Gratianus wæs gehaten sum healic casere, swyðe on god
gelyfed, swa swa us segð seo boc <foreign>tripartita istoria</foreign>, þæt is,
þryfeald gereccednyss.
 62. Ða wunnon wið hine þa wildan hæþenan, ac se casere
asende him sona togeanes theodosium his heretogan, and he feaht wið ða
hæþenan, and he feala ðusenda afylde þæra hæþenra, and he for
þam micclan sige syððan wearð casere, swa swa seo boc us segð, sece
se þe wylle.
 68. Ða caseras woldon ða cenan men ofaxian, and him fultum
findan and hi eac fyrðrian to ealles folces ðearfe, and hi forð tihtan,
and wurðodon hi syððan hi sige hæfdon, swa swa we nu sædon be
theodosige.
 73. Theodosius se gingra and se wurðfulla casere sende oft his
heretogan, swa swa us segð seo racu, to gehwylcum gefeohtum for his leode
ware, and he him sylf wolde singan his gebedu, and gode betæcan symle his
fyrde, and god him eac fylste and his folc bewerode, swa swa we awriton on
sumon spelle hwilon.
 80. Langsume tale we magon macian be ðysum gif we wyllað secgan
be þam ðe us secgað bec, of þam ðe us becymð se wisdom and seo
wissung, hu oft wurdon asende þa sigefæstan heretogan to manegum gewinnum
heora leodum to ware; and ða cyningas sæton him sylfe swaðeah æt ham
ymbe oðre bysga heora leodum to þearfe.
 87. Moyses se mæra, þe mihte wið god sprecan, he asende
iosue, swa swa us segð exodus, togeanes amalech; and moyses þa hwyle motode
wið god and abæd him sige æt þam soðfæstan gode.
 91. Ðis gewræc saul eft syððan on amalech, swa þæt he
be godes hæse gehergode þone eard, and þa hæðenan acwealde, and
heora cynn adylegode, for þan ðe hi wunnon wolice wið moysen.
 95. Ure wissung and ure waru sceal beon of gode, and we sceolon
secan æt gode sylfum urne ræd mid anrædum mode, and on eornost
sprecan, þæt ure behat beon þe we behatað gode fæste and getreowe,
trumran þonne stanweall; for þan ðe god is soðfæstnyss, and he
soðfæstnysse lufað, and he ealle ða fordeð þe leasunga sprecað,
swa swa hit on leden stent ðysum wordum awriten: <foreign>perdes omnes qui loquuntur
mendacium</foreign>.

ÆHom 24
B1.4.24.
Addition to Catholic Homilies II no. 20: Sanctorum Alexandri ... : Pope 1967-8, II, 737-46.



 1. On ðissum dæge we wurðiað mid lofsangum þone halgan
papan þe is gehaten alexander, se ðrowode martirdom mid twæm
mæssepreostum þa wæron gehatene euentius and theodolus; hi ðrowodon
on ðissum dæge for heora drihtnes geleafan.
 6. He wæs se fifta papa æfter petres ðrowunge, iunglic on
gearum, and aldlic on geleafan, halig on his weorcum; and he gewende þa
hæðenan ðurh his godnesse to godes geleafan, and feala ðara burhwitena
he gebigde to gode.
 11. Hermes wæs gehaten se yldesta burhwita on romana byrig, and
he ða byri bewyste under þam casere traianus gehaten.
 14. Ða gelamp hit swa þæt his sunu forðferde, seofon
wintra cnapa, and he ða sarig wearð.
 16. Ða cwæð þæs cildes fostormodor to þam sarigan
fæder, gif ðu gelyfdest on crist, and gelæddest ðinne sunu to
ðæs halgan peteres cyrcan, na to hæðengildum, þu hæfdest þinne
sunu ansundne nu todæig.
 20. Hermes hire cwæð to, ðu eart ðe sylf blind; gelyf ðu
on crist, and gif ðin geleafa ðe gehælð, þonne gelyfe ic syþþan
þæt he minne sunu mage mihtelice of deaðe aræran.
 24. Ða eode þæt blinde wif ymb underntid to alexandre ðam
papan, and eft ymbe middæig com ham to hire hlaforde mid halum eagum
bliðe.
 27. Heo genam ða þæs cildes lic, and mid geleafan eode to
ðæm halgan papan, and hine bæd georne þæt he hit arærde þurh
ðæs hælendes mihte.
 30. Hwæt ða alexander on his gebedum cneowode, and þæt
cild sona aras of deaðe þurh godd, and seo fostermodor hit bær bliðe
to ðam fæder, hal and gesund, and he sona gelyfde on ðone ælmihtigan
god þe swylce mihte hafð.
 35. Hermes þa se fæder eode to ðam papan and feoll to his
fotum, fulluhtes biddende.
 37. He wearð ða gefullod æt ðam foresædan papan mid
wife and mid cildum and mid gesibbum mannum and mid æhtemannum, ealles twelf
hundred manna and fifti, ða he gefreode ealle and mid æhtum gegodode on
ðæm halgan eastordæge.
 42. Ðis wearð gecydd þæm casere traiane, hu hermes his
gerefa hæfde forlæten ðone hæþenscipe þe he on gelyfde and
wære gefullod æt þam foresædon papan; and he asende sona sumne
heretogan to rome, aurelianus gehaten, to ofsleanne ða cristenan; ac traianus
gewat on þæm ilcan geare.
 49. Aurelianus þa ferde mid mycelre fare to rome, and he hæfde
ðone anwald þe se oðer ær hæfde; and he gebrohte on cwartern þone
halgan papan and ermen ðone heahgerefan he het healdan on bendum mid anum his
þeigne, se hatte quirinus.
 54. Ða axode quirinus þone arwurðan ermen, hwi dest ðu ðe
swa wacne,swa æðelboren swa ðu eart, þæt þu þinne wurðscipe
forlætst and on bendum þuss ligst?
 57. Hermes him andwyrde ardlice and cwæð: se weorldlica
wurðscipe is awendedlic, and se heofonlica wunað ecelice.
 60. Quirinus him cwæð to, cwist ðu þæt ænig lif sy
æfter þissum life, be ðan ðe ðu gelyfst?
 62. Hermes him andwyrde, nu for feawum gearum ic tælde þa
cristenan þe cwædon þæt ænig oðer lif wære æfter þissum
life, and ic ðiss an lif to lufienne tealde.
 66. Quirinus him cwæð to, do þæt ic cunne ðæt lif,
and ic swa gelyfe swa swa ðu gelyfst.
 68. Hermes cwæð him eft to, alexander se papa, þe nu on
cwarterne is, þurh crist me onlihte, and me geleafan tæhte, and ic gelyfe
nu on god.
 71. Gewend nu to ðam cwearterne and cyþ him uncer word.
 72. Quirinus him cwæð to, ic gange nu to ðam cwarterne, and
ic cweðe to alexandre, gif ðu cristes bydel eart, gecum to ermen, oððe
hermes to þe, þæt ic inc gemete ðurh godes mihte ætgædere, and
ic syþþan gelyfe swa swa ðu me tæcst.
 77. Hermes him andwyrde, do swa ardlice.
 78. Quirinus þa eode to ðam cwarterne hraðe, and gesette ma
wearda ofer ðone halgan wer, and mid þrimfealdum locum þa duru beleac,
and mid þrimfealdum hæftnydum gehæfte ðone papan, and het hine
cunnien gif he acumen mihte of ðam hæftnydum to ðæm halgan ermen.
 84. Alexander ða clypode to criste and cwæð, eala hælend
crist, ðe me hete gesittan on peteres setle, asend me þinne engel, þæt
he me gelæde to ermen ðinum þeowan, and eft on ærnemergen hider
ongean gelæde, swa þæt nan mann nyte hwænne ic fare oððe cume.
 90. Hwæt þa on æfninge com godes engel mid leohte to
alexandre, and gelædde hine to ermen, to quirines huse, þær þær he
gehæft wæs.
 93. Eft on ærnemergen eode quirinus into his hordcleofan, and
þa halgan gemette, alexandrum and ermen, on heora gebedum samod, and leoht
ætforan heom, and he wearð afyrht.
 97. Ða halgan him cwædon to, ðu cwæde þæt þu
woldost sona on god gelefan gif ðu us gesawe ætgædere: gelyf nu on god,
nu ðu us ætgædere gesihst.
 100. Hermes him sæde eac hu his sunu wearð aræred of
deaðe to life þurh alexandres geleafan.
 102. Quirinus him andwyrde, ic habbe ane dohtor wlitige on ansyne,
ac heo is forðearle awlætt, for ðon ðe heo is hoferode; ac gehelpað
hire, ic bidde, and ic syþþan gelyfe on ðone hælend mid eow.
 106. Ða cwæð alexander, læd hig to ðam cwarterne to
me.
 107. Quirinus him andwyrde, ðu eart on minum huse nu, and humeta
hatst ðu hig bringan to þam cwarterne?
 109. Alexander him cwæð to, gang ardlice and bring hi, for
ðan þe ðu me ðær gemetest þonne þu mid hire cymst.
 111. He eode ða sona, and godes engel gelædde þone halgan
papan eft to ðam cwarterne, and se engel syþþan gewat.
 114. Quirinus com þa syþþan and þæt cwartern gemette all
swa fæste belocan swa he hit ær forlet.
 116. He unleac ða duru, and alexander se papa sæt on þam
cwarterne swa swa he ær gecwæð.
 118. Ða feoll quirinus afyrht to his fotum, ofdrædd þæt
him godes yrre on becumen sceolde.
 120. Se papa hine frefrode, þæt he unforht wære, and he
æteowde þæm halgan his unhalan dohtor.
 122. Ða het alexander hine axian hraðe hwæðer on ðam
cwarterne wæron ænige cristene menn for godes geleafan belocene on ðam
witum.
 125. He fandode þa, and afunde ðærinne twegen
mæssepreostas, mæres lifes menn, euentium and theodolum, of estdæle
cumene.
 128. Ða het alexander þæt he mid arwurðnesse sceolde hi
gefeccan swyþe raðe him to.
 130. Quirinus þa mid ofste adyde of ðæm papan ealle þa
hæftnedu þe he mid gehæft wæs.
 132. Ða dyde se halga wer on his dohter swyre þæt ilce geoc
þe wæs on his agenum swuran, and se fæder þa eode æfter ðam
preostum.
 135. Eft ða se fæder com mid þam foresædum preostum, þa
wæs his dohtor hal, and he ofwundrod cwæð: eala ðu halga fæder,
far heonon ic ðe bidde, ðe læs þe heofonlic fyr me færlice
forbærne.
 139. Alexander him cwæð to, gif ðu me ænigne ðanc don
wylt, gedo þæt alle þas hæftlingas þe on ðissum cwarterne synt
gebugon to cristendome þurh þine tyhtinge.
 142. Ða cwæð quirinus him to, ge cristenan syndon halie, and
þas hæftlingas synt swyþe fordone menn, sume morðslagan, sume manfulle
forligras, sume unlybwyrhtan, sume yfeldæde, sume eac forscyldegode mid
mislicum leahtrum.
 147. Alexander cwæð, crist ure alysend com to middanearde for
synfullum mannum, and he synfullan clypað simle to mildse; ne twynie ða nan
ðing, læt hi cuman ealle to me.
 151. Quirinus þa clypode to ðam mannum and cwæð: swa hwa
swa wyle cristen beon, cume hider to me; and se ðe gefulled beo, fare him
freo aweig.
 154. Hi comon ða ealle to ðæm arwurðan papan, and he hig
þa lærde, and heora geleafan heom tæhte oðþæt hi ealle gelyfdon

syþþan sona wearð gefullod mid eallum his hiwum on ðæs hælendes

 161. Ðiss wearð þa gecydd þam cwellere aureliane, and he
het him gelangien þone gelyfedan quirinum, and cwæð him sona to, ic
hæfde þe for sunu, and þu me gebysmrodest, nu ðu gebogen eart þurh
alexander to oðrum bigenge.
 166. Ða cwæð quirinus him to, ic eom cristen on eornest;
wylle ðu beswingen, wylle ðu ofslean, wylle ðu adrencean, wylle ðu
adydan, wylle ðu forbærnan, ne beo ic nan oðer.
 170. Witodlice ic dyde þæt þa gewurdon cristene ealle þe
in ðam cwarterne beclysode wæron, and ic hi ealle gescrydde mid eallhwitum
reafe, and ic let hi frige faran gif hi woldon; and alexandrum ic bæd, and
ermen eac swylce, þæt hi ut ferdon, ac hi faren noldon.
 176. Ða þa scyldige wæron, þa secgað mid geleafan, gif
we for urum synnum ofslagene beon sculdon, and mid ealle amyrde, hu mycele
swyþor sculon we ure sawla geoffrian for ures hælendes naman.
 180. Ealle hi gewilniað þe on ðam cwarterne wuniað
martirdom to þrowienne for drihtnes geleafan, swa swa se hungria mann his
metes bið oflyst; onginn nu to donne loc hwæt ðe geðynce.
 184. Hwæt þa aurelianus mid yrre him cwæð to, ic hate nu
forceorfan þine scearpan tungan, for ðon ðe ðu dorstest þus
dyrstelice sprecan.
 187. Quirinus him andwyrde, eala ðu erming, and þu
ungesæliga, alys ðine sawle, þæt þa ecan wita ðine sawle ne
gelæccan.
 190. Ða het aurelianus on hengenne afæstnien þone halgan
wer, and aðenian his lima swa swa man webb tyht; ac he nan word ne
gecwæð.
 193. He het þa forceorfan his handa and his fet, and syþþan
beheafdien, and swa hundum worpan.
 195. His lic wearð þeah bebyrged fram þam geleaffullum
cristenum, and his dohtor ðurhwunode for hire drihtnes lufon on clænum
mæigðhade, criste ðeowiende.
 198. Aurelianus het eac syþþan beheafdien ðone arwurðan
ermen, and his agen swustor, theodora gehaten, bebyrgde his lic.
 201. Ealla ða hæftlingas þe se halga papa on ðæm
cwarterne gefullode het se cwellere adrencan on anum tobrocenan scipe on
deoppre sæ, and heora sawla swa siþodon to criste.
 205. Æfter sumum fyrste het se foresæda cwellere þone
halgan alexandrum to him gelædan mid þam twam mæssepreostum, and se
manfulla him to cwæð, alexander papa, ic axie ærest ðe, <foreign>et
reliqua</foreign>.

ÆHom 25
B1.4.25.
Addition to Catholic Homilies II no. 21: Se þe gelome swerað: Pope 1967-8, II, 752.



 1. Se þe gelome swerað, he byð forsworen untwylice; he
geeacnað his feoh mid his sawle lyre, and his wite him wunað on ðære
toweardan worulde.
 4. Godes æ us forbyt, and godes witegan eac swa, þæt nan
man ne sylle nan feoh to gafole, for ðan ðe se swicola mann ðe beswicð
þa unwaran, and se reða reafere þe bereafað þa cristenan, and se þe
his feoh sylð to gafole ongean godes bebod beoð ealle gelice on heora
arleasnysse.
 10. Gif ðu ænigum menn gehylpst þe behofað þines feos
butan ælcum gafole, god ðe sylð þæs edlean.
 12. Manslyht is eac swyðe manfullic dæd, ealra synna mæst,
buton þæt man wiðsace gode: for ðan ðe se mann is godes anlicnyss.

 1. Ure hælend sitt on heofonum nu mid urum lichaman, and he

 7. Eft he cwæþ: <foreign>esuriui enim, et dedistis mihi manducare</foreign>: me

 8. Him hingraþ on hys þearfum, and swa hwæt swa we doþ

 12. Eft cwæþ ure drihten be hys gecorenum: <foreign>gaudete, quia

 15. Eft he cwæþ: <foreign>non delebo nomina eorum de libro uitæ</foreign>:
ic ne adiligie heora naman of lifes bec.

ÆHom 27
B1.4.27.
Addition to Catholic Homilies II no. 33: Dominica XII post Pentecosten: Pope 1967-8, II, 762-9.



 1. Gyt we wyllað eow secgan be sumon gesæligon cyninge þe
wearð eac geeadmet, na unþances swaþeah, ac for godes ege for hys agenum
gylte: þæt wæs theodosius, þe æfter ures drihtnes tocyme
cristendom underfeng and to fulluhte gebeah, mid þam þe se cristendom
þeonde wæs.
 7. Constantinus se æþela wæs ærest cristen of eallum
þam kaserum þe to criste gebugon, and he ana ahte ealles middaneardes
geweald.
 10. He awearp þone hæðenscipe, and awende his leode to
cristes geleafan and to hys clænum biggengum.
 12. He ne tobræc swaþeah þa deofolican tempel þæra
hæþenra goda for hys goodnysse, ac forbead hys folce þa fulan bigengas
þære deofollican offrunge.
 15. Ac theodosius æfter feawum gearum feng to þam cynedome,
ofer ealne middaneard geleaffull casere.
 18. He het þa tobrecan þa deofollican biggengas, and ealle þa
anlicnyssa þæra ærenra goda, and gyldene and seolfrene, for godes
geleafan, and þa mæran tempel þe menn macodon gefyrn þam hæðenum
godum to healicum wurðmyntum.
 23. He wæs swiðe sigefæst for his soðum geleafan, and
æfre he oferwann his wiðerwinnan gehwær þurh þæs hælendes
fultum þe he on gelyfde, and he adwæscte gedwyld and þa gedwolan
forseah, and he þone soðan geleafan symle arærde.
 28. Thesalonica wæs gehaten sum heafodburh þa on hys anwealde,
swa swa ealle oðre wæron, on þære gelamp þa for sumere ceaste
þæt man þæs caseres menn mistucode þær, and sume hys gerefan
oftorfodan mid stanum.
 33. Þa wearð se casere þearle gegremod, and asende his here
to þære heafodbyrig, het ealle ofslean þa ceastergewaran, ge scyldige ge
unscyldige for hys foresewennysse, and man ofsloh þær þa seofon
þusenda manna.
 38. Ða wæs sum mære biscop, ambrosius gehaten, on
mediolanabyrig, swiðe breme lareow and swiðe anræde mann.
 40. Þa ofahsode he þiss, and he swiðe bemænde þæt se
mæra casere swylce dæde gedyde ongean hys drihten.
 43. Hit gelamp þa siððan æfter lytlum fæce þæt se
casere com mid hys cempum farende to mediolanabyrig, wolde hyne gebiddan æt
þam biscopstole, ac se biscop eode ut hym togeanes and forwyrnde hym
innganges.
 48. Ambrosius hym cwæð to: eala þu casere, nast þu þa
micelnysse þæra manna sleges þe ðu gefremodest þurh þine
reðnysse, ne þin mod ne oncnæwð þone micclan hefe þinre
dyrstignysse þe þu gedon hæfst; oððe hwæþer þin miht þe
mæge forwyrnan þæt ðu þas synne ne sceole oncnawan?
 55. Hyt gerist swaþeah þæt þæt gerad oferswiðe þone
woruldlican anweald, and þu wite þæt ðu eart mannes gecyndes þeah
þu casere sy, and hwanon þu come and to hwam þu gewendst.
 59. Þu eart mannum gelic þeah þe þu mihte hæbbe, untrum
swa swa mann þeah ðe þu werige purpuran, and an soðlice is ure ealra
drihten/, ealra þeoda cyning, se ðe ana is scyppend.
 63. Mid hwylcum eagum besceawast þu þæs soðan godes
tempel, mid hwylcum fotum gæst þu on godes halgan flore, hu miht ðu
ahebban þine handa to gode, of ðam þe gyt dropað þæt unrihtwise
blod þe ðu þurh hatheortnysse nu hete ageotan?
 68. Mid hwylcere dyrstignysse dearst þu underfon þæt halige
husel æfter swylcere dæde?
 70. Gewit aweg, gewit, þe læs þe þe gewurðe þin
anwilnyss to deopran synne.
 72. Underfoh þone bend þe ure drihten geband: he is se mæsta
læcedom þinre manfullan dæde.
 74. Þa wiste se casere wel hwæt he mænde, þæt he sylf
wære gebunden þurh þæs biscopes hæse, and fram godes cyrcan
ascyred swa wære oðþæt se bisceop hyne unbunde eft; and he wæs
þa gehyrsum hys hæsum sona, gewende þa swa ham dreoriglice heofigende.
 80. He sæt þa on hys bure biterlice wepende eahta monðas
fullice for hys misdæde, þæt he næfre ne geswac þære sorhfullan
geomrunge oðþæt hit genealæhte þæs hælendes gebyrdtide to
middanwintra þa he to men wæs geboren.
 85. Þa wolde an hys þegna hyne frefrian, ruphinus gehaten, and
eode inn to him þær se casere læg on þære flore wepende, and
ahsode hwi he wolde swa wundorlice heofian.
 89. He cwæð þa mid wope, me þincð þæt ðu plegast
and þu mine yrmðe naht ne gefredst.
 91. Ic heofige and geomrie mine hefegan bendas, for þam þe
þeowum mannum to þissere halgan tide and earmum mannum is inngang alyfed
innto godes cyrican god to gebiddanne, and ic ne mot nu gan innto godes huse;
and eac þartoeacan me is heofon belocen.
 97. Þis he cwæð mid siccetunge and mid sarlicum wope.
 98. Ða cwæð ruphinus þæt he yrnan wolde to þam halgan
biscope, and hine georne biddan þæt he unbunde þone bend þe he
gewrað.
 101. Þa cwæð se casere, ic cann hyne swa geare þæt he
nele awendan godes rihtwisnysse for minum cynedome to nanre wohnysse.
 104. Hi eodan swaþeah begen to þam biscope sona, and fundon
hine sittende on cumena huse, and se casere hyne bæd mid soðre eadmodnysse
þæt he hys bendas unbindan sceolde.
 108. Þa cwæð ambrosius, hwi come þu hider?
 109. Wilt þu forgægan godes æ nu, and mid þinum riccetere
wendan ongean god?
 111. Se casere hym andwyrde, ne eom ic na swa dyrstig þæt ic
durre tobrecan drihtnes gesetnysse, ne ic nelle inn gan into godes huse; ac ic
bidde þe georne þæt ðu unbindan sceole mine swaran bendas, and gebide
for me þæt god me geopenige hys huses inngang, þone þe he geopenade
eallum behreowsiendum.
 118. Ða cwæð se biscop hym to, hwær is þin dædbot
æfter swylcere unrihtwisnysse?
 119. Oððe hu hæfst ðu gehæled þa micclan wunda
þinre manfullan dæde?
 121. Þa cwæð theodosius, þu scealt me tæcan þone
gastlican læcedom, and to gode me þingian, and ic sceal underfon æt
þe þa bote.
 124. Hwæt þa se biscop hym bote þæs tæhte, and het
hyne warnian eft wið swylce dæde, and hyne unband þa fram hys synna
bendum and lyfde him ingang into godes huse; and se casere gehyrsumode eallum
hys hæsum mid micelre eadmodnysse, and eode innto cyrcan, læg on
þære flore eallum limum astreht, and beot hys breost, biterlice wepende,
and bæd hym miltsunge hys misdæda æt gode, and gestod þa mæssan
mid oðrum mannum.
 134. We magon wundrian þæs mæran bisceopes, and hys
anrædnyss is swyðe heriendlic, and þæs caseres eadmodnyss eac
þartogeanes is swiðe micel, þæt he mihte swa forberan on swylcum
anwealde þæt he wære amansumod; ac seo eadmodnyss hym becom to ecere
hæle.

ÆHom 28
B1.4.28.
Addition to Catholic Homilies II no. 36: Pope 1967-8, II, 775-9.



 1. Þæt we on worulde wiðæftan us læfað, & eall
þæt leofre on þysum middanearde is, þeah hit huru wære eall on urum
anwealde þa hwile þe we her on life wæron, gyf we a worhton, þa hwile
þe we mihton, þæt gode licode.
 5. Wa þonne þam menn þe her on þisum life geearnað him
hellewite.
 6. Uton nu forþi, leofan gebroðra, andettan ure misdæda
& synna þa hwile þe we magon & moton, & betan hi georne, swa
ure scrift us wisige; & uton geswican æfre ælces yfeles, & don to
gode þone dæl þe we magon; þonne gebeorge we us sylfum wið ece wite,
& geearniað us heofena rice mid þam eallwealdendan criste.
 11. Witodlice ne mot se deofol ænigum menn þe hine sylfne her
on þisum life sylfwilles to his scrifte for godes ege wregð nan þæra
gylta him ongean wyrpan æfter his forðsiþe þe he ær be his scriftes
wissunge gebete.
 15. We wyllað eow secgan sume bysne nu be þysum, þæt ge
beon þe gewissran be eowre agenre þearfe.
 17. On þære halgan bec þe hatte <foreign>uita patrum</foreign> us segð
swutellice þæt sum munuc on westene abæd æt his drihtene þæt he
moste geseon hu se synfulla mann his sawle ageafe, & hu se rihtwisa gewite
of life.
 22. Ða nolde se hælend him þæs forwyrnan, ac him wæs
gewissod þæt he gewende to anre byrig weard, þæt he mihte geseon
swutellice be þam.
 25. Wiðutan þære byrig wæs on sunderlicre wununge sum
namcuð wer sittende, swylce he ancersetla wære, ac his lif wæs eall on
yfel gelogod, gode swiþe andsæte, swa swa him aeode.
 29. Se læg þa swiþe seoc ungesæliglice, andbidigende
deaþes mid eallum his synna.
 31. Ða geseah se munuc þe of þam westene þæt an egeslic
deofol of þære deorcan helle com to þam seocan menn on his
forðsiþe, & hæfde þryfyrclede force, & þæt wæs
glowende/ isen, þæt he hine mid þære acwealde.
 36. Ða com stefen ufan fram þam ælmihtigan Gode to þam
sweartan deofle, þuss secgende him to: Swa swa ic most on þisum menn
habban nane wununge næfre, ne minne willan on him, swa þu eac ne arige ne
him/ ne miltsige þonne þu ut atyhst his arleasan sawle.
 42. Ða sette se deofol sona his force swylce glowende isen into
his heortan & hine lange drehte mid licum witum; & æfter manegum
tidum þone mann adydde, þæt he his sawle genam swa of þam
lichaman, & hi lædde aweg mid helle.
 48. Æfter þisum eode se ylca foresæda munuc oninnan
þære/ byrig, & he efne þa funde ænne seocne mann se wæs
ælþeodig mann, & he ana þær læg unge.
 54. Godes englas him to, Michael & Gabriel, swa swa God
þæt hi þæs mannes sawle sceoldon underfon, & sæton hi healfa
oðþæt he sawlade; ac his sawul nolde swa ut, swylce wære lað ut of
þam lichaman.
 60. Ða cwæþ Gabrihel to Michaele, genim þas sawle ardlice
þe to, & uton siþian upp.
 62. Michael him andwyrde, us is beboden fram þam ælmihtigan
Gode þæt we butan sarnysse þas sawle genimon: nu ne magon we forþig
mid nanre earfoðnysse þas sawle totwæman fram þam lichaman.
 67. Ða clypode Michael upp mid mycelre stefne & cwæþ: hu
wylt þu, leof Drihten, embe þas sawle?
 69. Heo nele us geþafian þæt heo ut gewite.
 70. Him com þa andswaru þuss secgende of heofonum: ic asende nu
rihtes þære sawle togeanes Dauid mid his hearpan, & þone heofenlican
dream, ealle singende, þæt seo sawul gehyre heora ealra stemna, & heo
wyle swa ut.
 75. Hi comon þa ealle to þære anre sawle swyþe myrige
singende, & heo swa gewat ut of þam lichaman mid þam lofsange on
Michaeles handum mid mycelre blisse, & heo wearð upp geferod mid eallum
þam heape to þam soðan Hælende, þe heo swa gelicode; & se munuc
gewende to þam westene eft, hæfde þa gesawen swa swa he sylf gewilnode.
 83. Us segð seo ylce boc þæt sum oðer munuc hwilon,
swiþe geþogen mann on mihte & on gearum, com into anre byrig embe his
agene neode.
 86. Ða gesæt he swa æt anes rices mannes geate, se læg
þær on forðsiþe, & se munuc þa beheold, for þan þe he
mihte geseon, for his micclum geearnungum, hu se mann geendode on his
forðsiþe.
 90. Ða geseah se munuc mycelne getruman, swylce ridendra manna
mid swyþe reþum anginne, ansynes mid eallsweartum lichaman, & þa
hors wæron bæron þa deofla, be þam þe he geseah þe hit eft
ðu/.
 95. Lihton þa ealle & inn stopon caflice, & ælc
hæfde/ isenne sagol on fyres gelicnysse, & stodon þam earman seocan
menn, & he geseah hi ealle.
 99. He clypode mycelre angsumnesse, Drihten, gehelp min.
 100. Deoflu: Eart þu nu gemyndig þæs ælmihtigan Godes
þonne/ þin sunne þe is forsworcen mid ealle?
 103. Hwi noldest þu þa hwile þe ðu hæfdest ænig
þe he symle oð his ende.
 107. Bað swylce forebysne gehyred ge; his agene; sece to
scrifte, þæt him wyrðe God milde, for þam swa swa we nu hwene ær
sædon, betere is manna gehwylcum þæt him her on worulde beforan anum
menn for his gyltum sceamige, þonne him sceamige eft on Domesdæg beforan
Gode sylfum, & beforan eallum his englum, & beforan eallum
heofonlicum werede, & beforan eallum eorðlicum werede, & beforan
eallum deoflum.
 114. Hit his eall soð þæt we gyt secgan wyllað: ðam
þe nele her nu his synna andettan his scrifte, & betan swa he him
tæcð, him sceal on Domesdæg sceamian beforan Gode sylfum, & eallum
his halgum & eallum deoflum, swa þam menn dyde þe wurde færinga
nacod beforan eallum folce, & nyste þonne mid hwam he his sceamigendlican
bewruge: swa him byð on Domesdæge buton he his synna ær bewreo mid
andetnesse, & mid dædbote, & mid ælmyssum.
 121. Ealle þa synna þe we her wyrceað, ealle hi beoð eft on
us sylfum gesewene & geopenode, buton hi ær her on worulde gebette
beon.
