ÆHom 30
B1.4.30.
Addition to Lives of Saints no. 17: De auguriis: Pope 1967-8, II, 790-96.



 1. We spræcan ær be wiccan, nu wille we eow secgan sum þing
swutolicor be heora scincræfte, and be þam drymannum þe bedydriað þa
unsnoteran.
 4. Mannum is eac to witenne þæt manega drymenn maciað
menigfealde dydrunga þurh deofles cræft, swa swa wisceras oft doð, and
bedydriað menn swilce hi soðlice swylc þing don, ac hyt is swaþeah
dydrung mid deofles cræfte, and gif hwa hyt bletsað, þonne ablinð seo
dydrung.
 10. Be þam we magon secgan sume soðe bysene.
 11. Macharius wæs gehaten sum halig fæder on westene
wunigende, fela wundra wyrcende, munuclifes mann; þa wearð an mæden
forbroden þurh drymanna dydrunga, gedwymorlice swaþeah.
 15. Þæt mæden wæs swa forbroden swylce heo an myre
wære, & eallum þam þuhte þe hire on locodan swylce heo myre
wære, na mennisces gecyndes.
 18. Ða læddan hyre magas hy to macharie, & he sona ahsade
hwæt hi woldan mid þam.
 20. Þa magas hym cwædon to, þeos myre þe þu gesyhst
wæs ure dohtor, arwurðe mæden, ac awyrgede drymenn awendon hy to
myran.
 23. Nu bidde we þe, leof, þæt ðu gebidde for hy, and hy
eft awende to ðam þe heo ær wæs.
 25. Macharius þa cwæð to hyre magum þus: ic geseo þis
mæden on menniscum gecynde, and heo nis na awend swa swa ge wenað þæt
heo sy, and heo nan þing on hyre næfð horses gecyndes; ac on eowrum
gesihðum hit is swa gehiwod þurh þæs deofles dydrunge and hys drymenn
leaslice.
 31. Macharius þa gebæd for þæt mæden god, and mid ele
gesmyrede/, and mid ealle adræfde þæs deofles gedwymor þurh his
drihtnes naman, swa þæt hi ealle gesawan þæt heo ansund wæs.
 35. Swylce synd þa dydrunga þæra drymanna.
 36. Eac swylce we rædað on þære gerecednysse on þæra
cyninga bocum, swa swa hyt gecweden is, þæt saul se cyning on his unsiðe
þa þa hym god gram wæs for hys gramlicum dædum, become to anre
wiccan, wolde witan þurh hi hu him sceolde gelimpan, hwæðer þe lif
þe deað, sige oððe fleam on hys fyrdunge, þa þa he feohtan ongan
wið ða philisteos on gelboes munte mid mycelre fyrdunge.
 45. Nu segð se wyrdwritere þæt seo wicce sceolde aræran
þa of deaþe þone drihtnes witegan samuhel gehaten, haliges lifes mann,
and he sceolde secgan saule þam cyninge þæs þe he befran on hys
frecednysse.
 50. Ac augustinus se wisa wiðcwyð þyssere leasunge, and
segð us to soðan þæt se soðfæsta witega, þe on abrahames
wununge wæs gefyrn gebroht, ne mihte þurh þone wiccecræft eft to
worulde siðian, ne þances ne unþances, þæt he hyre to spræce.
 55. Hit is swa gesæd on þære gesetnysse, swa swa saul se
cyning þa gesihðe oncneow, for þam þe he wende þæt he þone
witegan samuhel gesawe; ac hit wæs sylf se deofol on hys gelicnysse þe
hyne swa forlærde.
 60. We secgað eac to soðan þæt nan scincræft ne mæg,
ne furþan se deofol sylf, nænne deadne aræran, for þam ðe seo
dæd is ures drihtnes anes, þæt he ða deadan arære swa swa he dyde
him sylf and eac þurh his halgan her on þysum life, se þe is soð
scyppend sawla and lichamena.
 66. Ac se deofol gehiwode hine sylfne swa on þæs witegan
gelicnysse, and to þære wiccan spræc, and sæde þam cyninge, þu
scealt beon mid me nu tomergen on minre wununge.
 70. Her we magon tocnawan þæt se cyning sceolde for hys
manfullum dædum to þam deofle becuman, and for þam wiccecræfte mid
him a wunian, for þam ðe he næs na wyrðe þæt he wununge hæfde
on abrahames wununge mid þam witegan samuhele.
 75. Ða feoll se cyning mid fyrhte fornumen to ðæs deofles
fotum þe hyne bedydrode, wende þæt hit wære se witega samuhel, and
hyne to hym gebæd mid gebigedum limum; ac gyf hyt se witega wære, he
wolde him forwyrnan þæt he to hym ne gebæde, his hælende on teonan;
for þam þe man sceal hyne gebiddan to þam hælende anum, and hym anum
þeowian, se ðe ana is god.
 83. Þæs gewilnað se deofol þæt man hyne wurðige, and
to him gebidde, þæt he hæbbe anweald ofer þa gedwolan þe hys
gedwyldum gelyfað, swa swa þa hæðenan dydan þe hyne wurþodan for
god, and forletan heora scyppend þe hy gesceop to mannum; and swa swa saul
dyde on þære deoflican gesihðe, þæt he fullice wære forwyrht to
þam deofle.
 90. Saul þa syððan æfter þære deoflican gesihðe
gewende to hys fyrde fram þære wiccan huse, and þa philistei fuhtan
fæstlice þæs on merigen wið saul þone cyning, and ofslogan hys
fyrde and hys þry suna, and he sylf þa feoll uppon his wæpne and gewat
swa of life to þam swicolan deofle, swa swa he him ær sæde.
 97. Nu wundrað gehwa hu se deofol wiste þæt saul sceolde
sweltan þæs on merigen, ac he wat gehwæt þæs þe gewurþan sceal
þurh hys scearpe andgit þæs engellican gecyndes, oððe þurh godes
geþafunge þæs ðe us dyrne is, oððe þurh gebicnunge þæs
mannes nebwlitan; for ðam þe he wæs gefyrn, and fela hæfð gesewen,
and wide and side færð, and cann fela searacræfta.
 105. Paulus cwæð be hym on sumon his pistole: <foreign>transfigurat se
in angelum lucis</foreign>: he abryt hine sylfne to scinendum engle, þæt he mid hys
lotwrencum þa geleaffullan fordo, ac he ne mæg þa fordon þe on drihtne
truwiað.
 110. Be þam ylcan cwæð eft se apostol þuss: <foreign>an ignoratis
altitudinem satane</foreign>; oððe nyte ge la þæs sceoccan deopnysse?
 113. For þam þe we ne cunnan tocnawan þa deopnysse hys
searacræfta hys swicolan modes; ac his miht nis naht wið þæne
ælmihtigan crist, þe us ealle bewerað wið hys wodnysse æfre, gif we
mid geleafan and mid lufe hyne secað.
 118. Gyt farað wiccan to wega gelæton, and to hæþenum
byrgelsum mid heora gedwimore, and clipiað to ðam deofle, and he cymð hym
to on þæs mannes gelicnysse þe þær lið bebyrged, swylce he of
deaðe arise; ac heo ne mæg þæt don, þæt se deada arise þurh
hyre drycræft.
 124. Deofolgild and drycræft, wiccecræft and wiglunga synd
swyðe andsæte urum hælende criste, and þa ðe þa cræftas
begað syndan godes wiðersacan, and hy soðlice belimpað to þam
swicolan deofle, mid hym æfre to wunigenne on þam ecum witum.

END_TEXT

ÆHom 31
B1.4.31.
Passages from De virginitate: Pope 1967-8, II, 804-8.



 1. Ure hælend crist wæs gehyrsum his fæder, swa þæt
he sylfwilles hine sealde to deaðe for ure alysednesse mid micelre lufe.
 4. Nu sceal ælc bearn beon his fæder underþeod to þæs
hælendes willan, ac he ne sceal na swaþeah his ræde folgian gif he him
misræt for gode, ne his wissungum, gif he hine wemð fram criste.
 8. Ða þe on mægðhade and on modes clænnesse heora lif
libbað, locien hy georne þæt hy þa ne forseon þe on sinscipe
wuniað, for ðan þe þæt eadmode wif, swa swa augustinus cwæð,
bið betere ætforan gode þonne þæt modige mæden.
 13. For ðam mot seo eadmodnes beon mid þære clænnesse
þæt se mægðhad mage þa miclan geþincðe habban þæs
hundfealdan wæstmes, swa swa se hælend cwæð.
 16. And æfre to godes bebodum man sceal beon gehyrsum, and
þam gastlican ealdre þe him for gode wissað.
 18. Be ðam cwæð samuel to saule þam cynge þa þa he
godes hæse and his wissunge forseah: <foreign>melior est enim obedientia quam
uictima</foreign>: betere is soðlice seo gehyrsumnes þonne seo onsægednes,
þæt syndon offrunga; and betere is to heorcnienne þæs hælendes
willan þonne him to offrigenne ænige oðre lac; for ðan þe hit
soðlice is, swa swa samuel sæde, swylce hæðenscipe, and swylc swa is
deofolgyld, þæt se man wiðrige ongean godes willan, and nelle
gehyrsumian his hæsum nateshwon.
 29. Ðis is nu gesæd sceortlice þus, and we sæcgað gyt
þæt we sceolan god don on urum ælmesdædum þam ælmihtigum gode
to lofe, se ðe ure lytlan lac mid lufe underfehð, gif we mid godum willan
hy gode betæcað, and on his þearfum her hy aspendað.
 35. He sceawað þæs mannes heortan swiðor þonne his lac,
for ðam þe him nan neod nis ure lytlan sylene, se ðe ægðer hæfð
on his anwealde symble heofonan and eorðan, and þæt þæt him on
wunað; ac he forgeaf us mannum middaneardlice þing us sylfum to bryce, and
þæt we hine oncnawan mid þam eorðlicum þingum him to wyrðmynte,
and he us forgylt eft be hundfealdum swa hwæt swa we her doð for his lufan
to gode.
 44. Gif þu oncnawst þinne drihten on þinum ælmesdædum
be ðinre lytlan mæðe on wanhalum mannum, hit fremað þe sylfum on
þam selran life, and gode naht ne hearmað þeah ðe þu hine forgite;
god girnð þære godnysse þines godan modes, na þinra æhta, se ðe
ah ealle þing.
 50. Gif þu hwæt dest him to lofe on his lacum mid cyste, þu
geswutelast þine godnessa swa mid þære dæde.
 52. Gif þu þonne nan god for gode don nelt, þu geswutelast
þa uncyste þines yfelan modes, and seo yfelnes þe fordeð on ecnysse
wið god.
 55. Be ðam þe se hælend on his halgan godspelle cwæð,
<foreign>nesciat sinistra tua quid faciat dextera tua,</foreign> nyte þin wynstre hand hwæt
þin swiðre hand do, us nis na to understandenne be ðam stæflicum
andgite, ac be þam gastlicum andgite, þæt we for godes lufan ure
ælmessan don, na for idelum gylpe.
 61. Seo wynstre hand getacnað þissere worulde gylp.
 62. Nu se ðe ælmessan dælð þam ælmihtigan to lofe,
he dælð soðlice mid þære swiðran handa.
 64. And se ðe for idelum gylpe his ælmessan dælð, he
dælð witodlice mid þære wynstran handa.
 66. Gif seo swiðre hand bið seoc oððe untrum, wel he mot
dælan mid þære wynstran handa, gif he þone idelan gylp eallunga
onscunað.
 69. Ealswa be fæstenum: gif we fæstað eawunga on gebodenum
fæstenum, and þonne we us gebiddað betwux oðrum mannum, æt
mæssan and æt tidsangum, eall hit bið diglice gif we hit doð butan
gylpe, urum hælende to lofe, þæt we habban þa mede on þam soðan
life on ecere gesælðe.
 75. God sylf bebead on þære ealdan æ, and eac manað on
þære niwan, þæt ælc cristen man sceal glædlice syllan gode his
frumwæstmas, and hie teoðunge ealra þæra wæstma þe him god to
þam geare forgifð, and ealre þære geoguðe þe him of his orfe
acenned bið, and ealra þara goda þe him god to þam geare foresceawað,
to þy þæt he mid gesundfulnysse and godes bletsunge þara nigen dæla
brucan mote; for ðam þe hit stent on halgum bocum þus awriten: <foreign>si quis
primitias retinuerit, aut decimas de laboribus suis, maledictus sit in omni
domo sua</foreign>; ðæt is on englisc, swa hwa swa his frumwæstmas oððe
teoðunge his agenre tilðe gode ætbret, þæt he bið awyrged on
ealre his hiwrædene.
 85. Eft is awriten, gif þu æthæfst gode þa teoðunge,
þæt his rihtwisnes benæmð þe þara nigon dæla, and læt þe
habban þone teoðan dæl.
 87. Se ælmihtiga god, þe us ealle þing forgifð, wile
habban æt us þa teoþunga his agenre gife, na for his neode, ac for ure,
him to wyrðmynte and us to þearfe, for þære gehyrsumnysse, swa swa he
behet þurh his witegan, þus cweðende: betæcað me eowre teoðunge
glædlice butan elcunge, and afandiað min swa, cwæð god, hwæðer
ic eow forgife syððan renscuras, and gode gewideru, and wæstmas oð
fulre genihtsumnesse.
 94. Ða twegen dælas þære teoþunge man sceal betæcan
godes þeowum into þam mynstre þær þær he to hyrð, þær
þær he his cristendom hæfð, and þone þriddan dæl man sceal
dælan þearfum, and wuduwum, and steopcildum, and ælþeodigum mannum;
for ðam þe seo teoðung is godes dæl, and he sylf hy betæhte þam
þe him synderlice þeowiað.
 99. Ælcum men þe ænige tilunge hæfð, oððe on
cræfte, oððe on mangunge, oððe on oðrum begeatum, ælcum is
beboden þæt hy þa teoðunge gode glædlice syllan of heora begeatum
oððe cræftum þe him god forgeaf.
 103. Se ðe næfð butan an cealf on geoguðe, oððe an
lamb, he do swa micel to godes lacum þærfore swa þær to teoþunge
gebyrige, þæt is se teoða dæl þæs þe hit wyrðe is.
 105. Frumwæstmas hatað sume men ælmesæcer, se ðe us
ærest geripod bið of þam man sceal don ælmessan be his mihte, and
bletsian þone niwan hlaf, and onbyrige ærest se godes þeowa þæs
hlafes, and ealra þara oðra wæstma, ær þam þe se hlaford his
onbyrige.
 109. Frumwæstmas synd eac swa hwæt swa us ærest on
geoguðe acenned bið, and þæt is eall geteald to godes lacum, þeah
ðe hit eow ungewunelic sy.
 112. On þissum þingum and on eallum oðrum begeatum we scylon
wurðian urne drihten þe us ða god foresceawað, se ðe leofað and
rixað a in ealra worulda woruld a butan ende.
 114. Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

ÆHomM 1 (Bel 9)
B1.5.1.
Christmas Day: Belfour 1909, 78-96.



 1. A LA, gebroðræ, aræreð eowre heorte to ðam
heofenlice Gode mid soðe ileafe for ðisse halgæ dæge; &
lufiæð eowre Hælend, þe mid eadmodnesse to us com nu todæg, on
soðe menniscnesse acenned of Mariæ þet halige mæden.
 4. & heo ane is mæden & moder buton wæres imane, swa
nan oþer ne bið næfre on ecnesse.
 5. Crist wearð akenned of þam clene mæden, on sawle & on
lichame soð mon & soð God, for ure alysednesse, & eac ure lufe.
 7. & he alysde us mid his agene life fram hellice pine, &
walde us habben to him to þære heofenlice blisse þe we to isceapene
weron.
 9. He wyle mucel habbæn of þissen middenearde, of al moncynne,
to his mycele blisse & to his heofenlice hirede mid his halgen englum; for
þan ðe hit birisæð ure Drihten þæt he mid mucele weorode on his
riche blissie, & þæt he mucel hirod habbe on his rice biforen alle
oðre kynges.
 14. For þon ðe he ane is God, & allre kynges kyng, &
alre lafordæ laford, a on ecnesse rixiende mid alle his halgen.
 15. Nu weron summe dwolmen mid deofles gaste ifulled þe nolden
ilyfæn þæt þe lyfigende Hælend wære æfre ær þysre
weorlde angein wuniende mid his heofenlice Fæder, of him soðlice acenned;
ac, bi þon þe heo sædon, sum timæ sceolde beon ær þam þe ðe
Hælend wære þe alle þing iwrohte.
 20. Nu mage ge ihyren hu þe Hælend andswerede þam arlease
Iudeis þe him syððan acwaldon, þa ðe heo him axodon mid onde &
cwæden, Sæge us, la.
 22. Hwæt eart ðu.
 22. & he heom andswarede þus, <foreign>Principium qui & loquor
uobis</foreign>; Ic me seolf eam angen þe wið eow speke.
 24. Her is sceortlic andsware, ant swiðe deoplic.
 25. Gif æni þing wære wuniende ær þene God, þenne
nære he angin ne ordfrumæ alræ isceaftæ, ac he soðlice is an
Almihtig God effre unbigunnen.
 27. & he alle isceaftæ isceop swa swa he wolde, summe to
engles, summe eac to monen; & on monie wise he wrohte iscefta.
 29. & nes nan timæ ne nefræ nane tide, ne nan oðre
gesceaft þe he ane ne isceop.
 30. Se Almihtig Fæder þe alle þing isceop, he streonde
ænne Sune of him sylfum acenned buton wifes imanan; & þe is his
wisdom, of þam wise Fæder na iwroht ne isceapen, ac he wæs effre
Almihtig Sune of þam Almihtig Fæder.
 33. Þurh ðone he isceop alle gesceaftæ, & heom alle lif
bifeste þurh ðone lifiende Gast, þe is heora begræ lufe of ham bam
eafre.
 35. Na swa ðeah acenned, ne he nis na Sunu, ne he næfre ne
ongon; ac he wæs æfre God of þam Almihtig Fæder, & of his
acennede Sune, heoræ begre lufe & willæ, on ane godcundnesse æfre
wuniende.
 38. Nu is þe Fæder angin, & þe Sune angin, & þe
Halga Gast angin, þæt is ordfrumæ.
 39. Na þreo angin, ne þreo ordfrumæ, ac heo alle þreo on
ane godcundnesse beoð an angin & an Almihtig God, us unasegenlic, &
unasmeagenlic.
 42. Ac þe mon goffæð & sottæð þe wule habben
ænig þing ætforæn þam anginne ðe alle þing isceop.
 43. Þeo halige ðrymnesse mid unasegenlicræ mihte wæs
æfre wunigende, & wrohte alle þing; & nis nan gesceaft þe heo ne
scopen; ne nan tid ne wunæð þe heo ne wrohten.
 46. Ðis ge sceolen ilyfen, swa swa us læreð þe witega,
<foreign>Nisi credideritis non intelligitis</foreign>, Buton ge hit ilefæn ne mage ge hit
understanden.
 48. Nu is eft awriton on oðre stowe þus, <foreign>Altiora te ne
quesieris</foreign>.
 49. Ne ongin þu to asmeagene ofer þine meðe embe þa mycele
deopnesse; ne hure embe þone þe alle þing iscop; ac ilef on him, forðan
þe he is soð lif; for þi læs ðe þu dweolie on þine þriste
smeagunge, for þan ðe ðu ne miht.
 53. Ne forðen engles ne magen næfre asmegen embe heoræ
Scuppend, buton þæt he æfre wæs unongunnen Wurhtæ; & he
æfre þurhwunæð on ecnesse an God.
 55. Gif he angin hæfde, oðer he ongunne to beon, þenne nere
he næfre Almihtig Wealdend.
 56. Gif nu sum sot wæneð þæt he wrohte hine sylfen,
þenne axie we him hu þe heofenlice God hine sylfen wrohte, gif he himsylf
ær nes, oðer hwa wurcæð ænig þing buton he ær wære, &
wununge hæfde þæt he wyrcen mihte.
 60. Þe ðe furðor smeað þæt he fandie God, he bið
ilic þam men þe summe læddræ æræreð, & astihð þonne
uppon þære læddrestæfæ, a þæt he up cume to þære
læddre ende; & wule þonne stigan ufor butan stafæ, þonne
fællæð he stedeleas for his stuntnesse, swa mucele wyrsse swa he
forðor stop.
 64. Ne ongon næfre þe Almihtig God Fæder, ac he wæs
æfre God; & his ancennedæ Sunæ æfre of him acenned, all swa
mihtig swa he, he is miht, & wisdom of þam wise Fæder.
 67. & þe Halgæ Gast, heoræ beigræ lufæ, ne ongan
næfre, ac he wæs æfre God, heo ðreo an God wunigende on ane cynde,
untodæledlic on ane mægenðrymme, & on ane godcundnesse iliche
mihtige, nan læsse þene oðer.
 70. Swa hwæt swa bið læsse ðone God, þæt ne bið na
God; þæt þæt lator bið þone God þæt hæfeð angin, &
ne bið na God.
 72. God næfð nan angin, ac he wæs æfre & wunæð
a on ecnesse.
 73. Nu beoð summe isceaftæ þurh God swa isceapene, þæt
heo habbæð angin, & eac endæð & to nohte iwurðæþ, for
þam þe heo nabbæð nane sawle.
 75. Heo beoð hwilwendlice, swa þæt heo beoð summe hwile.
 76. Þæt beoð nytene, & fiscæs & fugelas.
 76. Heo weron iscapene þurh God, & heo iwurðæþ to
nohte.
 77. Nu beoð oðre isceaftæ þurh Gode swa iscapene,
þæt heo habbæþ angin & nænne ende; & beoþ æce on
þam æftran dæle.
 79. Þæt beoð englæs, & monne sawle; heo ne
endiæð næfre, þeah heo ær ongunnon.
 80. Ðæh ðes monnes lichame swælte, oðer he on watere
adrynce, oðer he wurðe forbernd, ne mæg næfre his sawle endiæn; ac
beo heo ufel, beo heo god, heo bið æfre swa swa engles beoð æfre
þurhwuniende on ece worlde.
 84. Nu is þe Almihtig Scuppend þe alle þing iscop ane swa ece
þæt he nafeð nan angin.
 85. Ne he nafæð nenne ende, ac he him sylf is ægþer
ordfrume & ende, Ealwealdend God.
 86. Ne ondred he him nænne, for þan ðe nan oðer nis
mihtigræ þonne he, ne forðon him ilic.
 88. Æfre he bið gyfende his gyfæ þam ðe he wyle, ac he
his þing ne wonæð, ne he nanes þinges ne bihofæð.
 89. Æfre he bið Almihtig, & æfre he wule wæl.
 90. Nyle he næfre nan ufel, ac he hatæð soðlice þa ðe
unriht wurceæð, & eac þa fordeþ ðe leasungæ specæð mid
unleaffulnesse.
 92. Nu beoð þa gesceaftæ þe þe an Scyppend iscop mislice
heowes & monifealdes cyndes; & heo alle ne libbæð na on ane
wisæ.
 94. Summe heo beoð unlichamlice & eac unsegenlice swa beoð
englæs; heo nabbæð nænne lichame, & heo libbæð on heofene,
swiðe bliþful on Godes isihðe, & heo eorðlice mætes næfre ne
brucæð.
 97. Summe heo beoð lichamlice, & unsceadwise, & mid alle
lichame on eorðe creopaþ; þæt is, all wyrmcyn, swa swa eow fulcuð
is.
 99. Summe gað on twam fotum; summe beoð feowerfote.
 100. Summe swimmæð on flode; summe fleoð geont þas lyft.
 101. Þa fixas nabbæþ nan lif buton wætere; ne we ne magon
libban noht longe on watere.
 102. Ealle heo beoþ alytene & lybbæþ bi þare eorþan,
ac þe mon ane hæfð uprihtne geong, for þam þe he is isceapen to his
Scyppendes anlicnesse.
 104. He is on sawle liffæst mid gesceadwisnesse, & his geong
bitacnæð, þenne he uprihtes gæð, þæt he sceal smeagen embe God
& embe þa heofenlice þing swiðor þenne embe ða eorðlice þing,
swiðor embe þa ecan þonne embe þa ateoriendlice, forþi læs ðe
his mod beo bineoðan his lichame.
 108. Þe mon þe æfre smeað embe þas eorðlican &
witendlicen þing, he bið ilic þam wyrme þe mid alle lichame
creopæð on ðare eorðæ.
 110. Ne beo ge na attre, swa swa ða yfelæ neddræ, terende
eow bitweonen & teone wyrcende; ne ge ne gan lytende, swa swa ða nytene
gað þe libbæþ bi gres, & heo Godes ne gemeþ.
 113. Soðlice ure Scuppend us geaf to bileofenæn igearcnodne
laf of eorðlice tylunge, & eac þone arwurðæ laf þe engles
brucæð, þæt is, þe Hælend Crist þe is heoræ lif &
uræ.
 116. He is þe liflice laf þe of heofene astah, & nu
todæg wærð acenned of þam clæne mædene; he is engle lif &
ure þurh geleafe.
 118. He cwæð bi him sylfum on his godspelle, <foreign>Ego sum panis
uiuus qui de celo descendi</foreign>, Ic eom þe liflice laf þe of heofene astah;
& þe þe of þam lafe æet, he leofæð on ecnesse.
 120. & þe laf þe ic sulle is soðlice mi licame for
middaneardes life monne to alysednesse.
 122. Ðesne laf we æteð þonne we mid bileafan gað to
halige husle ure Hælendes lichame.
 123. & nu todæg for þisse symbledæge & for Cristes
accennednesse men sceoldon underfon Cristes lichame on þam halgæ husle
þam Hælende to wurðmente, þe us neahlæcede mid his acennednesse.
 126. & gif ge þaræ gode cyðon, ge sceolden ilome gan to
þam halge husle eowre sawle to hæle, swa swa mon deþ gehwær þær
ðe me wæl halt þone cristendom.
 128. Ge men sceolen witen & wislice understonden for hwi oðer
for hwon ge beoð isceapene on þisse sceorte life, oððe to hwan ge
wurðæþ iwende æfter þissum life.
 131. Eow is mucel neod þæt ge on eowre mode icnawæn þone
lifigende God, & on him ilefæn, & þæt ge eac smeagen embe eowre
agene sawle, þæt ge sum þing cynnon bi hure cynde.
 134. Heo is unsegenlic, & heo sylf beræð all þone
lichame & him liffæst, þa hwile þe heo bið on þam buce
wunigende.
 135. & þone heo ut gæð, he went al to stence & to
þam ylce duste þe he of isceapen wæs.
 137. He sceal swa ðeah arisan soðlice to life togeanes his
Drihtine on þam endenextæ dæge, & ædlean underfon alre his
dæda.
 139. Þam mon is icundelic þæt he lufie God.
 139. Hwæt is nu god buton God ane?
 140. He is healic godnes, & we sceolen him lufien.
 141. We nabbæð nane godnesse buton hit us cume of Gode.
 141. & þeo sawlæ ane is isæli & æþelboren,
þeo ðe ðenne lufæð þe hyre swylc isceop, þæt heo on hyre
andgite hafeð Godes anlicnes, gif heo ileafful biþ.
 144. & God on hire wunæð þurh his gastlice gyfæ,
& heo bið iwurðod mid his onwununge & Godes temple soðlice þurh
ða gastlice mihte.
 146. Ðe Almihtig Scyppend gescepeð alle sawle swa Salomon wrat
bi sawlæ & bi lichame, <foreign>Reuertatur puluis in terram suam unde erat et
spiritus redeat ad Deum qui dedit illum</foreign>, Gewende þæt dust, þæt is,
þe lichame, into þare eorðan þe he ær of com, & wende þe gast
to Gode þe hine ær sende.
 150. Eft God sylf cwæð þurh summe witegæ, <foreign>Omnem flatum
feci ego</foreign>; þæt is on Englisc, ælcne gast ic wrohte.
 152. Eft is iwriten bi þam ylce þus, God sceawæþ þæs
monnes sawle on him; & Paulus þe apostol wrat on his pistole, <foreign>Ipse Deus
dabit omnibus uitam & spiritum</foreign>, þæt is, God sylf gyfæð alle
monnum lif & gast.
 155. Alle þa leafulle fæderæs ðe Godes lare writon
untwylice sædon & gehwær lærdon on þam halige circean þæt
God sceawæþ ælces monnes sawlæ.
 157. & þeo sawle nis na of his agenes icynde.
 158. Gif heo wære of Godes agene cynde inumæn, witerlice ne
mihte heo sunegien.
 159. Uðwiten, þæt beoð wisæ lareowæs, secgæð
þæt ðare sawle gecunde is þreofeald: an dæl on hire is
wilnigendlic, oðer yrsigendlic, ðriddæ sceadwislic.
 161. Twegen þisseræ dæle habbæð deor & nyten mid
us, þæt is wilnunge & yrre: þe mon ane hæfæð gescead, &
ræd, & andgit.
 163. Wilnung is þam men igefæn to wilnigenne þa þing þe
him fremiæð, to nytwurðon þingæ, & to æce hæle.
 165. Þonne gif þeo wilnung miswent, þonne acenneð heo
gifernesse & forliger & gitsunge.
 166. Urre & wræþþæ is þare sawlæ geigefan, for
þi þæt heo sceal ursien & wræðþiæn agean sunnæn, &
ne beon na sunnen underþeod.
 168. Forþon ðe Crist cwæð.
 168. Ylc þære þe sunnæ wurcæð is þare sunne
ðeow.
 169. Gif þæt urre bið on yfel iwend, þonne cymeð of
þam unrodnesse & æmelnes.
 170. Gescead is igefan þare sawle to wissigenne & to steorene
hire agene lif & alle hire dæda.
 172. On þam gesceadæ, gif hit miswend þonne cymeð þerof
modignes, & idelgylp.
 173. Gescead wæxæð on cildrum na þeo sawlæ; ac þeo
sawlæ ðihð on megenum & ne bið na mare þonne heo æt frummen
wæs, ac bið bætere; ne heo ne underfehð lichamlice mucelnesse.
 176. Ðeo sawle hafeð, swa wæ ær sædon, on hyre cunde
þare halgæ þrynnesse anlicnesse, on þam heo hæfð gemynd, &
angit, & willæn.
 178. An sawul is, & an lif, & an edwist, þe ðas ðreo
þing hæfð on hyre.
 179. & þas ðreo þing ne beoð na ðreo lif, ac an; ne
þreo ædwist, ac an.
 180. Þeo sawle, oððe þæt lif, oððe þeo edwist
beoð icwædene to hyre sylfre; & þæt mynd, oððe þæt
angit, oððe þe willæ beoð icwædene to summe þingæ
edlesienlice; & þas ðreo þing habbæð annesse bitweonan heom.
 183. Ic undergite þæt ic wulle undergyten & þencean,
& ic wulle þæt ic undergite & mune.
 185. Ðer ðe þæt imynd bið, þær bið þæt angit
& þe willæ.
 185. Uton nu bihealden þa wunderlice swiftnesse þare sawlæ.
 186. Heo hafæð swa mycele swiftnesse, þæt heo on ane tid,
gif heo wyle, bisceawiæð heofenum & ofer sæ flyhð, lond &
burga geondfaræð.
 188. & alle þas þing mid þohte on hire sihðe isett,
& swa raðe swa heo iheræð þare hurge name þe heo ær cuðe,
swa ræðe heo mæg þa burh on hire þohte sceawian hwylc heo bið.
 191. All swa bi gehwylce þinge þe heo ær cuðe oðer ne
cuðe; heo mæg on hire mode sceawiæn þonne heo hereð bi þam
specæn; & swa styriende is þe sawle þæt heo forþam on slepe ne
stilð.
 194. Ac þenne heo smeað bi ane þinge, ne mæg heo þa
hwile bi oðre þingum smeagen, ac bið ibysgad mid þam anum þinge,
oððet þæt ðoht tewite & oðer cume.
 196. Witodlice God Almihtig wat alle þing togædere, & alle
he hafð on his andwealdnesse, þæt is ætforen his isihðe; & heo
beoþ æfre ætforen his isihðe, & næfre him uncuðe.
 199. & þis is ðet icwædon is, þæt God is
æghwær all; for þam ðe alle þa þing þe æfre wæron,
oððe nu beoð, oððe þa ðe towarde beoð, alle heo beoð on Godes
sihðe andwearde, na æne, ac æfre.
 202. Þeo sawle soðlice is þæs lichames lif, & þare
sawle lif is God.
 203. Gif ðeo sawle forlete þone lichame, þone swelt þe
lichame; & gif God forlet þa sawle, þonne swelt heo on þam swartan
dæle, swa ðet heo bið forloren þam ece life; & swa ðeah nefre ne
endæþ on þam ece pine.
 206. Ðes dæþ hire ilympeð, gif heo let rixiæn on hire
þa wilnunge & þæt yrre swiðor þonne þæt gescead, þe hire
wissiæn sceal to weldede a.
 208. Þurh þæt gescead ane we beoð sæligre þonne þa
ungesceadwise nytene.
 209. Mid twam wurðscipe wurðgode þe Almihtigæ Scyppend
þæs monnes sawle, þæt is mid eccenesse, & eadinesse; ac heo
forleas þa edignesse, þa ða heo gylte, & heo ne mihte þa eccenesse
forleosen, forþam þe heo ne endæþ næfræ.
 213. Ðare sawle wlite is þæt heo habbe þa mihte swa
þæt heo sunne forbuge, & for þi heo bið atelic þurh sunne, gif
heo him underlið.
 215. Þaræ sawle mihtæ beoð þas feower þing, þæt
is, <foreign>Prudencia, Iusticia, Temperantia, Fortitudo</foreign>.
 216. <foreign>Prudentia</foreign>, þæt is snoternes, þurh þam heo sceal
hire Scyppend understonden & hine lufian, & tosceadan god fram yfele.
 218. Oþer mægen is <foreign>Iusticia</foreign>, þæt is, rihtwisnesse,
þurh þam heo sceal God wurðian & rihtlice libban.
 219. Þæt ðridde mægen is <foreign>Temperantia</foreign>, þæt is
metegung, mid þare sceal þeo sawle alle þing metegiæn, þæt hit ne
beo to swiðe ne to hwonlice.
 221. For þam hit is iwriten, <foreign>Omnia nimia nocent</foreign>, þæt is,
Alle oferdone þing derigæð.
 223. Witerlice metegung is alræ mægene moder.
 223. Þæt feorðe mægen is <foreign>Fortitudo</foreign>, þæt is
strenhðe oððe anrednesse, þurh þam sceal þeo sawlæ forbæren
arfoðnesse/ mid anrede mode, for Godes lufe, & næfre deofle abugen to
forwyrde.
 226. Ðas feower mægenæ habbæð ænne kynehelm,
þæt is ðeo soðe Godes lufæ & monnæ; forþam ðe þeo
sawle is iselig þe lufæð þone Scyppend þe hire iscop, & hyre
iferan & wyle him fremiæn swa heo fyrmest mæg.
 229. Þeo sawle is isceadwis gast, æfre quic, & mæg
underfon ægðer godne willæ & yfele æfter hyre agene cure.
 231. Þe wælwillendæ Scyppend let hyre habban hire agene
cyres geweald, þa wearð heo bi hyre agene willæ iwemmed þurh deofles
lare.
 233. Ac heo wearð æft alysed þurh Godes gifu, gif heo Gode
hyrsumæð.
 234. Heo is unsegenlic & unlichamlic, buton hefæ, &
buton bleo, mid þam lichame bifangen, & on alle limæ wuniende; ne heo
ne mæg bi hyre agene mihte of þam lichame faren.
 237. Heo is on boce monigfealdlice inemnod bi hire weorces
þeignungum.
 238. Hyre nomæ is <foreign>anima</foreign>, þæt is, sawul, & þe
nomæ bilimpæð to hyre lyfe; & <foreign>spiritus</foreign>, gast, belimpæð to
hyre ymbwlatunge.
 240. Heo is <foreign>sensus</foreign>, þæt is, andgit oððe felnes, þonne
heo fælæð.
 241. Heo is <foreign>animus</foreign>, þæt is mod, þonne heo wat.
 241. Heo is <foreign>mens</foreign>, þæt is, eac mod, þonne heo understont.
 242. Heo is <foreign>memoria</foreign>, þæt is, gemund, þonne heo
imynæð.
 243. Heo is <foreign>ratio</foreign>, þæt is, gescead, þonne heo tosceat.
 244. Heo is <foreign>uoluntas</foreign>, þæt is willæ, þonne heo hwæt
wyle.
 245. Ac swa ðeah alle þæs nomen beoð an sawle.
 245. Þe apostol Paulus todælde þæs gastes nomen &
þæs modes, þus cwæðende.
 246. <foreign>Psallam spiritu, et psallam mente</foreign>; þæt is on Englisc,
Ic singe mid gaste, & ic singe mid mode.
 248. He singæð mid gaste þe ðe cleopað þa word mid
muðe & ne understont þæs angites tacnunge; & þe singæð
mid mode þe þe þæs angites tacnunge understont.
 250. Þeo sawle is þæs lichames læfdi, & heo
wissæþ ða fif angite þæs lichames swa swa of kynesetle.
 252. Ða angite beoð þus ihaten: <foreign>Visus</foreign>, þæt is sihð:
<foreign>Auditus</foreign>, þæt is lust: <foreign>Gustus</foreign>, fondung on þam muðe; <foreign>Odoratus</foreign>,
þæt is stenc on þære neosæ; <foreign>Tactus</foreign>, repung, oðer grapung on
alle limæn, & þæh gewunelycost on þam hondæn.
 255. Ða fif angite wissæð þa sawle to hire willæ, &
hire gedafenæð þæt heo swa swa læfdi geornlice foresceawie hwæt
heo gehwylcum limum iþafige on wilnunge his icyndes, þæt ðær nan
þing unþeawlices ne bilimpe on nanes limes þeignunge.
 259. Swa swa God Almihtig oferstihð alle sceaftæ, swa
oferstihð þeo sawle alle lichamlice sceaftæ mid wurðfulnesse hyre
cyndes, & nan lichamlic sceaft ne mæg beon wið hyre imeten.
 262. We cwædon ær þæt heo wære buton bleo, for þam
þe heo nis na lichamlic.
 263. On lichame bið bleo, & þeo sawle bið iwlitegod swa
heo on worlde ærnode.
 264. Be þam cwæð Crist on his godspelle, <foreign>Tunc fulgebunt
iusti sicut sol in regno Patris mei</foreign>; þæt is on Englisc, þonne
scinæð þa rihtwise swa swa sunne on heore Fæder rice.
 267. Witerlice þa sunfulle beoð heoræ yfele weorce ilice.
 268. Nis þeo eorðung þe we ut blawæð & in ateoð
ure sawle, ac is þeo luft þe alle lichamlice þing on libbæð.
 269. Oft bið þeo sawle on ane þinge oððe on ane þohte
swa bisig, þæt heo ne gemeð hwa hyre gehende byð þeah heo on lokie;
ne ðeah heo summe stefne ihyre, heo hit ne understont; ne þeah hire hwa
rine, vel reppe , heo hit ne fæleð.
 273. Hwylon heo bisoregæð hire lichames sarnesse, hwilon heo
glædeþ on gode limpum; hwilon heo þenchæþ þa ðing ðe heo
ær cuðe, hwilon heo wyle witan þa ðing þe heo ær ne cuðe.
 276. Sum þing heo wyle, sum ðing heo nyle; & alle
lichamlice heow, heo mæg on hire sylfæn hiwæn, & swa iheowed on
hyre mode healden.
 278. Þare sawle wille is, þæt heo wisdom lufige, ne þene
eorðlice wisdom, be þam ðe is iwritæn, <foreign>Sapientia huius mundi
stulticia est apud Deum</foreign>; þæt is on Englisc, þisses middaneardes wisdom
is stuntnesse ætforen Gode, ac þene wisdom heo sceal leornigen, þæt
heo lufie God & hine æfre wurðie on alle hire weorcum, & þa
þing leornie þe God liciæð, & þa ðing forlæten þe him
laðæ beoð.
 284. Þes wisdom is iwriten on halige bocum & þus is
icwædon, <foreign>Omnis sapiencia a Domino Deo est</foreign>; Ylc wisdom is of Gode.
 285. Forþi ylc mon is nu eadig & sælig þe for Gode wis
bið,& gif he his weorc mid wisdome wurceð.
 287. Be þam cwæð þe eadig Iob, þæs monnes wisdom is
arfestnes, & soð ingehyd þæt he yfel forbuge.
 288. Witerlice þæt is soð wisdom þæt mon wilnige
þæt soðe lif on þam þe he mæg æfre libban on murhðe mid
Gode, gif he hit on þissere worlde ærnæð.
 291. To þam us læde þe leofæ Drihten Crist, þe þe is
soð wisdom and sawle lif; þe ðe mid his ece fæder, and mid þam
Halgæ Gaste leofæð and rixæð a on ecenesse.
 293. Amen.

ÆHomM 2 (Bel 7)
B1.5.2.
Wednesday in the Fourth Week of Lent [Secundum Iohannem]: Belfour 1909, 58-74.



 1. <foreign>SECUNDUM IOHANNEM Preteriens Iesus uidit hominem cecum a
natiuitate & Reliqua</foreign> VRe drihten, ðe mildheortæ Hælend, þa þa
he mid monnum wæs lichomlice wunigende, ant he geond land færde fela
wundræ wyrcende for ðæs folces ileafan, þa ofseah he sumne mon ðe
wæs blind acenned.
 7. Þa befrynnon his <foreign>apostoli</foreign> hine & cwædon, For hwæs
synnæ wæs ðæs mon swa blind acenned, hwæðer þe for his agene,
oððe for his magæ?
 9. Ða cwæð ðe Hælend heom sonæ to andsware, Næs
he blind acenned for his agene synnum, oððe for his maga, ac ðæt Godes
wyndræ wyrdon on him iswytelode.
 11. Me idafenæð to wyrcenne his weorc þe me sende þa hwile
ðe dæg bið; forðan þe ðeo deorce niht cymæð, þonne nan mon
ne mæg naht to gode don.
 14. Ic am middaneardes liht, þa hwile ðe ic on middanearde
æm.
 15. Mid þam ðe he ðis gecwæð, þa spætte he on þa
eorðan, & makede of ðam spattle & of ðare eorðe lam; &
smirede mid þam lame ofer þæs blindan eagen, & het hine ða gan to
ane wæterscipe þe wæs ðær onhende, þe hatte Syloe, þæt is
icwæden, Asend.
 19. He eode þa sonæ & his eagan aþwoh, & com agean
lokinde.
 20. Ða cwædon his neahgeburæs, La.
 20. Hu næs þæs þe blinde mon þe swa iboren wæs, þe
we iseagen sittæn simle wædliende?
 21. Sume men þa sædon þæt hit ðe ylcæ were, &
sume sædon þæt hit wære sum oðer him ilic; ac he him seolf sæde
þæt he were ðe ylcæ.
 23. Heo þa axoden him, Humetæ isixst þu nu?
 24. He heom andswyrde & cwæð, ðe þe is ihaten
Hælend þe wrohte lam of eorðan, & mine eagen smirode; & het me
syððan gan, & me sylfne aðwean on ðam eornende wætere þe is
ihaten Syloe.
 27. Ic eode & weosc me; & ic sonæ iseah.
 28. Heo axodon him ða, & hwær is he nu?
 28. He cwæð þæt he nuste; & heo læddon hine
sonæ to þam synderhalgan, for þam sellice wundræ.
 30. & þe mon wæs ihæled on þam halgan
ræstendæge.
 31. Þa axodon þa synderhalgan eft hu he isege.
 31. He cwæð ða to þam unleaffullum, Mid lame he me smirode
ofer mine eahringæs, & ic weosc aþwoh me & iseah.
 33. Þa sædon sona sume þa synderhalgan, Nis þes mon na
from Gode, þe þone ræstendæg ne healt.
 34. Heom andswyrdan þa oðre, Hu mæg ænig synful man þas
tacnæ wyrcæn?
 35. & þa wearð þær flit betwyx þam synderhalgan.
 36. & heo syððan axodon eft þone ihælede mon hwæt
he be þam Hælende sæde.
 37. He cwæð þæt he were sum halig witega.
 38. Þa nolden þa Iudeiscen ilyfan be þam men þæt he were
blind acenned, ant wyrde ihæled, ac clypodon þa his mæges &
cwædon heom ðus to, þes mon is eower sunæ, þe þe ge secgæð
þæt wære soðlice blind accenned; & hu isihð he nu la ?
 42. His magas sædon þa, We witan soðlice þæt he ure
sunu is, & þæt he wæs blind acenned; ac we nyten swa þeah hu he
isihð nu, ne hwa his eagen geopenede.
 44. Axiæð him sylfne; he hæfð þa yldæ þæt he
andswyriæn mæg.
 45. Þis sædon þa magas for þan ðe heo heom asæton
þæt heo wyrden iutlagede of ðare gesamnunge.
 46. For þam ðe þa Iudeiscæn on heoræ dearne þeohte
hæfdon icwæden, þæt swa hwa swa Crist andette wyrde iutlagod of
heoræ gesamnunge.
 48. Þa forleton heo þa magas, & to þam men cwædon, Do
wulder Gode; we witan ful geare þæt ðes mon is synful.
 50. He sæde heom to andswyre, Nat ic gif he synful is; ac ic wat
swa þeah þæt ic blind wæs & ic wislice nu iseo.
 52. Heo axodon hine ða gyt, Ant hu ihælde he ðe?
 53. Ða cwæð ðe ihælede mon heom to andsware þus,
Hwene ær ic eow sæde; hwæt sceal hit eow eft iheræd.
 54. La, wylle ge beon his leorningcnihtæs?
 55. Heo warigedon þa wodlice hine & cwædon, Beo þu his
leorningcniht; we habbæð ure lareow Moysen þone heretogæ, & we
his leorningcnihtæs beoð.
 57. We witen þæt Moyses spæc to þone ælmihtiga Gode,
ac we ne cunnon þisne mon ne hwanon he icumen is.
 59. Ða andswarede þe ihælede mon þam heardheortan &
cwæð, On ðam is mucel wunder, ðæt ge nyten hwanon he beo, &
mihte geopeniæn swa þeah mine eagen.
 61. Soðlice we witan þæt ðe soðfestæ God þa
synfullen ne gehyrð to swylcere bene; ac ðe þe his begenga bið &
his willæn wyrcæð þonne wille ihyran þe heofenlicæ Wældend.
 63. Fram þissere weorulde anginne ne wearð næffre ihyred
þæt ænig man mihte þone mon gehælen & his eagen iopeniæn
ðe ær wæs blind acenned.
 66. Buton he fram Gode were, ne mihte he þis don.
 67. Þa andswaredon þa Iudei him þus huxlice & cwædon,
þu eart ærming al acenned on synum & þu lærst us ðus?
 69. & heo belucon hine þa wiðuton.
 69. Ða ihyrde ðe Hælend þæt heo hine ut adræfdon,
& he hine þa imette, & him þus to cwæð, ðu ilyfest on Godes
Sunu?
 71. And he mid ileafan him andswyrde, Laford la, hwylc is he
þæt ic ilyfe on hine?
 72. Ðe Hælend him andswyrde, & þu hine ær isæge,
& he is ðe ylca ðe þe to spæcð.
 74. He cwæð þa mid geleafan, Ic ilyfe, Drihten; & he
hine ða astræhte to þæs Hælendes fotum.
 75. Þa cwæð ðe Hælend him eft þus to, Ic com hider on
dome on ðisne middaneard, þæt ða men geseon þe ne mihten ær
iseon, & ða þe iseoð sceolon beon blinde.
 77. Ðis godspel is nu isæd swytellice on Englisc anfealdum
angite, ac we willæð eow sæcgen þæt gastlice angit mid Godes
fultume be þam ðe ðe wisæ Augustinus hit awrat on bocum.
 80. For þan ðe Cristes wundræ þe he wrohte on þisse life
wæron soðlice gefremede & swutelice mid weorcce; & swa getacnoden
þeah sum þing digelices; forðan ðe his weorc beoð wunderlice on
tacnum.
 83. Ðes foresæde blinde mon, ðe swa iboren wæs, tacnode
al moncynn on þisse middanearde, þe wearð earmlice ablend for Adames
gylte, & þæs ecan lihtes yfele bedæled, of ðam we alle men
ordfrymæn habbæð.
 87. & þurh ðæs deoflæs onde ðe Adam beswac us becom
dæð too & eac unrihtwisnesse; & us for icynde comæn leahtras
to, & on us beweoxon iwunelice to swiðe.
 89. Nu ælc þare monnæ þe mismaky his lif, & on fulum
leahtræn lið ungeleaffullice, his mod is ablend swylc he blind geboren
beo.
 91. Ne bið ðe mon na ileafful þe on leahtrum wunæð.
 92. Þeo unleaffulnesse is þare heortæ blindnysse, & þe
soða geleafa onliht þone mon þe mæg mid his mode his Scyppend iseon.
 94. Be þam cwæð ðe apostol Paulus on sumon his pistol,
<foreign>Fuimus & nos aliquando filii ire sicud & ceteri</foreign>; þæt is, on
Englisce spæce,We weron eac hwilon on ure gecynde swa swa oðre men yrres
bearn itealde, mid teonfulle weorcce.
 97. Yrræs bearn bið þe ilcæ ðe Godes yrre hæfð,
& ðe bið deaðes bearn þe deaþes wyrðe bið.
 98. Man cwæð on bocum gehu be þissum bearnteame, þæt
gehwa beo icwædon þæs sunæ þe he folgæð <foreign>Filius diaboli,
filius iniquitatis, filius uindicte, filius gehenne, & his similia</foreign>,
þæt is, he is deofles sunu , ðe þe deofles weorc wyrcð; &
unrihtwisnesse sunu, ðe þe unrihtlice leofæð.
 103. Eft he bið wracane sunæ þe ðe wræcæ
iearnæð; & he bið helle sunu, þe ðe helle geearnæð.
 104. Nu alle ðeos yfelnesse wæs on us wunigende ær þam
ðe þe mildheortæ Crist, þe is middaneardes liht, niðer asteah of
heofenum & her on life wunode xxxiii geare.
 107. & ða ðe on hine gelyfæð he mid his soðan
geleafan soðlice onlihte; & þa ðe ne gelyfæð libbæð on
blindnesse.
 108. Hwæt dyde þe Hælend þa ða he hælde þonne
blindne?
 109. He spætte on þa eorðan, & of þam spatle macode
lam; for þan ðe his godcundnesse underfeng þa menniscnesse ure
eorðlicen cyndes, & us mid þam alysde.
 111. He smirode his eagen eac mid þam lame; ac he wæs þeah
swa blind oððet þæt wæter hine aðwoh þe is ihaten Siloe,
þæt is icwædon, Asend.
 114. Ðe Hælend wæs asend soðlice to us to ure alysednesse
fram his Almihtigæ Fæder; & buton he wyrde asend, nere ure nan alysed
fram synnum ne fram hellepine.
 116. Ðenne ðe mon bið icristnod & me him tæcð his
ileafan, þonne beoð his eagan ismirode; ac he ne isihð swa þeah ær
þam þe he beo ifullod mid fulle geleafan on þæs Hælendes namæ
þe hider asend wæs.
 119. His leorningcnihtæs befrunnon hine & cwædon, For
hwæs synnum wæs ðes mon swa blind acenned, hwæðer þe for his
agene oððe for his magæ?
 121. Þa cwæð ða Hælend heom sonæ to andsware, Næs
he blind acenned for his agene synnum, oððe for his mage, ac þæt Godes
wundræ wyrdon on him iswytelode.
 124. Nes ðe blindæ man swa þeah buton synnum on life,
forþan ðe monig blind mon bið swiðe manful, ac he nes for his synnæ
oððe for his magæ blind acenned, swa swa Crist sylf sæde, ac þæt
Godes wundra wyrdon on him iswutelode.
 127. Me gedafenæð to wyrcenne his weorc ðe me asende.
 128. Nu ge magen ihyren hu ðe Hælend wearð asend fram his
Almihtiga Fader, swa swa we ær cwædon.
 130. He cwæð þæt him gedafenode to wyrccenne his weorc
for þam ðe he is his Sunu of þam soðan Fæder, Almihtigæ Alesend,
of þam Almihtiga Fæder, & he æffre his weorc & al his wuldor
tealde to his heofenlice Fæder, þe hine asende.
 133. Forþan ðe he of him is al þæt he is, eafre acenned
Sunu unasegenlice; & þe Fæder nis na of nanum oðrum.
 135. Crist cwæð, þa hwile þe hit dæg bið, for þam
ðe þeo deorce niht cymð, þonne nan mon ne mæg noht to gode wyrcean.
 137. Hwilc is ðe dæg, oððe hwæt is þeo niht?
 138. Crist cwæð him sylf þæt he is ðeo soðe liht
þisses middaneardes, & he is ure dæg, ðe us mid geileafæn onliht
fram blindnesse.
 139. He cwæð, Ic eam middaneardes liht, þa hwile ðe þe
ic on middanearde æm.
 141. Hwæt wene we la, broðræ, þæt he were þa mid
monnum, þa þa he on menniscnesse on middanearde wæs, & æfter his
æriste & upstige to heofonum us wyrde ætbrogdon & his beorhte
liht, & þeo deorce niht come æfter Drihtnes upstige?
 144. Nis hit na swa þeah swa we on ðare swarte nihte ure lif
adreogon buton Cristes lihte.
 145. His <foreign>apostoli</foreign> wrohten fela wyndræ & tacnæ æfter
his upstige, & eac heom becom to ðe Halige Gast of heofenum, & heom
alle geaf alle þeodæ spæce þe on þissere worulde beoð.
 148. Heo wrohten eac þa wundræ þe Crist sylf ne wrohte; for
þan þe he sæde to heom ær his ðrowunge, Maran wundræ ge
wurcæð; & hit wearð eac swa.
 151. Swa þæt ða leaffulle men lædden ða untruman men on
heoræ lægerbeddum, & lægdon heom bi þere stræte þer þer
Petrus eode; & heom oferglad þa ðæs apostolas scæde, & heo
sona wurdon hale fram al untrumnesse for his scæde repunge.
 154. Ne hælde þe Hælend nenne mon þurh his scæde, ac
þeos miht com of him swa þeah; forþan ðe he cwæð ær to heom,
<foreign>Sine me, nichil potestis facere</foreign>; þæt is on ure spæce, Ne mage ge nan
þing/ don buton me.
 157. Þes weoruldlice dæg þe us gewunelic is, bið iendod
mid þan onsigendum æfne; ac þe drihtenlicæ dæg, þæt is ures
Drihtnes midwunung, bið us æfre astreht oð ende þissere weorulde.
 160. Swa swa Crist sylf behet þam ðe hine lufiæð, <foreign>Ecce
ego uobiscum sum omnibus diebus usque ad consummationem saeculi</foreign>; þæt is
on Englisce spæce, Efne ic beo mid eow alle dagum heonon forð oð
þissere weorulde endunge.
 164. Hwæt is ðeo deorce niht buton helledimnes, on þære
nan mon ne mæg naht to gode wyrcean, þe ðe nu on his life þes lihtes
ne gemð þe Crist us behet þurh his midwununge?
 166. Oðer is weorces timæ, oðer is ætleanes timæ.
 167. Nu is weorces timæ oð þissere weorulde endunge; &
æfter ure life bið eadleanes timæ, þonne Crist on his domsetle
clypæð to his icorenum, Cumæð nu to me, mines fæder iblætsedon,
& iagniæð þæt rice þe eow igearcod wæs fram middaneardes
anginne.
 171. Þis is þæt edlean þare rihtwisæ monnæ þe
rihtlice leofedon, & mid gode weorce Gode icwæmdon.
 172. Ðeo dimme niht bið ðonne ure Drihten clypæð on
þam miclan dome to þam manfullæ heape þe mid yfele weorce hine ær
gremoden & on unrihtwisnesse heora lif adrogon, Gewitæð fram me, ge
awarigedan, into þam ece fyre, þe is deofle igearcod & his awarigedum
gaste.
 176. Þonne underfoð heo edlean on ecere þine heoræ
arleasæ dæda þe heo æfre adrugon oð heoræ lifes ende, &
heoræ/ Drihten forsægon.
 179. On ðare nihte cwylmde, swa swa Cristes boc us sægð,
þe wælga rice; ðe walde þa habban Lazarum þone þearfæn, þe he
on his life forseah, þæt he mid his fingræ hure his tunga drypte for
þan ormete bryne þe he on cwylmode.
 182. Ac him wæs þæs wætan forwyrnd, swa swa he forwyrnde
ær þa crumen þam earmæn Lazare.
 183. Him com þa to gemynde his gebroðræ on life; wolde þa
god wyrcan, & heom warnigæn þæt heo ðider ne comen to þare
cwylmynge.
 185. Ac þa nes na weorces timæ, ac wæs edleanes; & he
wæs þa on þare nihte þær he wyrcen ne mihte.
 187. Ðis godspel is langsum & hæfð longne traht.
 188. Nu wylle we eow secgan þæt arfoþeste andgit; þæt
oðer ge magon eow seolfe understanden.
 189. Ðe mon wæs ihæled on þam halga ræstendæg.
 190. Þa sædon sonæ sume þa sunderhalgan, Nis ðes mon na
fram Gode, þe ðonne restandæg ne heald.
 191. Þa Iudeiscan heoldon heom to freolsdæge þonne
Sæteresdæg, & na ðone Sunnendæg, on þa aldan wisæn,
æfter Moyses æ; swa þæt heo on þam dæge nan ðeowtlic weorc
wyrcan ne mosten for þare micclan tacnunge ðe þe dæg tacnode, swa swa
we sædon hwilon ær.
 195. Ðe Sæteresdæg þe heo swa swiðe freolsoden is ure
gastlice freols, þe we for Gode sceolon haldan on ure life on ðare neowen
gecyðnesse, & warniæn us wið synnæ þe beoð þeowtlice
weorce.
 198. Swa swa Crist seolf cwæð on sumne godspelle, <foreign>Omnis qui
facit peccatum seruus est peccati</foreign>, ælc ðare þe synnæ gewyrcæð
is ðare synne ðeow.
 200. Is nu þe ræstandæg ure lifes timæ, on þam we
sceolon simle synne forbugon, swa we selost magon, ure Scyppende to lofe, &
gif we hwæt tobrecon, beton þæt georne.
 203. Þa Iudeiscan freolsoden þone forsædon ræstandæg
fram weoruldlice weorcum, ac heo gewemdon swa ðeah þone ilcæ
ræstandæg mid unrihte dæda & mid þam ðe heo wið cwædon
þæt Crist nære fram Gode.
 206. He heold þonne restandæg þeah ðe he ihælde þonne
blindan, forðan ðe he leofede his lif buton synnum.
 208. & we halgiæð nu him þone halgan sunnandæg,
forþan ðe he on ðam dæge of deaþe aras, ða þe he us alysde fram
þam ecan deaðe.
 210. Heo cwædon to ðam men, Do wuldor Gode; swylc heo
cwædon þæt Crist nære God, & he sceolde þancian þam
heofenlican Gode.
 212. We witen ful gearæ þæt ðæs mon is synful; ðis
sædon þa Iudeiscan be þam soðfestæn Hælende, þe ne wrohte
næfre on þisse weorulde synnæ.
 214. Ac heo weron synfulle, ðeah ðe heo swa ne wendon, &
heom wære bætere þæt heo wrohton alle dæg on þam halgan
restandæg, þone heo be þam Hælende swa huxlice spæcon heom seolfum
to wite.
 217. Ðe restandæg wes ihalgod on ðes Hælendes ðrowunge
fram ðeowtlicum weorce; ac we nu ðurfon na leng lichamlice haldæn, ac on
ure lifes ðeawum on gastlice andgite, & on gode weorcum.
 220. Þa Iudesican warigedon wodlice ðone blindan syððan he
ihæled wæs, þa he be þam Hælende spæc & befran hwæðer
heo wolden his leorningcnihtæs beon.
 222. Heo sædon him to andsware, Beo ðu his leorningcniht,
swylce he wære awariged gif he cristene wære.
 224. Ac þæt nis na warigung, ac witolice blætsung þæt
mon Criste folgie mid soðæ cristendome.
 225. Heo temdon to Moysen þam mæran lareowe þæt heo his
leorningcnihtæs weron & his lare folgodon; ac gif heo his lare folgedon,
þonne lyfdon heo on Crist, forþam ðe Moyses awrat witegunge be Criste.
 228. & þa Iudeiscan noldon nowþre folgian ne Moysen ne
Criste mid nane soðfestnesse.
 229. Ðe ihælede mon cwæð þæt God nele ihyran þa
synfulle men, ac he ne sæde na riht.
 230. Forþan ðe he ne cuðe þagyt þa halga Cristes boc þe
sæð hu þe manfulle mid mycele onbrurdnesse binnon Salomones temple hine
sceortlice ðus ibed, <foreign>Deus propicius esto michi peccatori</foreign>, þæt is, God
Almihtigæ mildsige me synfulle; & he wearð irihtwisod, & wende him
ham.
 235. We nyton, þeah he mende þæt micele wundor, þæt nan
synful man ne mihte swylce tacnæ wyrcæn.
 236. Ðe ihælede mon cwæð to þam heardheortum Iudeiscum,
Fram þissere weorlde anginne ne wearð nefræ ihyred þæt ænig mon
mihte þone mon ihælen & his eagan openiæn þe ær wæs blind
acenned; buton he fram Gode were, ne mihte he þis don.
 240. Freolice he spæc her, & ful andrædlice, Hwa mihte
openigan þa unsceapenæ eagen & him sihðe gifen, buton ðe ðe
geisceop ær Adam of eorðan & Euam of his ribbe?
 242. Ða yrsodan þa Iudeiscan & hine utdrifon.
 243. Ac Crist hine underfeng þa þa heo hine forsægen &
him sonæ cwæð to, þu ilefest on Godes Sunu?
 244. He andswyrde mid ileafan, La hwylc is he, laford, þæt ic
ilefe on hine ?
 246. & þe Hælend cwæð him to, þu hine isæge
ær, & he is ðe ilcæ þe þe to spæky.
 247. He cwæð þa mid ileafan, Ic ilyfe, Drihten, & feol
to his fotum; forþan ðe he oncneow ðet hit idafenlice wæs ðæt he
to his Drihtne mid astreahtum limum & geleafan hine gebede.
 250. Ða cwæð ðe Hælend him eft to þus, Ic com hider
on dome on þisne middaneard, þæt ða men iseon þe ne mihten ær
iseon, & þa ðe iseoð sceolon beon blinde.
 252. Þes mon wæs blind iboren, ac he iseah þurh Criste
ægðer mid eagan & mid geleafan.
 253. Þa Iudeiscan wendon þæt heo weron hale, ac heo ne
isegon na Crist mid soðæ leafæ, ne his lihtes ne bedon, for þan ðe
heo blinde weron.
 255. Heo hine isegen swutelice mid eagan, & mid hearde
heortæ huxlice forsegon.
 256. We hine ne isegon mid lichamlicere gesihðe, ac we hine
iseoð nu mid soðæ geleafan.
 258. Heo þurhwunedon on blindnesse, & we wurdon onlihte
ðurh ðone lyfigendan Drihten þe leofæð a on ecnysse.
 259. AMEN.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

ÆHomM 4 (Ass 5)
B1.5.4.
Homily for Friday after the Fifth Sunday in Lent: Assmann 1889, 65-72.



 1. Þæt halige godspell, þe ge gehyrdon nu rædan, segð,
þæt þa bisceopealdras and þa farisei embe urne drihten ræddon on
heora geþeahte him betwynan and cwædon: Hwæt mage we la don, nu þes
man þus wyrcð swa fela tacna?
 6. Gyf we hyne forlætað swa, þonne gelyfað ealle menn
endemes on hyne and cumað þa Romaniscan leoda and ure land gegað and ure
cyn adylgiað.
 9. And heora an cwæð þa, Caiphas gehaten, se wæs sacerd
on þam geare: Nyte ge nan þing, ne ge ne þencað, þæt us fremað,
þæt an man swelte for folce and nateshwon ne losige eall seo mægð
tosomne.
 14. Nu segð se godspellere, þæt he ne sæde na þis of
his agenum andgyte,ac he openlice witegode, forðam þe he wæs sacerd
gesett to þam geare, þæt ure hælend sceolde sweltan for þeode, and
na for þeode anre, ac eac swilce gegaderian godes bearn on an, þe ær
wæron tostencte.
 20. Of þam dæge eornostlice hi anrædlice þohton, þæt
hi hyne ofslogon and swiðe þæs cepton.
 22. Se hælend þa nolde syððan openlice faran mid þam
Iudeiscum, ac ferde him þanon to anum westenum earde wið þa burh Effrem,
and he þær wunode mid his discipulum.
 26. Þa Iudeiscan ofaxodon, hu ure drihten arærde Lazarum of
deaðe.
 27. Þa ne licode him, þæt he swilce mihte betwux mannum
gefremode, forðam þe hi andodon æfre on hys dædum, and eac hi
þohton to ofsleanne þone gesæligan Lazarum, þe of deaðe aras þurh
drihtnes mihte, forþam ðe þa Iudeiscan fela gelyfdon on urne hælend
Crist þurh his ærist of deaðe.
 34. Dyslic dyrstignys heora, swilce ure drihten ne mihte Lazarum
aræran to life eft of deaðe, þeah þe hi hyne ofslogon, swa swa hi
gemynton.
 37. Se þe þone deadan arærde þurh his drihtenlican mihte,
se mihte eac swilce, þeah þe he ofslegen wære, hine eft aræran
eaðelice to life.
 40. Þa earman Iudeiscan embe þæt smeadon, hu hi þæt
soðe lif of life gedydon, and noldon smeagan, hu hi on hine gelyfdon,
þæt hi lif hæfdon mid þam soðan life and swa earmlice on ecnysse ne
forwurdon.
 45. Hi cwædon on heora geþeahte him betwynon þus: Hwæt
mage we la don, nu þes mann þus wyrcð swa fela tacna.
 47. Gyf we hine forlætað swa, þonne gelyfað ealle men
endemes on hyne and cumað þa Romaniscan leoda and ure land gegað.
 50. To þam swiðe hi smeadon and syrwdon ymbe Crist, þæt
þa bisceopealdras þæt geban setton, þæt swa hwa swa wiste, hwær
he wære to soðan, þæt he hyt cydde, þæt hi hyne gelæhton.
 54. Hi sohton þone hælend, ac hi sohton hyne yfele.
 55. Gesælige beoð þa, ðe hine secað wel.
 56. Swa hi hyne sohton, þæt hi sylfe hyne næfdon, ne we na
þe swiþor, gyf hyt be heora willan eode.
 58. Ac þa þa Crist hi forlet, þa gelæhte we hine mid urum
geleafan, and hi hyne forleton.
 60. Hyt wæs þa gehende heora eastertide, and hi woldon habban
þone halgan easterdæg geblodegodne welhreowlice mid þæs hælendes
blode.
 63. And he is þæt godes lamb, þe alysde mancynn and
gehalgode þone dæg mid his halgan blode, þeah þe þa earmingas
þæs ne wendon.
 66. Hi cwædon, þæt þa Romaniscan heora rice woldon
habban, and hyt eac syððan gelamp, swa swa hi foresædon þa, þæt
æfter Cristes æriste and upstige to heofonum comon þa Romaniscan leoda
and þæt land gehergodon and þa burh Hierusalem besæton mid fyrde,
oð ðæt hi hungre acwælon.
 71. And þa ðe hæfdon sum þing lytles to bigleofan,
þæt gelæhton reaferas and of þam muðe him abrudon unmæðlice
mid þreate.
 74. Þa ylcan reaferas urnon geond þa burh mete gehwær
secende, and hi manega ofslogon heora agenra burhwara for ðam earmlican
hungre.
 77. And man þa deadan ne mihte, þe þær adydde wæron,
sume mid þam hungre, sume þurh þa reaferas, nateshwon bebyrgean for heora
mægenleaste, ac wurpon fela hundreda forð ofer þone weall for þam
yfelan stence, þe him of eode.
 82. Þa gewunnon þa Romaniscan mid wige þa burh and þa
weallas towurpon and towendon þæt tempel and mid ealle adilogodon þa
dyrstigan burhware, swa þæt seo burh wearð geworht eft syððan on
oðre stowe, and se stede æfre syððan wæs æmtig, þær heo
ær on stod.
 88. Þa læddon þa Romaniscan þæt þær to lafe wæs
þæs folces, fela hund manna, ham to heora burgum.
 90. And þær naht ne belaf on þam lande þæs cynnes, and
is swa gefylled þæt, þæt hi forsædon, þæt hi wæron
benæmode lifes and eardes.
 93. Is swa ðeah micel dæl þæs mancynnes gehwær wide
tosawen, and Saracenas habbað þone æþelan eard, þe hi ær
hæfdon.
 96. Caiphas se sacerd cwæð to ðam Iudeiscum: Nyte ge nan
þing, ne ge ne þencað, þæt us fremað, þæt an man swelte for
folce and nateshwon ne losige eall seo mægð tosomne.
 100. Nu segð se godspellere, þæt he ne sæde na þis of
his agenum andgyte, ac he openlice witegode, forðam þe he wæs sacerd
gesett to þam geare, þæt ure hælend sceolde sweltan for þeode, and
na for ðeode anre, ac eac swilce gegaderian godes bearn on an, þe ær
wæron tostencte.
 106. Caiphas witegode, þeah þe he wyrðe nære, be ðære
anre þeode, forðam þe of þære comon manega gecorene, be þam
cwæð Crist ær: Ne eom ic na asend buton to ðam sceapum Israhela
hiwrædene, ða þe losedon.
 111. Ac se godspellere sæde be þam oðrum sceapum of
hæþenum folce, be þam se hælend cwæð: Ic hæbbe oðre scep,
þe soðlice ne synd of þysre eowde, and þa ic sceall lædan, and hi
mine stemne gehyrað, and byð an eowd and an hyrde.
 116. Þas synd þa godes bearn, þe se hælend gegaderode of
Iudeiscre þeode and of hæþenum folce to anre eowde his gelaþunge.
 119. And þis wæs gesæd be þære soðan forestihtinge,
þurh þa hi wæron gemynte on þam micclan dihte godes foresceawunge to
hys sceapa getele.
 122. Næron hi witodlice naðor ne godes scep, ne godes bearn
þa gyt, forþam þe hi ne gelyfdon þa gyt on þone hælend, ac
gelyfdon syððan, and synd nu soðlice his scep and his bearn, þa ðe he
him geceas ær middaneardes gesetnysse.
 127. On Caiphas witegunge we synd gemynegode, þæt þurh yfele
men eac swilce wæs hwilon seo witegung gefremmed, swa swa wæs þurh hyne
and þurh þone Chaldeiscan cyning Nabochodonossor, se þe þa þry
cnihtas, þe wiðcwædon his hæþenscipe, het hi gebundene wurpan into
þam byrnendum ofne and cwæð syððan to his þegnum, þæt he
gesawe on þam ofne godes sunu gangan mid þam þrym cnihtum.
 135. Nu is heora witegung and heora gelican him sylfum to forwyrde,
forþam þe hi wiðsocon Criste, be þam ðe hi witegodon, þeah þe hi
næron wyrðe.
 138. Caiphas wæs gesett sacerd to þam geare.
 139. Ac we secgað nu eow, hwi hit swa is gecweden, þæt he
gesett wære sacerd to ðam geare.
 141. God bebead Moyse on þam munte Sinai, þæt Aaron, his
broþor, sceolde beon sacerd and his sunu æfter him, and syððan æfre
forð of þam anum cynne sceolde beon gecoren to þam sacerdhade, swa swa nu
synd bisceopas, and ne moste na ma to ðam micclan hade, buton an æfter
anum of þam ylcan cynne.
 148. Ac þa Iudeiscan hæfdon for heora gytsunge and for heora
sacum gesett nu æt nextan, þæt hi ma sacerda him gesette hæfdon, and
sceolde ælc þenian to anes geares fyrste, swa swa Caiphas wæs þæs
geares sacerd.
 153. Hi hæfdon þone had, þe nu habbað bisceopas to godes
þenungum, ac hi ne þorfton mæssian, forðam ðe huselhalgung næs,
ærþam ðe se hælend ær his þrowunge gehalgode hlaf and win to
husle and het syððan don swa on his gemynde, and þa wæs seo mæsse
asteald þurh þone mildheortan Crist, þe us þæt wed sealde urum
sawlum to clænsunge.
 160. We moton nu geendian þyses godspelles race, swa swa seo
geendung us sæde hwene ær, þæt þa Iudeiscan of þam dæge
þohton, þæt hi Crist ofslogon and swiðe þæs cepton.
 164. Se hælend þa nolde syððan openlice faran mid þam
Iudeiscum, ac ferde him þanon to anum westenum earde wið ða burh Effrem,
and he þær wunode mid hys discipulum.
 168. He forbeah þa Iudeiscan, þeah þe he beon mihte ungederod
mid him, swa swa he dyde foroft.
 170. Ac he beah to ðam westene fram heora wodnysse, oð ðæt
se tima com, þæt he sylfwilles eft þam deaðe genealæhte and ongean
ferde.
 173. Þa þa he hi forbeah, þa sealde he bysne hys halgum
folgerum, þæt hi forfleon moston þæra arleasra ehtnysse buton
ælcere synne and heora lif gebeorgan and forbugan þa reðnysse.
 177. Se mildheorta hælend, þe swa micel forbær for us
synfullum, sylle us forgyfennysse and his mildheortnysse and mid him wununge on
þære ecan worulde.
 180. Sy him wuldor a on ealra worulda woruld ecelice.
 181. Amen.

END_TEXT

ÆHomM 5 (Ass 6)
B1.5.5.
Homily for the Third Sunday after Easter: Assmann 1889, 73-80.



 1. Ure leofa hælend, þa ða he her on life wæs, mid mannum
wunigende and wundru wyrcende, þa þa hit genealæhte, þæt he his
lufe geswutelode eallum mancynne mid micelre eadmodnysse, þæt he syllan
wolde hine sylfne for us, þa on ðam frigeæfene, þæs þe he on
mergen þrowode, þa manode he his folgeras, þe him folgodon on life, mid
langsumere spræce and hi lærde georne mid luflicum wordum and gewissode
hi, forðan þe he fundode þa to ferenne of worulde, of ðisum
earfoðnyssum to his ælmihtigan fæder.
 12. Iohannes awrat þis, þe wæs his <foreign>discipulus</foreign>, swiðe
leof þam hælende, þe gehyrde þa his word, swa swa þis godspell nu us
sægð heræfter: <foreign>Modicum et non videbitis me, et reliqua</foreign>, Medemmicel
hwil is, þæt ge me ne geseoð, and eft is lytel fæc, þæt ge me
eft geseoð, forðan þe ic fare nu to minum heofonlican fæder.
 19. Þa wundrodon hi swiðe þære sægene him betwynan, and
se hælend þa oncneow, þæt hi hine axian woldon þæra worda
digolnysse, and geandwyrde him þus: Soð, soð ic eow sæcge, þæt ge
sceolon wepan and on mode heofian and þes middaneard blissian.
 24. Ge beoð geunrotsode, ac eower unrotnys bið witodlice
awænd eow eall to blisse.
 26. Þonne þæt wif acænð, hyre cymð unrotnys.
 27. Eft þonne heo hæfð hyre cild acenned, þonne forgyt
heo hire unrotnysse, forþan þe man is on middanearde acenned.
 30. Nu eornostlice hæbbe ge sume unrotnysse, and ic eft eow
geseo and eower heorte blissað, and nan man ne mæg eowre blisse eow
ætbredan.
 33. We habbað nu gesæd þus sceortlice þis godspell
anfealdum andgite on Engliscum gereorde, and we eac wyllað sum andgit eow
sæcgan of ðæs hælendes wordum eow to geleafan.
 37. Medemmicel hwil is, þæt ge me ne geseoð, and eft is
lytel fæc, þæt ge me eft geseoð, forðan þe ic fare nu to minum
heofonlican fæder.
 40. Þeos hwilwende gesihð, þæt hi hine gesawon and eft ne
gesawon, to ðam swiðost belimpð, þe him þa mid wæron and his word
gehyrdon, forþan þe Iudas com mid þam cwealmbærum on þære ilcan
nihte mid ormætere wæpnunge and eac mid leohtfatum and belæwde þone
hælend þam arleasum cwellerum, swa swa him ær gewearð, and hi hine
læddon to heora heafodmannum.
 48. He wearð þa on frigedæg gefæstnod on rode and on
æfen bebyrged æfter his forðsiþe.
 50. And hi ða ne gesawon syððan þone hælend, oð
ðæt he on sunnandæg, swa swa he him sæde ær, gesund aras of
deaðe and geswutelode hine his halgum apostolum and hi gefrefrode, and he
menigfealdlice heora mod gegladode mid his fægeran lare, hu hi læran
scoldon ealle þeoda on ðisum middanearde to þam soðan geleafan, swa swa
witegan sædon be his agenre þrowunge and be his æriste and be his
upstige eft syððan to heofonum.
 60. Þa wundrodon hi swiðe þære segene him betwynan, and se
hælend ða oncneow, þæt hi hine axian woldon þæra worda
digolnysse, and geandwyrde him þus: Soð, soð ic eow secge, þæt ge
sceolon wepan and on mode heofian and þes middaneard blissian.
 65. Þa þe Crist lufedon and his lare gehyrdon mid him wunigende
and his wundru gesawon, þa wæron sarige and swiðe geunrotsode, þa ða
hi gesawon, swa swa we sædon ær, þæt þa cwelleras comon and hi
Crist gebunden læddon to þam heafodmannum.
 70. And hi hine fordemdon unscyldigne to deaðe, and þa swiðe
blissedon þa þe middaneardlice þing lufedon to swiðe.
 73. Þæt wæron þa Iudei, þe wunnon on ðone hælend,
and him hefigtyme wæs, þæt hi hine gesawon, forþan þe he ameldode
heora manlice geþohtas and heora unrihtwisnysse he him openlice sæde.
 77. Þa wurdon hi swiþe bliþe, þæt hi geseon moston
æfre þone dæg, þæt he fordemed wurde to swa bysmorlican deaðe,
swa swa hi him gemynton, forþan þe on ðam timan næs on þære
þeode nan deaþ swa huxlic swa swa on rodehengenne.
 82. Ge beoð geunrotsode, ac eower unrotnyss bið witodlice
awænd eow eallum to blisse.
 84. Hi wurdon geblissode wundorlice on mode þurh þæs
hælendes ærist and his upstige to heofonum, þa ðe hine lufedon.
 86. Ac þas word belimpað to eallum þam geleaffullum, þe her
on life swincað and þurh wop gewilniað þæs ecan wuldres mid him.
 89. Þonne þæt wif acænð, hyre cymð unrotnyss, and eft
þonne heo hæfð hire cild acænned, þonne forgyt heo hire unrotnysse,
forðan þe man is on middanearde acænned.
 93. Þæt wif is her gecweden eall Cristes gelaþung on
gastlicum andgite, þe is his agen bryd, swa swa hit oft sægð swutollice
on bocum, þæt heo is ure modor and mæden and swa þeah symble acenð
hire cild þam hælende on þam halgan fulluhte to þam heofonlican life,
and heo ne mæg na beon butan earfoðnyssum, þonne heo æfre sceal
winnan wið ða unþeawas and wið ða heafodleahtras her on þissum
life.
 102. Ac þonne heo oferwinð þa gewitendlican geswinc and þa
leahtras ofercymð þurh Cristes sylfes fultum, þonne ne gemunð heo hire
modes biternysse, gif heo þa gastlican cild gode acennan mæg.
 106. <foreign>Existimo enim, quod non sunt condignæ passiones huius
temporis ad futuram gloriam, quæ revelabitur in nobis</foreign>, Paulus, þeoda
lareow, cwæð on his larbocum: Ic wene soðlice, þæt ne synd na
emlice þissere tide þrowunga þam toweardum wuldre, þe bið geswutelod
on us sylfum þonne, þæt is on heofonan rice, gif we her nu swincað,
feohtende mid geleafan wið leahtras and synna.
 114. Ac ealle we forgytað þæt ærre geswinc, gif ure sawla
becumað gesælige to Criste.
 116. Se bið soþlice acænned, þe siðað to Criste to
ðam ecan life, on ðam þe he a leofað, swa swa þa halgan martiras,
þe her micel þrowedon, and þa clænan <foreign>confessores</foreign>, þe Criste
þeowedon and nu libbað mid him.
 120. And we on life healdað heora gemynd nu mid mæssum and
lofsangum on þam dæge, þe hi gewiton of þissere worulde to Criste, and
þæt is heora gebyrtid on bocum gecweden, nateshwon woplice, swa swa man
bewepð deadne, ac swiþe wuldorfull mid ecum wurðmynte.
 126. Þæt cild, þe bið acænned, sona hit cyð mid wope
and þærrihte witegað þissere worulde geswinc and þa toweardan
costnunga, þeah þe hit ne cunne nan þing, forðan þe hit cymð hyder
to hefegum geswince and to micclum gewinne, swa swa Iob iu awrat, and swa swa
Salomon sæde on his gesetnyssum.
 132. Nu eornostlice hæbbe ge sume unrotnysse, and ic eft eow
geseo and eower heorte blissað, and nan man ne mæg eowre blisse eow
ætbredan.
 135. Þis he gecwæð þa be ðam þe him folgodon and eac
be þam eallum, þe hine lufiað, forþan þe he geseah hi, syððan he
of deaðe aras, and he hi gefrefrode, swa swa we her foresædon.
 139. And dæghwamlice he gesihð þa þe hine lufiað and
heora geþyld gewelegað gewunnenum sige, þonne hi sigefæste beoð
oferswiðedum costnungum.
 142. Us ealle he gesihð on ðam ecan wuldre, and ure heorte
blissaþ on his gesihþe þearle, and þa micclan blisse us ne ætbret
nan man, forðan þe ðær ne wunað nan wiþerwinna, ne nan yfel
ehtere, þe us dreccan mage, þonne Crist ure lif, þe we lufiað nu, us
æfre gegladað on ealre godnysse.
 149. We wyllað nu sæcgan be þam ungesæligum Cristes
cwellerum, hu forcuðe hi ðohton, þa ða hi feoh sealdon, swa swa us
sæde se godspellere, eallum þam weardmannum, þe wæron asænde fram
þam ealdorbisceopum to Cristes byrgenne, þæt hi his lic bewacedon,
þæt he ne wurde forstolen.
 155. Hi comon þa and cyddon, þæt Crist aras of deaðe, and
þa heafodmenn sona on synderlicum geþeahte þone sceat him sealdon and
bædon, þæt hi sædon, þæt þæs hælendes lic him wurde
forstolen, midðam þe hi befulon fæste on slæpe.
 160. Hi namon þone sceatt and swa þeah muþetton and on
synderlicum runungum þæt riht eall ræddon.
 162. Þa wurdon þa Iudeiscan wodlice astyrode wið ðone
halgan Ioseph, þe ðone hælend bebyrigde, swa swa Hieronimus sæde
syððan on his cranice, þæt hi setton þone Ioseph sona on cweartern,
forþan þe he him on teonan his lic bebyrigde on eall niwre þruh and he
hine behwearf.
 168. Hwæt, þa godes wundor þær wearð geswutelod on
þære sweartan nihte, þa ða he sæt on þam cwearterne, þæt
þæt stænene cweartern stod eall on lyfte up fram þære eorðan,
swylce englas hit ahofon up be mannes wæstme.
 172. And Ioseph wearð ahred, swa þæt þa heardheortan his
næfdon nan þing, ne him nan bliss ne becom of Cristes æriste.
 175. Þa cwædon þa weardmenn, þe bewiston Cristes lic, to
þam hetelum Iudeiscum mid hospe him þus to: <foreign>Reddite nobis Ioseph, et nos
reddamus vobis Christum</foreign>, Agifað us nu Ioseph, and we agifað eow Crist.
 179. Manege unblissa and micele sorga becomon þam Iudeiscum, swa
swa us cyðað bec, æfter Cristes selge, be ðam we sædon hwilon on
Engliscum gewritum, hu hi wurdon adydde.
 183. And hi maran sorge sceoldon habban eft, þonne hi on domes
dæg fordemde beoð to helle mid ðam hetolan deofle, þe hi forlærde
to þam.
 186. Sy nu wuldor and lof þam welwillendan hælende a on
ecnysse, þæt he us alysde.
 187. Amen.

ÆHomM 6 (Bel 3)
B1.5.6.
Twenty-Second Sunday after Pentecost: Belfour 1909, 22-30.



 1. <foreign>Erat quidam regulus cuius filius infirmabatur Capharnaum &
reliqua</foreign>, Ure Hælend com hwilon to Chanan, þam tune on Galileiscre scire,
ðær ðær he swyðest bodede; & on þam tune he awende hwilon
water to wine, six fate fulle mid þam fyrmestan wine.
 5. Ða wæs sum underkyng on Capharnan burig, & his sune
ða læg seoc to forðfore.
 7. Ða axode þe underkyng embe þæs Hælendes fær,
þæt he from Iudea londe com to Galileam, ferde þa to þam Hælende
& hine bæd georne þæt he sceolde faren & his sune hælen,
þe læg þa æt forðsiðe his lifes unwæne.
 10. Þa andswarde þe Hælend þus ðam underkynge, Buton ge
tacne iseon, nelle ge ilyfæn.
 11. Þe underkyng him andswarde eft, La, leof Drihten, fare to
mine sune ær þan ðe he swælte.
 13. Ðe Hælend him cwæð þus to, Fare ðe nu on þinne
wæg; þin sune leofæð.
 14. Ða ilyfde þe kyng ðæs Hælendes spæce, &
wende him hamweard, & hopode to þan.
 15. Ða comen ðæs on maregen his men him togeanes &
cydden him mid blisse þæt his sune leofede.
 17. Ðe fæder heom befran þa mid fyrwetnysse sonæ, on
hwylcere tide þe sune gewurpte.
 18. Heo sæden him to andsware, Gyrstændæg he wurpte; swa
ofer midne dæg, þæt hine forlet þeo fefor.
 20. Þa oncneow þe fæder þæt hine forlet þe fefor on
þare ylcæ tide þe ðe Hælend him to cwæð, Fare þe nu ham
raðe; þin sune leofæð.
 22. & he þa sylf ilyfde, & all his hired þurh
ðæt.
 23. Ðis godspel is nu sceortlice isæd on Englisc, & we
wullæð eow sæcgæn sum andgit þerto of þare trahtnunge bi
eowræs andgites mæðe; na swa ðeah to longlice, þæt hit eow
æðryt ne þynce.
 26. Underkyng is ihaten þe under þam casere rixæð; &
on þam time wæron caseres on Rome swa þæt heo ahton ða anweald
& cynedom ofer alne middaneard & ofer alle kyngæs æfter Cristes
acennednysse.
 29. & heo kynelice rixoden fela hund geare; & heom mon
feorran brohten of huwhilce londe ægðer ge lac ge gafol; & heo sume
eac comen to Englelonde hwilon, & ðer forðfærdon, heoræ forwel
felæ.
 32. Ða wæron ða underkyngæs þam casere underðeode, to
ðam ðe heo wolden, & heoræ wurðscipe wæs bi þæs caseres
willæn, loca hu he wolde.
 34. Ðæt cydde þe casere þam kynge Archelau þæs
Herodis sune, þe þa childræn acwalde.
 35. He sette ut of kynestole & sende hine on wræcsiðe for
his forwenednysse.
 36. & gesette for hine feower oðre kyngæs, þa wæren
fiðerricæn, for þan ðe heoræ ælc hæfde feorðen dæl
þæs rices on Iudea londe; & wæs swa ilytlod heoræ ælces
andweald, þæt heo unðances sceoldon bugan þam casere, to his
kynegyrde.
 40. Nu wæs þes kyng þe com to Criste underkyng ihaten on
þa ylcan wisæn, & he bæd his sune hælu, swa swa hær sægð
þis godspel, þe læg ða æt forðsiðe on Capharnan burig.
 43. Ða andswarde þe Hælend þus þam underkynge.
 43. Buton ge tacnæ iseon, nylle ge ilefæn.
 44. Næs þe kyng alles buton Cristes ileafæn, ða ða he
hine bæd þæt he hælde his sune; ac he næfde swa ðeah alne
geileafan, swa swa mon ilyfæn sceal on ðone lifigenden Hælend, þæt
he mæg alle þing on ælcere stowe.
 47. He mihte hælen mid his hæse his sune, swa swa he ða
dyde, ðeah ðe he ne siðode ham to his huse mid him & hine swa
gehælde/.
 49. Ðe kyng nyste þa gyt þæt Crist mihte swa don & mid
his worde hine hælen, & he forþy bed hine þæt he ðer come &
ðone cnapæn hælde.
 51. Gif he rihtlice ilyfde, he sceolde ðonne witen þæt God
sylf is æghwær, on ælcere stowe, þurh his mycele mihte; & mæg
æfre hælpan allum ðe to him clypiæð on ælcere stowe.
 54. Wen is þæt eower sum þisses wundrige nu, hu ðe
Almihtigæ God ælcne mon ihere, beo ðær he beo, gif he bit his
mildsunge.
 56. Ac gesceawæ þas sunnæn hu heo scynæð æghwær
& send hire leomen to alle londum endemes; & heo is ðeah gesceaft
isceapen þurðh þone Hælend.
 58. Mycele swyðor mæg þe Almihtigæ Wealdend his leomen
senden to his ileaffullum monnum on gehwylcum londe, locæ hu he wulle, &
heom swa frefren, & his fultum heom don þurh his mycele gife þe mæg
alle ðing.
 62. Þe underkyng him andswarde, Efest la, leof Drihten, far to
mine sunæ ær þan ðe he swelte.
 63. Her him tweonode eft for his andgitleaste.
 64. He sceolde ilyfen þæt þe leofæ Hælend mihte his
sune hælen swa swa he Lazarum dyde, þeah ðe he dead wære, þurh his
drihtenlice mihte.
 66. Forþan ðe Lazarus læg on burigene feower niht fule þa
stincende; ac he forð stop sonæ þa ðe ure Hælend hæt hine
forþgan, & he syððan leofede longe mid monnum.
 69. Crist cwæð to þam kynge, Far ðe nu on ðine wæg;
þin sune leofæð; & his sune wearð swa from his seocnysse hal.
 70. Sum hundredes aldor com to þam Hælende hwilon on oðre
stowe, & cwæð ðus to him þa, Eala, ðu leofe Drihten, min
cnapæ lið æt ham al on paralisim, & he yfele þrowæð.
 73. Ðe Hælend him cwæð to, Ic cume me sylf to him &
ic hine hæle.
 74. Þa cwæð þe hundredes aldor, Ne am ic na wurðe,
Drihten, þæt ðu swa don sceole, þæt ðu under mine rofe ingonge
mid fotum; ac cwæð þin word, & min cnapæ bið hal.
 77. Ic sylf am nu an mon on anwealde iset, & ic habbe under me
monigæ cnihtæs on fare; & ic cwæðe to ðissum, Far ðu, &
he færð; al swa eft to oðrum, Cum þu, & he cymæð sonæ;
& to mine ðeowe, Do þus, & he deþ.
 80. Ða wundrode þe Hælend his wordæ & geleafen; &
on ende cwæð to him, Far ðe nu hamweard, & getimige þe swa swa
ðu ilyfdest.
 82. & his cnapæ wearð ihæled on ðare ylcan tide.
 83. Ðe underkyng laðode Crist to his huse ham; & he nolde
swa ðeah nateshwon mid him faren.
 84. & he wolde unlaðod to þam licgendæ cnapæ þæs
hundredes aldres, swa swa ge ihyrdon nu for his eadmodnysse, þæt he eac
swutelode þæt we sceolen arwurðiæn þa eadmoden symle, &
þæs monnes gecynd na his mihte wurðiæn.
 88. We ne cunnon wurðiæn witollice on monnum þæt heo
Godes anlicnysse habbæð on heom sylfum, ac þa welan we wurðiæþ
wolice on ðam ricum.
 90. Ac þe Hælend nolde siðiæn mid þam kynge, ðeah
ðe he ibeden wære; ac wæs gearu to farenne to þam bæddrædæn
cnapæn/, ðeah ðe ðe hundredes aldor hine þæs ne bede, þæt he
swa geswutelode þæt we sceolon tocnawæn hwæt we us sylfe beoð, na
hwæt we sylfe habbæð, & þa soðan eadmodnesse on us sylfe
cyþan.
 95. Ða ilyfde þe kyng þæs Hælendes spæce, &
wende, him hamweard, & hopode to þam.
 96. On þæs Hælendes wordum he undernam geleafan; &
sæ ðe mid twynunge com to ðam Hælende, þe ferde ileafful to his
londe hamweard; & he forþan earnode swa his sune hæle.
 99. Ða comen ðæs on maregen his men him togeanes, &
cyddon him mid blisse þæt his sune leofode.
 100. Þe fæder heom befran ða mid fyrwytnysse sonæ, on
hwylcere tide ðe sune wurpte.
 102. Heo sæden him to andsware, Gyrstendæg he wyrpte; swa
ofer midne dæg þæt hine forlet þeo feofer.
 103. On ðare seofoðen tide wearð his sune ihæled, &
þæt getel is halig þurh ðone Halgæ Gast on his seofenfealde gyfe,
ðe ure sawle onlihtæð; & he us dæþ forgyfennysse alræ ure
synnæ/.
 106. Ða oncneow þe fæder þæt hine forlet þeo feofer
on ðare ylcan tide þe ðe Hælend him to cwæð, Fare þe nu ham
ræðe; þin sune leofæð; & he þa sylf lyfde & all his hired
þurh ðæt.
 109. Þeo Cristes boc us sægð þæt Crist sylf bodede
twegen dages on an on Samarian burig, & heo ða ilyfdon þurh his lare on
God.
 111. Nu ilyfde þes kyng on Crist mid his hirede þurh ðæt
an wundor þe he wrohte on his sune; forþan ðe monige ilyfæþ of alle
londe on Crist of hæðenum ðeodum þurh his halgum apostlum þe
þæs Hælendes æ ofer lond seowon.
 114. Ða Iudeisce isægen hu he wrohte tacnæ mycele &
monigæ him sylfe tomiddes; ac swa ðeah to feawe of þam folce ilyfdon.
 116. Ða Iudeisce boceræs bifrynnon hine hwilon, Sæge us, we
biddæþ, on hwæs mihte ðu wurcæst þas syllice wundræ; oððe
hwa geaf þe ðesne andweald þæt ðu swylce ðing makyge?
 119. Ðe Hælend heom andswarde, Sæcgð me nu an ðing,
wæs Iohannis fulluht of heofenum oððe of mannum?
 120. Ða smeadan ðe boceræs betwyx heom, þus cwæðende,
Gif we him nu sæcgæð þæt his fulluht beo of heofene, þenne
andswaræþ he us, Hwi nolde ge him ilefen.
 123. Gif we þenne sæcgæþ þæt his fulluht is of
monnum, þenne wule al folc us oftorfiæn mid stanum, for þan ðe heo
witæn to soðe þæt Iohannes is witegæ.
 125. Heo cwæden þa to andsware, Nute we na to sæcgenne
hwanon Iohannis fulluht beo; & þe Hælend heom andswarde, Ne ic eac eow
ne sæcge on hwylcere mihte ic makige þas wundræ.
 128. & heo letæn þa swa.
 128. Þa boceræs wæron ablende on mode þa þa heo nolden
sæcgen soð be Iohanne, ðonne heo wæl wiston þæt his fulluht
wæs of Gode; & heo dweloden swyðe þa ða heo swylces axoden, hwanon
Cristes miht wære on his mycle wundrum.
 132. For þan ðe heo mihten icnawæn, gif heo cyðen ænig
god, þæt nan mon ne mihte makigen swylce tacnæ butan Gode sylfum,
oððe on Godes nome, þe ðe ane wurcð wundræ ðurh his mihte.
 135. Swa swa þe sealmwurhte song hwilon bi Gode, <foreign>Benedictus
Dominus Deus Israelis, qui facit mirabilia solus</foreign>; Ibledsod is þe Drihten
Israele ðeodæ God þe ðe ane wurcæð wundræ þurh his mihte.
 138. Forþan ðe nan mon ne mæg nane mihte fremmæn, buton
God wurce þa wundræ ðurh þone mon.
 140. Þe ðe him sylf makæð mihte & wundræ butæn
ælcum men; ðam is anweald & wuldor & wurðment on ecnysse a to
worulde.
 141. AMEN.

END_TEXT
