ÆHomM 7 (Bel 4)
B1.5.7.
Twenty-Third Sunday after Pentecost: Belfour 1909, 30-40.



 1. <foreign>Simile est regnum celorum homini regi & religua</foreign>.
 3. Cristes iwunæ wæs ðæt he wolde oft spæcæn on
deopum bigspellum to his <foreign>discipulis</foreign>; ða sæde he hwilon bigspel to heom.
 5. Heofene rice is ilic ane kynge, he ðe hæfde mot wið his
men hwilon & wolde mid gesceade settan his spæce.
 6. He spæc þa wið ænne mon þe him ahte to geldene ten
þusend pundæ, & manode him þæs feos.
 8. Ða næfde þe ðegen nane mihte to þam þæt he ðam
laforde his lane forgylde; ac þe laford het þa lædon ðone þægen
mid wife & mid alle his cildrum & syllæn wið feo, þæt hure
his lan wurde him forgolden.
 11. Þa feol ðe þægen adun to his lafordes fotum &
bæd hine georne mid þissum worde, cwæðende, La, leof, let me fyrst
& ic þin feoh forgylde.
 13. Ðe laford þa mildsode þam ðegene þerrihte, &
læt hine faren, & all þæt feoh him forgeaf.
 14. Ða eode þe ðegen ut; & he efne þa imette sumne
oðerne mon of his agenum iferum, þe ahte him to geldenne hundtentig
penegæ.
 16. & ilæhte hine sonæ, & lægde hine adun &
hine ofðryhte, ðus cwæðende him to, Ageld nu swiðe raðæ
þæt þæt ðu me geldæn scealt.
 17. Ða geælnode ðe oðer hine up swa ðeah, & feol to
his fotum fyrstes him biddende.
 18. Bihet þæt he wolde al his feoh him forgeldæn.
 20. Þa nolde þe ðegen læten him nænne fyrst, ac sette
hine on cwearterne mid swiðlicum gramæ oð ðet he him forgylde
unðances his feoh.
 22. Ða isægen þa hiredmen hu ðe þegen dyde embe ðone
oðerne, & unrodsoden unglededon swiðe & cyddon þam kynge hu he
idon hæfde.
 24. Ðe kyng het þa sonæ hine clypiæn him to, &
cwæð ðus mid yrre, Ealæ, ðu, yfelæ ðeowæ, ic forgeaf þe
ðone sceat, swa swa ðu me bæde; & ðu noldest forgifæn swa
þinum geferæn & him swa mildsiæn, swa swa ic ðe mildsode.
 27. Ða yrsode ðe laford, ant læt hine bitæcen þam
stiðum witnerum, þe hine witniæn sceolden, oð ðet he forgylde al
ðæt feoh him seolfum for his arleasnesse þæt þæt he him
forgeaf.
 30. Nu sægð us þis godspel þæt þe Hælend þa
sæde.
 31. Al swa deþ to soðan min heofenlice Fæder eow, gif ge ne
forgifæð eowrum gebroðrum, ælc an of his heortæn, þæt
þæt he agylte.
 33. Her is mucel andgit eow monnum to witenne; & we nimæð
her to to ðissere trahtnunge Augustinum ðone wisæ, ðe we wæl
truwiæð, swa swa he hit gelogode on ðare Ledenspæce; & we al swa
hit sæcgæð on Engliscere sprece eow.
 37. Heofene rice is ihaten on ðissere stowe Godes agene laðung,
þæt is, al Godes folc, ðe rihtlice ilefæð on ðone lifigende God;
& on þare laðunge gewurð þeos gelicnesse, for þan ðe God sylf
is þe soðæ kyng þe us monnum mildsæð for his mycele cyste, &
wule þæt we mildsien oðrum monnum al swa.
 41. Ðe Hælend cwæð hwilon to þam halgan Petrum ðus,
Gif þin broðor synegæð wið þe, cyð him onsundron ærest.
 43. Gif he þe ihyræð, swa ðu strynest hine Gode.
 44. Gif he þe ne ihyræð, hafe ðe to gewitæn ænne
broðor oððe twegen, & ðrea hine eft swa; ant gif he him ne
gehyrð þæt he hine gerihtlæce, sæge ðenne openlice on alle
gelaðunge.
 46. Gif he ðonne ne gehyrð ða halga laðunge, beo he ðenne
ælfremed, swa swa hæðen mon from ðe.
 48. Ða axode Petrus, Hu ofte sceal ic forgifæn?
 48. Bið inoh seofen siðum?
 49. & him sæde ðe Hælend, Ne sæcge ic na seofen
siðum; ac ðu scealt forgifan seofon siðon gewis, & hundseofentig
siðon.
 51. Ða sæde him ðe Hælend syððan þis bigspel, swa
swa we hwene ær eow sæden on Englisc.
 52. For þan ðe he us lærde mid þare licness, & nolde
þæt we loseden, from his lufe ælfræmede.
 53. Ælc mon eornestlice ah to geldene sum þing, ant hæfð
oðerne mon þe him sceal sum ðing; forþon ðe nan mon nis ðe næbbe
sume synne, ant nan mon nis eft aht eað fynde on life þe næbbe oðerne
mon ðe wið hine agylte.
 57. Nu sette God sylf us þesne regol betwyx us, þæt we þam
forgifan þe wið us agyltæð, þæt God us forgife ure gyltæs
wið him.
 59. Twa weorc beoð þare soðan mildsunge þe us alysæð
be Cristes sylfes lare.
 60. <foreign>Dimitte & dimittetur uobis, date & dabitur uobis</foreign>, He
cwæð, Forgife ge, and eow bið forgifen.
 61. Doð god oðrum monnum, & eow bið god igifen.
 62. Ðu bist mildsunge æt Gode; mildsæ ðu oðre men.
 63. Ðu wylt underfon god; tyðæ ðu oðre men, na for
ðissum life ane, ac for þam ece life, ðær ðe bið forgolden be
hundfealde iwiss swa mycel swa ðu bi anfealde her monnum tyðæst for
þæs Hælendes lufæn, ðe ðe het don swa.
 66. Nu mage we axiæn swa swa Petrus axode, Hu ofte we sceolon
oðrum monnum forgifæn?
 66. Ælce dæge we biddæþ ure synne forgifennysse on þam
<foreign>paternoster</foreign>, swa swa Crist sylf us gesette þæt gebed; ærest his
<foreign>apostolis</foreign>, & heo syððan us forþ, þæt God sylf us forgife ure
synnæn wið hine, swa swa we forgifæð þam ðe wið us
agyltæð.
 71. Nu acsoð God þe hu felæ synna he forgife þe, þenne
sægest ðu, alle; do þu al swa ðe sylf forgif allum þam monnum ðe
wið þe agyldtæþ.
 73. Hwæt gemænð þonne ic cwæðe þæt monigfealde
getel seofen & hundseofentig?
 74. Nu sægð us Augustinus mycele tacnunge be ðam getæle
þus.
 75. Ða þa ure Hælend wæs her on life ifullod, þa tealde
þe godspellere Lucas from Criste sylfum upweard to Adame alle þa
fæderæs æfre, from men to oðrum; & he funde þa seofen and
hundseofentig fæderæs, þæt beoð swa fæla mægða.
 78. Ant Matheus þe godspellere ongon to tellenne fram Abrahame
duneweard oððet Cristes acennednysse.
 80. He tealde niðerweard hu Crist com to middanearde, & Lucas
tealde upweard fram Cristes fulluhte, forþan ðe his upstige ongan on þam
fulluhte.
 82. On his fulluhte wæron heofenæs iopenode, ðæt iseah
Iohannes, þe hine fullode, & Lucas tealde þanon, swa swa we sædon
ær, upweard to Adame seofen & hundseofentig mægða.
 85. Nu næs nan mægð forlæten æfre from men to
oðrum; ne nan synna þæt ne sceal beon forgifen.
 86. Forþan ðe on ðam fulluhte beoð alle synna forgifenæ,
ðanon þe Lucas tealde þa mægracan upweard.
 88. Ða ða ðe Hælend wolde her on life beon acenned on
þare seofan mægðe & ðare hundseofenteoðan mægðe, & bead
syððan Petrum þæt he swa oft forgife, ðæt he geswutelode þæt
alle synna sceolen beon a forgifene be ðam ylcæ tele.
 91. Git þær is oðer tacnuncg alswa deop swa ðis.
 92. Godes lage wæs isett þurh hine sylfne, iwriten on twam
stænene weaxbræden mid tyn ealicum wordum, þæt is <foreign>Decalogus</foreign>
icwæden on Leden, ða he bitæhte Moysen on ðam munte Synay his folce
to steore, & forð swa us alle.
 95. Nu is þæt tynfealde getel on ðam tyn ðusendæ, swa
fela ðusend pundæ sceolde þe ðægen þam kynge; & hundteontig
penegæ bið tyn siðes tene, swa mycel sceolde þe mon þam þegene bi
þam ylce getæle be þam tyn bebodum þe God sylf sette his monnum to
steore.
 99. On ðam tenfealde getæle bið Godes lage ifylled; & on
endlyfænfealde bið þeo forgeagednysse þæt mon Godes lage
tobræce mid forgægednysse & synna gefræmme on his gesetnysse.
 102. Forþyg weron itealde on þam Godes itælde, þe Moyses
wrohte on þam wæstene, þa alles endlyfæn wæbb betwyx þam oðrum
webbum.
 104. Þa endlyfæn wæron hærene for ðare dæþbote
and for þare andetnysse mid bireowsunge, þe ðe mon don sceal, þe Godes
lage tobræcð; & he sceal mid stiðnysse his synne gebeten.
 107. Nu forgeaf þe kyng, swa swa ðis godspel cwæð ær,
alne þone mycele gylt mildelice þam þegene, ðeah þe he wurðe
nære; ac he nolde forgifæn his agenum iferæn ðæt ðæt he him
sceolde mycele læsse gesceat þonne him sylfum wæs forgifen.
 110. He nolde getyðian ðæt ðæt him wæs ityðod,
& he wearð þa bitæht to tintregienne þam stiðum witnerum, þe
hine witniæn sceolden oððet he forgylde alne þone sceat.
 113. Nu sægð us þis godspel þæt þe Hælend þa
sæde, All swa deþ to soðan min heofenlice Fæder eow, gif ge ne
forgifæð eowrum gebroðren, ælc an of his heortæn, ðæt
þæt he agylte wið hine.
 116. Johannes þe apostol, ðe wæs eac godspællere, awrat
on his pistole ðissum wordum cwæðende, <foreign>Si dixerimus quia peccatum non
habemus ipsi nos seducimus & ueritas in nobis non est & cetera</foreign>, Gif we
sylfe sæcgæð þæt we synnan næbbæð, we bipæceð us
sylfum & soðfestnysse ne bið on us.
 120. Gif we ðonne andetteð ure synnæn geornlice, God bið
us itreowe, & eac swiðe rihtwis, & forgyfæð us ure synnæn
þurh his soðæ lufe, and eac us afeormæð fram unrihtwisnesse.
 123. We sceolon forgyfæn ðam ðe wið us agyltæð, swa
swa ðe Hælend sæde, be ðam ðe ge sylfe herdon, of inneweardre
heortæ þæt he us mildsige.
 125. Ac ne cwæð þu na mid wordum þæt þu wylle
mildsiæn, & ælcige swaðeah wiðinnæn ðinre heortan; for þan
ðe God isihð þin ingehyd swytellice, þeah ðe men nyten hwæt ðu
on mode bihydest.
 128. God cwæð eft nu to þe, Ic forgife nu ærest þe;
forgif þu hure syððan; & gif ðu swa ne dest on eornost, ic wulle
habban eft æt þe þæt þæt ic ðe ær forgeaf; ðis is to
understandenne mid inneweardre heortan.
 131. Ac Augustinus us sægð ðæt mon steoræn sceal his
agene childum mid æge & mid lufe, hwilon mid wordum, hwilon mid
swingelum, gif he ælles ne mæg heoræ dysig alecgæn.
 134. Ðæt bið yfel geðyld þæt ðu iðafige þinum
bearne/ þæt he on fræcednesse fare mid his dysige, and þu locige on
hwylce þe licie; þenne bið þeo lufe him al to hatungæ awend, gif
þu nelt his gehælpæn & him steoræn on ær.
 137. Ðam stuntum monne mon sceal steoræn æfre butæn
ælcere hatunge, & hine rihtlæcen; ða ðe styræn sceolon na to
stiðlice swa ðeah, ac swa swa milde fæder, mid mildheortnysse æfre,
þæt þe mon beo irihtlæht, na mid ræðnesse fordon.
 141. All swa ðe læce deþ ðe læcnæð þene mon,
þe pinæð on ða wundæ ðæt heo wurðæ ihæled.
 142. Forþan ðe ðe mon losæð þe ligeð yfele
forwundod, gif þe læce him aræð & nyle mid stiðnesse þa wunde
hælen mid þam ðe his creft tæcæð.
 144. Nu beoð sume gultæs, swa swa us sæcgæð bec, ðe
mon digollice sceal mid gesceade betan, & sume openlice þæt oðre
beon isteoredæ.
 146. Gif ðe gylt beo digle, bet þu hine digollice, and ne
mælde þu nateshwon hine oðrum monnum; and gif openlice agulte, bed þu
hine openlice.
 148. Ðu þe styran scealt, þæt he seolf beo irihtlæht,
& oðre beon istyrede, ðe þa steor ihyræð.
 150. Þus tæcæð us þæt godspel and þe Godes
apostol.
 151. Ðe ðe monhatæ bið, ne mæg he wæl styræn;
forþan ðe þa halga weræs ðe weron iu lareowæs beoð nu iherode
ðurh heoræ liðnysse; ant God sylf is liðe ant mid liðnysse us
steoræð; and lufæð mildheortnysse ant ða he tæhte us.
 154. Beo him a a wurðmynt and wuldor, Amen, Amen.

END_TEXT

ÆHomM 8 (Ass 3)
B1.5.8.
Homily for the Nativity of the Blessed Virgin Mary: Assmann 1889, 24-48.



 1. Men ða leofostan, we synd gemyngode þurh ðyses dæges
wurðmynt, þe we wurðiað to lofe þære eadigan Marian, eow nu to
secgenne sum ðing be hyre, beþam ðe us to onhagað.
 5. Ac we nellað secgan be þære gesetnysse of ðam gedwylde,
þe gedwolmen setton be hyre acennednysse, forðan þe hyt tocwædon þa
wisan lareowas, and be hyre forðsiðe, þe ða halgan boceras forbudon to
secgenne.
 10. Ioachim wæs gehaten hyre halga fæder and Anna hyre modor,
under Moyses lage ælice lybbende on eallre eawfæstnysse, swa swa se
mæra æsyllend Moyses bebead on his ælicum bocum æfter godes dihte.
 15. Him geuðe þa god, þe ealle ðing gediht, þæt hi
þæt bearn begeaton, þe abær urne hælend, Marian þa eadigan of
Abrahames cynne and of Iudan mægðe, þæs mæran cynecynnes, Davides
ofspringes, us eallum to hæle.
 20. And heo wearð acenned, þæt heo com to mannum on ðysum
andweardan dæge ures drihtnes modor on his menniscnysse, þe he us mid
alysde.
 23. And eac his godcundnyss wæs on þære menniscnysse to
anum soðan Criste of hyre acenned, æfre unbegunnen on ðære
godcundnysse, þeah ðe his menniscnyss of Marian ongunne þurh hyne sylfne
gesceapen, se ðe gesceop his modor, þæt heo hyne gebære butan weres
gemanan.
 29. Nu is ðes dæg gehalgod hyre to wurðmynte on eallum
cristendome for hyre acennednysse, swa swa heo com to mannum for hyre micclum
geðingðum.
 32. And we on halgum lofsangum hyre mærða cyðað, þæt
heo us þingige to hyre agenum suna, þæt he us miltsige for ðære
mærsunge, þe we hyre gedoð him eac to lofe.
 36. Oðra halgena tid and heora freolsdagas we habbað on gemynde
mid urum lofsangum on ðam dagum, þe hi forðferdon oððe for gode
ofslagene and swa gesiðodon gesælige to Criste, of heora geswincum to
orsorhnysse, fram deofles ehtnyssum to þam ecum wuldre, fram eallum
costnungum to ealre glædnysse.
 43. Ac we ne healdað nateshwon nanes halgan acennednysse on urum
gemynde, hu hi to mannum comon, buton Cristes anes and his clænan meder and
þæs halgan Iohannes, þe hine gefullode.
 47. Heora gebyrdtida beoð on bocum gesette for ðam micclum
mærðum mancynnes alysednysse.
 49. Nu wylle we eow secgan sum ðing eow to lare for ðises
dæges mærðe, þe eow mage to trymminge, gif ge þa halgan lare
gehyran wyllað and hyre deopnysse on diglum andgite underniman wyllað on
incundre heortan.
 54. <foreign>Incipit De Sancta Virginitate</foreign>.
 55. Se halga hælend Crist and se heofenlica æþeling of his
ælmihtigan fæder wæs æfre acenned butan ælcere meder on
ðære micclan godcundnysse.
 57. And he is se eca wisdom of þam wisan fæder, þurh þone
he gesceop ealle gesceafta, ge ða gesewenlican, ge þa ungesewenlican.
 60. Se ylca hælend syððan on þære syxtan ylde þyssere
worulde wearð to men geboren of Marian þam mædene for mancynnes
alysednysse butan eorðlican fæder on Bethleem byrig, soð man and soð
god gesewenlic mid mannum.
 65. He gebohte eall mancynn mid his agenum life, forþan ðe we
wæron forwyrhte to helle.
 67. Ac us alysde se hælend mid his halgum blode of þam ecan
þeowte þæs ealdan deofles.
 69. He geceas þa him sylfum, swa swa us secgað bec, þa halgan
gelaðunge him sylfum to bryde, þæt is eall godes folc, þe on god nu
gelyfð mid soðum geleafan, ge læwede ge gehadode, ge wæpmen ge
wimmen, cnihtas and mædenu: ealle hi synd gehatene on halgum bocum godes
sylfes gelaþung, forðan ðe we synd gelaðode þurh þone leofan
hælend to his heofonlican rice þurh his halwendan tocyme.
 77. Be þam sang se sealmwyrhta þisum wordum secgende: <foreign>In sole
posuit tabernaculum suum, et cetera</foreign>, He gesette on ðære sunnan his
scinende geteld, and he sylf forðstop syððan witodlice, swa swa ænlic
brydguma of his brydbedde.
 83. Iohannes, se fulluhtere, be þam ylcan cwæþ: <foreign>Qui habet
sponsam, sponsus est</foreign>, Se ðe hæfð bryde, he is se brydguma.
 86. On þære halgan bec, þe hatte Apocalipsis, is oft
geswutelod, þæt se soða hælend is se gastlica brydguma godes
gelaðunge, þurh ða he gestrynð þurh staðolfæstne geleafan on
þam halgan fulluhte and on his cyrcan þa gastlican cild, þe to gode
becumað, gif hi heora fulluht forðhealdað on ðeawum.
 93. Ðurh þone halgan geleafan heo is him beweddod ure ealra
modor, and heo is mæden swa þeah, æfre ungewemmed, þonne heo æfre
þurhwunað on godes geleafan and nele abugan to nanum hæðenscipe fram
þæs hælendes geleafan, fram hyre brydguman to bysmorfullum deofolgylde,
ne to wiccecræfte, ne to wiglungum, mid nanum gedwylde fram hyre drihtne
ahwar.
 101. Heo is an culfre gecweden on bocum for ðære bylewitnysse
þæs beorhtan geleafan, þe ða Cristenan men for Cristes lufe
healdaþ.
 104. And heo is cwen gehaten swa swa Cristes agen bryd.
 105. Be þam sang se witega þisum wordum cweðende: <foreign>Adstitit
regina a dextris tuis, et cetera</foreign>, Seo cwen stent soðlice on ðinre
swyþran hand on ofergyldum reafe.
 108. Þæt synd þa godan weorc, ænlice embscryd eall mid
fahnyssum, þæt syndon hyre mihta and menigfealde geearnunga, þe seo
halige gelaðung habban sceal for gode on manegum godum mannum, þe heo gode
acenð þurh soðne geleafan symle on clænnysse on gastlicere
acennednysse binnan godes cyrcan.
 115. And ealle godes cyrcan synd to anre getealde, and seo is seo
gelaðung, þe we embe sprecað.
 117. Seo asent hyre cild to þam soðan life of þyssere
earfoðnysse, þe we on wuniað, of þisum sceortan life up to þam ecan,
þær þær hi æfre wuniað on ðære ecan gelaðunge.
 121. Nu syndon ealle cristene men anum naman gehatene, ge weras, ge
wif and ða unwittigan cild, seo halige gelaðung, þe gelyfð nu on god.
 124. And heo is mæden gehaten for þam micclan geleafan and for
þam soðan truwan, þe heo symle hæfð to gode, þæt heo nele
forlætan godes geleafan næfre, ne oðerne wer wolice geceosan, ac hylt
þone sinscipe þæs soðan hælendes on gastlicum þeawum and on
gastlicum bearnteame, on clænnysse wunigende swa swa Cristes bryd.
 131. Þeah ðe sume habbon æfter godes gesetnysse woruldlicne
sinscipe, wunigende ætgædere for bearnes gestreone, ac hi beoð swa
ðeah on godes gelaðunge on gastlicum andgite Cristes agene limu, gif hi
lybbað rihtlice.
 136. Be þam cwæð Paulus eac to eallum geleaffullum:
<foreign>Desponsavi vos uni viro, virginem castan exhibere Christo</foreign> Ic beweddode eow
anum clænum were, þæt ge an clæne mæden gearcion Criste.
 141. Her ge gehyrað, hu he het eall folc, þæt is seo
gelaðung, ðe on god gelyfð, an clæne mæden, Cristes sylfes bryd, na
on galnysse, ac on gastlicere clænnysse.
 145. And se apostol beweddode witodlice þæt mæden þam
hælende Criste þurh ðone halgan geleafan, þa ða he him geleafan
tæhte, hu hi gelyfdon on god, and he hi gefullode mid þam fæstan wedde,
þæt hi þurhwunedon swa þurh his wissunge.
 150. And we synd gewissode þurh his gewritu git, forðan ðe
his lar becom to eallum lareowum, and he is gehaten ealra þeoda lareow.
 153. Nu syndon ða men swiðe wurðfulle, ðe on mægðhade
wuniað sylfwilles for gode, þe healdað on lichaman, þæt þæt
eall seo gelaðung þurh geleafan hylt.
 156. And heo swa geefenlæcð hire weres meder, þe wunede on
mægðhade and Crist þeah gebær on hyre clænan bosme.
 159. Swa is eac seo gelaðung þurh geleafan mæden and on
gastlicere cenninge acenð dæghwamlice micelne bearnteam on eallum
middanearde.
 162. Maria acende Crist lichamlice, ure ealra heafod, and seo
halige gelaðung acenð gastlice Cristes limu oð ðis.
 165. On ægþrum is mægðhad and eac swylce bearnteam, and
se bearnteam ne wanode, ne ne awyrde þone mægðhad naþor ne on Marian,
ne on godes gelaðunge.
 168. Seo gelaðung is halig on lichaman and on gaste, ac heo nis
na eall mæden swa þeah on lichaman, ac heo is swa þeah mæden
soðlice on gaste, and heo is eall halig for þam halgan geleafan, and heo is
swiðor halig on þam halgum mannum, þe on mægðhade wuniað on
lichaman and on gaste.
 174. On Cristes bec is awriten, þæt his modor com him to and
his siblingas.
 175. Þa sæde him man þæt, þæt hi ðær ute stodon
and in ne mihton to him for þære micclan menigu, þe him ða mid
wæs.
 178. Ac he andwyrde sona þam secgendum þus: La, hwa is min
modor oððe hwa synd mine gebroðru?
 180. He astrehte þa his hand ofer his apostolas, ðus him
secgende: Her synd mine gebroðru and eac min modor and ælc ðæra þe
wyrcð mines fæder willan, þe wunað on heofonum, se bið min broþor
and swustor and modor.
 185. Eadig is Maria, þæt heo his modor is, ac heo is eadigere
þurh his geleafan, þæt heo on hine gelyfð, þæs lyfigendan godes
sunu, and heo hine on mode hæfð, þone þe heo to men gebær.
 189. Heo behet gode hyre mægðhad æt fruman, þæt heo
lybban wolde hyre lif on mægðhade sylfwilles for gode, na for neadunge.
 192. God sende hyre ða to Gabrihel his heahengel, þæt he
hyre cydde Cristes acennednysse þurh hyre innoð, and heo him andwyrde
þus: Hu mæg ðis gewurðan, þonne ic weres ne bruce?
 196. And heo mid þysum wordum witodlice cydde, þæt heo
hæfde behaten hyre mægðhad gode.
 198. God mihte hi hatan, þæt heo heolde hyre mægþhad to
swilcere acennednysse, ac wæs swa þeah hyre willa mærlicor, þæt
heo wolde hyre sylf hyre mægðhad behatan þam heofonlican gode,
ærðan þe heo wiste, hwæne heo acennan sceolde, and wæs gode
gehalgod be hyre agenum cyre, na swylce geneadod mid nanre hæse, eallum
mædenum to bysne, þe on mode geceosað, þæt hi for Cristes lufon on
clænnysse þurhwunian.
 206. Ne magon oðre mædenu on heora mode ceorian, hwi hi moddru
næron and eac swylce mædenu, forðan ðe Maria sceolde swylcne
wurðmynt habban, þæt heo modor wære on clænum mægþhade,
þonne heo þone acende, þe næfde him gelicne.
 212. And se ylca is ealra mædena wurðmynt, þe hine lufiað
gehealdenre clænnysse, and hi magon beon Cristes moddru eac, gif hi wyrcað
on life his fæder willan.
 216. Eall Cristes gelaðung is Cristes modor, forðan ðe heo
acenð Cristes sylfes limu þurh ða halgan gife on ðam halgan fulluhte.
 219. And Maria is his modor lichamlice and gastlice his swustor and
soðlice his modor.
 221. And heo is ana for ði modor and mæden, modor lichamlice
and modor gastlice, lichamlice heo ana and gastlice gemænelice.
 224. Se mægðhad is gemæne ægþrum, cnihtum and
mædenum, þe clænlice lybbað æfre fram cildhade oð ende heora
lifes for Cristes lufon, swa swa þa clænan munecas doð and ða
clænan mynecena on mynstrum gehwær wide geond þas woruld, swa swa hit
awriten is on <foreign>Vitas Patrum</foreign> and on fela bocum be manegum þusendum on
mynstrum and on westenum.
 232. Se mægðhad sceal þurh ðæs modes godnysse gode beon
geoffrod be his agenum cyre, þæt seo lac beo leofre þam lyfigendan
hælende, þe him bið behaten þurh halige drohtnunge and him wel
gelæst þurh his lifes clænnysse, þonne he wære, gif he unðances
wære.
 238. Ne magon na ealle men beon anes modes, ne anre geearnunge
ætforan þam ælmihtigan, swa swa Paulus sæde, ealra þeoda lareow:
Anra gehwylc hæfð syndrige gife of gode, sume þas gife, sume oðre
gife.
 243. Ac se ðe æne behæt þam hælende his clænnysse
and ðæt syðþan awægð, he bið scyldig wið god þæs
clænan behates, þe he gode behet, forðan ðe god ne bið næfre
bepæht.
 247. Gif gehadod mæden hi sylfe forligð, heo mæg to gode
gecyrran mid soðre dædbote, ac heo ne wyrð næfre eft syððan
mæden, ne heo næfð þone wurðmynt þæs hundfealdan wæstmes,
mæg swa þeah ætwindan þam hellicum witum mid soðre behreowsunge and
geswicennysse.
 253. Ða ðe on sinscipe wuniað and embe þæt hogiað,
þæt hi heora bearnteam gebringon to Criste þurh þæt halige fulluht
and ðone halgan geleafan, þa moton geoffrian heora cild gode to þære
clænnysse and Cristes þeowdome, swa swa Abraham dyde, se ealda
heahfæder, þe geoffrode gode Isaac his sunu, and þæt wif Anna, ðe
geoffrode Samuhel, and fela oðre men, ðe we ne magon namian.
 262. And ða bearn sceolon beon gode gehyrsume to þan ðe heora
magas hi gemynton and beheton.
 264. Sume men wyllað wolice betæcan heora laðostan cild to
godes lareowdome.
 266. Ac hi ne geefenlæcað na Abrahame þam heahfædere,
þe his leofran sunu to lace geoffrode gode ælmihtigum uppan his weofode,
ne eac hi ne geefenlæcað Annan þam wife, þe hyre yldestan sunu, swa
swa heo ær behet, gode betæhte to his ðenungum.
 272. Gode man sceal don mid glædnysse æfre þa betstan
behat, swa swa se witega bebead, Malachias gefyrn under Moyses lage:
<foreign>Maledictus dolosus, qui immolat debile domino, et cetera</foreign>, Awyrged bið se
facenfulla, se wyle gode geoffrian wanhal oððe blind oððe witodlice
healt, and hæfð him æt ham þa halan him sylf.
 279. Eall swa be mæssereafe, þe sume menn maciað of heora
ealdum claðum, þe beoð eal on swate, þonne god sylf bebead soðlice
Moysen, þæt he niwe gyrlan, þe ær to note næron, gesceope to reafe
þam sacerde Aaron.
 284. Gif hwa wyle wyrcan weofodsceatas gode oððe oðre reaf of
his ealdum claðum, gesylle þa ealdan and geceapige niwe, þæt hi to
huxlice to his lacum ne beon.
 289. Micel geoffrað gode, þe hine sylfne geoffrað.
 290. Þæt synd ða mæstan lac, þe man mæg geoffrian,
þæt he holocaustum beo, þæt is eall godes lac, swa swa þa clænan
doð, þe dæghwamlice campiað wið ða ungesewenlican and ða
swicolan fynd and wið unlustas, gelærede ðurh Crist.
 294. Hi beoð Cristes martyras þurh ða munuclican drohtnunge,
na æne gemartirode, ac oft digollice, swa swa Hieronimus, se wisa trahtnere,
be swylcum mannum awrat on sumum sealmtrahte.
 298. Þa ðe on sinscipe beoð and on asettum timan hi to gode
gebiddað, swa swa se apostol bebead, hi bringað sume lac þam leofan
drihtne, ac hi ne beoð na eallunga his holocaustum, þæt is eall his lac,
ac heora ælmyssan sceolon hi fram gyltum aþwean, swa swa godes witega
cwæþ: Swa swa wæter adwæsct witodlice þæt fyr, swa adwæscð
seo ælmysse ure synna fram us.
 306. Nu cweþað sume men, hwi god gescyppan wylle of þam
dyrnum forligrum ænig lybbende cild, þonne nan cild ne bið buton þa
ðe god gescypð on sawle and on lichaman, swa swa he gesceop Adam.
 310. Ic acsige þone man nu anes þinges: Gif hwa forstelð
hwæte and þæt forstolene sæwð, hwæt ah þæt corn geweald,
þæt hit wearp se sædere mid unclænre handa on ða clænan moldan,
oððe hwi sceolde seo eorðe hyre wæstmas ofteon þam unscyldigum
sæde for ðam scyldigan sædere, þonne god wyrcð oft micel to gode of
manna unrædum þurh his micclan godnysse, swa swa on bocum stent fela bysna
be þam?
 319. And ælc sawul bið gesceapen þurh god and ælces
mannes lichama, þe on life bið cucu, and se ðe elles gelyfð, he
gelyfð gedwylde.
 322. Nu ne sceolon þa mædenu heora moddru forseon, of ðam
ðe hi comon, þeah ðe hi clæne beon on mægðhade lybbende and heora
moddru beon wif, forðan ðe þa heahfæderas halige wæron and heora
wif herigendlice on halgum gewritum, sidefulle on ðeawum and syferlice
lybbende, and on godes bletsunge bearn strynende, swa swa wæs Abraham and
his gebedda Sarra.
 330. Seo wæs untymende oð ðæt hundnigonteoþe gear, and
god him þa behet, þæt hi habban sceoldon sunu, Isaac gehaten.
 332. And se wæs gebletsod þurh þone soðan god swiðe
gesæliglice.
 334. Eft Isaaces wif, Rebecca gehaten, wæs untymende twentig
wintra mid hyre gebeddan.
 336. Þa bæd Isaac þone ælmihtigan god, þæt he him
bearn forgeafe.
 338. And his wif syððan wearð mid getwysan, Esau and Iacob,
and heo geswac ða teames.
 340. Hit wæs wundorlic ðing, þæt god wolde behatan þurh
þone Isaac us eallum bletsunge and ðurh his ofspring eallum mancynne
hæle.
 343. And his wif swa ðeah wæs swa untymende, oð ðæt
Isaac abæd hyre bearnteames.
 345. On þam geswutelode god, þæt we sceolon biddan his
mildheortnysse æfre to his agenum bebodum, þæt we hi gefyllan magon
þurh his agenne fultum, forðan ðe we butan him naht to gode ne gedoð.
 349. Eall swa Iacobes wif, Rachel geciged, twentig wintra wunode
mid hyre were fullice, ærðan ðe heo cild hæfde, and hyre syððan
forgeaf se ælmihtiga scyppend hyre sunu Iosep and syðþan Beniamin, swa
swa bec secgað.
 354. Helchana se ealda and Anna his wif wæron butan cilde, oð
ðæt heo abæd æt gode mid agotenum tearum godes willan to þam,
þæt heo sunu hæfde, and heo sona wæs tiðu and acende Samuhel,
þone soðfæstan witegan and betæhte hine gode to his þenungum
æfre.
 360. Eac on þære niwan æ on anginne godspelles Zacharias
leofode lange mid his wife, Elisabeth genamod, eall swa butan cilde.
 363. Ac hi gestryndon on ylde, swa swa se engel him cydde, Iohannem
þone fulluhtere, þe gefullode þone hælend.
 365. Se wæs swa haliges lifes, þæt se hælend cwæþ
be him, þæt of wifa bearnum næs nan mærra man.
 367. Synd swa þeah þa wudewan, ðe wuniað on clænnysse,
to nunnan gehadode for ðæs hælendes lufon, on marum geþincðum, gif
hi gode þeowiað, and on marum geearnungum þurh heora clænnysse,
þonne þa wif beoð, þe wuniað on sinscipe.
 372. And ða mædenu beoð on maran geþingðe, þe synd
gehadode to haligre drohtnunge, þonne þa wudewan beoð; swa swa witan
secgað, þæt ða wif habbað, þe wuniað on sinscipe and heora
æwe healdað wið unhlisan æfre, þrittigfealdne wæstm, swa swa
þæt godspel segð, and ða wudewan syððan sixtigfealdne wæstm,
and þa halgan mædenu hundfealdne wæstm, swa swa þa halgan martyras
and eall swa þa munecas, þe fram cildhade symle gode þeowiað under
abbodes wissunge æfter þam regole.
 383. Hi sceolon swa ðeah, swa swa we sædon ær, habban
eadmodnysse on heora æðelum þeawum mid nanre hiwunge, ne mid higeleaste
on ðam micclum geþingðum, swa swa hi manað þæt gewrit: <foreign>Quanto
magnus es, humilia te in omnibus, et coram Deo invenies gratiam</foreign>, Swa ðu
mærra beo on micclum geþingðum, swa ðu eadmodra beo on eallum ðingum
a, and ðu gemetst gife æt þam mildheortan drihtne.
 392. God hatað æfre þa upahafenan mod, and his gast wunað,
swa swa god sylf sæde, ofer ðone eadmodan and ofer þone gedefan and ða
ðe mid ege his bebodu gefyllað.
 396. Betere bið þæt wif, þe wunað on sinscipe, gode a
gehyrsum to his halgum bebodum and eadmod on heortan, þonne heo hæfð twa
ðing untæle for gode, sinscipe and eadmodnysse on æþelum þeawum,
þonne þæt mæden beo, þe modig bið on heortan and gode ungehyrsum,
þonne heo hæfð twa ðing, clænnysse and modignysse, micel god and
micel yfel, þe ne magon beon geþwære on nanre þeawfæstnysse,
forðan ðe ælc yfel cymð of modignysse.
 406. Betere bið to hæbbenne on haligre þeawfæstnysse huru
ða læssan god mid oðrum læssum godum, þonne þa micclan god mid
micclum yfele.
 409. Swa is eac on lichaman se læssa man betere, swa swa Zacheus
wæs, mid gesundfulnysse, þonne se unhala beo and hæbbe on his wæstme
Golian mycelnysse, þæs gramlican entes.
 413. Ne bið þæt læsse god nahwar gelytlod þurh þæt
mare god on þam mægðhade, ne seo mare ne sceal modigan to swiðe ofer
ða læssan æfter godes lare, ne seo læsse ne sceal laðlice andigan
ongean þa maran.
 418. Ac mid godes ege beo ægþer underþeodd þære
boclican lare, and hæbbe heora ægþer be heora geearnungum.
 421. Ne sceolon ða clænan men, þe Criste þeowiað,
edleanes gewilnian on ðissere worulde, forðan ðe God sylf behet his
halgum ðenum, þe on clænum mægðhade him gehyrsumiað, on his
heofonlican huse, þær þær he sylf wunað, and binnan his weallum
þære wynsuman byrig ða selostan wununga toforan sunum and dohtrum and
þone ecan naman, þe næfre ne ateorað.
 429. Ac ðes miccla wurðmynt nis na ealra manna, ac swa swa God
sæde toforan sunum and dohtrum on synderlicum wurðmynte þam gesæligum
mædenum and þam clænum cnapum, swa swa we cwædon ær, þe fram
anginne æfre gode þeowiað.
 434. Sum synful wif iu, swa swa þæt godspel us segð, gesohte
Cristes fet and mid swiðlicum wope his fet aþwoh and mid hyre fexe wipode
and gelome hi cyste, licgende æt his fotum, and mid deorwyrðre sealfe hi
syððan smyrode, swa swa hit þeawlic wæs on ðære þeode.
 440. And se hælend sona hyre synna forgeaf, manega and micele,
and hyre milde ða wæs.
 442. And hit segð on þam godspelle, þæt heo hine swiðe
lufode, forðan ðe heo hæfde hyre synna forgyfennysse.
 444. Micele swiðor gedafenað þam mædenum to ðencenne,
þe on clænnysse wuniað on Cristes þeowdome, þæt hi hine lufion
mid incundre lufe and mid eallre heortan, ðe hi clæne geheold to þam
micclan wurðmynte þæs hundfealdan wæstmes and to þam ecan naman on
his agenum hirede, þær ðær he sylf wunað, swa swa þæt godspell
us segð.
 451. On godes rice beoð eac ða godan wif and ða rihtwisan
weras, þe wurðodon hine.
 453. Ac se hælend sæde, þæt on his fæder huse syndon
manega wununga.
 454. Þonne wuniað þa mædenu and ða mægðhades men on
þam mærostum wunungum and folgiað þam hælende, swa hwider swa he
gæð.
 457. Ne forlæt se hælend þa geleaffullan weras, ne ða
godan wif, þeah ðe hi gan ne magon, swa hwider swa he gæð mid his
heofonlicum þrymme and mid þam clænan werode, þe him wynsumlice
singað þone niwan lofsang, þe nan singan ne mæg buton þam clænum
anum, þe ne comon neah wife, and þam halgum mædenum, þe ðone
hælend gecuron him to brydguman to ecere blisse.
 465. Ða oðre halgan magon gehyran þone sang, þe ða
mædenu singað mid swiðlicum dreame, and hi habbað þa blisse þæs
heofonlican sanges, þeah ðe hi singan ne magon þone sang swa swa hi.
 469. And ða ðe þær singað ne swincað on þam sange,
ac mid softnysse butan geswince hi heriað mid þam sange þone hælend on
blisse, þe hi to þam wurðmynte and to ðam wuldre gebrohte, forðan
ðe mægþhad is micel godes gifu, swa swa martyrdom, ðe ðurh his mihte
becymð.
 475. Iohannes, se godspellere, on his gastlican gesihðe geseah
þisne heap healice standan mid þam halgan hælende, and heora getel
wæs anhund þusenda and feower and feowertig þusenda, þone sang
singende, swa swa we ær sædon, mid micelre myrhðe þæs mæran
dreames.
 481. Wynsum is seo wunung on þam wuldorfullum dreame swa manegra
þusenda mid micclum swege.
 483. And ða rihtwisam scinað, swa swa se hælend sæde, swa
swa seo sunne scinð mid hyre scearpan leoman on ðisum middanearde, mannum
to lihtinge.
 486. Bið swa ðeah toscead, swa swa se apostol sæde: <foreign>Stella
autem ab stella differt in claritate, et cetera</foreign>, þæra steorrena
beorhtnyss ne bið on eallum gelice.
 489. Oþer is soðlice þære sunnan beorhtnyss and oðer
þæs monan on ðisum middanearde and oðer þæra steorrena, beþam
ðe hi standað.
 492. Swa bið eac on domes dæg, þær nan ðing dyrne ne
bið, þonne þa halgan scinað, ælc be his geearnungum, æfter þam
æriste, and on þære beorhtnysse hi beoð æfre wunigende buton
ateorodnysse.
 496. Maran wurðscipe habbað þa ðe þas woruld forsawon and
þa syndrian æhta mid ealle forleton and hi sylfe geþywdon on godes
þeowdome and þær to eacan wæron wuldorfulle on mægðhade, þonne
þa habban magon, þe heoldon heora mægðhad and heora æhta ne
forleton, ac leofodon him orsorge be heora agenum dihte, be nanes ealdres
wissunge.
 503. Ne nan mægðhad ne bið witodlice herigendlic buton se
ðe for Criste þa clænnysse lufað.
 505. Nu smeagað sume menn, hwæt se pening getacnige, þe se
hlaford forgifð þam latostum wyrhtum, þe on æfnunge becomon into þam
winearde, swa wel swa þam ærostum, þe on ærnemergen comon, swa
þæt hi ealle wæron on ðære hyre gelice.
 510. Nu segð Augustinus, se æþela lareow, þe ðas
gesetnysse on leden gesette, þæt se pening bið forgifen þam wyrhtum
gelice on þam ecan life, þonne hi of deaðe arisað, þa ðe god
forestihte on frymðe þyssere worulde, and ða ðe god geclypode to þam
clænan life, and ða ðe he gerihtwisode on ðyssere worulde, and ða
ðe he gewuldorfullode to þam ecan wurðmynte, þæt hi ealle habbon
heofonan rice him gemænelice, him sylfum to mede, and wynsumne lichaman, on
to wunigenne a, unbrosnigendlicne, butan eallum wommum and butan awyrdnysse a
to worulde syððan.
 523. And þis bið him eallum æfre gemæne, þeah ðe hi
sume scinon, swa swa we ær sædon, on maran beorhtnysse for heora micclum
geearnungum.
 526. Ðas micclan geþincðu hi moton geearnian on þyssere
worulde wunigende her on life þurh ða eadignyssa þæs eahtafealdan
geteles, swa swa ure hælend þurh hine sylfne gebysnode and us ealle manode
to þam eadignyssum on his halgan godspelle, ðus secgende eallum: <foreign>Beati
pauperes spiritu, et cetera</foreign>, Eadige synd þa ðearfan, þa ðe on gaste
synd þearfan, þæt synd þa ðe habbað þone halgan willan, þæt
hi lufiað swiðor þa ungesewenlican god and ða ecan speda, þonne ða
ateorigendlican.
 537. And hi habbað þurh þæt heofonan rices myrhðe, and
hi geefenlæcað urum hælende Criste, se ðe æfre is rice and wearð
þearfa for us.
 540. <foreign>Beati mites, et cetera</foreign>, Eadige beoð þa liðan, þe on
heora lifes þeawum geefenlæcað þam hælende, þe ðus cwæð to
us eallum: Leorniað æt me, þæt ic swiðe liðe eom and eadmod on
heortan, and ge habbað syððan eowrum sawlum reste on ðam soðan life.
 546. Eadige beoð þa heofigendan, þe heora synna bewepað.
 547. And hi geefenlæcað Criste, þe com to Hierusalem and
beweop swiðe hyre toworpennysse, þæt seo burhwaru forferde for hyre
geleafleaste.
 550. Eadige beoð þa men, þe þurh modes godnysse beoð
swið ofhingrode and eac swylce ofþyrste æfter rihtwisnysse, þæt hi
rihtlice lybbon.
 553. Hi geefenlæcað Criste, þe cwæð on his godspelle:
Min mete is witodlice, þæt ic wyrce æfre mines fæder willan, se ðe
me asende.
 556. Eadige beoð þa mildheortan, þe gemildsiað oðrum.
 557. And hi geefenlæcað Criste, þe com to þam forwundodum
and his wunda gewrað and geworhte him sealfe of wine and of ele and wæh
hine syððan ham to his inne and hæfde his gymene, þæt is þes
middaneard, þe he mid his tocyme fram synnum gehælde mid his sylfes
þrowunge.
 563. Eadige synd þa clænheortan, þe on clænnysse
lybbað.
 564. Hi geefenlæcað Criste, þe ða clænnysse astealde,
and he synne ne worhte, ne nænne swicdom on life.
 566. Eadige beoð þa gesibsuman, forþan ðe hi synd godes
bearn.
 567. And hi geefenlæcað þam hælende, þe for his ehterum
gebæd his heofonlican fæder, þæt he him gemiltsode.
 569. Eadige beoð þa halgan, þe for rihtwisnysse ehtnysse
þrowiað her on ðisum life.
 571. Hi geefenlæcað Criste, þe for us þrowode and sealde
us swa bysne, þæt we him swa folgion.
 573. Ðas eahta eadignyssa synd eow mædenum to lufigenne,
þæt ge wislice lybbon and wel geþeawode beon, na to higelease, ne to
ungehealtsume, ne to biterwyrde, ne bealufulle on mode, ne nan unðeaw æfre
on eow ne rixige, ac ge habban sceolon, swa swa se hælend sæde, micele
geþincðu on eowres modes godnysse, þæt Cristes lufu æfre on eowrum
heortum wunige to godum fremmingum fulfremedra dæda, and beoð anræde,
and habbað sum eornost.
 583. Se ðe eornost hæfð, earfoðlice he sceal æfre
geðeon to ænigre geðingðe.
 585. Ure hælend cwæð iu on his halgan godspelle to his
discipulum and ðurh hi swa to us: On þam bið min fæder gewuldorfullod
soðlice, þæt ge menigfealdne wæstm and micelne forþberon on eowrum
godum dædum.
 589. Nu sceole we don swa þurh þæs hælendes fultum,
þæt we hogion georne, þæt we sume godnysse and sume gode lac of
ðyssere worulde þam hælende gebringon, forþan ðe he lufað us, gif
we lufiað hine and gif we his bebodu healdað her on life.
 595. Gewissige us se hælend to his willan a, and he us gelæde
to þam ecan life.
 597. Þam is wuldor and wurðmynt a to worulde.
 597. Amen.

END_TEXT

ÆHomM 9 (Bel 8)
B1.5.9.
On a Martyr's Day: Belfour 1909, 74-6.



 1. <foreign>UNIUS MARTIRIS AMEN Amen dico uobis nisi granum frumenti cadens
in terram mortuum fuerit ipsum solum manet & reliqua</foreign>.
 4. Soð soð, ic eow secge, Gif þæt sawene hwætene corn
feallende on eorðen ne bið fullice beægðæd, hit wunæð him
sylf/ anæ.
 5. Ant he cwæð eft þa, Gif hit soðlice beægðed bið,
hit bringæð mycele wæstm forð.
 7. Ðe þe his sawla lufæð, he forlyst heo witodlice; &
þe ðe his sawlæ hatæð on þissere weorulde, þe heald hire on
þam ecan life.
 9. Ðe ðe me ðenæð fylige he me þenne; ant þær
ðær ic me sylf beo, þer bið eac min þegn.
 10. & þe ðe me ðenaþ, him þonne arwurðað min
Fæder Almihtigæ þe ðe is on heofenum.
 11. Ðis godspel is nu isæd sceortlice on Englisc, ac we
wyllæð openian eow þæt gastlic andgit, na swa ðeah to langlice,
þæt hit eow ne laðige.
 13. Æfter weorldþingum we witon to soðan, þæt þæt
asawene corn, gif hit ne chinæð on þare moldan, & gif hit ne bið
aðyd of þam þe hit ær wæs, ðet hit na ne weaxæð, ac
wunæð him sylf anæ.
 16. Þæt clæne hwætene corn, þe Crist þa embespæc,
tacnæð hine sylfne þe sealde his lif for us; & he micelne wæstm
of moncynne aber þurh his anes deað, þe swiðe deorewurðe is; & he
bringæð þone wæstm, þæt beo we synfulle, into þe wynsume
bærne þare ecan wununge.
 20. He wæs ða dead þurh þa Iudeiscen, & he cwicede us
þe on hine lyfæð.
 21. Heo hine forluron, & we hine ilæhten.
 22. & his nomæ weaxæð wunderlice on us swa mycel
swiðor swa he mid heom is iðryht, þæt he adwæsced beo on heoræ
dwyldum.
 24. Rihtlice þæt hwætene corn, þe iclænsod is on
wæstmum & ealræ sæde fyrmest, is iset on getacnunge ures
Hælendes Cristes for his heahlice mihte.
 26. For þan þe he oferstihð alle isceaftæ.
 27. Ðe þe his sawle lufæð, he forlosæð heo witodlice;
& þe ðe his sawlæ hatæð on þissere weorulde, he healt hire
soðlice on þam ecan life.
 29. Þæt is on twa wise witolice to secgene.
 29. Gif þu wylt witodlice lif habbæn mid þam lifigendum
Hælende, ne ondræed þu ðe to swæltænne for his soðan ileafan;
& ne lufe þu þis lif, þæt ðu on leahtrum wunige & þine
sawle forleose on þe soðe life.
 32. Her is ðeo sawla iset for þisse sceorte life; & þe
ðe on þissere weorulde witodlice leofæð & on druncenesse his dagas
aspent, be ðam cwæð Paulus, ne cymæð he na to Godes rice.
 35. Iselige beoð þa ðe heora sawlæ hatiæð on
þissere weorlde, þæt heo wislice libban þæt heo þa ecan murhðe
moten habben mid Gode.
 37. Þa halige martyræs swa mycel forsægen þis andwearde
lif, þæt heom leofere wæs to swæltanne for þæs Hælendes
namen ær þam þe heo hine wiðsocen; swa swa Uincencius dyde, be þam
þe we eow sæden ær.
 40. Ðe þe me þenæð, fylige he me þenne.
 41. On monige wisum men þeniæð Criste; sume on his
ðeowdome on isette timan; sume on mæsseþenunge & on monige bedum;
sume on clænnesse for Cristes lufæn wuniæð; sume sealden heora lif
for his lufe to cwale; sume doð ælmessan heoræ Drihtene to lofe.
 44. & swa hwa swa deð his Drihtnes willan on enige wisan he
þenæð him sylfum.
 46. Ðe ðe me þenæð, fylige he me þenne.
 46. Gif we Criste ðeniæð, we sceolen him fyligen.
 47. We sceolon faran on his wegas, þæt is, on rihtwisnesse
& soðfestnessæ simle þeniæn.
 48. And þer ic beo seolf þær bið eæc men þegn.
 49. Her we magen ihyren hwæt he deð us to leane, gif we him
þeniæð on eawfestum life, & on wældedum, þæt we wuniæn
moten þær þær he sylf bið on þam soðe life on ece wuldre a to
weorulde.
 52. And þe ðe me þenæð hine, þone, arwurðæþ min
Almihtiga Fæder þe ðe is on heofenum.
 53. Mid hwylce wurðmente arwyrðæð þe Fæder þone
mon þe þenæð on þisse life his Sunu, butan mid þam wyrðmente
þæt he wuniæn mote on þam ecan life þær þær he sylf bið,
& his wuldor iseon, & þare wynsumnesse a butæn ende brucæn mid
alle his halgum?
 57. Hwa mæg æffre wilniæn mare wyrðmente, oððe hwa
durste þisses wilniæn, gif þe Almihtiga Hælend þisses ne behæte
þam ðe hine lufiæð?
 59. Ðe ðe leofað on ecnesse mid his Almihtigæ Fæder
& þam Halgan Gaste on anre godcundnesse, on ane mægenðryme, on anum
gecynde a on ecnesse.
 61. AMEN.

END_TEXT

ÆHomM 11 (Ass 4)
B1.5.11.
Homily for the Common of a Confessor: Assmann 1889, 49-64.



 1. Matheus se godspellere us sæde on ðysum godspelle, þæt
ure hælend Crist, ða ða he her on life wæs on soðre menniscnysse
betwux mannum wunigende, þæt he gewarnode his apostolas þysum wordum and
cwæþ: <foreign>Vigilate ergo, quia nescitis, qua hora dominus vester venturus
sit</foreign>, Waciað eornostlice, forþan ðe ge nyton on hwylcere tide eower
drihten cume.
 9. Wite ge þæt to soðan, þæt se hiredes ealdor wacian
wolde, gif he wiste þone timan, hwænne se ðeof come, his hus to
brecenne.
 12. And he nolde geþafian þam þeofe nateshwon, þæt he
underdulfe digellice his hus.
 14. Beoð for ði gearwe, forðan ðe ge nyton on hwylcere tide
mannes sunu cume.
 16. Hwæt wenst þu la, hwa is getreowe ðeow and snotor,
þone ðe se hlaford sette ofer his hirede, þe him do heora mete on rihtne
timan?
 19. Eadig bið se ðeowa, gif he swa deþ geornlice, þonne se
hlaford ongean cymð.
 20. Ic cweþe to soðan, þæt he hine geset ofer ealle his
god.
 22. Ðis godspell is nu gesæd sceortlice on Englisc on
anfealdum gereorde, and we eac wyllaþ þæt andgyt eow secgan on urum
gereorde mid sceortum andgyte be ure mæþe, forþan ðe we rædaþ
ðas rædinge foroft æt þæra halgena mæssan, þe we hataþ
<foreign>Confessores</foreign>, swa swa wæs ðes halga wer Ille, þe we wurðiað to
dæg mid halgum lofsangum to lofe þam hælende, þe hine gewurðode mid
heofenlicum wurðmynte.
 31. Ure hælend þa cwæþ to his halgum discipulum, and
þæt ðæt he to him cwæð, þæt he cwæþ eac to us:
Waciað eornostlice, forðan ðe ge nyton on hwylcere tide eower drihten
cume.
 35. Ge sceolon nu ærest witan, þæt twa wæccan synd: An
is þæs lichaman, oðer þæs modes.
 37. Þæs lichaman wæcce is, þonne we waciað on cyrcan
æt urum uhtsange, þonne oðre men slapaþ, and we tobrecað urne
slæp and gebiddað for eow and heriað urne drihten mid halgum lofsangum,
swa swa se witega us manað þisum wordum cweðende: <foreign>Memor fui in nocte
nominis tui, Domine, et custodivi legem tuam</foreign>, On niht ic wæs gemyndig
þines naman, drihten, and ic þine æ swa geheold.
 46. Good is þæs lichaman wæcce, þe for gode bið
gefremod, ac þæs modes wæcce is micele betere, þæt se man hogie,
hu he gehealden beo wið ðone swicolan deofol, þe hine beswican wyle mid
mislicum leahtrum and manfullum dædum, swa swa se apostol Petrus on his
pistole awrat: Beoð eow syfre on bigleofan and soðlice waciað, forþan
ðe eower wiðerwinna, þæt is se wyrsta deofol, swa swa grymettende leo
færð him onbutan, secende gehwær, hwæne he forswelge.
 56. Wiðstandaþ ðam eornostlice strange on geleafan.
 57. Lucas, se godspellere, awrat eac be þysum, þæt ure
hælend sæde on sumum his godspelle be ðyssere ylcan wæccan, þe we
embe sprecað, þæt is ðæs modes wæcce, swa swa ge magon gehyran:
<foreign>Et si venerit in secunda vigilia, et reliqua, Secunda vigilia vel tertia non
dicitur, nisi sit prima, quæ præcedat</foreign>, Gif se hlaford cymð on
þære oðre wæccan oððe on ðære þriddan, and he swa gemet
his þeowan donde, þonne beoð hi eadige.
 67. Seo forme wæcce is witodlice on cildhade, and seo oðer
wæcce is on weaxendum cnihthade, and seo þridde wæcce is on forweredre
ylde.
 70. Se ðe nolde wacian on ðære forman wæccan, swa
ðæt he on cildhade gesohte his drihten and mid godum bigengum hine
gegladode, wacie he huru on þære oðre wæccan and his mod awrecce of
middaneardlicum gedwyldum, forþan ðe he nat þone timan, ðe his drihten
cymð.
 76. Gif hwa ðonne bið, þe hine sylfne forgyt on þam twam
wæccum and wunað on his leahtrum, warnige he þonne, þæt he huru ne
forleose þa ðriddan wæccan, þæt he ne forwurðe mid ealle, ac huru
on his ylde of ðam yfelan slæpe his ærran nytennysse ardlice arise and
mid soðre gecyrrednysse gesece his drihten and on godum weorcum wunige oð
ende.
 84. Ure drihten wolde, þæt us wære bediglod se endenexta
dæg þises andweardan lifes, þæt we wacele beon on godum weorcum
symle, swylce we sceolon siðian of life on þam oðrum dæge and swa dom
underfon, beþam ðe we geearnodon ær on life.
 90. Wite ge þæt to soðan, þæt se hiredes ealdor wacian
wolde, gif he wiste þone timan, hwænne se ðeof come, his hus to
brecenne.
 93. And he nolde geþafian þam ðeofe nateshwon, þæt he
underdulfe digollice his hus.
 95. Ðæs hiredes ealdor soðlice is ure agen mod, and se dyrna
þeof, þe digollice cymð, is se gemænelica deaþ, ðe þæs mannes
lichaman mid his digelan tocyme to deaðe gebringð.
 99. Gif se hiredes ealdor wende him þæs ðeofes oððe
wiste his tocyme, he wolde him wiðstandan, forðam ðe þæt mod wolde
micclum hogian, þæt hit awoce and geworhte dædbote his swærran
synna, ærþam þe se swearta deað him to become, gif hit his cyme
wiste.
 105. Ne mæg nan man swa ðeah nahwar ætberstan þam
gemænelican deaðe, þe eallum mannum becymð, ac we sceolon wacian on
godum weorcum swa þeah, þæt we ne þurfon ondrædan us þæs
deaðes tocyme, gif we on godes bigengum beoð geendode.
 110. Beoþ for ði gearwe, forðan ðe ge nyton on hwilcere
tide mannes sunu cume.
 112. Se hælend us warnode mid þisum wordum ðus, forðan
ðe he wyle, þæt we ware beon, þæt we yfelum deaðe geendian ne
sceolon, forþan ðe þæs synfullan deað symle bið yfel and ðæs
rihtwisan deað bið deorwyrðe gode.
 117. Se hælend soðlice het hine sylfne mannes sunu foroft, swa
swa ge gehyrdon nu, forþan ðe he ana is anes mannes sunu, and he cwæþ,
ðæt we nyston, hwænne he cuman wolde, forðan ðe we nyton to nanum
gewisse, hwænne se welwillenda Crist us wile habban to him of ðyssere
yrmðe to ecere myrhðe.
 124. Hwæt wenst ðu la, hwa is getreowe þeow and snotor,
þone ðe se hlaford sette ofer his hirede, þe him do heora mete on rihtne
timan?
 127. Ælcum hlaforde gedafenaþ, ðæt he do his mannum symle
heora bigleofan on gesettum timan.
 129. Ac se hælend mænde þone gastlican mete, þa halgan
lare, ðe ge men behofiað eowrum sawlum to bigleofan, þa ge sceolon
gehyran æt eowrum lareowum, swa swa hi leorniaþ on bocum.
 133. Se getreowa þeowa and se snotera is se goda lareow on godes
gelaþunge, ðe segð ða halgan lare þam læwedum folce, swa swa þes
halga wer Ille dyde, þe we wurðiað to dæg.
 137. He dælde wislice on gewissum timan þone gastlican mete
godes hirede symle, and he manega sawla mid his lare gestrynde þam
ælmihtigan gode, þe hine nu wurðað.
 141. Þa halgan apostolas, þe ðam hælende folgodon,
wæron þa getreowan þeowan and ða fyrmestan bydelas, þe godes lare
geond þas land toseowon, swa þæt heora bodunge sweg swegde geond eall
and heora word becomon to eorþan gemærum.
 146. Eac heora æftergengan and ða æþelan <foreign>Confessores</foreign>
cyddon godes lare, oð ðæt hit com to us.
 148. Nu sceole we eac secgan ða soðan lare eow nu on urum
timan, elles we beoð gehatene yfele þeowan and unnytwyrðe.
 151. Se hælend sæde on ðisum soðan godspelle: Eadig bið
se þeowa, gif he swa deþ geornlice, þonne se hlaford ongean cymð.
 153. Ic cweþe to soðan, þæt he hine geset ofer ealle his
god.
 155. Se soða hlaford is ure leofa hælend.
 156. Se cymð to demenne eallum mancynne, and on ure geendunge he
underfehð us to him gif we swa gesælige beoð, þæt we swa doþ
geornlice, swa swa þis godspel segð.
 159. And he set us ofer his god on heofonan rice on healicum
wurðmynte, na þæt we ana habbon us ðone wurðmynt, ac swa man mare
swincð, swa man maran mede hæfð.
 163. Þa lareowas swincað swiðor þonne ða læwedan, ge
on heora þeowdome, þe hi gode þeowiað, ge on heora gehealdsumnysse,
þe hi healdan sceolon, ge on þære boclican lare, þe hi bodian sceolon,
and bið for ði mare heora med mid gode.
 168. We sceolon eow secgan and forsuwian ne durron, hu se
ælmihtiga god foroft gewrecð swiþe his forsewennysse on forscyldegodum
mannum, and hwilon eac forberð, swa swa we on bocum rædaþ, and læt
ðam yfelum fyrst, þæt hi heora yfeles geswicon and hine gladion mid
godum weorcum.
 174. Moyses swustor, ðæs mæran heretogan, wæs Maria
gehaten, swiðe mære wimman.
 176. Heo spræc ongean god and ongean Moysen.
 177. Ac ðærrihte heo wearð mid hreoflum geslagen, þæt
eal hire lic egeslice tobærst, oð ðæt Moyses eft hire earfoðlice
geþingode, swa þæt heo eft wearð on þam eahteoðan dæge hal
ðurh ðone mildheortan god, ðe mæg eal, ðæt he wile.
 182. Ozias, se cyning, wolde eac offrian æfter Moyses æ þam
ælmihtigan gode þa gewunelican lac.
 184. Ac he wæs læwede man and nam þa storcyllan and sterde
æt þam weofode.
 186. Ða gesloh hine sona se snawhwita hreofla, and he swa
hreoflig wunode, oð ðæt he wearð dead for þære dyrstignysse,
þæt he dorste onginnan þæra sacerda þenunga, þa ða he sylf
wæs læwede.
 190. Swiðe hraðe eac Iudas, þe urne drihten belæwde, aheng
hine sylfne and swa to helle gewat.
 192. Eac swilce Annanias, þe on his agenum swicode, and his wif
Saphira wurdon ofslegene ætforan þam halgan Petre for heora swicdome.
 195. Arrius wæs gehaten sum arleas mæssepreost.
 196. Se wæs se mæsta gedwola, þe wurde æfre on
mancynne.
 197. He wolde gelytlian urne lyfigendan drihten and wanian his
godcundnysse, swa þæt he wurde getwæmed fram his heofonlican fæder
on þære halgan godcundnysse.
 200. Þa com him hraðe to swiþe reðe wite, swa þæt him
wand eal ut his innoþ æt his setle, and he swa sceandlice þa sawlode
sona.
 203. Olimpius hatte eac swilce an biscop.
 204. Se wæs eac gedwola on ures drihtnes geleafan, and he
egeslice spræc embe ða halgan þrynnysse.
 206. Þa sæt he on sumum dæge swa on his bæþe,
tælende þone hælend and ða halgan þrynnysse huxlice mid wordum.
 208. Ac he wearð sona eal forbærned on þam bæþe middan
mid gesewenlicum fyre, and ne mihte þæt bæþ þæt fyr adwæscan,
þe hine forbærnde.
 212. And his wodnys wearð gewrecen swa þurh god.
 213. God wrecð hwilon hraþe, swa swa we ræddon her, on
mancynne heora mislican synna, hwilon eac lator æfter langsumum fyrste, swa
swa he dyde on Adam.
 217. Æt fruman he behet him deaþ, gif he his bebod
tobræce.
 218. Þa tobræc he his bebod, ac god abad swa þeah nigon hund
geara and þrittig geara.
 220. And Adam wearð þa dead for þam deopan gylte.
 221. Cain, se broðorslaga, þe Abel ofsloh, Adames sunu, abad
eac on life oð ða seofoþan mægðe, swa swa us secgað bec.
 224. And he syþðan underfeng his fyrnlican dæde wite on his
deaþe, swa swa he wyrðe wæs.
 226. Saul, se cyning, þe syngode ongean god and hine swa
gegremode, þæt god cwæþ be him, þæt him ofþuhte, þæt he
hine to cyninge gesette, næs na sona dead for his synnum swa þeah, ac god
him let fyrst feowertig geara.
 231. Salomon, se cyning, eac swilce syngode micclum ongean god and
macode him deofolgyld.
 233. Ac for his fæder geearnungum, þæs æðelan Davides,
god him let fyrst feowertig geara, and his cynerice wearð syððan
todæled on his suna handum, se hatte Roboam, swa ðæt him fram abeah
þæs folces micel dæl, þæt synd tyn mægða and him twa
belifon.
 239. Ða Iudeiscan syngodon swiðe ongean god, þa þa hi
acwealdon Crist, urne hælend.
 241. Ac god him let fyrst swa þeah feowertig geara, þæt hi
heora synna sceoldon behreowsian.
 243. Ac ða þa hi ne dydon nane dædbote, þa sende him god
to þone scearpan here Romaniscre leode, þe eall þæt land fordyde and
heora burga tobræc and hi bysmorlice acwealde, sume mid hungre, sume mid
heardum isene, and gelæddon þa herelafe to gehwylcum landum.
 249. Fela we mihton secgan swilcera bysena, gif hit to langsum
nære on þysum lytlan cwyde.
 251. Ac we secgaþ swa þeah: Se ðe his scyppend gremaþ,
þæt hit bið gewrecen gewislice on him, swa ær, swa lator, locahu god
wylle, buton he swa gesælig beo, þæt he hit sylf gebete his agenes
willes ær his geendunge.
 256. God gewrecð his forsewennysse, swa swa we sædon ær,
hwilon ær, hwilon lator, locahu him gewyrð.
 258. Hwilon he gewitnaþ ðæs mannes gewitleaste sona mid
styrnysse, oðrum to steore and eac þæt he to swiþe his synna ne
geeacnige and maran witu hæbbe on þære toweardan worulde.
 262. Hwilon he andbidað, swa swa we ær cwædon, for his
micclan geþylde, þæt se man gecyrre fram his synnum, gif he wile,
oððe he butan ladunge losie mid ealle, þonne he swa lange leofode
unrihtlice and on þam langan fyrste his fyrnlican dæda nolde gebetan, ne
gebugan to gode.
 269. For ði synd witan gesette and wise lareowas, þæt hi
sceolon styran stuntra manna anginne, þæt, gif se dysega him ne ondræt
his drihtnes yrre, þæt he huru hæbbe her for worulde woruldlice steore,
þæt he ne forwurðe mid ealle, gif nan steor ne gestilð his stuntnysse
on ær.
 275. Ælc ðing sceal habban sumne ege on his life, ge furðon
þa wildan deor, þe on wuda eardiaþ.
 277. We rædaþ be þære leon, ðe is swa reðe deor,
þæt ðurh hyre grymetunge, þonne heo grædig bið, þæt ða
oðre deor, þe hyre stemne gehyrað, þe mihton hire ætfleon þurh
heora fota swiftnysse, þæt hi beoð swa afyrhte, þæt hi fleon ne
durron.
 282. Ac swa þeah seo leo þone lytlan hanan hyre ondræt, gif
heo him on besyhð, and ealra swiðost, gif se hana hwit bið.
 285. Eac se micela ylp, þe ða modigan fearras mid ealle ofbeat
mid his egeslican nypele, ondræt him forþearle, gif he gesihð ane mus,
ðeah ðe seo mus ne mage his micelnysse derian.
 289. Nu habbað deor ege him betwynan, and þa wildan deor be
ures drihtnes gesetnysse syndon mannum underþeodde and hi mannum þeowiað,
ge wilde, ge tame, and we sceolon beon gode underþeodde, þe ealle þing
gesceop, se ðe ana rixað on ecnysse.
 294. Amen.

ÆHomM 12 (Brot 1)
B1.5.12.
Dedication of a Church: Brotanek 1913, 3-15.



 1. <foreign>Incipit Sermo De Dedicatione Aecclesiae</foreign>.
 1. Lucas se godspellere awrat on þære þriddan Cristes bec
þæt ure hælend Crist wæs farende to þære byrig Hierusalem,
ðaþa he mennisclice on þisum life wuniende wæs.
 4. Þa worhte he wundra be þam wege swaswa his gewuna wæs.
 6. & betwux oðrum wundrum on þam wege he gehælde ænne
blindne, forþan þe he bæd his hæle mid geleafan, & se hælend
mildheortlice, swaswa he mildheort is, hine þurh his mihte onlihte, swa
þæt se mann mihte butan lateowe þam hælende mid halre gesihþe
folgian.
 11. & he swa dyde; & þæt folc þe þis wundor geseah
swiðe herede god; Se hælend ferde þa þurh þa burh Hiericho.
 14. Þa wæs þær sum welig mann ongeanwerd þam hælende
& hys nama wæs Zacheus, Se wæs ealdor & heafod þara woruldmanna
þe openlice on unriht reafedon.
 17. He smeade þa on hys mode, hu he mihte þone hælend
geseon, forþanþe se ylca rica wæs sceort on wæstme, & ne mihte
for þære menigu þe him mid ferdon þone hælend geseon.
 21. He arn þa beforan ealra þære meniu, & ardlice astah
uppan an treow, ðe is on bocum gehaten sycomeres beam, þæt he hine
gesawe huru of þam treowe, forþanþe se hælend ferde forð be þam
wege.
 26. Hwæt þa se hælend sona swa he him to com, beseah upp
wið þæs rican, & hine hraðe het astigan niþer of þam treowe,
& he neodlice swa dyde.
 29. Þa cwæð se hælend him to, Nu to dæg me gedafenað
þæt ic to þinre dugoðe gecyrre, & þæt ic on þinum huse
hæbbe wununge mid þe; & Zacheus sona mid swiðlicre blisse hine
underfeng.
 33. Hwæt þa iudeiscean þæs wundrodon swiðe, & mid
ceorunge bemændon þæt he to swa synfullum menn wolde gebugan, oððe
his goda onbyrigean Zacheus þa on þam gebeorscipe mid bliðum mode clypode
to þam hælende þus, & mid behate gefestnode, Ic wille nu min drihten
wædlum & þearfum dælan healfe mine æhta, ealles þæs þe ic
hæbbe, & gif ic hwæne bereafode unrihtlice oð ðis, ic wylle
þæt be feower fealdum mid freondrædene forgildan.
 42. Þa cwæþ se hælend sona to Zachee þus, Nu to dæg
is gefremmed þisum hirede hæl, forþanþe he is sunu soðlice
Habrahames.
 45. Mannes bearn com to secenne, & sylf to gehælenne
þæt þe of mancynne on middan earde losode.
 47. Ðes rica Zacheus wolde þone hælend geseon ac he ne mihte
for þære meniu, ne eac þa lenge næfde.
 49. Þa arn he beforan & astah uppan þæt foresæde treo
þæt he hine geseon mihte.
 51. Se hælend eac þa geseah his godan willan, & cwæð
þæt he wolde to him gecyrran, & on his huse hine gereordian.
 53. He ne dorste þone hælend to his huse laðian, ac mid
þære gewilnunge þe he wolde hine geseon, he geearnode þæt he moste
þone ælmihtigan underfon him sylfum & his hirede to eccre bletsunge.
 57. Se hælend beseah up wið þæs rican, & he hine
geseah, forþanþe he hine geceas fram þam woroldlicum gitsungum þe he
oþ þæt on begripen wæs, & hyne mid his gife fram his
unrihtwisnessum gerihtwisode.
 61. Godes gesyhð getacnað his gecorennesse oððe his lufe,
swaswa hit awriten is, <foreign>Oculi domini super iustos, et aures eius ad preces
eorum</foreign>; Godes eagan synd ofer þa rihtwisan, & his earan beoð ahylde to
heora benum.
 65. We menn eac swylce þa þing þe we lufiað we gewilniað
to geseonne, & fram þam þe we onscuniað, we awendaþ ure gesihðe.
 68. Se hælend geseah þone welegan, forþanþe se welega
geseah hine, & Crist geceas þone þe hine geceas, & þone lufode
þe hine lufode.
 70. Þæs folces meniu þe mid þam hælende ferde hremdon
þone rican þæt he ne mihte þone hælend geseon, ærðan þe he
uppan þæt treow astah, swaswa hi geletton þone blindan þe be þam
wege sittende his hæle bæd.
 75. Hi forbudon þam blindan þæt he to þam hælende ne
clypode, ac he clypode þæs þe swiðor, oð þæt se hælend
ætstod, & his eagan onlihte.
 78. Seo meniu þe hine hremdon getacnodon þa flæsclican
lustas, þe þæs mannes mod oft hrepað, þonne he to gode gecyrran
wile; ac se þe anrædlice to gode gecyrran wile sceal oferswyþan his
ærran unþeawas, & þa uplican þing gewilnigean, swaswa Zacheus dyde
þaþa he uppan þæt treow astah.
 84. Þæt treowcynn is sicomorus gehaten; hit is on leafum &
on bogum morbeame gelic, bið swa þeah heahre on wæstme, & is mid
hospe gehaten idel ficdreow.
 87. Hit getacnaþ þa halgan rode, þe þa geleaffullan
lufiað, & þa ungeleaffullan forseoð.
 89. Mid þære halgan rode tacne we us bletsiað on Godes
naman, & we beoð wið deofles costunga gescylde, & þa
ungeleaffullan iudeiscean tælaþ þa halgan rode, swaswa idelne ficbeam.
 93. Be þam cwæþ se apostol Paulus, <foreign>Nos autem predicamus
Christum crucifixum, iudeis quidem scandalum, genitibus autem stultitiam, ipsis
uero uocatis iudeis atque gentibus Christum dei virtutem et dei sapientiam</foreign>, He
cwæþ, we bodiaþ Crist þe wæs on rode ahaggen, Nu þincþ hit
iudeiscum mannum tallic, & hæþenum hit þincþ dyslic, ac þa þe
synd geleaffulle on gode, of iudeiscre þeode & of hæþenum leodum,
þam þincð þæt crist is godes miht & godes wisdom.
 103. Zacheus is gecweden <foreign>iustificatus</foreign>, þæt is gerihtwisod,
forþanþe god hine gerihtwisode, & he getacnaþ þæt folc þe of
hæþenscipe gebeah to godes geleafan, & wæs on þam halgan fulluhte
fram eallum fyrnlicum synnum aþwogen, & fram arleasnessum gerihtwisod on
drihtnes naman ures hælendes, & on gaste ures godes.
 110. Swaswa Zacheus astah þæt treow þæt he mihte beon
geuferod, swa astigað þa geleaffullan, þonne hi clypiað mid þam
apostole paule, <foreign>Mihi autem absit gloriari nisi in cruce domini nostri ihesu
christi</foreign>, þæt is on engliscum gereorde, ne gewurþe hit la þæt ic
wuldrige, buton on þære halgan rode ures hælendes cristes.
 117. Be þam cwæþ eft se ylca þeoda lareow, <foreign>Non enim
iudicaui me scire aliquid inter uos, nisi christum ihesum et hunc crucifixum</foreign>,
þæt is on urum gereorde, Ne tealde ic þæt ic betwux eow ænig
þing cuþe, buton hælend crist, & þisne on rode ahaggenne.
 122. Ðeos is seo hergendlice eaðmodnes þæt se hælend
wolde for us þrowian, & mid his anes deaðe ealne middaneard þa þe
on hine gelyfaþ, fram þam ecean deaþe alyfan.
 125. Hit þuhte þam dysegum hæþenum þæt seo dæd
waclic wære, þæt he wolde sylfwilles on rode beon gefæstnod; ac gif
he ne sealde hyne sylfne to cwale for us, ne become ure nan næfre to þam
ecean life, ac we sceoldon a on ecnesse on þam ecum witum helle susle
cwylmian.
 131. Ne mihte naþor ne engel ne heahengel, ne heahfæder ne
witega, ne apostol, ne nan oðer halga, ne gold ne seolfor, ne nan deorwyrðe
scet fram deofles anwealde us alysan, gif ure drihten sylf of heofonum nyþer
ne astige, & us swa mildheortlice þurh his menniscnysse alysde.
 137. Se hælend cwæð to Zachee, nu to dæg me gedafenaþ
þæt ic to þinre dugoðe gecyrre, & þæt ic on þinum huse
hæbbe wununge mid þe, & Zacheus sona mid swyþlicre blisse hine
underfeng.
 141. Hine gelaþode hwilon sum iudeisc sundorhalga to his huse, ac
he hine ne underfeng na mid swilcum geleafan, swa þes Zacheus dyde.
 144. We magon eac gewislicor eow onwreon be þan.
 145. Sum iudeisc sundorhalga wæs gehaten Simon, se gelaþode
þone hælend to his gereorde, & he swa gelaðod þider com.
 147. Þa wæs þær on þære byrig Hierusalem sum synful
wif swiþlice forscyldgod on forligere, & heo þa geaxode þæt se
hælend wæs æt þæs sundorhalgan huse.
 150. & brohte þyder hyre sealfbox mid deorwyrþre sealfe,
& stod æt þæs hælendes fotum bewepende hyre synna, swa þæt
heo aþwoh his fet mid hyre tearum & mid hyre fexe adrigde & gelome
his fet cyste, & mid þære deorwyrþan sealfe gesmyrede, swa swa heora
gewuna wæs.
 157. Þa geseah se sundorhalga þæt, þe hine gelaþode
& cwæþ on his geþance þus, Gif þes lareow witiga wære,
þonne wiste he to soþan hwylc & hu synful þæt wif is, þæt
hine hrepað.
 160. Se hælend þa andwyrde his geþance þus cweðende,
Simon ic hæbbe þe sum þing to secgenne.
 163. And he cwæð, la leof lareow, sege.
 163. Se hælend cwæð him to, Twegen gafolgylderas wæron
feoh scyldige sumum massere, se an him sceolde fifhund penega & se oðer
fiftig; þa næfde heora naþor þone andfeng þæt hi him þæt
feoh forguldon, & he þa mildheortlice him bam þæt feoh forgeaf.
 169. Hwæt þincð þe nu, Simon, hwæþer heora lufode
hine swiþor.
 170. Þa andwyrde Simon & cwæð, Ic wene þæt se hine
lufode swiðor, þam þe he mare forgeaf.
 172. Him andwyrde se hælend & cwæð, Rihtlice þu
demdest.
 172. He beseah þa to þam wife & cwæð to Simone, Simon,
gesyhst þu þis wif?
 173. Ic com into þinum huse, & þu ne bude me furþon to
minum fotum wæter, & þis wif aþwoh mine fet forhtlice mid hire
tearum, & mid hire fexe drigde.
 177. Þu noldest me cyssan.
 178. & þis wif syþþan heo in com, ne geswac mine fet to
cyssanne.
 179. Þu ne smyredest min heafod mid ele, & heo smyrede mine
fet mid deorwurðre sealfe.
 181. Forþi ic secge þe þæt hyre menifealdan synna beoð
hyre forgifene, forþan þe heo swa swyþe me lufode; þam þe bið
læs synna forgifen, se lufað hwonlicor.
 184. Ða cwæþ se hælend to þam wife, þe synd þine
synna forgifene.
 185. And þa ymbsittendan sona þus cwædon, hwæt is þes
þe eac swylce synna forgifð?
 187. Se hælend cwæð þa git to þam wife, þin geleafa
þe gehælde, gang þe nu on sibbe.
 188. Ðises Simones welwillendnes næs swa fulfremed on þæs
hælendes tocyme, swaswa Zachees wæs, þæs welegan mannes.
 191. Þa iudeiscan ceorodon þaþa hi gesawon þæt he wolde
gecyrran to Zachees huse, cweþende hwi he wolde to swa synfullum men
gecyrran.
 193. Æfre hi andedon arleaslice þæt se hælend wolde þa
hæþenan þeoda him to folce geceosan, & to fulluhte gebiggan; ac se
welwillenda Crist wolde hi swa þeah habban.
 197. Zacheus þa stod on his gebeorscipe & bliþelice
cwæð to þam hælende, Ic wylle nu min drihten dælan mine æhta on
twa.
 199. & þone oþerne dæl syllan þearfum & wædlum,
& gif ic hwylcne mannan bereafode, þæt ic forgylde be feowerfealdum.
 202. Se hælend cwæð ær to sumum oðrum rican men
þaþa he hine befran hu he mihte þæt ece lif begitan, Far & beceapa
ealle þine æhta wiþ feo, & dæl þæt wyrðþearfum; þonne
hæfst þu þinne goldhord on heofenum, & cum & filig me.
 206. Swahwaswa unscyldiglice butan facne leofode ær his
gecyrrednysse, se mæg his æhta ealle þearfum dælan, gif he swa
fulfremedlice to gode gecyrran wyle; ac seþe ær facnfullice leofode, se
sceal ærest æfter godes æ forgildan swa hwæt swa he ær
unrihtlice bereafode, & syþþan þæt him to lafe bið, syllan
þæt þearfum, þonne wunað his rihtwisnys on ealra worulda worold.
 214. Þeos is seo wise stuntnys þæt man woruldþing forseo
his agen forlæte, & þa ungesewenlican gewilnige his agene lustas
oferswiðe, & Cristes fotswaðum folgie, & his agen lif gif hit neod
bið for Criste syllan.
 218. Forþig Zacehus heold healfe his æhta, þæt he mihte
his unriht be feowerfealdum gebetan, & þa gegladian þe he ær mid
swicdome geunrosode.
 221. Þa cwæð se hælend to Zachee, Nu to dæg is hæl
þisum hirede gelumpen, forþanþe he soþlice is sunu Habrahames.
 224. Seo ece hæl & þæt ece lif becom þam hiredes
ealdre Zachee & his hirede þurh þæs hælendes tocyme, forþan
þe he mid ealre heortan fram his arleasnysse gecyrde, & his yfelan
dæda mid ælmissan adilgode.
 228. Nu cwið sum man on his geþance þæt þes Zacheus
gesælig wære þurh swylcne cuman, þæt he moste þam ælmihtigan
mid his mectum þenian.
 231. Soð þæt is gesælig he wæs, ac swa þeah ne
þurfe we forþi ceorian, þæt we nabbað Crist lichamlice nu on urum
timan, swaswa hi hæfdon.
 234. Forþanþe he sylf cwæð on his godspelle, <foreign>Quamdiu
fecistis uni de his fratribus meis minimis, mihi fecistis</foreign>, þæt is on
englisc, swa lange swa ge dydon eower god anum of þisum læstum minum
gebroðrum, me sylfum ge hit dydon.
 238. Swa hwæt swa ge doð to gode hafenleasum mannum on godes
naman.
 240. Þæt ge doð gode sylfum, & he hit forgilt eow eft be
hundfealdum.
 241. Gode beoð þa þenunga þe man godes þearfum deð,
& swiðost þa þe man godes þeowum deþ.
 243. Þæt godspel cwyð þæt se welega wære Habrahames
sunu; forþan þe he geefenlæhte mid his dædum þam heahfædere
Habrahame.
 246. Be þam cwæð se þeoda lareow Paulus to þam
geleaffullum, <foreign>Si autem uos christi, ergo habrahæ semen estis</foreign>, þæt is
on englisc, gif ge soðlice synd Cristes, ðonne synd ge witodlice Habrahames
sæd.
 250. Mannes sunu com to secenne & to gehælenne þæt þe
losode.
 251. Se hælend sylf is mannes sunu anes mannes, swaswa nan
oðer man nis.
 253. He is mannes sunu on þære menniscnysse þære eadigan
Marian, seo þe is mæden & modor, & he is godes sunu on þære
godcundnysse of þam heoflican fæder acenned, æfre butan anginne, se com
on menniscnysse on þisum middan earde acenned, to þig þæt he wolde us
alysan & gehælan.
 259. We þe forlorene wæron, & us þæt ece lif forgifan
mid him sylfum, & mid eallum his halgum, gif we hit mid godum bigengum
geearnian willað.
 262. Us gedafenað þæt we beon gemyndige ures hælendes
mildheortnysse on us.
 264. & his lare to worce awendan, þe læs þe we þa
stiþan þreale gehyran, þe he sumum receleasum cwæð, <foreign>Quid autem
uocatis me domine domine, et non facitis quæ dico</foreign>, þæt is on
englisc/, to hwi hate ge me drihten drihten & ne doð þa þing þe ic
eow secge?
 269. Ælc þæra manna þe cymð to me, & mine spræce
gehyrð, & hi mid weorcum gefylð, ic geswutelige eow hwam he bið
gelic.
 272. He byð gelic þam men þe arærð him stænen botl,
& dylfð þone grundweall swyþe deopne & legð hine mid stane.
 274. Eft þonne se storm cymð him to, & þæt flod
slyhð on þa gebytlu.
 276. Þonne ætstent þæt hus fæste, forþan þe hit
wæs getimbrod on þam stane.
 277. Witodlice seþe gehyrð mine spræce, & nele hi mid
weorcum gefyllan, he bið þam men gelic þe bytlað uppan sandceosle.
 280. Þonne cymð færlice se storm & þæt flod, &
towendað þa getimbrunge grundlunga; þæt is se man þe hine sylfne
& his weorc on Criste gefæsðnað, his weorc þurhwunað a to
worulde, & beoð him sylfum ecelice gehealdene.
 284. Ealswa se man þe his hiht & his geornfulnysse on þisse
worulde gitsunge beset, his geswinc him losað, & his hus bið towend,
& he hæfð þone hearm endeleaslice.
 288. Gif we soðlice Cristene beoð, þonne ne sceal us nan
woruldgestreon beon swa inmede swa ures drihtnes lufu, forþan þe he is to
lufigenne ofer ealle þing, se þe leofað & rixað on ealra worulda
woruld AMEN.
