ÆHex
B1.5.13.
Hexameron: Crawford 1921,33-74.



 1. <foreign>Exameron Anglice</foreign> On sumum oðrum spelle we sædon hwilon
ær hu se ælmihtiga God ealle ðing gesceop binnon syx dagum and seofon
nihtum.
 4. Ac hit is swa menigfeald and swa mycel on andgite ðæt we ne
mihton secgan swa swiðe embe ðæt swa swa we woldon on ðan ærran
cwyde.
 7. Ne we gyt ne magon swa micclum eow secgan on ðam deopan
andgite swa swa hit gadafenlic wære.
 9. We wyllað ðeah eow secgan sum ðing deoplicor be Godes
weorcum on ðysum soðum gewrite ðæt ge wislicor magon witan eowerne
Scyppend mid soðum geleafan and eow sylfe oncnawan.
 13. Næs nan man on life on ðyssere langsuman worulde, ðe
ðas lare cuðe cyðan ænigum menn ærðamðe se ælmihtiga God, se
ðe ana is Scyppend, hi gecydde Moyse on ðam munte Sinai.
 17. And hine ðær lærde embe ðas deopan lare feowertig
daga onan.
 18. And he ætes ne gymde on eallum ðam fyrste, ac hine afedde
God.
 20. And he underfeng ða of Godes sylfes dihte ealle ða
deopnyssa, ðe he on fif bocum syððan afæstnode.
 23. Ða bec synd gehatene seo ealde gecyðnyss and seo ealde
æ, ðæt is open lagu, ðe God gesette Israhela folce ærðanðe
Crist come to ðyssere weorulde on menniscnysse acenned.
 27. And he cydde him sylf ðæt gastlice andgit ðære ealdan
gesetnysse his leorningcnihtum oð ðæt hit becom to us.
 30. Ðæra fif boca angin is ðysum wordum ongunnen: <foreign>In
principio creauit Deus celum et terram</foreign>; ðæt is on Englisc: God
ælmihtig gesceop ærest on anginne heofonan and eorðan.
 34. Her ge magon gehyran ðæt heofone næs na ær
ærðamðe se ælmihtiga wyrhta hi geworhte on anginne and ealne
middaneard on his mycclum cræfte.
 37. Ac he sylf wæs æfre unbegunnen scyppend se ðe swa
mihtiglice gemacode swylcne cræft.
 39. Full dysig byð se mann, and ðurh deofol beswicen, se ðe
nele gelyfan ðæt se lifigenda God æfre wære wunigende ærðamðe
he worhte gesceafta.
 42. Ac he geswutelode his mihta ðurh ða gesceafta, and wolde
ðæt ða gesceafta gesawon his mærða.
 44. And hine wurðodon a on wuldre mid him ða ðe andgyt
habbað, ðæt syndon englas and menn.
 47. On anginne gesceop se ælmihtiga fæder ðysne middaneard,
swa swa Moyses awrat, and ðæt angin is ðæs ælmihtigan Godes sunu
on gastlicum andgite, swa swa ðæt godspell us segð: <foreign>Ego principium qui
et loquor uobis</foreign>, ðis cwæð se Hælend on his halgan godspelle: Ic sylf
eom angin ðe eow to sprece.
 54. He sylf is soð anginn of ðam soðan anginne, and he is
soð wisdom of ðam wisan Fæder, and seo mycele miht ðe he mid geworhte
ða wundorlican gesceaftu.
 57. And he hi ealle geliffæste on ðam life ðe hi habbað
ðurh ðone Halgan Gast ðe gæð of ðam Fæder and of ðam Suna,
forðamðe he soðlice is heora begra lufu him bam gemæne, ælmihtig
God, anes gecyndes and anre mægenðrymnysse on anre godcundnysse.
 64. Ðis is mycel eow mannum on mode to asmeagenne, and nan man ne
mæg on ðysum middanearde fullfremedlice secgan embe ðone soðan God.
 67. Ge sceolon gehyran ðeah sum ðing be him, ðæt ge on
geleafleaste eower lif ne adreogan gif ge nan andgit embe ðæt ne cunnon,
and gif ge naht ne gehyrað embe ðone heofonlican God, se ðe on ðrim
hadum soðlice æfre rixað on anre godcundnysse, an ælmihtig scyppend.
 73. Mycel is se fæder and mycel is his Wisdom, and mycel is
heora Lufu.
 74. Loca ðu nu georne ðæt ðu swa swyðe ne dwelige
ðæt ðu gedon wylle ðone Sunu læssan ðonne his leofa Fæder is,
oððe heora begra Lufu be ðinum lytlan andgite unmihtigran gemacian wylle,
ac ðu ne miht swa ðeah ðeah ðu swa micclum dwelige, gedon ðæt
heora ænig unmihtigre beo ðonne ælmihtig God.
 81. Eall seo ealde gesetnyss ðe we ær embe spræcon and se
Hælend sylf on his halgan godspelle cyðað ða halgan ðrynnysse on
soðre annysse, ænne ælmihtigne God, æfre unbegunnenne, se ðe
næfre ne geendað.
 85. And hu wylt ðu nu furðor embe ðis smeagian, ðonne ðu
sylf ne canst embe ðe sylfne soðlice smeagian?
 88. Sege me nu soðlice miht ðu geseon ðinne hrycg oððe
ðinne henccan ðeah ðu locige underbæc oððe ðine agene sawle, hu
heo gesceapen is?
 91. Ðu scealt gelyfan on ðone lifigendan God, and na ofer
ðine mæðe motian be him, ðe læste ðu dwelige swa swa to feala
dydon ðe ofer heora andgit embe ðæt smeadon butan geleafan and forði
losodon.
 96. On ðam forman dæge ure Drihten gesceop seofonfealde weorc,
ðæt wæron ealle englas and ðæs leohtes angin and ðæt antimber
ðe he of gesceop syððan gesceafta, ða upplican heofenan and ða
nyðerlican eorðan, ealle wæterscypas and ða widgillan sæ, and
ðæt upplice lyft, eall on anum dæge.
 103. Ða englas he geworhte on wundorlicre fægernysse and on
mycelre strencðe, manega ðusenda, ealle lichamlease lybbende on gaste.
 106. Be ðam we sædon hwilon ær swutelicor on gewrite.
 107. Næs na God butan leohte ða ða he ðæt leoht
gesceop: he is him sylf leoht ðe onliht ealle ðing, ac he gesceop ðæs
dæges leoht and hit syððan geeacnode mid ðam scinendum tunglum swa swa
her æfter segð.
 111. Dæges leoht he gesceop and todræfde ða ðeostru
ðæt ða gesceaftu gesewenlice wurdon ðurh ðæs dæges lihtinge on
lenctenlicre tide; forðanðe he on lenctentid, swa swa lareowas secgað,
gesceop ðone forman dæg ðyssere worulde, ðæt is on gerimcræfte
<foreign>XV kalendas aprilis</foreign>, and syððan ða gesceafta swa swa we secgað her.
 118. Ða upplican heofonas ða englas on wuniað, he geworhte
eac ða on ðam ylcan dæge.
 120. Be ðam we singað on sumum sealme ðus: <foreign>Opera mannum
tuarum sunt celi</foreign>; ðinra handa geweorc syndon heofonas, Drihten.
 123. Eft on oðrum sealme sang se ylca witega: <foreign>Ipse dixit et
facta sunt, ipse mandauit et creata sunt</foreign>: He sylf hit gecwæð and hi
wurdon geworhte, he sylf hit bebead and hi wurdon gesceapene.
 127. Ðæt wæter and seo eorðe wæron gemengede oð
ðone ðriddan dæg: ða todyde hi God, swa swa her æfter segð on
ðyssere gesetnysse.
 130. Ðæt lyft he gesceop to ures lifes strangunge, ðurh
ðæt we orðiað and eac ða nytenu.
 132. And ure fnæst ateorað gif we ateon ne magon mid urum
orðe into us ðæt lyft and eft ut ablawan ða hwile ðe we beoð
cuce.
 135. Ðæt lyft is swa heah swa swa ða heofonlican wolcnu and
eac eal swa brad swa swa ðære eorðan bradnyss.
 137. On ðære fleoð fugelas ac heora fiðera ne mihton na
hwider hi aberan gif hi ne abære seo lyft.
 139. <foreign>Secunda die fecit Deus firmamentum</foreign>: On ðam oðrum dæge
ure Drihten geworhte ðone firmamentum ðe men hatað rodor, se belycð on
his bosme ealle eorðan bradnysse and binnan him is gelogod eal ðes
middaneard, and he æfre gæð abutan swa swa yrnende hweowol, and he
næfre ne stent stille on anum, and on anre wendinge ða hwile he æne
betyrnð gað witodlice forð feower and twentig tida, ðæt is ðonne
ealles an dæg and an niht.
 149. Ðone rodor God gehet heofon.
 150. He is wundorlice healic and wid on ymbhwyrfte: se gæð
under ðas eorðan eal swa deop swa bufan, ðeah ðe ða ungelæredan
menn ðæs gelyfan ne cunnon.
 153. And God ða todælde ðurh his drihtenlican mihte ða
nyðerlican wæteru ðe wæron under ðam rodere fram ðam upplicum
wæterum ðe wæron bufan ðam rodore.
 156. Be ðam upplicum wæterum awrat se witega ðus: <foreign>Laudate
eum celi celorum et aque que super celos sunt laudent nomen domini</foreign>: Heriað
hine heofonas ðæra heofona heofonas, and eac ða wæteru ðe bufan
heofonas synd herian hi Godes naman; ðus segð ðæt halige gewrit.
 162. Ne heriað ða wæteru mid nanum wordum God, ac ðurh
ða gesceaftu ðe he gesceop wundorlice his miht is geswutelod and he byð
swa geherod.
 165. On ðam ðriddan dæge ure Drihten gegaderode ða
sælican yða fram ðære eorðan bradnysse.
 167. Seo eorðe wæs æt fruman eall ungesewenlic,
forðamðe heo eall wæs mid yðum oferðeht, ac God hi asyndrode fram
ðam sælicum yðum on hyre agenne stede, swa swa heo stent oð ðis.
 171. Heo ne lið on nanum ðinge ac on lofte heo stynt ðurh
ðæs anes mihte ðe ealle ðing gesceop.
 173. And he ealle ðing gehylt butan geswince forðanðe his
nama is <foreign>omnipotens Deus</foreign>; ðæt is on Englis: ælmihtig God.
 176. His willa is weorc and he werig ne byð, and his mycele miht
ne mæg nahwar swincan, swa swa se witega awrat be him cweðende: <foreign>Quia in
manu eius sunt omnes fines terræ</foreign>; Forðanðe on his handa syndon ealle
ðære eorðan gemæru.
 181. Ða sæ he gelogode swa swa heo lið git wiðinnan ðe
eorðan on hyre ymbhwyrfte and ðeah ðe heo brad sy and gebyged gehu and
wundorlice deop, heo wunað eall swa ðeah on ðære eorðan bosme binnan
hyre gemærum.
 186. God sylf geseah ða ðæt hit god wæs swa and het ða
eorðan ardlice spryttan growende gærs and ða grenan wyrta mid heora
agenum sæde to menigfealdum læcecræfte.
 190. And ða wyrta sona wynsumlice greowon mid menigfealdum
blostmum mislice gebleode.
 192. God het hi eac spryttan ðurh his godcundan mihte menigfealde
treowcynn mid heora wæstmum mannum to ofætan and to oðrum neodum.
 195. And seo eorðe sona, swa swa hyre God bebead, stod mid holtum
agrowen and mid healicum cederbeamum and mid manegum wudum on hyre widgilnysse,
mid æppelbærum treowum and mid orcgeardum and mid ælcum treowcynne mid
heora agenum wæstmum.
 200. On ðam feorðan dæge ure Drihten gecwæð: Gewurðan
nu leoht, ðæt synd ða leohtan steorran on ðam heofonlican rodore,
ðæt hi todælan magon dæg fram nihte and hi beon to tacne and tida
gewyrcon dagum and gearum, and scinon on ðam rodore and onlihton ða
eorðan.
 206. God geworhte ða sona twa scinende leoht, mycele and mære,
monan and sunnan, ða sunnan on merigen to ðæs dæges lihtinge, ðone
monan on æfen mannum to lihtinge on nihtlicere tide mid getacnungum.
 211. And ealle steorran he eac ða geworhte and he hi
gefæstnode on ðam fæstan rodore ðæt hi ða eorða onlihton mid
heora mænigfealdum leoman, and ðæs dæges gymdon and eac ðære
nihte, and ðæt leoht todældon and ða ðeostru on twa.
 216. Næron nane tida on ðam gearlican getæle ærðamðe
se ælmihtiga Scyppend gesceop ða tunglan to gearlicum tidum on manegum
getacnungum on lenctenlicere emnihte swa swa lareowas secgað, on
gerimcræfte <foreign>XII kl Aprilis</foreign>.
 221. And ne beoð næfre eastron ær se dæg cume ðæt
ðæt leoht hæbbe ða ðeostru oferswiðed, ðæt is ðæt se
dæg beo lengra ðonne seo niht.
 224. Be ðam oðrum tidum cwyð ðeos ylce boc, swa swa God
sæde him sylf to Noe: Sædtima and hærfæst, sumor and winter, cyle
and hætu, dæg and niht ne geswicað næfre.
 229. Ne standað na ealle steorran on ðam steapan rodere ac hi
sume habbað synderlicne gang beneoðan ðam rodere mislice geendebyrde, and
ða ðe on ðam rodere standað tyrnað æfre abutan mid ðam bradan
rodere on ymbhwyrfte ðære eorðan, and heora nan ne fylð of ðam
fæstan rodere ða hwile ðe ðeos woruld wunað swa gehal.
 236. Eall swa gæð seo sunne and soðlice se mona abutan ðas
eorðan mid bradum ymbhwyrfte eall swa feorr beneoðan swa swa hi bufan us
gað.
 239. On ðam fiftan dæge ure Drihten gesceop of wætere anum
ealle fixas on sæ and on eauum and eall ðæt on him crypð and ða
mycelan hwalas on heora cynrynum and eac eall fugolcynn eall swa of wætere,
and forgeaf ðam fugelum flyht geond ðas lyft, and ðam fixum sund on ðam
flowendum yðum.
 246. God hi gebletsode ða ðus cweðende to ðam fixum:
Weaxað and beoð gemenigfylde and gefyllað ða sæ and eac ða fugelas
beon gemenigfylde bufan ðære eorðan; and hit gewearð ða swa.
 250. Ða fugelas soðlice ðe on flodum wuniað syndon flaxfote
be Godes foresceawunge, ðæt hi swimman magon and secan him fodan.
 253. Sume beoð langsweorede, swa swa swanas and ylfettan,
ðæt hi aræcan him magon mete be ðam grunde, and ða ðe be
flæsce lybbað syndon clyferfete and scearpe gebilode ðæt hi bitan
magon on sceortum swuran and swyftran on flihte ðæt hi gelimplice beon to
heora lifes tilungum.
 260. Nis na eall fugolcynn on Engla ðeode, ne on nanum earde ne
byð naht eaðe eall fugolcynn, forðanðe hi feala syndon, mycele on
wæstme and mislice fleoð, swa swa us bec secgað swutollice be ðam.
 265. On ðam syxtan dæge ure Drihten gecwæð: Acenne seo
eorðe nu cuce nytenu on heora cynryne and ða creopendan wyrmas and eall
deorcynn on heora cynrynum.
 269. Hwæt ða God geworhte ðurh his wunderlican mihte eall
nytencynn on heora cynrynum and ða wildan deor, ðe on wudum eardiað, eall
ðæt fiðerfote byð of ðære foresædan eorðan, and eall
wyrmcynn, ða ðe creopende beoð, and ða reðan leon, ðe her on lande
ne beoð, and ða swiftan tigres and ða syllican pardes, and ða egeslican
beran and ða ormætan ylpas, ða ðe on Engla ðeode acennede ne beoð,
and feala oðre cynn ðe ge ealle ne cunnon.
 279. Ða beoð langswyrede ðe lybbað be gærse, swa swa
olfend and assa, hors and hryðeru, headeor and rahdeor, and gehwylce oðre:
and ælc byð gelimplic to his lifes tilunge.
 284. Wulfas and leon and witodlice beran habbað strangne swuran
and sceortran be dæle and maran tuxas to heora metes tilunge.
 287. Forðamðe hi lybbað heora lif be reaflace, swa swa
gehwylce oðre deor ðe deriað ðam oðrum.
 289. Ða ylpas beoð swa mycele swylce oðre muntas and hi magon
lybban ðreo hund geara and man mæg hi wenian to wige mid cræfte swa
ðæt menn wyrcað wighus him on uppan and of ðam feohtað on heora
fyrdinge.
 295. Ðonne flihð ælc hors afæred ðurh ða ylpas, and
gif him hwa wiðstent he byð sona oftreden.
 297. Ac we nellað na swiðor nu embe ðis sprecan.
 298. On ðam ylcan dæge ure Drihten wolde mannan gewyrcan of
ðære ylcan eorðan, forðamðe on ðysum fyrste afeoll se deofol of
ðære healican heofonan mid his gegadum for his uppafednysse into helle
wite.
 302. Ure Drihten cwæð be him on his halgan godspelle: <foreign>In
ueritate non stetit quia ueritas non est in eo</foreign>; He ne wunode na on
soðfæstnysse forðamðe seo soðfæstnyss nis nateshwon on him.
 306. God hine geworhte wundorlicne and fægerne; ða sceolde he,
gif he wolde, wurðian his Scyppend mid micelre eadmodnysse, ðe hine swa
mærne gesceop.
 309. Ac he ne dyde na swa ac mid dyrstire modignysse cwæð
ðæt he wolde wyrcan his cynesetl bufan Godes tunglum ofer ðæra wolcna
heannysse on ðam norðdæle and beon Gode gelic.
 313. Ða forlet he ðone ælmihtigan, ðe is eall
soðfæstnyss, and nolde habban his hlafordscipe ac wolde beon him sylf on
his sylfes anwealde.
 317. Ða næfde he nane fæstnunge ac feoll sona adun mid
eallum ðam englum ðe æt his ræde wæron; and hi wurdon awende to
awyrigedum deoflum.
 320. Be ðam cwæð se Hælend her on ðysum life: Ic geseah
ðone sceoccan swa swa scinende liget feallende adun dreorig of heofonum;
forðamðe ahreas ungerydelice.
 324. Ða wolde God wyrcan ðurh his wundorlican mihte mannan of
eorðan, ðe mid eadmodnisse sceolde geearnian ðone ylcan stede on
ðæra engla geferrædene ðe se deofol forworhte mid his dyrstignysse.
 329. And God sylf cwæð ða swa swa us segð ðeos boc:
<foreign>Faciamus hominem ad imaginem nostram et reliqua</foreign>; ðæt is on Englisre
spræce: Uton gewyrcan mannan to ure anlicnysse and to ure gelicnysse,
ðæt he anweald hæbbe ofer eallum fixum and ofer fugolcynne and ofer
wildeorum and ofer eallum gesceafte.
 336. Her ge magon gehyran ða Halgan ðrynnysse and soðe
annysse anre godcundnysse.
 338. Uton wyrcan mannan, ðær is seo Halige ðrynnyss; to ure
anlicnysse, ðær is seo annyss: to anre anlicnysse, na to ðrim
anlicnyssum.
 341. On ðæs mannes sawle is Godes anlicnyss, forðam is se
mann selra ðonne ða sawulleasan nytenu ðe nan andgit nabbað embe heora
agenne Scyppend.
 344. God ða geworhte of ðære eorðan lame mid his halgum
handum mannan to his anlicnysse, and ableow on his ansyne liflicne blæd, and
he wearð man geworht on lybbendre sawle.
 348. God sylf ða syððan gesceop him naman Adam, and of his
anum ribbe worhte him gemacan: hyre nama wæs Eua, ure ealra modor.
 351. And God hi ða gebletsode mid ðyssere bletsunge: Wexað
and beoð gemenigfylde and gefyllað ða eorðan and habbað eow anweald
ofer ða eorðan, and ofer sæfyxum and ofer ðam fleogendum fugelum, and
ofer eallum ðam nytenum ðe styriað ofer eorðan.
 356. God gesceawode ða ealle his weorc and hi wæron swyðe
gode, and se syxta dæg wearð swa geendod.
 358. And God ða gefylde on ðam seofoðan dæge his weorc
ðe he worhte on wunderlicum dihte, and hine ða gereste and ðone dæg
gebletsode, forðanðe he on ðam seofoðan dæge geswac his weorces.
 362. Næs he na werig, ðeah ðe hit swa awriten sy, ne he mid
ealle ne geswac ða gesceafta to geedniwigenne, ac he geswac ðæs dihtes
ðæs deoplican cræftes swa ðæt he selcuðe syððan scyppan
nolde ac ða ylcan geedniwian oð ende ðysse worulde, swa swa ure Hælend
on his halgan godspelle gecwæð: <foreign>Pater meus usque modo operatur et ego
operor</foreign>, ðæt is on Englisc, Min Fæder wyrcð git oð ðisne
andweardan dæg and ic eac wyrce.
 371. Ælce geare byð orf acenned and mennisce menn to mannum
acennede ða ðe God gewyrcð swa swa he geworhte ða ærran, and he ne
scypð nane sawle buton ðam cildum anum.
 375. And ealle nytenu nabbað nane sawle.
 376. Sume menn wendon ðæt ðeos woruld wære æfre buton
ælcum anginne eall swa heo nu is, heofen and eorðe and eall gesceafta.
 379. Ac we secgað to soðan ðæt God sylf hi gesceop, and
næron nane gesceafta gif hi gesceapene næron, ne hi ne gewurdon ðurh hi
sylfe ac hi geworhte God.
 382. Ælc ðing hæfð anginn and ordfruman ðurh God, buton
se ana Scyppend ðe ealle ðing gesceop; se næfð nan anginn ne nænne
ordfruman, ac he sylf is angin and soðlice ordfruma ealra ðinga and æfre
ungeendod.
 387. Næs hit na færlic geðoht oððe unforesceawod ræd
ðæt se ælmihtiga God ðysne middaneard gesceop, ac wæs æfre
æt fruman on his ecum ræde ðæt he wolde gewyrcan ealle ðas woruld
and ealne middaneard mid his agenre mihte, him sylfum to lofe, swa swa we
geseoð nu ðæt ealle gesceafta heriað heora Scyppend butan ðam earmum
mannum ðe hine forseoð, and hine herian nellað ne hi his ne gymað
ðæt hi mid ðam ealdan deofle endeleaslice losion.
 397. Wel wyste ure Scyppend ða ða he geworhte Adam, ðone
frumsceapenan mann, ðæt he syngian wolde ðurh ðæs deofles lare, swa
swa he dyde syððan.
 400. And God wyste eac swylce hu he sylf smeade embe ða bote ða
iu, hu he hit gebetan mihte ðurh his halgan gife, ðæt he gehulpe ðam
menn, and eac his ofsprincge ðam ðe on hine gelyfað, and mid soðre lufe
hine simble wurðiað.
 405. On ælcum lichamlicum gesceafte syndon feower ðing,
eorðe and wæter, fyr and lyft.
 407. Fyr is behyd on heardum stanum; se stan cymð of eorðan and
he swæt swa ðeah, and of stancludum cumað wyllspringas.
 410. Ure lichama is eorðe and he oft ðeah swæt, and of ðam
fyre hatað, ðe him on wunað, and on ðam lyfte we lybbað ealle.
 413. Se mann wæs swa gesceapen ðæt he syngian ne ðorfte,
and he wære gesælig gif he na ne syngode and æfre undeadlic gif he his
Drihtne gehyrsumode; and gif he syngode he wære ungesælig and syððan
deadlic for ðære synne fremminge.
 418. God hine ne neadode on naðre healfe, ac let hine habban his
agenne cyre.
 420. Næs he na geworht mid nanre wohnysse, ne mid nanum synnum
gesceapen to menn, ne nane leahtras on his life næron, ac hæfde on his
anwealde eall his agen gecynd butan geswince on gesælðe lybbende, ne him
nan gesceaft næfre ne derode ða hwile ðe he gehyrsumode his Scyppende on
riht.
 427. God hi ða gebrohte binnan <foreign>Paradisum</foreign>, ðæt we hatað
on Englisc Neorxnawang: ðær wæs wynsum wunung, and hi wunodon ðær
swa hale on lichaman and hæfdon ealles geweald, ge heora hagenes sylfes on
eallum ðingum, butan eallum ðam gedrecednyssum ðe us deriað nu, and
ealre ðære myrhðe ðe ðær binnan wæs, buton anes treowes ðe
him forboden wæs ðæt hi on ðam anum bebode Gode gehyrsumodon.
 436. God cwæð to Adame: Ne ete ðu of ðam treowe; gif ðu
his onbyrgist, ðu byst sona deadlic.
 438. Næs na se deað ðurh Drihten gesceapen ne on ðam
treowe aweaxen, ac hit wæs swa ðeah ðæt gif he tobræce ðæt
litle bebod ðæt he wære syððan sona deadlic, and he næfre ne
swulte gif he swa gesælig wære ðæt he ðæt eaðelice bebod
eallunga geheolde.
 444. Wæs eac oðer treow on ælemiddan <foreign>Paradisum, lignum
uite</foreign> gehaten, ðæt is lifes treow.
 446. Of ðam sceolde Adam geetan on ende æfter his
gehyrsumnysse and habban ðæt ece lif, and ða heofonlican wununge mid
ðam halgum englum.
 449. Ða wæs ðam deofle waa on his awyrgedum mode ðæt se
mann sceolde ða myrhðe geearnian ðe he of afeoll for his upphefednysse,
and he mid micclum andan ða menn ða beswac, ðæt hi buta æton of
ðam forbodenan treowe and wæron ða deadlice and wið heora Drihten
scyldige, and hi cuðon ða ægðer ge yfel ge good.
 456. God hi ða adræfde ut of ðære wununge fram ðære
myrhðe mid micclum geswincum, and hi on yrmðe leofodon heora lif
syððan.
 459. Hi mihton ða syððan seocnysse ðrowian, and hine byton
lys and lyftene gnættas and eac swylce flean and oðre gehwylce wyrmas, and
him wæron deregendlice dracan and næddran and ða reðan deor mihton
derian his cinne, ðe hine ealle ær arwurðodon swyðe.
 465. Heora gecynd eac ða wæs eall on costnungum and him
ungewylde to rihtre wissunge.
 467. And seo galnyss weohs unwilles on him and oðre unðeawas,
ðe he ær ne cuðe, wunnon him ða on and on his cynne syððan swa
ðæt moston mid micclum geswince ða godan ðeawas, ðe God hi on
gesceop, healdan æfre syððan gif hi hi habban woldon ðæt ðæt
hi ær heoldon butan eafoðnyssum.
 474. Ðær to eacan hi swuncon and on swate leofodon and mid
earfoðnyssum him ætes tilodon on mycelre geomerunge for heora gymeleaste,
and him ða uneaðe ðæt hi ær wæron on ealre wynsumnysse and
wunodon ða on sorhge anbidigende deaðes, and eall heora ofspring.
 480. Se ælmihtiga God ða het his engla werod healdan ða gatu
æt ðam ingange into <foreign>Paradisum</foreign>, and ðam englum bebead: Behealdað
ðæt Adam ne ete of ðam treowe ðe is <foreign>lignum uite</foreign> and he libbe on
ecnysse, and him wæs swa forwyrned ðæs inganges syððan.
 486. Hearmlic him wære ðæt he wurde ða ece and eallum his
ofspringe on ðære yrmðe, ðæt we ealle sceoldon on ecnysse swa
lybban on eallum ðam costnungum ðe us becumað nu, and on eallum ðam
earfoðnyssum ðe we on libbað.
 491. Ða forwyrnde him God ðæs inganges forðig to ðam
lifes treowe, ðæt we lybban ne sceoldon swylce earmingas on ecum lichaman,
swylce we nu syndon on ðysum sorhfullum life.
 495. Wel us foresceawode se welwillenda God ðæt he on oðre
wisan ure yfel gebette and cydde his mihte and his mildheortnysse ðæt he
swa mycel yfel mihte gebetan, and he eac wolde for his welwillednysse us
earmingas alysan fram ðam ecum suslum; ðæt mihte he ana don forðamðe
he is ælmihtig God.
 502. Hit segð on ðære bec on ðyssere gesetnysse ðæt
ðær wæs ligen swurd gelogod æt ðam ingange mid ðam halgum englum
ðe heoldon ðæt geat, and ðæt ylce swurd wæs awendendlic swa
ðeah forðamðe ure Hælend Crist ðæs heofonlican Godes sunu, on
ðære syxtan ylde ðyssere worulde wearð to menn geboren of ðam
mædene Marian, and he mid his agenum deaðe ðone deofol oferwann and he
us swa alysde of his laðum ðeowdome.
 510. And he of deaðe aras on ðam ðriddan dæge and awende
ðæt swurd of ðam wæge mid ealle ðæt we inn moton gaan to ðam
upplican Paradise, to ðam lifes treowe, ðæt is se leofa Hælend ðe
ðæt ece lif forgifð ðam ðe hine lufiað and mid weorcum cyðað
ðæt hi wilniað his.
 517. Ðis is nu betre ðæt we on blissum wunion a on ecnysse
ðonne Adam ða æte of ðam lifes treowe and leofode on ecnysse, mid
eallum his cynne, swa swa we sædon ær, on eallum ðam yrmðum ðe us
on rixiað, and on eallum ðam costnungum ðe us her becumað.
 523. Nu ðingð ðam dysegan menn ðe dwollice leofað
ðæt him genoh well si on ðyssere worulde gif he lybban mot be his lustum
æfre, ac he ne understent na his agene stuntnysse, and nat ðæt his lif
is gelogod on geswincum.
 528. Ðonne him hingrað, he yt grædilice, eft ðonne him
ðyrst, he drincð gif he hæfð, ðonne him cælð, he cepð him
hlywðe, ðonne him to gange lyst, he gæð ðyder unðances, ðonne he
werig byð he wyle hine gerestan, gif he gewundod byð he wilnað
læcedomes.
 534. Nis ðys nu eall geswinc?
 534. And gyt mycele swarran ealle ða ungelimp ðe on ðysum
life becumað, ðe man earfoðlice mæg ealle areccan.
 537. Uton forðig hogian her on ðysum life ðæt we mid
geornfulnysse gewilnian æfre ðæs beteran lifes on ðære ecan blisse
mid urum Hælende Criste, swa swa he us behaten hæfð, se ðe leofað
and rixað mid his leofan Fæder and ðam Hlagan Gaste, on anre
godcundnysse, ana soð Scyppend ealra ðinga.
 543. AMEN.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

ÆHomM 14 (Ass 8)
B1.5.14.
Esther: Assmann 1889, 92-101.



 1. Iu on ealdum dagum wæs sum rice cyning namcuð on worulde,
Asuerus gehaten.
 3. And se hæfde cynerice east fram Indian oð Eþiopian lande;
þæt is fram easteweardan þissere worulde and suþweardan oð to þam
Silhearwum.
 6. Hundtwelftig scira he soðlice hæfde and seofon scira, swa
swa us secgað bec, on his anwealde ealle him gewylde.
 9. On þam þriddan geare his cynerices he het gewyrcan
wundorlice feorme hundteontig daga on an and hundeahtatig daga eallum his
ealdormannum and his eþelborenum þegnum and eallum his folce, þe þa
feorme gesohton, wolde him æteowian his welan and his mærða.
 15. Us is earfoðe to secgenne þa seltcuðan mærða on
gyldenum beddum and agrafenum fatum, gyldene and sylfrene, seltcuþe æfre,
on pellum and purpuran and ælces cynnes gymmum, on menigfealdre þenunge,
þe man þær forðbær.
 20. Se cyning bebead þam gebeorum eallum, þæt hi bliþe
wæron æt his gebeorscipe and þæt ælc mann drunce þæs
deorwurðan wines, beþam þe he sylf wolde and him softost wære, and nan
man ne moste neadian oðerne to maran drænce, þonne his mod wolde.
 26. Ac þa byrlas scencton be þæs cyninges gesetnysse
ælcum men genoh name, þæt he wolde.
 28. His cwen hatte Vasthi, seo wæs swiðe wlitig.
 29. Heo worhte eac feorme mid fulre mærðe eallum þam
wifmannum, þe heo wolde habban to hire mærþe on þam mæran palente,
þær þer se cyning wæs oftost wunigende.
 33. Se cyning þa het on þam seofoðan dæge, þa þa he
bliþe wæs betwux his gebeorum, his seofon burðenas, þæt hi sceoldon
gefeccan þa cwene Vasthi, þæt heo come to him mid hire cynehelme: swa
swa heora seodu wæs, þæt seo cwen werode cynehelm on heafode.
 39. And he wolde æteowian hire wlite his þegnum, forþan þe
heo wæs swiþe wlitig on hiwe.
 41. Þa eodon þa burðenas and abudon þære cwene þæs
cyninges hæse.
 42. Ac heo hit forsoc and nolde gehyrsumian him to his willan.
 44. Se cyning þa sona swiðe wearð geyrsod, þæt heo hine
forseah on swylcere gegaderunge, and befran his witan, þe wæron æfre
mid him on ælcum his ræde, þe he rædan wolde, and he ealle þing
dyde æfre be heora ræde hwæt him þuhte be þam, be his
forsewennysse.
 50. Þa andwyrdon sona sume his ealdormen of Medan and of Persan,
þe him mid druncon: Seo cwen witodlice, þe þin word forseah, leof, ne
unwurðode na þe ænne mid þan, ac ealle þine ealdormenn and eac
þine þegnas.
 55. Ðonne ure wif geaxiað be þisum wordum æt ham, hu seo
cwen forseah hire cynehlaford, þonne willað hi eac us eall swa forseon;
þonne beoð ealle Medas micclum forsewene and þa Pærsican leoda, swa us
na ne licað.
 60. Ac gif þe swa geþincð, leof, gesette þisne dom,
þæt ealle Medas cweðað anmodum geþeahte and eac þa Persican
leoda to þisre dæde, þæt seo cwen Vasthi ne cume næfre
heononforð into þinum pallente betwux þinum gebeorum, ac hæbbe sum
oðer wimman ealne hire wurðmynt, hire ungelicu seo, ðe þe oflicige.
 67. And se cyning Asuerus þisne ræd underfeng, and man cydde
þa geond eall þæs cyninges willan.
 69. And Vasthi geseah þa, þæt heo forsewen wæs.
 70. Hit wearþ þa gecweden þurh þæs cyninges witan,
þæt man ofaxode on eallum his rice, gif ænig mæden ahwær mihte
beon afunden swa wlitiges hiwes, þe him wurðe wære; and swilcere
gebyrde, þe his gebedda wære, and seo þænne fenge to Vasthies
wurðmynte.
 76. And se cyning þa het embe þæt beon swiðe.
 77. On þam dagum wæs an Iudeisc þegen on þære byrig
Susa, Mardocheus gehaten.
 79. Se gelyfde soðlice on þone lifigendan god æfter Moyses
æ, and he mid him hæfde his broðor dohtor, seo hatte Hester, wlitig
mædenmann on wundorlicre fægernysse.
 83. And he hi geforðode on fægerum þeawum æfter godes
æ and his ege symle and hæfde hi for dohtor, forðan þe hire dead
wæs ge fæder, ge modor, þa þa heo unmagu wæs.
 87. Seo wearð þa gebroht and besæd þam cyninge.
 88. And he hi sceawode and him sona gelicode hire fægra nebwlite
and lufode hi swiðe ofer ealle þa oðre, þe he ær gesceawode.
 91. Ac heo ne moste na for Mardocheo nateshwon hire cynn ameldian,
ne þam cyninge secgan, hwilcere mægþe hire magas wæron.
 94. Mardocheus þa folgode þam mædene to hirede and hire
gymæne hæfde holdlice symle, wolde gewitan, hu hire gelumpe.
 97. Heo wæs swiðe wlitig on wundorlicre gefægernysse and
swiþe lufigendlic eallum onlociendum and wislice geþeawod and on wæstme
cyrten.
 100. And se cyning hi genam to cwene þa and gesette þone
cynehelm on hire heafod sona, þe Vasthi ær hæfde.
 103. He het þa gearcian to heora gyftum swiðe mænigfealde
mærða, swa him mihte gerisan.
 105. And æfter heora gewunan he gewifode þa swa be his witena
ræde on heora gewitnysse and his folc gegladode and liþegode him on
mislicum geswincum for ðære mærðe.
 109. Hit gelamp þa siððan æfter litlum firste, þæt
twegen his burðena mid bealuwe afyllede woldon berædon swiðe unrihtlice
heora cynehlaford and hine acwellan and embe þæt wæron.
 113. Þa wearð hit sona cuþ þam Mardocheo, þære cwene
fæderan.
 115. And he hit þa cydde ardlice hire and heo þam cyninge
forð.
 116. And man afunde mid him swutele tacnu, þæt hi swa woldon
don, and hi sylfe sædon, þæt hi swa woldon.
 119. And man aheng hi begen on healicum gealgan.
 120. And Mardocheus þa wearð þurh þa micclan hlyde cuð
þam cyninge for ðære gecyþnysse.
 122. Hit wæs þa gewunelic swiðe wislice, þæt man
gesette on cranice ælc þæra dæda, þe gedon wæs mid him on
þæs cyninges belimpum, oððe his leode fær.
 125. Þa het he awritan, hu hine gewarnede Mardocheus se þegen,
þæt hit on geminde wære.
 127. Sum ealdorman wæs þa Aman gehaten, þone geuferode se
cyning ofer ealle his þegnas and ofer his ealdormen, and het hi ealle sittan
on cneowum to him, swa swa to þam cyninge, and hine sylfne he asætte on
heahsetle fyrmest.
 132. And ealle his men siððan him anum abugon, buton Mardocheus
for his micclum geþingþum nolde him abugan, ne gebigan his cneowu to þam
Amane for his upahafennysse, þylæs þe he gegremode god mid þære
dæde, gif he eorðlicne mann ofer his mæðe wurðode.
 138. Þa geseah Aman, þæt he hine forseah, and he hæfde
ofaxod æt oðrum mannum ær, þæt he wæs Iudeisca, þe wurðodon
symle þone heofonlican god, and him þa þuhte to waclicre dæde,
þæt he fordyde hine ænne, ac wolde miccle swiðor eall þæt
manncyn fordon Iudeisces cynnes, þæt he wræce his teonan.
 145. Aman þa smeade swicollice embe þæt, hu he eall Iudeisc
cynn fordyde ætgedere, þe godes æ heoldon æfter godes
gesetnyssum, and began hit to wregenne wið þone cyning þuss: An manncynn
wunað, leof, wide tostenced under þinum anwealde on gehwilcum scirum, þe
næfð ure þeawas, ne ure laga ne hylt.
 152. And þu wel wast, leof, þæt hit wile hearmian þinum
cynerice heora receleasnysse, gyf him man ne gestyrð heora stuntnysse.
 155. Læt hi ealle fordon and ic gedo, þæt þu hæfst tyn
þusend punda to þinum mydercum.
 157. Se cyning þa sona slypte his beah of and forgeaf Amane and
be þam mancynne cwæþ: Hafa þe þæt seolfor to þines sylfes
bricum and gedo be þam folce, swa þe best licie.
 161. Aman þa sona, swa he þis gehyrde, dihte gewritu be þam
Iudeiscum to ælcere scire, þe hi on wunodon, þæt man hi ofsloge
sæmtinges ealle, ealde and iunge, ealle on anum dæge, and him fultum
gesænde to heora slege micelne to þam ylcan andagan, þe he him
gewissode.
 168. Mardocheus þa micclum wearð geangsumod and for his agenum
magum get micele swiðor, þonne for him sylfum, and gesæde hit þære
cwene, bæd, þæt heo gehulpe hire mægðe and hire, þæt hi ealle
ne wurdon to swilcere wæfersyne.
 173. Þa bebead seo cwen, þæt hire cynn eall sceolde
fæstan þreo dagas on an and godes fultum biddan.
 175. And heo sylf eall swa eac swylce fæste, biddende æt
gode, þæt he geburge þam folce and eallum þam manncynne on swa micelre
frecednysse.
 178. Þa eode seo cwen æfter þam fæstene swiðe
fægeres hiwes ætforan þam cyninge.
 180. And he swiðe bliðe bicnode hire to mid his cynegyrde and
gecwæþ þas word: Hwæs bytst þu, la Hester, and þeah þu biddan
wille healfne þone anweald, þe ic hæbbe under me, þu scealt beon
tiþu untweolice þæs.
 185. Seo cwen cwæð þa to him: Leof cynehlaford, ic wille,
þæt þu beo æt minum gebeorscipe, þu, leof, and Aman to þinum
wurðscipe, þæt ic þe mage secgan minne willan.
 189. Þa het se cyning clypian Aman and het, þæt he wære
gehyrsum þære cwene to hire willan, to hire gereorde.
 192. And Aman þa gecyrde sona to his inne.
 193. Mardocheus þa sæt þær ute and nolde alutan, ne
lyffettan þam Amane.
 195. Þa wearð he swiþe gram þam godes þegene and
cwæþ to his cnihtum, þæt him forcuþlic þuhte, þæt se an
Iudeisca hine forsawe.
 198. Se cyning me wurðaþ, swa swa gewitaþ ealle, and seo cwen
ne gelaþode nenne oðerne to hire butan me ænne to eacan þam
cyninge.
 201. Nu þingþ me, þæt ic næbbe nænne wurðscipe on
life, swa lange swa Mardocheus me nele abugan.
 203. Þa cwædon his magas, þæt he macian sceolde ænne
heagan gealgan and habban hine gearwe and biddan æt his hlaforde, þæt
he lete ahon þone Mardocheum, þe his mihte forseah.
 207. And he þa swa dyde be heora dyslican ræde.
 208. Hit gelamp þa on þære nihte, þæt se cyning læg
wæccende lange on forannihte.
 209. And he het þa forðberan þone cranic fram his yldrena
dagum and rædan ætforan him, oð ðæt he fulge on slæpe.
 212. Man him rædde þa fela þæs þe gefyrn gelamp, oð
ðæt hit becom þærto, hu his burcnihtas woldon hine sylfne amyrran and
hu Mardocheus hit sæde þære cwene and heo cydde þa him.
 216. Þa befran se cyning his cnihtas and cwæþ: Hwylce mede
hæfde Mardocheus for þam, þæt he swa holdlice hogode embe me?
 219. His cnihtas him andwyrdon and cwædon him þus to: Leof
cynehlaford, ne com him nan þing to þance, þæt he swa getreowlice
þæt þe geopenode.
 222. Hwæt, þa on ærnemergen com Aman to þam cyninge,
wolde, þæt he hete ahon Mardocheum.
 224. Ac se cyning axode hine sona and cweð: Hwæt þingð
þe, Aman, hwæt hit mage beon, þæt ic gedon þam menn, þe ic
gemynte wurþscipes?
 227. Þa wende Aman to gewissan þinge, þæt se cyning wolde
wurþian hine swiðor and nænne oþerne, and he andwyrde þus: ðone
man, þe se cyning wile wurðian mid his gife, man sceal embscrydan hraþe
mid cynelican reafe and settan on his heafod sumne cynehelm eac and letan
hine ridan on þæs cyninges radhorse.
 234. And læde sum ealdormann hine geond þas burh and secge
þam burhmannum, þæt þus beo gewurðod se man, þe se cyning wile
wurðscipe hæbbe.
 237. Þa cwæþ se cyning to Amane: Ic cweðe, þæt ic
wille, þæt þu genime Mardocheum and þisne wurðmynt him gedo, and
loca þu georne, þæt þu ne forlæte nan þing.
 240. Aman þa dyde swa mid sorhfullum mode and gelædde
Mardocheum mærlice gescrydne and mid helme geond þa burh, swylce he his
horscniht wære, and sæde eallum mannum, þæt se cyning mihte on þa
wisan mærsian þone man, þe he wolde, and eode him ham siððan
sorhfull to his cnihtum.
 246. Se cyning þa sende sona æfter Amane and he unþances
þa com to þære cwene feorme.
 248. And se cyning Asuerus swiþe bliðe wæs þæs dæges
mid þære cwene Hester and cwæð hire þus to: Hwæs bytst þu, la
Hester, þæt ic þe forgife?
 251. Hester seo cwen þa cwæð to þam cyninge þus: Ic
bidde þe, la leof, mines agenes lifes and mines folces feores and minra
freonda eac.
 254. We synd ealle belewde to ure lifleaste, þæt we beon
toheawene mid heardum swurdum, þæt ure gemynd beo mid ealle adilegod.
 257. Se cyning þa befran þa cwene þus eft: Hwæt is se
manna and hwilcere mihte, þe þas dæda æfre dorste gefremman?
 260. Heo cwæð to andsware: Us is se wyrsta feond witodlice
þes Aman, þe hæfð gecweden andagan, þæt he sceall acwellan mine
agene mægðe for Mardochees þingon, se þe is min fædera, se þe me
afedde.
 265. Þa ablicgde Aman unbliþum andwlitan and ne mihte na acuman
þæs cyninges graman, ne he ne dorste beseon to his ansyne.
 268. And se cyning aras hraþe gehathyrt and eode him sona ut
binnon his æppeltun swilce for rædinge.
 270. Ac he hraþe sona eft eode him inn.
 271. And efne Aman þa niþer afeallen to þære cwene fotum,
þæt heo him gefultumode to his agenum feore.
 274. Þa oflicode þam cyninge, þæt he læg hire swa
gehende.
 275. And þa cnihtas oncneowon þæs cyninges micclan graman
and gefengon þone Aman and hine geblindfelledon and hine fæste geheoldon
to þam þe se cyning hete.
 278. Þa cwæð an þara burcnihta to þam cyninge þus: La
leof cynehlaford, an lang gealga stænt æt Amanes inne, þe he gemynt
hæfde Mardocheo þinum þegene, þe þe hyldo gedyde.
 282. Þa cwæð se cyning to andsware: Ahoh hine þæron.
 283. And hi sona swa dydon mid swiðlicum ofste, ahengon þone
Aman on þam healican gealgan, þe he gemynt hæfde Mardochee on ær.
 286. And þæs cyninges yrre wearð þa geliþegod.
 287. Þa cydde seo cwen eall be hire cynne hire cynehlaforde,
hwanon heo cumen wæs, and be Mardocheo, hu he hire mæg wæs.
 290. And he eode þa inn toforan þam cyninge.
 291. And se cyning him sealde sona þone beah, þe he genam of
Amane, him to wurðscipe, and he underfeng þone anweald, þe se oðer
hæfde.
 294. And he his æhta betæhte þære cwene to hæbbenne.
 295. Seo cwen þa aleat to þæs cyninges fotum mid agotenum
tearum, mid godes ege onbryrd, and bæd hire cynehlaford, þæt he lete
awritan oðre gewritu to eallum þam scirum, þe þa Iudeiscan on eardedon,
togeanes þam gewritum, þe Aman ær awrat, þæt þa Iudeiscan moston
for his micclan cynescipe beon ealle on friðe and unforhte to þam dæge,
þe Aman him gecwæþ to heora agenum slege.
 303. Se cyning þa andwyrde þære cwene þus and eac
Mardocheo swiðe mildelice: Aman ic aheng and his æhta þe betæhte.
 306. Hwa dear nu gedyrstlæcan, þæt he derige þam folce?
 307. Awritað nu gewritu, beþam þe ge willaþ, þæt eall
beo aidlod Amanes sirwung ongean þam Iudeiscum and him ne derige nan man.
 310. Ac ic swiðor wille, þæt man ofslea eac Amanes magas for
his micclan swicdome.
 312. Þis wearð þa geforþod and hi on friþe wunedon þurh
þære cwene þingunge, þe him þa geheolp and fram deaþe ahredde
þurh hire drihtnes fultum, þe heo on gelyfde on Abrahames wisan.
 316. Þa Iudeiscan eac wundorlice blissodon, þæt hi swilcne
forespræcan him afunden hæfdon, and heoldon þa godes æ þæs þe
glædlicor æfter Moyses wissunge, þæs mæran heretogan.
 320. Mardocheus eac micclum wæs gewurþod and swiðe geuferod
for his eadmodnysse, swa swa Aman wearð gehynd for his uppahefednysse.
 323. And se cyning wearð gerihtlæht þurh þære cwene
geleafan gode to wurðmynte, þe ealle þing gewylt.
 325. And he herode god, þe hine geuferode and to cyninge geceas
ofer swilcne anweald.
 327. And he wæs rihtwis and rædfæst on weorcum.
 328. And he hæfde oþerne naman Artarxerses.
 329. Sy wuldor and lof þam welwillendan gode, se þe æfre
rixað on ecnysse.
 330. Amen.

ÆHomM 15 (Ass 9)
B1.5.15.
Judith: Assmann 1889, 102-16.



 1. Leofan men, we secgað nu ærest on þisum gewritum,
þæt twegen cyningas wæron, gecweden on leden Nabochodonosor, swiðe
namcuðe begen.
 4. An wæs se Chaldeisca, þe acwealde godes folc on Iudea lande
for heora geleafleaste, þa þa hi wurðodon wolice hæþængyld and
deofolgyld beeodon heora drihtne on teonan.
 8. Ða towænde se cyning heora winsuman burh, Hierusalem
gehaten, and þæt halige templ, ðe Salomon geworhte mid wundorlicum
cræfte, and towearp hi grundlunga and þæt godes folc ofsloh and þa
herelafe to his lande adraf to Babiloniam, heora micclan byrig, and hi þær
wunedon on his wælhreowan þeowte gecnæwe heora synna wið þone
soþan god.
 16. Hundeseofontig geara hi wunedon þær on þeowte, oð
þæt Cyrus cyning hi asænde eft ongean to Iudea lande, þanon þe hi
alædde wæron, and het hi eft aræran þæt ænlice templ, swa swa
se ælmihtiga god on his mod asænde, þæt he his folce mildsode
æfter swa micelre yrmþe.
 21. Nu wæs se oþær cyning, þe wæs gehaten on leden
Nabochodonosor, on Syrian lande, þæs Cyres sunu, þe we ær
foresædon, and his tonama wæs Cambises gecweden.
 26. Hwæt, þa Cambisus gecwæð to gefeohte ongean Arfaxath,
þæra Meda cyning, and he hine ofsloh and þurh þone sige hine sylfne
ahof on swiðlicre modignysse and asende his ærendracan him on ælce
healfe to eallum þam leodscipum, þe lagon to his rice, wolde, þæt hi
ealle sceoldon him anum abugan, þæt he ana wære heora cyning.
 34. Ac ealle þa leodscipas anmodlice him wiðcwædon and
asændon his ærendracan eft sona ongean butan ælcum wurðmynte swiðe
unwurðlice.
 37. Ða gebealh se cyning Nabochodonosor hine sylfne and swor
þurh his cynestol, þæt he wolde gewrecan witodlice on him eallum,
þæt hi his ærendracan and hine sylfne forsawon.
 41. He gegaderode his witan ða and wið hi ealle rædde,
cwæð, þæt him swa þuhte, þæt he sylf wolde ealne middaneard to
his anwealde gebigean, and hi him andwyrdon, þæt he ænlice spræce.
 45. Þa sende se cyning sumne heretogan, Holofernem gehaten, mid
mycelre fyrdinge and bebead him þas word: Ne wanda þu nan ðing, ne ara
ðu nanum rice, ne ænigre burhscire, ac ælce getrymmede burh þu gebige
to me.
 50. Ða ferde Holofernis mid ormætre fyrde, swa swa se cyning
bead, and tobræc ælce burh and þa ofsloh, þe him wiðstodon, swa
þæt his ege asprang ofer ealle þeoda.
 54. Hundtwelftig þusenda wigendra manna wæron on his fyrdinge
and twelf þusenda scyttena symle him ætforan.
 56. And nan folc ne mihte his fyrde wiðstandan, ac comon him to
of fyrlenum landum, mid fyrhte fornumene, friðes biddende, cwædon,
þæt him leofre wære, þæt hi libbende þeowdon þam mæran
cyninge Nabochodonosor, ðonne hi swyltende samod forwurdon.
 62. And hi swa abugon þa þam breman heretogan mid eallum heora
æhtum to þæs cyninges anwealde.
 64. He ferde þa mid þrymme feohtende swyðe wið manega
leodscipas and heora land gewann, oð þæt þæt Iudeisce folc his fare
geaxodon, and hi swiðe forhtodon for his fyrdinge.
 68. Hi gearcodon swa þeah hi sylfe to wige on þam heagum muntum
micclum ymbtrymde and fordytton ælc fær upp to þam muntum.
 71. And hi anmodlice ealle to gode clypodon, biddende his fultumes,
þæt hi ne forwurdon.
 73. Holofernis þa siððan mid his fyrde becom to Iudea lande,
þe on god gelyfdon, and his fyrd endemes to gefeohte hi gearcodon ongean
Israhela folc, þæt hi hi fordydon.
 77. Ac him wearð gesæd, þæt hi hi sylfe gegearcodon mid
wige him togeanes and woldon him wiðstandan.
 79. Holofernis þa axode his yldestan cempan, hwæt þæt
mennisc wære on ðam muntum wunigende, þe hine swa forsawon and hine
secan noldon, ne hine friðes biddan him abugende.
 82. Ða cwæð sum heretoga, se hatte Achior, Ammoniscre
þeode, mid swiðlicum truwan: Leof, ic þe secge soð be þisum folce.
 86. Þis cynn com iu of Chaldeiscre mægðe and hi æfre
wurþiað ænne ælmihtigne god, se þe on heofonum eardað, on hine
truwigende.
 89. Ða þa se miccla hunger ealne middaneard ofereode, þa
ferdon heora fæderas þær þær hi fundon him bigleofan, to Egypta
lande and þær lange wunodon, feower hund geara, oþ þæt ðær swa
fela wæs þæs mancynnes geweaxen, þæt man ne mihte hi geriman.
 94. Ða wolde Pharao, se Egyptisca cyning, hi yfele geswencan and
gesette hi on þeowte to his weallgeweorcum, þæt hi worhton his burga.
 97. Ac hi clypodon endemes to þam ælmihtigan gode, þe hi on
gelyfdon, þæt he hi ahredde.
 99. And he sona asende syllice witu ofer Egypta lande, oð
ðæt hi forleton his folc of heora lande faran frige to heora earde.
 101. Heora god hi þa gelædde of þam lande ealle ofer þa
readan sæ, siðigende be þam grunde, swa þæt þæt wæter astod
swylce stanweallas him on ælce healfe þær þær hi inn eodon.
 106. And Pharao, se cyning, ferde him æthindan, wolde hi habban
eft to his þeowte.
 108. Ac god hine adræncte on þære deopan sæ, þæt of
ealre his fyrde an mann ne belaf.
 110. Ðæt godes folc þa eode upp be þam grunde, herigende
heora drihten, þe hi swa ahredde, and hi wunedon þa on westenum feowertig
wintra, þær þær nan man ær eardian ne mihte.
 114. And him dæghwamlice com þurh heora drihtnes sande mete of
heofenum eallum þam mancynne and þa biteran wyllspringas him wurdon
geswette and eac of heardum stane hi hæfdon yrnende wæter.
 118. Hi gewunnon syððan mid sige ðysne eard, and heora god
him fylste and feaht for hi, and ne mihte nan mann naht þisum folce, swa
lange swa hi heoldon heora god on riht.
 121. Swa oft swa hi bugon fram his biggengum to þam hæðenum
godum, hi wurdon gehergode and to hospe gewordene þurh hæðene leoda.
 125. Swa oft swa hi gecyrdon mid soðre dædbote eft to heora
gode, he gedyde hi sona mihtige and strange to wiðstandenne heora feondum.
 128. Heora god soþlice hatað unrihtwisnysse.
 129. Nu for manegum gearum, þa þa hi misheoldon þone
heofonlican god, hi wurdon gehergode and sume ofslagene and sume gelædde to
fyrlenum landum on hæftnede wunigende, oð ðæt hi wendon eft to þam
heofonlican gode, þe hi on gelyfað, and hi habbað nu eft heora eard
gebogod and þa burh Hierusalem, þær bið heora haligdom.
 137. Ic bidde þe nu, hlaford, þæt þu læte ofaxian, gif
ðis folc nu hæbbe ænige unrihtwisnysse oððe gylt geworhtne ongean
heora god, and hi beoð underþeodde þonne þinum anwealde.
 141. Gif hi þonne nabbað nane unrihtwisnysse, ne heora gode
abolgen, þonne beo we ealle to hospe gedone þurh heora drihten, þe hi
bewerað, swa swa his gewuna is.
 145. Holofernis þa sona æfter þissere segene gebealh hine
swiðe and mid gebeote cwæð: Wite ðu nu, Achior, þæt ðu wurþan
scealt mid urum swurdum ofslagen mid him, þonne we hi ealle ofsleað swa swa
ænne mann, þæt þu mage tocnawan, þæt ure cynehlaford
Nabochodonosor is soðlice god and he nu Israhel ealle eaðelice fordeð.
 153. He het hine þa gebindan and gebringan on þæt land and
þam folce betæcan, þæt he mid him forwurde.
 155. He wearð þa gebunden, swa swa se brema het, and to ðam
lande gelæd and forleton hine þær to anum treowe huxlice gebundenne.
 158. He wearð þa afunden fram ðam folce þær and he him
eall sæde his sið be ændebyrdnysse.
 160. And þæt folc þa sona æfter his segene feollon to
eorðan mid flowendum tearum, cweðende mid heofunge: ðu heofonlica
drihten, geseoh heora modignysse and ure æadmodnysse and geswutela, drihten,
þæt þu forseon nelt þa þe on þe truwiað mid trumum geleafan and
þu þa geeadmetst, þe on heora mihte wuldriað.
 167. Hi þa gefrefrodon þone foresædan Achior and Ozias heora
heafodmann hine hæfde mid him.
 169. And hi bædon þa ealle godes mildheortnysse and his
gescyldnysse wið þone Syriscan here.
 171. Hwæt, þa Holofernus wolde hi ut asittan and he heora
wæterscipe mid weardmannum besette twentig daga on an on æmn ðære
byrig: cwædon, þæt hi hopodon to þam muntum swiðor, þonne to
wæpnum oððe to ænigum wigge.
 176. Ðæt Israhela folc þa wearð geangsumod on mode for
þære wæterleaste.
 177. And þær witodlice næs on eallum þam þyttum, þe
on þære byrig wæron, swa mycel wæteres dæl, þæt him mihte
eallum to genihtsumnysse.
 180. Ac hi leton þa to ræde, þæt hi woldon abugan þam
breman heretogan to his mannrædene, þæt hi moston libban.
 183. Ozias ða cwæð to eallum þam folce: Mine gebroðru,
beoð eow geðyldige and mid emnum mode andbidiað gyt anum fif dagas ures
drihtnes willan, and gif us þonne ne becymð nanes cynnes frofer, ne nan
alysednys ure neodþearfe, þonne mote we abugan þam breman heretogan to
his mannrædene, þæt he us amundige.
 191. Ða wæs on þære byrig on þam ylcan timan an
ænlic wimman on wudewanhade, Iudith gehaten, þæra heahfædera
cynnes.
 194. Swiðe gelyfed mann on þone lyfigendan god, hlisfull on
þeawum, rihtlice lybbende æfter Moyses æ, Manases laf: se wæs hire
wer, ac he wearð ofslagen þurh þære sunnan hætan on hærfestlicre
tide ute mid his rifterum, þe ripdon his corn.
 200. He læfde þære wudewan unlytel on feo and on oðrum
æhtum, æfter his gebyrdum mycele welan on manegum begeatum.
 203. And hi wunode on clænnysse æfter hire were on hyre
upflore mid hire þinenum.
 205. Heo wæs swiðe wlitig and wenlices hiwes and heo fæste
symle buton on freolsdagum, mid hæran gescryd to hire lice æfre, on godes
ege butan unhlisan.
 209. Ðeos Iudith ofaxode, hu Ozias gespræc, and cwæð,
þæt hit wære witodlice unræd, þæt mann sceolde settan swylcne
andagan gode, þæt he binnan fif dagum þam folce gehulpe, oððe hi
woldon gesecan þone Syriscan here and þone ealdorman to his anwealde.
 215. Ne gladiað þas word god us to miltsunge, ac hi hine
gremiað to gramlicre yrsunge.
 217. We sceolon beon gemyndige his mildheortnysse, forþan ðe we
nyton nænne oðerne god buton hine ænne.
 219. Uton andbidian mid eadmodnysse his anes frofres.
 221. Abraham and Isaac and ure heahfæderas wurdon afandode.
 222. On heora frecednyssum and on earfoðnyssum hi wæron
getrywe þam ælmihtigan gode, þe hi æfre ahredde.
 225. Hine we sceolon biddan, þæt he us geblissige and of
þyssere earfoðnysse us generige.
 227. Æfter þisum wordum and oðrum gebedum heo awearp hire
hæran and hire wudewan reaf and hi sylfe geglængede mid golde and mid
purpuran and mid ænlicum gyrlum.
 230. And eode hire syððan mid anre þinene ut of þære
byrig and bebead þam folce and þam foresædan Oziam, þæt hi na ne
hogodon embe hire fær, ac wunodon on gebedum and gebædon for hi.
 235. And hi ealle wundrodon hire wlites swiðe.
 236. Heo ða on ærnemergen to þam weardum becom, sæde,
þæt heo wolde gesecan þone ealdormann and hine gewissian to his agenum
willan, hu he eaðelice mihte þæt manncynn berædan butan frecednysse
his agenes folces, þæt an man ne wurde of his werode amyrred.
 242. Hi ða wundrodon hire wlites swiðe and hire wislicra worda
and mid wurðmynte hi gelæddon to heora ealdormen into his getelde.
 245. Sona swa he beseah on hire scinendan nebbwlite, swa wearð he
gegripen mid ðære galnysse his unstæððigan heortan.
 247. And heo aleat to his fotum, sæde, þæt heo wiste to
gewissan þinge, þæt þæt Israhela folc swa yfle wæs gehæfd mid
scearpum hungre and swiðlicum þurste for heora synnum wið þone soðan
god, þæt hi moston ealle endemes forwurðan buton hi ðe hraðor to his
ræde gebugon.
 254. Heo cwæð eft oðrum worde: Ic wurðige minne god eac
swilce mid þe and on asettum timan ic sceal me gebiddan gebigedum cneowum to
him and æt him ofaxian, hwænne þu eaðelicost miht to þam folce
becuman mid ealre þinre fare tomiddes Hierusalem be minre wissunge and þu
hæfst hi ealle swa swa hyrdelease sceap.
 261. For þi ic com to þe, þæt ic cydde þe þis.
 262. He gelyfde þa hire wordum and hire wel behet.
 263. And his þegenas sædon, þæt swylc wimman nære on
ealre eorðan swa fægeres wlites and swa wis on spræce.
 265. And se ealdorman hi het gan into his madmum and þær
wunian, oð þæt he hyre word sende.
 268. And he het his hiredmen hire þenian of his agenum þenungum
and his estmetum.
 270. Ac heo nolde swa þeah his sanda brucan for his
hæðenscipe, ac heo hæfde gebroht on hire þinene fætelse hire
fercunge, oð þæt heo hire modes smeagunge mid weorcum gefylde.
 274. Iudith þa abæd æt þam ealdormen, þæt heo moste
be leafe on ðam langum nihtum gan on hyre gebedum to gebiddenne hire drihten
ut of þam madmcleofan on hire cneowgebedum.
 278. And he sealde hire leafe, þæt heo swa don moste.
 279. And heo swa dyde symle on nihtum, bæd þone ælmihtigan
god, þæt he hire gewissode his folce to ahreddinge on þære
frecednysse.
 281. Ða on þam feorðan dæge feormode se ealdorman his
heahþegnas on his getelde on micelre blisse and bebead his burðegne,
þæt he gebringan sceolde into his gebeorscipe þa foresædan Iudith,
and he swa dyde.
 287. Heo com þa geglenged for nanre galnysse and stod him
ætforan swiðe fægres hiwes, and his mod sona swiðe wearð ontend on
hire gewilnunge to his galnysse and het hi beon bliðe on his gebeorscipe, and
heo him behet, þæt heo swa wolde.
 293. Þa wearð Holofernis wundorlice bliðe ealne þone dæg
and fordræncte hine sylfne mid þam strangum wine ofer his gewunan.
 296. And ealle his þegnas eac wæron fordræncte and hi
efston on æfnunge to heora mane swiðe.
 298. And þa burþegnas gebrohton þone ealdormann on anum bedde
mid þære Iudith and na swiðe ne gymdon syððan heora hlafordes.
 301. Iudith geseah þa, þa þa he on slæpe wæs, þæt
hire wæs gerymed to hire ræde wel forð, and het hire þinene healdan
þa duru and gelæhte his agen swurd and sloh to his hneccan and mid twam
slegum forsloh him þone swuran and bewand þæt bodig mid ðam
beddclaðum.
 307. Heo nam ða þæt heafod and his hopscytan and eode hire
ut mid hire þinene swylce on gebedum, swa swa hyre gewuna wæs, oþ
þæt hi buta becomon to þam burhgeate.
 311. Iudith þa clypode and cwæð to þam weardmannum:
Undoð þas burhgatu.
 312. God sylf is mid us, se þe mihte gefremode on Israhela
þeode.
 314. And hi þa ardlice undydon þa gatu and comon endemes mid
leohte hire to, forþan þe hi wendon, þæt heo ne com na ongean.
 317. Heo astah þa up to anum steapum beorge and ætywde
þæt heafod him eallum, cweðende: Heriað, ic bidde, mid blisse urne
drihten, se þe ne forlæt on hine gelyfende and þa þe hihtað on his
micclum truwan and on me gefylde his mildheortnysse, þa þe he behet
Israheles hirede.
 324. And he ofsloh nu to niht on minum handum his folces feond.
 325. And heo unforht cwæð: Godes engel soðlice me gescylde
wið hine, þæt ic unwemme eft becom to eow, and god sylf ne geþafode,
þæt ic gescynd wurde, ac butan besmitennysse he asende me ongean, on his
sige blissigende and on eowre alysednysse.
 331. Hi sceawodon þa þæt heafod mid swiðlicre wafunge and
Ozias, heora ealdor, and hi ealle samod bletsodon Iudith mid þissere
bletsunge: Drihten þe gebletsode on his drihtenlican mihte, se ðe þurh
þe gehwyrfde ure fynd to nahte and se ðe nu to dæg þinne naman
gemærsode, swa þæt of manna muðum þin mærð ne ateorað.
 338. Ða com Achior, Holofernes þegen, se ðe ær him gecydde
godes gecyðnysse, and him swa aeode, swa swa he him sæde, þeah þe he
mid huxe hine hete gebindan and hine þeowde to ofsleanne mid þam folce.
 343. He wearð þa afyrht æt fruman swiðe for ðære
gesihþe, þa þa he sceawode þæt heafod.
 345. Ac he blissode sona and bletsode Iudith and gelyfde siððan
on þone lyfigendan god æfter Moyses æ, þæs mæran heretogan.
 348. Iudith þa bebead þam burhwarum þus: Asettað þis
heafod on þam hehstan wealle and gað eow gewæpnode on gode truwigende nu
on ærnemergen ut of þyssere byrig.
 352. Þonne beoð eowre fynd afyrhte for eow, þonne hi
heafodleasne heora ealdorman findað.
 354. Þonne mage ge gewyrcan eower word on him.
 355. Hi dydon þa swa sona on dægred and gewæpnode utferdon
mid folclicum truman, swiðe hlydende to þam ungeleaffullum, oð ðæt
þa Syriscan gesawon heora fær, and hi þa woldon awreccan heora
ealdorman.
 360. Ac nan man ne dorste þa duru unlucan, ac hi woldon elles mid
gehlyde hine awreccan.
 362. Ða þa him þæs ne speow þurh heora hludan spræce,
þa asændon hi inn ænne his burðena.
 363. And se afunde his hlaford licgan heafodleasne and he þa mid
wanunge wende ut ongean, secende Iudith and sæde þam folce: An wifman
hæfð nu us ealle gescynd and urne cynehlaford.
 368. Her lið se ealdormann heafodleas on bedde, mid his blode
besyled.
 370. Hi wurdon þa afyrhte wundorlice ealle and butan ælcum
ræde bysmorlice flugon to heora lande weard and forleton heora ðing heora
feondum to handa, þe him fyligdon on bæc and hi æfre hyndon hindan mid
wæpnum.
 375. And of eallum heora burgum Ozias asende him maran fultum and
afligdon hi endemes of heora earde, þæt hi eft ne gecyrdon.
 378. Israhela folc þa mid ænlicum sige wendon him hamweard and
þa herelafa dældon betwux him on deorwurðum sceattum, swa þæt hi
wurdon swiðe gewelegode.
 382. And hi ealle betæhton Holofernes þing Iudithe to
hæbbenne.
 383. And hi heredon þa god mid swiþlicre blisse on sange and on
dreame.
 385. Ioachim wæs gehaten heora yldesta sacerd.
 386. Se com of Hierusalem mid eallum his preostum to Bethulian
byrig mid mycelre blisse, þæt he Iudith gesawe.
 388. And hi hi swiðe bletsodon, ealle þisum wordum: þu eart
wuldor soðlice ure byrig Hierusalem and Israheles bliss, ures folces
arwurðnyss, forþan þe þu wunodest æfter þinum were wiflice on
clænnysse, and god þe gestrangode for þære clænnysse, and forðan
þu sylf bist gebletsod on worulde.
 395. Iudith þa herode þone heofonlican god swyðe mid
lofsange, swa swa hit on læden us sægð.
 397. And hi ealle offrodon heora lac gode binnan Hierusalem bliðe
for ðam sige.
 399. Iudith þa þurhwunode on hire wudewanhade mærlice for
gode on micclum wurðmynte.
 401. Hundteontig geara heo leofode and hire lytlan heo freode.
 402. And þæt Israhela folc eall wunode on sibbe on eallum hire
life and eac lange syððan.
 404. Nis þis nan leas spel: hit stent on leden, nis on ðære
bibliothecan.
 405. Þæt witon boceras, þe þæt leden cunnon, þæt
we na ne leogað.
 407. On hire wæs gefylled þæs hælendes cwyde: ælc,
þe hine ahefð, sceal beon geeadmet and se þe hine geeadmet, sceal beon
ahafen.
 410. Heo eadmod and clæne and ofercom þone modigan, lytel and
unstrang and alede þone micclan, forðan þe heo getacnode untweolice mid
weorcum þa halgan gelaðunge, þe gelyfð nu on god, þæt is Cristes
cyrce on eallum cristenum folce, his an clæne bryd, þe mid cenum geleafan
þam ealdum deofle of forcearf þæt heafod, æfre on clænnysse Criste
þeowigende.
 418. Iudith behet ærest þam welhreowum ealdormen, þæt heo
wolde hine gebringan binnan to hire folce.
 420. Ac hit næs na ealles leas, þæt þæt heo him behet,
þa þa heo bær his heafod binnan þam weallum and þam folce
æteowde, hu hire fylste god.
 423. Þam sy a wurðmynt to worulde.
 423. Amen.
 424. Heo nolde agan, swa swa us sægð seo racu, þæs
wælhreowan hærereaf, þe þæt folc hire forgeaf, ac amansumode mid
ealle his gyrlan, nolde hi werian, ac awearp hi hire fram, nolde þurh his
hæþenscype habban ænige synne.
 429. Sume nunnan syndon, þe sceandlice libbað, tellað to
lytlum gylte, þæt hi hi forlicgon and þæt hi leohtlice magon swa
lytel gebetan.
 432. Ac heo ne bið na eft mæden, gif heo hi æne forligð,
ne heo næfð þa mede þæs hundfealdan wæstmes.
 434. Nimað eow bysne be þyssere Iudith, hu clænlice heo
leofode ær Cristes acennednysse, and ne leogað ge na gode on ðæs
godspelles timan þa halgan clænnysse, þe ge Criste beheton, forðan
þe he fordemð þa dyrnan forligras and þa fulan sceanda he besengð on
helle, swa swa hit on læden stent æfter Paules lare: <foreign>Fornicatores et
adulteros iudicabit Deus</foreign>.
 442. Ic wylle eac secgan, min swustor, þæt mægðhad and
clænnys mycele mihte habbað, swa swa we gehwær rædað on martira
þrowungum and on <foreign>Vitas Patrum</foreign>, swa swa Malchus.
 448. Malchus ða eode ut of ðam scræfe mid his gemacan
mycclum ablicged.
 452. And hi namon þa hors, ðe hi þyder brohton, and wæron
ða ridende, ðe ær wæron feðende, and becomon to Syrian, þær
ðær hi syþþan wunodon, æfre on clænnysse Criste ðeowigende.
 452. Ðam sy wuldor and lof a to worulde.
 452. Amen.
