ÆIntSig
B1.6.1.
Interrogationes Sigeuulfi in Genesin: MacLean 1884, 1-59.



 0.1. <foreign>Interrogatio Sigeuulfi Presbiteri</foreign>.
 0.2. Sum geþungen lareow wæs on Engla lande Albinus gehaten,
& hæfde mycele geþingða.
 0.3. Se lærde manega þæs engliscan mennisces on boclicum
cræfte, swa swa he wel cuþe, & ferde syððan ofer sæ to þam
snoteran cyninge Carolus gehaten, se hæfde mycelne cræft for Gode &
for worulde, & he wislice leofode.
 0.7. To þam com Albinus se æþela lareow, & on his
anwealde ælþeodig wunode on Sancte Martines mynstre, & þær manega
gelærde mid þam heofonlicon wisdome þe him se Hæland forgeaf.
 0.11. Þa on sumne timan Sigewulf mæssepreost hine befran
gelome feorran mid gewritum be gehwylcum cnottum þe he sylf ne cuþe on
þære halgan bec þe is gehaten Genesis.
 0.14. Þa cwæð Albinus him to andsware, þæt he wolde his
axunga ealle gegaderian, & him andsware sendan mid heora swutelungean.
 0.17. And Sigewulf hine befran æt fruman þisum wordum.
 1.18. Hu is to understandenne þæt se ælmihtiga God geswac
his weorca on þam seofoþan dæge, þaþa he gesceop ealle þing, &
Crist cwæð on his godspelle, Min Fæder wyrc oð ðis, & ic
wyrce.
 1.21. Albinus him andwyrde, God geswac þa þære niwan
gesceapennysse, ac he geedniwað þa ylcan gecynd ælce dæge, & his
weorce gewissað oð ðisse weorulde geendunge.
 2.24. Hu fela gesceadwise gesceafta gesceop God?
 2.25. Twa, Englas & menn.
 3.26. Hwi wæs þæra engla synn forsuwod on þære bec
Genesis, & þæs mannes wæs gesæd?
 3.27. For þan þe God gemynte þæt he wolde þæs mannes
synne gehælon, na þæs deofles.
 4.29. Hwi wæs þæs heah engles synn unmiltsigendlic &
þæs mannes miltsigendlic?
 4.31. Forþon þe se heaengel þe nu is heatol deofol himsylf
his synne afunde, & se man wæs beswicen.
 4.32. And eac swa myclum swa þæs engles gecynd mare wæs on
wuldre, swa hit wæs mare on forwyrde.
 4.34. And swa micclum swa þæs mannes gecynd unmihtigre wæs,
swa hit wæs leohtre to miltsunge.
 5.36. Hwi wæs se man betæht to his agenum cyre?
 5.37. To þan þæt he wære himsylfum ealdor swa to life,
swa to deaðe.
 5.38. Forþon gif he wære neadunga Gode geunderþeod, þonne
næfde he nan wuldor for godum weorcum, ne nan wite for yfelum, ac wære
þonne swilce an nyten.
 6.41. Hwi wæs Adame an treow forboden þaþa he wæs ealles
oðres hlaford?
 6.43. To þan þæt he hine ne onhofe on swa micclan
hlafordscipe, ac wære on gehealtsumnysse þæs bebodes his Scippende
underþeod, & þus þæt wiste þæt he him hyran sceolde.
 7.46. Hwi wæs se man on þone sixtan dæg gesceapen æfter
þam oþrum gesceaftum þonne se man is betera þonne þa ungesceadwisan
nytena?
 7.49. Forþe se Scyppend gesceop ærest þone middaneard swylce
he þam men hus getimbrode, & hine syððan into þam gelædde, swa
swa þæs huses hlaford.
 8.52. Hwig awyrigde se Scyppend þa eorþan on Adames gylte &
na þæt wæter?
 8.53. Forþon þe se mann æt of þære eorðan wæstme
ongean Godes bebod na of þan wætere, & forþam þe God gemynte
þæt he wolde þurh þæt wæter þa synne adilegian þe se man
þurhteah þurh þære eorðan wæstm.
 9.57. Hwi wolde ure Scyppend þæs mannes synne þurh
hinesylfne gehælan & na þurh sumne engel?
 9.59. Forþon þe sumes engles geearnung ne genihtsumade to
alysednysse ealles mancynnes.
 9.61. Ne eac se deofol on swa mycelne gylt ne befeolle þurh anes
engles cwale; on swa mycelne swa he befeoll, on Cristes cwale.
 10.64. Hwi is se deofol swa onweard þam men?
 10.65. For þære hatunge þe he hæfð to his Scyppende
& for þam andan þe he hæfð to þam men, & orwennesse his
agenre hæle.
 11.67. Hwi nolde God settan æ æt fruman swa he syððan
dyde þurh Moysen?
 11.69. Forþon þe lange æt fruman wæs gehealden seo
gecyndelice æ swa þæt nan oðrum ne derode.
 11.70. Eft þa þa þeos æ becom to gymeleaste, þa sette
God æ þurh Moysen to ege & to steore & to geleafan on God.
 12.73. Hwi beseah God ta Abeles lacum & hi underfeng, &
nolde beseon to Kaines lacum?
 12.74. Forþan þe Abel geoffrode þa selestan lac Gode, &
Cain þa waccran.
 13.76. Hwi namode Crist on his godspelle Abel rihtwisne toforan
oðrum?
 13.77. Forþan þe Abel hæfde þreo healice mihta.
 13.78. An is þæt he wæs Godes sacerd þa þa he him
gecweme lac offrode, oþer þæt he on clænum magðhade his life
geendode, þridde þæt he wæs gemartyrad unscyldig for his godnysse.
 13.81. & on þam þrim þingum he getacnode Crist se þe is
soð sacerd, & on clænum mægðhade leofode, & for manncynne
wæs gemartyrod.
 14.84. Hwi is Enoh swa lange cucu gehealden?
 14.85. To þon þæt wære geswutelad þæt ealle men
mihton æfre butan deaþe lybban gyf nan man ne syngade.
 15.87. Hwi sceal se ylca Enoh oððe Elias gyt sweltan?
 15.88. Þæt hi gelæstan þa menniscan gecynde, þone
deað þe Adam mid his ofergægednysse geearnode swa swa ealle men doð,
& swa swa Crist sylf nolde þone deað forbugan.
 16.91. On hu manegum wisum is Godes weorc?
 16.92. On feower wisum: ærest on Godes wordes gefudunge on þam
ecan geþeahte; Eft on þam ungehiwodum antimbre þe he þa gesceafta of
gesceop, swa swa hit awriten is <foreign>QUI UIUIT IN ETERNUM CREAUIT OMNIA SIMUL</foreign>, Se
þe leofað on ecnysse gesceop ealle ðing togædere.
 16.97. Þæt ðridde wæs þaþa God todælde mislice
gesceafta on þære syx daga gesceapennysse; þæt feorþe is þæt
God gescipð symle edniwan of þam ærran, þæt hi ne ateorian.
 17.100. Hwylce gesceafta wæran of nahte gesceapene?
 17.101. Heofon & eorþe, englas & leoht, lyft &
wæter, & þæs mannes sawl.
 18.102. On hu fela gesceaftum stent þes middaneard?
 18.103. On feowrum: on fyre & on lyfte; on wætere & on
eorþan.
 19.104. Hwæt is heora ælces gecynd?
 19.104. Ðæs fyres gecynd is hat & drie; þære lyfte
gecynd is wearm & wæt ; þæs wæteres gecynd is ceald &
wæt; þære eorþan gecynd is ceald & drige.
 20.107. Hwylces gecyndes is seo heofon ?
 20.108. Fyres gecyndes & sinewealt & symle turniende seo
tunglene heofon.
 21.109. Gif heo turniende is humeta ne fealð heo?
 21.110. Weoruldlice uðwitan sædan þæt heo feolle for hire
swiftnysse gif þa seofon dweligendan steorran hyre ryne ne wiðhæfton.
 21.112. Ic wene þæt þu nyte hwæt þis gemæne, buton
we of oðrum bocum þis openlicor secgon.
 21.114. Ic secge nu þæt ic hwilon ær forsuwade forþam
ungewunan woroldlices gesceades.
 21.115. Witodlice seo tunglene heofon tyrnð æfre onbutan þas
eorþan easten westwerd, & hire winnað ongean þa seofon dweligendan
tunglan.
 21.118. Hi synd dweliende oððe woriende gecwedene na for
gedwylde ac forþan þe heora ælc gæð on his agenum ryne, hwilon
ufor, hwilon nyþor, & ne synd na fæste on þære rodorlican
heofonan swa swa oðre tunglan.
 21.121. Ðone ufemyston heton þa hæþenan Saturnus, se
gefylð his ryne on þrittig geara fyrste.
 21.123. Þone oðerne þe beneoþan Saturnum gæð, hi heton
Iouis, & se gefylð his ryne binnan twelf gearum.
 21.125. Þone þriddan þe benoþan Iouem gæð hi heton
Mars, & se gefylð his ryne binnan twam gearum.
 21.127. Se feorða is seo sunne.
 21.127. Seo gefylð hire ryne on twelf monþum, þæt is on
þrim hund dagum & fif & sixtigum & syx tidum.
 21.129. Se fifta is gehaten Uenus, se is æfensteorra.
 21.130. Se gefylð his ryne on þrim hund dagum & eahta &
sixtigum dagum.
 21.131. Se syxta is gehaten mercurrus, micel & beorht.
 21.132. Se gefylð his ryne on þrim hund dagum & nigon &
twentigum dagum.
 21.133. Se seofoþa is se mona ealra tungla nyðemest &
forþi hæfð læstne embegang.
 21.134. And forþi he gefylð his ryne on seofon & twentigum
dagum & on eahta tidum.
 21.135. Ðas seofon tunglan gað æfre easwerd ongean þa
heofonan, ac seo heofon is strengra & abret hi ealle underbæc westward
mid hire ryne, & is foði mannum geþuht swylce seo sunne & þa
foresædan tunglan gangon westweard.
 21.140. Soð þæt is westwerd hi gað unþances, ac hi gað
swa þeah ealle be heora mihte æfre eastwerd.
 21.142. Micel sweg gæð of heora swiftum ryne & of þam
scinendan rodore, þeah þe we for þam mycclan fyrlene hit gefredan ne
magon.
 21.144. We foð nu on þa axunge þar we hi ær forlæton.
 22.145. Hu is to understandenne on anginne gesceop God heofonan
& eorðan?
 22.147. Þæt angin is Crist, Godes sunu, swa swa he sylf
cwæð on his godspelle to þam Iudeiscum þa þa hi axodon hwæt he
wære.
 22.149. He cwæð, Ic eom anginn þe to eow sprece.
 22.150. Þurh þæt anginn, þæt is þurh þone sunu
gesceop se fæder ærest þæt antimber of nahte, of þam þe he
syððan heofonan & eorþan geworhte.
 23.152. Hu is to understandenne þæt se Godes gast wæs
geferod ofer wæterum?
 23.153. Ne ferde Godes gast woriende ofer þam wæterum ac
þurh his mihte & wissungenne to gescyppenne, & to geliffæstenne
þæt ungehiwode antimber.
 24.156. Hwi gesceop God leoht on þone forman dæg?
 24.157. Hit gedafenade rihtlice Godes weorcum þæt se
ælmihtiga, se þe is ece leoht ærest þæt hwilwendlice leoht
geworhte, þæt þa oþre gesceafta þe he syððan gesceop mihton beon
þurh þæt leoht gesewene.
 24.161. God sylf is soð leoht, ac þæt gesceapene leoht
geswutelade his weorc.
 25.162. Hwi is gecweden on þæs mannes gesceapennysse, Uton
wyrcan mannan.
 25.163. & be þam oðrum gesceaftum is awriten þæt God
gecwæð & hi wurdon þurh his hæse gesceapene?
 25.165. Witodlice forþan þe þæs mannes wurðscipe &
æþelborennyss is toforan þam oðrum gesceaftum, & forþi wolde God
mid geþeahte & þurh his agene handa hine gescyppan.
 26.169. Hwi is gecweden þæt God cwæde, Uton wyrcan mannan
to ure anlicnesse?
 26.170. Forþi is gecweden Uton wyrcan þæt wære geswutelad
þære halgan þrynnesse weorc on annysse.
 26.172. Seo halige þrynnes is undergiten on þam worde Uton
wyrcan.
 27.173. & seo soðe annys is understanden on þam worde, to
ure alicnysse?
 27.174. On þam is se mann his Scyppendes anlicnyss.
 27.175. On þam inran men, þæt is on þære sawle.
 27.176. Seo hæfð on hire þreo þing on annysse æfre
wyrcende, þæt is gemynd & andgit & willa.
 28.178. Hwi is gecweden ægþer geanlicnyss ge gelicnyss?
 28.178. Seo anlicnyss is ta understandenne on þære ecnysse,
& seo gelicnyss on hire þeawum, þæt is on þrim þingum þe we
ær namodan.
 29.181. Hwi ne cwæð þæt halige gewrit be þam men þa
þa he gesceapen wæs synderlice þæt god wære, swa swa hit cwæð
mænigfealdlice be þam oðrum gesceaftum þæt God gesawe þæt hi
gode wæron?
 29.184. Syððan se man gesceapen wæs, segð þæt halige
gewrit, þæt God gesawe ealle þa þing þe he geworhte, & hi
wæron swiþe gode.
 29.186. Swilce hi wæron ær þam ænlipige Gode &
wæron syððan for þam menn, ealle swiðe gode, forþon þe hi ealle
to þæs mannes wlite gesceape synd.
 29.189. Se man soðlice is to wuldre & herunge his Scyppendes
geworht.
 30.190. Hwi wæs þæt treow þe Adam on agylte gehaten
<foreign>lignum scientiae boni et mali</foreign>, þæt is on englisc treow ingehydes yfeles
& godes?
 30.192. Næs þæt treow on his gecynde gesceadwis, ne hit
næfde ingehyd godes oððe yfeles, ac þæt se man mihte on þam
treowe þe him forboden wæs to cnawan hu mycel god is on gehyrsumnysse.
 31.196. Hwæt is getacnod on þam worde þe God cwæð to
Adame ær þam þe he agylte, þu scealt deaðe sweltan gif þu of þam
treowe geetst?
 31.198. Se twyfealda deað wæs mid þam getacnad, þære
sawle & þæs lichoman.
 31.200. Þære sawle deað is þonne hi God forlæt for
sumere synne & heo seoððan sceandlic wunað.
 31.201. Ðæs lichoman deað is þonne seo sawul him of gewit,
& þysne twyfealdan deað towearp Crist mid his anfealdan deaðe, se
þe wæs soðlice dead on lichoman & næfre on þære sawle,
forþon þe he næfre ne syngode.
 32.205. Hwi wolde God þæt se man Adam eallum nytenum naman
gesceope?
 32.206. Þæt se man þurh þæt undergeate hu mycele betera
he wæs þurh his gesceadwisnyssa þonne ða nytenu, & þæt he
þæs þe swiþor his Scyppend lufode, þe hine swylcne geworhte.
 33.209. Hwi segð þæt halige gewrit þæt Adam ne gemette
nænne him gelicne ær þam þe Eua wæs gesceapen?
 33.211. Forþon þe nan nyten næfde nan gescead ne sawle butan
he ana.
 34.212. Hwi wolde God gescyppan Euan of Adames sidan þa þa he
slep, & na of eorþan swa swa He hine gesceop?
 34.214. For þære getacnunge þæt Crist sylf wæs mid
deaðe geswefod on þære rode & wæs on þære sidan gewundod.
 34.216. Of þære arn wæter & blod to alysenne his
gelaðunge, seo is gecweden Cristes bryd & clæne mæden.
 35.218. Hwæþer seo næddre þurh hyre agen andgit to Euan
spræce?
 35.219. Nis hit na geleaflic þæt se wyrm þurh his agen
andgit Euan bepæhte, ac se deofol spræc ðurh þa næddran swa swa he
deð þurh wodne man.
 35.222. & heo ne undergeat þe ma þe se woda deð.
 36.223. Hwi geþafode God þæt se man afandod wære þa
þa he wiste þæt se man abugan wolde?
 36.224. Forþan þe se man nære herigendlic gif he forþi ne
syngode þe he ne mihte, ac he wære herigendlic gif he ne syngode þa þa
he mihte.
 36.227. Git dæghwamlice drecð deofol mancyn mid mislicum
costnungum, þæt þa beon hergendlice & halige þe him
wiðstandeð, & þa beon genyðerode þe nellað him wiðstandan.
 37.230. Hwi wolde se æþela Scyppend æfre þone mannan to
his agenum cyre lætan?
 37.232. Forþon þe se Scyppend nolde þæt se man þeow
wære, se þe to his anlicnysse gesceapen wæs, ac wære þurh godne
willan hergenlic, oððe of yfelum willan nyðergendlic.
 38.235. Hwi axode God Adam æfter his gylte hwar he wære,
swilce he nyste?
 38.236. Þæt he dyde for þreaunge, na swylce he nyste, &
þæt Adam understode hwar he þa wæs & hwanon he afeolle.
 39.239. Humeta wende Adam þæt he mihte hine behydan fram Godes
gesihðe?
 39.240. Seo stuntnyss him gelamp of his synne wite þæt he
wolde hine bedyglian þam þe nan þing nis digle.
 40.242. Hwi ne axode God þa næddran hwi heo þa men
forlærde swa swa he dyde Euan hwi heo Adame þone æppel sealde?
 40.244. Forþon þe seo næddre be agenum willan þæt ne
dyde, ac se deofol þurh hi.
 40.245. & forþi cwæð God hire to, þu bist awyrged,
& þu scealt gan on þinum breoste, & þu ytst þa eorðan eallum
dagum þines lifes.
 40.248. Se deofol þe spræc þurh þa næddran wæs on
þære næddran awyrged, he gæð on his breoste, þæt is, þæt
he færð on modignysse & mid þære men beswicð, & he ytt þa
eorþan, forþon þe þa belimpað to þam deofle þa þe ða
eorðlican grædignysse & gæslan ungefohlice fremmað.
 40.253. God cwæð to Euan þæt heo sceolde þære
næddran heafod to brytan, & seo næddre wolde syrwan ongean hyre ho.
 41.255. Hwæt is þære næddran heofod & hwæt
þæs wifes ho?
 41.256. Þære næddran heafod getacnað þæs deofles
tihtinge þa we sceolon mid eallre geornfullnysse sona tobrytan, for þa gif
heo þæt heafod innan þam men bestincð, þonne slingð heo mid ealle
inn.
 41.259. Swa þeah ne bescyt se deofol næfre swa yfel geþoht
into þam men þæt hit him to forwyrde becume, gif hit him ne licað
& gif he winð mid gebedum ongean.
 41.262. He sæwð foroft manfullice geþohtas into þæs
mannes heortan þæt he hine orwennysse gebringe, ac hit ne bið þam men
derigendlic gif he to his Drihtne cleopað.
 41.266. Swa se man swiðor bið afandod, swa he selra bið.
 41.266. Þæs wifes ho getacnode þæt se deofol wile on
fyrste gif he æt fruman ne mæg þone man beswican, & swa near his
lifes geendunge, swa bið þam deofle leofre þæt he þone man
forpære.
 41.270. Ac us is to hopigenne on þæs Hælendes gescyldnesse
se ðe us tihte þus: <foreign>Confidite ego uici mundum:</foreign> Truwiað & beoð
gebylde, ic oferswiþe þisne middaneard.
 41.273. Eft he cwæð, þises middaneardes ealdor com to me
& he on me naht his ne afunde.
 41.274. Se deofol is þara manna ealdor þe þisne middaneard
ungemetlice lufiað, & he com to Criste, cunnode hwæðer he ænig
þing his on him gecneowe.
 41.277. Þa ne funde he on him nane synne, ac
unscæððignysse.
 41.278. Þæt þæt we ne magon þurh us þæt we magon
þurh Crist, se þe cwæð: <foreign>Omnia possibilia credenti:</foreign> Ealle þing synd
þam geleaffullan acumendlice.
 41.280. We sculon winnon wið þone deofol mid fæstum geleafan
gif we wyllað beon gehealdene, & se þe him onbyhð bið soðlice
beswicen.
 42.283. Hwi worhte God pylcan Adame & Euan æfter þam
gylte?
 42.284. Þæt he geswutolade mid þam deadum fellum þæt hi
wæron þa deadlice for þære forgægednysse.
 43.285. Hwæt is þæt God gelogode cherubim & fyren swurd
& awendedlic to gehealdenne þone weg þe lið to lifes treowe?
 43.287. Þæt is þæt neorxnawanges get is gehealden þurh
engla þenunge & fyrene hyrdrædene & þæt is anwendendlice
forþan þe hit bið aweg gedon, & se weg bið us gerymed.
 43.290. Cherubin is gereht gefyllednys ingehydes , þæt is seo
soðe lufu, & þæt fyrene swurd getacnade þa hwilwendlican
earfoðnyssa þe we her on life forberað.
 43.293. & we sculon þurh þa soþan lufe godes & manna
& þurh earfoðnysse to þæs lifes treowe eft becuman.
 43.295. Þæt lifes treow is se leofa Hælend Crist, se þe
is soð lif on hine gelyfendum.
 44.296. Hu cleopode seo stemn Abeles blodes to Gode?
 44.297. Heo clypode swa þæt Caines gylt wearð æteowed on
Godes gesyhðe, & gehwylces mannes dæda clypiað to Gode & hine
gewregað oððe geþingiað þonne God hi gesihð swa gode swa yfele.
 45.300. Hwi wæs Cain awyrged on his synne & se eorðe
wæs awyrged on Adames synne?
 45.302. Cain wiste his fæder forgægednysse & næs
þurh þæt gewærlæht, ac þar toeacan his agenne broþor rihtwisne
& unscæððigne acwealde, & forþi wæs wyrþe maran
wyrigunge.
 46.305. Hwylc tacn sette God on Caine þæt man hine ofslean ne
sceolde?
 46.306. Þæt tacn gewistlice þæt he cwaciende &
geomerigende & woriende, & utlaga leofode symle ofer eorþan.
 47.308. Hwæt is yfel?
 47.309. Yfel nis nan þing þurh hitsylf, & nane wununge
næfð butan on sumum gesceafte.
 47.310. Se deofol wæs ærest to godum engle gesceapen, ac he
wearð yfel þurh modignysse.
 47.312. Nu nis yfel nan þing butan godnysse forgægednyss, swa
swa þeostru ne synd nan þing buton leohtes forlætnyss.
 48.314. Humeta cwæð God ælmihtig þa þa he manna
þwyrnysse geseah, þæt him of þuhte þæt he æfre men gesceope?
 48.316. Ne bið God næfre bepeht, ne him næfre ne
ofþincð þæt þæt he ær to ræde geþohte.
 48.318. Ne he ne besargað swa hwæt swa he foresceawode swa swa
men doð, ac þæt halig gewrit wyle to ure spræce geþwærlætan,
& on ure wisan us to sprecð, swa þæt we þurh þa gewunelican
spræce þa þing oncnawan þe us uncuðe wæron.
 49.322. Hu wæs Noes arc gesceapen?
 49.322. Se arc wæs fyðerscyte þreo hund fæðma lang
neoðan, & fiftig fæðma wid, & þrittig fæðma heah &
wæs fram nyðeweardan oð ufeweardan swa togædere gescoten, & swa
genyrwerd þæt he wæs mid anre fæðme belocen ufewerd, swa swa he
strengest beon mihte ongean þa stiðlican scuras.
 49.327. He wæs fif flere & hæfde þreo wununga.
 49.328. On þære nyðemestan fleringe wæs heora gangpyt
& heora myxen, on þære oðre fleringe wæs heora nytena foda
gelogod, on þære þriddan fleringe wæs seo forme wunung & þær
wunedon þa wildeor & þa reðan wurmas.
 49.332. On þære feorþan fleringe wæs þara tamra nytena
steal.
 49.333. On þære fiftan fleringe wæs þara manna wunung mid
wyrðmynte gelogod, & hi þar on wunodon for nean twelf monað ær
þan/ þe þæt flod mihte beon adruwod.
 50.336. Hwi wurdon adydde ma þæra eorðlicra nytena on þam
flode þonne þara sælicra fixa?
 50.338. Forþon þe seo eorþe wæs awyrged on Adames gylte,
þe ða nytenu on leofodon.
 51.339. Hwider arn þæt wæter on þam widgillan flode þa
þa þæt flod wanigende wæs?
 51.341. Wen is þæt þæt wæter gewende to þære
widgillan nywelnesse þurh þa æddran þisre eorþan.
 51.343. Be þan þe Salomon cwæð þæt ealle ean eft
gewendað þanon þe hi ær coman þæt he eft flowan magon.
 51.344. Hwi wæs mancynne fleascmettes alyfed æfter þam
flode & na ær?
 52.346. For þære eorþan unwæsmbærnysse & þæra
manna tyddernysse.
 52.347. Wise lareowas sædan þæt seo eorþe wære miccle
unwæstmbærre æfter þam flode þonne heo ær wære, þa þa
mancyn be hire wæstmum leofode.
 53.350. Hwi wæs se renboga to wedde gesett mancynne?
 53.351. God gesette þonne renbogan to wedde & to orsorhnysse
mancynne to þam behate þæt he næfre eft nolde ealne middaneard mid
anum flode oferteon.
 53.354. Forþan þe he wiste gif he swa ne dyde þæt men
woldan forhtigan þæt he mid flode eft fornumene wurdon þonne hy gesawon
swiðlice renas.
 54.356. Hwi is þæt tacn on þære lyfteran heofonan
gesewen?
 54.357. To þan þæt hit ealle men geseon magon & þæt
we beon gemyngode þæt we ure mod on ælcere gedrefednysse to Gode
awendon, se þe wunað on heofonum.
 55.360. Hwi is þæt tacn on mislices bleos?
 55.361. On þam tacne is wæteres hiw & fyres, &
þæt tacn þæt is se renboga cymð of þam sunbeame & of wætum
wolcne to þan þæt he sy middanearde to orsorhnysse mid þam
wæterigan bleo þæt wæter us eft ealle ne adrence.
 55.365. & þæt he sy to ogan mid þæs fyres hiwe,
þæt eall middaneard bið mid fyre forswæled on þam micclan dæge.
 56.367. Hu wæs þes middaneard todæled æfter þam
flode?
 56.368. Se yldesta Noes sunu Sem gestrynde mid his sunum seofon
& twentig suna & hi gebogodan þone east dæl middaneardes þe is
gehate Asia.
 56.371. Se oðer Noes sunu Cham gestrynde mid his sunum þrittig
suna, & hy gebogodan þone suðdæl þe is gehaten Affrica.
 56.373. Se þridda Noes sunu Iafeth gestrynde mid his sunum
fiftyne suna & þa gebogodan norðdæl þe is gehaten Europa.
 56.375. Þas ealle togædere syndon twa & hund seofontig
þeoda, & swa fela leorningcnihta sende Crist to bodigenne þone soðan
geleafan geond ealne middaneard.
 57.378. Hwa wolde ærest beon cyning on mancynne?
 57.379. Nembroð se ent se þe fyrmest wæs æt þære
getimbrunge þære mycclan byrig Babilonian on þære þe hi woldan
þone stypel up to heofenum aræran on þære wurdon þa gereord on twa
& hund seofantig todæled.
 58.383. On hwylcere mægðe þurhwunode þæt gereord þe
Adam hæfde?
 58.384. On þære Ebreiscan mægðe þe Crist syððan on
menniscnysse of acenneð wæs.
 58.386. Forðan þe hit gedafenode þæt mancynnes alysednys
wurde ærest geboded þurh þæt gereord þe ærest of com on
middanearde.
 59.388. Hwæt gemænað þa þreo utfæru þe God
Abrahame bead þus cweþende, Far of þinum lande & of þinre
mægðe & of þines fæderes huse & cum to þam lande þe ic
þe gewissige, & ic þe þar mærne gedo & þe gebletsige?
 59.392. Þæt getacnað þæt ða gecorenan Godes þegnas
sceolan forlætan þa flæslican lustas & ealle leahtras & þisne
middaneard on mode forseon, & to þam ecan eðle æfre gewilnian.
 60.395. Hu fela behata behet God Abrahame?
 60.396. Twa; An wæs þæt he & his ofspring sceoldan agan
þone eard Iudeisces landes;Oþer þæt he is þurh geleafan manegra
þeoda fæder, & ealle þeoda syndon gebletsode on his ofspringe,
þæt is on Criste.
 61.400. Ic axige hwæðer hit mihte gedafenian Abrahame þam
halgan were þæt he cwæde to þam cyninge Pharao be his wife Sarran
þæt heo his swustor wære, þe læs þe he for hire wlite wurde
ofslagen.
 61.404. Abraham geswutelode mid þære dæde þæt man ne
sceal fandian Godes, þa hwile þe he mæg mid ænigum gesceade himsylfum
gebeorgan.
 61.406. Se fandað Godes, se þe his agen gescead forlæt þe
him God forgeaf & swa butan gesceade secð Godes fultum.
 62.408. Hwæt wæs se Melchisedech se ðe wæs ægðer ge
cyning ge Godes sacerd, & eac se apostol Paulus cwæð be him þæt
he wære butan fæder & butan meder?
 62.411. Se Melchisedech wæs cyning & Godes sacerd swa
þæt he offrode þam ælmihtigan Gode hlaf & win.
 62.413. Forþon þe he getacnade urne Hælend Crist, se þe is
ealra cyninga cyning & ealra sacerda sacerd & he gehalgode husel of
hlafe & of wine & hine sylfne for us geoffrod.
 62.416. Næs Melchisedech butan fæder & meder acenned, ac
he leofode swa lange þæt man his cynn nyste.
 62.418. & forþi he getacnode Crist, se þe is acenned on
heofonum butan meder & on eorðan butan fæder.
 62.420. Be þam is awriten, <foreign>Tu es sacerdos in æternum
saecundum ordinem Melchesedech</foreign>, þæt is on englisc, þu eart sacerd on
ecnysse æfter melchisedehes endebyrdnysse.
 63.423. Hwæt wæs se Damascus þe Abraham embe spræc to
Gode & wende þæt he sceolde beon his yrfenuma?
 63.425. Se Damascus wæs Abrames gerefan sunu & he næs
Abrahames yrfenuma, ac wæs his agen sunu Isaac þe syððan wæs
geboren.
 63.426. Ac se Damascus getimbrode syððan ane burh & hire
naman gesceop be himsylfum, Damascum, & he on þære byrig rixade.
 64.430. Hwi is awriten on þære bec Genesis þæt Abrahames
cyn sceolde gecyrran ongean fram Egipta lande on þære feorþan mægðe
& seo oþer boc Exodus segð þæt hi ferdon of Egyptalanda on
þære fiftan mægðe?
 64.434. Iacob Abrahames suna sunu hæfde twelf suna.
 64.435. Þonne gif þu telst þa mægrace fram Iudan, þonne
findst þu þar fif mægða, & gif þu telst fram Leui þam gingran
breþer, þonne finst þu þar feower mægða.
 64.438. Is nu forþi ægðer soð.
 65.439. Hu mihte Abraham beon clæne þæt he nære forligr
geteald þa þa he hæfde cyfese under his riht wife?
 65.441. Abrahames wif wæs untymende oð hire ylde & þa
bæd heo hire were þæt he wið hire wylne tyman sceolde, & he swa
dyde, swiðor for bearn teame þonne for galnysse.
 65.444. & eac seo ealde æ þe þa stod næs swa stið
on þam þingum swa swa Cristes godspel is þe nu stent & tæcð to
anum wife.
 66.446. Hwæt gemænð þæt word þe God cwæð to
Abrahame þe þam synfullum leodscipum þus, þæra Sodomitiscra hream
astah up to heofenum?
 66.449. Seo syn bið mid stemne þonne se gylt bið on dæde.
 66.450. And seo syn bið mid hreame þonne se man syngað
freolice butan ælcere sceame.
 66.451. Swilce he his yfel oþrum mannum bodige.
 67.452. Hwi wolde God þa ylcan Sodomitiscan mid byrnendum
swæfle adydan & on Noes flode wurdon þa synfullan mid wætere
gewitnode?
 67.455. On Noes dagum gewitnode God manna galnysse mid wætere,
mid liðran gesceafte, for þan þe hi syngodan mid wifum, & þa
Sodomitiscan syngodon bysmorlice ongean gecynd & wurdon forþi mid
swæflenum fyre forswælede þæt heora fule galnys wurde mid þam
fulan swæfle gewitnod.
 67.460. On Noes flode wæs seo eorðe afeormad & eft
geedcucod, & on þæra Sodomitiscra gewitnunge forbarn seo eorþe &
bið æfre unwæstmbære & mid fulum wætere ofergan.
 67.463. On Noes dagum cwæð God be þam synfullum, ne
þurhwunað min gast on þisrum mannum on ecnysse, forþon þe hi synd
flæsc.
 67.466. Se gast getacnað her Godes yrre.
 67.466. Swylce God cwæde, Nelle ic þis mennisc gehealdan to
þam ecum witum, forþam þe hi synd tyddre.
 67.468. Ac ic wylle her on worulde him don edlean heora gedwyldes.
 67.469. Nis na þus awriten be þam Sodomitiscan þe ongean
gecynd sceamlice syngodon; forþan þe hi synd ecelice fordemede.
 68.472. Hwi wearð Lothes wif awend to sealtstane þa þa God
sende his twegen englas to ahreddene Loth & his wif & his twa dohtra of
þam fyre þe þa fif burga forbærnde?
 68.475. Ða Godes englas þe hi of þære byrig gelæddon
warnedon hi & þus cwædon,Ne behealde ge underbæc ac efstað aweg.
 68.477. Þa no þe læs beseah Lothes wif underbæc, &
wearð sona awend to anum sealt stane for þære getacnunge þæt nan
man ne sceal se ðe wile synnum ætberstan & to Godes þeowdome gebugan
beseon underbæc.
 68.481. Þæt is þæt he ne sceal gewilnian þa woruldlican
þing þe he ær forlet swa swa Crist cwæð to his discipulum: <foreign>Memores
estote uxoris Loth:</foreign> þæt is, beoð gemyndige Lothes wifes, þæt ge ne
bugon eft to weoroldþingum swa swa þæt wif wende underbæc.
 69.486. Hit is awriten on Genesis þæt God afandode Abrahames,
& se apostol Iacob awrat on his pistole þæt God ne costnað nænne
man.
 69.488. Hu mæg ægðer beon soð?
 69.489. God afandað þæs mannes na swilce he nyte ælces
mannes heortan ær he his fandige, ac he wyle þæt se man geþeo on
þære fandunge & his ingehyd beo geopenad.
 69.492. God afandode Abrahames swa þæt he het hine niman his
leofan sunu Isaac & geoffrode Gode to lace, & syððan ofslean on
þa ealdan wisan.
 69.495. Ða wæs Abraham Gode gehyrsum & wæs him leofre
þæt he Godes hæse gefylde þonne he his leofan bearne gearode, &
he wæs þa afandod & gerihtwisod & gewuldorbeagod swa þæt God
him cwæð to, On þinum ofspringe beoð ealle eorðlice mægða
gebletsode.
 69.500. Þus afandode God his gecorenan, na swylce he nyte heora
ingehyd, ac he wyle þæt hi beon geþungenran on þære fandunge.
 69.502. Oþer is seo fandung þe Iacob se apostol embe spræc,
þæt is seo costnung þe gewemð þone man to synnigenne.
 69.504. Ac God ne costnað nænne man, forþan þe he nele
nænne to synnum gebigan, ac þeos costnung is of þam niðfullan deofle
& of yfelum luste.
 69.507. & se lust acynð þa synne, & seo syn þonne heo
bið geendod acenð þone ecan deað.
 69.509. Nelle we na swiðor embe þis sprecan, forþan þe we
habbað þa nyd be hefestan axunga nu awritene, ac we secgað nu be þam
soðan Gode þe ealle þing gesceop se ðe ana is God, þæt he is
wunigende swa swa þa witegan secgað, æfre on þrim hadum butan anginne
& ende.
 69.514. Se ælmihtiga fæder nis of nanum oðrum gestrynde,
ænne sunu of him anum acennede, & se wæs æfre wuniende ær
anginne mid him on his bosme halgum & þurh hine gesceop ealle þa
gesceafta þe gesceapene syndon.
 69.519. Forþam þe he is wisdom of þam wisan fæder, &
seo micele miht of þam mihtigan fæder, þurh þone þe he gedihte
þone deopan cræft & he ealle þing geliffæste þurh þone
lyfigendan gast, se þe is witodlice heora willa & lufu him bam gemæne
on anre godcundnysse & on anum mægenþrymme anes gecyndes.
 69.525. He nis na acenned ac cymð of him bam, swa swa lufu &
willa, forþan þe hi willað an, se fæder & se sunu & se
foresæda halga gast.
 69.528. Hi synd þry on naman on þrynysse wunigende, ac seo an
godcundnyss þe him eallum is gemæne nele geþafian þæt hi þry
godas syndon, ac an ælmihtig God on soðre annysse.
 69.531. Nu is se fæder & se sunu & heora begra willa,
þæt is witodlice seo lufu heora micclan mægenþrymmes æfre swa
wunigende þæt heora nan nis læssa ne lator þonne oþer.
 69.535. Forþon þe seo godcundnyss ne gæð næfre on twa,
ne heo nateshwomne underfohð nane lytlunge.
 69.537. Se sunu ana is soðlice acenned ærest of þam fæder
butan ælcere meder, & eft of Marian butan eorðlicum fæder, þæt
he us alysde & lif forgeafe an his heofonlican wuldre mid his halgum
englum.
 69.541. Þæs we him þanciað on urum þeowdome & his
halgan fæder þe hine asende to us, þam is a wurðmynt mid þam halgan
gaste, on ealra worulda woruld we cweðað, Amen.

ÆAbusMor
B1.6.2.1.
De duodecim abusivis (Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, MS. 178): Morris 1868, 296-304.



 1. <foreign>Omnia nimia nocent et temperantia mater uirtutum dicitur</foreign>,
þæt is on englisc, ealle oferdone þingc deriað & seo gemetegung is
ealra mægna modor.
 3. Se oferlyfa on æte & on wæte deð þone man unhalne
& his sawle gode læðetteð swa swa ure drihten on his godspelle
cwæð.
 5. Eft þær togeanes ungemetgod fæsten & to mycel
forhæfdnyss on æte & on wæte deð þone man unhalne & on
mycelre frecednysse gebringð swa swa us secgað bec þæt sume men
fæstan swa þæt hi geswencton hy sylfe forþearle & nane mede
næfdon þæs mycclan geswinces ac þæs þe fyrr wæron from Godes
miltsunge.
 10. Eaðe mæg se mann findan hu he hine sylfne amyrre ac we
sceolan witan þæt nan sylfcwala þæt is agenslaga ne becymð to Godes
rice.
 12. Nu syndon eahte heafodleahtras þa us onwinnað swiðe.
 13. An is gecweden <foreign>gula</foreign>, þæt is gifernyss on Englisc seo
deð þæt man ytt ær timan & drincð oððe he eft to mycel
nimð on æte oððe on wæte.
 15. Seo fordeð ægðer ge sawle ge lichaman forþam þe heo
macað þam menn mycele untrumnysse & to deaðe gebringð mid
ormætum drencum.
 18. Heo fordeð eac þa sawle forþan þe he sceal syngian oft
þone he sylf nat hu he færð for his feondlicum drencum.
 20. Se oðer leahter is forliger & ungemetgod galnyss se is
gehaten <foreign>fornicatio</foreign>.
 21. & he befylð þone mannan & macað of Cristes limum
myltestrena lima & of Godes temple gramena wununge.
 22. Se þridda is <foreign>auaritia</foreign>, þæt is seo yfele gitsung &
seo is wyrtruma ælcere wohnysse.
 24. Heo gemacað reaflac & unrihte domas, stala & leasunga
& forswornysse.
 25. Heo is helle gelic forþam þe hi habbað butu unafylledlice
grædignesse þæt hi fulle ne beoð næfre.
 26. Se feorða leahter is <foreign>ira</foreign> gehaten, þæt is on englisc
weamodnyss.
 27. Se deð þæt se mann nah his modes geweald & macað
manslyhtas & mycele yfelu.
 29. Se fifta is <foreign>tristitia</foreign>, þæt is þisre worulde unrotnyss,
þonne se mann geunrotsað ealles to swiðe for his æhta lyre þe he
lufode swiðe & cit þonne wið God & his synna geeacnað.
 31. Twa unrotnyssa synd, an is þeos yfele, oðer is halwende
þæt man for his synnum geunrotsige.
 33. Se syxta leahter is <foreign>accidia</foreign> gehaten, þæt is asolcennyss
oððe slæwð on englisc, þonne þam men ne lyst nan good don on his
life & bið him þonne micel yfel þæt he ne mæge nan good don and
bið æfre ungeru to ælcere dugoðe.
 37. Se seofoþa leahter is <foreign>iactantia</foreign> gehaten, þæt is
idelgylp on engliscre spræce, þonne se man bið lofgeorn & mid
licetunge færð & deð forgylpe gif he hwæt dælan wyle &
bið se hlisa his edlean þære dæde & hys wite andbidað on
þære toweardan worulde.
 41. Se eahtoða leahter is <foreign>superbia</foreign> gehaten, þæt is on
englisc modignyss gecweden seo is ord & ende ælcere synne.
 42. Seo geworte englas to atolicum deoflum & þone mann
macað eac gif he modegað to swiðe þæs deofles geferan þe feoll
ær þurh hi.
 45. Nu syndon eahta heafodmægna þe magon oferswiðan þas
foresædan deoflu þurh Drihtnes fultum.
 46. An is <foreign>temperantia</foreign>, þæt is gemetegung on englisc þæt
man beo gemetegad & to mycel ne þicge on æte & on wæte ne ær
timan ne gereordige.
 48. Nytenu etað swa ær swa hi hyt habbað ac se gesceadwisa
mann sceal cepan his mæles & þonne hys gesetnysse mid gesceade healdan
þonne mæg he oferswiðan swa þa gifernysse.
 51. Seo oðer miht is <foreign>castitas</foreign>, þæt is clænnyss on
englisc, þæt se læweda hine healde buton forligre on rihtum gesinscipe
mid gesceadwisnysse & se gehadoda Godes þeowa healde his clænnysse.
 54. þonne bið oferswiðed seo galnyss.
 55. Seo þridde miht is <foreign>largitas</foreign>, þæt is cystignes on
englisc þæt man wislice aspende na for woruldgilpe þa þing þe him
god lænde on þisum life to brucenne.
 57. God nele þæt we beon grædige gitseras ne eac for
woruldgilpe forworpan ure æhta ac dælan hi mid gesceade swa swa hit
Drihtne licige & gif we ælmyssan doð don hi butan gilpe.
 60. þonne mage we fordon swa þa deofollican gitsunge.
 61. Seo feorþe miht is <foreign>patientia</foreign>, þæt is geþyld
gecweden, þæt se man beo geþyldig & þolmod for Gode & læte
æfre his gewitt gewyldre þonne his yrre forþam þe se Hælend
cwæð þus on his godspelle, <foreign>In patientia uestra possidebitis animas
uestras</foreign>, þæt is on engliscre spræce, on eowrum geþylde ge habbað
eowre sawla soðlice gehealdene.
 66. Se heofonlica wisdom cwæð þæt þæt yrre hæfð
wununge on þæs dysegan bosme þonne he bið to hrædmod & se eall
waldenda dema demð æfre mid smyltnysse & we sceolan mid geþylde
oferswiðan þæt yrre.
 69. Se fifte miht is <foreign>spiritalis laetitia</foreign>, þæt is seo
gastlice bliss, þæt man on God blissige betwux unrotnyssum þissere
reðan worulde swa þæt we on ungelimpum ormode ne beon ne eft on
gesælðum to swiðe ne blissian.
 73. & gif we forleosað þas lænan weoruld þing þonne
sceole we witan þæt ure wunung nis na her ac is on heofenum gif we
hopiað to Gode.
 75. þyder we sceolan efstan of þissere earfoðnysse mid
gastlicre blisse.
 76. þonne bið seo unrotnyss mid ealle oferswiðed mid urum
geþylde.
 77. Seo syxte miht is <foreign>instantia boni operis</foreign>, þæt is,
anrædnyss goodes weorces.
 78. Gif we beoð anræde on goodum weorcum þonne magon we
oferswiðan þa asolcennysse swa forþam þe hyt bið langsum bysmor gif
ure lif byð unnyt her.
 81. Seo seofoðe miht is seo soðe lufu to Gode, þæt we on
godum weorcum Godes lufe cepan na ideles gylpes þe hym is andsæte.
 83. Ac uton don ælmessan swa swa he us tæhte gode to lofe na
us to hlisan þæt God sy geherod on urum goodum weorcum & se idela gilp
us beo æfre unwurð.
 85. Seo ahtoþe miht is seo soðe eadmodnyss ge to Gode ge to
mannum mid modes hluttornysse forþam se ðe wis bið ne wyrð he næfre
modig.
 87. On hwam mæg se mann modigian þeah ðe he wille?
 88. Ne mæg he on geþingcðum forþam þe fela synd
geþungenran.
 89. Ne mæg he on his æhtum forþam þe he hys ende dæg
nat.
 90. Ne on nanum þingum he ne mæg modigian gif hi wis bið.
 91. Nu ge habbað gehyred hu þas halgan mægnu oferswiðað
þa leahtras þe deofol besæwð on us.
 92. & gif we nellað hi oferswiðan hi besencað us on
helle.
 93. We magon þurh Godes fultum þa feondlican leahtras mid
gecampe oferwinnan gif we cenlice feohtað & habban us on ende þone ecan
wurðmynt a mid Gode sylfum gif we swincað nu her.
 96. Nu synd twelf <foreign>abusiua</foreign>, þæt synd twelf unþeawas þa we
eow secgað on leden & syððan on englisc.
 98. <foreign>Duodecim abusiua sunt seculi. Hoc est, sapiens sine operibus
bonis, senex sine religione, adolescens sine oboedientia, diues sine
aelemosina, femina sine pudicitia, dominus sine uirtute, Xpristianus
contentiosus, pauper superbus, rex iniquus, episcopus neglegens, plebs sine
disciplina, populus sine lege et sic suffocatur iustitia dei.</foreign> Twelf unþeawas
syndon on þyssere worulde to hearme eallum mannum gif hi moton ricsian &
hi alecgað rihtwisnysse & þone geleafan amyrrað & mancynn
gebringað gif hi moton to helle.
 106. þæt is gif se wita bið butan goodum weorcum & gif
se ealda butan eawfæstnysse & se welega butan ælmæsdædum, wif
butan sydefulnysse & hlaford butan mihte & gif se cristena bið
sacfull & gif þearfa bið modig, gif se cyning bið unrihtwis & se
biscop gymeleas, þæt folc butan steore oððe butan æ.
 111. Nu gif se wita bið butan goodum weorcum se ðe oþrum
mannum sceolde syllan gode bysne hu ne bið sona his lar þam læwedum
mannum unwyrð gif he sylf nele don swa swa he hym to donne tæcð?
 114. Ne bið se lareowdom þam læwedum fremfull gif se lareow
mid weorcum towyrpð his bodunge.
 115. Eft gif se lareow dwelað hwa bið his lareow syððan?
 116. & gif þæt eage ablindað ne bið seo hand
lociende.
 117. Se ealda mann þe bið butan eawfæstnysse bið þam
treowe gelic þe leaf byrð & blostman & nænne wæstm ne byrð
& bið unwurð his hlaforde.
 119. Hwæt bið æfre swa stuntlic swa þæt se ealda nelle
his mod to Gode awendan mid goodum inngehyde þonne his lima hym cyðað
þæt he ne bið cucu lange?
 121. Iungum mannum mæg twynian hwæðer hi motan libban &
se ealda mæg witan gewiss him þone deað.
 123. ðam ealdun is to warnienne wið þa yfelan geþohtas
forþam þe seo heorte ne ealdað ne eac seo tunge ac þas twegen dælas
deriað oft þam ealdum.
 125. Wite forþi se ealda hwæt his ylde gedafenige & þa
þing forseo þe his sawle deriað.
 127. Se þridda unþeaw is on þissere worulde þæt se iunga
mann beo butan gehyrsumnysse.
 128. Unwyrðe bið se on ylde þæt him oðre menn þenion
se þe on iuguðe nele his yldrum gehyrsumian.
 129. Ure Hælend on his iugoðe wæs gehyrsum his magon &
his heofonlican fæder he gehyrsumode oð deað.
 131. Swa swa þam ealdan gedafeniað dugende þeawas &
geripod syfernyss swa gerist þam iungan þæt he hæbbe gehyrsumnysse
& underþeodnysse.
 133. Godes æ byt eac þæt man arwurþige symble hys
fæder & modor mid mycelre underþeodnysse & gif he hi wyrigð he
byð wyrðe deaðes.
 135. Se feorþa unþeaw is þæt se welega mann beo butan
ælmesdædum & bediglige hys feoh & geornlice healde hym to helle
wite.
 137. Ungesælig bið se gitsere þe þurh hys gesælþa
losað & for þam gewitendlicum þingum forwyrð a on ecnysse.
 139. And gesælige beoð symle þa mildheortan forþam þe hi
gemetað þa mildheortnysse eft.
 140. Se þe dælð ælmyssan for his Drihtnes lufan se behyt
his goldhord on heofonan rice þær nan sceaða ne mæg his madmas
forstelan ac hi beoð be hundfealdum gehealdene him þær.
 143. On manegum wisum man mæg wyrcan ælmyssan on æte &
on wæte & on gewædum eac & on cumliðnysse þæt man cuman
underfo & gif man seocne geneosað oððe sarigne frefrað oððe
blindne læt oððe byrð wanhalne oððe unhalne gelacnað gif he
læcedom can oððe gif he ræd tæcð þam þe rædes behofað
oððe gif he miltsað þam menn þe him abealh oððe gif he gehergodne
of æftnyde gedeð oððe gyf he forðfarene ferað to byrgene.
 150. Eall þis bið ælmysse & eac þæt man beswinge
þone stuntan for steore se þe styran sceal forþam þe he deð
mildheortnysse gif he þone mann rihtlæcð.
 153. Ne licge on þinum horde þæt þam hafenleasan mæge
fremian to bigwiste forþam þe þu ne brycst ana þinra welena þeah þu
wolice healde.
 155. þu gaderast ma & ma & menn cwelað hungre &
þine welan forrotiað ætforan þinum eagum.
 156. Doð swa swa drihten cwæð, dælað ælmyssan &
ealle þing eow beoð clæne, þis he cwæð on his godspelle.
 158. Se fifta unþeaw is þæt wif beo unsydefull.
 159. Unsydefulnys bið sceamu for worulde & þæt
unsydefulle wif bið unwurð on life & eft æfter life nan edlean
næfð æt Gode.
 161. Wisdom gerist werum & wifum forþam seo sidefulnyss
gescylt hi wið unþeawas.
 162. þær þær seo sidefulnyss bið ðær bið eac seo
clænnyss & þæt sidefulle wif onscunað gitsunge & ceaste ne
astyrað ac gestilð graman & forsihð galnysse & grædignysse
gemetegað.
 165. Heo hi warnað wið druncennysse & wordlunge ne
lufað.
 166. witodlice se sidefulnyss gewylt ealle unþeawas & goode
þeawas heo hylt þe gode liciað & mannum.
 167. Seo syxta unþeaw is þæt se ðe to hlaforde bið geset
þæt he for modleaste ne mæge his mannum don steore ac bið him swa
mihtleas on his modes strece þæt he his underþeoddan egesian ne dear ne
to nanum wisdome hi gewissian nele.
 171. Sume hlafordas genealæcað þurh heora hlafordscipe to
Gode swa Moyses se arwurða þe to þæm ælmihtigan gode spræc &
sume on heora anwalde þone ælmihtigan gremiað swa swa Saul dyde þe
foseah Godes hæse.
 174. Se hlaford sceal beon liðe þam goodum & egefull þam
dysegum þæt he heora dysig alecge & he sceal beon wordfæst &
witan hwæt he clypige hine man sceal lufian for his liðnysse & þa
dysegan sceolon ondrædan hyne symle.
 178. Elles ne bið his gefadung ne fæst ne langsum.
 179. He sceal beon swa geworht þæt him man mote wið sprecan
& swa hwæt swa he wrece wrece for rihtwisnysse na for his agenum yrre ac
for Godes ege.
 181. Hyt is awriten on bocum þæt se bið eall swa scyldig se
þe yfel geþafað swa swa þe ðe hyt deð gyf he hyt gebetan mæg
& ymbe þa bote ne hogað.
 183. He sceal hyne geþeodan mid þeawfæstnysse to Gode
forþam þe he nane mihte habban ne mæg to rihte butan Godes fylste swa
swa God sylf cwæð.
 185. Se hlaford sceal hogian þæt he hæbbe Godes fultum
& he ortruwian ne sceal ahwær be Godes fultume.
 187. Gif God bið his gefylsta ne bið his miht forsewen forþam
þe nan miht nis butan of Gode seðe ahefð of meohse þone mann þe he
wile þeah þe he wædla wære & wyrcð hine to ealdre.
 190. He awyrpð þa modigan of heora mihtesetle & ahefð
þa eadmodan þæt eall middaneard beo Gode underþeod & beþurfe his
wuldres.
 192. Se seofoþa unþeaw is þæt se cristena mann beo
sacfull.
 193. Of cristes naman is cristianus gecweden, þæt is se
cristena mann þe on criste is gefullod.
 194. Gif he þonne bið sacfull ne bið he soðlice cristen.
 195. Nis nan man rihtlice cristen butan se ðe Criste
geefenlæcð.
 196. Crist sylf nolde flitan swa swa his fæder cwæð be hym,
Efne her is min cild þe me is swiðe leof & ic sette minne gast
soðlice ofer hine.
 198. Ne flit he mid ceaste ne sace ne astyreð ne on strætum ne
gehyrð ænig mann hys stemne.
 200. He cwæð eac on his godspelle þæt þa beoð Godes
bearn þa þe gesibsume beoð & sace ne astyriað.
 201. Swa swa þa gesibbsuman beoð soðlice Godes bearn swa
beoð þa eac sacfullan deofles bearn.
 203. Ealle we clypiað to Gode & cweðað, <foreign>pater noster</foreign>,
þu ure fæder þe eart on heofenum.
 204. Ac we ne magon habban þone heofonlican eþel buton we fram
eallum sacum orsorge beon.
 206. Se eahtoða unþeaw is þæt se þearfa beo modig.
 207. Menig mann næfð æhta & hæfð modignysse swa
þeah & is earm for worulde & ungesælig for Gode þonne he
arærð his mod mid modignysse ongean God & nele on his yrmðe
eadmodnysse healdan.
 210. Crist cwæð on his godspelle be þam gastlican þearfum,
<foreign>Beati pauperes spiritu quoniam ipsorum est regnum celorum</foreign>, Eadige synd þa
þearfan þa þe on gaste synd þearfan forþam ðe hym bið forgifen
heofonanrices myrhðe.
 213. þa beoð þearfan on gaste þa þe for Godes lufan
beoð eadmode forþam þe þæs modes eadmodnyss mæg begitan Godes
rice hroðor þonne seo hafenleast þe of hynþum becymð.
 216. Witodlice þa rican þe rihtlice libbað magon beon
getealde betwux Godes þearfum gif hi eadmodnysse habbað &
oferflowednysse forlætað swa swa Dauid cyning cwæð be him sylfum,
<foreign>Ego uero egenus et pauper sum Deus adiuua me</foreign>, Ic eom wædla & þearfa,
God fylst þu me.
 220. Se modiga þearfa for his modes upahefednysse is to rican
geteald rihtlice on bocum & se eadmoda rica þeah ðe he æhta hæbbe
mæg beon Godes þearfa gif he Gode gecwemð.
 223. Se nigoþa unþeaw is þæt se cyning beo unrihtwis.
 224. Se cyning bið gecoren to þam þe him cyð his nama.
 225. <foreign>Rex</foreign> we cweþað cyning, þæt is gecweden wissigend,
forþam þe he sceal wissigan mid wisdome his folce & unriht alecgan
& þone geleafan aræran & þonne byð hit earmlic gif he bið
unrihtwis forþam þe he ne gerihtlæcð nænne gif he unrihtwis bið
sylf.
 229. þæs cyninges rihtwisnyss arærð his cynesetl &
þæs folces steore gestaþelað his soðfæstnyss.
 230. þæt is cyninges rihtwisnyss þæt he mid riccetere ne
ofsitte ne earmne ne eadigne ac ælcum deme riht.
 232. He sceal beon bewergend wydewena & steopcilda & stala
alecgan & forliger gewitnian & þa arleasan adræfan of his earde
mid ealle wiccecræft alecgan & wiglunge ne gyman.
 235. Witan hym sceolan rædan & he ne sceal beon weamod.
 236. Godes mynstra he sceal mundian æfre & fedan þearfan
& fæstlice winnan wið onsigendne here & healdan his eðel.
 238. He sceal soðfæste menn settan hym to gerefan & for
Gode lybban hys lif rihtlice & beon on earfoðnysse anræde & eadmod
on stilnysse & his ofsprynge ne geþafige þæt hy arlease beon.
 241. He sceal hyne gebiddan on asettum tidum & ær
mæltidum metes ne abitan.
 242. Forþam þe hit is awriten þæt wa þære leode þar
se cining bið cild & þar þa ealdormenn etað on ærnemergen
uneawfæstlice.
 244. Gif se cyning wile mid carfulnysse healdan þas foresædan
beboda þonne byð his rice gesundfull on life & æfter life he mot
faran to þam ecan for his arfæstnysse.
 246. Gif he þonne forsyhð þas gesetnyssa & lare þonne
byð his eard geyrmed for oft ægðer ge on heregunge ge on hungre ge on
cwealme ge on ungewyderum ge on wildeorum.
 249. Wite eac se cyning hu hyt is geweden on bocum gif he
rihtwisnysse ne hylt þæt swa swa he ahafan is on his cynesetle toforan
odrum mannum swa he bið eft genyþerad on þam nyþemestam witum under
þam unrihtwisum þe he unrædlice geheold.
 253. Se teoða unþeaw is þæt se bisceop beo gymeleas.
 254. <foreign>Episcopus</foreign> is grecisc nama þæt is on leden <foreign>speculator</foreign>
& on englisc sceawere forþam þe he is geset to þam þæt he
ofersceawian sceole mid hys gymene þa læwedan swa swa God sylf cwæð
to Ezechiele þam witegan, <foreign>Speculatorem dedi te domui Israeles</foreign>, Ic þe
gesette to sceawere soðlice minum folce Israheles hirede þæt ðu gehyre
mine word & of minum muðu mine spræce hym cyde.
 260. Gif þu þam arleasan nelt hys arleasnysse secgan þonne
swylt se arleasa on his arleasnysse & ic ofgange æt þe mid graman his
blod.
 262. Gif þu þonne warnast þone arleasan wer & he nelle
gecyrran fram his synnum þurh þe he swylt on hys unrihtwisnysse & þin
sawul bið alysed.
 264. Gif se bisceop bið gymeleas þonne he Godes bydel is &
to lareowe geset þam læwedum folce þonne losiað fela sawla & he
sylf forð mid for his gimeleaste ac þæt folc bið gesælig þurh
snotorne bisceop þe him segð Godes lare & healt hy under Gode swa swa
good hyrde þæt hi beon gehealdene & he hæbbe þa mede.
 269. Se endlyfta unþeaw is þæt folc beo butan steore.
 270. Fela beoð stuntnyssa þær nan steor ne bið &
þær þæt dysig bið orsorh & þæt gedwyld ricsað þær
bið yfel to wunienne ænigum wisan men.
 272. Be þam cwæð se sealmwyrhta þisum wordum clypiende,
<foreign>Adprehendite disciplinam ne quando irascatur dominus & pereatis de uia
iusta</foreign> þæt is, underfoð steore þe læs þe God yrsige wið eow
& ge þonne losian of þam rihtan wege.
 275. Eac Paulus se apostol cwæð on his pistole, þurhwuniað
on steore & gewitodlice beoð swylce forligeras gif ge libbað butan
steore.
 277. Eft se witega Isaias be þam ilcan cwæð, <foreign>Quiescite
agere peruerse discite, bene facere</foreign>, Geswicað þwyrlicra dæda &
leorniað good to wyrcanne.
 280. Dauid cwæð eac, <foreign>Declina a malo & fac bonum</foreign>, Buh
fram yfele & do good.
 281. Gif þu unsceððig si gescyld þe wið yfel & gif
þu sceððig wære gewend þe fram yfele þy læs þe þu steorleas
losige on ende.
 283. Se twelfta unþeaw is þæt folc beo butan æ we ne
moton nu healdan Moyses æ on þa ealdan wisan æfter ures Hælendes
tocyme ac we sceolan gefyllan swa we fyrmost magon þæs Hælendes beboda
& þa beoð us for æ forþam þe we beoð butan him gif we hys
beboda ne healdað.
 287. Manega wegas synd swa swa se wisdom clypað.
 288. þe mannum þingað rihte ac hi swa þeah gelædað to
deaðe on ende þa þe hym dyslice folgiað.
 289. Se þe Godes æ forlæt seo þe is ure weg se sceal
mislice faran on manegum gedwyldum.
 291. Crist sylf is se weg swa swa he sæde be hym, <foreign>Ego sum uia
& ueritas & uita</foreign>, Ic sylf eom se weg & soðfæstnys & lif,
Nan man ne mæg becuman to minum heofonlican fæder buton þurh me.
 294. Ac we beoð þurh Crist to heofenum gebrohte gif we his
biggengas healdað.
 295. ða þe butan Godes æ & Godes gesetnyssum libbað
þa beoð butan Gode æfre wunigende.
 297. Drihten sylf behet þis þam þe healdað hys beboda,
<foreign>Ecce ego uobiscum sum omnibus diebus usque ad consummationem seculi</foreign>, Ic sylf
beo mid eow soðlice eallum dagum oð geendunge þissere worulde.
 300. Se Hælend us gewissige to hys willan symble þæt ure
sawla moton siðian eft to him æfter urum life to þam ecan life þæt
he ure sawla underfo þe hi asende to þam lichaman.
 302. Sy him a wuldor & wurðmynt Amen.

ÆAbusWarn
B1.6.2.2.
De duodecim abusivis (London, British Library, MS. Cotton Vespasian D.XIV): Warner 1917, 11-19.



 1. Nu synd twelf <foreign>abusiua</foreign>, þæt synd twelf unþeawes þe we
eow secgeð on Leden & syððen on ænglisc.
 2. <foreign>Duodecim abusiua sunt seculi, Hoc est, sapiens sine operibus
bonis, senex sine religone, adolescens sine obedientia, diues sine elemosina,
femina sine pudicitia, dominus sine uirtute, christianus contentiosus , pauper
superbus, rex iniguus, episcopus negligens, plebs sine disciplina, populus sine
lege et sic suffocatur iusticia dei,</foreign> Twelf unðeawes synden on þyssen
wurlde to hearme eallen mannen gyf heo moten rixigen, & heo alecgeð
rihtwisnysse & þone geleafe amerreð & mancynn gebringeð gyf heo
moten to helle. þæt is gyf se wyte beo bute gode weorcan, & gyf se
ealde beo buten eawfæstnysse, se junge buten gehyrsumnysse & se welige
buten ælmesdæden, wif buten sydefullnysse & hlaford bute mihte &
gyf se cristene byð sacfull & gyf þearfe byð modig, gyf se cyng byð
unrihtwis & se biscop gemeleas, þæt folc buten steore, oððe folc
buten æ.
 17. Nu gyf se wyte byð buten gode weorcan se þe oðre mannen
scolde syllen gode bisne, hwu ne byð sone his lare þan læwede mannen
unwurð, gyf he sylf nyle don, swa swa he heom to done tæhð?
 20. Ne byð se lare freomful, gyf se larðeaw mid weorcan
towurpð his bodunge.
 21. Eft gyf se larðeaw dweleð, hwa byð his larðeaw
syððen?
 22. Gyf þæt eage ablindeð, ne byð seo hand lochigende.
 23. Se ealde mann þe byð buten æwfæstnysse byð þan
treowwe gelic, þe leaf berð & blostmen, & nænne wæstme ne
berð, & byð unwurð his hlaforde.
 25. Hwæt byð æfre swa stuntlic, swa þæt se ealde nelle
his mod to Gode gewænden mid goden ingehyde, þonne his lymen hym cyðeð
þæt he ne byð cwica lange?
 27. Junge mannen mæig tweonigen hweðer heo moten libben, &
se ealde mæig wyten gewiss him þone deað.
 29. Þan ealden is to warnigen wið þa yfele geðohtes,
forþan þe seo heorte ne ealdeð, ne eac seo tunge, ac þas twegen
dæles derigeð of þan ealden.
 31. Wyte for þy se ealde hwæt his elde gedafenige, & þa
þing forseo þe his sawle derigeð.
 33. Se þridde unðeaw is on þyssen wurlde, þæt se junge
mann beo buten gehersumnysse.
 34. Unwurð byð se on elde þæt him oðre mænn
þenigen, se þe on jugoðe nele his eldren gehersumigen.
 35. Ure Hælend on his jugoðe wæs gehyrsum his magen, &
his Heofonlice Fæder he gehyrsumode oð deað.
 37. Swa swa þan ealden gedafonigeð dugende þeawes &
geripode syfernysse, swa gerist þan jungan þæt he habbe gehyrsumnysse
& underðeodnysse.
 39. Godes æ beot eac þæt mann arwurðige symle his
fæder & moder mid mycelre underðeodnysse, & gyf he heo weregað,
he byð wurðe deaðes.
 41. Se feorðe unðeaw is, þæt se welige mann beo buten
ælmesdæden, & bedigelige his feoh, & geornlice healde him to
hellewite.
 43. Ungesælig byð se gitsere, þe þurh his gesælðe
losað, & for þan gewitegendlice þingan forwurð a on ecnysse.
 45. & gesælige byð symle þa mildheorte, for þan þe
heo gemeteð þa mildheortnysse eft.
 46. Se þe dælð ælmesse for his Drihtenes lufen, se behytt
his goldhord on heofone rice, þær nan sceaðe ne mæig his madmes
forstelen, ac heo byð beo hundfealden gehealden him þær.
 49. On manegan þingen man mæig wyrcen ælmessen, on æte
& on wæte & on gewæden eac & on cumliðnysse, þæt man
cumen underfo, & gyf man seocne geneoseð, oððe sarigne gefrefroð,
oððe blindne lætt, oððe berð wanhale, oððe wanhale
gelæcneð, gyf he læcedom cann, oððe ræd tæcheð þan þe
rædes behofeð, oððe gyf he miltseð þan mæn þe hine abealh,
oððe gyf he geheregodne of hæftnoðe gedeð, oððe gyf he
forðfarene fereð to byrigene.
 56. Ealle þiss byð ælmesse, & eac þæt mann beswinge
þone stunten for steore, se þe steren sceal, forþan þe he deð
mildheortnysse, gyf he þone man gerihtlæceð.
 58. Ne licge on þine horde, þæt þan hafeleasen mæig
freomigen to bigwisten, forþan þe þu ne brucst ane þinre welena þeh
þu heo wolice healde.
 60. Þu gaderest ma & ma & mæn cweleð hungre, &
þine welen forrotigeð ætforen þinen eagen.
 62. Doð swa swa Drihten cwæð, Dæleð ælmessen &
ealle þing eow byð clæne, þiss he cwæð on his godspelle.
 63. Se fifte unðeaw is, þæt wif beo unseodefull.
 64. Unseodefull byð scame for wurlde, & þæt unsedefulle
wif byð unwurð on life, & eft æfter life nan edlean næfð æt
Gode.
 66. Wisedom gerist weren & wifen sydefullnysse, for þan seo
sydefullnysse gescylt heo wið unðeawes.
 67. Þær þær seo seodefullnysse byð, þær byð eac
clænnysse, & þæt seodefulle wif onscuneð gittsunge & ceaste
ne astyreð, ac gestilleð gramen & forsihð galnysse &
grædignysse gemetegað.
 70. Heo heo warneð wið druncannysse & wordlunge ne
lufeð.
 71. Witodlice seo sydefullnysse gewyllt ealle unðeawes, &
gode þeawes heo healt þe Gode lichigeð & mannen.
 73. Se sixte unðeaw is, þæt se þe to hlaforde beo gesett,
þæt for modeleaste ne muge his mannen don steore, ac byð he swa
mihteleas on his modes strece, þæt he his underðeodden egesigen ne
dearr, ne to nane wisedome he gewissigen nele.
 76. Sume hlafordes genealæceð þurh heora hlafordscipe to
Gode, swa swa Moyses se arwurðe, þe to þan ælmihtigen spæc &
sume on heora anweald þone ælmihtigen græmigeð, swa swa Saul dyde,
þe forseh Godes hæse.
 80. Se hlaford sceal beon liðe þan goden & egefull þan
dysigen, þæt he heora dysig alecge, & he sceal beon wordfæst, &
wyten hwæt he clypige, hine man sceal lufigen for his liðnysse & þa
dysige scylen ondræden hine symle.
 83. Elles ne byð his gefadung ne fæst ne langsum.
 84. He sceal beon swa geworht, þæt him wið mote specan,
& swa hwæt swa he wreca, wreca for rihtwisnysse, na for his agene yrre,
ac for Godes ege.
 86. Hit is gewriten on bocan, þæt se byð eall swa scyldig,
se þe þæt yfel geðafoð, swa swa se þe hit deð, gyf he hit
gebeten mæig, & emb þa bote ne hogeð.
 88. He sceal hine geðeodan mid þeawfæstnysse to Gode, for
þan þe he nane mihte habben, ne mæig to rihte buten Godes fylste, swa
swa God sylf cwæð.
 91. Se hlaford sceal hogien þæt he habbe Godes fylst, & he
ortuwigen ne sceal ahwar beo Godes fultume.
 92. Gyf God byð his gefylste, ne byð his mihte forseowen, for
þan þe nan mihte nis buten of Gode, se þe ahefð of mixe þone mann
þe he wyle, þeh he wædle wære, & wyrcð hine to ealdre.
 95. He awyrpþ þa modige of heora mihtesetle, & ahefð þa
eadmede, þæt eall middeneard beo Gode underðeodd & beðurfe his
wuldres.
 97. Se seofoðe unðeaw is þæt se cristene man beo sacfull.
 98. Of Cristes name is christianus gehaten, þæt is se cristene
mann, þe on Criste is gefulhtod.
 99. Gyf he þonne byð sacfull, ne byð he soðlice cristene.
 100. Nis nan mann soðlice cristen, bute se þe Criste
geefenlæceð.
 101. Crist sylf nolde fliten, swa swa his Fæder cwæð beo
him, Efne her is min cild þe me is swyðe leof, & ic sette minne Gast
soðlice ofer hine.
 103. Ne flitt he mid ceaste, ne saca ne astyreð, ne on stræte
ne gehyrð ænig mann his stæmne.
 105. He cwæð eac on his godspelle, þæt þa byð Godes
bearn, þa þe gesibsume byð, & saca ne astyrigeð.
 106. Swa swa þa gesibsume soðlice Godes bearn byð, swa byð
eac þa sacfulle soðlice deofles bearn.
 108. Ealle we clypigeð to Gode & cweðeð, <foreign>Pater noster</foreign>,
þu ure fæder þe eart on heofone.
 109. Ac we ne mugen habben þone heofonlice eðel bute we fram
eallen sacan orsorge beon.
 111. Se ehteðe unðeaw is, þæt se þearefe beo modig.
 111. Manig mann næfeð æhte, & hafeð modignysse swa
þeh, & is earm for wurlde & ungesælig for Gode, þonne he
arærð his mod mid modignysse ongean Gode, & nele on his ermðe
eadmodnysse healden.
 114. Crist cwæð on his godspelle beo þan gastlice þearfen,
<foreign>Beati pauperes spiritu quoniam ipsorum est regnum celorum</foreign>, Eadige synd þa
þearfen, þa þa on gaste synd þearfen, forþan þe heom byð forgyfen
heofonrices myrhðe.
 118. Þa byð þearfe on gaste, þa þa for Godes lufe byð
eadmode, forþan þe þæs modes eadmodnysse mæig begyten Godes rice,
raðer þone se hafonleaste þe of henðe becumð.
 120. Witodlice þa rice, þe rihtlice libbeð mugen beon
getealde betwux Godes þearfen, gyf heo eadmodnysse habbeð &
oferflowednysse forlæteð, swa swa Dauid cyng cwæð beo him sylfen,
<foreign>Ego uero egenus & pauper sum, Deus adiuua me</foreign> Ic eam wædle &
þearfe, God fylst þu me.
 125. Se modige þearfe, for his modes upahafennysse, is to ricen
geteald rihtlice on bocan, & se eadmode rice þeh he habbe æhte,
mæig beon Godes þearefe, gyf he Gode gecwemð.
 127. Se nigoðe unðeaw is, þæt se cyng beo unrihtwis.
 128. Se cyng byð gecoren to þan þe him cyðð his name.
 129. <foreign>Rex</foreign> we cweðeð cyng, þæt is gecweðen Wissigend,
forþan þe he sceal wissigen mid wisedome his folc, & unriht alecgen,
& þone geleafe aræren, þonne byð hit earmlic gyf he byð
unrihtwis, forþan þe he ne rihtlæceð gyf he unrihtwis byð sylf.
 133. Þæs cynges rihtwisnysse arærð his cynesetle, &
þæs folcas steora gestaðeleð his soðfæstnysse.
 134. Þæt is cynges rihtwisnysse þæt he mid riccetre ne
ofsitte, ne earmne ne eadigne, ac ælcen deme riht.
 136. He sceal beon bewerigend wydewena & steopcildena, &
stale alecgen, & forliger gewitnigen, & þa arlease adræfen of his
earde, mid eallen wiccecræft aleggen, & wigelunge ne gemen.
 139. Weotan him sculen ræden & he ne sceal beon weamod.
 140. Godes mynster he sceal myndigen æfre, & feden þearfe,
& fæstlice winnen wið onsigendne here, & healden his eðel.
 142. He sceal soðfæste mænn setten him to gerefen, &
for Gode libben his lif rihtlice, & beon earfoð on ræde & eadmod
on stillnysse, & his ofsprynge ne geðafige þæt heo arlease beon.
 144. He sceal hine gebiddan on gesetten timen, & ær
mæltime metes ne onbyrigen.
 146. Forþan þe hit is awriten, þæt wa þære þeode
þær se cyng byð cild, & þær þa ealdormænn eteð on
ærnemorgen uneawfæstlice.
 148. Gyf se cyng wyle mid carfullnysse healden þa foresæde
beboden, þonne byð his rice gesundfull on life, & æfter life he mot
faren to þan ecen for his earfoðnysse.
 150. Gyf he þonne forsihð þas gesettnysse & lare, þonne
byð his eard gehearemed foroft, æigðer gea on heregunga, gea on hungre,
gea on cwealme, gea on wederen, gea on wild deoran.
 153. Wyte eac se cyng hwu hit is gecweðen on bocan gyf he
rihtwisnysse ne healt, þæt swa swa he ahafen is on his cynesetle toforen
oðre mannen, swa he byð genyðerod on þan nyðemestan witen under þan
unrihtwisen, þe he unrædlice ær geheold.
 157. Se teoðe unðeaw is, þæt se biscop beo gemeleas.
 157. <foreign>Episcopus</foreign> is Grechisc name, þæt is on Leden
<foreign>Speculator</foreign>, & on ænglisc Sceawere, forþan þe he is gesett to þan
þæt he ofersceawigen scule mid his gemene þa læwede, swa swa God sylf
cwæð to Ezechiele þan witega, <foreign>Speculatorem dedi te domui Israeles,</foreign>
þæt is, Ic þe gesette to sceawere soðlice mine folca Israeles hirde,
þæt þu gehere min word, & of mine muðe mine spæce him cyðe.
 163. Gyf þu þan arleasen nelt his arleasnysse asecgen, þonne
swelt se arlease on his arleasnysse, & ic ofga æt þe mid gramen his
blod.
 165. Gyf þu þonne warnest þone arlease were, & he nylle
gecyrren fram his synnen þurh þe, he swylt on his unrihtwisnysse &
þin sawle byð alesed.
 167. Gyf se biscop beo gemeleas þonne he Godes bydel is, & to
larðeawe gesett þan læweden folca, þonne losigeð feale sawlen &
he sylf forðmid, for his gemeleaste, ac þæt folc byð gesælig þurh
snoterne biscop, þe heom sæið Godes lare, & healt heo under Gode swa
swa god herde, þæt heo beon gehealdene, & he habbe þa mede.
 172. Se ændlyfte unðeaw is, þæt folc beo buten steore.
 173. Feale byð stuntnyssen, þær þær nan steore ne
byð, & þær þæt dysig byð orsorh, & þæt gedwyld
rixeð, þær byð yfel to wunigen ænigen wisen mænn.
 175. Beo þan cwæð se sealmwyrhte þysen worden clypigende,
<foreign>Apprehendite disciplinam nequando irascatur dominus & pereatis de uia
iusta</foreign> þæt is, Underfoð steore þelæste God yrsige wið eow &
ge þonne losigen of þan rihten weige.
 179. Eac Paulus se apostol cwæð on his pistole,
þurhwunigeð on steora, & gewitodlice byð swylce forligeres, gyf ge
libbeð abuten steore.
 181. Eft se witega Ysaias be þan ilcan cwæð, <foreign>Quiescite
agere peruerse, discite bene facere</foreign>, Geswicað þwyrlicre dædon, &
leornigeð god to done.
 183. Dauid cwæð eac, <foreign>Declina a malo & fac bonum</foreign>, Buh
fram yfele & do god.
 184. Gyf þu unscæððig seo, gescild þe wið yfel, &
gyf þu scæððig wære, gewænd þe fram yfele, þelæste þu
steoreleas losige on ænde.
 186. Se twelfte unðeaw is, þæt folc beo buten æ.
 187. We ne moten nu healden Moyses æ on þan ealde wisen
æfter ures Hælendes tocyme, ac we scylen gefyllen swa swa we fyrmest
mugen þæs Hælendes beboden, & þa byð us for æ, for þan
þe we byð buten him, gyf we his beboden ne healdeð.
 191. Manege weges synd swa swa se wisedom clypeð.
 192. Þe mannen þynceð rihte, ac heo swa þeh gelædeð to
deaðe on ænde, þa þa him dyselice folgigeð.
 193. Se þe Godes æ forlætt, seo þe is ure weig, se sceal
mistlice faren on manegan gedwylden.
 195. Crist sylf is se weig, swa swa he sæde beo him, <foreign>Ego sum
uia & ueritas & uita</foreign>, Ic sylf eam se weig & soðfæstnysse
& lif, nan mann ne mæig becumen to minen Heofonlice Fæder bute þurh
me.
 198. Ac we byð þurh Crist to heofone gebrohte, gyf we his
biggenges healdeð.
 199. Þa þa buten Godes æ & Godes gesetnysse libbeð,
þa byð buten Gode æfre wunigende.
 200. Drihten sylf behet þiss þan þe healdeð his beboden,
<foreign>Ecce ego uobiscum sum omnibus diebus, usque ad consummationem seculi</foreign>, Ic sylf
beo mid eow soðlice ealle dagen, oððe geændunge þysser wurlde.
 203. Se Hælend us gewissige to his wille symle, þæt ure
sawlen moten siðigen eft to him æfter ure life, to þan ecen life,
þæt he ure sawlen underfo, þe he asænde to þan lichamen.
 206. Sy him a wuldor & wurðmynt, Amen.
 208. Nu syndon ehte heafodlehtres þe us onwinneð swyðe.
 208. An is gecweðen gula, þæt is gifernysse on ænglisc.
 209. Seo deð þæt mann ett ærtime & drincð, oððe
he eft to mycel nymð on æte oððe on wiste, seo fordeð æigðer
gea sawle gea lichame, forþan þe heo macað þan mænn mycele
untrumnysse, & to deaðe gebrincð mid ormæten dræncen.
 213. He fordeð eac þa sawle, for þan þe he sceal synegian
oft, þone he sylf nat hwu he færð for his feondlice drænce.
 215. Se oðer lehter is forleger, & ungemetegod galnysse.
 215. Se is gehaten <foreign>fornicatio</foreign>, & he befylð þone mann,
& macað of Cristes lymen myltestrena lymen, & of Godes temple,
gramena wununga.
 218. Se þridde is <foreign>auaritia</foreign>, þæt is seo yfele gitsung,
& seo is wyrttrume ælcere wohnysse, heo macað reaflac & unrihte
domes, stale & leasunge & forsworennysse, heo is helle gelic, for þan
þe heo habbeð bute unafylledlice grædignysse, þæt heo fulle ne
byð næfre.
 221. Se feorðe lehter is <foreign>ira</foreign>, þæt is on ænglisc
weamodnysse, se deð þæt se mann nah his modes geweald, ac macað
manslehtes & mycele yfela.
 223. Se fifte is <foreign>tristicia</foreign>, þæt is þysser wurlde
unrotnysse, þone se mann geunrotsoð ealles to swyðe for his æhte lyre,
þe he lufode to swyðe & citt þonne wið God, & his synne
geecneð.
 226. Twa unrotnysse synd, an is þeos yfele, & oðer is
halwende, þæt man for his synnen geunrotsige.
 228. Se sixte lehter is <foreign>accidia</foreign> gehaten, þæt is asolcannysse
oððe slæwðe on ænglisc, þonne þan mænn ne lyst on his life
nan god don, & byð him þonne mycel yfel þæt he ne mæig nan god
don, & byð æfre ungeare to ælcere dugeðe.
 231. Se seofoðe lehter is <foreign>jactantia</foreign>, þæt is idelgelp on
Engliscre spæce, þonne se mann byð lofgeorn & mid liccetunga
færð, & deð for gelpe gyf he hwæt dælen wyle, & byð
þonne se hlyse his edlean þære dæde, & his wite his anbideð on
þære towearden weordle.
 235. Se ehteðe lehter is <foreign>superbia</foreign> gehaten, þæt is on
Englisc/ modignysse gecweden.
 237. Seo is ord & ænde ælcere synne, seo geworhte
ængles to atelicen deoflen, & þone mann macað eac, gyf he modegað
to swyðe þæs deofles gefere, þe feoll ær þurh heo.
 240. Nu synden ehte heafodmægna, þa mugen oferswiðen þa
foresæde deoflen, þurh Drihtenes fylste.
 241. An is <foreign>Temperantia</foreign>, þæt is gemetegung on ænglisc,
þæt man beo gemetegod, & to mycel ne þygge on æte & on
wæte, ne ær time ne gereordie.
 244. Nytene etað swa ær swa heo hit habbeð, ac se gescadwise
mann sceal chepen his mæles, & þonne mid gescade his gesettnysse
healden, þonne mæig heo oferswiðen swa þa gifornysse.
 246. Seo oðer mihte is <foreign>Castitas</foreign>, þæt is clænnysse on
ænglisc, þæt se læwede hine healde buten forligere on rihten
sinscipe mid gescadwisnysse, & se gehadode Godes þeowe healde his
clænnysse, þonne byð oferswiðed swa eac seo galnysse.
 250. Seo þridde mihte is <foreign>Largitas</foreign>, þæt is cystignysse on
ænglisc, þæt mann wislice aspende, na for wurldgelpe þa þing þe
him God lænde, on þyssen life to brucane.
 253. God nyle þæt we beon grædige gitseres, ne eac for
wurldgelpe forwurpen ure æhte, ac dælen heo mid gescade, swa swa hit Gode
lichige, & gyf we ælmesse doð, don heo buten gelpe, þonne muge we
swa fordon þa deofollice gitsunge.
 256. Seo feorðe mihte is <foreign>Pacientia</foreign>, þæt is geðyld
gecweðen, þæt se man beo geðyldig & þolemod for Gode, &
læte æfre his gewitt geweldre þone his eorre, for þan þe se
Hælend cwæð þuss on his godspelle, <foreign>In patientia uestra possidebitis
animas uestras,</foreign> þæt is on ængliscre spæce, On eowre geðylde ge
habbeð eower sawle soðlice gehealden.
 262. Se heofonlice wisedom cwæð, þæt yrre hæfð
wununge on þæs dysigen bosme, þonne he byð to rædmod, & se
ealwealdende Deme demð æfre mid smyltnysse, þy we sculen mid geðylde
oferswiðen þæt yrre.
 265. Seo fifte mihte is <foreign>Spiritalis leticia</foreign>, þæt is seo
gastlice blisse, þæt man on Gode blissige betwux unrotnysse þysser
reðen wurlde, swa þæt we on ungelimpen to ormode ne beon, ne eft on
gesælðen to swyðe ne blissigen, & gyf we forleoseð þas hlæne
wurd þing, þonne scule we wyten þæt ure wunung nis na her, ac is on
heofone, gyf we hopegeð to Gode.
 270. Þider we sculen efstan of þysser earfoðnysse mid
gastlicre blisse, þonne byð seo unrotnysse mid eallen oferswiðed mid uren
geðylde.
 272. Seo sixte mihte is <foreign>Instantia boni operis</foreign>, þæt is
anrædnysse godes weorcas.
 273. Gyf we byð anræde on uren gode weorcan, þonne muge we
oferswiðen þa asolcannysse, swa for þan þe hit byð langsum
bisemær, gyf ure lif byð unnytt here.
 275. Seo seofoðe mihte is seo soðe lufe to Gode, þæt we on
gode weorcan Godes lufe cepen, na ideles gelpes þe him is andsæte.
 277. Ac uten don ælmesse swa swa he us tæhte, Gode to lofe,
na us to hlysan, þæt God sy geherod on uren gode weorcan, & se idele
gelp us beo æfre unwurð.
 280. Seo ehteðe mihte is seo soðe eadmodnysse, gea to Gode gea
to mannen, mid modes hlutternysse, for þan se þe byð wis, ne byð he
næfre modig.
 282. On hwan mæig se man modegien þeh he wylle, ne mæig he
on geðingðen, for þan þe feala synd geðungenre.
 284. Ne mæig he on his æhte, for þan þe he his
ændedæig nat, ne on nane þingan he ne mæig modegigen gyf he wis
byð.
 285. Nu ge habbeð geherd hwu þas halge mægn oferswiðeð
þa lehtres, þe deofol besawð on us, & gyf we nylleð heo
oferswiðen, heo besænceð us on helle.
 288. We mugen þurh Godes fylst þa feondlice lehtres mid gecampe
oferwinnen gyf we chenlice fihteð, & habbeð us on ænde þone ece
wurðment a mid Gode sylfen gyf we swincað nu her.

ÆSpir
B1.6.3.
De septiformi Spiritu [Be þam halgan gaste]: Napier 1883, 56-60.



 2. Isaias se witega awrat on his witegunge be ðam halgan gaste
and be his seofonfealdum gifum.
 3. Þa seofonfealdan gifa synd þus gehatene: <foreign>sapientia</foreign> on
leden, þæt is wisdom on englisc; <foreign>intellectus</foreign> on leden, þæt is
andgit on englisc; <foreign>consilium</foreign> on leden, þæt is ræd on englisc;
<foreign>fortitudo</foreign> on leden and modes strengð on englisc; <foreign>scientia</foreign> on leden and
god ingehyd on englisc; <foreign>pietas</foreign> on leden and arfæstnyss on englisc; <foreign>timor
domini</foreign> on leden, godes ege on englisc.
 9. Þas seofonfealdan gifa soðlice wunodon on urum hælende
Criste eall be fullum þingum æfter þære menniscnysse swiðe
mihtiglice, and se halga gast hy todælþ dæghwamlice git godes halgum
mannum be ðam, þe him gewurð, ælcum be his mæðe and his modes
geornfulnysse.
 14. Se man hæfð wisdom, þe wislice leofað; and se
hæfð andgit, þe hit awent to gode and to his drihtnes willan mid godum
weorcum symble.
 15. And se hæfð godne ræd, þe him gerædað æfre,
hwæt him to donne sy and hwæt to forlætenne.
 17. And se hæfð modes strengðe, þe micel mæg forberan
and on eallum earfoðnyssum æfre bið geðyldig and eft on godum gelimpum
ne forlæt his anrædnysse.
 21. And se hæfð god ingehyd, þe godnysse lufað and bið
betera wiðinnan, þonne he wiðutan bið gesewen, and can him gescead
betwux soð and leas.
 24. Se hæfð arfæstnysse, þe arfæst bið him sylf and
mæðe cann on mannum on his modes godnysse, ge on his gelicum ge on
læssum mannum, and nele forseon ne gescyndan oðerne.
 27. Godes ege is seo seofoðe þissa gastlicra gifa, and seo gifu
is anginn ealles wisdomes, and se ðe godes ege hæfð, ne forlet he nan
þing.
 29. Se man, þe bið bedæled eallum þissum gifum, nis he na
godes mann ne to gode ne belimpð, butan he get geearnige godes gife æt
him.
 32. Nu hæfð se yfela gast and se ungesewenlica feond
seofonfealde ungifa wiðerræde þissum gifum, þa he dæleð his
mannum, þe him gehyrsumiað and godes gifa ne gymað ne godes ege
nabbað.
 36. Þa yfelan ungifa þæs arleasan deofles syndon þus
gehatene on ledenspræce; <foreign>insipientia</foreign>, þæt is dysig oððe
dwæsnyss; <foreign>stultitia</foreign>, þæt is stuntnys; <foreign>inprouidentia</foreign>, þæt is
receleasnyss butan foresceawunge; <foreign>ignauia</foreign>, þæt is abroðennyss oððe
nahtnyss; <foreign>ignorantia</foreign>, þæt is nytenyss; <foreign>impietas</foreign>, þæt is
arleasnyss; <foreign>temeritas</foreign>, þæt is dyslic dyrstignyss.
 42. Ælc wisdom is of gode, forðam þe god sylf is wisdom, and
ælc man bið eadig, þe hæfð þone wisdom, gif he his agen lif
gelogað mid wisdome.
 44. Se wisdom is halig, þæs halgan gastes gifu, and se deofol
forgifð þærtogeanes dysig, þæt he wisdomes ne gyme ne wislice ne
libbe, and gyt þæt forcuþre is, þæt he telle hine wisne, and bið
swa gehiwod, swylce he wis sy.
 48. Ongean þam andgyte se deofol forgifð stuntnysse, and eac
þæt he hiwige, swylce he andgitful sy.
 50. Ongean þam wislican ræde se wiðerræda deofol sylð
receleasnysse his underþeoddum and eac, þæt he hiwige, swylce he
rædfæst sy.
 53. Ongean þæs modes strengðe se manfulla deofol forgifð
abroðennysse, þæt se man abreoðe on ælcere neode nahtlice æfre,
and eac þæt he hiwige hine sylfne mihtigne.
 56. Ongean þam ingehyde se hetela deofol syleð nytennysse
nahtlicum mannum, and eac þæt hy hiwigon, þæt hy ingehyd habban.
 58. Ongean þære arfæstnysse he sylð arleasnysse, þæt
he ne arige ne eac ne mæðige his underþeoddum ne his gelicum, and eac
þæt he hiwige, swylce he arfæst sy.
 61. Ongean godes ege se gramlica deofol syleð dyrstignysse mid
dwæslicum gebærum receleasum mannum mid modes unstæððignysse, and
eac þæt hy hiwion, swylce hy habban godes ege.
 64. Be ðisum þeawum man mæg þæne man tocnawan,
hwæðer him godes gast on wunige oððe þæs gramlican deofles.

ÆCreat
B1.6.4.
De creatore et creatura (London, British Library, MS. Cotton Otho C.I, vol. 2): Dictionary of Old English transcript, edited from MS.



 1. Ænig þing wununge hæfde wyrcean.
 3. Furðor smeað fandige God se bið þam men þonne
hlædre/ arerð & astihð þonne uppan þære hlædrestæpum
oðþæt he upp cymð & wyle buton stapum ufor þonne his
stuntnysse/ mycclan fylle swa he.
 7. Ongan næfre almihtiga fæder, ac he wæs sunu efre of
him acennedde al swa mihtig swa he wes se of þam wisan fæder.
 10. Halga heora begra lufe nes nefre ac wæs and æfre
bið/ an God æfre wunigende on anre godcundnysse undæledlice on anum
mægenþrym/ anne godcunnysse gelice mihtige nan lasse þenne.
 13. Swa hwæt swa lasse bið þonne God þæt ne bið na
God þæt þæt later bið þone God þæt hæfð angin na
bið no God.
 15. God nefð nan anginn ac æfre & wunð a on
ecnesse/.
 16. Sume gesceafta swa þurh God habbeð anginn endiað
& forþam ðe hi nabbeð.
 18. Syndon sume hwile.
 19. Þæt & fugelas.
 19. Wæron þurh God & hi nohte.
 20. Nu synd oþre gesceafta gescapene þurh God anginn &
nabbað nænne ende syndon ece on þan æftram dæle.
 22. Þæt syndon englas & eac menna nafre þeah ðe hi
ær ongunnon.
 23. Ne mæg sawle þeah ðe se lichama swelte oðþe he on
wætere wurþe forbærned nefre geendian.
 25. Ac heo bið yfel beo god swa swa englas beoð æfre
þurhwuniende on ece.
 27. Ælmihtig scyppend þe ealle þing gesceop ane swa ece
þæt he angin næfð.
 28. Ac hesylf is egðer ordfruma & ende eallwealdend God.
 29. Ne ondræt he nenne forþan ðe nan oðer nis mihtigre
þonne he ne furþan him gelic.
 31. Efre he bið gefende his gefa þam ðe he wyl þing ne
waniað ne he nanes ne behafað.
 32. Efre he bið ælmihtig & efre he wyle wel.
 33. Nele he næfre nan ac he lufað soðlice þaðe god
weorc/ wyrceð fordoð þe unleafulnysse.
 36. Mycel is se fæder & mycel is his wisdom lufu.
 37. Locu þu nu georne þæt ðu swa swyðe ne dwelie
þæt þu gedon wylle sunu læssan þonne his leofa fæder is
oððe heora lufu be þinum andgite unmihtigran gemakian wylle ac þu ne
miht swa þeah ðu swa mycclum dwelige gedon wylle þæt heora ænig
unmihtigra þonne ælmihtig God.
 44. Wylt þu furþor embe þæt smeagan þone sylf ne
canst embe þe sylfne soðlice smeagan?
 47. Sege me nu soðlice, miht ðu geseon þinne hricg oððe
þinne hneccan þeah ðu lokie underbæc oððe þine agene saule, hu
heo gesceapen is?
 50. Ðu scealt gelyfan on þone lifigendan God & na ofer
þine mæðe motian be him þe læs ðe þu dwelige swa swa to fela
dydon þe ofer heora andgit embe þæt smeadan butan leafan & forði
losedon.
 55. God ælmihtig gesceopp ærest on anginne heofen &
eorðan.
 57. Her ge magon gehyran þæt heofen næs na ær ærðam
se ælmihtiga wyrhta hi geworhte on anginne & ealne middaneard on his
micclum cræfte.
 60. Ac wæs æfre unbegunnen scyppend swa mihtiglice gemacode
cræft/.
 62. Englas he geworhte on wundorlicre fægernysse & on
mycelre manega þusenda ealle lichamlic lybbende on gaste.
 65. & on weorod he gesceopp þære scinendra engla se
fyrmesta on þam teoðan flat mid mycelre modinysse beon þam ælmihtigan
gelic.
 68. God hine geworhte wundorlic ða sceolde he gif he wolde
wurðian his scyppend mid mycel eadmodnysse þe hine swa mærne
gesceopp.
 71. Ac he ne dyde na swa ac mid dyrstig modignysse cwæð
þæt he wolde wyrcean his cyneseld bufan Godes tunglum ofer ðæra
wolcna heahnyssæ on ðam norðdæle & beon Gode gelic.
 75. Þa forlet he þone ælmihtigan þe is eall
soðfæstnyss & nolde habban his hlaforscipe ac wolde beon himsylf on
hissylfes anwealde.
 79. Þa næfde he nane fæstnunge ac feoll sona adun mid
eallum þam englum þe æt his ræde wæron & hi wurdon awende to
awyrgedum deoflum ða drecceað nu mancyn on ðissum middanearde.
 83. & hi to ælcum yfele ælcne man tihtað þæt hi
manna sawla mid synnum fordon for þam mycclum andan þe hi to mannum
habbað.
 86. God wolde ða gewyrcan mannan of eorðan þæt he
geearnian sceolde mid his eadmodnysse and gehyrsumnysse þa heofonlican
winnan/ þæt ðæra engla getæl eft worde gefylled & heora werod
eft ðæs mannes ofspring forðan þe heora werod wæs gewanod
ðæra/ deofla hryre þe heora Drihten forleton & of heofenum helle
wite.
 94. God þa gestaðolfæste & gestrangode his englas þa
forleton/ þæt hi lybbað nu æfre buton ælcere synne or sorge on
bliss/ gehyrsume on wuldre mid him.
 98. & hi hine wurðiað to worulde mid buton ælcum
geswince a on ecnysse.
 100. God ða geworhte of ðære mid his halgum handum mannan
to his ænlicnysse & ableow on his liflicne blæd & he wearð man
geworht on lybbendre sawle.
 104. God sceop him naman Adam & of his anum ribbe worhte him
gemacan wæs Eua ure ealra modor.
 107. & God hi ða gebletsode mid þissere, wexað &
beoð gemenigfylde & gefyllað þa eorðan & habbað eow ofer
þa eorðan & ofer sæfyxum & ofer þam fleogendum fugelum
eallum/ þam nytenum þe styriað ofer eorðan.
 112. On six dagum swa swa us secgað bec þa menigfealdan
gesceafta gesewenlice & hesylf þa gesceawade ealle þa sceafta.
 115. & hi wæron ætgædere gude.
 115. Ða geendode God ealle his weorc on ðam seofoðam
dæge & hine on ðam seofoðam dæge geswac his weorc.
 118. Næs he na werig þeah ðe hit swa awriten si ne he mid
ealle ne geswac þa gesceafta geedniwianne ac he geswac þæs dihtes
þæs deoplican cræftes swa þæt he syððan scyppan nolde ac ða
ilcan geedniwian oð ende þyssere woruld ure Hælend on his halgan
godspelle cwæð, <foreign>Pater meus usque modo et ego operor</foreign> þæt is on
englisc, min fæder wyrcð gyt oð þysne andweardan & ic eac
wyrce.
 127. Ælce geare byð orf acenned & mennisce menn to mannum
ðe/ þa God gewyrcð swa swa he þa ærran geworhte.
 130. Ac he ne gescypð nane buton þam cildum anum & ealle
þa nytena nabbað nane sawle.
 132. Ælces mannes sawle þe on his meder byð acucod
gescypð se ælmihtiga God.
 133. He Adames dyde swa lange swa mancynn & ðes middaneard
wuniað & nyten næfð nane sawle.
 136. Sume men wendon þæt ðeos woruld wære æfre
ælcum/ anginne eall swa nu is heofen & eorðe & ealle gesceafta.
 139. Ac to soðan þæt God.
 139. Sceop & hi næron na gesceafta gyf hi gesceap hisylfe
ac hi geworhte God.
 142. Ælc þing hæfð angin þurh God butan se ana
scyppend þe ealle ðing gesceop se næfð ordfruman ac hesylf is anginn
& soðlice ordfruma eallra oðra ungeendod.
 147. Næs hit na færlic geþoht oððe unforsceawod ræd
God/ þisne middaneard gesceop ac wæs æfre æt fruman on his ræde
þæt he wolde gewyrcan ealle þas woruld ealne middaneard mid his mihte
himsylfum to lofe swa swa we geseoð nu ealle gesceafta heriað scyppend
butan þam earmum mannum þe hine forseoð & hine herian ne gymað
þæt hi mid þam ealdan deofle endleaslice losiað.
 157. Ure scyppend þaða he geworhte Adam þone frumsceapenan
man syngian wolde þurh ðæs deofles lare swa swa he dyde syðþan.
 160. God swylce hu hesylf smeade ða iu embe þa bote hu he hit
gebetan/ ðurh his halgan gife þæt he gehulpe þam men eac his
ofspryncge/ on hine gelyfað & mid soðre wurðiað.
 165. Se man wæs he syngian ne þorfte & he wære
gesælig/ gif he na ne syngode & æfre gif he his Drihtne
gehyrsumode.
 168. & gif he syngode he wære & syðþan deadlic for
ðære synne fremminge.
 170. God hine ne naðre healfe ac lett hine habban his agenne
cyre.
 172. Næs geworht mid nanre wohnysse ne mid nanum synnum
