ÆLet 2 (Wulfstan 1)
B1.8.2.
First Old English Letter for Wulfstan: Fehr 1914, 68-145, [corrections] 269.



 2. Us bisceopum gedafenað, þæt we þa boclican lare þe
ure canon us tæcð and eac seo Cristes boc, eow preostum geopenigan on
engliscum gereorde; forþonþe ge ealle ne cunnon þæt leden
understandan.
 3. And we ne durran forsuwian, þæt we eow ne secgan þa
deopan lare and ures drihtenes beboda, þylæsþe we scyldige beon, gif we
hit forsuwiað.
 3. Ac we awerigað us.
 3. Wite ge hwæt ge don.
 4. Ic wat to gewissan, þæt wyle mislycian þeos ure mynguncg
eow for wel manegum.
 5. Byð swaþeah sum swa onbryrd þurh God, þæt him lyst
gehyran þa halgan lare and hine sylfne gerihtlæcan to his sawle þearfe.
 6. Þa godan wyllað gehyran Godes bebodu and þa yfelan
nellað.
 6. Ac hi sceolan swaþeah, þæt him on sumne sæl huru
gesceamige hyra stuntnyssa, þæt hi geswycan yfeles.
 7. Ge sceolan eowerne had healdan arwurðlice and mid godum
þeawum symble geglencgan and mid clænum mode Criste þenigan æt his
halgum weofode, swaswa eowrum hade gerist.
 8. Forþanþe ge synd gesette soðlice to lareowum ofer Godes
folce, þæt ge hig Gode gestrynan.
 8a"> <foreign>Tria enim sunt tempora huius sæculi: Ante legem, tempore
patriarcharum sub lege, tempore Christianorum, post Christi aduentum in carne</foreign>;
þreo tyda synt on þisse worulde: An tyd wæs ær Godes æ, on
þære heahfædera tyman; Oþer under Godes æ, on Moyses tyman;
þrydde under Cristes gyfe, æfter Cristes tocyme.
 9. Fram Adame menn wunedon on flæsclicum lustum, and sume on
hæþenscype unsnoterlice gelyfdon and mid deofles biggencgum higsylfe
fordydon and þone scyppend forsawon, þe hig gesceop to mannum þurh
þæs deofles lare, þe Adam forlærde.
 10. Hwæt þa se ælmihtiga God on Moyses tyman, þæs
mæran heretogan, mancynne to steore sette þa fif bec, on þam þe is
Godes æ, and Moyses hy awrat and mancynne forbead, þæt hi nænne
hæþenscype habban ne mostan, ac sceolde efre wurþian þone soþan God,
seþe ana is ælmihtig scyppend.
 10. And seo æ forbead eac swylce synna and eac gewitnode þa
þe wolice syngodon.
 11. Þa æt nyhstan soðlice se soðfæsta hælend,
þæs ælmihtigan Godes sunu, þe ealle þing gesceop, com on þas
woruld on soþre menniscnysse, to þig þæt he wolde þa synfullan
alysan and þa forlorenan to lyfes wege gebringan.
 12. And astealde cristendom and clænnysse tæhte.
 12. Þa clænnysse he lufað on his clænum þenum, þe him
sceolan þeowigan symle on clænnysse, þæt is, on munecum and on
mynecynum and on mæssepreostum.
 12. <foreign>Cuius gratie tempus permanet usque ad consummationem
sæculi</foreign>; þæs gyfu tyma wunað nu oþ þyssere worulde geendunge.
 13. Se ylca Godes sunu geceas him to meder þæt halige
mæden, Marian gehaten and he sylf is ordfruma eallre clænnysse and he ana
wunode on þyssere worulde butan ælcere synne swaswa nan oþer man.
 14. Iohannes se fulluhtere, þe hine gefullade, þurhwunade on
mægðhade on mycelre forhæfednysse.
 15. And Iohannes se godspellere, þæs hælendes mæg,
lyfode on mægðhade oþ his lyfes ende.
 16. <foreign>Quia uirginitas non solum in feminis sed etiam in castis uiris
habetur</foreign> þæt is, forþanþe þa haligan bec us bysniað be þam,
þæt se haliga mægðhad wunað on þam mannum þe næfre wifes ne
brucað, swaswa he wunað on þam wifmannum þe næfre weres ne brucað,
ac hi for Godes lufan þa galnysse forhogiað.
 17. Eac þa twelf apostolas þe þam hælende folgodan,
þaþa he her on worulde wunode mid mannum, and þa twa and hundseofontig
wera, þe wunedon mid him on his lareowdome, þa synd leorningccnihtas, ealle
hi forletan heora æhta and wif and wunedon on clænnysse, Criste
folgigende.
 18. Swaswa Petrus cwæð to Criste sylfum: <foreign>Ecce nos reliquimus
omnia et secuti sumus te</foreign>; þæt is on englisc: Efne we forleton ealle ure
woruldþing and we þe folgiað.
 19. Ge sceolan witan, gif ge wisdom lufiað, hwæt sy betwux
þam twam gecyðnyssum, þære ealdan æ, ær Cristes tocyme, and
þære niwan gecyðnysse, under Cristes gife; forþonþe men moston ær
Moyses æ mislice libban, and under Moyses æ mancyn lifode on oþre
wisan.
 19. On oþre we sceolan don be ures drihtnes lare.
 20. Swaswa he sylf cwæð on his haligan godspelle: <foreign>Lex et
prophetæ usque ad Iohannem</foreign>;<foreign>A diebus autem Iohannis baptiste usque nunc
regnum celorum uim patitur et uiolenti rapiunt illud</foreign>, þæt is on englisc:
Seo ealde æ wæs and witigan wæron on þissere worulde oþ þæt
Iohannes com, þe Crist gefullade, and fram his dagum heofenarice þolað
mycele neadunge and þa strecanmod mid hyra strecnysse hit gegripað.
 21. Þa ealdan men leofodon on hyra lustum swiðe, ær Cristes
tocyme.
 22. Ac he cwæð, þæt we sceoldan mid strecum mode
stiðlicor libban and winnan wið leahtras and unlustas forseon, þæt we
heofena rice habban motan.
 23. He cwað be þam martyrum, þe he wiste towearde æfter
his þrowunge for his geleafan: Ne ondræde ge eow þa þe ofsleað
eowerne lichaman, forþanþe hi þa sawle ofslean ne magan.
 24. Ac ondrædað þone þe þa sawle mæg and eac þone
lichaman on helle besencan.
 25. Þurh þas myngunge and manegum oþrum wordum wurþan
gemartyrode manega þusenda wide into þas woruld, ægðer ge weras ge
wifmen for Cristes geleafan mid ænum mode and hi swa mid strecnysse astigan
to heofonum.
 26. Eft cwæð se hælend be his haligum anddetterum, þa
þe hatað confessores on haligum bocum: <foreign>Sint lumbi uestri precincti Et
lucerne ardentes in manibus uestris</foreign>; Beon eower lendena ymbgyrde and leohtfatu
byrnende on eowrum handum.
 28. On þam lendenum is, swaswa we leornigað on bocum, seo fule
galnys and we sceolan fæstlice þa gewriþan and gewyldan us to
clænnysse.
 29. And habban us on handum halige weorc, symle on ælmesdædum
and on eallum godnyssum, mannum to bysene, swaswa byrnende leohtfatu.
 30. Johannes se godspellere on his gastlican gesyhþe þone
hælend geseah, syþþan he to heofenum astah, mid alban his breost wæs
gegyrd.
 31. He het us begyrdan ure lendena, swa þæt we forseon þa
fulan galnysse, and he sylf wæs begyrd mid gyldenum gyrdle æt his haligan
breoste, forþanþe we habban sceolan ures modes clænnysse on ure heortan,
symble, we þe Criste þenigað on his haligan þeowdome.
 32. Eft Daniel se witega, awrat on his witegunge æ, þæt he
God gesawe on his gastlican gesyhþe and he wæs lineweard and his lendena
ymbgyrde.
 33. And Iohannes geseah, swaswa we sædon ær, þone hælend
ymbgyrdne æt his haligan breoste.
 34. Nu is us geswutelad soðlice mid þam, ge on þære ealdan
æ, ge eac on þære niwan, þæt God wile habban on his gastlican
þeowdome halige þenas and halige þinena, þaþe mid clænnysse
lichaman and modes þæt halige husel him geoffrian, swaswa he sylf
getæhte ær his þrowunge.
 35. Þyses wæron gemyndige þa mæran andetteras, þe we
hatað confessores, and þa haligan mædenu, þe on clænnysse lyfedon
hyra lif æfre and Criste þenedan æfter þæra cwellera ehtnyssa,
þe þa martyras ofslogan, swaswa we sædon ær.
 36. Æfter þæs hælendes þrowunge and his upstige to
heofenum com se haliga gast of heofenum to eorþan swaswa byrnende fyr mid
bradum liggette ofer Cristes apostolos, swaswa Crist him ær behet and hig
ealle gefylde butan frecednysse, swa þæt hi ealle cuþon eallre þeoda
gereord.
 37. And hi ealle þa lare, þe we leorniað on bocum, awriton
and gesetton be Godes wissunge.
 38. Hi worhton eac swylce fela wundra þurh Crist, þa ylcan
wundra, þe he sylf ær worhte.
 39. Þa bodade Petrus on þære byrig Hierusalem þam
iudeiscum folce and þa gebugon to fulluhte of þam folce þreo þusend
manna on anum dæge and eft gebugon æt oþre bodunge fif þusend manna.
 40. Swa mycclum onbryrde, þæt hi hyra æhta ealle beceapedon
and þæt wurð brohton to þæra apostola fotan, and hyra nan næfde
naht synderlices, ac didan him gemæne, ælcon be his neode.
 41. And Iacob, se rihtwisa, bewyste hi ealle and heold Cristes setl
þrittig geara swa.
 42. Her wæs asteald þurh þisne haligan heap þæra muneca
lif, þe libbað æfter regule under hyra abbode; ealle hyra þingc him
doð gemæne, swaswa him diht se abbod.
 43. Þa toferdon þa apostolos to fyrlynum landum, geond ealle
þas woruld, wundra wyrcende and bodigende geleafan, and þa gelyfeda
gefulledon and cyrcean arærdon and gesetton bisceopas and mæssepreostas
gehadedon and manega Godes þeowan on þam seofon hadum, swaswa us segð se
canon.
 44. And Godes geleafa weox and wanode se hæþenscype.
 45. Hwæt þa æfter fyrste asprang færlice ormæte
ehtnys ofer þa cristenan and man hi gemartirode mid mænigfealdum witum,
and ælcne acwealde þe on Crist gelyfde.
 46. Ac God geworhte æfre wundra þurh hig, swa þæt þa
hæþenan on þone hælend gelyfdon, oft an þusend manna, þær man
ænne ofsloh, þurh þa myccla tacna, þe se martyr gefremode, and se
cristendom ne mihte beon acwenced næfre and God þa syþþan sealde sybbe
on fyrste on his gelaþunge, and se geleafa weox.
 47. Þa feng se casere Constantinus to rice on Romana byrig and he
rices geweold ofer eallne midoaneard, swa þæt him ealle men abugon.
 47. He wæs se forma casere þe on Crist gelyfde, sancte Elenan
sunu, þære eadigan cwene.
 48. Se het gegaderigan bisceopa synað.
 49. Wolde gehiran þa haligan lare and þone soþan geleafan be
þam soðfæstan Gode, þe he ongelyfde, aworpenum hæþenscype.
 50. Þa coman þær togædere on Nycea byrig þreo hund
bisceopa and <foreign>XVIII</foreign> bisceopas.
 51. And se casere com him þær togeanes and mid eallre
arwurðnysse hy gewylcumode and him eallon gedon het biglyfan genohne and hyra
lare hliste mid geleaffullan mode.
 52. Þær wæron þa manega, þe mihtan wyrcean wundra
þurh God.
 53. And hig wunedon þær lange.
 54. Þær wæs eac sum arleas preost, Arrianus gehaten, of
Alexandrigan byrig, ablend on his mode, se mæsta gedwola þe of mancynne
come.
 55. Se wolde gelytlian þone lyfigendan hælend and sæde,
þæt he nære on godcund nysse his fæder gelic, ac wære læssa on
mihte.
 56. Þa amansumedon þa bisceopas þone manfullan gedwolan.
 57. Ac he nolde geswycan swaþeah his gedwyldes, ærþamþe
him wand ut his innoð æt his setle, þaþa he to gange eode.
 58. And he geendode swa æmtig on his innoþe, swa he on his
geleafan wæs.
 59. Oþer sinoð wæs eft, þæt wæs oþer healf hund
bisceopa, on þeodosiges tyman, þæs ,æþelan caseres, and hy þær
fordemdon þone dweligendan bisceop, Macedomum gehaten, and hine amansumedon,
forþonþe he wiðsoc and sæde on his gedwylde, þæt se haliga gast
nære on anre godcundnysse mid þam heofenlican fæder and þam
hælende Criste, and hi getæhtan þa swutelice, þæt he soð God is,
on anre godcundnysse mid þam ælmihtigan fæder and his acennedan sunu,
æfre wunigende.
 60. Se þridda sinoð wæs eft, þæt wæs twa hund
bisceopa, under þam gingran þeodosige, and hi fordemdon þær Nestorium,
þone gedwolan, þe dyrstelice cwæð, þæt on Criste wæron twegen
hadas, and hi his gedwyld adwæscton þær midealle, forþanþe se
hælend is soðlice an Crist, on anum hade æfre wunigen.
 60. Se feorþa sinoð wæs eft, þæt wæs syx hund
bisceopa and þrittig sacerda on Martianus tyman, þæs mæran caseres,
se fordemde þone deoflican abbod, þe cwæð on his gedwylde, þæt
ures drihtenes lichama and his godcundnes wære anes gecyndes.
 61. Þa wearð he amansumod fram þam mycclan sinoþe,
forðanþe se hælend is, swaswa ge gehyrdan oft, soð man and soð God,
symle wunigende.
 62. Syððan wæron for oft oþre sinoþas wisra bisceopa, ac
þas wæron þa fyrmestan, þe mid fulre lare þone geleafan getrymedon
and þa gedwolan amansumedon, þe mid hyra gedwylde woldon awendan woh to
rihte and adweligan mancyn fram hyra drihtne.
 63. Þas feower sinoþas gesettan eac ealle þa þenunga to
Godes þeowdome, to mæssan and to uhtsange and to eallum tydsangum.
 69. Seofan tidsangas hi gesettan us to singanne dæghwamlice urum
drihtne to lofe.
 70. Swaswa se witega Dauid on his witegunge cwæð: Seofan
syþan, drihten, ic sæde þe lof on anum dæge for þinra doma
rihtwisnyssa.
 72. Se forma tydsang is:Uhtsang mid þam æftersange, þonne
primsang and Undernsang, Middægsang, Nonsang, æfensang, Nihtsang.
 73. Þas seofon tidsangas ge sceolon syngan mid mycelre gymenne
eowrum drihtene to lofe, dæghwamlice on cyricean; and eac swylce
mæssian.
 75. Mycel bið, þæt man mote mæssian æne to anum
dæge, þeahþe he hit oftor ne do, forðanþe ure drihten æne
þrowade and us ealle alysde.
 76. Nu is seo mæsse gemynd his mæran þrowunge and mycclum
mæg fremigan eallum mancynne, ægðer ge libbendum ge þam
forðfarenum; swaswa we leornigað on bocum.
 77. Man sceal mæssian mid mycelre clænnysse.
 78. Swaswa þa haligan dydan, þe we hatað confessores.
 79. Sume hy wæran wunigende æfre butan wife, sume hy forleton
þæt unalyfede þing.
 80. And mid clænnysse Criste þenedon.
 81. Swaswa þa canones us cyþað openlice: <foreign>Quod nullus
episcopus aut presbiter aut diaconus aut regularis canonicus habeat in domo sua
mulierem manentem, nisi sit mater ei aut soror aut amita aut matertera, ex
quibus nulla mala suspicio nascatur, et si quis aliter facit, degradetur</foreign>;
þæt is on englisc, þæt nan bisceop ne nan mæssepreost, diacon
oþþe mynsterpreost næbbe on his wununge ne on his huse wunigende
ænigne wifman, butan hit syg his modor oþþe his swustor, faþu oþþe
moddrige of þæm þe ne mage nan unhlysa aspringan, and gif he elles do,
þolige his hades.
 83. Þis eow þingð hefelyc, forþanþe ge habbað on
gewunan eowre yrmþe, swa þæt eow sylfum þingð, þæt eow nan syn
ne sy, þæt ge swa libban swaswa læwede men.
 84. Ge secgað for oft, þæt Petrus, se apostol, hæfde wif
and cild; and we eac secgað, þæt he swa hæfde and sume þa oþre,
þe þam hælende folgodan, hæfde wif and cild ær hyra gecyrrednysse;
ac hi geswycon þæs, syþþan hi coman to Cristes lareowdome, and hyra
æhta forleton and ealle woruldþing.
 85. We ne magan eow neadian, ac we myngiað eow, þæt ge
clænnysse healdan, swaswa Cristes þegenas on godum geþingðum, Gode to
cwemnysse, swaswa þa haligan dydon, þe we her beforan ræddon, þe eall
hyra lif lyfedon on clænnysse.
 86. Be swylcum witegode se witega Isaisas, þus cweþende: <foreign>Ego
nunc his, qui custodierint sabbata mea et elegerint que ego uolui, et tenuerint
foedus meum, dabo eis in domo mea et in muris meis locum et nomen melius a
filiis et a filiabus</foreign>;<foreign>Nomen sempiternum dabo eis quod non peribit</foreign>; God
soðlice gecwæð, swaswa us sæde se witega: Ic forgife þam clænum,
þe gecuran minne wyllan and min wed healdað and mine restendagas, þa
beteran wununge on minum weallum; And on minum huse hi habbað wununge, and
hyra nama bið toforan oþrum bearnum;Ecne naman ic him forgife.
 89. Be þisum ylcan cwæð Crist on his godspelle: <foreign>Sunt
eunuchi qui se castrauerunt propter regnum celorum</foreign>; þæt is: Ne mot nan
man aceorfan his gesceapu him fram; se man þe hit deð, he bið amansumod.
 91. Ac Crist cwæð swaþeah, swaswa her cwyð on leden,
þæt synd sume men, ge wel manega syndon, þe for heofenarice hisylfe
geclænsiað fram fulre galnysse and beoð gastlice genælede.
 92. Hi habbað hira lima and libbað on clænnysse.
 92. Hi ne beoð na forcorfene, ac Gode gecorene.
 93. Þæt synd wæpmen and wifmen, þe wuniað on
clænnysse.
 94. And hi sylfe offriað eall Gode on sægdnysse, ge on sawle
ge on lichama.
 94. And hi sceolon habban þa selran wununge binnan Godes weallum
and þone ecean naman on his huse mid him.
 96. Ne þurfan we us ondrædan þa deoflican costnunga.
 96. Ne magon hig us derian, gif hi us ne licyað.
 97. Swa mycel bið seo synn, þe man sylfwilles deð, swa mycel
yfel hit bið.
 98. Þæt us ne mæg derigan, gif us hwæt unþances of
þam deofle be cymð þurh nis searo cræftas, slapende oþþe
wæccende.
 99. Seofan hadas syndan gesette on bocum to Godes þenungum into
Godes ciricean.
 100. An is <foreign>hostiarius</foreign>, oþer is <foreign>lector</foreign>, þridda <foreign>Exorcista</foreign>,
feorþa <foreign>acolitus</foreign>, fifta <foreign>subdiaconus</foreign>, sixta <foreign>diaconus</foreign>, se seofoþa
<foreign>presbyter siue episcopus</foreign>.
 101. <foreign>Hostiarius</foreign> is dureweard, seþe cyricean cægan healt.
 102. <foreign>Lector</foreign> is rædere, seþe ræt on cyricean.
 103. <foreign>Exorcista</foreign> is halsiend, seþe ræt ofer þa witseocan men
and ofer þa untruman.
 104. <foreign>Acolitus</foreign> is seþe tapor byrð æt Godes þenungum.
 105. <foreign>Subdiaconus</foreign> is underdiacon, seþe þone calic and þone
disc byrð to þære mæssan and þenað þam diacone.
 106. <foreign>Diaconus</foreign> is gecweden þegn se þenað þæm
mæssepreoste oþþe þæm bisceope æt þære mæssan and
godspel ræt; He mot hlaf syllan and cild fullian.
 108. Gif mæssepreost bið butan diacone, he hæfð þone
naman and he næfð þa þenunge.
 109. <foreign>Presbyter</foreign> is grecisc nama, þæt is on leden <foreign>senior</foreign> and
on englisc ealdwita.
 110. Na þæt hi ealle ealde beon magon, þe to mæssepreoste
gehadode synd, ac for þam wurðscype and þæm wisdome, þe hi habban
scylan, hi synd swa gehatene.
 111. Begen synd on anum hade, se bisceop and se mæssepreost, on
þæm seofoþan hade.
 112. Swaswa us secgað bec.
 113. Begen hi mæssiað and mannum bodiað.
 114. And nis nan had geteald to þære haligan þenunge butan
þa seofon hadas þe we fore secgað.
 115. Se bisceop is geset to maran bletsunge: cyricean to halgienne
and to hadigenne preostas, men to bisceopigenne forþan hit wære to
mænigfeald, gif ealle mæssepreostas þis don mostan.
 116. Ac him gedafenað, þæt hi hyra bisceope beon
underþeodde and be his wissunge and wisdome libban, and he hi ofersceawige,
swaswa his nama is gecweden, þæt is ofersceawiend on englisc, swa þæt
he ofersceawige symle his underþeoddan and hi gerihtlæcean to rihtum
þeawum æfre.
 117. Munuchad and mynecena, abbodas and abbedessan ne synd na
getealde to þyssum seofon hadum.
 118. Forþonþe he mot mæssian, þeahþe he munuc ne sy, and
munuc ne mot mæssian, butan he mæssepreost sy.
 119. Se forma bisceop wæs, þe God sylf gesette on þære
ealdan æ, Aaron gehaten, Moyses broþor, þæs mæran heretogan.
 120. Ac he ne mæssade næfre.
 121. Forþanþe mæsse næs gyt geset, ærþanþe Crist
sylf on þære niwan gecyðnysse gehalgode, husel and het us eac swa don on
his gemynde.
 122. Nu wæs seo mæsse asteald þurh urne hælend Crist.
 123. And se haliga Petrus gesette þone Canon, þe we <foreign>te igitur</foreign>
cweþað.
 124. Ac se Aaron sceolde and þa ealdan bisceopas geoffrian Gode
on þa ealdan wisan fearras and rammas and buccan and lambru and gehwylcu
nytenu.
 125. Swaswa nan man ne moste on þissum dagon don.
 126. Forþanþe þa offrunga ealle getacnedan ures hælendes
slege, þe wæs ofslagen for us and on rode gefæstnode for ure
alysednysse.
 127. And he swa geendode þa ealdan gecyðnysse.
 128. Þa moste se Aaron and his æftergengan niman him to
gemacan, æfter Moyses æ an clæne mæden.
 129. Forþanþe nan ne moste of oþrum cynne becuman to þæm
hade, þæt he bisceop wære, butan of Aarones cynne.
 130. Hi ne mostan na wifian on nanre wudewan ne on forlætenan
wife be Godes leafe þa, ac on clænum mædene.
 131. And hyra clænnysse healdan, swa oft swa hi offredon þa
ænlican onsægdnysse.
 132. Hy moston þa wel wif habban, þæt ne wurde ateorad
þæt mære bisceopcyn þe com of Aarone.
 133. Forþanþe nan cyn ne moste becuman to þam hade butan
þæt an cyn, þe com of Aarone.
 134. And hit stod æfre swa on þære ealdan æ.
 135. Nu is seo ealde æ geendod æfter Cristes tocyme.
 136. And men ne ceosað nu on þissere nywan gecyðnysse of
nanum bisceopcynne oþerne bisceop, ac of ælcum cynne, þær þær he
clæne bið and on þeawum geþogen to Godes þenungum.
 137. Ge of munuchade ge of preosthade.
 138. Munuc wæs Martinus and mære bisceop.
 138. Munuc wæs Gregorius and mære bisceop and munuc wæs
Cuthberhtus and mære bisceop and manega oþre of munuchade bisceopas
wæron, swaswa we on bocum rædað.
 139. And of preosthade on clænnysse libbende manega wæron
mære bisceopas and mæssepreostas, on mycelre drohtnunge, swyþe halige
weras, þe we hatað confessores.
 140. Ac ge wyllað beon, þæs þe we wenað, of þam yfelan
heape gehadedra manna, be þam þe se hælend cwæð on his haligan
godspelle.
 141. He cwæð:<foreign>Multi dicunt mihi in illo die, hoc est in die
iudicii: DOMINE, DOMINE ET RELIQUA</foreign>;Manega cweþað to me on þam dæge:
drihten, drihten leof, on urum life we worhtan manega tacna on þinum mæran
naman and we eac witegodan þe to wurþmynte.
 142. Þonne cweðe ic him anto: Ne cann ic eow to soþan.
 142. Gewitað fram me, ge unrihtwise wyrhtan, þærþær
bið wop and toþa gristbitung.
 143. Seþe cild gefullað, se afligeð deoflu and he wyrcð
wundra; and se witegað, seþe þam folce segð hyra sawle þearfe; ac
mænig bið swaþeah swa mycelre þenunge swyþe unwyrðe, þonne he
sylf bið unclæne, and se gehyrð æt Criste þone heardan dom, swaswa
her segð on þyssum sceortum cwyde.
 144. Crist wat ealle þing, ac he ne oncnæwð swaþeah þa
unclænan þegnas, þe ne gecwemdon him.
 144. Ne hi naht nabbað þæs þe him gelicige, ne hi swa fule
ne motan into his fægeran healle, ac beoð utan belocene, to þam ecum
witum.
 145. Ne mæg se yfela preost mid his yfelnysse, þeah he
manslaga sy and manful on dædum, Godes þenunge befylan, ne þæt
fulluht ne þa mæssan.
 146. Nu ge habbað gehyred be gehadedum mannum, ge on þære
ealdan æ ge on þære niwan gecyðnysse.
 147. Nu mæg eaþe getimian, þæt eower sum ahsige, hwi he
ne mote wif habban swaswa Aaron hæfde.
 148. Þonne secge we eow, þæt seo ealde æ wæs ær
Cristes tocyme eall getacniendlic.
 149. And hi þa wif hæfdon, forþonþe hi wæron
flæsclice and hi næfre ne mæssedon and mihton þa swa don.
 150. Nu is seo ealde æ eall awend on oþer to gastlican
þingum, and Godes þenas sceolon healdan hyra clænnysse,swaswa Crist hit
astealde.
 151. And seþe nu hilt þa ealdan æ æfter Cristes tocyme on
þa ealdan wisan, he bið amansumod, Canones us tæcað.
 152. Canones sind gecwedene rihte regulas, þe us
gerihtlæcað.
 153. Þæt seþe wuduwan genimð oþþe forlæten wif,
þæt he næfre syþþan ne beo diacon oþþe mæssepreost.
 154. And seþe forliger gefremme, þolige his hades.
 155. We ne durran forsuwian, þæt we ne secgan eow þa haligan
gesetnysse, þe ge healdan sculan.
 155. We beoð unscyldige, gif we hit secgað eow.
 155. Wite ge hwæþer ge wyllan eow gerihtlæcean.
 156. Se læweda man mot oþre siþe wifian, and geong wuduwe
mot eft ceorlian ac nan ne mot swaþeah syllan him bletsunge, buton heo
mæden sy, ac hy ma sceolan dædbote gedon for hyra ungehealtsumnysse.
 157. Ge sceolan beon gebocade, swaswa eower hade gebyrað.
 157. Mæssepreost sceal habban mæsseboc and pistelboc, and
sangboc and rædingboc and saltere and handboc, and penitentialem and gerim.
 158. And þa beon wel gerihte.
 159. And clæne mæssereaf to Cristes þenungum.
 160. And sceolon singan sunnauhtan and mæsseuhtan æfre nigan
repsas æfre mid nigon rædingon.
 161. Beo his calic geworht of ecum antimbre, gylden oþþe
sylfren, glæsen oþþe tinen.
 162. Ne beo he na hyrnen ne huru treowen.
 163. Ne man ne mæssige mid nanum oþrum fæte butan mid
þæm calice, þe Criste sig gehalgod.
 164. And his weofod beo clæne and wel gescryd æfre, na mid
musa tyrdlum ne mid meoxe befiled.
 165. Hwi scyle ge waccran beon þonne woruldcræftan on eowrum
gastlicum þeowdome to Godes þenungum, þæt ge næbban þa wæpnu
to þam gastlicum gewinne þæt syndon þa þing, þe we nu eow
sædon.
 166. Se smið him begyt slecge and anfylte and tangan and bylias
and gehwylce tol.
 167. Se trywwyrhta eac æhxe and nafegar and ealle þa tol, þe
to trywe gebyriað.
 168. Se fiscere and se hunta foresceawiað him mid net.
 169. And ealle woruldcræftige men wyrcað hira tol.
 170. And se eorðlingc ne erat, butan ne erigan cunne.
 171. Warniað eow nu, ic bidde, þæt ge beon beteran on eowrum
gastlicum cræfte to Cristes þenungum, swaswa eow gebyrað þæt ge
beon scylan, þonne þa woruldmen syndon on hyra woruldcræftum.
 172. Lange sceal leornian seþe læran sceal; gif he nele
leornian, þæt he lareow beo, he sceal beon ealdor eft syþþan
gedwyldes.
 173. Swaswa Crist sylf cwæð on sumum his godspelle: <foreign>Cæcus
si ceco ducatum prestat, ambo in foueam cadent</foreign>; Gif se blinda man bið
þæs blindan ladþeow, þonne befeallað hi begen on sumne pytt gewiss.
 174. Blind bið se lareow, þe læran sceal folc, gif he
læran ne cann, ne he leornian nele, ac mislæt his hyrimen and hine sylfne
forðmid.
 175. Se mæssepreost sceal mannum bodian þone soþan geleafan
and hym larspel secgan.
 176. And þa seocan geneosian.
 177. And cild fullian, swa raþe swa man raþost mæge hi
geradian to fulluhte.
 178. Gif se seoca man gyrnað, þæt man hine smyrige, he do
þonne anddetnysse ær þære smyrunge.
 179. And gif he eft gewyrpð æfter þære smyrunge, he mot
wifes brucan and flæsces, gif he wile.
 180. On þære smyrunge bið synna forgifennys, him to
beterunge, and ne bið na hadung.
 181. And gif he eft seoc bið, hine man eft smyrige.
 182. Sume preostas fægnieð, þonne men forðfarað and
gegaderiað hy to þam lice, swaswa grædige hremmas, þærþær hy
hold geseoð, on holte oþþe on felda.
 183. Ac hym gebyrað to bestandenne þa men, þe gehyrað to
his hyrnysse into his mynstre.
 184. And he ne sceal na faran on oþres folgoþe to nanum lice,
butan he gelaþod sy.
 185. Ne mot nan preost beon mangere oþþe gerefa.
 186. Ne drincan æt wynhuse, ne druncengeorn beon.
 187. Ne modig, ne gylpende, ne on his gyrlum ranc, ne mid golde
geglenged ac mid godum þeawum.
 188. Ne he sacful ne beo.
 188. Ne he ceaste ne astyrige.
 188. Ac he sceal þa sacfullan gesibbian, gif he mæg.
 189. Ne mot he wæpnu werian ne to gefeohte faran.
 189. Forþonþe se canon us segd: gif he ofslagen bið on folces
gefeohte oþþe for sumere ceaste, þæt man nateshwon ne mot him
mæssian fore ne him fore gebiddan, ac bebyrian swaþeah.
 190. Nu secgað sume preostas, þæt Petrus hæfde sweord,
þaþa he of asloh þæs forscyldigan eare, þæs iudeiscan þeowan,
swaswa we rædað be þam.
 191. Ac we secgað to soþan, þæt se soðfæsta
hælend, ne þa þe him folgodon, ne ferdon gewæpnode, ne mid nanum
wige.
 192. Swaswa hit awriten is be him, þæt he ferde geond land,
geleafan tæcende, god wyrcende and þa witseocan gehælde and ealle
untrumnysse and adla gehælde.
 193. He ne flat, ne ne hrymde, ne mid hreðnysse ne ferde, ac
wæs gebroht to slege swaswa unscæþþig lamb.
 194. Þær com þeah færlice, swaswa hit gecweden
is:<foreign>domine; ecce gladii duo hic</foreign>;Drihten leof, her syndon twa sweord.
 196. Gif þær ær wæron, ne cwædon hi na swa.
 197. And gif Petrus moste þone man fulslean, þonne ne hete
Crist hine behydan þa sweord.
 198. He cwæð: Do þæt sweord into þære scæþe.
 199. He nolde geyfelian þam arleasan menn, ac he hine sona
gehælde on besettum eare.
 200. Se ylca Petrus eft, þe þæt eare of asloh, wearð
ahangen on rode for þæs hælendes geleafan, and he ongean ne wan,
naþer ne mid worde ne mid dæde.
 201. We ne moton beon ymbe mannes deað.
 201. Þeahþe he manslaga beo oþþe morð gefremede oþþe
mycel þeofman, swaþeah we ne scylan him deað getæcean.
 201. Na we ne motan deman ymbe þæt.
 201. Ac tæcean þa læwedan men him lif oþþe deað,
þæt we ne forleasan þa liþan unscæþþignysse.
 202. We ne forþon ne moton ænne fugel acwellan.
 203. Na we ne motan huntian ne hafecaras beon.
 204. Ac we motan fixian and swa us fodan begytan.
 205. Forþanþe nan hunta næs næfre halig, ac fisceras
wæron, swaswa Petrus wæs and his broþor Andreas and oþra gehwylce.
 206. Ne mot nan mæssepreost werian munucscrud on symbel, buton
he þone had sylf habban wylle.
 206. Na he ne mot beon mid læwedum scrude gescryd.
 206. Ne wer mid wifscrude, ne wif mid weres scrude.
 206. Gif hit hwa þonne deð, he bið amansumod.
 207. Ne sceal nan preost his cyricean forlætan, þe he to
gehadod bið and to oþere faran, buton his bisceop lyfe for sumon gesceade.
 208. Na he ne mot habban twa mynstre ætgædere, forþanþe
he ne mæg gefyllan þone fullan þeowdom on ægðrum stede on an
togædere.
 209. Ne nan uncuð preost, þe cymð of oþre scyre, ne mot
mæssan syngan ne mynster underfon butan þæs bisceopes leafe, þe on
þære scyre bið.
 210. And se bisceop gewite, þæt he þæs wyrþe sy,
þilæsþe he fare mid ænigum facne.
 211. We biddað eow preostas: beoð þyses gemyndig, þæs
þe ge nu gehyrdon.
 212. Þæt ge habban þa mede, þe ure hælend behet þam,
þe him þeniað.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

ÆLet 3 (Wulfstan 2)
B1.8.3.
Second Old English Letter for Wulfstan: Fehr 1914, 146-221.



 1. Eala ge mæssepreostas, mine gebroþra.
 1. We secgað eow nu þæt we ær ne sædon.
 2. Forþonþe we todæg sceolan dælan urne ele, on þreo
wisan gehalgodne, swaswa us gewissað seo boc: <foreign>Id est oleum sanctum et oleum
crismatis et oleum infirmorum</foreign>; þæt is on englisc: halig ele, oþer is
crisma and seoccra manna ele.
 3. And ge sceolon habban þreo ampullan gearuwe to þam þrym
elum.
 4. Forþanþe we ne durran don hi togædere on anum elefate,
forþanðe/ hyra ælc bið gehalgod on sundron to synderlicre þenunge.
 5. Mid þam haligan ele ge scylan þa hæþenan cild mearcian
on þam breoste and betwux þæm ge sculdru on middeweardan mid rode
tacne, ærþanþe ge hit fullian on þam fantwætere.
 6. And þonne hit of þæm wætere cymð, ge scylan wyrcan
rode tacen upp on þæm heafde mid þam haligan crisman.
 7. On þam haligan fante, ærþanþe ge hy fullian, ge scylon
don crisman on Cristes rode tacne.
 8. And man ne mot besprengan men mid þæm fantwætere,
syþþan se crisma bið þæron gedon.
 9. Mid seoccra manna ele ge scylan smyrian þa seocan, swaswa
Iacob se apostol on his pistole tæhte.
 10. <foreign>Ut alleuet eos dominus, et si in peccatis sint, dimittentur
eis</foreign> þæt drihten hi arære fram hyra seocnysse, and gif hy on synnum
syndon, þæt hy beon forgifene.
 11. Man sceal huslian þone seocan, þa hwyle þe he hit
forswelgan mæg.
 12. And man ne sceal hit na don nanum samcwyce men.
 13. Forþanþe he hit sceal etan, swaswa ure drihten cwæð:
<foreign>Qui manducat carnem meam et bibit sanguinem meum, in me manet et ego in eo</foreign>,
þæt is: Seþe yt min flæsc and drincgð min blod, se wunað on me
and ic wunige on him.
 14. Sume seoce synd swa dysige, þæt hy ondrædað him,
þæt hi sceolan swyltan sona for þam husle.
 15. Ac we secgeað to soþan, þæt he ne swylt na for þy,
þeahþe he ælce dæge underfo þæt husel, ac his synna beoð
adylegode þurh þone drihtenlican hlaf and he bið eac gescyld wið
deofles syrwunga.
 16. Se seoca man sceal swyþe behreowsian his ærran synna and
geswycennysse behatan and he mot hy andettan oþ þa nyhstan orþuncge.
 17. And he sceal forgifan eallum þam mannum, þe him ær
abulgon, and biddan hym forgifnysse.
 18. Ge sculon huslian þa cild, þonne hi gefullode beoð, and
hy man bere to mæssan, þæt hyg beon gehuslode ealle þa seofon dagas,
þa hwile þe hig unþwogene beoð.
 19. Ge ne motan mæssian on læwedra manna huse.
 20. Ne man ne mot drincan ne dwollice plegan, ne etan innan
cyrican, ne unnytte word þærinne sprecan; ac hine gebiddan.
 21. Forþonþe heo his gebedhus.
 22. And eac forþanþe se hælend adræfde of þam haligan
temple ealle þa gedwolan mid hyra gedwylde and cwæð þus: min hus is
gecweden gebedhus.
 23. <foreign>SERMO IN CENA DOMINI ET SEXTA FERIA ET SABBATO SANCTO</foreign>.
 23. <foreign>In cena domini et in parasceue et in sancto sabbato</foreign>.
 23. On þyssum þrym swigenihtum ge sceolan singan ætgædere
be fullan eowerne uhtsang, swaswa se antifonere tæcð.
 24. And feower and twentig candela acwencan æt þam sealmum and
æt ælcere rædingce oþ þone æftemynstan antifon.
 25. And geendian þone æftersang swa, þæt ælc singe his
pater noster on sundron and þa <foreign>preces</foreign> þærto butan ælcum leohte
licgende on cneowum.
 26. On þam þunresdæge ge singað ætgædere ealle eower
tydsangas.
 26. Singað swaþeah æfre þæt pater noster and þa
preces on sundran.
 27. On frigedæg and on sæternesdæg singað eowre
tyddsangas ælc preost on sundran, butan þam uhtsange.
 28. On þunresdæg ge sculan aþwean eower weofodu,
ærþanðe ge mæssian and ge elles ne motan.
 29. And æfter æfensange ge sculon unscrydan þa weofodu, and
standan hi swa nacode oþ þone sæternesdæg.
 30. And man þa weofodsceatas awahxe betwux þam.
 31. And healdað on þam dæge eower fæsten oþ non.
 32. <foreign>Implete mandatum domini in caena ipsius</foreign>, Doð on þam
þunresdæge, swaswa ure drihten bebead.
 32. Aþweað þearfena fet and him fodan doð; scrud, gif eow
to onhagige.
 33. And eac eow betwynan eowre fet aþweað mid eadmodnysse,
swaswa Crist sylf dyde and us swa don het.
 34. On þam dæge ge ne motan cweþan æt þære
mæssan: <foreign>dominus uobiscum</foreign>, butan se bisceop ana, þe þone ele halgað.
 35. Ne ge eac ne sculon gan to pacem ne agnus dei singan.
 36. Ac þær man þone ele halgað, man sceal cyssan þa
fatu.
 37. And ge sculon healdan of þam husle, þe ge halgiað
þæs dæges, to þicgenne on frigedæg æt þære þenuncge.
 38. Forþanþe man ne mot halgian nan husel on þam dæge,
þe Crist on þrowode for ure alysednysse.
 39. On frigedæge ær none æt fruman man sceal rædan
þæs witegan rædincge: <foreign>In tribulatione sua mane</foreign>.
 39. And syþþan þone traht singan: <foreign>Domine audiui</foreign>.
 39. Æfter þam trahte: <foreign>Flectamus genua</foreign>; þonne: <foreign>Deus a quo
et Iudas</foreign>.
 39. Eft oþre rædincge: <foreign>Dixit dominus ad Moysen et Aaron</foreign> and
þonne traht: <foreign>Eripe me, domine</foreign>.
 40. Ræde man þonne Cristes þrowunge be Iohannes gesetnysse.
 41. Æt þære ne man sceal cweþan: Dominus uobiscum ne
nænne gloria tibi domine.
 42. Æfter þison cweþe se preost þa collecta swaswa seo
mæsseboc him tæcð.
 43. Æfter þam beran twegen gebroþru þa rode forð mid
hrægle bewæfed and singan þa fers: <foreign>Popule meus</foreign>.
 44. Twegen gebroþru him andwyrdon on grecisc: Agios o theos oþ
ende.
 45. And hi ealle þonne þæt ylce singan on leden: <foreign>Sanctus
deus, sanctus fortis</foreign>.
 46. Þonne þæt oþer fers: <foreign>Quia eduxi uos</foreign>; þonne eft:
<foreign>agios, o theos</foreign>, and: <foreign>sanctus deus</foreign>.
 47. Þonne þæt þrydde fers: <foreign>Quid ultra debui</foreign> and: <foreign>Agios</foreign>
and: <foreign>Sanctus</foreign>; Unwreon þonne þa rode and singan: <foreign>Ecce lignum crucis</foreign> and
þa oþre antifonas.
 49. Þa hwile þe þa gebroþru hi gebiddað æt þære
rode and þæt læwede folc eallswa do.
 50. Lecge se diacon syððan corporale uppon þæm weofode mid
þæm husle, þe wæs on þæm ærran dæge gehalgod and sette
þone calic þæron emn mid ungehalgodum wine.
 51. And cweþe se mæssepreost be sone: Oremus: <foreign>Preceptis
salutaribus moniti</foreign> and pater noster oð ende.
 52. Cweþe þonne fægre: <foreign>Libera nos, quæsumus, domine, ab
omnibus malis</foreign>.
 52. Eft syþþan be sone: <foreign>Peromnia secula seculorum</foreign>.
 53. Do se mæssepreost þonne of þam husle mid swygan into
þam calice.
 54. And gange he to husle and ealle þa gebroþru.
 55. Singan syþþan hyra æfensang, ælc on sundron, and gan
syþþan to hyra gereorde.
 56. And ne beo hyra nan gesceod þæs dæges, butan he untrum
sy, ærþanþe þis gefylled sy.
 57. On easteræfen man sceal halgian ærost þone tapor.
 58. And syþþan rædan þa rædincge: <foreign>In principio fecit
deus celum et terram</foreign>.
 59. Don syþþan þa seofon letanias þenuncge, swa eower
bec eow tæceað and mid fif letanias halgie fant.
 60. Ac ge ne scylan singan offerendan on þæm dæge ne agnus
dei ne communia ne gan to pacem.
 61. Singan swaþeah: <foreign>Gloria in excelsis deo</foreign>.
 62. Æfter þæm huselgange singað alleluia be sone and
þone sceortan sealm þærmid: <foreign>Laudate dominum, omnes gentes</foreign>.
 62. Aginnan syþþan þone antiphon: <foreign>Uespere autem sabbati and
fulsingan magnificat</foreign>.
 63. Æfter þæm antiphone cweðe se mæssepreost þa
collectan: <foreign>Post communionem</foreign> and geendige swa þa mæssan and þone
æfensang mid anre collectan.
 64. Se mæssepreost sceal halgian sealt and wæter on ælcum
sunnandæge ærþanþe he mæssige and stredan geond þa cyricean and
ofer þæt folc.
 65. And healdan þæt wæter, gif hwa habban wylle, oþ
þæt he oþer halgige on þam oþrum sunnandæge.
 66. Man sceal to mæssan don gemencged win and wæter
togædere well clænlice.
 67. Forþanþe þæt win getacnað ure alysednysse þurh
þæs hælendes blod, þe he for us ageat, and þæt wæter
getacnað witodlice þæt folc, þe Crist alysde mid his leoffæstan
blode.
 68. Gif hwa win næbbe ofer ealne þone gear, he nime lynen
hrægl, þe to note ær ne com and bedyppe on wine, þæt he
þurhwæt sy.
 68. Dryge hine ðonne on sunnan and dyppe hine oþre syþan,
dryge hine eft and dyppe þryddan syþe, dryge hine þonne eft on þære
hatan sunnan, and healde hine clænlice and on clænum wætere wæte of
þam claðe and wringe on his calic.
 68. Do swa lytlum and lytlum, oþ þæt se clað sy asoht.
 69. Se preost sceal hogian, þæt he his offrunga do swyðe
clænlice þurh clað geseohgod.
 70. And his ofletan ne beon na to eald bacene.
 71. And he aþwea his calic æfre ymbe seofon niht.
 72. Forþanþe se wytega segð, þæt se bið awyrged,
seþe Godes þenunge deð mid gymeleaste.
 73. Forþy ne mot nan blynd preost mæssian næfre,
forþanþe he ne gesyhð hwæt he sylf offrað.
 74. Mycele mede geearnað æt þam ælmihtigan Gode, seþe
him clænlice þenað æt his clænum weofode.
 75. And þam folce deð for Gode þa þenunga, þe to cyricean
gebyriað on asettum tyman.
 76. And genoh halig byð lif þam, þe hylt his clænnysse
and Gode swa þenað on his gastlican þeowdome.
 77. Gif he fram heafodleahtrum gehealden byð.
 78. Nu cwyð, ic wene, eower sum to me: we nabbað þone fultum,
þæt we þis forðbringan magan.
 79. Þonne we standað ana æt urum weofode.
 80. And ic secge eow to soþan, þæt ge sceolan læran
cnapan and geonge men eow to fultume, þæt hig æfter eow don þa ylcan
þenunga.
 81. Na eower agene cild, þe ge unrihtlice gestrynað, ac þa
ælfremedan, þæt hy eowre cild beon þurh þa gastlican lare.
 81. And ge beoð þonne lareowas.
 82. And ge magon swa begytan þa mæstan geþyngðu.
 83. Swaswa Daniel se witega on his witegunge gesette: <foreign>Qui autem
docti, fulgebunt quasi splendor firmamenti et qui ad iustitiam erudiunt multos,
quasi stelle in perpetuas æternitates</foreign>; þæt is on engliscre spræce:
þaþe gelærede beoð, hy scynað swaswa steorran soðlice on ecnisse.
 84. Ne most þu na ana mæssian, butan man ðe andwyrde,
ðeahþe þu for unkiste clerec nabban nelle, oþþe ðu for Godes lufan
oþre læran nylle.
 85. Ac healst Godes pund on þinum swat claðe, þe to ecum
wite, swaswa us segð þæt godspell.
 86. Sume preostas afyllað hyra husel boxcs on eastran and healð
ofer twelf monað to untrumum mannum, swilce þæt husel sig haligre
þonne oþer.
 87. Ac nig doð swiþe unwislice, forþonðe hit wanað
oððe mid ealle forrotað on swa langum fyrste.
 88. And he bið þonne scyldig, swaswa us secgð seo boc.
 89. Seðe husel forhilt oððe hit forlyst oððe hit mis
etað oþþe oþre nytenu, sceawa ða penitentialem hwæt heo segð be
ðysum.
 90. Eal swa halig is þæt husel, þe bið gehalgod todæg,
swa þæt, þe bið gehalgod on þam haligan easterdæge.
 91. Healdað forðy, ic bidde, þonne haligan Cristes lichaman
mid maran wisdome to seocum mannum fram sunnandæge to sunnandæge on
swiþe clænum boxcse, oððe be þam mæstan <foreign>xvi</foreign> nyht and ðicgan
hit þonne and lecgan þær oðer.
 92. We habbað bysne be þam on Moyses æ, þæt se sacerd
sceolde on ælcum saternes dæge settan twelf hlafas on þam tabernacula,
ealle nibace.
 92. Þa wæran gehatene <foreign>panis propositionis</foreign>.
 92. And hyg sceoldan þær standan on þam Godes getelde oð
oðerne sæternes dæg and etan hyg ðonne þa sacerdas sylfe and settan
þar oðre to.
 93. Sume preostas nellað þicgan þæt husel, þe hyg
halgiað.
 93. Nu willað we eow secgað, hu seo boc segð be þam:
<foreign>Presbiter missam celebrans et non audens sumere sacrificium, accusante
conscientia sua, anathema sit</foreign>; Se mæsse preost, þe mæssað and ne
dear ðæt husel ðicgan, wat hine scildigne, se is amansumad.
 95. Læsse pleoh is to ðicganne þæt husol þonne to
halgienne.
 96. Seðe aniges þinges abirigð, ætes oððe wætes,
ostran oþþe ofet, wines oðð wæteres, ne ræde he pistol ne
godspell to mæssan.
 96. Gif hit hwa þonne deð, he unarwirðað God and mid
þære dyrstignysse hine sylfne fordeð.
 97. Seðe tuwa halgað ane ofeletan to husle, se bið ðam
gedwolan gelic, þe an cyld fulað tuwa.
 98. Crist silf gehalgode husel ær his þrowuncge.
 99. He bletsode þonne hlaf and tobræc, þus cweþende to his
haligum apostolum: ætað þisne hlaf, hit is min lichama.
 100. And he eft bletsode ænne calic mid wine and cwæd him
ðus to: Drincað ealle of þissum, hit is min agen blod þare niwan
gecyðnesse, þe byð for manegum agoten on sinna forgifnesse.
 101. Se drihten, þe halgode husol ær hys þrowuncge and
cwæd, þæt se hlaf wære his agen lichama and þæt win wære
witodlice his blod, se halgað dæghwamlice þurh his sacerda handa hlaf to
his lichaman and win to his blode on gastlicre gerine, swaswa we rædað on
bocum.
 102. Ne bið se liflica hlaf lichamlice swaðeah se ylca lichama,
þe Crist on þrowade.
 102. Ne ðæt halige win nis ðæs hælendes blod, þe for
us agoten wæs on lichamlicam ðincge.
 103. Ac on gastlicum andgite ægðer bið soðlice se hlaf his
lichaman and þæt win eac his blod.
 104. Swaswa se heofonlica hlaf wæs, þe we hatað manna, þe
feowertig geara afedde Godes folc, and þæt luttre wæter wæs
witodlice his blod, þe arn of þam stane on þam wæstene ða.
 105. Swa Paulus awrat on sumum his pistole: <foreign>Omnes patres nostri
eandem escam spiritalem manducauerunt et omnes eundem potum spiritalem biberunt
et cetera</foreign>.
 105. Ealle ure fæderas ætan on ðam westene þone ylcon
gastlican mete and gastlican drinc druncon.
 105. Hyg druncon of ðam gastlican stane and se stan wæs
Crist.
 106. Se apostol sæde, swaswa ge nu gehyrdan, ðæt hig ealle
ætan þone ylcan gastlican mete and hyg ealle druncon þone gastlican
drenc.
 107. Ne cwæð he na lichamlice ne ac gastlice.
 107. Næs Crist þa gyt geboren, ne his blod næs agoten,
ðaða þæt Israhela folc geæt þæne mete and of ðam stane
dranc.
 108. And se stan næs lichamlice Crist, þe ac þe swa
cweðende wære.
 109. Hit wæron ða ylcan gerinu on þare ealdan æ and hyg
gastlice getacnodon þæt gastlice husol ure hælendes lichaman, þe we
halgiað nu.
 110. Sume preostas nellað syllan þam folce husol, buton hi hyt
gebicgan.
 110. Ne heora bearn fullian.
 110. Ac hyg sceoldan understandan, hu se hælend adræfde mid
geworhtre swipe ða cypan of þam temple.
 111. Nolde þæt hyg mangedon on þam mæran huse.
 111. And hu he eac bebead on his godspelle: <foreign>Gratis accepistis;
gratis date</foreign>.
 112. Ge hit underfencgon butan gearnuncgum; doð hit eac oðrum
butan gearnuncgum.
 113. Gyf we þa þenunga haligan, þe we ðam hælende doð,
sillað wið feo, hwæt silð he us þonne?
 114. Þara laca we motan be Godes leafe brucan, þe man
silfwilles deð, ac we sceolan geearnian.
 115. Mann ne mot na logian andluman innan cyrican, ne corn ne nan
ðing on Cristes huse, buton þam anum þincgum, þe to his þenuncgum
gebyriað.
 116. Sume preostas mencgað win to þam fantwætere, swiðe
unrihtlice.
 117. Ongean þa setnyss, swaswa he cwyð to Gode on þære
bletsunge: <foreign>Tu has simplices aquas tuo ore benedicto</foreign>; ðæt is on engliscum
gereorde bletsa, ðu drihten, þas anfealdan wætum mid þinum haligum
muþe.
 118. Ac þæt wæter ne bið nanfeald, gyf þar bið win to
gedon.
 119. And Crist ne het na fullian his folc mid wine, ac mid
anfealdum wætere, swaswa us gewisað ðæt godspell.
 120. Ge sceolan cunnan gemindelice and mannum eac secgan þa tyn
ænlican word, þe God tæhte Moysen and mid his fingre awrat on twam
stænenum tabulum on ðam munte Synai, eallum mannum to steore, eallum folce
þa, ðe geo wæs, ge us, þe nu sindan.
 121. <foreign>Hoc est decalogum Moysi</foreign>.
 121. Þæt sint þa tin beboda, þe eac God sylf geclipode on
þam munte myd micelre stemne to eallum ðam mannum, þe mid Moyse wæron
on þam wæstene þa: <foreign>Ego sum dominus deus tuus, qui eduxi te de terra
Egypti;Non habebis deos alienos coram me</foreign>;þæt is on englisc: Ic eom
drihten, ðin God; ic, þe þe alædde of Egypta lande; ne hafa þu
ællfremde godas ætforan me nateshwon.
 123. Ðis is ðæt forme bebod, þæt we simle wurðian
þone ælmihtigan God, seðe ana is God, seo halige þrinis, þe ealle
ðincg gesceop on anre godcundnisse æfre rixiende, and we ne sceolan na
weorðian þa dwolican godas; hi ne sind na godas, ac gramlice deoflu.
 124. Ðæt oþer bebod is þus: <foreign>Non adsumas nomen domini dei
tui in uanum</foreign>; Ne underfoh ðu on idelnisse þines drihtines naman.
 125. Seðe gelif swa on Crist, þæt he si gesceapen and nele
gelifan, þæt he æf God wære mid his ælmihtigan fæder on anre
godcundnisse and mid þam halgan gaste on anum mægenþrimme.
 125. He nis na gesceaft, ac is soð scippend and ælc gesceaft
is soðlice underðeod nu idelnisse, þæt is awendedlicnesse,
forðonðe þa gesceaftum beoð to beteran þincgum awende.
 126. Ðæt þridde bebod is <foreign>Memento ut diem sabbati
sanctifices</foreign>; þæt is on urum gereorde: Beo ðu gemindig, þæt þu
gehalige restendæg.
 127. Under Moyses æ men halgodan þa þone sæternesdæg
mid swiðlican weorðmynte fram ðeowetlicum weorcum, and we sculon us
healdan fram ðeowetlicum weorce, þæt sindan sinna gewiss, þe
gebrincgað on ðeowete þa ðe hi swyðost begað, swaswa se hælend
cwæð on his haligan godspelle: <foreign>Omnis qui facit peccatum, seruus est
peccati</foreign>; ælc þara ðe sinna gewyrcð, is ðara sinna ðeow.
 127. We sculon gastlice healdan Godes restendæg, swa þæt we
silfe beon fram sinnum æmptige and se dæg beo gehalgod on us sylfum swa.
 127. Fela þincga getacnað se foresæda restendæg.
 127. Ac we healdað nu æfter þæs hælendes æriste
ðone sunnandæg freolice, forðonðe he of deaðe aras on ðam
easterlican sunnandæge, and se sunnandæg is on gesceapennisse firmest and
we sculon eac hine æfre weorðian, Gode to wyrðminte, on gastlicum
ðeowdome.
 128. Þas þreo beboda wæron on anre tabulan awritene and ða
oðre seofon on oðre tabulan.
 129. Ðæt feorðe bebod is: <foreign>Honora patrem tuum et matrem
tuam</foreign>; ðæt is engliscre spræce: Arwyrða þinne fæder and eac
þinre meder.
 129. Seðe wyrgeð fæder oððe modor, se is deaðes
scyldig.
 130. Æfter gastlicum andgite God is ure fæder and his halige
gelaðuncg, þæt is geleaffull folc, ure gastlice modor, on ðære we
beoð accennede on þam haligan fulluhte, Gode to bearnum, and we forþig
sceolan God, urne fæder, and his gastlice bride, þa haligan cyrican,
simble wurðian.
 131. Ðæt fifte bebod is: <foreign>Non occides</foreign>;Ne ofsleh ðu nænne
mann.
 132. Þæt is seo mæste sinn, þæt man mann ofslea
unscyldigne oððe his sawle ofslea, gyf he hine to sinne tiht.
 133. And yfel bið þam mann, þe mæg gehelpan þam
wædligan menn and forwyrnð him his goda and læt hine acwellan for his
uncyste.
 134. Ðæt sixte bebod is: <foreign>Non mechaberis</foreign>; Ne unriht hæm
ðu.
 135. Ælc þæra manna, þe butan rihtre æwe hæmð, he
hæmð unrihtlice.
 136. Ðæt seofoðe bebod is: <foreign>Non furtum facies</foreign>; ðæt is:
Ne stala þu.
 137. Forþon seðe stilð, he hæfð wulfes wican and na
wises mannes, and se rica, þe berypð and myd reðnysse ofsitt þa
unscildigan menn, he is soðlice wyrsa þonne se digla þeof, forðonðe
he deð openlice þæt, þæt se oðer deð dearnunga symble.
 138. Ðæt eahtoðe bebod is: <foreign>Non loqueris contra proximum
tuum falsum testimonium</foreign>; Ne beo ðu leas gewyta.
 139. Hit is soðlice awriten: Ne bið se leasa gewita ungewitnod
nateshwon.
 140. And seðe spicð leasuncga he sceal losian sylf.
 141. Wa ðam, ðe for sceattum forsylþ hyne silfne and awent
soð to leasum and leas to soðum.
 142. Ðæt nigoðe bebod is: <foreign>Non concupisces uxorem proximi
tui</foreign>; Ne gewylna ðu oðres mannes wifes.
 143. Ðæt teoðe bebod is: <foreign>Non concupisces ullam rem proximi
tui</foreign>; Ne gewilna ðu oðres mannes æhta.
 144. Hyt bið riht, þæt gehwa hæbbe þæt, þæt he
sylf begitt, butan he his geunne oþrum menn sylf willes, ðincg oþþe he
hit forgange.
 145. Nu ge habbað gehyred be þam healican tyn bebodum.
 146. Nu willæ we eow secgan sceortlice eac swilce be þam eahta
heafodleahtrum, ðe ða unwaran menn fordeð and witodlice besencað on
ða ecan witu.
 147. Se forma heafodleahtor is on leden superbia and on englisc
modygniss.
 148. Seo macode to deoflum þa wlitigan encglas, þe wunedon on
heofonum.
 149. And se modiga mann ne mæg cuman to heofonum, ac byð
ðara deofla gefera, butan he þæs dysiges geswice.
 150. Forðonþe modigniss is swiðe micel dysig and se wisa mann
nat, on hwan he modige.
 151. Seo modigniss is ælces yfeles ord and ende, ac heo bið
oferswiðeð þurh þa soðan eadmodnysse.
 152. Seo eadmod nyss gedeð, þæt þa eaðmodan beoð
encglum gelice on þam ecum lyfe.
 153. Se oðer heafodleahtor is <foreign>castrimargia uel gula</foreign>, þæt
is on englisc gyferniss.
 154. Seo awearp æt fruman þa frumsceapenan menn of neorxna
wange, ðaða hig ætan of ðam forbodenan treowe.
 155. And se mann byð gifre, þe for gyfernisse ne mæg his
mæles onbidan, swaswa mann don sceal.
 156. And seðe drunconnysse to dyselice begæð and on
oferflowednysse gefadað his lyf.
 157. Þone unþeaw oferswyð seo gesceadwyse gemetegung,
þæt he hæbbe gemet on mettum and on druncen.
 158. Seo þridda heafodleahtor is Fornicatio, þæt is seo
galniss, þa oferswið seo clænnis.
 159. Seo feorða heafodleahtor is Auaritia on leden and on englisc
gytsuncg.
 160. Seo ontent þane mann to maran æhte æfre and heo
næfre ne byð full.
 161. Seo bið oferswiðed þurh cystignesse swaþeah.
 162. Se fifta is Ira, þæt is weamodniss, þæt se mann ne
mæge his mod gewildan, ac butan ælcum wisdome waclice irsað and
mannslihtas gefremað and fela reþnissa.
 163. Þone mæg oferswyðan þæs modes geðild, seðe mid
gesceade him sylfan gewissað.
 164. Se sixta is accidia, þæt is asolcennyss, ðæt is
modes swærniss and ungemetegod slapulniss.
 167. Se leahtor bið oferswiðed þurh þæs modes
anrædnisse, þæt se mann beo anræde æfre on godum weorcum.
 165. Þæt se mann beo ungearo to ælcum gode æfre.
 166. Þes leahtor gemacað micel yfel þam menn, þonne he
þurh asolcennysse swa aswunden leofað, þæt he nan ðing to gode ne
deð on his life and nan edlean næfð butan ece wite.
 168. Se seofoða heafodleahtor is Tristitia on leden, þæt is
on englisc unrotnyss for mislicum gelimpum, þe mannum becymð on cwelme and
on lyrum oþþe on freonda forðsiðe.
 169. Þonne murcnað se mann on his mode to swiðe and ceorað
ongean God ungesceadwislice.
 170. Twa unrotnisse sindan swaswa us seccað bec.
 170. An is ðeos yfele, ðe we embe sprecað, oþer is
halwende, swaswa we her secgað, ðæt se mann unrotsi for his ærrum
sinnum and hig behreowsige mid rædfæstum mode.
 171. Seo yfele unrotnyss byð eac oferswiðed þurh ða
gastlican blisse, þe mann for Gode habban sceal.
 172. Se eahtoðe heafodleahtor is: <foreign>cenodoxia, id est, iactantia
uel uana gloria</foreign>, þæt is gylp on englisc oððe getot, gereht, þæt
se mann beo leofgeorn and mid gylpe afylled, þeahðe he nateshwon hergendlic
ne si.
 173. And byð þonne hiwere þurh þone heafodleahter and ranc
on his gyrelum and unrædfæst on dædum.
 174. Þone leahter oferswið se soðe lufu on Gode, on urum
heortan agoten þurh þone haligan gast.
 175. Nu ge habbað gehyred þa eahta heafodleahtris and eac þa
eahta mihta, þe hi magan oferswiðan.
 176. Þa unsigendan deor and heora toðum ætberstan.
 177. Forþonþe ne byð nan ðing swa yfel on ðissum life,
þæt næbbe læcedom þurh ðæs hælendes foresceawunge, þe
hylt ealle ðingc, gyf we ða læcedomas us sylfum don cunnan.
 178. <foreign>Debetis in purificatione sancte Marie candelas
benedicere et cetera</foreign>.
 178. Ge sculon on þam mæssedæge, þe is gehaten
purificatio sancte Marie, bletsian candela and beran mid lofsange, ge
gehadode ge læwede, to processionem and ofrian hig swa byrnende æfter
þam godspelle þam mæssepreoste mid ðam offrumsange.
 179. Ge sculon bletsian axan on caput ieiunium and mid halig
wætere besprencgan.
 180. Do þonne se mæssepreost on ufeweardum his heafde myd
ðære haligan rode tacne and on ealra þara manna, þe æt þære
mæssan beoð, ærðamþe he mæssige and gan to processionem.
 181. Ge sculon on palmsunnandæge palmtwigu bletsian and beran
mid lofsange to processionem and habban on handa, ge gehadade ge læwede, and
offrian hig æfter þam godspelle þam mæssepreoste mid þam
offrungsange.
 182. Nu gyf hwa nyte hwæt þis getacnige, he leornige æt
oðrum menn on leden oððe on englisc.
 183. Beoð soðfæste, ic bidde, and betweox eow getriwe.
 184. Beoð eac snotere and swiðe rihtwyse.
 185. Ne beswice nan oðerne.
 186. Ne ge næ swerian man.
 187. Ne lufige higeleaste.
 188. Ne ge gligmenn ne beon.
 189. Sprecað butan aðe mid anfealdre bilewitnesse, swaswa se
hælend tæhte on his haligum godspelle.
 190. Lufiað eow betweonan and gyf hwa lare ne cunne, he leornige
æt oðrum, þe gelæred si and se mid eaðmodnysse hine gewissige.
 191. Þæt we willað eac don, gif us hwa ahsað, swaswa us
manað Moyses gesetniss: <foreign>Interroga patrem tuum et adnuntiabit tibi et
cetera</foreign>; Ahsa þinne fæder and he cyð þe ymbe God.
 193. Ahsa þine yldran; hi ðe andwyrdað and secgað.
 194. Uton beon gemyndige, hu se mildheorta Crist cwæð: Lufa
ðinne drihten God mid ealre þinre heortan, and lufa þinne nihstan swaswa
ðe sylfne.
 195. Þas twa bebodu belucaþ ealle þa haligan lare.
 196. Forðon seðe God lufað, he gelyfð eac on hine and nele
nan ðincg don þæs ðe Gode oflicige, ac, swaswa he firmest mæge, he
gefilð his bebodu.
 197. And seðe his nihstan lufað, nele he him nan lað don ne
his æhta him ætbredan dearnuncga oþþe eawuncga.
 198. Gefultmige us se hælend to his bebodum, seðe leofað and
rixað mid his leofan fæder and þan haligum gaste on anre godcundnisse,
hig ðri an God, æfre ryxiende a woruld.
 198. Amen.

ÆLet 4 (SigeweardB)
B1.8.4.3.
Letter to Sigeweard ['On the Old and New Testament'] (Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Bodley 343): Crawford 1922, 18-33, 39-51.



 51. Ðe ælmihtigæ Scyppend, þa þa he englæs isceop,
þa wrohte he þurh his wisdom tyn englæ werod on ðam forme dæge on
mucelre fægernesse, fela þusendæ on ðam frumsceafte, þæt heo
hine on his wuldre wurðedon ealle lichamlease, leohte & strange, butan
ealle synnum on sælðe libbende, swa wlitiges cyndes, swa we secgan ne
magon, & nan yfel nes on þam englæn þa gyt, ne nan yfel ne com
þurð Godes sceapenesse, for þon ðe him sylf is ealgod & ælc god
cymeð of him; and þa englas þa wunedon on þam wuldre mid Gode.
 67. Hwæt, ða binnan six dagum, ðe þe soðæ God þa
gesceafte isceop, þe he scyppen wolde, sceawode þe an ængel þe
þær ænlicost wæs, hu fæger he sylf wæs & hu scinende on
wuldre, & cunnode his mihte, þæt he mihtig wæs isceapen, & him
wel licode his wurðfulnesse þa.
 76. Ðe hatte Lucifer, þæt is Lihtberende, for þare mycele
beorhtnysse his mæren heowæs.
 78. Ða þuhte him to huxlic, þæt he hyran sceolde ænigum
laforde, þa he swa ænlic wæs, & nolde wurðian ðone, ðe hine
wrohte, & him þankiæn æfre ðæs þe he him geaf & beon him
underþeod þæs ðe swiðer geornlice þe he hine mæðegode.
 87. He nolde þa habban his Scyppend him to laford, ne he nolde
ðurhwuniæn on ðare softnysse ðæs soðfestæn Godes, þe hine
swa fæger isceop, & wulde mid ricetere him rice gewinnan & ðurh
modignesse hine maciæn to God, & nam him gadan ongean Godes willan to
his unræde on eornost ifæstnod.
 96. Ða næfde he nan setl, hwær he sittan mihte, for þan
ðe nan heofon nolde hine aberon, ne nan rice næs, þe his mihte beon
ongean Godes willan, þe wrohte ealle þing.
 101. Ða funde ðe modig, hwylce his mihtæ wæron, þa þa
his fet ne mihton ahwær stonden, ac he feol þa adun to deofle awend &
ealle his gadæn of þam Godes hirede in to helle wite be heora wruht.
 107. Ða on þam sixten dæge, syððan þis idon wæs,
sceop þe almihtigæ God mannan of eorðan, Adam mid his handum, & him
sawle geaf, & Euam eft syððan of Adames ribbe, þæt heo sceoldon
habben, & heora ofspryng mid him, þa fægra wununge ðe þe feond
forleas, gif heo gehyrsumedon heora Scyppende on rihte.
 116. Ða beswac ðe deofel syððan eft ða men, þæt heo
Godes bod tobrecan fulraðe & wurðan ða deadlice, & adræfde ba
twa of ðare murhðe to ðissum middanearde, & on sorege leofoden &
on swincum syððan, & æll heoræ ofspryng þe of heom com
syððan, oð ðet ure Hælend Crist ure yfel gebette, swa swa ðeos
racu hæræfter sæð us.
 126. We nimæð of ðam bocum ðas endeburdnesse, ðe Moyses
wrat, þe mæra heretoga, swa swa him God sylf dihte on heora
sunderspæce, þa þa he mid Gode wunode on þam munte Synai xl dagæn
on an, & underfeng his lare, & he ætes ne gymde on ealle ðam
fyrste for þare micelan bisgunge þare bocæ lare.
 137. Fif bec he wrat mid wunderlice dihte.
 138. Þe forme is Genesis, ðe befehð þas race ærest fram
frumsceafte, & be Adames synne & hu he leofede nigon hund gearæ
& þrittig geara oð þare forman ylde þissere weorlde & bearn
strunde be his ibeddan Euam, & he syððan gewat mid sorege to helle.
 146. Caim wæs his sunu, þe acwalde his broðor, Abel ihaten,
unscyldigne man, for his agene andan, ðe he hæfde to him, & Caines
ofsprung, þe him of com, syððan eall wearð adrenced on þam deope
flode, ðe on Noes dagum adydde eal moncyn butan þam æhtan monnum, ðe
binnan þam arche weron, & of ðam yfelæn teame ne com nan þing
syððan.
 157. Ac Adam istreonde æfter Abeles slæge oðerne sunu, þe
wæs Seth ihaten, of ðam strenge com þæt ðer cwic bilaf, Noe &
his wif & heora ðreo sunæ, Sem, Cham & Iaphæt mid heoræ
ðreom wifum Adam tacnode, þe on ðam sixtan dæge isceapen wæs þurh
Gode, ure Hælend Crist, ðe com to ðissere weorulde & us edniwode to
his licnysse.
 171. Eua tacnode, þe of Adames sidan God sylf wrohte, Godes
gelaðunge, ðe of Cristes siden syððan wearð acenned his sylfes agen
bryd mid his blode aðwogen.
 176. Abeles slæge soðlice tacnode ure Hælendes slæge,
þe ða Iudeiscan ofslogen, yfele broðræ swa swa Caim wæs.
 180. Seth, Adames sunu, is isæd ærist, & he tacnode
untwylice Crist, ðe þe of deaþe aras on ðam ðriddæ dæge.
 183. Enohc wæs isæd þe seofeða mon from Adame: he wrohte
Godes willan & God hine nam ða mid andsundum lichame of þisse life up,
& he is cwic gyt, swa swa Helias, þe æðela witega, þe wæs eal
swa inumen to ðam oðre life, & heo cymeð begen togeanes Antecriste,
þæt heo his leasunge alecgan ðurh God, & beoð þenne ofslægene
ðurh ðone sylfan feond, & heo eft arisað, swa swa ealle men doð.
 195. Noe, ðe on ðam arche wæs on ðam miclæn flode, ðe
al weorld adrencte buton æhtæ monnum, is iræht <foreign>requies</foreign>, þæt is
ræst on Englisc; & he tacnode for ði Crist, ðe to us for ði com,
þæt he us of ðissere weorlde to ræste brohte & to blisse mid
him.
 203. And swa forð oð ende, ælc halig fæder oððe mid
wordum, oððe mid weorcum, cyddon ure Hælend & his Fæder
witolice.
 208. Herto wæs þeo forme ylde þissere weorlde, & of
ðam æhta monnum com eal moncyn syððan, & ðeo oðer ylde wæs
þissere werolde oð Abrahames timen, þæs ealden heahfæderes.
 213. Nu sæð us ðeo boc be Noes ofsprunge, þet his sunu
streonedon twa ant hundseofentig sunæ; þa begunnon to wurcenne þa
wunderlice burh & þenne heagan stypel, þe sceolde astigen up to
heofenum, be hora unræde; ac God sylf com þerto & sceawæde heora
weorc & sealde heora ælcum synderlice spæce, þæt heora ælc
wæs uncuð hwæt oðer sæde & heo swa swican sonæ þare
timbrung, & heo ða toferdon to fyrlæna landum on swa moniga spæce
swa þær monna wæs.
 228. On ðare ilcan ylde mon arerde hæðengyld wide geond
þas weorld & on ðissere ylde þa yfela leoda, fif burhscira ðæs
fulestan mennisces Sodomitisces eardes, mid swæflene fyre, færlice wurdon
ealle forbearnde, & heora burga samod, buton Loth ane, ðe God lædde
ðanon mid his þrim hiwum for his rihtwisnesse.
 239. Of Noes ealdeste sunu, ðe wæs Sem ihaten, com þæt
Ebreisce folc, ðe on Gode lyfde, Abrahames forðfæderes, & his
fæder wæs Thare, þe eardode ærest on Caldea rice, oð ðet Abraham
ferde eft be Godes hæse to Chananeiscan earde, þer his cyn syððan
wunode.
 247. Abraham, ðe heahfæder, hæfde twægen sunu, Ismael
& Isaac, & he wurðode God mid al his heortan, & þe heofenlice
fæder ilome to him spæc for his myclan leafan, for ðan ðe he wolde
offrian his agene sunu Gode, Isaac ðone leofran, to lace on his weofode on
ða ealdan wisan, gif hit God swa wolde.
 257. God þa hine bletsode & his bearn wæs isund, & God
sylf him behet, þæt þurh his cyn sceolde al moncyn beon ibletsod for his
miclan ileafan & for his hyrsumnesse, þe he hæfde to Gode.
 262. Abraham, ðe wolde Isaac offrian be Godes hæse, hæfde
tacnunge þæs heofenlicen Fæder, þe his Sunu sende to cweale for us,
& Isaac tacnode ðone Hælend Crist, þe acweald wæs for us.
 270. Ðeo ðridde ealde wæs ða wunigende oð Dauid, þone
mæran kyng Abrahames cynnes; of ðam com Crist syððan, þe eal moncyn
alysde.
 274. Of Cham, Noes sunu, com þæt Cananeisce folc, & of
Iaphet, ðam gingstan, þe wæs ibletsod þurh Noe, com þæt norðene
mennisc be ðare Norðsæ, for ðan þe ðry delas beoð idælede
ðurh heom, Asia on eastrice ðam ealdestan sunu, Affrica on suðdælæ
ðes Chames cynne & Europa on norðdæle Iapheðes ofsprunge.
 284. & þe ælmihtiga God æfter Noes flode ællum
moncynne geaf heom imænelice fisccynn & fugolcynn & ða
fiðerfetan deor & ða clene nytenu for his myclæn cyste; ac he
forbead swa ðeah þæt blod to þicgene.
 290. Isaac þa gestreonde Esau & Iacob, twæge twinnes on
mycele tacnunge.
 292. Ac ðe gungere broðor, þe Iacob wæs ihaten, wearð
Gode leofræ for his gode ðeawum, & for his bilewitnysse he wearð
ibletsod.
 296. Ðe streonde xii sunæs; ða beoð heahfæderas,
nomecuðe wæras.
 299. & wearð ða mycel hungor vii gear on an, & heo
siðoden ealle to Egypte londe, þer heo bileofenæ fundon.
 302. His gyncestæ sunu buton anum wæs Ioseph ihaten.
 303. Ðe wearð þær laford on Egypta lande under ðam
kyninge, him swiðe icwæme, & he heold his fæder on fulle
wurðscipe þær mid ealle his ibroðrum & heora childran samod; &
þe Ioseph leofede on þam londe mærlice c geara & tyn geara, &
þeo boc Genesis ended þus her.
 313. Ðeo oðer boc is Exodus ihaten, þe Moyses wrat be ðam
micle tacnum & be ðam tyn witum, ðe wurðon ða gefremode ofer Pharao
ðone kyng & ofer his folce þurh ðonne ælmihtiga God on Moyses
timæ.
 319. Þe wearð acenned, swa swa us cuð ðeos boc, & his
broðor Aaron, Amrames sunu, on Pharaones dæge, Gode swiðe deore &
swiðe mihtige mon on monige wundrum.
 324. Ða wolde God habben þæt folc of þam londe Abrahames
cynnes eft to heora earde.
 327. Ac þe Pharao nolde ðet folc fram him læten, ær ðam
ðe God him sende swiðlicne ogan tyn cynna wita for his teonreddenne.
 331. & Moyses þa syððan ðet moncyn lædde of
Pharaones ðeowte æfter feowerhund gearum, syððan Iacob ðider com mid
ðam Ebreiscan cynne.
 335. On ðare fyrde weron, ðe ferdon fram Egypte, sixhund
þusend monnæ, buton wifum & childum & buton ðare mægðe
Leui, ðe næs inamod þerto.
 340. Moyses heom lædde þa ðurh Godes mihte ealle ofer ða
Readæn Sæ, swa swa we rædað on bocum: & Pharao þe kyng ferde
him æthindan on gyt mid mare ferde, wolde þet folc habben ongean to his
lande & to his laþum ðeowte.
 347. Ða openode ðeo sæ togeanes Moyses & þet water him
stod swylce stanweallæs bufon heoræ hæfdum, & heo eodon be þam
grunde, oð ðet heo up comen ealle isunde, herigende mid sangum ðone
heofenlice God.
 354. Moyses ða sloh þa sæ mid his gyrde, & þet water
ða feol ofer Pharaones fyrde ofer his manigfealde crætum & his
mærlicum riddum, & adrencte heom ealle þet ðer an mon ne belaf.
 359. Nu sæð us ðeos boc, þet God syððan fedde ælne
ðone here mid heofenlice mæte, & heom ælce dæge com edniwe of
heofenum xl wintra fyrst on þam wæstene farende, & of hearde stanum
heom com yrnende water, & God heom sette æ, þet is open lagu, ðam
folce to steore on ðam fif bocum, ðe Moyses wrat, swa swa him wissode God.
 370. Ða twa bec we nemnodon; Leuiticus is ðeo þridde; Numerus
feorðe; þeo fifte is ihaten Deuterononium, þet is oðer lagu.
 373. Þas ðreo bec us secgað hu heo syððan ferdon ofer
þet widgille wæsten þer ðer nan mon ne wunode ær, & bi þam
micle wundrum, þe God wrohte on him binnan þam feortigum gearum on ealre
ðare fare; & we hit habbað awend witodlice on Englisc; on þam mon
mæg ihyran, hu þe heofenlice God þa spæc mid weorcum & mid
wundrum heom to; & he eac ða weorc mid write afestnode monnum to gemynde
on mycele tacnunge.
 387. & Moyses ðe mæræ, mid þam ðe he wæs cxx
wintra on ylde, ða ferde he of life, & God sylf hine burigede ant sette
Iosue on Moyses stede þam monnum to heretogan, & Moyses hæfde hine
ær ibletsod, & God sylf him behet þet he wolde mid him beon, swa swa
he mid Moyse wæs, on his micele wundrum.
 399. Ðeo boc þe he sette, Liber Iosue, sægð hu he ferde
mid Israelæ folce to Abrahames earde, & hu he ðonne eard gewan, &
hu þeo sunne ætstod, oð ðet he sige hælde, & hu he þonne eard
al todælde.
 409. His fæder Nun hatte, & he leofede hund geara & tyn
geara to eacan, & he syððan gewat æfter his miclan sige, & þet
menisc ðær syððan þone eard bogodon under Moyses lage.
 414. Iosue hæfde þæs Hælendes tacnunge, mid þam ðe
he lædde to ðam lande ðet folc, þe heom behaten wæs, swa swa ðe
Hælend deþ, ðe læd to heofenen rice þa ðe on him ilyfað, gif
heo mid gode weorcum hine glædiað.
 422. Æfter ðissum weron witodlice deman on þam ilcan earde
on Israele ðeode, þe ðam folce wissoden, swa swa hit awriten is on <foreign>Liber
Iudicum</foreign>, þet is, demere boc.
 427. Þeo boc us sæð swutellice be þam folce, þet heo on
sibbe wunedon swa lange swa heo wurðoden ðone heofenlice God on his
bigengum georne, & swa oft swa heo forlæton ðone lifigendan God,
þenne wurdon heo ihærgode & to hospe idone fram hæðenum leodum,
ðe heom abuten eardoden.
 436. Eft ðonne heo cleopodon on eornost to Gode mid soðre
dædbote, ðonne sende he heom fultum ðurh sumne deman, ðe wiðsette
heoræ feondum londe, þanon ðe heo ilædde wæron, & het heom
æft aræren þet ænlic tempel, swa swa ðe almihtiga God on his mod
asende, þet he his folce mildsode æfter swa mycele yrmðe; & heo
ðer syððan wunedon, oð ðet Crist sylf wearð iboren.
 552. Nu syndon twa mære bec isette on endeburdnesse to Salomones
bocum, swylce he heom dihte; for þare gelicnesse his gelogodan spæce &
for ðære getingnysse heom mon titelode; ac Iesus heo gesette, Siraches
sunu: an is <foreign>Liber Sapiencie</foreign>, þet is, wisdomes boc, þeo oðer is
icwæden <foreign>Eclesiasticus</foreign>, swiðe mycele bec, & mon heom red on circan to
mycele wisdome swiðe gewunelice.
 564. We nimæð þa witegan nu, þe witegoden embe Criste
ðurh þone Halgan Gast be þæs Hælendes tocyme to þisse middanearde
on soðre menniscnesse, swa swa we willæð awritan heræfter.
 570. Isayas wæs ihaten sum halig witega on þære kynega
timæ, swa swa us cyð þeo boc.
 572. Þe witegode be Criste swiðe wislice, swylce he godspellere
wære, swiðe wurðelice, & cwæð on his gesetnysse swa swa we
sæcgað her: <foreign>Ecce uirgo concipiet & pariet filium & uocabitur
nomen eius Emanuel</foreign>.
 579. Efne mægden sceal eacnian & acennen sunu & his nome
bið icwædon God sylf is mid us.
 582. Æfter þe ylca witega wrat on his setnysse: <foreign>Puer natus
est nobis & filius datus est nobis, & reliqua</foreign>.
 585. Vs is cild acenned & us is sunu igyfan, & his
ealdordom is on his eaxle, & his nome bið ihaten wundorlic, rædbora,
witolice strang God & fæder toweardre weorlde, soðlice sibbe ealdor,
& his kynedom bið monigfeald & ne bið nan ende his ecan sibbe.
 592. His boc is swiðe mycel & monigfeald be Criste & be
Godes mærðæ, be alle moncynne on gastlice andgite on Godes laðunge.
 596. He bodode geleafan on Iudea lande & unriht forbead, oð
ðet þe reða kyng, Manases ihaten, Ezechiæ sunu, hine tocleaf on twa
& hine acwealde swa.
 602. Hieremias þe witega wæs on ðam ylcan lande swiðe
halig witega fram his cildhade; be þam cwæð God sylf to him: Ic þe
cuðe soðlice ær ðan ðe ic þe isceope on ðinre moder innoðe,
& ic þe halgode ær ðan ðe þu acenned wurde, & ic þe sette
þeodæ to witegan.
 611. He wunode on clænnesse, & he wrat ane boc ðurh þone
Halgan Gast on his witegunge, micele & monigfealde, þam monnum to lare,
on gastlice andgite eac be þam Hælende.
 616. He wearð oft gebunden & on cwartene ibroht for his
halgan lare, & he hofode mycel þæs folces synnæ, swa swa his boc us
sægð, & he wearð oftorfed mid stanum æt nehstan on Egypte londe
for his ileafan.
 623. Plato þe uðwita & þe wisesta mon of hæðene
folce hæfde hine gesprecan, & þe witega þa hine wissode, þet he
cuðe geleafan on ðone lifigende God, swa swa Augustinus hit on bocum
gesette; & Hieremias is ure witega sundorlice.
 631. Ezechiel þe witega wearð ihergod mid þam folce, þa
þa ðe Chaldeisce kyng acwealde þa Iudeiscan & þa herelafa to his
londe adraf, þa þa Daniel þe witega wearð eac ilæht.
 636. Ant Ezechiel ða on ðeowte þær wunode & witegode
þær, & awrat ane boc mucele on gesetnysse be þam mancynne & be
ure Drihtne, swiðe deop on andgite, oð ðet þe heofodmon þæs
ihergoden folces hine acwalde, swa swa us cuð sum lareow.
 645. Daniel þe witega wunode on Caldea wurðful þam kyngum,
& wrat ane boc on his witegunge, ðe him God sylf unwreah, & he
swutelice sæde on his isetnysse bi Cristes acennednesse, swa swa he com to
monnum cccc geara & hundnigantig geara fram Darie þam kynge, oð ðet
ure Drihten com on soðre menniscnesse of Mariæ innoðe.
 655. His boc is swiðe mycel on monige tacnunge, langsum her to
secgenne be hire gesetnesse & hu he wæs aworpen ðam wildan leon.
 661. He næs na ofslagen, ac he him sylf gewat, ða ða he hund
geara wæs & tyn gearæ on ylde, & he wæs iburiged on
Babilonia.
 666. Twelf witegan beoð to ecan ðissum gyt, ðe twelf bec
writon on heora witegunge, be sumum dæle læsse on gesetnesse, mycele on
andgite, be Cristes menniscnesse & be Godes folce, swa swa God heom
unwreah.
 672. Þære namæn we wyllæð writan on ðissum cwide:
Osee, Iohel, Amos, Abdias, Ionas þe þe ðreo niht wæs innan ðam
hwæle, & þe hwæl hine bær to Niniuea burig, & þe dæð
tacnode ures.
 678. Drihtnes dæð, þe læg on burigenne swa lange fæce,
ac he aras of deaþe ðurh his drihtenlice mihte Micheas, Naum, Abbacuc, þe
namode þone Hælend be his naman ðus: <foreign>Ego autem in Domino gaundebo &
exultabo in Deo Iesu meo</foreign> þet is on Englisc; Ic blissige on Drihtne & ic
fægnige on Gode mine Hælende.
 688. Iesus wæs ihaten ure Hælend on life, & swa sæde
þes witega, ær ðan ðe he wurde acenned, & swa swa ðe heahengel
hit sæde on þam godspelle.
 692. He is ihaten eac Crist; be þam cwæð sum witega for fela
hund gearæ, ær ðan ðe he acenned wurde: <foreign>Astiterunt reges terre &
principes conuenerunt in unum aduersus Dominum & aduersus Christum eius</foreign>,
Eorðlice kyngas & ealdormen arison ongean ure Drihten & þone
Hælend Crist; þet wæs Herodes kyng & Pilatus ealdormon, swa swa
ða apostolas be þam understoden; Sophonias Aggeus, Zacharias, Malachias.
 707. Weron eac oðre witegan, ðe ne writen nane bec, swa swa
wæs Helias & Heliseus, ac heora wundra wurdon iwritene swa ðeah on
þære Kyngbocum on fulcuðe gemynde.
 712. Tyn mædena wæron on mislicere tide on hæðene
leodum, þa mon het Sybillas, þet beoð witegestran, & heo witegodan
ealle be þam Hælende Criste & heora bec setton swiðe swutelice
þurh ðone soðan Gast be alre his fare mid fullum geleafan, for þan ðe
God wolde heom gewitan habban of hæþenum leode & of geleaffullum; ac
heora bec ne beoð na on ure gesetnysse on ðare bibliothecan, swa swa ðas
oðre beoð.
 726. Ezras þe writere wrat ane boc, hu þet folc com ongean fram
Chaldea londe to Iudea londe & heo Ierusalem þa burh æft arærdan,
& þet tempel ðærbinnæn, swa swa Cyrus kyng heom sealde leafe
æfter hundseofontig gearum, þet heo heora eard bogodon, & þe boc is
iendeburd on þissere gesetnesse mid deopum andgite on diglum getacnunge.
 737. Iob wæs ihaten sum heah Godes þægen on þam londe
Hus, swiðe leafful wer, welig on æhtum; þe wearð afondod þurh þone
swikele deofel, swa swa his boc us sæð, þe he sylf sette syððan he
afandod wæs & hit is eac iwitegæd witolice be Criste & be his
laðunge, swa swa larewæs secgað, & þeo boc is iendeburd on
ðissere gesetnysse.
 750. Sum Iudeisc mon wæs eac afondod, Tobias ihaten, swiðe
ealmes georne & swiðe ilyfed on ðone lifigendon God.
 754. Þe wæs ihergod to Syrian lande, ac he heold swa ðeah
his ileafan ðer mid gode weorcum.
 756. & God hine fandode, swa þet he blind wearð & swa
wunode tyn gearæ; ac God hine hælde æft þurh his heahengel, Raphael
ihaten, swa swa ðeo race us sægð on his agene bec, þe he sylf wrat,
& ðeo boc is iteald to ðissum tæle, for þan ðe þæron is eac
swylce getacnung.
 766. Hester þeo cwæn, þe hire cyn aredde, hæfð eac ane
boc on ðissum tæle, for þan ðe Godes lof is gelogod þeron.
 772. Iudith þeo wudewe, þe oferwan Holofernen ðone Syriscan
ealdormon, hæfð hire agene boc betwyx ðissum bocum be hire agene sige;
þeo is eac on Englisc on ure wisan iset eow monnum to bisne, þet ge eower
eard mid wæpnum beweriæn wið onwinnende here.
 781. Twa bec beoð isette æfter cirlice ðeawum betwyx
ðissum bocum, ðe geburiað to Godes lofe, Machabeorum ihatene, for heora
mycele gewinne, for þan þe heo wunnon mid wæpnum þa swiðe wið
ðone hæðene here, ðe heom on wan swiðe, woldon heom adiglian &
adydan of þam earde, þe heom God geaf, & Godes lof alecgan.
 791. Hwæt, þa Mathathias, þe mære Godes þegen, mid his
fif sunu, feaht wið ðone here mycele lomlucor, ðone þu lyfan wylle,
& heo sige hæfdon þurh ðone soðan God, þe heo on lyfdon æfter
Moyses æ.
 797. Heo noldon na feahton mid fegere wordum ane, swa þet heo wel
spæcon, & awendon þet eft, ðe læs ðe heom become þe
hæfigtyma cwide, þe ðe witega cwæð be summum leodscipe ðus: <foreign>Et
iratus est furore Dominus in populo suo & abhominatus est hereditatem suam,
& cetera</foreign>: Drihten wearð yrre mid gramen his folce & he onscunode his
yrfwerdnesse, & he betæhte heom on hæðenra handum, & heora
feond soðlice hæfdon heora geweald, & heom swiðe dræhton þa
derigendlice fynd, & heo wurdon iætmette under heora handum.
 813. Nolde Machabeus, þe mæræ Godes cempa, habben ðisne
dom ðurh his Drihtnes yrre, ac him wæs leofre, þet he mid ileafan
clypode on eornost to Gode þysne oðerne cwide: <foreign>Da nobis, Domine, auxilium
de tribulatione, quia uana salus hominis, & cetera</foreign>: Sule us, leofæ
Drihten, þinne soðan fultum on ure dræfednesse & do us strengran,
for þan ðe monnes fultum is unmihtig & idel.
 825. Ac uten wurcæn mihte on ðone almihtigæ God, & he
to nohte dæð ure derigendlicæ feond.
 828. Machabeus þa gefylde þas foresæde word mid stronglice
weorcum, & oferwan his feond, & beð for þi isette his sigefesta
dæda on ðam bocum on bibliothecan Gode to wurðmente.
