ÆLet 4 (SigeweardZ)
B1.8.4.4.
Letter to Sigeweard ['On the Old and New Testament'] (Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Laud Misc. 509 fols. 120v-141v: Crawford 1922, 15-75.



 1. <foreign>Incipit libellus de ueteri testamento et nouo.</foreign> þis gewrit
wæs to anum men gediht ac hit mæg swa ðeah manegum fremian.
 1. ÆLFRIC ABBOD GRET FREONDLICE SIGWERD æt Eastheolon.
 1. Ic secge þe to soðan þæt se bið swiþe wis, se þe
mid weorcum spricð, & se hæfð forþgang for Gode & for worulde,
se ðe mid godum weorcum hine sylfne geglengð, & þæt is swiðe
geswutelod on halgum gesetnissum þæt þa halgan weras þe gode weorc
beeodon, þæt hi wurðfulle wæron on þissere worulde, & nu halige
sindon on heofenan rices mirhþe, & heora gemynd þurhwunað nu a to
worulde for heora anrædnisse & heora trywðe wið God.
 8. Ða gimeleasan men, þe heora lif adrugon on ealre idelnisse,
& swa geendodon, heora gemynd is forgiten on halgum gewritum, buton
þæt secgað þa ealdan gesetnissa heora yfelan dæda & þæt
þæt hig fordemde sindon.
 11. Ðu bæde me for oft Engliscra gewritena, & ic þe ne
getiðode ealles swa timlice, ær ðam þe þu mid weorcum þæs
gewilnodest æt me, þa ða þu me bæde for Godes lufon georne þæt
ic þe æt ham æt þinum huse gespræce, & þu ða swiðe
mændest, þa þa ic mid þe wæs, þæt þu mine gewrita begitan ne
mihtest.
 16. Nu wille ic þæt þu hæbbe huru þis litle, nu ðe
wisdom gelicað & þu hine habban wilt, þæt þu ealles ne beo minra
boca bedæled.
 18. God lufað þa godan weorc, & he wyle hig habban æt
us, & hit ys awriten witodlice be him þæt he sylf blissað on his
agenum weorcum, swa swa se sealmwirhta þus sang be him: <foreign>Sit gloria Domini in
seculum seculi; letabitur Dominus in operibus suis</foreign>, ðæt ys on Engliscre
spræce: Si ures Drihtenes wuldor on worulda woruldum; ure Drihten blissað
on his agenum weorcum.
 23. Þus cwæþ se witega.
 24. Se ælmihtiga Scippend geswutelode hine sylfne þurh þa
micclan weorc ðe he geworhte æt fruman, & wolde þæt ða
gesceafta gesawon his mærða & on wuldre mid him wunodon on ecnisse on
his underþeodnisse him æfre gehirsume, for ðam þe hit ys swiðe wolic
þæt ða geworhtan gesceafta þam ne beon gehirsume þe hi gesceop &
geworhte.
 29. Næs þeos woruld æt fruman, ac hi geworhte God silf, se
þe æfre þurhwunode buton ælcum anginne on his miclan wuldre & on
his mægenþrimnisse eall swa mihtig swa he nu ys & eall swa micel on
his leohte, for ðan ðe he ys soð leoht & lif & soðfæstnisse,
& se ræd wæs æfre on his rædfæstum geþance, þæt he
wircan wolde þa wundorlican gesceafta, be þan ðe he wolde þurh his
micclan wisdom þa gesceafta gescippan & þurh his soðan lufe hig
liffæstan on þam life, þe hig habbað.
 36. Her is seo halige þrinnis on þisum þrim mannum: se
ælmihtiga Fæder of nanum oðrum gecumen, & se micla Wisdom of þam
wisan Fæder æfre of him anum butan anginne acenned, se þe us alisde of
urum þeowte syððan mid þære menniscnisse, þe he of Marian genam;
nu is heora begra lufu him bam æfre gemæne, þæt is se Halga Gast,
þe ealle þing geliffæst, swa micel & swa mihtig, þæt he mid his
gife ealle þa englas onliht, þe eardiað on heofenum, & ealra manna
heortan, þe on middanearde libbað, þa þe rihtlice gelifað on þone
lifiendan God, & ealra manna synna soðlice forgifð, þam þe heora
synna silfwilles behreowsiað, & nis nan forgifenis buton þurh his gife;
and he spræc þurh witegan, þe witegodon ymbe Crist, for þan þe he ys
se willa & witodlice lufu þæs Fæder & þæs Suna, swa swa we
sædon ær.
 48. Seofonfealde gifa he gifð mancynne git, be þam ic awrat
ær on sumum oðrum gewrite on Engliscre spræce, swa swa Isaias se witega
hit on bec sette on his witegunge.
 51. Se ælmihtiga Scippend, ða ða he englas gesceop, þa
geworhte he þurh his wisdom tyn engla werod on þam forman dæge on
micelre fægernisse, fela þusenda on ðam frumsceafte, þæt hi on his
wuldre hine wurðedon ealle lichamlease, leohte & strange, buton eallum
synnum on gesælþe libbende, swa wlitiges gecindes, swa we secgan ne magon,
& nan yfel ðing næs on ðam englum þa git, ne nan yfel ne com
ðurh Godes gesceapennisse, for ðan ðe he sylf ys eallgod & ælc god
cimð of him; & ða englas þa wunodon on þam wuldre mid Gode.
 67. Hwæt, þa binnan six dagum, þe se soða God þa
gesceafta gesceop, þe he gescippan wolde, gesceawode se an engel þe
þær ænlicost wæs, hu fæger he silf wæs & hu scinende on
wuldre, & cunnode his mihte, þæt he mihtig wæs gesceapen, & him
wel gelicode his wurðfulniss þa: se hatte Lucifer, þæt ys Leohtberend,
for ðære miclan beorhtnisse his mæran hiwes.
 79. Ða þuhte him to huxlic, þæt he hiran sceolde ænigum
hlaforde, þa he swa ænlic wæs, & nolde wurðian þone, þe hine
geworhte, & him þancian æfre ðæs þe he him forgeaf & beon
him underðeodd þæs ðe swiþor geornlice for þære micclan
mærðe þe he hine gemæðegode.
 87. He nolde þa habban his Scippend him to hlaforde, ne he nolde
þurhwunian on ðære soþfæstnisse ðæs soðfæstan Godes sunu,
þe hine gesceop fægerne, ac wolde mid riccetere him rice gewinnan &
þurh modignisse hine macian to Gode, & nam him gegadan ongean Godes
willan to his unræde on eornost gefæstnod.
 96. Ða næfde he nan setl, hwær he sittan mihte, for ðan
ðe nan heofon nolde hine aberan, ne nan rice næs, þe his mihte beon
ongean Godes willan, þe geworhte ealle ðinc.
 101. Ða afunde se modiga, hwilce his mihta wæron, þa þa
his fet ne mihton furðon ahwar standan, ac he feoll ða adun to deofle
awend, & ealle his gegadan of ðam Godes hirede in to helle wite be heora
gewirhtum.
 108. Ða on ðam sixtan dæge, siþþan ðis gedon wæs,
gesceop se ælmihtiga God mannan of eorðan ADAM mid his handum & him
sawle forgeaf, & EVAN eft siþþan of Adames ribbe, þæt hi sceoldon
habban, & heora ofspring mid him, þa fægeran wununge þe se feond
forleas, gif hi gehirsumedon heora Scippende on riht.
 117. Ða beswac se deofol siððan eft þa men, þæt hi
Godes bebod tobræcon forraþe & wurdon þa deadlice, & adræfde
butu of ðære myrhþe to þisum middanearde, & on sorhge leofodon
& on geswincum siþþan, & eall heora ofsprinc þe him of com
siððan, oþ þæt ure hælend Crist ure yfel gebette, swa swa þeos
racu æfter us segð.
 127. We nymað of þam bocum þas endebyrdnysse, þe Moises
awrat, se mæra heretoga, swa swa him God silf dihte on heora
sunderspræce, þa þa he mid Gode wunode on þam munte Sinai feowertig
daga on an, & underfeng his lare, & he ætes ne gimde on eallum þam
fyrste for ðære miclan bisnunge þæra boca lare.
 137. Fif bec he awrat mid wundorlicum dihte.
 138. Seo forme ys Genesis, þe befehð þas racu ærest fram
frumsceafte, & be Adames synne & hu he leofode nigan hund geara on
þære forman ylde þissere worulde, & bearn gestrinde be his gebeddan
Euan, & he siððan gewat mid sorge to helle.
 145. Cain wæs his sunu, se acwealde his broðor, Abel gehaten,
unscildigne mannan for his agenum andan, þe he hæfde to him, & Caines
ofspring, þe him of com, siððan eall wearð adrenced on þam deopan
flode, þe on Noes dagum adydde eall mancinn buton þam eahta mannum, ðe
binnan þam arce wæron, & of þam yfelan teame ne com nan ðing
siþþan.
 156. Ac Adam gestrinde æfter Abeles slege oðerne sunu, se
wæs Seth gehaten, of ðam strenge com þæt þæt cucu belaf, Noe
& his wif & heora þri suna, Sem, Cham & Iafeth mid heora þrim
wifum.
 161. We secgað nu mid ofste þas endebirdnisse, for þan ðe
we oft habbað ymbe þis awriten mid maran andgite, þa þu miht sceawian,
& eac ða getacnunga, þæt Adam getacnude, þe on ðam sixtan
dæge gesceapen wæs þurh God, urne Hælend Crist , þe com to
þissere worulde, & us geedniwode to his gelicnisse.
 171. Eua getacnode, þe of Adames sidan.
 172. God silf geworhte, Godes gelaðunge, þe of Cristes sidan
siþþan wearð acenned.
 175. Abeles slege soðlice getacnode ures Hælendes slege, þe
ða Iudeiscan ofslogon, yfele gebroðra swa swa Cain wæs.
 178. Seth, Adames sunu & eac se þridda ys gesæd ærist,
& he getacnode untwilice Crist, se þe of deaðe aras on ðam þriddan
dæge.
 182. Enoh wæs geciged se seofoða man fram Adame; he worhte
Godes willan & God hine ða genam mid ansundum lichaman of þisum life
upp, & he ys cucu git, swa swa Helias, se æðela witega, þe wæs
eal swa genumen to þam oðrum life, & hi cumað begen togeanes
Antecriste, þæt hig his leasunga alecgon þurh God, & beoð þonne
ofslegen þurh ðone sylfan feond, & hi eft arisað, swa swa ealle men
doð.
 195. Noe, þe on ðam arce wæs on ðam miclum flode, þe
ealle woruld adrencte buton þam eahta mannum, ys gereht <foreign>requies</foreign>, þæt
is rest on Englisc; & he getacnode Crist, þe for ðy com to us, þæt
he us of yðum þissere worulde to reste gebrohte & to blisse mid him.
 203. And swa forð oð ende, ælc halig fæder mid wordum
oþþe mid weorcum cyddon urne Hælend & his fær witodlice.
 208. Her wæs seo forme yld þissere worulde, & seo oðer
yld wæs þissere worulde oð Abrahames timan, þæs ealdan
heahfæderes.
 212. Nu segð us seo boc be Noes ofspringe, þæt his suna
gestrindon twa & hundseofontig suna; þa begunnon to wircenne þa
wundorlican burh & þone heagan stipel, þe sceolde astigan upp to
heofenum, be heora unræde; ac God silf com þærto & sceawode heora
weorc & sealde heora ælcum synderlice spræce, þæt heora ælcum
wæs uncuð hwæt oþer sæde, & hi swa geswicon sona þære
getimbrunge, & hi ða toferdon to fyrlenum lande on swa manegum gereordum
swa þæra manna wæs.
 227. On þære ylcan ylde man arærde hæðengild wide
geond þas woruld, swa swa we awriton æror on oðrum larspellum to
geleafan trimminge, & on þissere ylde þa yfelan leoda, fif burhscira
ðæs fulan mennisces Sodomitisces eardes, mid sweflenum fyre færlice
wurdon ealle forbærnde, & heora burga samod, buton Loþe anum, þe God
alædde þanon mid his ðrim hiwum for his rihtwisnisse.
 239. Of Noes yldstan sunu, þe wæs Sem gehaten, com þæt
Ebreisce folc, þe on God gelifde, Abrahames forðfæderas, & his
fæder wæs Tare, se eardode ærest on Chaldea rice, oð þæt
Abraham ferde be Godes hæse to Chananeiscan earde, þær his cynn
siððan wunode.
 247. Abraham, se heahfæder, hæfde twegen suna, Ismæl &
Isaac, & he wurþode God mid ealre his heortan, & se heofonlica God
him gelome to spræc for his micclan geleafan, for þan þe he wolde
offrian his agenne sunu Gode, Isaac þone leofran, to lace on his weofode on
þa ealdan wisan, gif hit God swa wolde.
 257. God þa hine gebletsode & his bearn wæs gesund, &
God silf him behet, þæt þurh his cyn sceolde eall mannkynn beon
gebletsod for his micclan geleafan & for his gehirsumnisse, þe he
hæfde to Gode.
 263. Abraham, þe wolde Isaac geoffrian be Godes hæse, hæfde
getacnunge þæs heofonlican Fæder, þe his Sunu asende to cwale for us,
& Isaac getacnode þone Hælend Crist, ðe acweald wæs for us.
 270. Seo þridde yld wæs ða wuniende oð Dauid, þone
mæran cyning Abrahames cynnes; of ðam com Crist siððan, þe eall
mancynn alysde.
 274. Of Cham, Noes suna, com þæt Chananeisce folc, & of
Iaphet, þam ginstan, þe wæs gebletsod þurh Noe, com þæt
norðerne mennisc be þære Norðsæ, for þan þe ðri dælas sind
gedælede þurh hig, Asia on eastrice þam yldstan suna, Affrica on
suðdæle þæs Chames cynne, & Europa on norðdæle Iapheþes
ofspringe.
 283. & se ælmihtiga God æfter Noes flode eallum mancinne
forgeaf him gemænlice fisccinn & fugolcinn & þa fiðerfetan deor
& þa clænan nytena for his micclan ciste; ac he forbead swa þeah
blod to þicgenne.
 290. Isaac þa gestrynde Esau & Iacob, twegen getwisan on
micelre getacnunge.
 293. Ac se gingra broðor, þe Iacob wæs gehaten, wæs Gode
leofre for his godum þeawum, & for his bilewitnisse he wearð
gebletsod.
 297. Se gestrynde twelf suna; þa syndon heahfæderas, namcuðe
weras.
 299. & wearð þa micel hunger seofon gear on an, & hig
siþodon ealle to Egipta lande, þær hi bigleofan fundon.
 302. His ginsta sunu buton anum, wæs Ioseph gehaten, wearð
ðær hlaford on Egipta lande under þam cininge, him swiðe gecweme,
& he heold his fæder on fullum wurðscipe þær mid eallum his
broðrum & heora bearnum samod; & se Ioseph leofode on þam lande
mærlice hundteontig geara & tin to eacan, & seo boc Genesis
geendað þus her.
 313. Seo oþer boc ys Exodus gehaten, þe Moyses awrat be þam
miclum tacnum & be þam tyn witum, þe wurdon þa gefremode ofer Pharao
þone cining & ofer his folce þurh ðone ælmihtigan God on Moises
timan.
 319. Se wearð acenned, swa swa us kyð þeos boc, & his
broðer Aaron, Amrames sunu, on Pharaones dæge, Gode swiþe dyre, swiðe
mihtige menn on manegum wundrum.
 324. Ða wolde God habban þæt folc of ðam lande Abrahames
cynnes eft to heora earde.
 327. Ac se Pharao nolde þæt folc fram him lætan, ær
þan þe God him sende swiðlice ogan tyn cinna wita for his
teonræddenne.
 331. & Moises þa siððan þæt manncinn gelædde of
Pharaones ðeowte æfter feowerhund gearum, siþþan Iacob þider com mid
þam Ebreiscan kinne.
 335. On þære fyrde wæron, þe ferdon fram Egipte, sixhund
þusend manna butan wifum & cildum, & butan þære mægðe Leui,
þe næs genamod þærto.
 340. Moyses hig lædde þa þurh Godes mihte ealle ofer ða
Readan Sæ, swa swa we rædað on bocum: & Pharao se kyning ferde him
æthindan on git mid maran fyrde, wolde þæt folc habban ongean to his
lande to his laðum þeowte.
 347. Þa geopenode seo sæ togeanes Moysen & þæt
wæter him stod swilce stanweallas bufan heora heafdum, & hi eodon be
þam grundum, oð þæt hi up comon ealle gesunde, heriende mid sange
þone heofenlican God.
 354. Moyses þa sloh þa sæ mid his girde & þæt
wæter þa feoll ofer Pharaones fyrde ofer his menifealdum crætum &
his mærlicum riddum & adrencte hi ealle, þæt þær an mann ne
belaf.
 359. Nu segð us seo boc, þæt God siððan afedde ealne
þone here mid heofonlicum mete, & him ælce dæg com edniwe of
heofenum feowertig wintra fyrst on þam westene farende, & of heardum
stane him com yrnende wæter, & God him sette æ, þæt ys open
lagu, þam folce to steore on þam fif bocum, þe Moyses awrat, swa swa him
gewissode God.
 370. Ða twa bec we nemnodon; Leuiticus is seo þridde, Numerus
feorðe; seo fifte ys gehaten Deuteronomium, þæt ys oþer lagu.
 374. Ðas ðreo bec us secgað hu hig siþþan ferdon ofer
þæt widgille westen þær þær nan mann ne wunode ær, & be
þam miclum wundrum, þe God worhte on him binnan þam feowertigum gearum on
ealre þare racu; & we habbað awend witodlice on Englisc.
 382. On þam mann mæg gehiran, hu se heofonlica God spræc
mid weorcum & mid wundrum him to; & he eac þa weorc on gewritum
afæstnode mannum to gemynde on miclum getacnungum.
 388. & Moises se mæra, mid þam þe he wæs on ylde
hundtwentig wintra, ða gewat he of life, & God silf hine bebirigde &
gesette Iosue on Moyses stede þam mannum to heretogan, Moyses hæfde hine
ær gebletsod, & God silf him behet þæt he wolde mid him beon, swa
swa he mid Moyse wæs, on miclum wundrum.
 399. Seo boc þe he gesette, Liber Iosue, segð hu he ferde mid
Israhela folce to Abrahames earde, & hu he þone eard gewann, & hu seo
sunne ætstod, oð þæt he sige hæfde, & hu he þone eard ealne
todælde.
 405. Ðis ic awende eac on Englisc hwilon æþelwerde
ealdormen; on þam man mæg sceawian Godes micclan wundra mid weorcum
gefremode.
 409. His fæder hatte Nun, & he leofode hund geara & tyn
gear to eacan, & he siþþan gewat æfter his micclan sige, &
þæt mennisc ðær siþþan þone eard bogodan under Moises lage.
 415. Iosue hæfde ðæs Hælendes getacnunge, mid þam þe
he gelædde to þam lande þæt folc, þe him behaten wæs, swa swa se
Hælend deð, þe læt to heofenan rice þa ðe on hine gelyfað, gif
hi mid godum weorcum hine gegladiað.
 422. Æfter þisum wæron witodlice deman on þam ylcan earde
on Israhela þeode, þe þam folce wissodon, swa swa hit awriten ys on Liber
Iudicum, þæt ys demena boc.
 427. Seo boc us segð swutollice be þam folce, þæt hi on
sibbe wunedon swa lange swa hi wurðodon þone heofonlican God on his
bigengum georne, & swa oft swa hi forleton þone lifiendan God, þonne
wurdon hi gehergode & to hospe gedonne fram hæðenum leodum, þe him
abutan eardodon.
 436. Eft þonne hi clipodon on eornost to Gode mid soþre
dædbote, þonne sende he him fultum þurh sumne deman, þe wiðsette
heora feondum & hi alisde of heora yrmðe; & hi lange swa on þam
lande eardodon.
 442. Ðis man mæg rædan, se þe his recð to gehirenne, on
þære Engliscan bec, þe ic awende be þisum.
 443. Ic þohte þæt ge woldon þurh ða wundorlican race
eower mod awendan to Godes willan on eornost; ac beo þeos boc her þus
geendod.
 445. An wimman hatte Ruth þe wæs æfter þisum Moabiscre
þeode, ac heo wearð geæwnod Iessan ealdan fæder & se Iesse wæs
DAVIDES fæder.
 447. Seo boc þe þis segð hatte <foreign>Liber Ruth</foreign>, & heo is
geendebyrd on ure bibliothecan.
 449. Æfter þisum demum þæt Israhela folc gecuron him
ciningas, swa swa us cyð seo racu, on Samueles timan, þæs soðfæstan
witegan.
 450. Be þam sind awritene witodlice feower bec, þa sind
gehatenne Liber Regum on Leden, þæt ys cininga boc gecweden swa on an,
& Verba Dierum lið þærto geiced; seo ys seo fifte boc, for fela
gewissungum þe seo an boc hæfð toforan þam oðrum, & þas bec
awriton Samuel & Malachim.
 455. On þisum bocum us segð þæt Saul wæs gecoren
ærest to cyninge on Israhela þeode, for þan þe hig woldon sumne
weriend habban, þe hi geheolde wið þæt hæþene folc, & cyddon
heora willan þam witegan Samuele, þæt hig heora cynne cining habban
woldon, swa swa oðre leodscipas on eallum lande hæfdon.
 459. Hwæt þa Samuel sæde þæt Gode, & God him
geþafode þæt hig setton him to kininge Saul, Cises sunu, & he
siððan rixode feowertig geara fæc, & þæt folc bewerode wið
þa hæþenan leoda heardlice mid wæmmum, þeah þe he misferde on
manegum oðrum þingum.
 463. David, Iessan sunu, se deorwurða sealmwirhta of þam
firmestan kynne, þe wæs gecweden Iudan, wearð þurh God gecoren to
cininge siþþan on Israhela þeode hig to bewerienne, & he stranglice
rixode, & bewerode þæt folc wið þa hæðenan leoda ðe him on
wunnon/, & he hæfde æfre sige & ofsloh þa hæðenan on
ælcum/ gefeohte, for þan þe he wurðode þonne ælmihtigan God mid
ealre heortan, & mid godum weorcum he geglende his kynedom & þæs
kynedomes geweold feowertig geara on an, & his hlysa is fulcuð on
geleafullum bocum.
 471. And seo feorðe yld þissere worulde stod fram Dauide oð
Daniele þam witegan.
 472. Dauid is gecweden fortis manum; on andgitte þæt ys
stranghynde on Englisc, for þan þe he gewylde þone wildan beran & his
ceaflas totær buton ælcum wæmne, & þa wildan leo he gewylde eal
swa; tobræc hire ceaflas mid his barum handum.
 476. & he eode to anwige ongean þone ent, Goliam gehaten,
þa þa he cniht wæs, & mid his liðeran ofwearp þone geleafleasan
ent, þæt he læg geswogen & sloh him of þæt heafod & on
fleame gebrohte þa Philisteos ealle, þe fuhton wið Saul, & he sige
þa hæfde.
 480. He hæfde getacnunge þæs Hælendes Cristes, þe ys
stranghynde, þe þone hetolan deofol eaðelice gewilde, & him of gewann
ealle þa geleafullan on his gelaðunge, swa swa Dauid gelæhte þæt
scep of þam deorum.
 483. He ys halig witega, & he witegode fela ymbe urne Hælend
Crist, swa swa us kyþað þa sealmas, þe he þurh Godes gast Gode to
lofe gesang, & se Saltere ys an boc, þe he gesette þurh God betwux
oðrum bocum on þære bibliothecan.
 487. He gesette on his ylde his sunu to cininge, þone snoteran
Salomon, & he siþþan rixode feowertig wintra on fulre sibbe æfre,
& for his micclum wisdome hyne wurðodon ciningas, & man his wisdom
sohte of fyrlenum eardum, & of gehwilcum landum him comon lac to
wurðscipe, & he his folc geheold butan ælcum gefeohte.
 492. He arærde Gode þæt ænlice tempel binnan Hierusalem
on wunderlicum cræfte swa fægere getimbrod & swa fæste getrymmed
& swa widgille hus oferworht mid golde & mid hwitum seolfre, swa we
secgan ne magon.
 495. He gesette þreo bec þurh his snoternisse.
 495. An ys Parabole, þæt ys bigspellboc, na swilce ge
secgað, ac wisdomes bigspell & warnung wið disig, & hu man selost
mæg synna forbugan, & þone weg gefaran þe gewissað to Gode.
 498. Oþer ys gecweden <foreign>Ecclesiastices</foreign>, þæt ys on Englisc
ealra þeoda ræd & deaflic to gehirenne on healicum gemote.
 500. Seo þridde ys gecweden Cantica Canticorum, þæt segð
on Englisc ealra sanga fyrmest þone he sang be Criste & be Cristes
circean, þæt ys eall seo laþung þe gelyfð on Crist; & þas bec
standað nu on þære bibliotheca.
 503. Salomon ys gecweden gesibsum on Englisc, & he getacnode
urne Hælend Crist, þe us sibbe brohte, & ys þære sibbe ealdor, se
þe us geðeodde to engla werodum, & us circean arærde, ðe is his
gelaðung.
 507. Nu standað manega cyningas on þæra Cininga Bocum, be
þam ic gesette eac sume boc on Englisc.
 508. Sume hig wæron rihtwise & wurþodon a God, swa swa
Ezechias wæs & siþþan Iosias, & eac sume oþre, þe
sigefæste wæron & heora kynedom heolden kenlice þurh Gode, þe hig
wurðodon, & hi wunodon on friðe.
 511. Sume wæron arlease & swiðe yfele ferdon, þonne hi
Godes ne gimdon, ne God him ne fylste; & amyrdon heora folc þurh heora
mandæda & on bysmore leofdon þurh geleafleaste, & yfele geendodon
on heora unhlisan, swa swa Sedechias, se ungesæliga kining, þe mann
gelædde on bendum to Babilonian birig, & man ofsloh his twegen suna
ætforan his gesihþe & hine ablende siððan & gesette hine on
cweartern & þam eardum becom oðer wracu siððan.
 519. Nabochodonosor, se namcuða cining on Chaldeiscum earde, com
to Hierusalem mid micelre fyrde, & þæt manncyn ofsloh, & þa burh
towende, & þæt tempel towearp æfter feowerhund gearum þæs þe
hit gesett wæs, for ðæra kininga geleafleaste, þe forleton heora
Drihten, & þæs folces gimeleaste, þe ne gimde Godes; &
gelædde þone kining to Chaldea mid him, Achim gehaten, swiðe huxlice,
þæt he mihte oncnawan his manfullan dæda huru on þam hæftnede
wið þone heofenlican God.
 526. Se Chaldea cininc com þa to his earde mid þære huðe
& þære herelafe, on ðære wæs Daniel, se deorwyrða witega,
& þa þry cnihtas, þe synt gehatenne þus, SIDRAC, MISAAC ET
ABDENAGO, & on oþre wisan hi wæron gehatene Annanias, Azarias,
Misael.
 529. Ðas þri cnihtas het se cyning awurpan in to byrnendum
ofne; ac heora bendas sona wurdon forswælede, & hig gesunde eodon,
heriende mid sange þone heofenlican God, þe hi swa geheold on þam hatan
ofne, þæt heora fex næs furðon forswæled.
 533. & se kining hi het þa gan of þam ofne.
 535. Her ongan seo fifte yld þissere worulde; seo stod swa
astreht oð þæt Crist sylf com on þære sixtan ylde to þissere
worulde on menniscum gecynde of Marian innoðe, se þe æfre wæs God mid
his ælmihtigan Fæder.
 538. Seo herelaf ða wunode þæs gehergodan folces on
Chaldeiscum earde under þam kininge, gecnæwe heora synna wið þone
ælmihtigan God.
 540. Hundseofontig geara hi wunodon þær on þeowte, oð
þæt Cirus cyning hi asende eft ongean to Iudea lande, þanon þe hi
alædde wæron, and het hig eft aræran þæt ænlice tempel, swa
swa se ælmihtiga God on his mod asende, þæt he his folce mildsode
æfter swa micelre yrmðe; & hi þær siþþan wunedon, oð
þæt Crist sylf wearð geboren.
 552. Nu sindon twa mære bec gesette on endebyrdnysse to
Salomones bocum, swilce he hig gedihte; for þære gelicnisse his gelogodan
spræce & for þære getingnysse hig man getitelode him; ac Iesus hi
gesette, Siraces sunu: an ys Liber Sapientie, þæt ys, wisdomes boc, seo
oðer ys gecweden.
 561. Ecclesiasticus, swiðe micele bec, & man hig ræt on
circan to micclum wisdome swiðe gewunelice.
 564. We nymað þa witegan nu þe witegodon embe Crist þurh
þone Halgan Gast be þæs Hælendes tokime to þisum middanearde on
soðre menniscnisse, swa swa we wyllað awritan heræfter.
 570. Isaias wæs gehaten sum halig witega on ðæra kininga
timan, swa swa us kyð seo boc.
 572. Se witegode be Criste swiðe gewislice, swilce he godspellere
wære, swiðe gewyrdelice, & cwæð on his gesetnysse swa swa we
secgað her: <foreign>Ecce uirgo concipiet & pariet filium & uocabitur nomen
eius Emmanuel, & reliqua</foreign>.
 579. Efne mæden sceal geeacnian & oncennan sunu & his
nama bið geciged God sylf ys mid us.
 583. Eft se ylca witega awrat on his gesetnysse: <foreign>Puer natus est
nobis & filius datus est nobis, & reliqua</foreign>: Vs ys cild acenned: &
us ys sunu forgifen & his ealdordom ys on eaxle, & his nama bið
gehaten wundorlic, rædbora, witodlice strang God & fæder towerdre
worulde, soðlice sibbe ealdor, & his kynedom bið menigfeald, & ne
bið nan ende his ecan sibbe.
 594. His boc ys swiðe micel & menigfeald be Criste & be
Godes mærðe, be eallum mancinne on gastlicum andgitte on Godes
gelaþunge.
 597. He bodode geleafan on Iudea lande & unriht forbead, oð
þæt se reða kyning, Mannases gehaten, Ezechian sunu, hine tocleaf on twa
& hine acwealde swa.
 603. Hieremias se witega wæs on þam lande swiðe halig witega
fram his cildhade; be þam cwæð God sylf to him: Ic þe gecuðe
soðlice ær þan þe ic þe gesceope on þinre modor innoðe, & ic
þe gehalgode ær þan þe þu acenned wurde, & ic þe gesette
þeodum to witegan.
 611. He wunode on clænnysse, & he awrat ane boc þurh
þone Halgan Gast on his witegunge, micele & menigfealde, þam mannum to
lare, of gastlicum andgitte eac be þam Hælende.
 617. He wearð oft gebend & gebroht on cweartern for his
halgan lare, & he heofode micclum þæs folces synna, swa swa his boc us
segð, & he wearð oftorfod mid stanum æt nextan on Egipta lande for
his geleafan.
 623. Plato se uðwita & se wisosta mann on hæðenum folce
hæfde hine gesprecen, & se witega þa hine gewissode, þæt he
cuðe gelyfan on þone lifiendan God, swa swa Agustinus hit on bocum gesette;
& Ieremias ys ure witega synderlice.
 631. Ezechiel se witega wearð gehergod mid þam folce, þa þa
se Chaldeisca kining acwealde ða Iudeiscan & ða herelafe to his lande
adraf, þa þa Daniel se witega wearð eac gelæht.
 636. & Ezechiel ða on þeowte þær wunode & witegode
þær, & awrat ane boc micele on gesetnisse be þam mancynne & be
urum Drihtene, swiðe deop on andgite, oð þæt se heafodman þæs
gehergodan folces hine acwealde, swa swa us kyð sum lareow.
 645. Daniel se witega wunude on Chaldea, wurðfull þam ciningum,
& awrat ane boc on his witegunge, þe him God sylf onwreah, & he
swutelice sæde on his gesetnisse be Cristes acennednisse, swa swa he com to
mannum feowerhund geara & hundnigontig geara fram Darie ðam cining, oð
þæt ure Drihten com on soðre menniscnisse of Marian innoþe.
 655. His boc is swiðe micel on manegum getacnungum, langsum her
to secgende be hire gesetnyssum & hu he wæs aworpen þam wildum leonum,
be þam we awriton on Englisc on sumum spelle hwilon.
 661. He næs na ofslagen, ac he him sylf gewat, þa þa he hund
geara wæs & tyn gear on ylde, & he wæs bebirged on Babilonia.
 666. Twelf witegan syndon to eacan þisum git, ðe twelf bec
awriton on heora witegunge be sumum dæle læssan on gesetnysse, micele on
andgitte be Cristes menniscnysse & be Godes folce, swa swa God him
onwreah.
 673. Ðæra naman we willað awritan on þisum cwyde: OSEE,
IOHEL, AMOS, ABDIAS, IONAS se þe ðreo niht wæs wiðinnan þam hwale,
& se hwæl hine abær to Niniuea birig, & seo dæd getacnode ures
Drihtenes deað, þe læg on birgine swa langum fæce, ac he aras of
deaðe þurh his drihtenlican mihte MICHEAS, NAVM, ABBACVC, se namnode þone
Hælend be his naman þus: <foreign>Ego autem in Domino gaudebo & exultabo in
Deo Iesu meo</foreign>, ðæt ys on Englisc; Ic blissie on Drihtene & ic
fægnie on Gode minum Hælende.
 688. Iesus wæs gehaten ure Hælend on life, & swa sæde
þes witega, ær ðan þe he wurde acenned, & swa swa se heahengel hit
sæde on þam godspelle.
 693. He ys gehaten eac Crist; be þam cwæð sum witega for
fela hund gearum, ær þan þe he acenned wurde: <foreign>Adstiterunt reges terre
& principes conuenerunt in unum aduersus Dominum & aduersus Christum
eius</foreign>, Eorðlice ciningas & ealdormenn arison ongean urne Drihten &
þone Hælend Crist; þæt wæs Herodes cining & Pilatus
ealdormann, swa swa ða apostolas be þam understodon; Sophonias, AGGEUS,
Zacharias, Malachias.
 707. Wæron eac oðre witegan, þe ne writon nane bec, swa swa
wæs Helias & Heliseus, ac heora wundra syndon awritene swa ðeah on
þæra Cininga Bocum on fulcuðum gemynde.
 712. Tyn mædena wæron on mislicre tide on hæþenum
leodum, þa man het Sibillas, þæt synd witegestran, & hi witegodon
ealle be þam Hælende Criste, & heora bec setton swiðe swutelice
ðurh þone soþan God be ealre his fare mid fullum geleafan, for ðan þe
God wolde him gewitan habban of hæðenum leodum & of geleafullum; ac
heora bec ne synd na on ure gesetnissum on þære biblioþecan swa swa
þas oðre beoð.
 726. Esdras se writere awrat ane boc, hu þæt folc com ongean
fram Chaldea lande to Iudea lande & hi Hierusalem þa burh eft arærdon,
& þæt tempel þærbinnan, swa swa Cirus kining him sealde leafe
æfter hundseofontigon gearum, þæt hi heora eard bogodon, & seo boc
ys geendebyrd on þissere gesetnysse mid deopum andgitte on diglum
getacnungum.
 737. Iob wæs gehaten sum heah Godes þegen on þam lande Chus,
swiðe geleafull wer, welig on æhtum; se wearð afandod þurh þone
swicolan deofol, swa swa his boc us segð, þe he sylf gesette siþþan he
afandod wæs, be þam ic awende on Englisc sumne cwide iu, & hit ys eac
witegung witodlice be Criste & be his gelaþunge, swa swa lareowas
secgað, & seo boc ys geendebyrd on þissere gesetnysse.
 750. Sum Iudeisc man wearð eac afandod, Tobias gehaten, swiðe
ælmesgeorn & swiþe gelyfed on þone lyfiendan God.
 753. Se wæs eac gehergod to Sirian lande, ac he heold swa þeah
his geleafan þær mid godum weorcum & God his afandode, swa þæt he
blind wearð and swa wunode tyn gear; ac God hine gehælde eft þurh his
heahengel, Raphael gehaten, swa swa seo racu us segð on his agenre bec, þe
he sylf awrat, & seo boc ys geteald to þisum getele, for ðan þe
þæron ys eac swilce getacnung.
 766. Hester seo cwen, þe hire kynn ahredde, hæfð eac ane boc
on þisum getele, for ðan þe Godes lof ys gelogod þæron; ða ic
awende on Englisc on ure wisan sceortlice.
 772. Iudith seo wuduwe, þe oferwann Holofernem þone Siriscan
ealdormann, hæfð hire agene boc betwux þisum bocum be hire agenum sige;
seo ys eac on Englisc on ure wisan gesett eow mannum to bysne, þæt ge
eowerne eard mid wæmnum bewerian wið onwinnendne here.
 781. Twa bec synd gesette æfter cyrclicum þeawum betwux
þisum bocum, þe gebiriað to Godes lofe, Machabeorum gehatene, for heora
micclum gewinne, for ðan þe hig wunnon mid wæmnum þa swiðe wið
þone hæðenan here, þe him on wann swiðe, wolde hig adilegian &
adyddan of þam earde, þe him God forgeaf, & Godes lof alecgan.
 791. Hwæt, þa Mathathias, se mæra Godes þegen, mid his
fif sunum, feaht wið þone here miccle gelomlicor ðonne þu gelyfan
wylle, & hig sige hæfdon þurh þone soðan God, þe hig on gelyfdon
æfter Moyses æ.
 797. Hig noldon na feohtan mid fægerum wordum anum, swa þæt
hi wel spræcon, & awendon þæt eft, þe læs ðe him become se
hefigtima cwyde, þe se witega gecwæð be sumum leodscipe þus: <foreign>Et
iratus est furore Dominus in populo suo & abhominatus hereditatem suam,
& cetera</foreign>: Drihten wearð yrre mid graman his folce, & he onscunode
his yrfewerdnisse, & he betæhte hig on hæþenra handum, & heora
fynd soðlice hæfdon heora geweald, & hig swiðe gedrehton þa
deriendlican/ fynd & hig wurdon geeadmette under heora handum.
 815. Nolde Machabeus, se mæra Godes cempa, habban þisne dom
ðurh his Drihtenes yrre, ac him wæs leofre, þæt he mid geleafan
clipode on his eornost to Gode þisne oðerne cwyde: <foreign>Da nobis, Domine,
auxilium de tribulatione, quia uana salus hominis, & cetera</foreign>: Syle us, leof
Drihten, þinne soðan fultum on ure gedrefednisse & gedo us strengran,
for þan þe mannes fultum ys unmihtig & idel.
 827. Ac uton wyrcean mihte on þone mihtigan God, & he to
nahte gedeð urne deriendlican fynd.
 830. Machabeus þa gefylde ðas foresædan word mid stranglicum
weorcum, & oferwann his fynd, & sint for ði gesette his sigefæstan
dæda on þam twam bocum on bibliothecan Gode to wurðmynte, & ic
awende hig on Englisc & rædon gif ge wyllað eow sylfum to ræde.
 838. <foreign>Explicit de Veteri Testamento. INCIPIT DE NOVO TESTAMENTO</foreign> IC
SECGE ÞE NU, SIWERD, ÐÆT ic her gesett hæbbe þas feawa bysna of
ðan ealdan bocum on þære ealdan gecyðnysse under Moyses æ, &
hu, gif þu wiltest ealne ðone wisdom þe on þam bocum stynt, þonne
woldest þu gelyfan þæt ic na ne wæge on þisum gewrite.
 844. Ic wille nu secgan eft sceortlice þe be þære niwan
gecyðnisse æfter Cristes tocyme, þæt þu mid ealle ne beo þæs
andgites bedæled, þeah þe ðu be fullan underfon ne mage ealle þa
gesetnissa þæs soþan gewrites: bist swa ðeah gebet þurh þas litlan
bysne.
 848. <foreign>Lex & prophete usque ad Iohannem, sicut legitur in
Euangelio</foreign>: Moyses æ wæs & witegan soþlice oð Iohannes wearð
acenned, þe Crist gefullode.
 850. He ys ende þære ealdan æ & æt him ongann seo
godspellbodung, & he wæs acenned on Cristes tocime.
 851. Swa swa dægsteorra on dægred upp gæð ætforan
þære sunnan, swa scean Iohannes on haligre bodunge ætforan þam
Hælende, & he wæs his bydel on his bodunge, & mid his fulluhte
kydde Cristes fulluht toweard.
 855. Crist sylf cwæð be him, þæt ne come nateshwon betwux
wifa bearnum nan mærra man ðonne he wæs; ac Crist næs na geteald to
þissere wiðmetenysse, se þe acenned wæs of ðam clænan mædene.
 858. Ne awrat Iohannes nane boc synderlice, ac his dæda sind
awritene on Drihtenes godspelle, þone he gefullode & his forerynel wæs
on life ge on deaðe, & his hlisa nu stynt swa hwær swa cristendom
bið & þa Cristes bec cumað.
 862. Feower Cristes bec sindon be Criste sylfum awriten.
 862. An ðæra awrat Matheus, þe mid þam Hælende wæs,
his agen leorningcniht on þisum life farende.
 864. & he his wundra geseah & awrat hi on þære bec,
þe him to gemynde þa mihton becuman, on Ebreiscum gereorde æfter Cristes
þrowunge on Iudea lande, þam þe gelyfdon on God; & he ys se forma
godspellere on ðære gesetnisse.
 867. Marcus se godspellere, þe wæs mid Petre on lare, his agen
godsunu on Godes lare geþogen, wrat þa oðre boc be Petres bodunge be
ðam þe he geleornode of his larspellum on Romana byrig, swa swa he gebeden
wæs þurh ða geleafullan, þe gelyfdon on God of þare burhware þurh
Petres bodunge.
 872. Lucas se godspellere awrat ða þriddan boc, se ðe fram
cildhade folgode þam apostolum & mid Paule siþþan siðode on his
fare, & æt him leornode ða godspellican lare on clænisse lybbende,
& awrat þa Cristes boc on Achaian lande mid Greciscum gereorde, swa he of
Paules lare & þæra apostola lare leornode.
 876. Iohannes se apostol on Asian lande, swa swa þa biscopas
bædon, began þa feorðan boc be Cristes godcundnysse, on Greciscum
gereorde, & be ðære deopnysse, þe him Drihten awreah þa þa he
hlinode on his luflicum breoste, on þam ðe wæs behydd se heofonlica
goldhord.
 881. Ðas synd þa feower ean of anum wyllspringe, þe gað of
Paradisum ofer Godes folc wide: & þas feower godspelleras wæron gefyrn
getacnode, swa Ezechiel hi geseah, Matheus on mannes hiwe, Marcus on leon,
Lucas on cealfes, Iohannes on earnes, for ðære getacnunge þe hig
getacnodon.
 885. Matheus awrat be Cristes menniscnisse, & Marcus, swa swa
leo hludswege, clipode on þam wildan mancynne swilce on westene, & Lucas
be þam sacerde Zacharias ongann, þe cealf geoffrode on Godes
onsægednisse, and Iohannes, swa swa earn, þa upplican digolnisse mid his
scearpum eagum sceawode georne & be Cristes godcundnysse his godspell
gesette.
 891. Ðas feower bec kyþað hu Crist com to mannum of Marian
ðam mædene, middaneardes alysend on þære sixtan ylde þissere
worulde, be þan ðe þa witegan hit gewriton on bocum, on Bethleem birig
binnan Iudea on Augustes dagum, þæs æðelan caseres, & englas þa
kyddon his acennednysse mid heofonlicum sange fela þusenda.
 895. Ða comon þri ciningas to Criste mid lacum of eastrice
feorran, & Herodes acwealde ealle þa litlan cild, þe on ðam lande
wæron, þæt he Crist acwealde, ac he ne com him to na, for ðan ðe he
mid swicdome hine swa sohte; & se yfela cining on yrmþum acweal.
 899. Ða bec us secgað swutelice be Criste, hu he wundra worhte
& hu he wæs gefullod & hu he apostolas geceas, þæt sind
ærendracan, twelf on anginne þa þa he ærest bodode.
 902. Þa sint gehatene þisum naman on bocum Petrus &
Andreas, Iacobus & Iohannes Thomas, Matthæus & se oðer Iacob,
Philippus & Bartholomeus, Tatheus, Simon Cananæus & Paulus: ac
Paulus wæs gecoren æfter Cristes upstige, & Mathias eac mann geceas
for Iudan, þe Crist belæwde & þa forloren wæs.
 906. Æfter þisum he geceas twa & hundseofonti to his
lareowdome him to leorningcnihtum, þa he tosende geond eall to ælcere
birig þider þe he towerd wæs, þæt mann wiste his cyme; ac we ne
afundon na awritene heora naman on bocum.
 910. He wunode þa mid mannum on þisum middanearde þreo &
þrittig geara & sumne eacan þærto, & cristendom arærde &
kydde mid wundrum, swa swa his godspell secgað, þæt he Godes sunu ys,
þa þa he þa deadan menn þurh his mihte arærde, & ælce
untrumnysse eaðelice gehælde, & he wæter awende to winlicum drence,
& ofer sæ eode eall drium fotum, & windas gestilde mid his wordes
hæse, & deofla adræfde of gedrehtum wodum, & forgeaf gewitt
æfter wodnysse.
 917. Eft siþþan he þrowode sylfwilles deað on rode ahangen
for ure alysednysse, & of deaðe aras on þam ðriddan dæge, &
astah to heofenum to his heofenlican fæder gewunnenum sige, & gewylt
ealle þing, & cymð to demende eallum mancynne on þam micclan dæge,
ælcum be his dædum.
 921. Ic secge þis sceortlice, for ðan þe ic gesett hæbbe
of þisum feower bocum wel feowertig larspella on Engliscum gereorde &
sumne eacan ðærto, þa þu miht rædan be þissere race on maran
andgite, ðonne ic her secge.
 925. Ða apostoli gesetton eac swilce larspell to þam leodscipum
þe to geleafan bugon, þæt hi þurh ða mynegunge heora mod getrymdon
on Cristes geleafan on þam cristendome, ðe þa niwan asprang on þære
micclan niwan gecyðnysse.
 928. Petrvs se apostol awrat twegen pistolas, ac hig synd maran
þonne man æt mæssan ræt, & habbað langne tige to geleafan
trimminge, & hig synd to bocum getealde on þære bibliothecan.
 931. Iacob se rihtwisa awrat anne pistol micelne on lare mannum to
understandenne, þam þe æniges cristendomes cepað on heora life.
 933. Iohannes se godspellere, Gode to wurðmynte, gesette ðri
pistolas, þæt syndon þreo bec mid lufe afyllede folce to lare.
 935. Iudas se apostol awrat anne pistol, na se forlorena Iudas þe
ðone Hælend belæwde, ac se halga Iudas þe him æfre folgode.
 937. And her sind nu seofon bec on þissere gesetnisse.
 938. Paulus se apostol awrat manega pistolas, for þan þe Crist
hine gesette eallum þeodum to lareowe, & on soþre eufæstnysse he
gesette ða þeawas, ða þa geleafullan folc on heora life healdað, þa
þe hig sylfe gelogiað & heora lif for Gode.
 941. Fiftyne pistolas awrat se an apostol to þam leodscipum, þe
he to geleafan gebigde; þa syndon micele bec on þære bibliothecan &
þa fremiað us to ure rihtinge, gif we þæs leoda lareowes lare
folgiað.
 944. He awrat to þam Romaniscum anne, to Corinthios ii, eac to
Galathas anne, to Ephesios anne, to Philipenses anne, to Thesalonicenses
twegen, to Colosenses anne, eac to Ebreos anne, & to his agenum discipulum
Timotheum twegen, & Titum anne, to Philemonem anne, to Laodicenses anne;
ealles fiftyne, swa hlude swa ðunor, geleafullum folcum.
 950. Be þam ic wille secgan sume feawa word; ærest be ðam
Hælende, hu he us lærde on his halgan godspelle, þa þe hine lufiað:
<foreign>Si diligitis me, mandatu mea seruate, & cetera</foreign>: Gif gelufiað me,
healdað mine beboda.
 953. Se þe me lufað, he healt mine spræce & min Fæder
hine lufað & wit cumað to him & mid him wuniað witodlice
syððan; se þe me ne lufað, ne healt he na mine spræce.
 955. Her we magon gehiran, þæt se Hælend lufað swiðor
þa dæde þonne þa smeðan word: þa word gewitað & þa weorc
standað.
 957. Be þam cwæð Iacob, se rihtwisa apostol: <foreign>Estote
factores uerbi & non auditores tantum fallentes uosmet ipsos</foreign>: Beoð
þæs wordes wircendras witodlice mid dædum & eow sylfe ne
bepæcað, swa þæt ge hlyston þa word ana butan þam weorcum.
 961. Eall swa Iohannes us lærde þisum wordum: <foreign>Filioli mei,
non diligamus uerbo neque lingua, sed opere & ueritate</foreign>: Mine leofan bearn,
ne lufige we, ic bidde, mid worde & mid tungan, ac mid weorce &
soðfæstnysse.
 964. Paulus se apostol be ðam ylcan cwæð: <foreign>Qui dicunt se
nosse Dominum, factis autem negant</foreign>: Hi secgað, þæt hig cunnon þone
soðan God, ac hig mid heora weorcum hine wiðsacað.
 967. Se man, þe behet geswicennysse yfeles & his wedd to
þam sylð & awend þæt eft, hu mæg he ðonne habban þæs
Hælendes fultum, se þe gesihð and gesceawað his heortan, þæt he
wylle awendan his word eft wið hine?
 970. Ac man mot on eornost motian wið his Drihten, se þe wyle
þæt we sprecon mid weorcum wið hine; for þan se ðe wel spricð
& þa word na gelæst, he ne deð nan þingc buton fordemð hine
sylfne.
 974. Lucas se godspellere, se ðe wæs læce on life, gesette
twa bec urum saulum to hæle: an ys seo Cristes boc; oþer ys gecweden
þus, <foreign>Actus Apostolorum</foreign>, þæt ys on Engliscre spræce, þæra
apostola dæda, þe hi dydon ætgædere, & hu hi siððan toferdon
to fyrlenum eardum, swa swa se Hælend bebead on his halgum godspelle,
þæt hig ealle leoda læran sceoldon & gebigan to geleafan mid heora
bodunge.
 980. Petrus bodode on Antiochian byrig, & þær wæron
ærest gecwedene cristene men þurh hine, & he ferde siððan swiþe
fus to Rome, & þær bodode þære burhwure geleafan fif and twentig
wintra mid wundrum & tacnum, oð þæt se casere Nero hine acwealde on
rode.
 983. Paulus ferde wide geond þas woruld bodiende manegum
leodscipum, oð þæt he on last becom in to Rome byrig & þær eac
bodode.
 985. & Nero het þa hine beheafdian on þam ylcan dæge,
þe he aheng Petrum.
 986. Andreas bodode on Achaian lande & on Scithian, & he
syððan wearð on rode ahangen for þæs Hælendes naman.
 988. Iacob se gingra, þe wæs Iohannes broþor, bodode þam
Iudeiscum þe wæron tostengte, þam twelf mægðum, tacna wircende,
oð þæt Herodes cyning hine beheafdode.
 991. Iohannes his broðor bodode on Asia, on easteweardan worulde,
& he ne wearð na ofslagen, ac æfter manegum wundrum he gewat to
Criste, þa þa he on ylde wæs nygan & hundnygontig wintra.
 993. Philippus bodode þam hæðenum folce wið þære
sæ sylfre, & he siððan gewat to Hærapolim & wearð þa
geendod.
 995. Thomas bodode on Parthon & Medon & on Yrcaniam, oð
þæt he com to Indian & þær wearð ofslagen for þone soðan
geleafan.
 997. Bartholomeus bodode on Indian, on þære fyrran Indian,
& þær wearð ofslagen.
 998. Matheus bodode on Ethiopian lande, þæt synd þa
Silhearwan, & se kining hine ofsloh, na se gelyfeda, ac se ungeleaffulla.
 1000. Iacob se rihtwisa wunode on þam lande binnan Hierusalem
bodiende geleafan oð þæt þa Iudeiscan hine acwealdon.
 1002. Simon & Iudas samod wæron gemartyrode on Persida lande
for Cristes geleafan, on ðam þe hi bodedon & biscopas gehadedon on
heora twelf scirum, oð þæt man hig ofsloh.
 1004. Mathias bodode on Iudea lande, se þe wæs gecoren on
Iudan stede, þæt þæra apostola getel wurde gefylled.
 1006. Ealra þissera apostola geendunge ic hæbbe awriten buton
Mathian anes, þe ic ofacsian ne mihte: ða ge mihton rædan & eow
aræman on þam, gif ge holde wæron eowrum agenum sawlum.
 1010. Iohannes leofode on þisum life heora lengst, & he awrat
þa boc on his wræcsiðe <foreign>Apocalipsis</foreign> gehaten, þæt ys onwrigennys,
þe him Crist geswutelode on his gastlican gesihþe be þam Hælende
sylfum & his gelaðunge & be domes dæge & be þam deoflican
Antecriste & be þam æriste to þam ecan life; & þeos boc ys
æftemyst on ðære bibliothecan.
 1015. Ic mæg þe secgan git sum þing be Iohannes, þæt
þu wylt gelyfan, þæt he mid weorcum spræc to sumum cnihte, swa swa us
kyð seo racu, ðone he lufode, & him eac swa gelæste.
 1017. Hieronimus se wurþfulla & se wisa bocere, þe ure
bibliothecan gebrohte to Ledene of Greciscum bocum & of Ebreiscum, he awrat
be Iohanne þam halgan godspellere, Cristes modrian sunu, on þære
circlican bec <foreign>Ecclesiastica Hystoria</foreign>, þus cweðende be him: <foreign>Audi fabulam,
non fabulam sed rem gestam de Iohanne apostolo, & cetera</foreign>.
 1022. Gehyr ðu þas race, na swilce lease sagu, ac geworden
þing be Iohanne ðam apostole & swiþe gemyndelic eallum geleaffullum
þe on ealdum dagum be him gedon wæs.
 1025. Domicianus hatte se deoflica casere, þe æfter Nerone
þa reðan ehtnyssa besette on þam cristenum, & hi acwealde mid witum.
 1026. Se het genyman þone halgan apostol & on weallendum ele
he het hine baðian, for ðan þe se hata ele gæð in to ðam bane;
& him wæs eaðgete ele to þam baðe.
 1029. Hig gebrohton þa Iohannem binnan þære cyfe on þam
weallendan ele; ac he wearð gescild þurh Godes mihte & mid halum
lichaman of þam baðe eode, swa swa he unwemme wæs fram flæsclicum
lustum & fulre galnysse.
 1032. Æfter þisum gehet se hetola casere, for ðan ðe
Iohannes nolde his bodunge geswican, þæt man hine gebrohte binnan anum
igoðe feor on wræcsiðe, Pathmos gehaten, & he þær wunode, oð
þæt þæs caseres witan heora hlaford ofslogon, swa swa him eallum
gewearð, for his wælhreownysse & his gewittleaste, & þa witan
þa demdon þæt eall wurde aidlod, & mid ealle awend, swa hwæt swa
he wolde mid his yfelan ræde ær þam gefremman.
 1038. Wearð þa eft gelangod se geleaffulla apostol of þam
iglande ham to Ephesan byrig, þær þær he wununge hæfde, Godes
wundra wyrcende & þæt folc lærende to geleafan simble.
 1041. Ða æfter sumum fyrste ferde se apostol, swa swa he
gelaðod wæs þurh þa geleaffullan, to gehendum burgum bodigende
geleafan & þæt he circean arærde on gehwilcum scirum, þær
þær ær ðam næron, & he eac þa gesette mid gehadodum
preostum, be þam þe se Halga Gast him simble gewissode, swa swa us segð
seo racu.
 1046. He becom þa to anre birig, swa swa he gebeden wæs,
gehende Ephesan, & þær bisceop gehadode, & þa circlican þeawas
him sylf þær getæhte þam gehadodum preostum, ðe he þær
gelogode, & mid micelre mærþe þæt mennisc þær lærde to
Godes geleafan mid glædre heortan.
 1051. Ða geseah Iohannes sumne cniht on þam folce iunglicre
ylde & ænlices hiwes, stranglic on wæstme & wenlic on nebbe,
swiðe glæd on mode & on anginne caf, & begann to lufienne on his
liðum þeawum þone iungan cniht þæt he hine Criste gestrynde.
 1054. Ða beseah Iohannes swa upp to þam bisceope, þe ða
niwan wæs gehadod, & him þus to cwæð: Wite þu la bisceop,
þæt ic wille þæt þu hæbbe þisne iungan man mid þe on þinre
lare æt ham, & ic hine þe befæste mid healicre gecneordnisse on
Cristes gewitnysse & þissere gelaðunge.
 1059. Hwæt, þa se bisceop bliðelice underfeng þone
foresædan cniht, & sæde þæt he wolde his gimene habban mid
geornfulnysse, swa he him bebead, on his wununge mid him.
 1061. Iohannes þa eft geedleahte his word & gelome bebead
þam bisceope mid hæsum, þæt he þone iungan cniht gewissian sceolde
to ðam halgan geleafan, & he ham þa gewende eft to Efesan birig to his
bisceopstole.
 1064. Se bisceop þa underfeng, swa swa him beboden wæs, þone
iungan cniht, & him Cristes lare dæghwamlice tæhte & hine
deorwurðlice heold, oð þæt he hine gefullode mid fullum truwan
þæt he geleafful wære, & he wunode swa mid him on arwurðnysse,
oð þæt se bisceop hine let faran be his wille, wende þæt he sceolde
on Godes gife þurhwunian on gastlicum þeawum.
 1070. He geseah þa sona þæt he his sylfes geweold on
ungeripedum freodome & unstaððigum þeawum, & begann þa to
lufienne leahtras to swiðe & fela unðeawas mid his efenealdum cnihtum,
þe unrædlice ferdon on heora idelum lustum on gewemmednyssum & wolicum
gebærum.
 1074. He & his geferan þa begunnon to lufienne þa micclan
druncennisse on nihtlicum gedwylde, & hig þa hine on gebrohton þæt
he begann to stelenne on heora gewunan, & he gewenede swa hine sylfne
simble to heora synlicum þeawum & to marum morðdædum mid þam
manfullum flocce.
 1078. He genam þa heardlice þurh heora lare on his orþance
þa egeslican dæda, & swa swa modig hors þe ungemidlod byð &
nele gehirsumian þam ðe him on uppan sitt, swa ferde se cniht on his
fracedum dædum, & on morðdædum micclum gestrangod on orwennysse his
agenre hæle, swa þæt he ortruwode on his drihtnys mildheortnysse, &
his mildheortnysse, & his fulluhtes ne rohte, þe he underfangen
hæfde.
 1085. Him þuhte þa to waclic þæt he wolde gefremman þa
læssan leahtras, ac he leornode æfre maran & maran on his manfulnysse
& ne let nanne his gelican on yfele.
 1088. He ne geþafode þa, þæt he underþeod wære yfelum
gegadum, þe hine ær forlærdon, ac wolde beon yldest on þam yfelan
flocce & geworhte his geferan to wealdgengum ealle on widgillum dunum on
ealre hreownysse.
 1090. Eft þa æfter fyrste ferde se apostol to þære
foresædan byrig, ðe se bisceop on wunode, þe þone cniht hæfde on
his gimene æror, swa swa Iohannes het, & he hine befæste & he
swiðe bliðe wæs æt þam bisceopstole, syððan he gedon hæfde
his Drihtenes þenunga & þa ðing gefyllede, þe he fore gelaþod
wæs.
 1095. He cwæð þa anrædlice: Eala þu la bisceop, gebring
me nu ætforan þæt þæt ic ðe befæste on mines Drihtnes truwan,
& on þære gewitnysse, þe ðu wissian scealt on þissere
gelaðunge.
 1097. He wearð þa ablicged & wende þæt he bæde
sumes oþres sceattes oððe sumes feos, þæs þe he ne underfeng fram
þam apostole; ac he eft beðohte, þæt se eadiga Iohannes him leogan
nolde, ne hine þæs biddan þæt he ær ne befæste, & he
forhtmod wafode.
 1101. Iohannes þa geseah þæt he sæt ablicged, &
cwæð him eft þus to: Ic bidde æt þe nu þæs iungan cnihtes,
þe ic þe befæste, and þæs broþor sawle þe me besorh ys.
 1104. Ða begann se ealda incuðlice siccettan & mid wope
wearð witodlice ofergoten, & cwæð to Iohanne: He, leof, ys nu dead.
 1105. Ða befran Iohannes færlice, & cwæð: Hu ys he la
dead oððe hwilcum deaðe?
 1107. He cwæð him eft þus to andsware: He is Gode dead, for
þan þe he leahterfull & geleafleas ætbærst, & he ys geworden
nu to wealdgengan & þæra sceaðena ealdor, þe he him sylf
gegaderode, & wunað on anre dune mid manegum sceaþum, þam þe he nu
ys ealdor & heretoga.
 1111. Hwæt, þa Iohannes mid ormætre geomerunge cwehte his
heafod, & cwæð to þam bisceope: Godne hyrde let ic þe, þæt
þu þæs broðor sawle heolde; ac beo me nu gegearcod an gerædod hors
& latteow þæs weges þe lið to þam sceaðum.
 1114. & man him sona funde, þæs þe he frimdig wæs,
& he fram þære ciricean sona swiðe efste, oð þæt he geseah
þæra sceaþena fær, & to þam weardmannum witodlice becom.
 1117. Ða gelæhton þa weardmen his wealdleðer fæste,
þæt he mid fleame huru ne ætburste; ac he nolde him ætfleon ne nanes
fleames cepan, ac he clypode ofer eall: Ic com me sylf to eow; alædað me
nu to butan late eowerne ealdor.
 1120. Hig clipodon þa mid þam þone cniht him raðe to, þe
hira heafodman wæs, & he com þa gewæmnod, & he mid sceame
wearð sona ofergoten, þa þa he oncneow þone Cristes apostol, &
began to fleonne fram his andweardnysse.
 1123. Iohannes ða heow þæt hors mid þam spuran &
wearð him æfterweard & his ylde ne gimde, clypode þa hlude &
cwæð to þam fleondum: Eala þu min sunu, hwi flihst þu þinne
fæder?
 1126. Hwi flihst ðu þisne ealdan & ungewæpnodan?
 1127. Ne ondræd þe la earming; git þu hæfst lifes hiht.
 1128. Ic wille agildan gescead for þinre sawle Criste & ic
lustlice wille min lif for þe syllan, swa swa se Hælende sealde hine
sylfne for us, & mine sawle ic sille for þinre.
 1130. Ætstand huru nu, & gehyr þas word, & gelyf
þæt se Hælend me asende to þe.
 1131. Þa ætstod se wealdgenga, syþþan he þas word
gehirde, & aleat to eorðan mid eallum lichaman & awearp his wæmna
& weop swiðe biterlice, & he bifiende feoll to Iohannes fotum mid
geomerunge & þoterunge mid tearum ofergoten, biddende miltsunge be þam
ðe he mihte, & behydde his swiðran hand ofsceamod forðearle for
þære morðdæde þe he gedon hæfde, & for þam manslihte þe
he sloh mid þære handa.
 1137. Þa swor se apostol, þæt he soðlice wolde him
mildsunge begitan æt þam mildheortan Hælende, & eac he sylf aleat
to him, & gelæhte his swiþran, for ðære þe he ofdrædd wæs
for his morðdædum, & alædde hine aweg wepende to circean, & for
hine gebæd mid broðorlicre lufe, swa swa he him behet, to þam Hælende
gelome, & eac mid fæste fela daga on an, oð þæt he him mildsunge
beget æt þam mildheortan Criste.
 1143. He hine frefrode eac mid his fægeran lare & his
afyrhte mod swiþe fægerlice mid his frofre geliðewæhte, þæt he
ne wurde ormod, & he nateshwon ne geswac, ær þan þe his sawul wæs
wiðinnan gegladod þurh þone Halgan Gast & he mildsunge hæfde ealra
his misdæda.
 1147. He hine hadode eac to þæs Hælendes þeowdome; ac us
ne segð na seo racu to hwam he hine sette, buton þæt he sealde soðe
gebysnunge eallum dædbetendum, þe to Drihtene gecyrrað, þæt hig
magon arisan , gif hig rædfæste beoð, fram heora sawle deaþe &
fram heora synna bendum, & heora Scippend gladian mid soðre dædbote,
& habban þæt ece lif mid þam leofan Hælende se þe a rixað on
ecnysse.
 1153. Amen.
 1154. We habbað nu gesæd be ðam circlicum bocum on þære
ealdan æ & eac on þare niwan: ða synd þa twa gecyðnyssa be
Cristes menniscnysse & be þære halgan þrinnysse on soðre annysse,
swa Isaias geseah on his gastlican gesihðe, hu God sylf gesæt & him
sungon abutan duo seraphin, þæt sind twa engla werod: <foreign>Sanctus, sanctus,
sanctus, Dominus Deus Sabaoth</foreign>, þæt ys on Englisc: Halig, halig, halig,
Drihten weroda God.
 1160. Mid his wuldre ys afylled eall eorðan bradnysse.
 1161. Ða twa seraphin soðlice getacnodon þa ealdan
gekyðnysse & eac þa niwan, þe heriað mid wordum & mid weorcum
æfre þone ælmihtigan God, se þe ana rixað on anre godcundnysse
butan anginne & ende.
 1164. Ða lareowas, þe nellað heora lare nyman of þisum
halgum bocum, ne heora gebysnunga, þa beoð swilce lareowas, swa swa Crist
sylf sæde: <foreign>Cecus si ceco ducatum prestet, ambo in foueam cadent</foreign>.
 1167. Gif se blinda man bið þæs blindan latteow, þonne
befeallað hi begen on sumne blindne seað.
 1168. Ða lareowas þe willað heora lare nyman of þisum
halgum bocum & heora gebysnunga ge of þære ealdan gekiðnisse ge of
þære niwan, þa beoð swilce lareowas, swa swa Crist eft sylf cwæð:
<foreign>Omnis scriba doctus in regno celorum similis est homini patrifamilias, qui
profert de thesauro suo noua & uetera</foreign>: ælc gelæred bocere on Godes
gelaðunge ys gelic þam hlaforde, þe forlæt simble of his agenum
goldhorde ealde þing & niwe.
 1176. Twa & hundseofontig boca sind on bibliothecan, for þan
þe hig sume sind tosette on twa for heora langnysse on geleafulre ciricean:
þæt mæg sceawian þe ða gesetnisse cann.
 1178. & swa fela þeoda wurdon todælede æt þære
wundorlican byrig, þe þa entas woldon wircean mid gebeote æfter Noes
flode, ær þan ðe hi toferdon.
 1180. And swa fela leorningcnihta asende ure Hælend mancinne to
bodienne þæra boca lare mid þam cristendome, þe þa com on þas
woruld þurh ðone Hælend sylfne & þurh his bydelas.
 1183. Syndon swa þeah gesette oðre bec ðurh halige lareowas,
þe man hæfð wide gehwær on cristendome Criste to lofe.
 1185. & seo sixte yld þissere worulde stynt fram Criste
astreht oþ domes dæg eallum mannum ungewiss, ac hit wat se Hælend.
 1187. Seo seofoðe yld ys þe yrnð mid þisum sixum fram Abele
þam rihtwisan oð þissere worulde ende, na on lybbendum mannum, ac on
forðfarenum sawlum on þam oðrum life, þær þær hig blissiað
andbidiende git þæs ecan lifes þonne hig arisað, swa swa we ealle
sceolon, of deaðe gesunde urum Drihtene togeanes.
 1191. Seo eahteoðe yld ys se an eca dæg æfter urum
æriste, þonne we rixiað mid Gode on sawle & on lichaman on ecere
sælþe, & ne biþ nan ende þæs anes dæges, þonne þa halgan
scinað swa swa seo sunne deð nu.
 1195. Hu mæg se man wel faran, ðe his mod awent fram eallum
þisum bocum & bið him swa anwille, þæt him leofre bið, þæt
he lybbe æfre be his agenum dihte ascired fram þisum, swilce he ne cunne
Cristes gesetnyssa?
 1198. Moyses us lærde, se mæra witega, on his gesetnissum
þus secgende eallum: <foreign>Interroga patrem tuum & adnuntiabit tibi, maiores
tuos, & dicent tibi, & cetera</foreign>; þæt ys on Englisc: Acsa þinne
fæder embe ðone soþan God & he þe kyð be him; befrin þine
yldran & hig þe secgað.
 1202. Gif þu nelt witan & beon gewissod her, þu scealt
leornian ðær þe laþre bið on egeslicum witum, ðæt þu wite
þonne hwæne þu forsawe & hwæs gesetnysse.
 1204. Witan sceoldon smeagan mid wislicum geþeahte, þonne on
mancinne to micel yfel bið, hwilc þæra stelenna þæs cinestoles
wære tobrocen, & betan þone sona.
 1207. Se cinestol stynt on þisum þrim stelum: <foreign>laboratores,
bellatores, oratores</foreign>.
 1208. <foreign>Laboratores</foreign> sind þe us bigleofan tiliað, yrðlingas
& æhtemen to þam anum betæhte.
 1209. <foreign>Oratores</foreign> syndon þe us þingiað to Gode &
cristendom fyrðriað on cristenum folcum on Godes þeowdome to ðam
gastlican gewinne, to þam anum betæhte us eallum to þearfe.
 1212. <foreign>Bellatores</foreign> sindon þe ure burga healdað & eac urne
eard, wið þone sigendne here feohtende mid wæmnum, swa swa Paulus
sæde, se þeoda lareow, on his lareowdome: <foreign>Non sine causa portat miles
gladium, & cetera</foreign>, Ne byrð na se cniht butan intingan his swurd.
 1216. He ys Godes þen þe sylfum to þearfe on ðam yfelum
wyrcendum to wræce gesett.
 1217. On þisum þrim stelum stynt se cynestol, & gif an
bið forud, he fylð adun sona þam oðrum stelum to unþearfe gewiss.
 1219. Ac hwæt gebyrað us embe þis to smeagenne?
 1219. Þis sceolon smeagan þe þæs giman sceolon.
 1221. Se rihtwisa God lufað rihte domas; ac medsceattas awendað
wolice to oft þa rihtan domas ongean Drihtenes willan, & seo yfelnyss
becymð ofer eallum folce, þær ðær se unþeaw orsorhlice rixað.
 1223. Se þe Godes þegen bið, sceolde deman rihtlice butan
ælcum medsceatte mid soðfæstnysse; þonne wurðode he God mid þam
godan þeawe & his med wære micel for Gode, se ðe leofað &
rixað a to worulde.
 1226. Amen.
 1227. Ic wolde secgan be þam ungesæligum folce, be þam
Iudeiscum, þe urne Drihten ahengon, ac ic wolde ærest secgan þæt
þæt ic gesæd hæbbe.
 1229. Manega ðær gelyfdon of þam mancinne on Crist, ac se
mæsta dæl þæs mancinnes nolde on hine gelyfan and losodon for ði.
 1231. Him becomon fela yrmða æfter Cristes þrowunge on
eallum ungelimpum, & ofslagenne wurdon fela þæs folces mid færlicum
onræsum.
 1233. & hi acwealdon Cristes apostolas þone gingran Iacob
& þone rihtwisan Iacob, & Stephanum oftorfedon mid heardum stanum,
& heora yfel geeacnodon him sylfum to unþearfe & noldon besargian
þæs Hælendes slege ne mid nanre dædbote his mildse biddan.
 1236. Ða sende he him to sillice tacna & siððan hergunge
þurh þa Romaniscan.
 1238. Vespassianus wæs casere on þam timan; se asende him to
his sunu Titum mid micelre fyrde þæs Romaniscan folces & besæt
heora burh, oð þæt hi swulton hungre & mann awearp þa lic for
þan laþlican stence ut ofer ðone weall, & ne mihton nateshwon for
heora mægenleaste þa meniu bewerian.
 1242. Hi cuwon heora girdlas & gærs æton georne, &
ælc læhte of oðrum, gif he hwæt litles hæfde, & ðone mete
of þam muðe swiþe unmægðlice, & reaferas urnon geond ealle þa
burh & smealice sohton mid swiþlicum ðreate þone behiddan mete on
heora hordcleofan, & beoton ælcne man þe ænig þing hæfde, gif
he heora wodnisse wolde wiðcweðan.
 1247. Nys us na to secgenne þone sceamlican morð þe þær
gedon wæs, ac hi wurdon adydde mid þam hatan hungre, fela hund manna
þæs ærman mennisces, ma þonne we secgan willað, & þa reaferas
siþþan ofsloh ælc oðerne, & seo burh wearð gewyld & toworpen
grundlunga, swa se Hælend sæde ær his þrowunge.
 1252. Of þam iungum cnihtum, þe comon of ðam hungre, on
eallum þam lande hi alæddon aweg to wircenne godeweb, swa swa hi wæron
getogne, & of þam cnapum ys þæt kynn git gehwær, & þis
wæs þæt edlean heora yfelan dæda & eac hellewite, þæt
þæt him hefegore ys.
 1257. Nu miht þu wel witan, þæt weorc sprecað swiþor
þonne þa nacodan word, þe nabbað nane fremminge.
 1258. Is swa þeah god weorc on þam godan wordum, þonne man
oðerne lærð & to geleafan getrimð mid þære soþan lare,
& þonne mann wisdom sprecð manegum to þearfe & to rihtinge,
þæt God si geherod, se þe a rixað.
 1261. Amen.
 1262. Ðu woldest me laðian, þa þa ic wæs mid þe,
þæt ic swiðor drunce swilce for blisse ofer minum gewunan: ac wite þu,
leof man, þæt se þe oðerne neadað ofer his mihte to drincenne,
þæt se mot aberan heora begra gilt, gif him ænig hearm of þam drence
becymð.
 1266. Vre Hælend Crist on his halgan godspelle forbead þone
oferdrenc eallum gelyfedum mannum: healde se ðe wille his gesetnysse.
 1268. & þa halgan lareowas æfter þam Hælend aledon
þone unðeaw þurh heora lareowdom & tæhton þæt man drince swa
swa him ne derede, for ðan þe se oferdrenc fordeð untwilice þæs
mannes sawle & his gesundfullnysse, & unhæl becymð of þam
drence.
 1272. Locahwa þas boc awrite, write hig be þære bysne, &
for Godes lufon hi gerihte, þæt heo to leas ne beo þam writere to plihte
& me to tale.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

ÆLet 5 (Sigefyrth)
B1.8.5.
Letter to Sigefyrth: Assmann 1889, 13-23.



 2. Ælfric abbod gret Sigefyrð freondlice.
 3. Me is gesæd, þæt þu sædest be me, þæt ic
oðer tæhte on Engliscum gewritum, oðer eower ancor æt ham mid eow
tæhð, forþan þe he swutelice sægð, þæt hit sy alyfed,
þæt mæssepreostas wel moton wifian, and mine gewritu wiðcweðað
þysum.
 8. Nu secge ic þe, leof man, þæt me is lað to tælenne
agenne godes freond, gyf he godes riht drifð, ac we sceolon secgan and
forswigian ne durron þa halgan lare, þe se hælend tæhte: Seo lare
mæg eaðe unc emlice seman.
 13. Ure Hælend Crist cydde, þæt he lufode þa clænnysse
on his þeowum swutelice, þa þa he mædenmann him to meder geceas.
 16. And he sylf leofode buton eallum synnum on þære ylcan
clænnysse, þe he com to mannum, oð þæt he us alysde mid his agenum
life and mid his æriste urne deað towearp.
 20. Iohannes eac, se fulluhtere, þe Crist gefullode, heold þa
clænnysse gecwemlice gode on mode and on lichaman on micelre drohtnunge.
 23. And he is mægðhades man, forðam þe mægðhad is ge
on wæpmannum, ge on wimmannum, swa swa gewritu secgað.
 26. Iohannes se godspellere, þe gode wæs gecweme, and Crist
hine lufode for þære clænnysse, swa swa we singað swutelice be him:
<foreign>Virgo electus a Deo, virgo in eum permansit</foreign>.
 30. He wæs on clænum mægðhade gecoren fram gode, and he
on mægðhade on ecnysse þurhwunode.
 31. Sume þa apostolas, þe siðodon mid Criste on his
lareowdome, þa þa he her on life wæs, hæfdon him gemacan æfter
Moyses æ.
 35. Ac hi sona geswicon þæs sinscipes æfre, syððan hi
Cristes lare geleornodon æt him, swa swa Petrus sæde on sumum godspelle:
<foreign>Ecce nos reliquimus omnia et secuti sumus te</foreign>.
 39. <foreign>Quid ergo erit nobis</foreign>?
 40. We forleton ealle þing and þe, leof, folgiað.
 41. Hwæt gewyrð be us?
 41. And him andwyrde Crist: Ge, þe folgiað me, for þi ge
sceolon sittan on twelf domsetlum, and ge deman sceolon eallum manncynne on
þam micclan dæge æfter þam æriste, þonne ic sylf sitte on þam
domsetle mines mægenþrymmes.
 47. And ælc þæra, þe forlæt on þisum life nu
fæder oððe modor, gebroðru oððe geswustru, his wif oððe
cildru, hus oððe æceras for minum naman, he underfehð þa mede be
hundfealdum edleane and þæt ece lif.
 52. Ðysne wurðmynt geearniað æt þam ælmihtigan gode
þa þe mid clænnysse him gecwemað on life and mid godum weorcum hine
gladiað nu, þæt hi be hundfealdum habbað þa mede, þæt þæt
hi be anfealdan for his lufon dydon, and þær to eacan syþþan þæt
ece lif mid him.
 58. Under Moyses lage men moston lybban on maran softnysse and on
geswæsum lustum, swiþor þonne nu on þisum niwum dagum æfter Cristes
acennednysse, þe þa clænnysse astealde ge þurh hine sylfne, ge þurh
his halgan þegenas, ge wæpmenn, ge wimmenn, þe wunedon on clænnysse,
fela þusend manna on micelre drohtnunge, þe nu syndon halige on heofonan
rice.
 66. <foreign>Lex et prophetae usque ad Iohannem</foreign>.
 67. Seo ealde æ wunode and witegan eac swylce oþ Iohannes
timan, and witodlice syþþan man sceal mid earfoðnyssum þæt ece lif
geearnian, swa swa se hælend on his halgan godspelle cwæð.
 71. Iacob, se heahfæder, hæfde twa geswustru buta him to wife
be þam ealdan gewunan.
 73. Ac þæt is nu manfullic ænigum menn to donne on þam
cristendome, þe Crist sylf astealde on þæs godspelles timan nu under
godes gyfe.
 76. Se bisceop þa moste under Moyses æ habban wif and cild for
þære gesetnysse, þe nan mann ne moste to þam micclum hade nateshwon
becuman buton of Aarones cynne, þæs forman bisceopes, be godes
gesetnysse.
 81. Hit mihte þa swa wel beon, forþam þe hi ne mæssodon
næfre, ne husel ne halgodon, ærþan þe se hælend sylf husel
gehalgode ær his þrowunge and het us swa don on his halgan gemynde.
 85. He ne gecyst nu be nanum cynrene, ac of ælcere mægðe be
þæs mannes geþingðum, to his halgum þenungum him to mæssigenne
bisceopas and mæssepreostas to swa mycelre gerynu, þæt hi halgian magon
mid heora þenungum þæt halige husel to his lichaman and blode, and he
wyle habban huru þa clænan to swylcum weorce, swa swa him wel gerist.
 93. He cwæð on his godspelle be þam þe him þeniað:
<foreign>Sint lumbi vestri procincti et lucernae ardentes in manibus vestris</foreign>.
 95. Beon eowre lendena ymbgyrde, and beon leohfatu on eowrum handum
byrnende.
 97. Lareowas us secgað, þæt on þam lendenum is þæs
lichaman galnyss, and god bebead for þi, þæt we sceolon gewriðan and
gewyldan þa galnysse, we þe him þeniað on þære halgan mæssan.
 101. And we sceolon habban on urum handum leohtfatu, þæt synd
þa godan weorc, þe gode liciað, oðrum mannum to bysne, na us sylfum to
gylpe.
 104. Eft cwæð se hælend to his gingrum þuss: <foreign>Qui mihi
ministrat, me seguatur, et cetera</foreign>: Se ðe me sylfum þenað, folgie he eac
me, and þær þær ic sylf beo, þær byþ eac min þen.
 108. Se þe Criste þenað, he sceal him eac folgian æfre on
clænum þeawum be Cristes gebysnungum, þæt he mote wunian on þære
ecan worulde mid hælende Criste, swa swa he sylf behet þam þe him
þeniað on his þeowdome her.
 112. Iohannes, se godspellere, on his gastlican gesihðe,
Apocalipsis gehaten, þe se hælend him onwreah, geseah Crist standan and
þone clænan flocc mid him, hundteontig þusenda and feower and feowertig
þusenda, swiðe hlude singende þone heofonlican sang, and nan oþer halig
mann ne mihte singan mid him þone gastlican lofsang on godes gesihðe, buton
þa þusenda, þe þuss synd geherode.
 121. <foreign>Hi sunt, qui cum mulieribus non sunt coinquinati. Virgines
enim sunt. Hi sequuntur agnum, quocumque ierit</foreign>.
 124. Ðas halgan næron næfre mid wifum besmitene.
 125. Hi sindon mægðhade gehealdenre clænnysse.
 126. Hi folgiað Criste, swa hwider swa he gæð.
 127. Ac þa godes þeowas, þe gode sceolon þenian, gyf hi
licgað nu on heora lustum her, þonne ne magon hi singan þone heofonlican
sang, ne Criste folgian on his fægerum wununge, þe þa clænnysse
lufað on his clænum þeowdome.
 132. Is nu for ði mycel neod læwedum mannum, þæt hi
leornion heora geleafan æt Cristes lareowum, and hu hi lybbon on riht on
godes gelaðunge, forþan ðe þry hadas syndon, þe fullice gode
liciað.
 136. Þæra is ærest riht sinscipe and syþþan wudewanhad
and þonne mægðhad mid þæs modes clænnysse.
 138. Riht sinscipe is on gesinhiwum, þa þe beoð geæwnode
æfter godes gesetnysse and æwbryce ne wyrceað wolice and sceamlice, ac
heora lif lybbað, swa swa hit alyfed is, bearn strynende mid godes bletsunge
on alyfedum timan, godes folce to eacan, forþan ðe god fordemð þa
dyrnan forligeras and þa unrihtan hæmeras on helle suslum, buton hi heora
unriht ær heora ende gebeton.
 147. Hit wære swyþe rihtlic æfter rihtum life, þæt se
cniht heolde hine sylfne clæne, oð þæt he wifode, swa swa he wyle
habban clæne mæden, þonne hi cumað togæderes.
 151. And æfter godes gesetnysse eall swa scyldig byð geteald
se forlegena cniht swa þæt forlegene mæden.
 153. Wudewanhad is, þæt man wunige on clænnysse for godes
lufon, swa swa þæt godspell segð, æfter his gemacan mid
anrædnysse, ægðer ge weras ge wif æfter godes wissunge.
 157. Hit byð swyþe sceandlic, þæt eald wif sceole ceorles
brucan, þonne heo forwerod byð and teames ætealdod, ungehealtsumlice,
forðan ðe gesceafta ne beoð for nanum oðran þinge astealde butan for
bearnteame anum, swa swa us secgað halige bec.
 162. Mægðhad is witodlice se þe wunað on clænnysse
æfre fram cildhade gesælig for Criste, ge wæpmenn, ge wimmenn, þa
þe wurðiað Crist mid swa micelre lufe, þæt him leofre byð,
þæt hi mid earfoðnysse hi sylfe gewyldon to þære clænnysse, þe
hi Criste beheton, þonne hi heora lustas on heora life gefremmon and fram
þam ecan wurðmynte ælfremede beon; swa swa þa godan munecas and
mynecena doð, þa þe on clænnysse Criste æfre þeowiað.
 172. Ðas þry hadas habbað þone þryfealdan wæstm
þære godre eorðan; swa swa þæt godspell us segð, þæt
þæt gode sæd, þe god sæwð on mancynne, sum berð
þrittigfealdne wæstm, sum syxtigfealdne, sum hundfealdne mid healicum
geþylde.
 177. Ða þe on sinscipe wuniað mid gesceadwisnysse and heora
æwe healdað buton æwbryce symle, þa habbað þrittigfealde mede
æt þam mildheortan Criste on þam ecan life mid þæra engla
geferrædene.
 181. Ða þe on wudewanhade wuniað for Criste, þa habbað
eft æt him syxtigfealde mede, and þa þe on mægðhade and on modes
clænnysse fram cildhade wuniað on Cristes þeowdome, mid eadmodnysse him
æfre þeowigende, þa habbað hundfealde mede mid him sylfum on ecnysse
and þa mærestan wununge, swa swa se witega cwæð, Isaias se
æþela, on his gesetnysse.
 189. On þære gesetnysse mæg sceawian se þe wyle, hu
holdlice god spræc þurh þone halgan witegan be his clænum þegenum
and his clænum þinenum, hu he hi gearwurðað toforan oðrum mannum on
þam ecan wurðmynte and on wuldre mid him.
 194. We ne magon nu secgan on þysum sceortum gewrite, hu þa
halgan apostolas heredon þa clænnysse, and hu þa wisan lareowas awriton
be þære mycele bec on manegum gesetnyssum.
 198. And se þe him wiðcwyð and heora gesetnyssum, he ne byð
na wita, ac witodlice gedwola.
 200. We rædað on bocum, þæt ungerim bisceopa and muneca
wæron, swa swa wæs Martinus, Gregorius and Augustinus, Basilius and
Cuthberhtus, and manega oðre, on micelre drohtnunge Criste þeowigende on
clænnysse æfre.
 205. And heora nan ne sealde swylce leafe næfre, þæt
ænig weofodes þen moste wif habban, se þe mid his handum halgian sceal
þæt halige husel, swa swa se hælend tæhte.
 209. Eac swylce mæssepreostas manega wæron halige, swa swa
wæs Beda, se mæra bocere, and eft Hieronimus and oðre gehwylce wide
geond þas woruld, þe wunnon wið unþeawas and galnysse onscunedon þurh
godes gast onbryrde and þa fulan forsawon for heora fracodnysse.
 215. On westenum wunedon þa wisan fæderas Antonius and Paulus,
Hilarion and Macharius, Iohannes and Arsenius, Pafnutius and Apollonius, and
fela þusenda, swa swa <foreign>Vita Patrum</foreign> segð, muneca and mynecena, on mycelre
drohtnunge Criste þeowigende on modes clænnysse.
 221. And swa byð æfre oð þissere worulde geendunge,
þæt þa clænheortan on Cristes lufe þeonde beoð on halgum
geþingðum, oð þæt hi becumon to Criste sylfum.
 225. Þam sy a wuldor to worulde.
 225. Amen.
