ÆLet 6 (Wulfgeat)
B1.8.6.
Letter to Wulfgeat: Assmann 1889, 1-12.



 1. Nis þis gewrit be anum men awriten, ac is be eallum.
 2. Ic ælfric abbod on ðisum Engliscum gewrite freondlice grete
mid godes gretinge Wulfget æt Ylmandune.
 4. Beþam þe wit nu her spræcon be ðam Engliscum gewritum,
ðe ic þe alænde, þæt þe wel licode þæra gewrita andgit, and
ic sæde, þæt ic wolde þe sum asendan git.
 7. Nu sæde ic þe ær on ðam ærrum gewritum, hu se
ælmihtiga god, se ðe ne ongan næfre, se þe ana is soð god, gesceop
ealle þing gesewenlice and ungesewenlice þurh his soðan wisdom.
 11. And se wisdom is witodlice his sunu, ure hælend Crist, se
þe us alysde.
 12. And se þridda had is on þære halgan þrynnysse se halga
froforgast, þe us frefrað mid his gife and ure mod onliht æfre to
godnysse.
 15. And he ealra manna synna þurh his mihte forgyfð, þam ðe
mid dædbote doð geswicennysse.
 17. Se is soðlice lufu þæs soðfæstan fæder and his
suna lufu and heora agen willa, forþan ðe hi wyllað an.
 20. And þurh þone gast syndon soðlice geliffæste ealle
þa gesceafta, þe se fæder gesceop þurh his ancennedan sunu, swa swa us
secgað bec.
 23. Ðeos is seo halige þrynnys, þe ealle þing gesceop, on
anre godcundnysse æfre wunigende, on anum mægenþrymme and on anum
gecynde.
 26. Englas he gesceop on ænlicre fægernysse manega þusenda,
on micelre strengðe, þæt hi mihton geseon godes mærða mid him and
mid him wunian on his ecum wuldre.
 30. Hi nabbað nænne lichaman, ac hi libbað on gaste
ungesewenlice us, þe on synnum lybbað.
 32. And þa halgan englas, þe on heofonum wuniað, ne worhton
nane synne, ne hi synnian ne magon, buton þam anum, þe þanon afeollon for
heora modignysse ongean þone ælmihtigan god.
 36. And hi wurdon awende to awyrigedum deoflum, forðam þe hi
noldon habban heora scyppend him to hlaforde.
 38. Ac wolde se fyrmysta him sylf beon god.
 39. Ða ne mihte he wunian on þære micclan mærðe, ne eac
his gegadan, butan godes mihte, ac wurdon þa asyndrode fram þam soðum
gode, forþam ðe hi forleton his hlafordscipe ealle swyðe unwislice, fram
him ascyrede, mid andan afyllede and mid orwennysse ælcere miltsunge,
manfulle gastas.
 46. And ælc þæra yfela, ðe oð ðis becom, eall hit
gewyrð æfre þurh þa awyrgedan gastas and þurh þa yfelan menn, þe
hi magon forlæran to ðam yfelan willan, þe hi on wuniað.
 50. Nu sæde ic ðe ær þis on þam ærrum gewritum, hu
se ælmihtiga drihten ealle þing gesceop, heofonas and eorðan and ealne
middaneard, þone widgyllan garsecg and þa wundorlican nywelnyssa, and
syððan þa twegen men on sawle and on lichaman, Adam and Evan to his
anlicnysse, and hu se deofol beswac syððan eft þa men, þæt hi godes
bebod tobræcon þurh his lare, and wurdon ða deadlice and fordemde to
helle and eall heora ofspring to ðam ecum witum.
 60. Ac se mildheorta fæder, þe us to mannum gesceop þurh his
ancennedan sunu sende us alysednysse, swa þæt se sunu wearð soðlice
acenned to menniscum men of Marian innoðe, þæs halgan mædenes, butan
weres gemanan.
 65. And he us alysde of ðam laðan þeowte and fram þæs
deofles anwealde mid his agenum deaðe, on rode ahangen unsynnig for us.
 68. He wearð ða bebyrged on ðam ylcan dæge, and he aras of
deaðe on þam þriddan dæge gewunnenum sige on þam wælhreowan
deofle.
 71. And he him of anam his agen handgeweorc Adam and Evan and eall,
þæt he wolde of heora cynne, þe him gecweme wæron.
 74. And he astah to heofonum to his halgan fæder mid þære
menniscnysse, þe he of Marian genam, and sitt nu on heofonum soðlice an
Crist æt his fæder swyðran and ealra gesceafta gewylt, and cymð eft
to demenne on þam micclan dæge eallum mancynne, ælcum be his dædum.
 80. And we ealle cumað cuce him togeanes of urum deaðe
arærde þurh his drihtenlican mihte, ælc mann, þe ær cucu wæs on
his modor innoðe, þæt ure ælc þær onfo edlean æt gode, swa
god, swa yfel, beþam ðe we geearnodon.
 85. Nu wast ðu eall þis, and we wyllað þe secgan sum
þæra lara, þe se leofa hælend, her on ðysum life lybbende mid
mannum, tæhte his folgerum, þe him filigdon on life, swa swa he sylf
sæde on his halgum godspelle: <foreign>Esto consentiens adversario tuo cito, dum es
in via cum illo, et reliqua</foreign>; ðæt is on Engliscre spræce: Beo ðu
eornostlice swyðe gebeogul mid gebygedum mode þinum wiðerwinnan, þonne
þu on wege byst mid him, þelæs þe þin wiðerwinna, gif ðu
wiðerast wið hine, þe mid yrre betæce þam egefullan deman, and se
dema þe betæce his underþeoddum, and his underðeodda þen þe
gebringe on cwearterne.
 99. Soð ic ðe secge: Ne scealt ðu of ðam cwearterne,
ærðan þe ðu forgelde þone endenextan feorðling.
 101. Her syndon egeslice word us eallum to gehyrenne, and
samlæredum mannum swyðe deoplice word.
 103. Ac Augustinus se wisa us onwreah þas deopnysse, se þe
wæs swa wis on godes wisdome, þæt he gesette þurh his sylfes diht an
þusend boca be ðam soðan geleafan and be ðam cristendome, swa swa Crist
him onwreah on his bisceophade binnan Affrican scire.
 109. And þa bec syððan sume becomon to us, and geond ealle
þas woruld hi synd tosawene, godes þeowum to lare and to geleafan
trymminge.
 112. Se hælend cwæð eft on oðrum godspelle to his twelf
folgerum, þe him folgodon on life: <foreign>quod autem vobis dico, omnibus dico</foreign>:
ðæt, þæt ic eow secge, þæt ic secge eallum mannum, forþan ðe
he lærde hi, and hi lærdon oðre forð oð þæt hit becom to us
endenextum mannum, and Cristes bebodu syndon eallum mannum gesette.
 119. Gehyre hi se ðe wylle habban þæt ece lif.
 120. Ure wiðerwinna is witodlice se deofol, þe embe us swicað
mid his searacræftum, þæt he us fordo and us drihtne ætbrede.
 123. Ac us ne het na se hælend him beon gebeogole, ne him
gehyrsumian us to forwyrde.
 126. Is nu oðer wiðerwinna, ðe us wyle gerihtlæcan fram
urum unðeawum, and him we sceolon gehyrsumian: þæt is godes word, þe
us gewissian sceal, and þæt word winð on us, swa swa wis læce deð,
þe mid stiðum læcecræfte gelacnað þone untruman.
 130. And swa swa god lareow lærð his cnapan georne and
tæcð him gode þeawas to godes gesetnyssum, swa deð þæt halige
word, þe us forbyt unriht and is swyðe stið urum stuntnyssum, and
þincð us hefigtyme, þæt we him gehyrsumion.
 135. Hwæt gewilnað þes wiðerwinna, þe wyle, þæt
þu beo wið hine geþwære, buton þines sylfes hæle?
 137. Ðæt halige godes word is witodlice þin freond, and þu
wyrcst þe sylfne þe to wiðerwinnan, ðu dest yfele þe sylfum, þæt
þu forsyhst godes word.
 140. Ðu lufast druncennysse and dwollice leofast, swylce þe
togamenes, ac godes wisdom þe segð: Hwam becymð wawa, hwam witodlice
sacu, oððe hwa byð bepæht, oððe hwam becumað wunda oððe
eagena blindnyss: buton þam unðeawfæstum, ðe wodlice drincað and
heora gewitt amyrrað, swa þæt hi dwæsiað for heora druncennyssum.
 147. Eac ure hælend on his halgan godspelle forbead þa
druncennysse his discipulum, and eac us þurh hi, swa swa we sædon ær,
and þa egeslican oferfylle, þe he onscunað þearle.
 151. Ac se byð healic wita, þe wat his gemet, and god læce
him sylfum, þe leofað gemetlice, forðam þe se lichama losað þurh
ða oferfille and eac swylce seo sawul, swa swa us secgað bec.
 155. Godes word þe forbyt, þæt þu ne beo forliger, ne
þin æwe ne brece, þæt þu ne beo gescynd, ac leofa þin lif, gif
ðu læwede mann sy on rihtum sinscipe mid rædfæstum mode, and se ðe
gehadod sy, hogie he embe þæt, þæt he godes þenunga gedo mid
clænnysse.
 161. Ðæt halige godes word þe forbyt ælc facn and þa
yfelan gitsunge, ðe ælc unriht of cymð.
 163. And þu wylt beswican and besyrwian oðerne and þe sylfne
forswerian?
 164. Ac ðe segð god þus:<foreign>Qui enim diligit iniquitatem, odit
animam suam</foreign>: Se ðe lufað unrihtwisnysse, he hatað his sawle.
 167. Nu to dæg þu beswicst sumne oðerne mann, and to merigen
beswicð sum oðer man ðe: þonne synd gyt begen beswicene for gode.
 170. Ac inc bam wære betere, gif gyt woldon, þæt incer
ægðer fylste oðrum to rihte, þæt gyt begen wæron butan swicdome
and eowre æhta hæfdon and eac eowre sawla.
 174. Ne lufast þu na godes word, gif ðu ne lufast þe sylfne.
 175. Ne ðu ne miht naht eaðe oðerne mann lufian, gif ðu
þe sylfne ne lufast, ne oðrum men styran, gif ðu þe sylfum ne styrst.
 178. Godes lar bebyt us, þæt we lufion ure nextan, and
þæt we eac styron þam stuntum mannum.
 180. Ac we sceolon lufian æfter godes lare ærest ure sawle
and us sylfum styran, forþam þe sume wyllað witnian stiðlice þa
læssan gyltas on heora underþeoddum and nellað witnian mid nanre wrace
þa maran synna on him sylfum nateshwon.
 186. Sume witniað þeofas and wyrcað him sylfe reaflac, swylce
drihten onscunige ða dyrnan stala and na þæt opene reaflac, þonne he
ægðer forbyt.
 189. Yrre and anda us synd forbodene, manslyht and morðdæda
and ealle manlice þing þurh þæt halige godes word, þe is ure
wiðerwinna her on ðysum life, and þis lif is se weg, on þam þe we
sceolon geþwærlæcan wið þæt word þa hwile, þe we magon and
moton us gerihtlæcan, forþan ðe we ne magon, þonne se weg byð
geendod, æfter urum deaðe aht to gode gedon, ne þonne us gebygan to
godes bebodum, gif we ær forsawon his gesetnyssa on life.
 199. Ðonne þes weg byð geendod, þe we nu on lybbað, ne
byð nan oðer weg us to lafe syððan, on ðam þe we magon ure
misdæda gebetan, ac andbidað se dema, þe ure dæda asmeað, and
betæcð þa unrihtwisan þam unmildheortan witnere, and se witnere hi
gebrincð on þam blindan cwearterne þære hellican susle betwux þam
sweartum deoflum, þær hi magon behreowsian on ðam reðum witum heora
yfelan dæda.
 207. Ac þær ne byð nan dædbot, ne nan liðe miltsung
þam manfullum næfre.
 209. Lybbe we leng her on life, libbe we læssan hwile, æfre
us færþ mid se foresæda wiðerwinna, þam we sceolon abugan to ure
beterunge, and he ne abyhð na us, þæt he us ne forbeode ealle
unrihtwisnyssa and yfel to donne.
 214. Þonne byð us micel sceamu, gif we ne magon
geþwærlæcan on swa langsumere tide wið swylcne wiðerwinnan.
 216. Ne sceole we hine forseon, forþan ðe ure drihten sæde:
Se þe me forsyhð and mine word ne underfehð, he hæfð witodlice, hwa
him deman sceal: Min word, þe ic secge, sceal hine fordeman.
 220. We sceolon for ði deman for ures drihtnes lufon æfre
mildheortlice þam mannum, þe we sceolon her on life wissian, butan
wælhreownysse, forþan ðe us byð swa gedemed, swa swa we demað
oðrum.
 224. We ne magon mid slæwðe, ne þurh asolcennysse þa ecan
myrhðe mid gode geearnian, swa swa Salomon, se snotera cyning, cwæð:
<foreign>Propter frigus piger arare noluit; Mendicabit aestate, et non dabitur ei</foreign>: For
ðæs wintres cyle nolde se asolcena erigan; He bedecað eft on sumera, and
him ne byð na getiðod.
 231. Ðæt is on gastlicum andgite, se ðe godes bebodu nele nu
gefyllan, swa swa he fyrmest mæg, and to weorce awendan, þæt him byð
forwyrned eft þære ecan myrhðe, forþam ðe he hi geearnian nolde.
 235. He cwæð be ðam ylcan on oþre stowe: <foreign>Dormitatio
vestietur pannis</foreign>: Seo slapolnys byð soðlice gescrydd mid wacum
tætticum, forþan ðe he wyrðe byð, þæt he lytle mede hæbbe se
ðe leofað on asolcennysse.
 240. Be ðam ylcan sæde se soða hælend on his halgan
godspelle and het us cuman to him: <foreign>Venite ad me omnes, qui laboratis et
onerati estis, et ego reficiam vos</foreign>: Cumað endemes to me ge ealle, þe
swincað and ge, ðe synd gehefegode, and ic eow gereordige.
 246. Forðam ðe we sceolon mid geswince geearnian, þæt we
moton becuman to his gereordunge, swa swa he eallum þam behet, þe hine
lufiað.
 249. Wegað min geoc nu on eowrum swurum and leorniað æt me,
þæt ic liðe eom and eadmod on heortan, and ge soðlice gemetað eowrum
sawlum reste.
 252. Ðis sæde drihten.
 253. Ne het se leofa drihten us leornian to wyrcenne oðerne
middaneard, ne ða micclan wundru, þe he worhte on life on alefedum mannum,
ne ða deadan to arærenne, þæt þæt we don ne magon, ac het us
beon liðe on ures lifes þeawum and eadmode on heortan æfter his
gebysnunge.
 259. Gif þu mycel wylle beon and mærlice geþogen, þonne
most ðu hit onginnan on þære eadmodnysse.
 261. Gif ðu þencst to wyrcenne stænen weorc mid cræfte,
þonne scealt þu ærest embe þone grundweal smeagan, þæt is,
þæt ðu gelogie þin lif 

END_TEXT

ÆGram
B1.9.1.
Grammar: Zupitza 1880, 1-296.



 2.13. Ic ælfric wolde þas lytlan boc awendan to engliscum
gereorde of ðam stæfcræfte, þe is gehaten <foreign>GRAMMATICA</foreign>, syððan ic
ða twa bec awende on hundeahtatigum spellum, forðan ðe stæfcræft is
seo cæg, ðe ðæra boca andgit unlicð; and ic þohte, þæt
ðeos boc mihte fremian iungum cildum to anginne þæs cræftes,
oððæt hi to maran andgyte becumon.
 2.19. Ælcum men gebyrað, þe ænigne godne cræft
hæfð, þæt he ðone do nytne oðrum mannum and befæste þæt
pund, þe him god befæste, sumum oðrum men, þæt godes feoh ne
ætlicge and he beo lyðre þeowa gehaten and beo gebunden and geworpen
into ðeostrum, swaswa þæt halige godspel segð.
 2.24. Iungum mannum gedafenað, þæt hi leornion sumne wisdom
and ðam ealdum gedafenað, þæt hi tæcon sum gerad heora iunglingum,
forðan ðe ðurh lare byð se geleafa gehealden.
 3.2. And ælc man, ðe wisdom lufað, byð gesælig, and, se
ðe naðor nele ne leornian ne tæcan, gif he mæg, þonne acolað his
andgyt fram ðære halgan lare, and he gewit swa lytlum and lytlum fram
gode.
 3.6. Hwanon sceolon cuman wise lareowas on godes folce, buton hi on
iugoðe leornion?
 3.8. And hu mæg se geleafa beon forðgenge, gif seo lar and
ða lareowas ateoriað?
 3.9. Is nu for ði godes þeowum and mynstermannum georne to
warnigenne, þæt seo halige lar on urum dagum ne acolige oððe ateorige,
swaswa hit wæs gedon on Angelcynne nu for anum feawum gearum, swa þæt
nan englisc preost ne cuðe dihtan oððe asmeagean anne pistol on leden,
oðþæt Dunstan arcebisceop and Aðelwold bisceop eft þa lare on
munuclifum arærdon.
 3.16. Ne cweðe ic na for ði, þæt ðeos boc mæge
micclum to lare fremian, ac heo byð swa ðeah sum angyn to ægðrum
gereorde, gif heo hwam licað.
 3.20. Ic bidde nu on godes naman, gyf hwa ðas boc awritan wylle,
þæt he hi gerihte wel be ðære bysne; forðan ðe ic nah geweald,
þeah hi hwa to woge gebringe þurh lease writeras, and hit bið ðonne his
pleoh, na min.
 3.24. Micel yfel deð se unwritere, gyf he nele his woh gerihtan.
 4.3. <foreign>SECVNDVM DONATVM OMNIS VOX AVT ARTICVLATA EST AVT CONFVSA</foreign>.
 4.5. <foreign>ARTICVLATA EST, QVAE LITTERIS CONPREHENDI POTEST; CONFVSA,
QVAE SCRIBI NON POTEST</foreign>; stemn is geslagen lyft gefredendlic on hlyste, swa
micel swa on ðære heorcnunge is.
 4.7. Ic secge nu gewislicor, þæt ælc stemn byð geworden
of ðæs muðes clypunge and of ðære lyfte cnyssunge.
 4.9. Se muð drifð ut ða clypunge, and seo lyft byð geslagen
mid ðære clypunge and gewyrð to stemne.
 4.11. Ælc stemn is oððe andgytfullic oððe gemenged.
 4.11. Andgytfullic stemn is, þe mid andgyte bið geclypod,
swaswa ys <foreign>arma uirumque cano</foreign> ic herige þa wæpnu and ðone wer.
 4.14. Gemenged stemn is, þe bið butan andgyte, swylc swa is
hryðera gehlow and horsa hnægung, hunda gebeorc, treowa brastlung <foreign>ET
CETERA</foreign>.
 4.17. <foreign>DE LITTERA</foreign>.
 4.18. <foreign>LITTERA</foreign> is stæf on englisc and is se læsta dæl on
bocum and untodæledlic.
 4.19. We todælað þa boc to cwydum and syððan ða cwydas
to dælum, eft ða dælas to stæfgefegum and syððan þa
stæfgefegu to stafum: þonne beoð ða stafas untodæledlice; forðan
ðe nan stæf ne byð naht, gif he gæð on twa.
 5.4. Ælc stæf hæfð þreo ðing: <foreign>NOMEN, FIGVRA,
POTESTAS</foreign>, þæt is, nama and hiw and miht.
 5.6. Nama, hu he gehaten byð: <foreign>a, b, c</foreign>.
 5.6. Hiw, hu he gesceapen byð.
 5.7. Miht, hwæt he mæge betwux oðrum stafum.
 5.7. Soðlice on ledenspræce synd þreo and twentig stafa: <foreign>a,
b, c, d, e, f, g, h, i, k, l, m, n, o, p, q, r, s, t, u, x, y, z</foreign>.
 5.10. Of ðam syndon fif <foreign>VOCALES</foreign>, þæt synd clypiendlice:
<foreign>a, e, i, o, u</foreign>.
 5.11. Ðas fif stafas æteowiað heora naman þurh hi sylfe
and butan ðam stafum ne mæg nan word beon awriten, and for ði hi synd
<foreign>QVINQVE VOCALES</foreign> gehatene.
 5.14. To ðisum is genumen se grecisca <foreign>y</foreign> for intingan
greciscra/ namena, and se ylca <foreign>y</foreign> is on engliscum gereorde swiðe
gewunelic.
 5.16. Ealle ða oðre stafas syndon gehatene <foreign>CONSONANTES</foreign>,
þæt is, samod swegende; forðan ðe hi swegaþ mid ðam fif
clypiendlicum.
 5.18. Ðonne beoð gyt of þam samod swegendum sume
<foreign>SEMIVOCALES</foreign>, þæt synd healfclypiende; sume syndon <foreign>MVTAE</foreign>, þæt synd
dumbe.
 6.1. <foreign>SEMIVOCALES</foreign> syndon seofan: <foreign>f, l, m, n, r, s, x</foreign>.
 6.1. Þas syndon healfclypiende gecigede, forðan ðe hi
nabbað fulle clypunge, swaswa ða <foreign>QUINQUE VOCALES</foreign>.
 6.3. And þa syx ongynnað of ðam stæfe <foreign>e</foreign> and geendiað
on/ him sylfum.

tæcinge.

þæt synd dumbe.
 6.7. Hi ne synd na mid ealle dumbe, ac hi habbað lytle clypunge.

clypiendlicum stafum.
 6.10. <foreign>b, c, d, g, p, t</foreign> geendiað on <foreign>e</foreign>.
 6.10. <foreign>h</foreign> and <foreign>k</foreign> geendiað on <foreign>a</foreign> æfter rihte.
 6.11. <foreign>q</foreign> geendað on <foreign>u</foreign>.
 6.11. <foreign>z</foreign> eac, se grecisca stæf, geendað on <foreign>a</foreign>.

greciscum wordum.

togædere gesette oððe mid oðrum swegendlicum.

 18.1. Witodlice ealle ða naman, þe of oðrum namum cumað,

 18.4. <foreign>DE GENERIBVS</foreign>.
 18.5. Æfter gecynde syndon twa cyn on namum, <foreign>MASCVLINVM</foreign> and
<foreign>FEMININVM</foreign>, þæt is, werlic and wiflic.
 18.6. Werlic cyn byð <foreign>hic uir</foreign> þes wer, wiflic <foreign>haec femina</foreign>
þis wif.
 18.8. Þas twa cyn synd gecyndelice on mannum and on nytenum.
 18.10. Nu ys gecweden æfter cræfte gemæne cyn, þæt
is, ægðer ge werlic ge wiflic: <foreign>hic et haec diues</foreign> ðes and þeos
welega: ægðer byð welig ge wer ge wif; <foreign>hic et haec heres</foreign> þes and
þeos yrfenuma; <foreign>ET CETERA</foreign>.
 18.14. <foreign>NEVTRVM</foreign> is naðor cynn, ne werlices ne wiflices, on
cræftspræce, ac hit byð swa ðeah oft on andgyte, swaswa ys <foreign>hoc
mancipium</foreign> ðes weal, <foreign>hoc animal</foreign> þis nyten: ælc nyten byð oððe he
oððe heo.
 18.17. Ac swa ðeah ðis cyn gebyrað oftost to naðrum cynne,
swaswa ys <foreign>hoc uerbum</foreign> þis word, <foreign>hoc lumen</foreign> þis leoht.
 18.19. Ys eac to witenne, þæt hi beoð oft oðres cynnes on
leden and oðres cynnes on englisc.
 18.21. We cweðað on ledyn <foreign>hic liber</foreign> and on englisc þeos
boc; eft on leden <foreign>haec mulier</foreign> and on englisc ðis wif, na ðeos; eft on
leden <foreign>hoc iudicium</foreign> and on englisc ðes dom, na ðis.

and oðre on menigfealdum, swaswa ys <foreign>hoc iugerum</foreign> þes æcer: se nama ys

declinunge on menigfealdum getele; <foreign>hoc uas</foreign> þis fæt ys ðære
þriddan declinunge on anfealdum getele and ðære oðre on menigfealdum.
 87.6. <foreign>DE FIGURA.  FIGVRA</foreign> is hiw on namum and on oðrum dælum
and æfter <foreign>DONATVM,</foreign> þam lareowe, synd twa <foreign>FIGVRA: SIMPLEX,</foreign> þæt is,
anfeald <foreign>ET COMPOSITA,</foreign> þæt is, gefeged.
 87.9. Anfeald hiw is <foreign>decens</foreign> geðæslic oððe arwurðe,
<foreign>potens</foreign> mihtig.
 87.11. Gefeged hiw byð, þæt ðe byð of twam dælum

 108.15. <foreign>DE NVMERO</foreign>.

 109.1. Sume beoð ægðres cynnes: <foreign>haec ancilla</foreign> þeos wyln

 109.11. Hig habbað eac ealle twegen hadas and twa cynn: an had

 110.3. <foreign>suus</foreign> his is ægðres geteles ge anfealdes ge

 110.13. <foreign>DE CASU.</foreign>  ða <foreign>PRONOMINA,</foreign> þe habbað <foreign>VOCATIVVM,</foreign>
þa habbað syx CASVS and ða oðre ealle nabbað, buton fif

 111.7. <foreign>nostras</foreign> ures landes man, <foreign>uestras</foreign> eowres landes mann

 111.10. Ane nigon naman synt, ðe habbað þa ylcan declinunga,
þe <foreign>PRONOMINA</foreign> habbað, and for ði wæron sume boceras swa bepæhte,

 111.16. Gif seo <foreign>DECLINATIO,</foreign> þæt is, declinung, sceal

 112.2. Þas nigon naman, þe we embe sprecað, sind
<foreign>APPELLATIVA,</foreign> þæt sind gecigendlice.
 112.4. <foreign>PROPRIVM NOMEN</foreign> is agen nama and <foreign>APPELLATIVVM</foreign> byð

 112.10. <foreign>quis</foreign> hwa is werlic had; <foreign>quae</foreign> hwylc is wiflic; <foreign>quod</foreign>

 113.2. Þes nama hæfð twyfealdne <foreign>NOMINATIVVM: quis</foreign> and

 113.5. <foreign>GENERIS FEMININI quae</foreign> hwylc, <foreign>cuius</foreign> hwylcere, <foreign>cui, quam,
a qua VEL a qui; ET PLVRALITER quae</foreign> hwylce, <foreign>quarum</foreign> hwylcera, <foreign>quis VEL
quibus, quas, a quis VEL a quibus,</foreign> ac se <foreign>quibus</foreign> ys gewunelicor, forðan
ðe <foreign>quis</foreign> is ðam oðrum gelic.
 113.9. <foreign>GENERIS NEVTRI quod VEL quid</foreign> hwylc oððe þæt,
<foreign>cuius</foreign> ðæs oððe hwylces, <foreign>cui, quod, a quo VEL a qui; ET PLVRALITER
quae</foreign> hwylce oððe ða, <foreign>quorum, quis VEL quibus, quae, a quis VEL a
quibus</foreign>.
 113.13. Hit is to witenne, þæt ðas naman habbað mislic
andgyt, be ðam ðe hi gesette beoð.
 113.14. Gif ic cweðe: <foreign>quis hoc fecit?</foreign> hwa dyde ðis?
 113.15. Þonne byð se <foreign>quis INTERROGATIVVM,</foreign> þæt is,
axigendlic.
 113.16. Gif ic cweðe: <foreign>nescio, quis hoc fecit</foreign> nat ic, hwa ðis
dyde, þonne byð se <foreign>quis INFINITIVVM,</foreign> þæt is, ungeendigendlic.
 113.18. Gif ic cweðe: <foreign>tu scis, quis hoc fecit</foreign> þu wast, hwa
ðis dyde, þonne byð se <foreign>quis RELATIVVM,</foreign> þæt ys, edlesendlic.
 113.20. Of ðisum beoð gefegede <foreign>quisque</foreign> gehwa, <foreign>quaeque,
quodque</foreign> gehwylc.
 114.2. Heora ealra <foreign>GENITIVVS</foreign> ys <foreign>cuiusque; cuique</foreign> and swa
forð, swa þa oðre.

 114.5. Eft <foreign>quisquam, quaequam, quodquam</foreign> ænig.

 115.1. <foreign>Solus sola, solum</foreign> ana and heora ealra <foreign>solius</foreign> anes;

 115.3. <foreign>Totus, tota, totum</foreign> eal; <foreign>totius</foreign> ealles; <foreign>toti</foreign> eallum;

 115.7. <foreign>Vter, utra, utrum</foreign> heora oðer oððe uncer oðer;

 115.9. Ealswa gæð of ðisum gefeged <foreign>uterque</foreign> heora

 115.13. <foreign>neuter</foreign> naðor, <foreign>neutri</foreign> naðres, <foreign>neutro</foreign> naðrum;

 115.16. And ealle þas habbað langne <foreign>i</foreign> on <foreign>GENITIVO,</foreign> ac he
byð swa ðeah on leoþcræfte ægðer ge lang ge scort, buton <foreign>alius:</foreign>

 115.19. <foreign>Alter, altera, alterum</foreign> oðer and heora ealra <foreign>alterius</foreign>
oðres: on ðisum byð se <foreign>i</foreign> æfre scort; <foreign>alteri</foreign> oðrum; <foreign>ET CETERA</foreign>.
 116.2. Of ðisum ys gefeged <foreign>alteruter, alterutra, alterutrum</foreign>
heora ægðer.
 116.3. Heora ealra <foreign>GENITIVVS alterutrius</foreign> and <foreign>DATIVVS alterutri
ET CETERA</foreign>.
 116.5. Gyt syndon sume naman, þe wæron unrihtlice getealde
betwux/ naman speliendum, forðan ðe naman speliend ne mæg habban þa
getacnunga/, ðe hi habbað.
 116.7. An þara ys <foreign>qualis</foreign> and <foreign>quale</foreign> hwylc, þæt
getacnað þreo ðingc: <foreign>INTERROGATIONEM,</foreign> þæt is, axunge and
<foreign>INFINITIONEM</foreign> endeleasnysse <foreign>ET RELATIONEM</foreign> and edlesunge.
 116.10. Gif ic cweðe: <foreign>qualis est rex?</foreign> hwylc ys se cyning?
 116.11. Þonne byð he <foreign>INTERROGATIVVM,</foreign> þæt is, axiendlic.
 116.12. Gif ic cweðe: <foreign>nescio, qualis est rex</foreign> nat ic, hwylc se

 116.15. Gif ic cweðe: <foreign>tu scis bene, qualis est</foreign> þu wast wel,
hwylc he is, ðonne byð hit <foreign>RELATIVVM,</foreign> þæt ys, edlesendlic.
 116.17. <foreign>talis</foreign> and <foreign>tale</foreign> swylc andwyrd þam oðrum.
 117.1. Þu cwyst: <foreign>qualis est ille?</foreign> hwylc ys he?
 117.1. Ic cweþe: <foreign>talis est</foreign> swylc he is.
 117.2. Þas twegen naman gað æfter ðære ðriddan
declinunge, þe maciað heora <foreign>ABLATIVVM</foreign> on <foreign>i</foreign>.
 117.4. Eft <foreign>quantus</foreign> hu micel getacnað þreo ðing: axunge and
endeleasnesse and edlesunge.
 117.5. Him andwyrt <foreign>tantus</foreign> swa mycel; and hi begen synd <foreign>MOBILIA</foreign>
æfter þære oðre declinunge.
 117.7. Eft <foreign>quot</foreign> hu fela getacnað ðreo ðing.
 117.7. Him andwyrt <foreign>tot</foreign> swa fela.
 117.8. Ðas twegen naman synd ðreora cynna.
 117.9. We cweþað: <foreign>quot homines?</foreign> hu fela manna?
 117.10. <foreign>quot litterae?</foreign> hu fela stafa?
 117.10. <foreign>quot uerba?</foreign> hu fela worda?
 117.11. <foreign>tot libri</foreign> swa fela boca; <foreign>tot paginae</foreign> swa fela trameta;
<foreign>tot folia</foreign> swa fela leafa; and hi synd undecliniendlice, ac hi andwyrdað swa
ðeah eallum casum: <foreign>hi quot, horum quot; hi tot, horum tot</foreign>.
 117.14. Of ðisum beoð gefegede <foreign>quotus</foreign> and <foreign>totus,</foreign> þa
gebyriað swyðost to endebyrdnysse.
 117.16. <foreign>quotus es in ordine monachorum?</foreign> hwylcere endebyrdnysse
eart ðu betwux munecum?
 118.1. Ic cweþe <foreign>secundus</foreign> se oþer <foreign>VEL tertius</foreign> oððe se
ðridda.
 118.2. Him geandwyrt <foreign>totus: totus sum</foreign> swylcere endebyrdnysse ic
eom.
 118.3. Hi syndon <foreign>MOBILIA</foreign> æfter þære oðre declinunge.
 118.5. Of ðam naman <foreign>quis</foreign> cumað ðreo <foreign>GENITIVI</foreign> æfter
ealdre spræce: <foreign>cuius MASCVLINVM, cuia FEMININVM, cuium NEVTRVM</foreign>.
 118.7. Ac we ne gymað na swiðe on ðisum dagum þissera
<foreign>GENITIVO,</foreign> ac brucað þæs anes on ælcum cynne.
 118.8. <foreign>cuius hominis</foreign> hwylces mannes oððe ðæs mannes,
<foreign>cuius feminae, cuius animalis</foreign>.
 118.10. Eac buton þison cwædon ða ealdan: <foreign>hic et haec cuias
et hoc cuiate, huius cuiatis</foreign>.
 118.11. Þæt byð þus on ledenspræce: <foreign>cuias es?</foreign>
hwylcere þeode eart þu?
 118.13. <foreign>uestras sum</foreign> eowre þeode ic eom oþþe eower landes
man; swaswa cwæþ se ealda <foreign>PLAVTVS: quid est? cuiates estis aut quo ex
oppido?</foreign> hwæt is la? hwylcere þeode sind ge oððe of hwylcum
fæstene?
 118.18. Is eac to witenne, þæt <foreign>ullus</foreign> and <foreign>nullus, nemo</foreign> and
<foreign>ambo</foreign> ne nan þæra namena, þe andwyrt ne byð on spræce, næfð
nanne <foreign>VOCATIVVM</foreign>.
 118.20. Eft <foreign>alter</foreign> and <foreign>uter</foreign> ne nan þæra, þe gæð on
twa, næfð nænne <foreign>VOCATIVVM,</foreign> forðan ðe se <foreign>VOCATIVVS,</foreign> þæt ys,
seo clypiendlice gebigednys, wyle beon æfre to andweardum menn geclypod and
to anum hade.
 119.5. <foreign>INCIPIT DE VERBO</foreign>.
 119.6. <foreign>VERBVM EST PARS ORATIONIS CVM TEMPORE ET PERSONA SINE CASV
AVT AGERE ALIQVID AVT PATI AVT NEVTRVM SIGNIFICANS, VERBVM</foreign> ys word, an dæl
ledenspræce mid tide and hade butan case getacniende oððe sum ðing to
donne oððe sum ðing to þrowigenne oððe naðor.
 119.11. <foreign>VERBVM HABET SEPTEM ACCIDENTIA</foreign> word hæfð seofon
gelimplice ðing.
 119.12. Him gelimpð <foreign>SIGNIFICATIO,</foreign> þæt ys, getacnung,
hwæt þæt word getacnige, dæde oððe þrowunge oððe naðor;
<foreign>TEMPVS</foreign> tid, <foreign>MODVS</foreign> gemet, <foreign>SPECIES</foreign> hiw, <foreign>FIGVRA</foreign> gefegednyss, <foreign>CONIVGATIO</foreign>
geþeodnyss, <foreign>PERSONA</foreign> had, <foreign>NVMERVS</foreign> getel.
 119.16. We wyllað nu secgan endebyrdlice and gewislice be eallum
þisum.
 120.1. <foreign>SIGNIFICATIO</foreign> ys getacnung, hwæt þæt word
getacnige.
 120.2. Ælc fulfremed word geendað on <foreign>o</foreign> oððe on <foreign>or</foreign>.
 120.3. On <foreign>o</foreign> geendiað <foreign>ACTIVA VERBA,</foreign> þæt synd dædlice
word, þa ðe geswuteliað, hwæt men doð.
 120.4. <foreign>amo</foreign> ic lufige geswutelað min weorc; ealswa <foreign>doceo</foreign> ic
tæce, <foreign>lego</foreign> ic ræde, <foreign>audio</foreign> ic gehyre: on eallum þisum wordum ys min
weorc geswutelod.
 120.7. Þas and ðyllice synd <foreign>ACTIVA</foreign> gehatene, þæt synd
dædlice, forðan ðe hi geswuteliað dæda: do ænne <foreign>r</foreign> to ðisum
wordum, þonne beoð hi <foreign>PASSIVA,</foreign> þæt synd ðrowiendlice; na swylce hi
æfre pinunge getacnion, ac, þonne oðres mannes dæd befylð on me
oððe on ðe, þonne byþ þæt on ledenspræce <foreign>PASSIVVM VERBVM</foreign>.
 120.13. Ic cweðe nu: <foreign>amo</foreign> ic lufige, þonne cwyst ðu: <foreign>quem
amas?</foreign> hwæne lufast ðu?
 120.14. Ic cweþe: <foreign>te amo</foreign> þe ic lufige; þonne befylð min
lufu on ðe, and ðu miht cweðan: <foreign>amor a te</foreign> ic eom gelufod fram ðe.
 120.16. <foreign>doceo te</foreign> ic tæce ðe, and ðu cwyst: <foreign>doceor a te</foreign>
ic eom gelæred fram ðe; <foreign>ET CETERA</foreign>.
 120.18. Nu synd þa word gehatene <foreign>ACTIVA,</foreign> þæt synd
dædlice, þa ðe geendiað on <foreign>o</foreign> and maciað of him sylfum <foreign>PASSIVA
VERBA,</foreign> þæt synd þrowiendlice word, gif se <foreign>r</foreign> byþ þærto genumen,
swaswa we nu sædon.
 121.3. Þa word, þe geendiað on <foreign>o</foreign> and ne magon æfter
andgyte beon <foreign>PASSIVA,</foreign> þa synd <foreign>NEVTRA</foreign> gehatene.
 121.5. Þæt is naðres cynnes: <foreign>uiuo</foreign> ic lybbe, <foreign>spiro</foreign> ic
orðige, <foreign>sto</foreign> ic stande, <foreign>ambulo</foreign> ic gange, <foreign>sedeo</foreign> ic sitte.
 121.7. Ne mæg her beon nan <foreign>PASSIVVM</foreign> on ðisum wordum,
forðan ðe heora getacnung ne befylð on nanum oðrum menn, buton on
ðam, ðe hit cwyð.
 121.9. Swa ðeah sume of ðisum neutrum maciað <foreign>PASSIVVM</foreign> on
ðam ðriddan hade, na to mannum, ac to oðrum ðingum.
 121.11. <foreign>aro</foreign> ic erige, <foreign>aras</foreign> þu erast, <foreign>arat</foreign> he erað.
 121.12. Ne cweð nan mann: ic eom geerod, ac on ðam ðriddan
hade ys gecweden: <foreign>aratur terra</foreign> þæt land ys geerod; <foreign>bibo</foreign> ic drince,
<foreign>bibitur uinum</foreign> þæt win ys gedruncen; <foreign>manduco</foreign> ic ete, <foreign>manducatur panis</foreign>
se hlaf is geeten; <foreign>laboro</foreign> ic swince, <foreign>laboratur uestis</foreign> þæt hrægl is
beswuncen: <foreign>ET CETERA</foreign>.
 121.18. Þa word, þe geendiað on <foreign>or,</foreign> habbaþ ðreo
getacnunga/.
 121.19. An ys ðrowiendlic, swaswa we ær sædon.
 121.19. Oþer ys <foreign>COMMVNE,</foreign> þæt ys, gemæne twegra
getacnunga, forþan þe on ðam worde byð ægðer ge dæd ge
ðrowung: <foreign>osculor te</foreign> ic cysse ðe <foreign>ET osculor a te</foreign> and ic eom fram ðe
cyssed; <foreign>complector te</foreign> ic ymbclyppe þe <foreign>ET complector a te</foreign> and ic eom fram
ðe ymbclypped.
 122.5. Þas word and ðyllice ne beoð na ledenword, gif se <foreign>r</foreign>
byð aweg gedon.
 122.7. Þa ðriddan getacnunge hæfð <foreign>DEPONENS VERBVM,</foreign>
þæt is, alecgende word, forðan ðe he legð him fram ða ane
getacnunge and hylt ða oþre.
 122.9. <foreign>DEPONENTIA VERBA SIGNIFICANT ACTVM</foreign> þa alecgendlican
word getacniað dæde, swaswa <foreign>ACTIVA,</foreign> ac hi geendiað on <foreign>or,</foreign> swaswa
<foreign>PASSIVA</foreign>.
 122.12. <foreign>luctor</foreign> ic wraxlige, <foreign>loquor</foreign> ic sprece: her is dæd on
ðissere getacnunge.
 122.13. Hi ne beoð na ledenword, gif se <foreign>r</foreign> byð awege.
 122.14. Ða word, þe synd <foreign>PASSIVA,</foreign> beoð <foreign>ACTIVA,</foreign> gif se <foreign>r</foreign>
byþ aweg gedon: <foreign>armor</foreign> ic eom gewæpnod, <foreign>armo te</foreign> ic wæpnige ðe <foreign>ET
CETERA</foreign>.
 122.16. Twa dædlice word synd, ðe habbað þwyrlice
getacnunge: þæt ðe geendað on <foreign>o,</foreign> getacnað þrowunge and, þæt
ðe geendað on <foreign>or,</foreign> getacnað dæde.
 123.1. <foreign>timeo</foreign> ic me ondræde, <foreign>metuo</foreign> ic me ondræde.
 123.2. Se ðe him ondræt, sumes ðinges he him ondræt.
 123.3. <foreign>timeo deum</foreign> ic me ondræde god.
 123.3. <foreign>timeor</foreign> ic eom ondræd, þæt is, þæt sumum men
stent ege fram me.
 123.5. <foreign>metuor a pueris nostris,</foreign> þæt is on andgyte, urum
cildum stent ege fram me.
 123.6. Ða word eac sume, þe synd <foreign>NEVTRA</foreign> gecwedene, habbað
þrowiendlice getacnunge, swaswa ys <foreign>uapulo</foreign> ic eom beswungen, <foreign>ueneo</foreign> ic eom
geseald; ac hi ne geendiað næfre on <foreign>or,</foreign> swa hwæðer swa hi
getacniað.
 123.11. <foreign>DE TEMPORE</foreign>.
 123.12. <foreign>TEMPVS ACCIDIT VERBO</foreign> tid gelimpð worde for getacnunge
mislicra dæda.
 123.13. Æfter gecynde synd þreo tida on ælcum worde, þe
fulfremed byð: <foreign>PRAESENS TEMPVS</foreign> ys andwerd tid: <foreign>sto</foreign> ic stande;
<foreign>PRAETERITVM TEMPVS</foreign> ys forðgewiten tid: <foreign>steti</foreign> ic stod; <foreign>FVTVRVM TEMPVS</foreign> is
towerd tid: <foreign>stabo</foreign> ic stande nu rihte oððe on sumne timan.
 124.1. Ac swa ðeah wise lareowas todældon þone <foreign>PRAETERITVM
TEMPVS,</foreign> þæt is, ðone forðgewitenan timan, on þreo: on <foreign>PRAETERITVM
INPERFECTVM,</foreign> þæt is unfulfremed forðgewiten, swilce þæt ðing beo
ongunnen and ne beo fuldon: <foreign>stabam</foreign> ic stod.
 124.5. <foreign>PRAETERITVM PERFECTVM</foreign> ys forðgewiten fulfremed: <foreign>steti</foreign>
ic stod fullice.
 124.7. <foreign>PRAETERITVM PLVSQVAMPERFECTVM</foreign> is forðgewiten mare,
þonne fulfremed, forðan ðe hit wæs gefyrn gedon: <foreign>steteram</foreign> ic stod
gefyrn.
 124.9. Forði is se forðgewitena tima on ðreo todæled,
forðan ðe naht ne byð swa gemyndelic on gecynde, swa þæt ys,
þæt gedon byð.
 124.12. <foreign>DE MODIS</foreign>.
 124.13. <foreign>MODVS</foreign> ys gemet oððe þære spræce wise, and
ðæra synd fif.
 124.14. <foreign>INDICATIVVS</foreign> ys gebicniendlic: mid ðam we geswuteliað,
hwæt we doð oððe oðre menn.
 124.15. Ic cweðe nu: <foreign>lego</foreign> ic ræde; þær bið min
dæd geswutelod.
 124.16. And ðis <foreign>MODVS</foreign> ys fulfremed on eallum tidum and on
eallum hadum and ys forði fyrmest.
 125.1. Þæt oðer <foreign>MODVS</foreign> ys <foreign>IMPERATIVVS,</foreign> þæt ys,
bebeodendlic: mid þam gemete we hatað oðre menn don sum ðing oððe
sum/ ðing þrowian.
 125.4. <foreign>lege</foreign> ræd ðu; <foreign>legat</foreign> ræde he; <foreign>flagella istum
puerum</foreign> beswing ðis cild; <foreign>flagelletur</foreign> sy he beswungen.
 125.5. Þis gemet sprecð forðwerd and næfð nanne
<foreign>PRAETERITVM,</foreign> forþan ðe nan man ne hæt don, þæt ðe gedon byð.
 125.7. He sprecð to oðrum and na to him sylfum; forþan ðe
gehwa hæt oðerne, na hyne sylfne.
 125.9. Þæt ðridde gemet ys <foreign>OPTATIVVS,</foreign> þæt ys,
gewiscendlic, and hit hæfð forðgewitenne timan and behofað oðres
wordes him to fultume, þæt he fulfremednysse hæbbe.
 125.12. <foreign>utinam amarem deum</foreign> eala gif ic lufode god, swylce ðu
cweðe: forgeafe god, þæt ic hine lufode.
 125.14. <foreign>utinam legerem nunc</foreign> eala gif ic rædde nu.
 125.15. <foreign>utinam legerem heri</foreign> eala gif ic rædde gyrstan dæg,
þonne cuðe ic hyt nu agyfan.
 125.16. <foreign>utinam legissem in iuuentute</foreign> eala gif ic rædde on
iugoðe, þonne cuðe ic nu sum god.
 125.18. <foreign>utinam</foreign> ys <foreign>ADVERBIVM,</foreign> þæt ys, wordes gefera, and he
fylst þisum gemete ðus.
 125.19. Þæt feorðe gemet ys <foreign>SVBIVNCTIVVS</foreign> oþþe
<foreign>CONIVNCTIVVS,</foreign> þæt ys, underðeodendlic, forðam ðe hyt is under
þam foresædum gemetum and behofað oþres wordes him to fultume.
 126.4. <foreign>cum legam</foreign> ðonne ic ræde.
 126.4. <foreign>cum legam, ueni ad me</foreign> ðonne ic ræde, cum to me.
 126.5. <foreign>cum doceam, discas</foreign> þonne ic tæce, þu leornast <foreign>ET
CETERA</foreign>.
 126.6. Þæt fifte gemet ys <foreign>INFINITIVVS,</foreign> þæt is,
ungeendigendlic, forðan ðe þær ne byð nan spræc geendod, buton
man ðar do to þreo ðing, þæt is, had and tid and getel.
 126.9. <foreign>amare</foreign> lufian: nys ðær nan gewis on ðære
spræce, buton ðu cweþe <foreign>amare uolo</foreign> ic wylle lufian.
 126.11. On ðam <foreign>uolo</foreign> ys se forma had and andweard tid and
anfeald getel.
 126.12. Þis gemet gæð geond ealle tida and ealle hadas and
ealle getel.
 126.14. <foreign>legere uis</foreign> þu wylt rædan ys se oðer had and
andweard tid and anfeald getel.
 126.15. <foreign>legere uolui</foreign> ic wolde rædan, <foreign>legere uoluistis</foreign> ge
woldon rædan sint forðgewitene tida; <foreign>ET CETERA</foreign>.
 126.17. Gyt ys an gemet gehaten <foreign>INPERSONALE,</foreign> þæt gæð
ofer ealle ða oþre fif on ðam ðriddan hade <foreign>PASSIVVM: amatur; amatur a
me</foreign> ic lufige; <foreign>legitur a me</foreign> ic ræde.
 127.2. Ac we nellað na mare be ðisum her sprecan.
 127.3. <foreign>DE PERSONIS</foreign>.
 127.4. <foreign>SVNT IGITVR PERSONAE VERBORVM TRES</foreign> þry hadas synt
worda.
 127.5. Se forma had ys, þe sprecð be him sylfum ana ðus:
<foreign>dico</foreign> ic secge, oððe mid oþrum mannum on menigfealdum getele: <foreign>dicimus</foreign>
we secgað.
 127.7. Se oðer had is, þe se forma sprecð to: <foreign>dicis</foreign> þu
segst, oþþe menigfealdlice <foreign>dicitis</foreign> ge secgað.
 127.9. Se þridda had ys, be þam ðe se forma had sprecð to
ðam oðrum hade: <foreign>dicit</foreign> he segð, oððe menigfealdlice <foreign>dicunt</foreign> hi
secgaþ.
 127.11. Se forma had and se oðer sprecað him betwynan and synd
andwerde and geendode, soþlice se þridda had nys na andweard ne geendod,
and forði he nymð him hwilon to fultume <foreign>PRONOMEN</foreign> naman speliend: <foreign>ille
dicit</foreign>.
 127.15. Ealle ðry hi magon eac him to genyman naman speliende:
<foreign>ego lego</foreign> ic ræde, <foreign>tu legis</foreign> þu rætst, <foreign>ille legit</foreign> he ræt.
 128.2. Naman soðlice beoð æfre on ðam ðriddan hade: <foreign>rex
equitat</foreign> se cyningc rit, <foreign>episcopus docet</foreign> se bisceop lærþ, and swa on
eallum casum, buton <foreign>VOCATIVVS,</foreign> se ðe byð æfre on ðam oðrum hade:
<foreign>o puer, lege</foreign> eala ðu cild, ræd.
 128.6. Eac se <foreign>NOMINATIVVS</foreign> mæg beon on ðam oðrum hade, gyf
ðær byð <foreign>PRONOMEN</foreign> betwux: <foreign>lego ego Priscianus</foreign> ic <foreign>PRISCIANVS</foreign>
ræde; <foreign>legis tu puer</foreign> þu cild rædst.
 128.8. Nama mæg beon eac on ðam forman hade on ðam worde,
ðe getacnað edwiste: <foreign>Priscianus sum</foreign> ic eom <foreign>PRISCIANVS,</foreign> and ealswa on
ðam wordum, ðe clypunge getacniað: <foreign>Priscianus uocor</foreign> ic eom geciged
<foreign>PRISCIANVS, Priscianus nominor</foreign> ic eom genemned <foreign>PRISCIANVS, Priscianus
nuncupor/</foreign> ic eom gehaten <foreign>PRISCIANVS</foreign>.
 128.14. Manega word synd, þe ne magon habban þa twegen forman
hadas, ac habbað þone þriddan: <foreign>tinnit</foreign> swegð, <foreign>pluit</foreign> hit rinþ,
<foreign>tonat</foreign> hit ðunrað, <foreign>fulminat</foreign> hit liht, <foreign>ningit</foreign> hit sniwð,
<foreign>grandinat</foreign> hit hagelað, <foreign>gelat</foreign> hit fryst.
 128.18. Ealswa be nytenum: <foreign>canis latrat</foreign> hund byrcð, <foreign>lupus
ululat</foreign> wulf ðytt, <foreign>equus hinnit</foreign> hors hnægð, <foreign>bos mugit</foreign> oxa hlewð,
<foreign>ouis balat</foreign> scep blæt, <foreign>sus grunnit</foreign> swin grunað <foreign>ET SIMILIA</foreign>.
 129.4. Þas word and ðyllice man mæg cweðan, gif man wyle,
ongean gecynde on eallum þrim hadum, ac hit byð swiðe dyslic, þæt se
man beorce oððe blæte.
 129.7. <foreign>DE NVMERO</foreign>.
 129.8. <foreign>NVMERVS ACCIDIT VERBIS VTERQVE, SINGVLARIS ET PLVRALIS</foreign>
getel gelimpð wordum ægðer ge anfeald ge menigfeald.
 129.10. Anfeald getel byð on anum: <foreign>lego</foreign> ic ræde, and

 129.13. <foreign>DE CONIVGATIONIBVS</foreign>.

 129.16. Naman habbað fif <foreign>DECLINATIONES,</foreign> and word habbað
feower <foreign>CONIVGATIONES</foreign>.
 130.2. <foreign>declinatio</foreign> mæg beon gecweden gebigednys, forðan ðe

 130.4. <foreign>CONIVGATIO</foreign> mæg beon gecweden geðeodnys, forðan ðe

 134.2. <foreign>INFINITIVO MODO</foreign> ungeendigendlicum gemete <foreign>NVMERIS ET

 139.16. <foreign>DE VERBO PASSIVO</foreign>.

 258.1. Se is an dæl ledenspræce undeclinigendlic
gefæstniende and endebyrdigende ælcne cwyde.
 258.3. Swaswa lim gefæstnað fel to sumum brede, swa getigð

 277.14. <foreign>INCIPIT INTERIECTIO</foreign>.
 277.15. <foreign>Interiectio est pars orationis significans mentis affectum
uoce incondita, interiectio</foreign> is an dæl ledenspræce getacnjende þæs
modes gewilnunge mid ungesceapenre stemne.
 278.1. <foreign>INTERIECTIO</foreign> mæg beon gecweden betwuxalegednys on
englisc, forþan ðe he lið betwux wordum and geopenað þæs modes
styrunge mid behyddre stemne.
 278.4. An þing he hæfþ: <foreign>SIGNIFICATIO,</foreign> þæt is
getacnung, forðan ðe he getacnað hwilon ðæs modes blisse, hwilon
sarnysse, hwilon wundrunge and gehwæt.
 278.7. <foreign>heu</foreign> getacnað þæs modes sarnysse: <foreign>heu mihi, domine,
quia peccaui nimis in uita mea</foreign> wa is me, drihten, forþan þe ic syngode
swiðe on minum life.
 278.10. Þes <foreign>heu</foreign> and <foreign>ei</foreign> getacniað wanunge.
 278.10. <foreign>hui</foreign> man cweþ on leden and ealswa on englisc: huig, hu
færst ðu.
 278.12. <foreign>uae</foreign> getacnað hwilon wanunge, hwilon ðeowracan, hwilon
wyrigunge.
 278.13. <foreign>uae mihi, quia tacui</foreign> wa is me, þæt ic suwode.
 278.14. Crist cwæð be Judan: <foreign>uae illi</foreign> wa him.
 278.14. He cwæð be þam ungeleaffullum Judeiscum: <foreign>uae uobis</foreign>
wa eow.
 278.16. On wyrigunge: <foreign>uae tibi sit</foreign> wa þe si.
 278.16. Eft he getacnað wawan, swaswa se witega <foreign>EZECHIEL</foreign>
cwæð be þære bec, þe him wæs gebroht fram gode: <foreign>et scriptae
erant in eo lamentationes et carmen et uae</foreign> and on ðære wæron awritene
heofunga and leoð and wawa ða heofunga getacnodon þæra manna wop, ðe
heora synna behreowsiað and mid soðre dædbote gebetað.
 279.4. Þæt leoð getacnode godes þeowena sang and ðæra
manna, þe god heriað mid gastlicum lofsangum.
 279.6. Se wawa getacnað þone ecan wawan, ðe ða habbað on
hellewite, þe nu god forseoð and his beboda.
 279.8. Þes <foreign>uae</foreign> sceal beon awriten mid þrim stafum, and se
sceorta <foreign>ue,</foreign> ðe is <foreign>CONIVNCTIO,</foreign> hæfð twegen stafas: <foreign>quid est stultius
quidue turpius?</foreign> hwæt is stuntlicor oðþe hwæt fracedlicor?
 279.12. Þes dæl <foreign>INTERIECTIO</foreign> hæfð wordes fremminge,
þeah ðe he færlice geclypod beo, and he hæfð swa fela stemna, swa
he hæfð getacnunga, and hi ne magon ealle beon on englisc awende.

 280.1. <foreign>la</foreign> getacnað yrsunge.
 280.1. <foreign>e</foreign> gebicnað forsewennysse.

 293.15. <foreign>fatuus</foreign> is on oðrum ledene <foreign>stultus,</foreign> þæt is stunt;
and swa gehwylce oðre.
 293.18. XX sum ðæra is <foreign>DIFFERENTIA,</foreign> þæt is todal
betwux twam þingum.
 293.19. Ic cweþe nu <foreign>rex</foreign> cyning, þæt is se ðe
gemetfæstlice his folc gewissað.
 294.1. Gif he þonne mid his riccetere hi ofsit, þonne bið he
<foreign>tyrannus,</foreign> þæt is reðe oððe wælhreow.
 294.4. XXI sum ðæra is <foreign>BARBARISMVS,</foreign> þæt is anes wordes
gewemmednyss/, gif hit byð miswriten oððe miscweden of þam rihtan
cræfte.
 294.7. XXII sum ðæra is <foreign>SOLOCISMVS,</foreign> þæt is miscweden
word on endebyrdnysse þære rædinge of ðam rihtan cræfte.
 294.9. <foreign>BARBARISMVS</foreign> bið on anum worde, and <foreign>SOLOCISMVS</foreign> bið
sum leas word on ðam ferse.
 294.10. Swa ðeah ne gebyriað þas twegen dælas to ðam
cræfte, ac hi becumað of þam samlæredum leaslice geclypode oððe
awritene.
 294.13. XXIII sume sind gecwedene <foreign>VITIA,</foreign> þæt synd leahtras
on ledenspræce on manegum wisum miswritene oððe miscwedene.
 294.15. Þam eallum we sceolon wiðcweðan, gyf we cunnon
þæt gescead.
 294.17. XXIIII sum ðæra dæla is <foreign>METAPLASMVS,</foreign> þæt is
awend spræc to oðrum hiwe hwilon for fægernysse, hwilon for neode,
swaswa is <foreign>audacter</foreign> dyrstelice: hit sceolde beon <foreign>audaciter,</foreign> gyf hit
moste; and swa gehwilce oðre.
 295.3. XXV sume sind gehatene <foreign>SCEMATA,</foreign> þæt sind mislice
hiw and fægernyssa on ledenspræce, hu heo betst gelogod beo.
 295.6. XXVI sume sind gehatene <foreign>TROPI,</foreign> þæt sind mislice
getacnunga oððe wisan on ledenspræce abrodene of heora agenre getacnunge
to oðre gelicnysse, swaswa ic gecweden <foreign>fluctuare segetes, gemmare uites,</foreign>
þæt æceras yðiað and wintreowa gimmiað, forðan ðe æceras
farað on sumera, swaswa sæ yðigende, and wintreowa blostman beoð
gimmum gelice.
 295.12. Ealswa <foreign>floridam iuuentutem et lacteam caniciem</foreign> ða
blostmbæran iuguðe and þa meolchwitan harunge.
 295.15. XXVII sum ðæra is <foreign>PROSA,</foreign> þæt is forðriht
leden buton leoðcræfte gelencged and gelogod.
 295.17. XXVIII sume sind gehatene <foreign>METRA</foreign> on grecisc, ðæt is
on leden <foreign>MENSVRAE</foreign> and on englisc gemetu.
 295.18. Ða gemetu gebyriað to ledenum leoðcræfte.
 295.19. Se cræft is swa ameten, þæt ðær ne mot beon
furðon an stæf ofer getel, ac beoð ealle þa fers geemnytte be anum
getele, gif hit aht beon sceal.
 296.4. XXIX sume synd gehatene <foreign>FABVLAE,</foreign> þæt synd idele
spellunga.
 296.5. <foreign>FABVLAE</foreign> synd þa saga, þe menn secgað ongean gecynde,
þæt ðe næfre ne gewearð ne gewurðan ne mæg.
 296.8. XXX sum ðæra is gehaten <foreign>HISTORIA,</foreign> þæt is
gerecednyss/.
 296.9. Mid þære man awrit and gerehð þa ðing and þa
dæda, þe wæron gedone on ealdum dagum and us dyrne wæron.
 296.12. SY þEOS BOC ðVS HER GEENDOD.
 296.13. On ledenspræce synd menigfealde getel, ac on englisc nis
nan ðæra gewunelic butan þrim anum.
 296.14. <foreign>libra</foreign> on leden is pund on englisc.
 296.15. Fif penegas gemaciað ænne scylling and þrittig
penega ænne mancus.

ÆAdmon 1
B1.9.3.
Admonitio ad filium spiritualem: Norman 1848, 32-56.



 0.1. Basilius se eadiga be ðam we ær awriton wæs swiðe
halig bisceop on Cessarean byrig on Greciscre þeode God lufigende swiðe, on
clænnesse wunigende, on Cristes þeowdome, manegra muneca fæder,
munuchades him sylf.
 0.4. He wæs swyðe gelæred and swyðe mihtig lareow.
 0.5. And he munuc regol gesette mid swyðlicre drohtnunge swa swa
þa Easternan and þa Greciscean munecas libbað hyra lif Gode to lofe
wide.
 0.8. He wæs ær Benedictus þe us boc awrat on Ledenre
spræce leohtre be dæle ðonne Basilius ac he tymde swa ðeah to
Basilies tæcinge for his trumnysse.
 0.10. Basilius awrat ane wundorlice boc be eallum Godes weorcum
þe he geworhte on six dagum Exameron gehaten swiðe deopum andgite.
 0.13. And he awrat þa lare þe we nu willað on Englisceum
gereorde secgean þam he his recceað.
 0.14. Heo gebyrað to munecum and eac to mynecenum þe regollice
libbað for hyra Drihtnes lufe under gastlicum ealdrum Gode þeowiende
gehealdenre clænnysse swa swa Cristes þegenas campiende wið deoflu
dæges and nihtes.
 1.1. Basilius cwæð þa on his boclican lare, Gehyr þu min
bearn, ðines fæder mynegunge and þin eare ahyld to minum wordum nu and
mid geleaffullre heortan hlyst hwæt ic secge.
 1.4. Ic wylle þe secgan and soðlice læran þæt gastlice
gewinn hu þu Gode campie and mid hwilcum gemete þu miht him þeowian.
 1.6. Gehyr þu geornlice and þu ne beo gehefegod mid ðam
swæran slæpe ac awrece þe sylfne mid mycelre geornfulnysse nu to minre
spræce.
 1.8. Ne synd þas word na of me ac of Godes lare.
 1.9. Ne ic mid niwre lare nelle læran þe nu ac mid þære
lare þe ic leornode gefyrn æt þam halgum fæderum þe wæron ure
foregengan.
 1.11. Gif þeos halige lar gelicað þinre heortan and gif ðu
hi underfehst þonne færst þu on sibbe and nan yfel ne mæg ne ne mot
þe genealæcean ac ælc wiðerweardnys gewiteð fram þinre sawle.
 2.1. Gif þu wylle campian on Godes campdome ne campa þu
ænigum buton Gode anum þæt þu him þeowie on his þeowdome simle
orsorh fram woruldcarum and fram ælcum gehlyde.
 2.4. Þa men þe campiað þam eorðlican cininge hi
gehyrsumiað æfre eallum his hæsum.
 2.5. Swa eac þa þe campiað þam heofenlican cininge sceolon
gehyrsumian þam heofonlicum bebodum.
 2.7. Se eorðlica kempa bið æfre gearo and caf swa hwyder swa
he faran sceal to gefeohte mid þam kininge and he for his wife ne for his
wenclum ne dearr hine sylfne beladian þæt he ne scule faran.
 2.10. Mycele swyðor sceal se soða Godes cempa buton ælcere
hremminge hraðe gehyrsumian Cristes sylfes bebodum þæs soþfæstan
kyninges.
 2.13. Se eorðlica kempa kampað mid his wæpnum ongean
gesewenlice feond and þu scealt campian wið þa ungesewenlican fynd þe
ne geswicað næfre wið þe to campienne þa hwile þe þu cucu bist.
 2.16. Ðam woruldlican kempan is gewinn gesewenlice ongean
flæsc and blod and þin gewinn is æfre ongean þa awyrgedan gastas þe
geond þas lyft fleoð to fordonne þa unwaran.
 2.19. Se woruld kempa werað woruldlice wæpna ongean his
gelican ac þu habban scealt þa gastlican wæpna ongean þone gastlican
feond.
 2.22. He byrð isenne helm and isene byrnan þæt he ne beo
gewundod fram his wiðerwinnan ac beo Crist sylf þin helm se þe is þin
heafod and beo Cristes geleafa for byrnan þe sylfum.
 2.25. He sceotað his flan and his scearpe spere ongean his
wiðerwinnan ac þu witodlice scealt mid halgum Godes wordum þinne feond
sceotian and cweðan on þinum mode, God is min gefylsta and ic for þy
forseo soðlice mine fynd.
 2.29. He ne awyrpð nateshwon his wæpna him fram ærþam
þe þæt gewinn wurðe geendod and þu ne miht beon orsorh on þinum
gewinne forþam þe þin feond is fakenfullra þonne his.
 2.32. His feond fyht sume hwile ac þin ne geswicð næfre swa
lange swa þu leofast on life mid mannum.
 2.34. His wæpna syndon swære him sylfum to berenne ac Cristes
geoc is wynsum and his byrðen swiþe leoht þam þe lufe habbað to þam
leofan Hælende.
 2.37. Se woruldcempa gecyrð syðþan he sige gewinð ham to
his wife and to his bearnum ac þu færst to heofonum to eallum Godes halgum
syððan þu oferswyðst þone ungesewenlican feond.
 2.40. He underfehð gife eorðlices gestreones for his
eorðlices geswinces ac þu scealt underfon þa heofonlican gife forþam
gastlican gewinne.
 2.42. Se munuc sceal geanbidian his edleanes æt Gode and beon
him sylf ælfremed fram eorðlicum dædum and hine ne abysgian mid
woruldlicum bysgum gif he campian sceal Criste on eornost.
 2.46. Hit is swiðe earfoðe ænigum to þeowienne twam
hlafordum ætgædere Gode and woruldwelum ne he þa gastlican wæpnu mid
þam welum ne mæg aht eaðe aberan and winnan wið his fynd.
 2.49. Ac he forlæteð Godes geoc gif he lufað eorðwelan and
his sawul bið gehefegod mid swærre byrðene.
 2.50. Þus gerad man bið mid his agenum wæpnum yfele gewundod
þeah he swa ne wene and for þam þe he lufað frecednysse he befealð on
deað.
 2.53. Besceawa þu wærlice hwilcum kininge þu campast and swa
micele swa se heofenlica cyning is mærra and furðor toforan þam
eorðlican cininge swa micele mara bið þin wurðmynt toforan þam
woruldlican kempan.
 2.56. Þu þencst to gewyrcenne wundorlicne stypel and swiþe
healicne.
 2.58. Hoga þu nu for þy ymbe þa gastlican gestreon to
þæs stypeles getimbrunge, þæt synd, þa halgan mægenu þe þu
habban scealt, þæt þu þæt weorc mæge wurðlice geendian þe
læs þe þu wegferendum wurðe eft to glige gif þin anginn ne becymð
to godre geendunge and þine fynd geblissian þe to bysmore syððan.
 2.63. Ne bið þes stypol getimbrod mid ænigum weorcstane ac
mid mænifealdum mihtum þæs innran mannes ne mid golde ne mid seolfre ac
mid gastlicum drohtnungum and getrywum inngehigde truwiende on Gode.
 3.1. Ic secge þe minum bearne, beo þe an foresceawung gif þu
Gode anum þeowian gewilnast.
 3.2. Ne abysga þu þin mod on mislicum þingum ne þu mid
olæceunge ænigum gecweme ac aceorf fram þe þa flæsclican lufe
þæt seo flæsclice lufu þe ne afyrsie Gode.
 3.5. Adræfe ælcne leahtor and ælcne unþeaw fram þe
þæt þu þære sawla mihta sylf mæge begitan.
 3.7. Gehyr nu on eornost hwæt þære sawle miht is and hwilc
miht hyre begite þæt mæste gestreon.
 3.8. Þære sawle miht is þæt heo hire scyppend lufie and
þa þing onscunie þe God sylf onscunað.
 3.10. Ðære sawle miht is þæt heo sylf beo geþyldi and
ælce weamodnysse fram hire awyrpe and þæt heo healde clænnysse
ægðer ge modes ge lichaman and þæt heo idel wuldor eallunga forseo
and þa gewitendlican þing mid wo ne lufie.
 3.14. Ðære sawle miht is þæt heo modinysse mycelum
onscunie and ealle leasunga and lufie eaðmodnysse and soðfæstnysse simle
folgie.
 3.16. Ðære sawle miht is þæt heo sibbe lufie and andan
and yrre æfre onscunige and dysi forbuge and wisdom asece.
 3.18. Ðære sawle miht is þæt heo sylf þæs lichaman
lustas underþeode þæs modes gesceade þæt þæt gescead beo
wylldre þonne seo yfele gewilnung and þæt heo gitsunge forhogige and beo
hire eaðhylde.
 3.22. Ðas mihta þu miht, min bearn, þe begitan gif þu
woruldcara awyrpst fram þinre heortan and þa gewitendlican ðing
forlætst and gewilnast þa heofenlican.
 3.24. And gif þin willa bið gelome abysgod on Godes herungum
and þu his domas asmeast ðonne bist þu gelic þam luftymum treowe þe
grewð wið þone stream stede fæst on wætan and byrð æfre
wæstmas on godne timan symle and þu bist Godes freond, þu þe wære
þeow æror.
 4.1. Lufa þu, min bearn, þone lifiendan God mid eallre þinre
mihte þæt þine weorc him licion.
 4.2. Gif se woruldmann kepð hu he his wife gelikie micele
swyðor sceal se munuc on eallum gemetum Criste gelikian and him gecweman a
and hine lufian and his bebodu healdan.
 4.5. God nele þæt þu hine lufie mid nacodum wordum ac mid
hluttre heortan and mid rihtwisum dædum.
 4.7. Se þe sægð þæt he lufie þone lifiendan God and
his beboda ne healdeð he bið þonne him sylf leas and bið his agen
pæca forþam þe se ælmihtiga God sceawað his heortan swyðor
þonne his word and God lufað þa bilwitan þe buton facne him
þeowiað.
 4.11. Ure fæder and modor swuncon for us hwilon and þæt
wæs Godes foresceawung hyra geswinc ofer us þæt hi us afeddon be his
fadunge þa.
 4.14. Nu sceolon we hi lufian be Godes sylfes lare ac swa þeah
swyðor we sceolon lufian God þe ure magas gesceop and us to mannum of him
and he dæghwamlice us deð ure neode.
 4.17. Gif ure magas willað us geweman fram Criste ne sceolon we
forþan þonne hy forðfarene beoð hyra lic bebyrian for hyra
geleafleaste.
 4.19. Crist we sceolon lufian þe us alysde fram synnum.
 4.20. And we ne magon asecgean his wel dæda on us þe us þurh
his drihtenlican mihte fram gedwyldum alysde and fram ecean deaðe us to life
gelædde.
 4.23. We wæron unðancwurðe and wendon us fram Criste ac he
us gesohte swa þæt he sylf nyðer astah of his heofenlican settle on swa
mycelre eaðmodnysse þæt he man wearð for us on middanearde akenned and
læg on cildclaðum.
 4.26. Se þe belycð on his handa ealle þas eorðan swa swa
ælmihtig God and se þe heofenas gehealdeð næfde hamas on worulde ne
hwyder he ahyllde his heafod on life.
 4.29. And se wæs hafenleas for us se þe hæfð ealle þing
þæt he us gewelgode on his eceum welum.
 4.31. And him wæs gedemed fram unrihtwisum demum þam þe on
wolcnum cymð on þysre worulde ende eallum to demenne þe æfre kuce
wæron.
 4.33. And se þe is lifes wylle he gewilnode wæteres æt
þam Samaritaniscean wife swa swa us sægð þæt godspell.
 4.35. And se þe ealle þing afedeð se gefredde hungor þa
þa he on þam westene wæs gecostnod fram deofle æfter þam þe he
fæste feowertig daga on an.
 4.38. And þam þe englas þeniað he sylf þenode mannum and
þwoh his gingrena fet mid his fægerum handum.
 4.39. And se þe fela wundra geworhte mid his handum se geþafode
for us þæt man gefæstnode his handa mid nægelum on rode and eac his
fotwylmas.
 4.42. And þa þa he drincan bæd þa dydon þa earman
Judeiscean geallan to his muðe of þam mannum becom seo godspellice lar mid
his liflican bodunge.
 4.44. And se þe nanum ne derede him man dyde talu and he wæs
beswungen unscyldig eac for us.
 4.46. And se þe þa deadan þurh his drihtenlican mihte
arærde to life se let hine ahon on rode gealgan be his agenum willan and swa
deað geþrowode.
 4.48. And he syððan wæs bebyrged ac he aras of deaðe on
þam þriddan dæge and he astah to heofenum to his halgan fæder.
 4.51. Eall þis he geþrowode for ure alysednysse þæt he
forgeafe þæt ece lif us mannum.
 4.52. And he ne biddeð us to edleane nanes oðres þinges buton
us sylfe him and ure sawla clæne þæt he on us wunige and ure willa mid
him and þæt he us sylfe hæbbe to þam heofenlican life.
 4.55. Gif we nu habbað on horde gold oððe seolfor þæt he
het us dælan for his lufan þearfum and us he wyle habban and ure he
gewilnað and he wyle on us his wununge habban þurh þone halgan gast þe
gegladað ure mod.
 4.59. Uton genealæcean to urum leofan Drihtne and uton us
geþeodan mid godum þeawum to him.
 4.61. And uton hine lufian and lufian us sylfe and eac ure neacstan
buton ælcnum facne.
 4.62. Se þe his neahstan lufað se gelicað Gode and he bið
Godes sunu geciged untwylice.
 4.64. Se þe his neaxtan hatað se bið gehaten þonne þæs
awyrgedan deofles bearn þe wyle æfre þwyres.
 4.65. Se þe his broðor lufað he leofað on sibbe and se þe
his broðor hatað he hæfð unstilnesse and swyðe drofi mod þurh
þæs deofles tihtinge.
 4.68. Se wellwillenda man wyle eaðe forberan gif hine man
ahwær tynð oððe him tale gecwyð and se unrihtwisa wer wyle niman on
teonan his niextan dæde þeah þe he him teonan ne gedo.
 4.71. Se þe mid lufe bið afylled se færð on smyltnesse and
se þe hatunge hæfð se færð mid yrsunge.
 5.1. Lufa þu, min bearn, on þinum life simle wellwyllendnysse
þæt þu gewilnie godes and hafa ðinne niextan swa swa þin agen lim.
 5.3. Læt þe ælcne mannan þe geleafan hæfð to Gode
swa leofne swa broðor and beo þe sylf gemyndig þæt an ys se soða
wyrhta þe us ealle gesceop.
 5.5. Ne astyra þu æswicunga ænigum men on life and þæt
þe sylfum mislicað ne do þu oðrum mannum þat.
 5.7. Gif þu hwene gesihst geþeon on gode blissa on his dædum
þæt his bliss beo þin and gif him hwæt mistimað besarga his
unrotnysse.
 5.9. Adræf fram þinre sawle ælce yfelnysse and seo hatung
ne ontende ðine heortan nates hwon.
 5.11. Ne astyra þu yrsunga þinum underþeoddum ne ummihtigum
men þeah þe þu mæge bet ac hafa hine swa swilce þin agen lim.
 5.13. Ne lufa þu þinne broðor mid gehiwodre heortan þæt
þu hine kysse and kepe him hearmes forþam þe se fakenfulla fægere word
sprecð oft and on his modes digolnysse macað syrwunga.
 5.16. On swilcum dædum se soða God byð gegremed soðlice.
 5.17. Þæt hluttre mod þe Gode gelicað forsihð þa
hiwunga and healt soðfæstnysse.
 5.19. Do þu feorr fram þe þa fakenfullan hiwunge and ne kep
þu nates hwon þinum niextan facnes ne þu hine ne tæl ne ne ter mid
wordum.
 5.21. Tala þe þinne broðor swilce he beo þin lim.
 5.22. Gif þu hwilon yrsie swa swa oðre men doð ne læt þu
þæt yrre licgean on þinre heortan ofer sunnan setlunge ac foh to sibbe
æror and adræf þa hatheortnysse fram þinre sawle hraðe.
 6.1. Se man þe sibbe lufað he sylf gearcað Criste wununge on
his mode forþam þe Crist sylf is sibb and he on sibbe wyle wunian
untwylice.
 6.3. Crist onscunað æfre þone andigendan wer and se
gesibsuma wer byð on smyltnesse a.
 6.4. Se niðfulla wer bið gelic þam scipe þe þa yða
drifað ut on sæ swa hu swa se wind blæwð buton ælcum steoran and
se gesibsuma wer hæfð him orsorhnysse.
 6.7. Eft se niðfulla wer byð þam wulfe gelic þe woðlice
abiteð þa bilewitan sceap and se gesibsuma wer byð þam winearde gelic
þe byrð gode wæstmas wynsumlice growende.
 6.10. Ðæs niðfullan mannes weorc byð on wædlunge
æfre and swa se gesibsuma wer swyðor blissað on gode swa aswindeð se
niðfulla swyðor to nahtlicum þingum.
 6.13. Se gesibsuma man soðlice byð oncnawen þurh his modes
blisse and on glædum andwlitan and se niðfulla wer wyrð eac geswutelod
þurh his hatheortnysse on hetolum andwlitan.
 6.16. Se gesibsuma mann hæfð him sylf gemanan mid þam halgum
englum and se niðfulla byð deofla gefera fordon þurh.
 7.1. Awend þine eagan fram yfelre gesihðe and ne gelustfulla
þu þæt þu mid fulre lufe sceawie wlitigra wifmanna andwlitan þæt
þu þurh yfele gewilnunge becume to wite.
 7.4. Gemun þu, min bearn, hwam þu gehalgodest þine agene lima
and ne læt þu nates hwon hi beon gemengede mid fulum myltestrum.
 7.6. Awend þine lufe fram wifmanna lufe þe læs þe hire
lufu þe beluce fram Criste.
 7.7. Ne forseoh þu nates hwon þa lytlan gyltas on þe þe
læs þe þa læssan þe gelædan to maran.
 7.9. Ne hiwa þu, min bearn, swilce þu mid bilewitnysse mæge
þe gan orsorh to mædena husum and wið hi motian þæt þin mod ne
beo yfele besmiten ðurh þa ydelan spellunga.
 7.12. Ne þince þe to hefityme to gehyrenne mine spræce ac
gelyf minum wordum.
 7.13. Hit is gewisslice soð gif se munuc wyle gan oððe se
gelæreda preost to wifmanna husum and wið hy motian and gif þam
mædenum likiað hyra luftyman spræce a sona hy awendað hyra
wurðfullnysse and hi sylfwilles forleosað þæt þæt hi Gode
beheton.
 7.18. Ne magon na swilce men makian wununge þam clængeornan
Gode on clænre heortan ac hy beoð tolysede ungeleaffullice swa swa
forrotod þreax on hyra unþeawum.
 7.21. Se mægðhad sceal beon mid þæs modes godnysse Criste
sylfum geoffrod be agenum willan buton ælcere hiwunge mid halgum þeawum
simle.
 7.23. Ne man ne mot befylan mid fulre besmitennysse þæt
þæt man Gode behateð and him gehalgod bið.
 7.25. On ægðrum hade byð se halga mægðhad on cnihtum
and on mædenum, on munecum and on mynecenum þam þe fram cildhade swa
gesælie wurdon þæt hig æfre on clænnysse Criste sylfum þeowodon
þæt hi habban on ende þa hundfealdan mede þe Crist sylf behet on his
halgan godspelle.
 7.30. Ðu mann, ne syngast na gif þu sylf ne behatest ac gif
þu æne behætst þam ælmihtigan Gode he wyle þonne habban þæt
þu him behete ne he nele mid nanre besmitennysse gemengan þine halgan limu
þe him gehalgode syndon.
 7.34. Warna nu, min bearn, þæt þu ne wurðe beswicen þurh
þæs lichaman wlite and þu swa forleose þinre sawle wlite þurh þone
sceortan lust.
 7.36. Warna þæt þu ne hreppe wifmanna lichaman swa swa fyr
wyle ontendan þæt ceaf þæt him wiðligeð swa byð se þe
handlað wifhades mannes lic.
 7.38. Ne ætbyrst he naht eaðe buton his sawle lyre þeah þe
he lichamlice mid hyre ne licge swa þeah byð his inngehigd wið innan
gewemmed.
 8.1. Sege me nu, min bearn, hwilc geþincð mæge beon þinre
agenre sawle þæt þu sceole lufian þæs lichaman wlite þe
gewyrðeð to duste and eallswa forsearað swa scinende blostman þe on
wyrtum weaxað wynsumlice on sumera and wurðað fornumene mid þæs
wintres cyle.
 8.5. Swa byð þæs mannes wlite þe wyrðeð eall fornumen
mid onsigendre ylde and se deað geendað þone ærran wlite þonne
ongitt þin sawl þæt þu sylf lufodest idel.
 8.8. Foroft se mann gewyrðeð on ende toswollen and to stence
awended mid unwynsumnysse þæt him sylfum byð egle and andsæte se
stenc and his lustfullnysse him ne belifð nan þing and his wistfullnys him
wyrðeð to biternysse.
 8.12. Hwær beoð þonne, ic axie, þa estfullan swæsnessa
and þa liðan liffetunga þe hine forlæddon æror?
 8.14. Hwær bið his gaf spræc and þa idelan gamenunga and
his ungemetegode hleahter?
 8.15. Hi beoð þonne alede and hi urnon him fram swa swa yrnende
flod and hi ne ætywdon him na hwær syððan.
 8.17. Ðis is seo geendung ealles þæs wlites and þæs
lichaman fægernysse forþig ic þe bidde þæt þu awende þin mod
fram þillicum wlitum and awend þine lufe to þære wlitigan
fægernysse ures Hælendes Cristes þæt þin heorte beo onliht mid his
scinendum leomum fram þære sweartan dimnysse.
 8.22. Ðes wlite is to lufianne þe gewendeð to blisse þæt
þu mid Criste wunie a to worulde on blisse gif þu hine lufast on þines
lifes ryne þe þe is ungewiss ac þu becymst to gewissan þær þu
endeleaslice orsorh byst on gefean.
 8.26. Bide þe sylfum æt Gode þæt he sylf þe forgife
snotere heortan and þurhwacol andgit þæt þu cunne tocnawan þæs
deofles costnunga and his swicolan facna þæt þin fot ne bestæppe on
his arleasum grinum þæt þu gelæht ne wurðe.
 8.30. Se snotera wer ne gewilnað þara woruld glenga ne þæs
lichaman wlites ac gewilnað þære sawle forþam þe Crist gegladað on
þære sawle godnysse and on hire wlite, gewilna þu þes.
 9.1. Ne lufa þu gitsunge ne unrihtlice welan þe þe ascyriað
and asyndriað fram Gode.
 9.2. Manega gewilniað oðres mannes wolice and hi beoð
benæmede neadlunga hyra agenes.
 9.3. Beo þe swiðe ælfremed ælc unrihtlic gestreon
forþam þe ure æht byð mid englum on heofonum.
 9.5. Beo þe wel gehealden þæt þu hæbbe bigleofan and
hlywðe wið cyle, ne sec þu na mare.
 9.7. Se þe wyle beon weli on life se befealð on costnunge and
on þæs costneres grinu.
 9.8. Warna þe wið gitsunge forþam þe heo witodlice is
eallra yfela wyrttruma, swa swa se apostol awrat.
 9.10. Se gitsere sylð his sawle wið feo and he wyle ofslean gif
him swa byð gerymed þone unscyldigan for his sceatta þingon and manlice
swerian his sawle to forwyrde.
 9.13. Þurh gitsunge forlyst oft se orleasa his lif þonne he
gewilniað þara æhta and ne warnað hine sylfne.
 9.15. Þurh gitsunge losode Achar se þegen þe mid Josue feaht
and fakenlice behydde of þam herereafe þe him wæs forboden on ær.
 9.17. And he wearð þa oftorfod teonlice mid stanum mid eallum
his hiwum fram Israhela folke.
 9.18. Ðurh gitsunge wearð beswiken eac Sawl se cining þa þa
him leofran wæron þa forbodenan herelafa þonne Godes willa and he
wearð for þy his rices bedæled and Dauid wearð gecoren.
 9.22. Achab eac se kining yfele wearð beswicen for Nabothes
winearde þe he wolice genam and he for þam hraðe feoll on gefeohte
ofslagen þæt swa wurde on him gewreken Naboth þe ær wæs ofslagen
for his agenum winearde.
 9.25. Judas se arleasa þe urne Hælend belæwde for þam
lyðran sceatte þe he lufode unrihtlice aheng hine sylfne and he þæs
sceattes ne breac.
 9.28. Ure Hælend wolde þurh his welwillendnysse mid his halgan
lare þe he gelome sæde þam Judeisceum heafod mannum of hyra heortan
adræfan þa yfelan gitsunge þe him is andsæte.
 9.31. Ac forþam þe hi wæron wundorlice grædie hi
hæfdon him to glige his halwendan mynegunge.
 9.33. Nis nan leodscipe swa grædig goldes and seolfres swa þa
Judeiscean and þa Romaniscean be þam þe lareowas on bocum awriton.
 9.35. Sum rice man wolde gewitan æt þam Hælende hu he mihte
habban heofenan rices myrðe.
 9.37. Þa cwæð se Hælend him to, Ne canst þu Godes æ,
Ne ofsleh ðu mannan, ne unrihthæm þu, ne beo þu leas gewita?
 9.39. And he him andwyrde, Drihten leof Hælend, þas ealle ic
geheold æfre fram minre geogoðe.
 9.40. And him andwyrde se Hælend, An þing þe is wana ac gif
þu wille beon fullfremed beceapa ealle þine æhta and dæl þæt
wurð þearfum and þu hæfst þinne goldhord on heofena rice swa and cum
þonne to me and fylig me syððan.
 9.44. Ða wearð se rica sarig swyðe for his wordum forþam
þe he hæfde fela æhta on life þe him wæron laðe to forlætenne
swa and eode him sona aweg syððon he þiss gehyrde.
 9.47. Se gitsienda wer þe ne wyrð næfre full is helle gelic
þe næfð nan gemet ac swa heo ma forswelgeð swa heo ma gewilnað.
 9.50. Do þe ælfremedne fram þysum leahtre a and hafa þe
gemet.
